histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAlwaysShowA11yMenu
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Accessibility Menu is set to be shown regardless of the state of a11y features.(checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAutoclick
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Autoclick feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAutoclickDelay
histogram.summary: If the user has enabled Autoclick, this is the delay set by the user for autoclicks to occur, in milliseconds.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosCaretHighlight
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS caret highlighting is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosChromeVoxNext
histogram.summary: Set when a Chrome OS user has spoken feedback enabled, recorded once each time ChromeVox starts up. True if the user has enabled "ChromeVox Next", a new ChromeVox experience that became the default in Chrome 56 (but can be toggled on or off by the user), false otherwise.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosCursorHighlight
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS cursor highlighting is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosFocusHighlight
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS focus highlighting is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosHighContrast
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS High Contrast mode feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosLargeCursor
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Large Cursor feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosLargeCursorSize
histogram.summary: Cursor size of the Chrome OS Large Cursor (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosScreenMagnifier
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Screen Magnifier feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS select-to-speak is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSpokenFeedback
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Spoken Feedback feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosStickyKeys
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Sticky Keys feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSwitchAccess
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS switch access is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosVirtualKeyboard
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Virtual Keyboard feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.InvertedColors
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that high-contrast mode is enabled and the user has selected a light-on-dark color scheme (checked once 45 secs after startup). This causes Chrome to prompt the user with a bubble to optionally install a High Contrast extension and theme.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Mac.DifferentiateWithoutColor
histogram.summary: Whether the "differentiate without color" Mac system setting is enabled. This is checked once, 45 seconds after startup.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Mac.FullKeyboardAccessEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether the "full keyboard access" Mac system setting is enabled. This is checked once, 45 seconds after startup.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Mac.IncreaseContrast
histogram.summary: Whether the "increase contrast" Mac system setting is enabled. This is checked once, 45 seconds after startup.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Mac.ReduceTransparency
histogram.summary: Whether the "reduce transparency" Mac system setting is enabled. This is checked once, 45 seconds after startup.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ManuallyEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome has enabled accessibility support because the user passed the --force-renderer-accessibility flag on the command-line (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.ModeFlag
histogram.summary: Whether individual accessibility mode flags are set. Tracked when each mode flag is flipped from false to true. These flags are flipped automatically when software communicates with Chrome via accessibility APIs. Flags can only be flipped off by advanced users or for debugging using chrome://accessibility/ - and that isn't tracked in this histogram.

histogram.name: Accessibility.State
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2016 in Issue 672205 with the addition of Accessibility.ModeFlag.
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome has enabled accessibility support because it detects supported assistive technology running, or due to being manually enabled via a command-line flag (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinAPIs
histogram.summary: Tracks usage of all public Windows accessibility APIs.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinAudioDescription
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that audio descriptions are enabled (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinJAWS
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party JAWS screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinNVDA
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party NVDA screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinSAToGo
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party System Access To Go screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinScreenReader
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that a screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup). Note that this does not necessarily mean that Chrome has detected a supported screen reader and has enabled its accessibility mode.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinStickyKeys
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that Sticky Keys are enabled.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinZoomText
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party ZoomText screen magnifier is running.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.AnalyzerCreationError
histogram.summary: The analyzer creation error code. Logged each time analyzer creation fails, at most once per processed stability debug file.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.InitStatus
histogram.summary: Status of the initialization to collect stability debug files. Logged once, during the initialization of the stability debug file collection.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.StabilityFileCount
histogram.summary: Number of files found during stability file collection. Logged each time the stability file collection proceeds (at most once per launch).

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.Status
histogram.summary: Status for the collection of a stability debug file. Logged each time a debug file collection attempt is made.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.SystemSessionAnalysisStatus
histogram.summary: Status for the analysis of the system session state. Logged each time a debug file is collected.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Time spent collecting stability debug information. Logged each time a collection is performed.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.UncleanShutdownCount
histogram.summary: Number of unclean shutdowns, as derived from the stability instrumentation. Logged each time stability file collection is performed.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.UncleanSystemCount
histogram.summary: Number of unclean shutdowns that can potentially be attributed to system instability. This should be smaller or equal to UncleanShutdownCount. Logged each time stability file collection is performed.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.WriteDumpStatus
histogram.summary: Status of the minidump writing. Logged each time a writing a minidump is attempted.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Record.InitStatus
histogram.summary: Status of internal activity tracking initialization. Logged once, during the activity tracking initialization.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Record.SetupTime
histogram.summary: Time spent setting up the stability debugging instrumentation. Logged once, during setup of the stability debugging instrumentation.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.ThreadTrackers.Count
histogram.summary: The number of threads being tracked for activities such as waiting for a lock/event, a thread to join, or a task to run. Analysis of this data can reveal why a thread will not exit. This value is updated every time a new thread gets an activity tracked for the first time so will show one count for every permanent thread but multiple counts for a thread than exits and is replaced.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.ThreadTrackers.MemLimitTrackerCount
histogram.summary: The limit on the number of thread trackers that could be allocated from the persistent memory segment. Trackers beyond this number were allocated from the heap and thus were not available for analysis. This value is updated on every "memory full" failure.

histogram.name: Android.Activity.ChromeTabbedActivity.StopReason
histogram.summary: What caused ChromeTabbedActivity#onStop() to be called, which indicates that Chrome is sent to the background.

histogram.name: Android.Activity.ChromeTabbedActivity.SystemBackAction
histogram.summary: What happened when the user hit the system back button in ChromeTabbedActivity.

histogram.name: Android.ArmFpu
histogram.summary: Reports the FPU capabilities of the Android ARM device. This is recorded once per browser session during startup.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.DurationOpen
histogram.summary: The duration the Chrome Home bottom sheet was open.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.OpenReason
histogram.summary: The reason the bottom sheet was opened.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.TimeBetweenCloseAndNextOpen
histogram.summary: The time between the last time the Chrome Home bottom sheet was closed and the next time it was opened.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.TimeToFirstOpen
histogram.summary: The time between app creation and the first open of the Chrome Home bottom sheet for this run of Chrome.

histogram.name: Android.CustomFeedback.Category
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user selects a category button when in the Custom Feedback UI.

histogram.name: Android.CustomFeedback.CategoryDetails
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user selects an option related to their problem within the Custom Feedback UI.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.Filter
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user selects a filter from the Chrome download manager navigation drawer.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.InitialCount
histogram.summary: The number of non-incognito download items displayed when the download UI is initialized.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.Item.OpenFailed
histogram.summary: Recorded when a download fails to open.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.Item.OpenSucceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when a download is opened.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OtherExtensions.InitialCount
histogram.summary: The extension type for non-incognito download items that match the "other" filter type. Recorded when the download UI is initialized.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OtherExtensions.OpenFailed
histogram.summary: The extension type for downloads that match the "other" filter type. Recorded when a download fails to open.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OtherExtensions.OpenSucceeded
histogram.summary: The extension type for downloads that match the "other" filter type. Recorded when a download is opened.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OtherExtensions.Share
histogram.summary: The extension type for downloads that match the "other" filter type. Recorded when downloads are shared through the download manager.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.Share.Count
histogram.summary: The number of downloads shared at the same time.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.Share.FileTypes
histogram.summary: Recorded when downloads are shared through the download manager. A recorded value of "All" indicates that multiple types of downloads were shared.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.ShowStorageInfo
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user clicks the info button on download home to toggle the storage info. The state recorded is after the visibility is toggled.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.SpaceUsed
histogram.summary: The percentage of total storage downloads consume.

histogram.name: Android.HistoryPage.OpenSelected
histogram.summary: The number of selected items the user opened in new tabs from the native Android history page.

histogram.name: Android.HistoryPage.RemoveSelected
histogram.summary: The number of selected items the user removed from the native Android history page.

histogram.name: Android.InstantApps.ApiCallDuration2
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time spent in the getInstantAppIntent() API call.

histogram.name: Android.InstantApps.ApiCallDurationWithApp
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time spent in the getInstantAppIntent() API call when the API was able to find an Instant App for the URL.

histogram.name: Android.InstantApps.ApiCallDurationWithoutApp
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time spent in the getInstantAppIntent() API call when the API was not able to find an Instant App for the URL.

histogram.name: Android.InstantApps.CallSource
histogram.summary: For intents to load a web page in browser from Instant Apps, records where the request to load came from.

histogram.name: Android.InstantApps.FallbackDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when we first received an eligible intent for Instant Apps to the time we processed it in the case where the Instant Apps activity had to invoke a fallback intent.

histogram.name: Android.InstantApps.HandleIntentDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time spent triaging an incoming event to decide whether it needs to be routed to Instant Apps.

histogram.name: Android.IsLastSharedAppInfoRetrieved
histogram.summary: Signifies whether the last shared app information is retrieved successfully or not. This is logged when configuring the direct sharing menu item.

histogram.name: Android.KernelVersion
histogram.summary: Reports the kernel major and minor version from the utsname.release field. The low 16 bits of each version are combined into a 32-bit integer. The range is from [0x00020006,0x0004000a] to track kernel versions 2.6 through 4.10.

histogram.name: Android.ManageSpace.ActionTaken
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user presses a button in the 'Manage Space' screen for Chrome. Note: the 'Clear App Data' option is likely incorrect, as the result of that button disables UMA recording (as we factory reset the app).

histogram.name: Android.ModerateBindingCount
histogram.summary: The number of moderate bindings which were kept while Chrome process is in the foreground. This is logged right before Chrome process goes into the background.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstanceMigration.FailedToRenameMetadataFile
histogram.summary: Renaming the old tab metadata file failed during multi-instance migration. Only true is recorded.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstanceMigration.NewMetadataFileExists
histogram.summary: The new tab metadata file already existed when multi-instance migration was attempted. Only true is recorded.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.Active
histogram.summary: Records on every metrics upload whether the activity is running in Android N multi-window mode or not.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.IsTabletScreenWidthBelow600
histogram.summary: Records whether the screen width is below 600dp when the activity is in Android N multi-window mode. True if the screen width is less than 600dp and false if is greater than or equal to 600dp.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.TabletScreenWidth
histogram.summary: Records the screen width in dp when the activity is in Android N multi-window mode and the width is below 600dp.

histogram.name: Android.NativeLibraryPreloader.Result.Browser
histogram.summary: The return value of NativeLibraryPreloader.loadLibrary() in browser process, is recorded once per browser process start.

histogram.name: Android.NativeLibraryPreloader.Result.Renderer
histogram.summary: The return value of NativeLibraryPreloader.loadLibrary() in renderer process, is recorded once per renderer process start.

histogram.name: Android.NTP.Impression
histogram.summary: Counts impressions of the NTP on Android. It also counts potential impressions. A potential impression is a place where it would make sense to open the NTP instead of the current view. E.g. the no-tab view is counted as a potential impression since this view could be replaced with the NTP. For better comparison regular impressions are also counted. The no-tab view counting happens right after the user closed the last tab and the regular impression counting happens at construction time of the NTP (=whenever a new tab is opened).

histogram.name: Android.PrepareMenu.OpenWebApkVisibilityCheck
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time spent querying for whether a WebAPK is already installed.

histogram.name: Android.RestoreResult
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome tried to restore its settings from a previous device or installation, and what happened when it did. Only recorded on first run.

histogram.name: Android.SeccompStatus.Prctl
histogram.summary: Reports the level of kernel support for the seccomp-bpf sandbox using prctl(PR_SET_SECCOMP).

histogram.name: Android.SeccompStatus.RendererSandbox
histogram.summary: Reports the status of the seccomp-bpf sandbox in renderer processes. Anything other than "Sandbox Engaged" indicates the sandbox is not turned on. See https://crbug.com/477049.

histogram.name: Android.SeccompStatus.Syscall
histogram.summary: Reports the level of kernel support for the seccomp-bpf sandbox using the seccomp system call.

histogram.name: Android.SelectFileDialogScope
histogram.summary: Records the scope of accepted content for a select file dialog when shown by a Web developer.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.CheckGooglePlayServicesTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from checking for whether play services is available.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.CheckGoogleSignedTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from checking for whether a package is Google signed.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.DocumentModeSharedPrefs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2016 in Issue 582539 with the removal of document mode.
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from fetching the DocumentMode shared preferences file.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.DocumentTabStateLoad
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2016 in Issue 582539 with the removal of document mode.
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from document mode loading its prioritized tab's state.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.DownloadsDir
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from fetching and possibly creating the downloads directory.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.NotificationUIBuildTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from custom notification builder through date formatting.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.OverrideUrlLoadingTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from calling out to Android activity manager.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.SnippetUIBuildTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from snippet UI through date formatting.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.TabPersistentStore
histogram.summary: Measures time spent during StrictMode-whitelisted code in TabPersistentStore.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.ThumbnailCacheDir
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from fetching for the thumbnail cache directory.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.WebappAuthenticatorMac
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from looking up a webapp's MAC on startup.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.WebappDir
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from fetching for creating the webapp directory.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.WebappSaveState
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from reading and saving webapp state.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.WebappSharedPrefs
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from fetching the Webapp shared preferences file.

histogram.name: Android.TabNavigationInterceptResult
histogram.summary: The distribution of results when running ExternalNavigationHandler, this shows how often we send intents to be handled by other applications.

histogram.name: Android.TabPersistentStore.MergeStateMetadataFileSize
histogram.summary: The number of bytes read for the other tab state's metadata file when merging tab states in Android N+.

histogram.name: Android.TabPersistentStore.MergeStateTabCount
histogram.summary: The number of normal and incognito tabs merged (for Android N+ multi-instance). This will be logged for both cold-start and non-cold-start merging assuming that the native library is loaded.

histogram.name: Android.TabPersistentStore.MergeStateTimePerTab
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to restore state for each merged tab (for Android N+ multi-instance). This will only be logged for non-cold-start merging, because restoring merged tabs is not distingushed from restoring regular tabs on cold start.

histogram.name: Android.TabPersistentStore.MetadataFileSize
histogram.summary: The number of bytes written for the tab metadata file.

histogram.name: AndroidTabCloseUndo.Toast
histogram.summary: When a user closes a tab an undo toast will popup on certain devices giving the user the chance to undo closing that tab. This stat tracks how the user interacts with that UI and what actions they take. A cold start means that the undo bar wasn't showing when it was triggered to show again. A warm start means that it was. Warm starts can happen when the user closes multiple tabs close together. When the undo bar is dismissed, all closes that were queued up to be undone are committed. This can happen either by a timeout or by an action by the user to move to another part of the UI.

histogram.name: AppBanners.BeforeInstallEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks usage of the BeforeInstallPromptEvent, which allows developers to control when an app banner appears. The events in this histogram are not mutually exclusive - for example, preventDefault() must be called if prompt() is called.

histogram.name: AppBanners.DismissEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks the different ways that an app banner left the screen, e.g. through an automatic dismissal after navigation or an explicit user action.

histogram.name: AppBanners.DisplayEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks when an app banner was requested and how the request was handled, e.g. the user blocked its appearance or the banner was ultimately created.

histogram.name: AppBanners.InstallableStatusCode
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks the status code logged by the app banner system as it processes a site's eligibility for an app banner. Every request for a banner will be logged in a bucket of this histogram.

histogram.name: AppBanners.InstallEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks when a user triggers an install dialog for the app promoted by the banner, as well as whether or not the user ultimately decided to install the app.

histogram.name: AppBanners.MinutesFromFirstVisitToBannerShown
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks the number of minutes between the first recorded visit to an origin and the time when the banner is actually shown.

histogram.name: AppBanners.UserResponse
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat specifically tracks a user's response to a displayed banner.

histogram.name: appcache.CheckResponseResult
histogram.summary: AppCache check response result code.

histogram.name: appcache.CompletionQueueTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between a completion task being queued and run.

histogram.name: appcache.CompletionRunTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to run a completion task on the IO thread.

histogram.name: appcache.CorruptionDetected
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times corruption is detected in the sql database.

histogram.name: appcache.InitResult
histogram.summary: AppCache initialization result code.

histogram.name: appcache.JobStartDelay.AppCache
histogram.summary: How long URLRequests to be retrieved from the appcache are delayed.

histogram.name: appcache.JobStartDelay.Error
histogram.summary: How long URLRequests that result in a synthesized error are delayed.

histogram.name: appcache.JobStartDelay.Network
histogram.summary: How long URLRequests to be retrieved over the network are delayed.

histogram.name: appcache.MainPageLoad
histogram.summary: Counts the number of appcached page loads for secure vs insecure origins.

histogram.name: appcache.MainResourceResponseRetrieval
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of retrieving a main resource from the appcache.

histogram.name: appcache.MissingManifestDetectedAtCallsite
histogram.summary: Identifies where a missing manifest was detected occured.

histogram.name: appcache.MissingManifestEntry
histogram.summary: Logged on each occurrence of there being no record for the manifest file in the entries table.

histogram.name: appcache.ReinitAttempt
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times the appcache reinit process occurs. The boolean value indicates whether it was a repeated attempt to reinitialize during a browsing session.

histogram.name: appcache.SubResourceResponseRetrieval
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of retrieving a sub resource from the appcache.

histogram.name: appcache.TaskQueueTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between a background task being queued and run.

histogram.name: appcache.TaskRunTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to run a background task.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJobResult
histogram.summary: AppCache update job result code.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateProgressAtPointOfFaliure
histogram.summary: Percent completion at point of failure of an update job.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateWasOffOriginAtPointOfFailure
histogram.summary: Whether the resource causing the failure was from a different origin.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateWasStalledAtPointOfFailure
histogram.summary: Whether any progresss had been made in the 5 minutes preceeding failure.

histogram.name: AppleScript.CommandEvent
histogram.summary: The number of times an AppleScript event gets called.

histogram.name: Apps.AppInfoDialog.Launches
histogram.summary: The number of times the app info dialog is launched. This is gathered each time the app info dialog is opened, from each of the places the dialog can be opened from.

histogram.name: Apps.AppInfoDialog.OpenedForLocation
histogram.summary: The location of the app that the dialog was opened for. This is gathered each time the app info dialog is opened.

histogram.name: Apps.AppInfoDialog.OpenedForType
histogram.summary: The type of the app that the dialog was opened for. This is gathered each time the app info dialog is opened.

histogram.name: Apps.AppLaunch
histogram.summary: The number of times v2 packaged apps are launched grouped by extension_misc::AppLaunchBuckets. See also Extensions.AppLaunch.

histogram.name: Apps.AppLauncherPromo
histogram.summary: Interactions with the App Launcher promo dialog.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListCreationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to build the app list UI. This is logged each time the app list is built from scratch.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListDoodleAction
histogram.summary: The number of user interactions with the app list doodle. This is logged once per action.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListHowEnabled
histogram.summary: The trigger that caused the app list to be enabled. Recorded when the user first shows the app list. If not shown after one hour, will be recorded then. If Chrome was not running at the one-hour mark, will be recorded during the next Chrome startup.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListPageOpened
histogram.summary: The page that the app list goes to. This is gathered every time the user initiates a transition to another page in the launcher.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchCommenced
histogram.summary: The number of searches that are started in the app list. This is gathered each time the app list search box transitions from empty to non-empty.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchQueryLength
histogram.summary: The length of the app list search query when a result is opened. This is gathered per click of a search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultDistanceFromOrigin
histogram.summary: The minimum number of arrow keys a user would need to press to navigate to the opened search result. This is gathered per click of a search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultOpenDisplayType
histogram.summary: The display type of the app list search result that was opened by the user. This is gathered per click of a search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultOpenType
histogram.summary: The type of app list search result that was opened by the user. This is gathered per click of a search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListTimeToDiscover
histogram.summary: Time between enabling the app list, and a user explicitly choosing to show it. If the app list is not shown after one hour, an entry in the last bucket is recorded. If the user installs a second packaged app within one hour, or if the app list was not enabled by installing a packaged app from the Web Store, no time value is recorded - only Apps.AppListHowEnabled.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListWarmupDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 07/2016 in Issue 600915 with the removal of the app list on Windows.
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in warmup (in WarmupForProfile call). This will tell us how long warmup blocks the UI.

histogram.name: Apps.AppShimErrorVersion
histogram.summary: Counts which major milestone versions of app_mode_loader are sending --app-shim-error. --app-shim-error is sent as a command line argument to Chrome when app_mode_loader was unable to dyload the Chrome Framework and call ChromeAppModeMain. For example, when Chrome updates from 32-bit to 64-bit, an older shim will find the new framework version but fail to dyload it.

histogram.name: Apps.NoteTakingApp.DefaultLaunchResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to launch a default note-taking app on Chrome OS. Only reported if the preferred app was unspecified or failed to launch.

histogram.name: Apps.NoteTakingApp.PreferredLaunchResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to launch the user-specified preferred note-taking app, if any, on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Arc.AndroidBootTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed for booting up the ARC instance.

histogram.name: Arc.AppCount
histogram.summary: The number of ARC apps open at any given time. Collected every 5 minutes. This indicates both how many users are engaging with apps and, when they do engage, how many apps they are engaging with at a time.

histogram.name: Arc.AppsInstalledAtStartup
histogram.summary: Total number of ARC apps installed on a device measured at startup. Note: This includes launchable apps that are installed by default, such as Play Store and Settings, as well as any vendor specific apps.

histogram.name: Arc.boot_progress
histogram.summary: The relative time of a boot progress event since the ARC starts.

histogram.name: Arc.ComplianceReportSinceUpdateNotificationTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from the policy update notification sent to ARC to the corresponding successfully obtained compliance report from CloudDPS.

histogram.name: Arc.CumulativeUseTime
histogram.summary: ARC use time. The use time is incremented in regular intervals while android container is active. Reported at most once a day, at which point accumulated time is reset (which means that sum of reported times for a OS version would give an estimate of ARC usage time per OS version).

histogram.name: Arc.FirstComplianceReportTime.SinceSignIn
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from the signing in process start to a successfully obtained compliance report from CloudDPS.

histogram.name: Arc.FirstComplianceReportTime.SinceStartup
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from ARC startup to a successfully obtained compliance report from CloudDPS. This value is not reported during the first startup when signing in happens.

histogram.name: Arc.IntentHandlerAction
histogram.summary: ARC intent handler action taken by user.

histogram.name: Arc.IntentHandlerDestinationPlatform
histogram.summary: ARC intent handler destination platform. The destination may be specified due to the user explicit selection or a previously stored preference.

histogram.name: Arc.LowMemoryKiller.Count
histogram.summary: Cumulative count of low memory kills in one user session.

histogram.name: Arc.LowMemoryKiller.FreedSize
histogram.summary: The memory size freed by each low memory kill event.

histogram.name: Arc.LowMemoryKiller.TimeDelta
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to last low memory kill event.

histogram.name: Arc.OOMKills.Count
histogram.summary: Cumulative count of OOM kills in one user session.

histogram.name: Arc.OOMKills.Score
histogram.summary: The oom_badness score of a OOM killed process as reported by kernel.

histogram.name: Arc.OOMKills.TimeDelta
histogram.summary: The elapsed time since last OOM kill event.

histogram.name: Arc.OptInAction
histogram.summary: Arc OptIn action taken by user.

histogram.name: Arc.OptInCancel
histogram.summary: Arc OptIn cancelation reason.

histogram.name: Arc.OptInResult
histogram.summary: Arc OptIn flow result.

histogram.name: Arc.OptInSilentAuthCode
histogram.summary: Arc Silent Auth Code status. This status is set during the ARC OptIn flow. Retrieving Auth Code silently is optional feature. If it is not activated, Disabled state is reported. Once it active, Auth code is retrieved silently. In no error occurs, Success is reported. Otherwise specific error is sent.

histogram.name: Arc.Provisioning.Result
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on 2016-09-15 and replaced by Arc.Provisioning.Result.Managed and Arc.Provisioning.Result.Unmanaged.
histogram.summary: The result (success or the type of failure) of ARC provisioning.

histogram.name: Arc.Provisioning.Result.Managed
histogram.summary: The result (success or the type of failure) of ARC provisioning on managed devices.

histogram.name: Arc.Provisioning.Result.Unmanaged
histogram.summary: The result (success or the type of failure) of ARC provisioning on unmanaged devices.

histogram.name: Arc.Provisioning.TimeDelta.Failure.Managed
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from the signing in process start to call to onSignInFailed for managed users.

histogram.name: Arc.Provisioning.TimeDelta.Failure.Unmanaged
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from the signing in process start to call to onSignInFailed for unmanaged users.

histogram.name: Arc.Provisioning.TimeDelta.Success.Managed
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from the signing in process start to successful call to onSignInComplete for managed users.

histogram.name: Arc.Provisioning.TimeDelta.Success.Unmanaged
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from the signing in process start to successful call to onSignInComplete for unmanaged users.

histogram.name: Arc.ShutdownTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes for ARC to shut down. This value is recorded on ARC shutdown as the time is takes for the init process to exit after setting 'sys.powerctl shutdown'. It is reported on the next ARC startup to avoid sending data during shutdown.

histogram.name: Arc.State
histogram.summary: Whether ARC is enabled or not. Before M56 this was collected only on login and when ARC was enabled or disabled. From M56 forward this is collected during every metrics recording interval, so it is in every record uploaded to the server. This is required because this value is used to categorize all other data in the dashboard as collected with ARC enabled or not.

histogram.name: ArcAuth.AccountCheckStatus
histogram.summary: The status of account check before GMS Sign-in.

histogram.name: ArcAuth.AccountCheckTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time waiting for the account status check to be completed. This is not recorded in case of account status check failure.

histogram.name: ArcAuth.CheckinAttempts
histogram.summary: Number of attempts done while waiting for the check-in task to be completed. 0 means that device was already checked-in. This is recorded in case check-in task is completed successfully.

histogram.name: ArcAuth.CheckinTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time waiting for the check-in task to be completed. This is recorded in case check-in task is completed successfully.

histogram.name: ArcAuth.NetworkWaitTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time waiting for network connection before starting other authorization operations.

histogram.name: ArcAuth.SignInTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time waiting for GMS sign-in to complete.

histogram.name: ArcRuntime.LowMemoryKiller.FreedSize
histogram.summary: The memory size freed by each low memory kill event.

histogram.name: ArcRuntime.LowMemoryKiller.TimeDelta
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to last low memory kill event.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Deprecated.LockScreen
histogram.summary: The lock screen action has two accelerators: - Ctrl+Shift+L which is deprecated. - Search+L which is new. This histogram shows the number of times each accelerator (deprecated and new) is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Deprecated.NextIME
histogram.summary: The switch to the next IME action has two accelerators: - Shift+Alt which is deprecated. - Ctrl+Shift+Space which is new. This histogram shows the number of times each accelerator (deprecated and new) is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Deprecated.ShowImeMenuBubble
histogram.summary: Showing the IME menu bubble has two accelerators: - Alt+Shift+K which is deprecated. - Search+Shift+K which is new. This histogram shows the number of times each accelerator (deprecated and new) is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Deprecated.ShowTaskManager
histogram.summary: Opening the task manager has two accelerators: - Shift+Esc which is deprecated. - Search+Esc which is new. This histogram shows the number of times each accelerator (deprecated and new) is used.

histogram.name: Ash.ActiveTouchPoints
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: Number of active touch-points when a new touch-point is added.

histogram.name: Ash.ActiveWindowShowTypeOverTime
histogram.summary: The show type of the active window tracked over time by logging on a regular basis (30 minutes).

histogram.name: Ash.AppList.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The amount of time between selecting an item from the Ash app list. Not recorded on the first time an item is selected from the app list after startup.

histogram.name: Ash.Desktop.TimeBetweenNavigateToTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between task window activations triggered by users clicking or tapping on a window, as recorded by the Desktop_SwitchTask user action. Recorded on ChromeOS only. Task switches from other sources are ignored and do not affect this metric. In other words, if a user performs the following steps (1) click on task window 'A' (2) Alt+Tab to task 'Z'(3) click on task window 'B', then this will result in a sample recorded for the time delta between activating task window 'A'and 'B'.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.Action
histogram.summary: User-initiated action taken that affects docked windows such as docking, undocking, minimizing, restoring, closing or just dragging a docked window.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ActionSource
histogram.summary: Source (mouse, touch, keyboard or unknown) of the user-initiated action for docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsAll
histogram.summary: Number of all docked windows or panels including hidden or minimized. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsLarge
histogram.summary: Number of large (wider than dock maximum width) windows that had to be shrunk to get docked among the visible docked windows. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsPanels
histogram.summary: Number of docked visible panels. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsVisible
histogram.summary: Number of visible docked windows or panels. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.TimeBetweenUse
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between instances of docking, undocking or any other action affecting docked state of a window.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.Width
histogram.summary: Width of the docked area in pixels. Recorded every time it changes after a user window resize operation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.GestureCreated
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2014 in Issue 352654, and replaced by Event.GestureCreated.
histogram.summary: The gesture-events recognized and dispatched by the browser gesture recognizer.

histogram.name: Ash.GestureTarget
histogram.summary: The gesture-events recognized and dispatched by the browser gesture recognizer for various UI components.

histogram.name: Ash.ImmersiveFullscreen.WindowType
histogram.summary: The type of the window which is put into immersive fullscreen. Immersive fullscreen is entered via the F4 key.

histogram.name: Ash.NumberOfVisibleWindowsInPrimaryDisplay
histogram.summary: An upper bound on the number of windows visible to the user on the primary display. Determined by processing the windows in increasing z-order and counting all non-minimized windows until a maximized or fullscreen window is processed. This metric is logged periodically every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Rotation.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when rotating screen. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user rotates the screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Menu.NumItemsEnabledUponSelection
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of menu items that are enabled in a shelf item's secondary menu. This metric is only recorded when a menu item is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Menu.SelectedMenuItemIndex
histogram.summary: Tracks the index of the selected menu item in a shelf item's secondary menu. This metric is only recorded when a menu item is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfItems
histogram.summary: The number of icons in the shelf, not including the App Launcher icon. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfPinnedItems
histogram.summary: The number of pinned icons in the shelf, not including the App Launcher icon. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfUnpinnedItems
histogram.summary: The number of unpinned icons in the shelf. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InLaserPointerMode
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time spend in Palette laser point mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InMagnifyMode
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time spend in Palette Magnify mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.ModeCancellation
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a palette mode is explicitly cancelled or switched out of.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Usage
histogram.summary: Tracks the usage of each pen palette option when palette is not automatically opened by a stylus eject event.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Usage.AutoOpened
histogram.summary: Tracks the usage of each pen palette option when palette is automatically opened by a stylus eject event.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenNavigateToTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between contiguous task switch user actions triggered by the Shelf buttons where the user activates a different user-predictable task. Task switches from other sources are ignored and do not affect this metric. In other words, if a user performs the following steps (1) launch task 'A' from the Shelf (2) Alt+Tab to task 'Z' (3) launch task 'B' from the Shelf, then this will result in a sample recorded for the time delta between launching tasks 'A' and 'B'.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenWindowMinimizedAndActivatedActions
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time between a window being minimized by the shelf and subsequently activated. In other words this metric is only recorded if a shelf button pressed action causes a window to be minimized and the very next shelf button pressed action causes the same window to be activated.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfAlignmentOverTime
histogram.summary: The current state of the shelf (alignment) tracked over time by logging on a regular basis (30 minutes), this is used instead of log in or shelf usage to track users that do not lock/unlock or log in frequently and use a small number of browser instances or otherwise infrequently interact with the shelf launcher.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfAlignmentUsage
histogram.summary: The current state of the shelf (alignment) when the shelf launcher is used to launch an app/window/etc, this is used instead of log in to give data on users that do not lock/unlock or log in frequently.

histogram.name: Ash.StationaryTouchDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The duration of mostly stationary long-duration touches.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.DefaultView.VisibleRows
histogram.summary: The visible rows displayed in the system menu's default view. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.PercentageOfWorkAreaHeightCoveredByMenu
histogram.summary: The height of the system menu divided by the height of the Ash desktop work area; a value over 100% indicates that a portion of the system menu is not visible to the user. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.Rows
histogram.summary: The number of user-visible rows in the system menu's default view. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.Tab.TimeBetweenSwitchToExistingTabUserActions
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between tab switches triggered by a user gesture (e.g. Ctrl+T, Ctrl+1, tapping or clicking the tab strip, etc).

histogram.name: Ash.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between contiguous task switch user actions triggered by any of the other task switch actions that are tracked. (e.g., Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenNavigateToTaskSwitches, Ash.Tab.TimeBetweenSwitchToExistingTabUserActions, Ash.WindowCycleController.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches, Ash.AppList.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches, Ash.WindowSelector.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges, etc). Note the Ash.AppList.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches and Ash.Tab.TimeBetweenSwitchToExistingTabUserActions histograms were deprecated and removed in 10/2016.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2013 in r239809, and replaced by Ash.TouchDuration2.
histogram.summary: The duration of a touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchDuration2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2014 in Issue 352654, and replaced by Event.TouchDuration.
histogram.summary: The duration of a touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMaxDistance
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2014 in Issue 352654, and replaced by Event.TouchMaxDistance.
histogram.summary: The maximum euclidean distance in dips which a touch point has travelled away from its starting point. Only measured for single finger gestures.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveInterval
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The interval between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveSteps
histogram.summary: The distance between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchPositionX
histogram.summary: The position of the touch-events along the X axis.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchPositionY
histogram.summary: The position of the touch-events along the Y axis.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchRadius
histogram.summary: The radius of a touch event.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartAfterEnd
histogram.summary: The interval between the end of a touch-sequence and the start of the next touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartBurst
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The number of rapid touch-starts that happened within a short interval. Logged once for each such burst group.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActive
histogram.summary: The length of time that TouchView is active, for each activation.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActivePercentage
histogram.summary: The proportion of time spent in TouchView during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactive
histogram.summary: The length of time between TouchView activations.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is not active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Apps
histogram.summary: The Wallpaper App that the user is using right now on Chrome OS. It's the app that is used when the user right clicks on desktop and selects "Set wallpaper" or when the user selects "Set wallpaper" from chrome://settings page. This is recorded at user login.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtraction.Durations
histogram.summary: The time taken to extract colors from wallpapers. Recorded each time the wallpaper image changes.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtraction.UserDelay
histogram.summary: The time taken to extract colors from 'expensive' wallpapers. Recorded each time the wallpaper image changes and the color extraction is expected to be expensive, e.g. image size > 100 pixels. This includes time spent switching threads.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtractionResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate for wallpaper color extraction. Recorded each time the wallpaper image changes.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.CustomLayout
histogram.summary: The custom wallpaper layout type. Recorded when the user sets a new custom wallpaper or changes the existing custom wallpaper's layout.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.DefaultIndex
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 11/2012. Use of indices has been removed.
histogram.summary: The wallpaper index if one of the default wallpapers has been selected. Recorded at user login. Currently only for the old wallpaper picker UI.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Source
histogram.summary: Recorded when a new wallpaper is set, either by the built-in Wallpaper Picker App, or by a third party App. Note the wallpaper change triggered by Sync file system event doesn't count.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.TimeSpentExtractingColors
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2017 in favor of Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtraction.Durations and Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtraction.UserDelay.
histogram.summary: The time taken to extract colors from wallpapers. Recorded each time the wallpaper image changes. NOTE, this measure also included the time spent jumping between threads, thus it was deprecated in favor of Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtraction.Durations.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.TimeSpentResizing
histogram.summary: The time taken to resize wallpapers. Recorded once each time the wallpaper changes (e.g. initial wallpaper loading at boot, switching user avatar at login screen, switching between logged in users, user selects new wallpaper, etc).

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Type
histogram.summary: The wallpaper type. Recorded at user login.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of cross fade animation when setting window bounds. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when SetBoundsDirectCrossFade is called, such as when window is maximized.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.CycleTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time the Alt key is held after pressing Alt+Tab to begin cycling through windows.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.Items
histogram.summary: The number of windows in the Alt+Tab selector. Only recorded once when cycling starts, not every time when Tab is pressed without releasing Alt.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.SelectionDepth
histogram.summary: When a window is selected after pressing Alt+Tab, records that window's position in the global MRU ordering. 1 represents the most-recently used window, 2 represents the next most-recently used window, and so on. Recorded when Alt+Tab cycling stops, i.e., when Alt key is released.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between task switches triggered by the next window and previous window accelerator keys (ie Alt+Tab, Alt+Shift+Tab).

histogram.name: Ash.WindowManager.Lock.Success
histogram.summary: How long it took for the screen lock process to complete. This does not include timeouts.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowManager.Lock.Timeout
histogram.summary: How long it took for the screen lock process to complete, for timeouts only.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.AnimationSmoothness.Close
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when closing a window in overview mode. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.AnimationSmoothness.Enter
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when entering overview mode. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.AnimationSmoothness.Exit
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when exiting overview mode. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.ArrowKeyPresses
histogram.summary: The number of times the arrow keys are pressed in overview mode per session, i.e. between bringing up overview mode and ending it. This is only measured for the sessions that end by selecting a window with the enter key.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.CycleTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 06/2014. No longer relevant since alt-tab switching was separated from WindowSelector.
histogram.summary: The amount of time the Alt key is held after pressing Alt+Tab to begin cycling through windows.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.Items
histogram.summary: The number of items (single windows or groups of windows such as panels) in the overview mode, present at the start of each session.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.ItemsWhenTextFilteringUsed
histogram.summary: The number of items showing in overview mode at the moment when an item is selected or when selection is canceled. Only recorded if the text filtering textfield contains a non-empty string.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.KeyPressesOverItemsRatio
histogram.summary: The ratio between the arrow key presses and the number of overview items, expressed as a percentage for a single session.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.OverviewClosedItems
histogram.summary: The number of items closed from the window overview for a single session.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.SelectionDepth
histogram.summary: When a window is selected in overview mode, records that window's position in the global MRU ordering. 1 represents the most-recently used window, 2 represents the next most-recently used window, and so on.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TextFilteringStringLength
histogram.summary: The length of the string entered into the text filtering textfield at the moment when an item is selected or when selection is canceled.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TextFilteringTextfieldCleared
histogram.summary: The number of times the text filtering textfield has had all of its text removed within a single overview mode session. Measured from the time overview mode is invoked to when an item is selected or when selection is canceled.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges
histogram.summary: The amount of time between endings of overview mode sessions which were caused by the user selecting a window which was not previously active. Only recorded on the second and later times after startup that the user selected a window which was not previously active.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeBetweenUse
histogram.summary: The amount of time between uses of overview mode, recorded when overview mode is entered. Only recorded on the second and later times after startup that the user entered overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeInOverview
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in overview mode. Overview mode is engaged by pressing the overview button. The time is measured from the moment the windows begin animating to a thumbnail size preview to when a window is selected or selection is canceled.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeInOverviewWithTextFiltering
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in overview mode when text filtering is used. The time is measured from the moment the windows begin animating to a thumbnail size preview to when a window is selected or selection is canceled. Only recorded if the text filtering textfield contains a non-empty string.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.AttemptCountFail
histogram.summary: Count of DnsAttempts before DnsTransaction completes with failure.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.AttemptCountSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of DnsAttempts before DnsTransaction completes successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigChange
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfigService::OnConfigChange actually corresponded to a change in DnsConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigNotifyInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time between calls to DnsConfigService::InvalidateConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent parsing DnsConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParsePosix
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsConfig in DnsConfigServicePosix.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseResult
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfig was parsed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseWin
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsConfig in DnsConfigServiceWin.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DNSChangerDetected
histogram.summary: Whether the first valid DnsConfig included a rogue nameserver.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DnsClientDisabledReason
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by DnsTask if a subsequent ProcTask succeeded, at the end of a streak of failures after which the DnsClient was disabled.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DnsClientEnabled
histogram.summary: TRUE counts the events when a valid DnsConfig is received and used to enable DnsClient, while FALSE counts the events when DnsClient is disabled after a series of successful fallbacks from DnsTask to ProcTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.FallbackFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent by ProcTask in failing fallback resolutions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.FallbackSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent by ProcTask in successful fallback resolutions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HaveDnsConfig
histogram.summary: Whether there was a valid DNS configuration at the start of a job which eventually completed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostParseResult
histogram.summary: Whether DnsHosts were parsed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsChange
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfigService::OnHostsChange actually corresponded to a change in DnsHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsNotifyInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time between calls to DnsConfigService::InvalidateHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsParseDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent parsing DnsHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsParseWin
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsHosts in DnsConfigServiceWin.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsSize
histogram.summary: The size of the HOSTS file observed before each attempt to parse it.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_HIGHEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_IDLE
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_LOW
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_LOWEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_MEDIUM
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_HIGHEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_IDLE
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOW
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOWEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_MEDIUM
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.NameServersType
histogram.summary: Type of nameservers in the DNS config, recorded each time the config is read by the DNSConfigService.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ParseToAddressList
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing addresses out of DNS responses in successful DnsTransactions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.PrefDefaultSource
histogram.summary: The source of the async DNS preference's default. Logged at startup, when the IO thread is created.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.PrefSource
histogram.summary: The source of the async DNS preference's value. Logged at startup, when the IO thread is created.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveError
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by DnsTask if a subsequent ProcTask succeeded.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTask in resolutions that failed. Excludes time spent in the subsequent fallback.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveStatus
histogram.summary: Counts of the overall results of using asynchronous DNS in HostResolverImpl. This only includes jobs started with valid DNS configuration and excludes synchronous resolutions (as IP literals, from cache, and from HOSTS).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTask in resolutions that succeeded.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV4
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv4 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV6
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_UNSPEC
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to IPv4/IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerCount
histogram.summary: Count of servers in DnsConfig. Recorded on every new DnsSession, which is created on DNS change.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailureIndex
histogram.summary: Index in DnsConfig of the failing server, recorded at the time of failure.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresAfterNetworkChange
histogram.summary: Count of server failures after network change before first success in the DnsSession. Recorded at the time of first success.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresAfterSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of server failures after success until the end of the session. Server has reported success at some point during the session. Recorded at the end of the DnsSession.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresBeforeSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of server failures before success. This is NOT the first success in the DnsSession. Recorded at the time of success.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresWithoutSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of server failures without success until the end of the session. Server has never reported success during the DnsSession. Recorded at the end of the DnsSession.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerIsGood
histogram.summary: The current server is "good" and does not have to be skipped.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SortFailure
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in failing calls to AddressSorter in dual-stack resolutions using DnsTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SortSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in successful calls to AddressSorter in dual-stack resolutions using DnsTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchDone
histogram.summary: The number of names from the search name list consumed during a successful transaction (QTYPE A only).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchRemain
histogram.summary: The number of names left on the search name list at the end of a successful transaction (QTYPE A only).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchStart
histogram.summary: The number of names on the search name list at the start of a transaction (QTYPE A only).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TCPAttemptFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTCPAttempt in failed attempts. Excludes timeouts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TCPAttemptSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTCPAttempt in successful attempts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorHistogram
histogram.summary: Difference between RTT and timeout calculated using Histogram algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorHistogramUnder
histogram.summary: Difference between timeout calculated using Histogram algorithm and RTT.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorJacobson
histogram.summary: Difference between RTT and timeout calculated using Jacobson algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorJacobsonUnder
histogram.summary: Difference between timeout calculated using Jacobson algorithm and RTT.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutSpentHistogram
histogram.summary: Duration of time that would be spent waiting for lost request using Histogram algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutSpentJacobson
histogram.summary: Duration of time that would be spent waiting for lost request using Jacobson algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Excludes speculative requests.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TotalTime_speculative
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Speculative requests only.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionFailure
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in failing DnsTransactions. This includes server failures, timeouts and NXDOMAIN results.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in successful DnsTransactions. This includes all NOERROR answers, even if they indicate the name has no addresses or they cannot be parsed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess_A
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess but limited to A query type.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess_AAAA
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess but limited to AAAA query type.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TTL
histogram.summary: TTL of the resolved addresses, as in the response received from the server. For results served from local cache, the TTL is from the original response.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UDPAttemptFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsUDPAttempt in failed attempts. Excludes timeouts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UDPAttemptSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsUDPAttempt in successful attempts. Includes responses arriving after timeout, if multiple attempts are allowed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UnchangedConfigInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time since the last empty config result to the time a non-change OnConfigChange is received.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UnchangedHostsInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time since the last empty config result to the time a non-change OnHostsChange is received.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.WatchStatus
histogram.summary: The result of DnsConfigService watch. Counts STARTED on every initialization and FAILED_* on any failure.

histogram.name: Aura.CreatedGpuBrowserCompositor
histogram.summary: Whether the browser compositor uses GPU or the software renderer.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.ErrorTypeOfAuthenticateUser
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to authenticate a user to an Active Directory domain.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.ErrorTypeOfJoinADDomain
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to join a machine to an Active Directory domain.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.ErrorTypeOfRefreshDevicePolicy
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to fetch device policy from an Active Directory domain and store it on disk.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.ErrorTypeOfRefreshUserPolicy
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to fetch user policy from an Active Directory domain and store it on disk.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.FailedTriesOfKinit
histogram.summary: Number of times 'kinit' failed until the next try succeeded or the method gave up because a maximum number of tries was exceeded. 'kinit' is run for Active Directory enrolled devices during user authentication and device policy fetch.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.FailedTriesOfSmbClient
histogram.summary: Number of times 'smbclient' failed until it the next try succeeded or the method gave up because a maximum number of tries was exceeded. 'smbclient' is run for Active Directory enrolled devices during policy fetch.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.NumGposToDownload
histogram.summary: Number of group policy objects attached to a specific user or machine on an Active Directory domain. This value is recorded when user or device policy is fetched from an Active Directory server.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.TimeToAuthenticateUser
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to authenticate a user to an Active Directory domain. The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.TimeToJoinADDomain
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to join a machine to an Active Directory domain. Domain join is part of the Active Directory enrollment process. The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.TimeToRefreshDevicePolicy
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to fetch device policy from an Active Directory domain and store it on disk. The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.TimeToRefreshUserPolicy
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to fetch user policy from an Active Directory domain and store it on disk. The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.TimeToRunKinit
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to call 'kinit' (request Kerberos ticket-granting- ticket). TGTs are requested regularly for accessing services on Active Directory domains. The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.TimeToRunNetAdsInfo
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to call 'net ads info' (query Active Directory information). The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.TimeToRunNetAdsJoin
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to call 'net ads join' (join machine to an Active Directory domain). The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.TimeToRunNetAdsSearch
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to call 'net ads search' (query information about an Active Directory account). The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.TimeToRunNetAdsWorkgroup
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to call 'net ads workgroup' (query Active Directory workgroup). The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: AuthPolicy.TimeToRunSmbclient
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to call 'smbclient' (download policy from an Active Directory domain). The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.Bubble
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of user interactions with the Autocheckout bubble, which prompts users to invoke Autocheckout on supported websites.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.BuyFlow
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of final states reached in Autocheckout buy flow.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.DismissalState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The state of the Autocheckout dialog when it was dismissed.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.FlowDuration
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user submitted the Autocheckout dialog and when the Autocheckout flow, or filling process, concluded.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.FlowDuration.Failed
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user submitted the Autocheckout dialog and when the Autocheckout flow concluded, in cases where the flow failed.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.FlowDuration.Succeeded
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user submitted the Autocheckout dialog and when the Autocheckout flow concluded, in cases where the flow succeeded.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.InitialUserState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The initial state of a user that's interacting with a freshly shown Autocheckout dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.PopupInDialog
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: User interactions with the Autofill popup shown while filling an Autocheckout dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.Security
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of security warnings and errors in the Autocheckout dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiDuration
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an Autocheckout dialog was shown.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiDuration.Cancel
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an Autocheckout dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up canceling out of the dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiDuration.Submit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an Autocheckout dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up accepting the dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiEvents
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
