histogram.summary: Measures how users are interacting with the Autocheckout dialog UI.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiLatencyToShow
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of time it takes for the Autocheckout UI to be actionable by the user after it is shown.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WalletErrors
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of errors in communicating with the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WalletRequiredActions
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of required user actions returned by the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WhitelistDownloadDuration
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures time taken to download the Autocheckout whitelist file.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WhitelistDownloadDuration.Failed
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures time taken to download the Autocheckout whitelist file in case the download was failed.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WhitelistDownloadDuration.Succeeded
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures time taken to download the Autocheckout whitelist file in case the download was succeeded.

histogram.name: AutodetectEncoding.Attempted
histogram.summary:
Whether the text encoding auto detection logic was attempted for a web page. The logic is triggered when the parser fails to find the encoding method from other signals such as http header, meta tag, BOM, etc.
If the logic successfully detects a new encoding method which is different from the default one, the result is reported through AutodetectEncoding.Detected with the encoding method (see below). Otherwise - i.e. detection logic somehow fails to work for the page or the detected one is same as the default - no result is reported.

histogram.name: AutodetectEncoding.Detected
histogram.summary: The number of web pages whose encoding method is found by the auto detection logic. Grouped by the encoding methods defined in EncodingMethod.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressBook.AccessSkipped
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to access the Mac AddressBook was skipped because doing so would incorrectly cause the appearance of the permissions dialog. This happens when Chrome auto-update changes the binary on disk before the first AddressBook access attempt.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressBookAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Mac AddressBook was available on an attempt to read data from it.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressBookAvailableOnFirstAttempt
histogram.summary: Whether the Mac AddressBook was available on the *first* attempt to read data from it. This is only recorded once per Chrome profile.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of address suggestions shown in the Autofill popup.

histogram.name: Autofill.AutomaticProfileCreation
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Autofill.ProfileActionOnFormSubmitted.
histogram.summary: Whether a new Autofill profile was created automatically. In the "false" case, an existing profile was used (and possibly updated).

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUploadDecision
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2/2016, replaced by Autofill.CardUploadDecisionMetric.
histogram.summary: Whether upload was offered upon detecting a form submission with credit card data and a reason if it wasn't.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUploadDecisionExpanded
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2017, replaced by Autofill.CardUploadDecisionMetric.
histogram.summary: Whether upload was offered upon detecting a form submission with credit card data and a detailed reason if it wasn't.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUploadDecisionMetric
histogram.summary: Whether upload was offered upon detecting a form submission with credit card data, a detailed reason if upload was offered even with some missing fields and detailed reasons if it wasn't.

histogram.name: AutoFill.CCInfoBarAccepted
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The Autofill credit card info bar was accepted.

histogram.name: AutoFill.CCInfoBarDenied
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The Autofill credit card info bar was denied.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardFillingInfoBar
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept, deny, or ignore the Autofill credit card assisted filling infobar prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept, deny, or ignore the Autofill credit card info bar prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.CreditCard
histogram.summary: Logs the number of days that have passed since the credit card was last used.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.Profile
histogram.summary: Logs the number of days that have passed since the profile was last used.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSincePreviousUseAtSubmission.Profile
histogram.summary: Logs the number of days between most recent use without modification and the penultimate use of the profile when submitting a credit card form.

histogram.name: Autofill.DeveloperEngagement
histogram.summary: Measures the adoption of the HTML autocomplete type hint specification (see http://is.gd/whatwg_autocomplete for more details). For each fillable form detected, logs whether that form includes author-specified type hints.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for an autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for a non-autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for an autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for a non-autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.Address
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for address forms. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting an address.
histogram.details: Important caveat about submission metrics: - Submission using autofill data is determined by simply evaluating if there was a fill operation in this page. So, if the user filled with local data, completed erased or modified the data after and then submitted, we would only emit one "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)"; - The submission segmentation works by checking what kind of data was last filled for this type of form in the page load. So, if a user initially filled with local data and after that filled with server, we will only emit "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)".

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for credit card forms. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting a credit card.
histogram.details: Important caveat about submission metrics: - Submission using autofill data is determined by simply evaluating if there was a fill operation in this page. So, if the user filled with local data, completed erased or modified the data after and then submitted, we would only emit one "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)"; - The submission segmentation works by checking what kind of data was last filled for this type of form in the page load. So, if a user initially filled with local data and after that filled with server, we will only emit "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)".

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.OnNonsecurePage
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for credit card forms on nonsecure pages. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting a credit card.
histogram.details: Important caveat about submission metrics: - Submission using autofill data is determined by simply evaluating if there was a fill operation in this page. So, if the user filled with local data, completed erased or modified the data after and then submitted, we would only emit one "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)"; - The submission segmentation works by checking what kind of data was last filled for this type of form in the page load. So, if a user initially filled with local data and after that filled with server, we will only emit "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)".

histogram.name: Autofill.FormSubmittedState
histogram.summary: The autofill state related to a submitted form.

histogram.name: Autofill.HasModifiedProfile.CreditCardFormSubmission
histogram.summary: Whether user modified an address profile shortly before submitting a credit card form.

histogram.name: Autofill.IcuCollatorCreationSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill was able to create the ICU collator successfully.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill is enabled on page load for a page containing forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill is enabled when Chrome launches.

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyboardAccessoryButtonsIOS
histogram.summary: [iOS] Measures the frequency of button presses on the iOS Autofill keyboard accessory.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook
histogram.summary: When Chrome tries to access the user's Address Book, OSX presents a blocking dialog which disrupts the user experience. A new Chrome feature has been introduced wherein Chrome only shows this blocking dialog if the user explicitly asked Chrome to access the user's Address Book. If a form's field looks like it might support Autofill suggestions from the user's Address Book and there are no other suggestions, Chrome shows an Autofill entry that prompts the user to give Chrome access to the user's Address Book. This histogram tracks the frequency that this Autofill entry is presented, and the frequency that this Autofill entry is selected.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.AcceptedSuggestionIsFromAddressBook
histogram.summary: This metric is emitted each time the user accepts an Autofill suggestion. It records whether the result is from the Address Book.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.AccessTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent accessing the OSX Address Book the first time after Chrome was launched. If this time is larger than ~100ms, this it is likely that the user was shown a blocking, modal dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.ContainedMeCard
histogram.summary: After a Chrome is given access to the Mac Address Book, whether the Address Book contained a Me card.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.MeCard.HadAddress
histogram.summary: When Chrome is given access to the Me Card of the Address Book, whether the card has an address that contained a street number and either a city or zip code.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.MeCard.HadEmail
histogram.summary: When Chrome is given access to the Me Card of the Address Book, whether the card has an email.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.MeCard.HadName
histogram.summary: When Chrome is given access to the Me Card of the Address Book, whether the card has a name.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.MeCard.HadPhoneNumber
histogram.summary: When Chrome is given access to the Me Card of the Address Book, whether the card has a phone number.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.NumShowsBeforeSelected
histogram.summary: The number of times that the access Address Book prompt has been shown when the user selects the prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfEditedAutofilledFieldsAtSubmission
histogram.summary: The number of autofilled fields that were subsequently edited prior to the form being submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfProfilesConsideredForDedupe
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill profiles that have been considered for deduplication.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfProfilesRemovedDuringDedupe
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill profiles that have been removed during deduplication.

histogram.name: Autofill.PasswordFormQueryVolume
histogram.summary: Tracks the increased load on the Autofill server if the restriction on querying for password forms with fewer than 3 fields were omitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.PayloadCompressionRatio
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 1/2016, autofill payload compression was removed.
histogram.summary: Compression ratio of the query and upload payload that are sent to the Autofill server. The payload is compressed using gzip.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileActionOnFormSubmitted
histogram.summary: The profile action that took place when a form was submitted.

histogram.name: AutoFill.ProfileCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.StoredProfileCount.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill address profiles a user has.

histogram.name: AutoFill.Quality
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.Quality.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The quality of the AutoFill implementation.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2/2014 (M35), replaced by Autofill.UserHappiness.
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill implementation.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.HeuristicType
histogram.summary: The quality of Autofill's heuristic field type detection.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.HeuristicType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The quality of Autofill's heuristic field type detection, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.PredictedType
histogram.summary: The overall quality of the Autofill field type predictions.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.PredictedType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The overall quality of the Autofill field type predictions, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.ServerType
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill server's field type detection.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.ServerType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill server's field type detection, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: Autofill.QueriedCreditCardFormIsSecure
histogram.summary: For credit card forms that are queried for Autofill, a ratio of how many are within secure contexts (which includes mixed passive content).

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPrompt
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept or deny the Autofill save credit card prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.ScanCreditCard.Completed
histogram.summary: Whether a credit card scan was completed or cancelled.

histogram.name: Autofill.ScanCreditCard.Duration
histogram.summary: How long a credit card took to scan.

histogram.name: Autofill.ScanCreditCardPrompt
histogram.summary: Usage of the "Scan card" control item.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2011, replaced by Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Query.
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received in response to an Autofill server query.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Query
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received in response to an Autofill server query.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Upload
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received at the time of an Autofill upload.

histogram.name: AutoFill.ServerQueryResponse
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.ServerQueryResponse.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The usefulness of AutoFill server information.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerQueryResponse
histogram.summary: The usefulness of Autofill server information.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerResponseHasDataForForm
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill server had at least some prediction data for a given form at query response time.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredLocalCreditCardCount

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileCount
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill addresses a user has stored, measured at launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileCountAtAutofillableFormSubmission

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredServerCreditCardCount
histogram.summary: The number of server credit cards a user has stored, measured at Chrome profile launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionAcceptedIndex
histogram.summary: The index of the accepted Autofill suggestion in the popup.

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionAcceptedIndex.Autocomplete
histogram.summary: The index of the accepted Autocomplete suggestion in the popup.

histogram.name: Autofill.Timing.DetermineHeuristicTypes
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between the start and end of FormStructure::DetermineHeuristicTypes().

histogram.name: Autofill.Timing.ParseForm
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between the start and end of parsing a single form.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.Duration
histogram.summary: Duration of the interaction with the UnmaskPrompt since it was shown until it was closed. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in an autofill dropdown.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.Events
histogram.summary: Events tracking the usage of the unmasking prompt. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in a autofill dropdown.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.GetRealPanDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of the GetRealPan API call. This API call is triggered by the unmasking prompt when the user types information to verify their ownership of the card being fetched.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.GetRealPanResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of the GetRealPan API call. This API call is triggered by the unmasking prompt when the user types information to verify their ownership of the card being fetched.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.TimeBeforeAbandonUnmasking
histogram.summary: Time the user waited before abandoning an unmasking operation. In such a scenario, the user is cancelling a pending unmasking operation (possibly because it is taking too long). The time measured here corresponds to the time between the user clicking the "Verify" button and then clicking "Cancel".

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.UnmaskingDuration
histogram.summary: Duration between the user clicking the Verify button within the unmasking prompt until we get a response back from the server. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in an autofill dropdown.

histogram.name: Autofill.UserHappiness
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of various events in the Autofill user interaction flow. By comparing frequencies, we can compute several interesting "user happiness" metrics.

histogram.name: Autofill.WalletAddressConversionType
histogram.summary: Tracks how the different wallet addresses are converted to local autofill profiles.

histogram.name: BackgroundFetch.EventDispatchFailure.Dispatch
histogram.summary: Records the Service Worker status code that caused a Background Fetch API event to fail dispatching whilst trying to dispatch an event on the active Service Worker.

histogram.name: BackgroundFetch.EventDispatchFailure.FindWorker
histogram.summary: Records the Service Worker status code that caused a Background Fetch API event to fail dispatching whilst trying to find the Service Worker.

histogram.name: BackgroundFetch.EventDispatchFailure.StartWorker
histogram.summary: Records the Service Worker status code that caused a Background Fetch API event to fail dispatching whilst trying to start the active Service Worker.

histogram.name: BackgroundFetch.EventDispatchResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of dispatching one of the Background Fetch API events to the Service Worker associated with the event.

histogram.name: BackgroundMode.BackgroundApplicationsCount
histogram.summary: The number of background applications (extensions) for a profile that were loaded after the profile was registered with the BackgroundModeManager.

histogram.name: BackgroundMode.BackgroundModeEnabledPrefChanged
histogram.summary: Logged if BackgroundModeManager is running and listening for pref changes, and the pref does indeed change. The new value is logged.

histogram.name: BackgroundMode.MenuItemClick
histogram.summary: Logged when an item in the system tray icon menu is clicked.

histogram.name: BackgroundMode.OnStartup.AutoLaunchState
histogram.summary: Logged during BackgroundModeManager's initialization. Indicates the AutoLaunchState the current browser process was launched in.

histogram.name: BackgroundMode.OnStartup.IsBackgroundModePrefEnabled
histogram.summary: Logged during BackgroundModeManager's initialization. Indicates the state of the kBackgroundModeEnabled pref on startup.

histogram.name: BackgroundMode.TimeBeforeOptimizedRestart
histogram.summary: The duration of a session before the browser got restarted in the background by the BackgroundOptimizer to purge the memory.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Event.BatchSize
histogram.summary: Records the number of sync events which were fired in a batch. A batch is defined as the set of sync events dispatched at the same time by the BackgroundSyncManager. One-shots usually run individually (a batch of one), unless the device was offline and multiple are waiting for the device to go back online.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Event.OneShotResult
histogram.obsolete: As of 10/2015 this has been replaced by BackgroundSync.Event.OneShotResultPattern.
histogram.summary: Records whether a one-shot sync event succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Event.OneShotResultPattern
histogram.summary: Records whether a periodic sync event succeeded or failed and whether the sync event finished in the foreground or background.
histogram.details: A sync event finished in the foreground if the associated Service Worker Registration has a client at the time that the event finished.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Event.OneShotStartedInForeground
histogram.summary: Records whether a one-shot sync started firing in the foreground or background. Called shortly before the event is fired.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Event.PeriodicResult
histogram.obsolete: As of 10/2015 this has been replaced by BackgroundSync.Event.PeriodicResultPattern.
histogram.summary: Records whether a periodic sync event succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Event.PeriodicResultPattern
histogram.summary: Records whether a one-shot sync event succeeded or failed and whether the sync event finished in the foreground or background.
histogram.details: A sync event finished in the foreground if the associated Service Worker Registration has a client at the time that the event finished.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Event.PeriodicStartedInForeground
histogram.summary: Records whether a periodic sync event started firing in the foreground or background. Called shortly before the event is fired.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Event.Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to execute a batch of sync events. A batch is defined as the set of sync events dispatched at the same time by the BackgroundSyncManager. Periodic syncs often run in a batch. One-shots usually run individually (a batch of one), unless the device was offline and multiple are waiting for the device to go back online.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.LaunchTask.CancelSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the result of attempting to cancel a future browser launch using the GCM Network Manager on Android.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.LaunchTask.PlayServicesAvailable
histogram.summary: Records whether Google Play Services is available to the Background Sync system on Android, for scheduling future sync events when the browser is not running. This will be logged at most once per run.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.LaunchTask.ScheduleSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the result of attempting to schedule a future browser launch using the GCM Network Manager on Android.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.NetworkObserver.HasPermission
histogram.summary: Records whether the browser has sufficient permissions to create a BackgroundSyncNetworkObserver object on Android, at the point when it tries to create it. This should never be false, but is being tracked in order to help resolve crbug.com/545473.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Registration.OneShot
histogram.summary: Records the result of attempting to register a one-shot sync.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Registration.OneShot.CouldFire
histogram.summary: Records the result of attempting to register a one-shot sync in a situation where the sync could fire immediately.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Registration.OneShot.IsDuplicate
histogram.summary: Records whether a one-shot sync registration exactly duplicates an existing registered sync.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Registration.Periodic
histogram.summary: Records the result of attempting to register a periodic sync.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Registration.Periodic.IsDuplicate
histogram.summary: Records whether a periodic sync registration exactly duplicates an existing registered sync.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Unregistration.OneShot
histogram.summary: Records the result of attempting to unregister a one-shot sync.

histogram.name: BackgroundSync.Unregistration.Periodic
histogram.summary: Records the result of attempting to unregister a periodic sync.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.NumberBatteriesWin
histogram.summary: Number of batteries reported by Windows at the start of the Battery Status API.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.StartAndroid

histogram.name: Blacklist.Blocked
histogram.summary: Records the name hashes of all the dlls that are blocked from the browser process.

histogram.name: Blacklist.PatchedInRenderer
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times a renderer process is started with the browser blacklist patch. This should never be hit.

histogram.name: Blacklist.RetryAttempts.Success
histogram.summary: Records the number of attempts needed before the blacklist is properly set up. This is logged immediately after a successful setup.

histogram.name: Blacklist.Setup
histogram.summary: Records the successes and failures when running the browser blacklist setup code. Used to determine if the blacklist is working as intended during startup (since the blacklist runs before crash reporting is set up). This only occurs on Windows.

histogram.name: Blimp.Compositor.CommitSizeKb
histogram.summary: Records the size of the uncompressed commit messages received by Blimp compositor.

histogram.summary: Time spent initializing LocalWindowProxy during a page loading in main windows.

histogram.name: Blink.Binding.InitializeMainRemoteWindowProxy

histogram.name: Blink.Binding.InitializeMainWindowProxy
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2017. This metric was split into two metrics depending if it figures time for local window proxies or remote ones.

histogram.name: Blink.Binding.InitializeNonMainRemoteWindowProxy

histogram.summary: Time spent initializing WindowProxy during a page loading.

histogram.name: Blink.BudgetAPI.QueryBudget
histogram.summary: Whenever the Budget API framework receives a query for the current budget, this records the total budget available to the origin, which is an internal Chrome value for the amount of background processing an origin can do without visibly alerting the user. Scale for the budget is 0 to 100. Care should be taken when drawing conclusions from this metric, as budget is based on both engagement and usage, so could vary significantly based on user behaviour and origin.

histogram.name: Blink.BudgetAPI.Reserve
histogram.summary: Whenever the Budget API framework receives a request to reserve budget for a future background operation, this records whether the reserve request succeeded or not.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.DrawImage
histogram.summary: Time spent on 2D canvas drawImage API call.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.GetImageData
histogram.summary: Time spent on 2D canvas getImageData API call.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.OffscreenCommitTimer
histogram.summary: Wall clock durations of OffscreenCanvas.commit() calls.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.PutImageData
histogram.summary: Time spent on 2D canvas putImageData API call.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.IdleEncodeDuration
histogram.summary:
This metric measures the total time spent on encoding all the rows of an image (jpeg or png), as part of a canvas.toBlob API call. Encoding occurs during one or more idle periods on the main thread.
This metric is useful in helping us adjust the IdleTaskCompleteTimeoutDelay in canvas.toBlob. When the encoding idle task is delayed for longer than IdleTaskCompleteTimeoutDelay, the browser will switch to a non-idle task to force encoding to happen on the main thread.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.IdleTaskStatus
histogram.summary:
Records the status of the idle task when finishing a toBlob call.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.InitiateEncodingDelay
histogram.summary:
This metric measures the time spent from initiating image encoding (jpeg or png) on idle task to the actual execution time of initiation, as part of a canvas.toBlob API call.
This metric is useful in helping us adjust the IdleTaskStartTimeoutDelay in canvas.toBlob. When the initialization idle task is delayed for longer than IdleTaskStartTimeoutDelay, the browser will switch to a non-idle task to force initialization and encoding to occur on the main thread.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlobDuration
histogram.summary:
Time spent on 2D canvas toBlob API call.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToDataURL
histogram.summary: Time spent on 2D canvas toDataURL API call.

histogram.obsolete: Linear fit found to be always inaccurate on 2017-02-28.
histogram.summary: The L-infinity error (in 8-bit values) of the numerical approximation of table-based ICC profile transfer functions, when falling back to a linear approximation.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.Matrix
histogram.summary: Whether or not to-XYZD50 matrix was extracted from the output color space ICC profile.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.NonlinearFitConverged
histogram.summary: Whether or not the nonlinear least squares fit of the table-based ICC profile transfer function for a single channel converged.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.NonlinearFitError
histogram.summary: The L-infinity error (in 8-bit values) of the numerical approximation of table-based ICC profile transfer functions for a single channel, when the nonlinear approximation converged.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.NonlinearFitErrorCombined
histogram.summary: The L-infinity error (in 8-bit values) of the numerical approximation of table-based ICC profile transfer functions for all channels combined, when the nonlinear approximation converged.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.Numerical
histogram.summary: Whether or not the output color space ICC profile has a numerical transfer function.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.OneMinusTMax
histogram.obsolete: TMax found to almost always be 1 on 2017-02-28.
histogram.summary: One minus the maximum value of table-based ICC profile transfer functions as an 8-bit fixed-point value. This histogram is temporary, to see if we can bake in the assumption that it will almost always be 255.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.TMin
histogram.obsolete: TMin found to almost always be 0 on 2017-02-28.
histogram.summary: The minimum value of table-based ICC profile transfer functions as an 8-bit fixed-point value. This histogram is temporary, to see if we can bake in the assumption that it will almost always be 0.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Source
histogram.summary: Gamma properties of image color space.

histogram.name: Blink.Compositing.UpdateTime
histogram.summary: Time spent updating compositing in the Blink document lifecyce.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.CanvasExpanded
histogram.summary: The original canvas dimensions were sufficient to determine image size. This is logged once per image header decode, which happens typically twice per image on the page.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.EffectiveDimensionsLocation
histogram.summary: How many bytes of the file were read before an image width and height were determined. This is logged once per image header decode, which happens typically twice per image on the page.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.Orientation
histogram.summary: Image orientation inferred during decode.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.XCanvasExpansion
histogram.summary: How much the canvas width needed to be expanded as a result of the first frame's width and x-offset being larger than the initial canvas width. This is logged once per image header decode, which happens typically twice per image on the page.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.YCanvasExpansion
histogram.summary: How much the canvas height needed to be expanded as a result of the first frame's height and y-offset being larger than the initial canvas height. This is logged once per image header decode, which happens typically twice per image on the page.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImageType
histogram.summary: Image codec inferred during decode.

histogram.name: Blink.EventListenerDuration.Resize
histogram.summary: Time it takes to execute all the `resize` event listeners on a page when a resize event is fired. Tracked only for the main frame.

histogram.name: Blink.Fetch.RequestResourceTime
histogram.summary: The total microseconds spent in ResourceFetcher::requestResource.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.HarfBuzzFaceZeroCopyAccess
histogram.summary: Counts success or failure of attempting to access font tables using the zero copy instantiation method in the HarfBuzz integration layer. This value is only recorded on non-Mac platforms. Reported each time a HarfBuzz face object is created.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.ShapeCache
histogram.summary: Total number of entries in all Blink ShapeCache instances. The value is reported each time the FontCache::purge() method is called.

histogram.name: Blink.Gesture.Merged
histogram.summary: How many times two user gesture tokens were merged by UserGestureIndicator, and whether each token had an active gesture. One of the new token's gestures, if any, is moved to the old token.

histogram.summary: Records how the download button on the MediaDocument is used.

histogram.name: Blink.MediaElement.Autoplay
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2016 in Issue 666370 with the deprecation of Autoplay experiment.
histogram.summary: Records user observation and interaction with Media HTML elements that feature autoplay, either script-controlled or through the attribute.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy
histogram.summary: RevalidationPolicy used for non-preloading requests for each resource type. https://crbug.com/579496

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.Dead
histogram.summary: RevalidationPolicy used for requests that hit Resource only referenced from MemoryCache for each resource type. https://crbug.com/579496 Requests counted by this are also counted by Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy or Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.Preload.

histogram.name: Blink.MemoryCache.RevalidationPolicy.Preload
histogram.summary: RevalidationPolicy used for preloading requests for each resource type. https://crbug.com/579496

histogram.name: Blink.PaintInvalidation.UpdateTime
histogram.summary: Time spent updating paint invalidation in the Blink document lifecycle. Not available when SlimmingPaintInvalidation or SlimmingPaintV2 is enabled.

histogram.name: Blink.PrePaint.UpdateTime
histogram.summary: Time spent updating paint properties and paint invalidation in the Blink document lifecycle. Available when SlimmingPaintInvalidation or SlimmingPaintV2 is enabled.

histogram.name: Blink.RestoredCachedStyleSheet
histogram.summary: On each link stylesheet tag resolve, record whether a Blink MemoryCached StyleSheetContents was reused.

histogram.name: Blink.RestoredCachedStyleSheet2
histogram.summary: On each link stylesheet tag resolve, record which cache Blink hit.

histogram.name: Blink.ScanPendingActivityDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to scan pending activities of all V8 wrappers in a worker thread.

histogram.name: Blink.ScriptValueSerializer.DOMWrapperCount
histogram.obsolete: Used to justify distribution of serialized data in the wild, but unlikely to be useful to track long-term.
histogram.summary: Number of DOM wrappers serialized as part of an object passed to postMessage, IndexedDB, or another API that serializes script values.

histogram.name: Blink.ScriptValueSerializer.JSObjectCount
histogram.obsolete: Used to justify distribution of serialized data in the wild, but unlikely to be useful to track long-term.
histogram.summary: Number of JavaScript objects (other than DOM wrappers) serialized as part of an object passed to postMessage, IndexedDB, or another API that serializes script values.

histogram.name: Blink.ScriptValueSerializer.PrimitiveCount

histogram.name: Blink.SharedBuffer.FailedLock
histogram.summary: Number of failed SharedBuffer::lock() calls for each resource type. https://crbug.com/603791

histogram.name: Blink.SharedBuffer.SuccessfulLock
histogram.summary: Number of successful SharedBuffer::lock() calls for each resource type. https://crbug.com/603791

histogram.name: Blink.SharedBuffer.Unlock
histogram.summary: Number of SharedBuffer::unlock() calls for each resource type. https://crbug.com/603791

histogram.name: Blink.StyleAndLayout.UpdateTime
histogram.summary: Time spent updating style and layout in the Blink document lifecycle.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.AnimatedCSSProperties
histogram.summary: Records usage of animated CSS properties used on a page, either statically or dynamically, from the time the page is initialised to when it is closed or navigated away from. Each property is counted at most once per page per view.
histogram.details: This histogram counts CSS properties only when they are animated by a CSS Animation. Refer to Blink.UseCounter.CSSProperties for more details.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.CSSProperties
histogram.summary: Records usage of CSS properties used on a page, either statically or dynamically, from the time the page is initialised to when it is closed or navigated away from. Each property is counted at most once per page per view.
histogram.details:
The first time a CSS property is parsed on a page, the histogram is updated to increment the counter. Each histogram bucket corresponds to a CSS property (eg. width, border-radius). The exception is the 'Total pages measured' bucket - this counts the number of pages that CSS properties were counted on. When a page navigation occurs the page count bucket is incremented and tracking of the set of which properties have been seen is reset.
These numbers give the percentage of pages that use a CSS property. For example, if the 'border-radius' histogram bucket has a count of 250, and the page count bucket (i.e. bucket number 1) has a count of 1000 - this means that 1000 pages were recorded, and border-radius was used on 25% of those pages.
Note that CSS properties used inside of SVG images are tracked separately in the Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.CSSProperties histogram.
As of M57 this histogram supercedes WebCore.FeatureObserver.CSSProperties.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.Extensions.Features
histogram.summary: Count of how many page loads use various features for pages with a chrome-extension:// URL only. The PageVisits bucket is incremented for each page load, and the other buckets incremented at most once per PageVisit via the WebCore::UserCounter class.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.Features
histogram.summary: Count of how many page loads use various features. The PageVisits bucket is incremented for each page load, and the other buckets incremented at most once per PageVisit via the WebCore::UseCounter class.
histogram.details:
Note that features used inside of SVG images are tracked separately in the Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.Features histogram.
As of M57 this histograms supercedes WebCore.FeatureObserver.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.AnimatedCSSProperties
histogram.summary: Like Blink.UseCounter.AnimatedCSSProperties but specifically for the case of CSS properties used inside of an SVG image.
histogram.details: This histogram counts usage of animated CSS properties only. Refer to Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.CSSProperties for details.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.CSSProperties
histogram.summary: Like Blink.UseCounter.CSSProperties but specifically for the case of CSS properties used inside of an SVG image.
histogram.details: The 'Total pages measured' bucket is incremented each time a new SVG image is created. Note that the same SVG image can be used across multiple tabs in a single renderer but this counts as a single usage. See http://crbug.com/236262.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.Features
histogram.summary: Like Blink.UseCounter.Features except specifically for the case of SVG Images.
histogram.details: Count of how many SVG images use various features. The PageVisits bucket is incremented each time a new SVG image is created. Note that the same SVG image can be used across multiple tabs in a single renderer but this counts as a single usage. See http://crbug.com/236262.

histogram.name: Blink.XHR.setRequestHeader.HeaderValueCategoryInRFC7230
histogram.summary: The count of XMLHttpRequest.setRequestHeader() calls where header values are invalid/valid but affected by normalization/valid in RFC 7230. https://crbug.com/455099.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.CollectGarbage
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run Heap::collectGarbage().

histogram.name: BlinkGC.CollectionRate
histogram.summary: The percentage of objects that have been collected by a Blink GC. 0 is passed if there were no objects when a Blink GC started.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.CommittedSize
histogram.summary: The committed memory size in Blink GC. The value is reported when we see the highest memory usage we've ever seen in the renderer process.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.CompleteSweep
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run ThreadState::completeSweep().

histogram.name: BlinkGC.GCReason
histogram.summary: A type of Blink GC.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.ObjectSizeAfterGC
histogram.summary: The size of allocated objects just after Blink GC is triggered.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.ObjectSizeBeforeGC
histogram.summary: The size of allocated objects just before Blink GC is triggered.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.ObjectSizeFreedByHeapCompaction
histogram.summary: The total size of objects freed by BlinkGC's heap compaction. This is recorded once following each compaction.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.PerformPendingSweep
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run ThreadState::performPendingSweep().

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForGlobalWeakProcessing
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run global weak processing of Blink GC.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForHeapCompaction
histogram.summary: Duration of wall time taken to run BlinkGC's heap compaction.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForInvokingPreFinalizers
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run ThreadState::invokePreFinalizers().

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForStoppingThreads
histogram.obsolete: As of 02/2017, the code to stop Blink threads was removed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to stop all Blink threads before starting a GC.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForSweepingAllObjects
histogram.summary: Accumulated time taken to sweep all objects.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForThreadLocalWeakProcessing
histogram.obsolete: As of 02/2017, the code for thread-local weak processing was removed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run thread-local weak processing.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TotalAllocatedSpace
histogram.summary: The total size of allocated space in OS when a Blink GC is triggered.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TotalObjectSpace
histogram.summary: The total size of object space in all threads when a Blink GC is triggered.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Android.GATTConnection.Disconnected.Result
histogram.summary: Disconnected GATT connection status codes. Used to better understand errors seen in Android.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Android.GATTConnection.Failure.Result
histogram.summary: Failed GATT connection error codes. Used to better understand errors seen in Android.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Android.GATTConnection.Success.Result
histogram.summary: Successful GATT connection result codes. Used to better understand Android results.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ConnectedDeviceCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of simulataneously connected Bluetooth devices. Used to direct testing efforts, and by our UI team to determine appropriate UI sizes.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.DiscoverySession.Start.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of calls to BluetoothAdapter::StartDiscoverySession. Used to prioritize efforts to fix failures of this function.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.DiscoverySession.Stop.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of calls to BluetoothDiscoverySession::Stop. Used to prioritize efforts to fix failures of this function.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.GATTErrors
histogram.obsolete: As of 08/2015 this has been replaced by Bluetooth.Web.Characteristic.ReadValue and Bluetooth.Web.Characteristic.WriteValue.
histogram.summary: Records how many times each GATT Error has occured. The results will be used to determine how common this errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.PairingMethod
histogram.summary: Records the method used to pair each Bluetooth Device. Used to direct our testing efforts.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.PairingResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of pairing each Bluetooth Device. Used to understand whether we are having significant problems with Bluetooth pairing and seeing errors more commonly than we should.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.RequestDevice.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice() call. Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones. Multiple outcomes may result for a given RequestDevice, such as rescan multiple times and then select a device.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Android
histogram.summary: 'status' values returned by Android GATT event.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Blacklist.ParsedNonEmptyString
histogram.summary:
Records the result of BluetoothBlacklist::Add parsing a non-empty string. These strings will be updated dynamically by a server, and this histogram provides feedback that parsing is functioning correctly on clients.
False values are BAD, a blacklist is failing to be applied correctly.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Blocklist.ParsedNonEmptyString
histogram.summary:
Records the result of BluetoothBlocklist::Add parsing a non-empty string. These strings will be updated dynamically by a server, and this histogram provides feedback that parsing is functioning correctly on clients.
False values are BAD, a blocklist is failing to be applied correctly.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Characteristic.ReadValue.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to characteristic.readValue(). Used to know what types of errors users are seeing. The results will be used to determine how common these errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Characteristic.StartNotifications.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to characteristic.startNofications(). Used to know what types of errors users are seeing. The results will be used to determine how common these errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Characteristic.WriteValue.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to characteristic.writeValue(). Used to know what types of errors users are seeing. The results will be used to determine how common these errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.ChooserInteraction
histogram.summary: Counts how many times users interact with a regular chooser vs. an invalid chooser. (A chooser is invalid when it's event handler becomes null.)

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.ConnectGATT.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a device.gatt.connect() call. Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.ConnectGATT.TimeFailed
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for a connection attempt to fail. Use to let developers know how to better wait for and handle connection errors.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.ConnectGATT.TimeSuccess
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes for a device to successfully connect. Use to let developers know how long it should take to connect to a BLE device.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Descriptor.ReadValue.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to descriptor.readValue(). Used to know what types of errors users are seeing. The results will be used to determine how common these errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Descriptor.WriteValue.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to descriptor.writeValue(). Used to know what types of errors users are seeing. The results will be used to determine how common these errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.FunctionCall.Count
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2017. Replaced by using blink IDL annotation MeasureAs which appear in Blink.UseCounter.Features.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each call to a WebBluetooth function is done.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetCharacteristic.Characteristic
histogram.summary: Records the UUIDs used when getting a characteristic. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. Used to know what types of characteristics to target when building libraries that use the Web Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetCharacteristic.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to getCharacteristic(). Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetCharacteristics.Characteristic
histogram.summary: Records the UUIDs used when getting characteristics. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. Used to know what types of characteristics to target when building libraries that use the Web Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetCharacteristics.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to getCharacteristics(). Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetDescriptor.Descriptor
histogram.summary: Records the UUIDs used when getting a descriptor. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. Used to know what types of descriptors to target when building libraries that use the Web Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetDescriptor.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to getDescriptor(). Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetDescriptors.Descriptor
histogram.summary: Records the UUIDs used when getting descriptors. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. Used to know what types of descriptors to target when building libraries that use the Web Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetDescriptors.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a call to getDescriptors(). Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetPrimaryService.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a GATTServer.getPrimaryService() call. Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetPrimaryService.Services
histogram.summary: Records what GATT Services are used when connected. The record value is a 31-bit hash of the Service UUID. This will help us know if we should build an API for specific services rather than a general Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetPrimaryServices.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a GATTServer.getPrimaryServices() call. Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.GetPrimaryServices.Services
histogram.summary: Records what GATT Services are used when connected. The record value is a 31-bit hash of the Service UUID. This will help us know if we should build an API for specific services rather than a general Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.Filters.Count
histogram.summary: Records how many filters are used when scanning. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.Filters.Services
histogram.summary: Records a 31-bit hash of the GATT Service UUIDs used when scanning. This will help us know if we should build an API for specific services rather than a general Bluetooth API.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.FilterSize
histogram.summary: Records how many services are used in a filter. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.NumOfDevicesInChooserWhenNotAcceptingAllDevices
histogram.summary: In the case of not accepting all devices, records the number of devices that are in the chooser when a device is paired.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.OptionalServices.Count
histogram.summary: Records how many optional services are used when scanning. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.OptionalServices.Services
histogram.summary: Records what optional services are used. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the Service UUID. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.Options.AcceptAllDevices
histogram.summary: Records the value of 'acceptAllDevices' in RequestDeviceOptions. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice() call. Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.RSSISignalStrength
histogram.summary: Raw RSSI values provided to chooser, before processing them for display in the Web Bluetooth chooser.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.RSSISignalStrengthLevel
histogram.summary: Displayed RSSI levels, after processing and as displayed to users in the Web Bluetooth chooser.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.ScanningDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration scanning for devices is run, terminated by events such as the chooser being closed with a selected device, cancelled, or the scan duration timing out.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.UnionOfServices.Count
histogram.summary: Records how many services are used when scanning. This results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.RequestDevice.UnionOfServices.Services
histogram.summary: Records what services are used from either required or optional sets. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the Service UUID. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: BookmarkManager.NumDragged
histogram.summary: Logs the number of bookmarks that were dragged simultaneously by a user.

histogram.name: BookmarkManager.ResultsRenderedTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to load the bookmarks Web UI and render. This is roughly equivalent to 'time to first meaningful paint' for the bookmark manager.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.BookmarksInFolder
histogram.summary: Logs the number of bookmark items inside a folder every time a folder is opened inside the bookmark manager.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.EntryPoint
histogram.summary: How users add a new bookmark.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.LaunchDepth
histogram.summary: Logs the depth of the bookmark in the bookmark tree hierarchy every time a bookmark is launched. Depth indicates how many levels below a permanent bookmark folder the bookmark was found in (e.g. a bookmark immediately in the bookmark bar has depth 1).

histogram.name: Bookmarks.LaunchLocation
histogram.summary: Logs a UI location from which a bookmark is launched.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.OnFaviconsChangedIconURL
histogram.summary: Logs how frequently BookmarkModel::OnFaviconsChanged() is called with a non-empty |icon_url| to determine whether BookmarkNodes should be cached based on their favicon URLs (e.g. http://www.google.com/favicon.ico) in addition to their page URLs (e.g. http://www.google.com). OnFaviconChanged() is expected to be called less than 10 times per user per day with a non-empty |icon_url|.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.OpenAction
histogram.summary: Logs how user is opening a bookmark on Android. For example, user can long press and select "Open in a new tab" or "Open in incognito tab".

histogram.name: BrotliFilter.CompressionPercent
histogram.summary: Compressed/Decompressed size ratio.

histogram.name: BrotliFilter.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: More detailed failure reason.

histogram.name: BrotliFilter.GzipHeaderDetected
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the gzip-like header was detected.

histogram.name: BrotliFilter.Status
histogram.summary: The final state of BrotliFilter.

histogram.name: BrotliFilter.UsedMemoryKB
histogram.summary: Maximal amount of memory allocated by decoder.

histogram.name: BrowserDialogs.ExternalProtocol.HandleState
histogram.summary: Whether or not the user checked the option in the external protocol dialog to remember their choice of opening or not opening the specified app. Recorded each time the user interacts with the External Protocol Dialog, when making a decision.

histogram.name: BrowserDialogs.ExternalProtocol.RememberCheckbox
histogram.summary: Whether or not the user checked the option in the external protocol dialog to remember their choice of opening or not opening the specified app. Recorded each time the user interacts with the External Protocol Dialog (either accepting or cancelling/dismissing).

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.ChildCrashes
histogram.summary: Count of renderer process crashes grouped by type.

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.ChildKills
histogram.summary: Count of renderer process kills grouped by type.

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.ChildKills.OOM
histogram.summary: Out of BrowserRenderProcessHost.ChildKills, numer of kills due to SIGKILL, which is a strong signal of out of memory on ChromeOS, grouped by renderer type.

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.ChildLaunchFailureCodes
histogram.summary: The launch error codes for failed renderer process launches.

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.ChildLaunchFailures
histogram.summary: Count of renderer process launch failures grouped by type.

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.DisconnectedAlive
histogram.summary: Count of renderer process crashes that we miscounted because we took the exit code too early. Grouped by type.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.Accepted
histogram.summary: An open bubble was closed because the user accepted it.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.Canceled
histogram.summary: An open bubble was closed because the user didn't accept it.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.FocusLost
histogram.summary: An open bubble was closed because of a focus change.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.Forced
histogram.summary: An open bubble was forced to close.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.FrameDestroyed
histogram.summary: An open bubble was dismissed because a frame was destroyed.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.FullscreenToggled
histogram.summary: An open bubble was dismissed because fullscreen was toggled.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.Navigated
histogram.summary: An open bubble was dismissed because the page was navigated.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.TabDetached
histogram.summary: An open bubble was closed because a tab was detached.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.TabSwitched
histogram.summary: An open bubble was closed because a tab was switched.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.UserDismissed
histogram.summary: An open bubble was dismissed by the user without making a decission.

histogram.name: Bubbles.DisplayTime.All
histogram.summary: Log the amount of time any bubble was visible. Only bubbles that are shown will have a visible time.

histogram.name: Bubbles.NeverShown
histogram.summary: A bubble was given to the bubble manager but not shown.

histogram.name: Canvas.ContextType
histogram.summary: Records the context type names used to create canvas rendering contexts.

histogram.name: Canvas.DisplayListFallbackReason
histogram.summary: The reasons why a canvas initially set to display list mode had to fall back to direct rasterization mode.

histogram.name: Canvas.GPUAccelerated2DCanvasDisableDeferralReason
histogram.summary: The reasons why a GPU accelerated canvas stopped deferring its rendering operations.

histogram.name: Canvas.HibernationEvents
histogram.summary: Records the occurrence of events related to 2D canvas GPU resource hibernation.

histogram.name: Canvas.Offscreen.CommitType
histogram.summary: The type of code path that OffscreenCanvas's commit API goes through.

histogram.name: Canvas.RequestedImageMimeTypes
histogram.summary: Records the occurence of image file formats passed into toDataURL and toBlob functions in canvas.

histogram.name: CAPSUpdater.Step
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2016 with removal of Chrome Crash Service component.
histogram.summary: Tracks the component updater steps for the Chrome Crash Service.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.DetectResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of a captive portal probe.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Notification.Status
histogram.summary: Count of displayed and not displayed due to errors notifications about captive portal.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Notification.UserAction
histogram.summary: Count of clicked, closed and ignored captive portal notifications.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.DetectionDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of the captive portal detection process for a particular network at OOBE. Detection duration is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.DetectionResult
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts performed at OOBE. Detection result is recorded when portal detection is completed for an active network and when it differs from the previous result for the same network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.DiscrepancyWithShill
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts at OOBE if it diverges from network manager results. Detection result is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.PortalToOnlineTransition
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between consecutive reports for the same network about portal and online states.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.RedirectTime
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds between start of request to gstatic.com/generate_204 and receipt of response with redirect to captive portal login page.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.DetectionDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of the captive portal detection process for a particular network in user session. Detection duration is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.DetectionResult
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts performed in user session. Detection result is recorded when portal detection is completed for an active network and when it differs from the previous result for the same network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.DiscrepancyWithShill
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts in session if it diverges from network manager results. Detection result is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.PortalToOnlineTransition
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between consecutive reports for the same network about portal and online states.

histogram.name: Cast.Channel.Certificate
histogram.summary: Records the result of the Cast certificate verification on the Cast sender.

histogram.name: Cast.Channel.Nonce
histogram.summary: Records whether the correct nonce challenge was in the Cast receiver's response.

histogram.name: Cast.Network.Down.Duration.In.Seconds
histogram.summary: Records the time the network has been down on a Cast device. Recorded when network goes up.

histogram.name: Cast.Network.Up.Duration.In.Minutes
histogram.summary: Records the time the network has been up on a Cast device. Recorded when network goes down.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastButtonShown
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the cast button was shown to the user. The value will be true if the button is enabled, and false if the button is disabled. Note that depending on the current UX, it's possible that we hide the button entirely if it's disabled, so it's possible for the false values to be 0.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastButtonShownInitialFullscreen
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the cast button was shown to the user when the video is fullscreened. The value will only be recorded on entering fullscreen. The value will be true if the button is enabled, and false if the button is disabled. Note that depending on the current UX,it's possible that we hide the button entirely if it's disabled, so it's possible for the false values to be 0.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastMediaType
histogram.summary: Records the media type of every video being cast.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastPlayerResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of a request to play remotely on a per player app basis within Chrome for Android.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastPlaySuccess
histogram.summary: Records the result of a request to play remotely. The value will be true if the playback succeeded, and false if there was an error.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastTimeRemainingPercentage
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of the video left at the time the remote playback is stopped. This will be recorded when the playback is stopped by the user, or when it's stopped by the cast device.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.DeviceType
histogram.summary: Records the type of the remote playback device selected by the user. This will be recorded when the user has chosen the device from the media route chooser dialog.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.FullscreenControlsActionWithMediaElement
histogram.summary: Record each interaction with the fullscreen remote playback controls in cases when the corresponding media element on the page was present.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.FullscreenControlsActionWithoutMediaElement
histogram.summary: Record each interaction with the fullscreen remote playback controls in cases when the corresponding media element on the page was not present.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.MediaElementPresentWhenShowFullscreenControls
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the corresponding media element on the page was present when the fullscreen remote playback controls were shown.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.Overlay
histogram.summary: Records events and user interactions related to the Cast overlay shown on video elements.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.SessionTimeWithoutMediaElementPercentage
histogram.summary: Records the ratio of the time the media element was detached from the remote playback session to the total duration of the session (as from when the element has been attached till when the session stopped or disconnected), in percents.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.UrlResolveResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of resolving the video URL for cast, including checking its CORS header.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.VideoEncodeAcceleratorInitializeSuccess
histogram.summary: Indicates whether initialization of a video encode accelerator for Cast sender was successful.

histogram.name: CastV2.Transport.Connect.Latency.Unknown
histogram.summary: The latency between when a Cast V2 connection is established and the first message is received on that connection. "Unknown" is the peer type, which is not known at this point in the CastV2 connection establishment. Naming conforms to the CastV2 sender-side histogram naming convention "CastV2.[action].[name].[peer_type]".

histogram.name: CastV2.Transport.SslHandshake.Error.Unknown
histogram.summary: On accepting a Cast V2 transport socket connection, if an error is encountered, the error code is logged here. "Unknown" is the peer type, which is not known at this point in the CastV2 connection establishment. "SslHandshake.Error" is the name of the action. Naming conforms to the CastV2 sender-side histogram naming convention "CastV2.[action].[name].[peer_type]".

histogram.name: CastV2.Transport.SslHandshake.Unknown
histogram.summary: The time taken to do the handshake during Cast V2 transport socket creation. "Unknown" is the peer type, which is not known at this point in the CastV2 connection establishment. Naming conforms to the CastV2 sender-side histogram naming convention "CastV2.[action].[name].[peer_type]".

histogram.name: Cellular.ActivationFailure
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of cellular device activation failures (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.ActivationTry
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of cellular device activation tries (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.ConnectionFailed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of cellular reconnect failures during activation (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.ConnectionRetry
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of cellular device reconnect tries during activation (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.MobileSetupFailed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of successful cellular plan established (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.MobileSetupStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of initiated cellular device setup starts (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.MobileSetupSucceeded
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.

histogram.name: Cellular.PaymentFailed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Cellular.PaymentReceived

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of successfully completed cellular plan purchases (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: CertificateType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013. This histogram only considered the leaf certificate expiry date as a proxy for whether a certificate was in-scope for the BRs, but did not consider the issuance date. As some CAs have issued long-lived certs prior to the BRs, this disproportionately reported those certs as being subject to the BRs, but non-compliant, when in reality they're not subject.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Information about the certificate algorithms and sizes in use on the web, to examine compliance with the CA/Browser Forum requirements and security best practice.

histogram.name: CertificateType2
histogram.summary: Information about the certificate algorithms and sizes in use on the web, to examine compliance with the CA/Browser Forum requirements and security best practice. This histogram considers the notBefore as the issuance date, for purposes of what requirements apply.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.BadMessgeTerminated
histogram.summary: Count of child processes killed because they sent an IPC that couldn't be deserialized.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Crashed
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of child process crashes grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Crashed2
histogram.summary: Count of child process crashes grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.CrashedWasAlive
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of child process crashes that we miscounted because we took the exit code too early. Grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Crashes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of child process crashes grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.CrashesWasAlive
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of child process crashes that we miscounted because we took the exit code too early. Grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.DefaultCase
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of child process crashes for which we were not able to understand the exit code, grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Disconnected
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of child process abnormal channel disconnects grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Disconnected2
histogram.summary: Count of child process abnormal channel disconnects grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.DisconnectedAlive
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of child process abnormal channel disconnects that are not classified and reported because we took the exit code too early. Grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.DisconnectedAlive2
histogram.summary: Count of child process abnormal channel disconnects that are not classified and reported because we took the exit code too early. Grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.HangRendererType
histogram.summary: What the browser was waiting for from the renderer when it was reported as hung.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.InvalidSandboxStateCrash.NoStartupWindow
histogram.summary: Whether the browser command line had the switch --no-startup-window when a child process crashed due to invalid sandbox state. Recorded when a child process crashes if the exit code from the child process is RESULT_CODE_INVALID_SANDBOX_STATE.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Killed
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of child process kills grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Killed2
histogram.summary: Count of child process kills grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Killed2.OOM
histogram.summary: Out of ChildProcess.Killled, number of kills due to SIGKILL, which is a strong signal of out of memory on ChromeOS, grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.KilledByExtensionAPI
histogram.summary: Count of child processes killed by the extension API (processes.terminate).

histogram.name: ChildProcess.KilledWasAlive
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
