histogram.summary: Count of child process kills that we miscounted because we took the exit code too early. Grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Kills
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of child process kills grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.KillsWasAlive
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of child process kills that we miscounted because we took the exit code too early. Grouped by process type.

histogram.name: Chrome.Android.Activity.CrashCounts
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates how many times each particular type of Activity was in the foreground when a UMA session was terminated abnormally. UMA sessions last as long as Chrome remains in the foreground.

histogram.name: Chrome.Android.Activity.LaunchCounts
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates how many times each particular type of Activity was brought to the foreground when a UMA session was active (i.e. launched at some point). UMA sessions last as long as Chrome remains in the foreground.

histogram.name: Chrome.Browser.CrashedExecutionPhase
histogram.summary: Indicates the execution phase the browser was in when the browser crashed.

histogram.name: Chrome.Browser.ExecutionPhase
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates the execution phase the browser was in when browser didn't exit cleanly.

histogram.name: Chrome.BrowserCrashDumpAttempts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total number of times the browser process has attempted to generate a crash dump. This should be the sum of Chrome.BrowserDumpsWithCrash and Chrome.BrowserDumpsWithNoCrash.

histogram.name: Chrome.BrowserDumpsWithCrash
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the browser process has attempted to generate a crash dump because of an actual browser crash.

histogram.name: Chrome.BrowserDumpsWithNoCrash
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the browser process has attempted to generate a crash dump in a non-crashing (i.e., reporting only) context.

histogram.name: Chrome.MessageLoopProblem
histogram.summary: Track set of Windows errors inside the meessage loop/pump system, where system calls fail, and we try to gracefully recover. These errors should really never happen, so we should be sure to look closer if they do.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.NotifyResult
histogram.summary: The result of every rendez-vous reported once per browser process launch.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.RemoteHungProcessTerminateReason
histogram.summary: The reason of remote hang processes termination.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.RemoteProcessInteractionResult
histogram.summary: Used to send the result of interaction with remote process as histograms in case when remote process influences on start.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TerminateProcessErrorCode.Posix
histogram.summary: The error code of remote process termination on Posix in case when remote process hung.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TerminateProcessErrorCode.Windows
histogram.summary: The error code of remote process termination on Windows in case when remote process hung.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TerminateProcessTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes from TerminateProcess call to the moment when we stop waiting for remote process switches to signal state.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TerminationWaitErrorCode.Windows
histogram.summary: The error code of wating for remote process termination on Windows.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TimeToCreate
histogram.summary: Time it takes to grab the process singleton. Reported once per successful attempt at obtaining the singleton.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TimeToFailure
histogram.summary: Time it takes to return an error from the process singleton algorithm (nor succeeding in obtaining it, nor in generating a rendez-vous). This does not include time spent in the fast notification path (chrome_exe_main_win.cc).

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TimeToNotify
histogram.summary: Time it takes to find the process singleton owner and notify it. Reported once per successful rendez-vous. This does not include time spent in the fast notification path (chrome_exe_main_win.cc).

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExempt
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user not in the search engine dialog experiment.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExperiment
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user in the search engine dialog experiment.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExperimentSlot1
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user in slot 1 of a randomized search engine dialog.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExperimentSlot2
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user in slot 2 of a randomized search engine dialog.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExperimentSlot3
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user in slot 3 of a randomized search engine dialog.

histogram.name: Chrome.SearchSelectExperimentSlot4
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default search engine selected by a user in slot 4 of a randomized search engine dialog.

histogram.name: ChromeGeneratedCustomTab.IntentToFirstCommitNavigationTime
histogram.summary: Time between the intent arrival in a Chrome generated CCT and the first navigation commit, if the navigation is successful. Similar in principle to Startup.FirstCommitNavigationTime.

histogram.name: ChromeGeneratedCustomTab.IntentToFirstCommitNavigationTime2
histogram.summary: In "Herb" mode shows the time between the intent arrival in a Chrome generated CCT and the first navigation commit, if the navigation is successful. Similar in principle to Startup.FirstCommitNavigationTime.

histogram.name: ChromeGeneratedCustomTab.IntentToPageLoadedTime
histogram.summary: In "Herb" mode shows time between the intent arrival in a Chrome generated CCT and the first "page loaded" event, if the navigation is successful.

histogram.name: ChromeNotifierService.Actions
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The actions to enable or disable services sending synced notifications. Synced Notification Sending services can be individually disabled by the user in the Chrome Notification center settings dialog.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Display.ColorProfile
histogram.summary: The name of the current color calibration of the display on ChromeOS. This value is sent when the color calibration is changed by the user.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.GAIA.WebViewFlow
histogram.summary: Whether a user signed in using the new WebView-based GAIA flow. This value is sent after the GAIA screen has completed user authentication.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MachineIdRegen.AgeSeconds
histogram.summary: The number of seconds of uptime since the last time the ChromeOS machine-id was regenerated. This is reported every time the machine-id is regenerated except for the first time since reboot.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MachineIdRegen.Reason
histogram.summary: The reason why the ChromeOS machine-id was regenerated. This is reported when the machine-id is re-generated.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MemoryPressureLevel
histogram.summary: The memory pressure level in ChromeOS, which is recorded periodically (once per second). This is used to show the relative frequency of the system being in a critical vs relaxed memory pressure state.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.Available
histogram.summary: Whether platform verification subsystem features are available at the time a platform verification request is made for content protection on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.ExpiryStatus
histogram.summary: The result of a certificate expiry check during a platform verification attempt for content protection on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.Result
histogram.summary: The result of a platform verification attempt for content protection on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.APIUsed
histogram.summary: Whether a Chrome OS login via SAML used the principals API. This is recorded during login on Chrome OS if SAML is being used for authentication.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.Scraping.PasswordCount
histogram.summary: The number of passwords that were scraped during a Chrome OS login via SAML. This is set only when the principals API is not used.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.Scraping.VerificationResult
histogram.summary: Whether one of the scraped passwords was successfully verified as the user's password. This is set only when the principals API is not used.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.BrowserLoadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to load the native libraries in the browser process.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.BrowserStates
histogram.summary: Whether relro sharing was attempted for the browser process, and if attempted, whether it succeeded.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.IsLowMemoryDevice
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2014 in Issue 419010, and replaced by ChromiumAndroidLinker.BrowserStates.
histogram.summary: Is low memory device.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.LibraryLoadFromApkStatus
histogram.summary: Whether the device supports loading a library directly from the APK file. The functionality is checked and reported during every Chromium browser process start up.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.LoadedAtFixedAddressFailed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2014 in Issue 419010, and replaced by ChromiumAndroidLinker.RendererStates.
histogram.summary: Load at fixed address failed.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RendererLoadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to load the native libraries in the renderer process.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RendererStates
histogram.summary: Whether relro sharing was attempted for a renderer process, and if attempted, whether it succeeded.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Connections
histogram.summary: Recorded every time a Chromoting connection enters a new state.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Connections.Durations.Closed
histogram.summary: The duration of sessions that were closed, normally by a user-initiated action.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Connections.Durations.Failed
histogram.summary: The duration of sessions that failed to connect.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Connections.Times.ToAuthenticate
histogram.summary: The time taken to authenticate as part of a Chromoting connection request.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Connections.Times.ToConnect
histogram.summary: The time taken to connect to a remote-host, after a request has been authenticated.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Input.EventLatency
histogram.summary: Input event delivery latency from the browser to the plugin.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.Bandwidth
histogram.summary: The bandwidth of non-empty packets in Chromoting remote sessions, updated every time a video packet is processed and logged every 1s.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.CaptureLatency
histogram.summary: The time to capture a video frame on the host, returned as part of a video packet.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.CaptureOverhead
histogram.summary: Amount of time wasted on IPC and threading overhead when capturing a video frame.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.CapturePendingLatency
histogram.summary: The time from when an input event is received to when the next frame is captured.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.DecodeLatency
histogram.summary: The time to decode a video packet on the client.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.EncodeLatency
histogram.summary: The time to encode a video packet on the host, returned as part of a video packet.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.EncodePendingLatency
histogram.summary: Delay before a newly captured frame is passed to the encoder.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.FrameRate
histogram.summary: The frame-rate of non-empty packets in Chromoting remote sessions, updated every time a video packet is processed and logged every 1s.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.NetworkLatency
histogram.summary: Estimated network roundtrip latency calculated by subtracting total processing time on host and client from the total roundtrip time.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.PacketRate
histogram.summary: The packets/sec, including empty packets, in Chromoting remote sessions, updated every time a video packet is processed and logged every 1s.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.PaintLatency
histogram.summary: The time to paint a decoded video packet on the client.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.RoundTripLatency
histogram.summary: The time from an input being sent from the client to a response being received by the client after it is processed by the host.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.SendPendingLatency
histogram.summary: Delay before an encoded video packet is written to the send buffer.

histogram.name: clickjacking.discard_download
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The length of time between a dangerous download appearing on the downloads shelf, and the "Discard" button being clicked.

histogram.name: clickjacking.dismiss_download
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The length of time between a dangerous download appearing on the downloads shelf, and the "Dismiss" button being clicked. Deprecated since M54.

histogram.name: clickjacking.launch_url
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The length of time between the external protocol dialog being shown and the "Launch Application" button being clicked.

histogram.name: clickjacking.open_download
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The length of time between a download appearing on the download shelf, and the user opening it by clicking the item or pressing return.

histogram.name: clickjacking.report_and_discard_download
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time between "Report and Discard" button being shown and it being clicked.

histogram.name: clickjacking.save_download
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The length of time between a dangerous download appearing on the download shelf, and the "Keep" button being clicked.

histogram.name: Clipboard.ConstructedHasher
histogram.obsolete: Launched briefly in M-59 dev, then refactoring made obsolete.
histogram.summary: Whether Android's Clipboard.java successfully constructed a hasher to hash clipboard entries. Recorded on construction of the class, which happens only on startup.

histogram.name: Clipboard.IncognitoUseCase
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 4/2013, experiment confirmed correctness of our patch.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts how often the user writes or reads from the clipboard and whether the write was from an incognito window or not.

histogram.name: Clipboard.X11StoreCopyPasteDuration
histogram.summary: The length of time that it takes to transfer ownership of Chrome's CLIPBOARD selection to the clipboard manager when Chrome exits.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.AuthEvent
histogram.summary: Event counts in CloudPrintAuth.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.AvailablePrinters
histogram.summary: The number of printers availible for registration.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.AvailablePrintersList
histogram.summary: The number of printers availible for registration in Windows Service.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.CapsUpdateInterval
histogram.summary: The amount of time between capabilities updates.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.JobHandlerEvent
histogram.summary: Event counts in PrinterJobHandler.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.JobsDonePerInterval
histogram.summary: The number of jobs successfully completed per hour.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.JobsStartedPerInterval
histogram.summary: The number of jobs started per hour.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.JobStatus
histogram.summary: Then number of job completion statuses.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.NativeJobStatus
histogram.summary: Event counts in PrintSystem.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.PrepareTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time needed to prepare job for spooling.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.PrinterBlacklistSize
histogram.summary: The number of printers user has blacklisted.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.PrinterWhitelistSize
histogram.summary: The number of printers user has whitelisted.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.PrintingTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time needed to finish print job.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceEvents
histogram.summary: Event counts in ServiceProcessControl.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceProcessSocketLength
histogram.summary: Temporarily histogram with size of IPC sockets in default location.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilityCapsFailTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time used to fail to collect printer capabilities.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilityCapsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time used to collect printer capabilities.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilityDisconnectTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time the utility process runs before disconnect.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilityMetafileFailTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time used to fail to generate metafile.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilityMetafileTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time used to generate metafile.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilityProcessHostEvent
histogram.summary: Event counts in ServiceUtilityProcessHost.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilitySemanticCapsFailTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time used to fail to collect printer capabilities.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilitySemanticCapsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time used to collect printer capabilities.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.SpoolingTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time needed to spool print job.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.UnregisterPrinters
histogram.summary: The number of printers to unregister.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.UrlFetcherDownloadSize
histogram.summary: The amount of data downloaded on cloud print request.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.UrlFetcherRequestTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time needed for cloud print request.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.UrlFetcherRequestType
histogram.summary: Request counts to cloud print service.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.UrlFetcherRetries
histogram.summary: The number of retries used to complete cloud print request.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.UrlFetcherUploadSize
histogram.summary: The amount of data uploaded with cloud print request.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.XmppPingTry
histogram.summary: Number of tries before successful ping. 99 means giving up.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.XmppTimeout
histogram.summary: Xmpp timeout option value provided by server.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.Calls
histogram.summary: The number of times the component updater called UpdateClient::Install or UpdateClient::Update. These correspond to the number of manual component update checks performed as a result of a user action, and the number of automated component update checks.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.UpdateCompleteResult
histogram.summary: The result of an install or an update check.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.UpdateCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Time to complete an Install or an Update component update call.

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2016. See Blink.Paint.UpdateTime as a related alternate metric.
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when display list recording source is updated (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateUs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2016. See Blink.Paint.UpdateTime as a related alternate metric.
histogram.summary: Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a display list, in microseconds. Recorded when display list is updated (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.LayersUpdateTime
histogram.summary: Time spent updating layers, in microseconds. Recorded when layers are updated (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.LayerTreeImpl.CalculateDrawPropertiesUs
histogram.summary: Time spent updating layer draw properties, in microseconds. Recorded when a LayerTreeImpl's draw properties are updated (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.NumActiveLayers
histogram.summary: The number of layers in the active tree for each compositor frame. This is logged once per frame, before the frame is drawn (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.NumRenderSurfaces
histogram.summary: The number of render surfaces in the render surface layer list. Recorded each time the render surface layer list is constructed (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.PictureMemoryUsageKb
histogram.summary: Total estimated memory used by SkPictures in the layer tree, in kilobytes. Recorded once per frame, before the frame is drawn (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.PicturePile.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.PicturePile.UpdateUs
histogram.summary: Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a picture pile, in microseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.RasterTask.RasterPixelsPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2016. Increased the max tracking range to accomendate GPU raster, and will require new baskets.
histogram.summary: Rasterized area, in pixels, divided by rasterization time, in milliseconds, of a compositor rasterization task. Recorded after the task finishes (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.RasterTask.RasterPixelsPerMs2
histogram.summary: Rasterized area, in pixels, divided by rasterization time, in milliseconds, of a compositor rasterization task. Recorded after the task finishes (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.RasterTask.RasterUs
histogram.summary: Time spent completing a compositor rasterization task, in microseconds. Recorded after the task finishes (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumMissingTilesNoImageContent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016. We'd learned as much as we could from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of missing tiles that had some image content in the browser process.

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumMissingTilesSomeImageContent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016. We'd learned as much as we could from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of missing tiles that did not have any image content in the browser process.

histogram.name: Compositing.CopyFromSurfaceTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The turn around time taken for the async readback of pixels is measured here.

histogram.name: Compositing.CopyFromSurfaceTimeSynchronous
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time taken for the sync readback of pixels is measured here.

histogram.name: Compositing.DirectRenderer.GL.DrawFrameUs
histogram.summary: Time spent drawing of composited layers by GLRenderer, in microseconds. This is logged once per frame, when a frame should be drawn.

histogram.name: Compositing.DirectRenderer.Software.DrawFrameUs
histogram.summary: Time spent drawing of composited layers by SoftwareRenderer, in microseconds. This is logged once per frame, when a frame should be drawn.

histogram.name: Compositing.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when display list recording source is updated.

histogram.name: Compositing.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateUs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a display list, in microseconds. Recorded when display list is updated.

histogram.name: Compositing.LayerTreeImpl.FindClosestMatchingLayerUs
histogram.summary: Time spent finding the closest matching layer to a given point, in microseconds. Recorded each time we do hit testing on LayerTreeImpl.

histogram.name: Compositing.NumActiveLayers
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: The number of layers in the active tree for each compositor frame. This is logged once per frame, before the frame is drawn.

histogram.name: Compositing.PictureMemoryUsageKb
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Total estimated memory used by SkPictures in the layer tree, in kilobytes. Recorded once per frame, before the frame is drawn.

histogram.name: Compositing.PicturePile.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated.

histogram.name: Compositing.PicturePile.UpdateUs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a picture pile, in microseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated.

histogram.name: Compositing.RasterTask.RasterPixelsPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Rasterized area, in pixels, divided by rasterization time, in milliseconds, of a compositor rasterization task. Recorded after the task finishes.

histogram.name: Compositing.RasterTask.RasterUs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Time spent completing a compositor rasterization task, in microseconds. Recorded after the task finishes.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.CALayerResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of attempting to replace all renderer tiles with CALayers. Either success, or the first reason why a DrawQuad couldn't be replaced by a CALayer.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2016. See Blink.Paint.UpdateTime as a related alternate metric.
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when display list recording source is updated (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateUs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2016. See Blink.Paint.UpdateTime as a related alternate metric.
histogram.summary: Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a display list, in microseconds. Recorded when display list is updated (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.LayersUpdateTime
histogram.summary: Time spent updating layers, in microseconds. Recorded when layers are updated (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.LayerTreeImpl.CalculateDrawPropertiesUs
histogram.summary: Time spent updating layer draw properties, in microseconds. Recorded when a LayerTreeImpl's draw properties are updated (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.NumActiveLayers
histogram.summary: The number of layers in the active tree for each compositor frame. This is logged once per frame, before the frame is drawn (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.NumRenderSurfaces
histogram.summary: The number of render surfaces in the render surface layer list. Recorded each time the render surface layer list is constructed (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.PictureMemoryUsageKb
histogram.summary: Total estimated memory used by SkPictures in the layer tree, in kilobytes. Recorded once per frame, before the frame is drawn (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.PicturePile.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.PicturePile.UpdateUs
histogram.summary: Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a picture pile, in microseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.RasterTask.RasterPixelsPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2016. Increased the max tracking range to accomendate GPU raster, and will require new baskets.
histogram.summary: Rasterized area, in pixels, divided by rasterization time, in milliseconds, of a compositor rasterization task. Recorded after the task finishes (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.RasterTask.RasterPixelsPerMs2
histogram.summary: Rasterized area, in pixels, divided by rasterization time, in milliseconds, of a compositor rasterization task. Recorded after the task finishes (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.RasterTask.RasterUs
histogram.summary: Time spent completing a compositor rasterization task, in microseconds. Recorded after the task finishes (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumMissingTilesNoImageContent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016. We'd learned as much as we could from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of missing tiles that had some image content in the renderer process.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumMissingTilesSomeImageContent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016. We'd learned as much as we could from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of missing tiles that did not have any image content in the renderer process.

histogram.name: Compositing.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.CheckerboardedNeedRasterContentArea
histogram.summary: Checkerboarded area, in number of pixels, that has recording but does not have time to finish rastering yet. A sample is recorded everytime a frame is drawn while a scroll is in progress. Tracking bug 535732.

histogram.name: Compositing.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.CheckerboardedNoRecordingContentArea
histogram.summary: Checkerboarded area, in number of pixels, that has no recording to raster from. A sample is recorded everytime a frame is drawn while a scroll is in progress. Tracking bug 535732.

histogram.name: Compositing.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumIncompleteTiles
histogram.summary: Keeps track of number of incomplete tiles in a drawn compositor frame while scrolling. This is a rough measurement of ugliness during user interaction. Incomplete tiles are non ideal scaled. A sample is recorded everytime a frame is drawn while a scroll is in progress. Tracking bug 381695.

histogram.name: Compositing.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumMissingTiles
histogram.summary: Keeps track of number of missing tiles in a drawn compositor frame while scrolling. This is a rough measurement of ugliness during user interaction. Incomplete tiles are checkerboard or solid color. A sample is recorded everytime a frame is drawn while a scroll is in progress. Tracking bug 381695.

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceAggregator.AggregateUs
histogram.summary: Time spent aggregating compositor frames from different surfaces in microseconds. This is logged once per frame.

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceAggregator.SurfaceDrawQuad.MissingSurface
histogram.summary: The number of SurfaceDrawQuads where the surface doesn't exist. This is logged for each call to Aggregate().

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceAggregator.SurfaceDrawQuad.NoActiveFrame
histogram.summary: The number of SurfaceDrawQuads where the surface exists but doesn't have an active CompositorFrame. This is logged for each call to Aggregate().

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceAggregator.SurfaceDrawQuad.ValidSurface
histogram.summary: The number of SurfaceDrawQuads where the surface exists and has an active CompositorFrame. This is logged for each call to Aggregate().

histogram.name: Conflicts.ConfirmedBadModules
histogram.summary: The number of confirmed bad modules found during module enumeration.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerateLoadedModules
histogram.summary: The length of time it takes to enumerate the loaded modules in the browser process.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerateShellExtensions
histogram.summary: The length of time it takes to enumerate the shell extensions.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerateWinsockModules
histogram.summary: The length of time it takes to enumerate the Winsock LSP modules.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerationInspectionTime
histogram.summary: The cumulative length of time it takes to inspect all modules on disk, extracting their certificates and version information. This work is actually spread out over a much longer period of time so as not to impact the user.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerationTotalTime
histogram.summary: The cumulative length of time it takes to enumerate and inspect all modules. This work is actually spread out over a much longer period of time so as not to impact the user.

histogram.name: Conflicts.SuspectedBadModules
histogram.summary: The number of suspected bad modules found during module enumeration.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.ChromeOsSignalStrength
histogram.summary: Connectivity Diagnostics App: WiFi signal strength recorded during NIC_SIGNAL_STRENGTH test.
histogram.details: The "Strength" property of a WiFi signal is a partially-reversible function that linearly maps the RSSI range -120dBm to -20dBm to Strength values from 0 to 100.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.HTTP_LATENCY
histogram.summary: HTTP latency seen by the Connectivity Diagnostics.
histogram.details: HTTP latency is computed using the chrome.socket API to make an HTTP GET request to the /generate_204 page of three randomly generated Google hostnames (*-ccd-testing-v4.metric.gstatic.com). The time taken from issuing the HTTP request to receiving a response is clocked in JavaScript and the arithmetic mean of the three times is used as the HTTP latency.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.RESOLVER_LATENCY
histogram.summary: Resolution latency seen by the Connectivity Diagnostics.
histogram.details: Resolver latency is computed by using the chrome.dns API to query three randomly generated Google hostnames (*-ccd-testing-v4.metric.gstatic.com). The random hostnames guarantees that there will be no caching of DNS hostnames. The time taken from issuing the DNS request to receiving a response is clocked in JavaScript and the arithmetic mean of the three times is used as the resolver latency.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.TestVerdict
histogram.summary: Connectivity Diagnostics App: Outcome of the connectivity tests.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.TimeTaken
histogram.summary: Connectivity Diagnostics App: Amount of time taken to run each of the connectivity tests.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultAutoplaySetting
histogram.summary: The default autoplay setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultCookiesSetting
histogram.summary: The default cookies setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultHandlersSetting
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 07/2014 since it is not referenced anywhere in the code.
histogram.summary: The default handler setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultImagesSetting
histogram.summary: The default image setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultJavaScriptSetting
histogram.summary: The default JavaScript setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultKeygenSetting
histogram.summary: The default setting for using key generation in forms at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultLocationSetting
histogram.summary: The default location setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultMediaStreamCameraSetting
histogram.summary: The default camera setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultMediaStreamMicSetting
histogram.summary: The default microphone setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultMediaStreamSetting
histogram.obsolete: This setting was deprecated in r322364 and replaced with separate settings for camera and microphone. See ContentSettings.DefaultMediaStreamCameraSetting and ContentSettings.DefaultMediaStreamMicSetting.
histogram.summary: The default MediaStream setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultMIDISysExSetting
histogram.summary: The default MIDI permission setting on sysex (system exclusive) messages at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultMouseCursorSetting
histogram.summary: The default mouse cursor setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultNotificationsSetting
histogram.summary: The default notification setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultPluginsSetting
histogram.summary: The default plugins setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultPopupsSetting
histogram.summary: The default popups setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultPushMessagingSetting
histogram.summary: The default permission setting for push messages at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultSubresourceFilterSetting
histogram.summary: The default subresource filter setting at profile open

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultWebBluetoothGuardSetting
histogram.summary: The default permission setting for Web Bluetooth at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.Exceptions
histogram.summary: The number of user defined content setting exceptions at browser start. Suffixed with the name of content setting types.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.ExceptionScheme
histogram.summary: Records the schemes of content setting exceptions at browser start. Each exception provides one sample.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.ExceptionSchemeFile.HasPath
histogram.summary: Records how often a content settings exception for the file: scheme has a non-empty path. Recorded once per exception at browser start.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.ExceptionSchemeFile.Type.WithoutPath
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type has a content settings exception defined for a file: scheme with no path (i.e., wildcard path). Recorded once per exception at browser start.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.ExceptionSchemeFile.Type.WithPath
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type has a content settings exception defined for a file: scheme with a valid, non-empty path. Recorded once per exception at browser start.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.LastSettingParsed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-10-05 in Issue 433475. Histogram was used temorarily for diagnosing crash causes.
histogram.summary: Numer of results of parsing WebsiteSettingsHandler::last_setting_ success or failure in WebsiteSettingsHandler methods.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.MixedScript
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the mixed content shield was shown, and how the user interacted with it.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.NumberOfAllowCookiesExceptions
histogram.summary: The number of user defined cookies setting exceptions for allowing cookies at browser start.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.NumberOfBlockCookiesExceptions
histogram.summary: The number of user defined cookies setting exceptions for blocking cookies at browser start.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.NumberOfExceptions
histogram.summary: The number of user defined hostname patterns for content settings at browser start.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.NumberOfSessionOnlyCookiesExceptions
histogram.summary: The number of user defined cookies setting exceptions for 'clearing cookies on browser exit' at browser start.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.PermissionActions
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.PermissionActionsInsecureOrigin
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc on an insecure origin. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.PermissionActionsSecureOrigin
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc on a secure origin. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.PermissionRequested
histogram.summary:
Number of times a given permission was requested by a website and the user has the permission set to prompt (i.e. not blocked or allowed).
Note this is probably not the metric you want - it does not correspond to the total number of times websites request a permission. Also, because specific permissions have code that can automatically block or grant permissions based on things like incognito, installed extensions etc., this does also not correspond to the number of times users are prompted to allow permissions.
For a better metric to track how often users are prompted, either use ContentSettings.PermissionsActions*, or Permissions.Prompt.*.
See https://crbug.com/638076 for more details.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.PermissionRequested_InsecureOrigin
histogram.summary:
Number of times a given permission was requested by an insecure origin and the user has the permission set to prompt (i.e. not blocked or allowed).
Note this is probably not the metric you want - it does not correspond to the total number of times websites request a permission. Also, because specific permissions have code that can automatically block or grant permissions based on things like incognito, installed extensions etc., this does also not correspond to the number of times users are prompted to allow permissions.
For a better metric to track how often users are prompted, use ContentSettings.PermissionsActions*.
See https://crbug.com/638076 for more details.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.PermissionRequested_SecureOrigin
histogram.summary:
Number of times a given permission was requested by a secure origin and the user has the permission set to prompt (i.e. not blocked or allowed).
Note this is probably not the metric you want - it does not correspond to the total number of times websites request a permission. Also, because specific permissions have code that can automatically block or grant permissions based on things like incognito, installed extensions etc., this does also not correspond to the number of times users are prompted to allow permissions.
For a better metric to track how often users are prompted, use ContentSettings.PermissionsActions*.
See https://crbug.com/638076 for more details.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.Plugins
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the plugin content blocked puzzle piece was shown in the Omnibox, and how the user interacted with it.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.Popups
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the popup content blocked puzzle piece was shown in the Omnibox, and how the user interacted with it.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SaveLinkType
histogram.summary: Type of the url when user saves the content through the save link context menu.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOption
histogram.summary: The option that the user selected from a context menu.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.Shown
histogram.summary: Recorded when a context menu is shown, sliced by whether a web contents was present. (It generally should be; indeed, this code path should not be followed when it is absent. For instance, invoking a context menu from the new tab page or from the sad tab page will not cause an emission to this histogram.) Note that this refers to link context menus, not the cut-copy-paste context menus that can appear during long presses on text on a web page or long presses in the omnibox. The value of this histogram for "present" could be usefully compared with the total count of ContextMenu.SelectedOption to determine the clickthrough rate for context menus.

histogram.name: Cookie.BackingStoreUpdateResults
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether or not updates to the backing store succeeded or failed, recorded every update.

histogram.name: Cookie.BetweenAccessIntervalMinutes
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-08-17 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/521135).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Intervals between access time updates for each cookie.

histogram.name: Cookie.CookieDeleteEquivalent
histogram.summary: Record when at attempt is made to delete an equivalent cookie on a set cookie operation and when such a cookie is found and deleted. Also measure when strict secure cookie rules affect this outcome and prevent a cookie from being deleted.

histogram.name: Cookie.CookieLineCookieValueValidity
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie initialised from a Set-Cookie header value was valid or not. This is only logged after cookies containing control characters have already been rejected, so "Invalid" here means that the cookie contains quotes, commas, backslashes or top-bit-set characters.

histogram.name: Cookie.CookiePrefix
histogram.summary: Number of times a cookie was set with a name prefixed by "__Secure-" or "__Host-" (prefixes reserved by https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-west-cookie-prefixes).

histogram.name: Cookie.CookiePrefixBlocked
histogram.summary: Number of times a cookie was set with a name prefixed by "__Secure-" or "__Host-" that violate cookie prefix rules. That is, a __Secure- cookie must be set over a secure connection with the Secure attribute, and a __Host- cookie must be set over a secure connection, with the Secure attribute, with no Domain attribute, and with a Path attribute of "/". (As defined in https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-west-cookie-prefixes.)

histogram.name: Cookie.CookieSourceScheme
histogram.summary: For each cookie added to the store, record whether its source URL has a cryptographic scheme, broken down by Secure and not Secure.

histogram.name: Cookie.CorruptMetaTable
histogram.summary: Records the detection of a corrupted meta table. See http://crbug.com/111376 .

histogram.name: Cookie.CorruptMetaTableRecoveryFailed
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records a failure to recover a corrupted meta table. See http://crbug.com/111376 .

histogram.name: Cookie.Count
histogram.summary: Number of cookies in the store (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time)

histogram.name: Cookie.DBSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size, on disk, of the cookie database as it is being loaded.

histogram.name: Cookie.DeletionCause
histogram.summary: For each cookie removed from the store, the reason it was removed.

histogram.name: Cookie.DomainCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-08-17 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/521135).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each domain, number of cookies in that domain (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time).

histogram.name: Cookie.DomainPerEtldp1Count
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-08-17 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/521135).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For every top level domain, number of subdomains in that top level domain (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time).

histogram.name: Cookie.Etldp1Count
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-08-17 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/521135).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For every top level domain, number of cookies in that domain (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time).

histogram.name: Cookie.EvictedLastAccessMinutes
histogram.summary: For each evicted (not expired) cookie, the amount of time since it was last used

histogram.name: Cookie.ExpirationDurationMinutes
histogram.summary: Number of minutes until cookie expires when set.

histogram.name: Cookie.KillDatabaseResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether killing the database because it was corrupted beyond repair succeeded.

histogram.name: Cookie.NumberOfLoadedCookies
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This histogram records the total number of cookies loaded from disk, including any cookies that are discarded during loading (for whatever reason).

histogram.name: Cookie.ParsedCookieStatus
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When parsing a cookie, indicates if control characters were present in any of the cookie values and if any of the cookie values were invalid. Specifically, checks that all of the parsed values are valid according to the valid token definition in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters.

histogram.name: Cookie.PriorityBlockingTime
histogram.summary: This histogram records the total duration of time during which at least one web request was blocked waiting for the cookie store to load. If no requests were affected, the value is 0. If two requests are simultaneously blocked for 1 second, the value is 1 second. If two requests are consecutively blocked for 1 second each, the value is two seconds.

histogram.name: Cookie.PriorityLoadCount
histogram.summary: The number of distinct Effective Top-Level Domains Plus One (ETLD+1, i.e., google.com, bbc.co.uk) for which a priority cookie load occurred.

histogram.name: Cookie.ReinstatedCookies
histogram.summary: The duration in seconds between a cookie getting evicted (due to the number of cookies exceeding a domain limit), and subsequently reinstated.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetAttributePairCharsValidity
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie attribute pair was set with both a valid key and a valid attribute value or not. For the key, this implies that it was a valid token as defined in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters. For the value, this implies that it contained no control characters and no semicolon.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetNameValidity
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie name was set with a valid token. A valid token is defined in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetValueCookieValueValidity
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie value was valid or invalid when there was an attempt to set it, where a valid value is defined in RFC 6265 as ASCII characters excluding controls, whitspace, comma, semicolon, and backslash.

histogram.name: Cookie.Shutdown.NumberOfCookiesDeleted
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2015. The associated experiment was flawed.
histogram.summary: The number of session cookies deleted on shutdown. This metric is emitted even if no cookies are deleted.

histogram.name: Cookie.Shutdown.TimeSpentDeletingCookies
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2015. The associated experiment was flawed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time required to delete session cookies on shutdown. This metric is emitted even if no cookies are deleted.

histogram.name: Cookie.Startup.NumberOfCookiesDeleted
histogram.summary: The number of session cookies deleted on startup. This metric is emitted even if no cookies are deleted. This metric is not emitted if session cookies are restored, rather than deleted on startup.

histogram.name: Cookie.Startup.TimeSpentDeletingCookies
histogram.summary: The amount of time required to delete session cookies on startup. This metric is emitted even if no cookies are deleted. This metric is not emitted if session cookies are restored, rather than deleted on startup.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeBlockedOnLoad
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) between the cookie store load starting and completing.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV5
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2015. The migration has finished for most users.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v4 database to v5.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV6
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2015. The migration has finished for most users.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v5 database to v6.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV7
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2015. The migration has finished for most users.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v6 database to v7.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV8
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2015. The migration has finished for most users.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v7 database to v8.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV9
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v8 database to v9.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeGet
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to get cookies for each URL request.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeInitializeDB
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to initialize the cookies database.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeInitializeDomainMap
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to read and parse the domain map from the cookies database.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeKeyLoadDBQueueWait
histogram.summary: This histogram records the wall-clock delay between a priority load task being posted to the DB-thread and its execution.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeKeyLoadTotalWait
histogram.summary: This histogram records the the total amount of time spent fetching the cookies associated with an eTLD+1 from disk, including time spent waiting in task queues.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeLoad
histogram.summary: This histogram records the sum of the durations of all initial tasks loading cookies from the database.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeLoadDBQueueWait
histogram.summary: This histogram records the wall-clock delay between the Load task being posted to the DB-thread and its execution.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeLoadDomains
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to read the domain map from the cookies database.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeParseDomains
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to parse the domains already loaded from the cookies database and put them in the domain map.

histogram.name: Cookie.Type
histogram.summary: For each cookie added to the store, record it's type(s).

histogram.name: CopylessPaste.CacheHit
histogram.summary: The cache hit status of metadata extraction for AppIndexing.

histogram.name: CopylessPaste.ExtractionFailedUs
histogram.summary: The time spent on scanning the document in the main frame to extract the metadata. The metadata would be used to feed Icing for CopylessPaste feature on Android. This only counts pages with failed or empty JSON extraction.

histogram.name: CopylessPaste.ExtractionStatus
histogram.summary: The error status of metadata extraction for AppIndexing.

histogram.name: CopylessPaste.ExtractionUs
histogram.summary: The time spent on scanning the document in the main frame to extract the metadata. The metadata would be used to feed Icing for CopylessPaste feature on Android. This only counts pages with successful JSON extraction.

histogram.name: Cras.StreamTimeoutMilliSeconds
histogram.summary: The longest additional time CRAS(Chrome OS audio server) ever waits for a stream exceeding the timeout threshold. This value is recorded per stream when it gets removed and used to investigate the audio glitch/skip problem on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: CrashExitCodes.Extension
histogram.summary: The exit codes for crashed extension processes.

histogram.name: CrashExitCodes.Renderer
histogram.summary: The exit codes for crashed renderer processes.

histogram.name: Crashpad.CrashReportPending
histogram.summary: The reason that a crash report entered the upload pending state.

histogram.name: Crashpad.CrashReportSize
histogram.summary: The size of a crash report minidump on disk when captured.

histogram.name: Crashpad.CrashUpload.AttemptSuccessful
histogram.summary: Logs whether a crash uploaded succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Crashpad.CrashUpload.Skipped
histogram.summary: The reason that a crash report upload was skipped.

histogram.name: Crashpad.ExceptionCaptureResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of execution of the Crashpad exception handler.

histogram.name: Crashpad.ExceptionCode.Mac
histogram.summary: The exception code encountered in a crash on Mac OS X.

histogram.name: Crashpad.ExceptionCode.Win
histogram.summary: The exception code encountered in a crash on Windows.

histogram.name: Crashpad.ExceptionEncountered
histogram.summary: A count of the number of exceptions handled by Crashpad with two buckets for starting and finishing.

histogram.name: Crashpad.HandlerCrash.ExceptionCode.Mac
histogram.summary: The exception code encountered for a crash of the crash handler process on Mac OS X.

histogram.name: Crashpad.HandlerCrash.ExceptionCode.Win
histogram.summary: The exception code encountered for a crash of the crash handler process on Windows.

histogram.name: Crashpad.HandlerLifetimeMilestone
histogram.summary: Handler start/crash/exit events.

histogram.name: CrashReport.BreakpadCrashDumpOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2016 as CrashPad does not implement this.
histogram.summary: Reports the result of an attempt to report a crash dump via Breakpad. Success indicates only that the out-of-process crash reporter succesfully generated a dump. The success or failure of the eventual upload is not measured. This stability metric is logged from the first Chrome launch post-dump.

histogram.name: CrashReport.BreakpadDumpWithoutCrashOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2016 as CrashPad does not implement this.
histogram.summary: Reports the result of an attempt to report a dump via Breakpad without crashing. Success indicates only that the out-of-process crash reporter succesfully generated a dump. The success or failure of the eventual upload is not measured. This stability metric is logged from the first Chrome launch post-dump.

histogram.name: CrashReport.CrashBackgroundUploadDelay
histogram.summary: Time delta between when the crash took place and when the crash was uploaded by the app as a background task. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: CrashReport.PendingReportsOnBackgroundWakeUp
histogram.summary: The number of crash reports present when the app wakes up as a background task to upload crash reports. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: CrashReport.PermanentUploadFailure
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2017 in Issue 680162 with the removal of Kasko.
histogram.summary: Counts crash reports that the Kasko crash reporter fails to upload and hands off to Chrome. Kasko stores the failed reports in a location specified by Chrome. Chrome records this metric when it detects new minidump files in that location. Currently the reports are discarded, but they could eventually be uploaded via the Chrome network stack.

histogram.name: Cros.ClickOnShelf
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 12/2013. Default pinned apps trial is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS shelf clicks.

histogram.name: CrosDisks.ArchiveType
histogram.summary: The type of archive file that Chrome OS cros-disks daemon is requested to mount.

histogram.name: CrosDisks.DeviceMediaType
histogram.summary: The media type of removable device that Chrome OS cros-disks daemon is requested to mount.

histogram.name: CrosDisks.FilesystemType
histogram.summary: The type of file system that Chrome OS cros-disks daemon is requested to mount.

histogram.name: CrosFirstRun.DialogShown
histogram.summary: Records the number of times when first-run dialog was shown.

histogram.name: CrosFirstRun.FurthestStep
histogram.summary: Index of furthest step that was reached during tutorial. Since order of steps could change eventially and new steps could apear we use index here instead of step name.

histogram.name: CrosFirstRun.TimeSpent
histogram.summary: The total time that user spent on first-run tutorial.

histogram.name: CrosFirstRun.TimeSpentOnStep
histogram.summary: The time that user spent on some step of tutorial.

histogram.name: CrosFirstRun.TutorialCompletion
histogram.summary: Tracks the way how user left tutorial.

histogram.name: CrosFirstRun.TutorialLaunched
histogram.summary: Records the number of times when first-run tutorial has been launched.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.ChecksumStatus
histogram.summary: Checksum status of critical persistent data used by Cryptohome. This status is recorded every time the cryptohomed daemon reads a file.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationEndStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the user home directory migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. This is logged once at the end of each migration.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationFailedErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code of file operation by which the user home directory migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto has failed. This is logged once the migration encounters a file I/O error.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationFailedOperationType
histogram.summary: The type of file operation at which the user home directory migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto has failed. This is logged once the migration encounters a file I/O error.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationFailedPathType
histogram.summary: The category of the path where the user home directory migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto has failed. This is logged once the migration encounters a file I/O error.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationStartStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the user home directory migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. This is logged once at the start of each migration.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.Errors
histogram.summary: Cryptohome errors.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.FreedGCacheDiskSpaceInMb
histogram.summary: The amount of drive cache (MB) which was evicted by cryptohome due to shortage of remaining disk space.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.HomedirEncryptionType
histogram.summary: The encryption type used for a user's cryptohome directory. This is logged each time the cryptohome is mounted.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationToGaiaId
histogram.summary: This is the status of cryptohome migration to GaiaId. Every time user logs in current migration status is recorded.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationUI.ConsumedBatteryPercent
histogram.summary: The amount of consumed battery level during cryptohome encryption migration. This is logged when the battery level decreases during migration, and the data is used to check if the minimum battery level required to start migration is appropriate.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationUI.FirstScreen
histogram.summary: The first screen in the encryption migration UI, which is shown when a user attempts to log in to the system and old encryption (eCryptfs) is detected.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationUI.UserChoice
histogram.summary: User's choice when the system is ready to migrate encryption. The user can start migration or skip it. It is used to know how many users have skipped migration.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToCompleteDircryptoMigration
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for the user's home directory to be migrated from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. If the migration is interrupted and subsequently resumed (such as due to power loss) the no value is recorded for either attempt.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToInitPkcs11
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for Chrome OS cryptohome daemon to initialize the PKCS#11. Initializations under 1 second represent checks on a previously initialized PKCS#11, and should be discarded for analysis.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToMountAsync
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for Chrome OS cryptohome to mount the encrypted home directory asynchronously.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToMountGuestAsync
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for Chrome OS cryptohome to mount the encrypted guest home directory asynchronously.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToMountGuestSync
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for Chrome OS cryptohome to mount the encrypted guest home directory synchronously.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToMountSync
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for Chrome OS cryptohome to mount the encrypted home directory synchronously.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToTakeTpmOwnership
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for Chrome OS cryptohome daemon to take ownership of the TPM.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TpmResults
histogram.summary: The errors resulting from interacting with the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) device.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.ClientAppId
histogram.summary: Android: AppId declared by the launching application in EXTRA_APPLICATION_ID in a custom tab. This histogram is used as a means to count the total instances of custom tabs created meanwhile binning them across launching apps that have identified themselves.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.IntentToFirstCommitNavigationTime
histogram.summary: Time between the intent arrival in Chrome and the first navigation commit, if the navigation is successful. Similar in principle to Startup.FirstCommitNavigationTime.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.IntentToFirstCommitNavigationTime2
histogram.summary: Time between the intent arrival to a Custom Tab and the first navigation start, if the navigation is successful. Non-"Herb" mode.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.IntentToFirstCommitNavigationTime3
histogram.summary: Time between the intent arrival to a Custom Tab and the first navigation commit, if the navigation is successful. Similar in principle to Startup.FirstCommitNavigationTime. Non-"Herb" mode.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.IntentToPageLoadedTime
histogram.summary: Time between the intent arrival in Chrome and the first "page loaded" event, if the navigation is successful. Non-"Herb" mode.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.MayLaunchUrlType
histogram.summary: Android only. Which flavors of mayLaunchUrl() were used before a tab launch. Can be low and/or high confidence. Recorded at the same time as CustomTabs.WarmupStateOnLaunch for the buckets "Session, No Warmup, Warmup called from another UID", "Session, No Warmup" and "Session, Warmup".

histogram.name: CustomTabs.NonDefaultSessionPrerenderMatched
histogram.summary: Android: When there is a prerender for a session with non-default parameters, whether the prerender was matched when navigating.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.PredictionStatus
histogram.summary: For Custom Tabs, records whether mayLaunchUrl() has been called, and if so, whether the call was later matched by a URL launch.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.PredictionToLaunch
histogram.summary: When a URL prediction succeeds, time in ms between the prediction and the actual launch.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.PrerenderSessionUsesDefaultParameters
histogram.summary: Android: When prerendering a URL for Custom Tabs, whether the client session uses the default parameters.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.Visible
histogram.summary: Recorded only for Android. Records on every metrics upload whether the currently visible tab is a custom tab. The custom tab is launched by a client app with customized UI. Some metrics like page load time will behave differently for these tabs since it will be possible to warm up the browser process and prepare resources for specific urls ahead of time via a service connection. This histogram can be used to cluster these metric differently.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.WarmupStateOnLaunch
histogram.summary: Recorded only on Android. Reports whether warmup() has been called when a Custom Tabs Intent is received from an application, and if so, whether the call could be matched with a session.

histogram.name: CustomTabs.WebContentsStateOnLaunch
histogram.summary: Android: When a CustomTabActivity creates its Tab, whether we use a prerendered WebContents, a spare renderer or create a new WebContents.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.AutoLoFiAccuracy
histogram.summary: Counts the accuracy of estimated network quality when using Lo-Fi. Counters are incremented when a main frame URL request is handled by Data Reduction Proxy and session was in Auto Lo-Fi enabled field trial.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.AutoLoFiRequestHeaderState
histogram.summary: Counts the changes in the state of Lo-Fi request header (q=low) being added to the Chrome proxy request header. Counters are incremented when a main frame URL request is handled by Data Reduction Proxy and session was in Auto Lo-Fi enabled field trial.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BlockTypeFallback
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to block the fallback configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BlockTypePrimary
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to block the primary configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassedBytes
histogram.summary: Counts the response bytes that did not go through the data reduction proxy as the result of a bypass event.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassedBytes.NotBypassed
histogram.summary: Counts the response bytes that went through the data reduction proxy and were not bypassed.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassInfoFallback
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2014, replaced by DataReductionProxy.BypassTypeFallback.
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to bypass the fallback configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassInfoPrimary
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2014, replaced by DataReductionProxy.BypassTypePrimary.
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to bypass the primary configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassOnNetworkErrorFallback
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that caused the fallback data reduction proxy to be bypassed and put on the proxy retry list. Called after a failure to connect or resolve a host name.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassOnNetworkErrorPrimary
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that caused the primary data reduction proxy to be bypassed and put on the proxy retry list. Called after a failure to connect or resolve a host name.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassTypeFallback
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to bypass the fallback configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassTypePrimary
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to bypass the primary configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.CaptivePortalDetected.Platform
histogram.summary: Records if the platform detected that a captive portal is present on the current network. Recorded at the time of Chrome startup and on IP change event. Recorded only for users that have data saver enabled.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ConfigFetchLostBytesCL
histogram.summary: Size of the response body. This is the actual number of bytes received, which usually agrees with but is not necessarily the same as the size specified by the Content-Length header. Only recorded if the request is sent while a simulated Data Reduction Proxy configuration fetch is taking place.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ConfigFetchLostBytesDiff
histogram.summary: The difference between the size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header and the size of the response body. Only recorded if the request is sent while a simulated Data Reduction Proxy configuration fetch is taking place. Only positive values are logged, so if X-Original-Content-Length is not specified or if it equals or exceeds the content length, it is not logged.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ConfigFetchLostBytesOCL
histogram.summary: Size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header. If this header is not present in the response, the size of the response body is used. Only recorded if the request is sent while a simulated Data Reduction Proxy configuration fetch is taking place.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ConfigService.AuthExpired
histogram.summary:
Total number of authentication required responses received from the Data Reduction Proxy.
An "Unexpired" value is recorded every time a new client config is fetched and parsed successfully. An "Expired" value is recorded every time Chrome receives an authentication failure from the data saver proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ConfigService.AuthExpiredSessionKey
histogram.summary:
On receiving an authentication failure from the data reduction proxy, records whether the session key used in the request matches the current session key.
Recorded every time Chrome receives an authentication failure from the data saver proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ConfigService.AuthFailure.LatencyPenalty
histogram.summary:
Time from when the request starts to the time when the auth failure is received from the data saver proxy.
Recorded every time an auth failure is received from the data saver proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ConfigService.FetchFailedAttemptsBeforeSuccess
histogram.summary:
The number of failed attempts when retrieving the configuration from the Data Reduction Proxy API before a successful attempt took place.
Recorded every time a new client config is fetched and parsed successfully. If the device has a valid connection type but no Internet connectivity, this count will keep increasing.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ConfigService.FetchLatency
histogram.summary:
Time from when the Data Reduction Proxy configuration request starts until it completes.
Recorded every time a new client config is fetched and parsed successfully.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ConfigService.FetchResponseCode
histogram.summary: Count per HttpResponseCode when attempting to retrieve the Data Reduction Proxy configuration from the Data Reduction Proxy API.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ConfigService.HTTPRequests
histogram.summary:
Upper bound on the count of HTTP requests that did or did not go through the data saver proxy.
An HTTP request may not go through data saver proxy if the config was unavailable, due to local bypass rules, or due to server side bypasses. If data saver is turned on, this metric is recorded every time proxy is resolved for an HTTP request.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.DaysSinceEnabled
histogram.summary: Records the number of days since data reduction proxy was last enabled by the user. Recorded only if the data reduction proxy was last enabled since this metric was added to Chromium (M-56).
