Recorded at Chrome startup if data reduction proxy is already enabled, and when the user enables the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.DaysSinceSavingsCleared.NegativeSystemClock
histogram.summary: Records the number of days since the data reduction savings were cleared because the system clock moved back by more than 1 day. Recorded at Chrome startup if data reduction proxy is enabled, and if the data reduction proxy savings were cleared in some previous Chrome session.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.EnabledState
histogram.summary:
Samples of user interactions with the Data Saver settings menu across all platforms (android, IOS, desktop extension). Data is collected whenever user toggles the ON/OFF switch in the settings menu for reducing data usage.
For desktop, Off-to-On/On-to-Off histogram count will increment when the data saver extension is installed/uninstalled respectively as well.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperDetectionHTTP
histogram.summary: For each carrier, the total number of HTTP responses that have been checked for tampering. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperDetectionHTTPS
histogram.summary: For each carrier, the total number of HTTPS responses that have been checked for tampering. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperDetectionPassHTTP
histogram.summary: For each carrier, the total number of HTTP responses that passed the tamper detection. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperDetectionPassHTTPS
histogram.summary: For each carrier, the total number of HTTPs responses that passed the tamper detection. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperedHTTP
histogram.summary: The total number of HTTP responses that some part (specified by suffix name) have been tampered with. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperedHTTPS
histogram.summary: The total number of HTTPS responses that some part (specified by suffix name) have been tampered with. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HistoricalDataUsageLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to load historical data usage from Level DB into memory. This UMA is reported each time the method to load historical data usage is called, which happens when user views data usage history.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.LevelDBOpenStatus
histogram.summary: Status of calling Open() on Data Reduction Proxy LevelDB.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.LevelDBSize
histogram.summary: Size of Data Reduction Proxy LevelDB measured at startup.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.LoFi.Accuracy
histogram.summary: Records the accuracy of estimated network quality when using Lo-Fi. Network quality predicted at the time of navigation start is compared with the network quality observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation. This metric is recorded only when the session is in Lo-Fi enabled field trial.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.LoFi.ImplicitOptOutAction
histogram.summary: Counts of Lo-Fi implicit opt out actions. If the user chooses to "Load image" for k pages in a session, LoFi is disabled for the remainder of that session. If Lo-Fi is disabled for j consecutive sessions, Lo-Fi is disabled for that user until the next implicit opt out epoch, which may be in a later session, or never. k and j default to 3 and are assigned via the DataReductionProxyLoFi field trial.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.LoFi.SessionState
histogram.summary: Tracks Lo-Fi usage at the granularity of browser sessions. Counts for each session if Lo-Fi was used or not. In the case where Lo-Fi was not used, records if it was because the network quality was always good or because the user had implicitly opted out. The session where a user permanently opts out is counted in the Lo-Fi used bucket.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.LoFi.TransformationType
histogram.summary: Counts of pageloads that received or requested, but did not receive, various Lo-Fi lite page transformations. Recorded when a lite page is requested or received through Data compression proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.LoFi.UIAction
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2016, replaced by Previews.ContextMenuAction.LoFi.
histogram.summary:
User interactions with the Lo-Fi snackbar and context menu option. These include:
Displays and clicks on the "Load images" snackbar. Displays and clicks on the "Load image" and "Load images"context menu options. Count of pages where the user has clicked "Load image" at least once.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.MissingViaHeader.Bytes
histogram.summary: Counts the response bytes of responses that Chrome expected to come through a data reduction proxy and have the data reduction proxy via header, but where the data reduction proxy via header was missing. Note that this does not include responses that were bypassed.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.MissingViaHeader.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: Counts the different HTTP response codes of responses that Chrome expected to come through a data reduction proxy and have the data reduction proxy via header, but where the data reduction proxy via header was missing.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.NetworkChangeEvents
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times various events occur when the data reduction proxy is enabled and the IP address of the client changes.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.Pingback.Attempted
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times that pageload metrics were queued to be attempted or not queued based on the reporting fraction. Recorded once per pageload.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.Pingback.Succeeded
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times that a batched pingback request succeeded or failed at being sent to the server. Recorded everytime a pingback request is attempted.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ProbeURL
histogram.summary: Counts various outcomes of requesting the data reduction proxy's probe URL.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ProbeURLNetError
histogram.summary: Reports the type of network error when the data reduction proxy probe fails due to a network error.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.PromoAction
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2015, replaced by DataReductionProxy.UIAction.
histogram.summary: Samples which method was used by the user to dismiss the proxy promo. This is sampled when the promo leaves view, with the sampled value depending on which of four possible controls the user used.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ProxyPrefMigrationResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of migrating the Data Reduction Proxy away from being configured via a proxy preference, including cases when no migration action was taken.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ProxySchemeUsed
histogram.summary: Records the scheme of the data reduction proxy server. Recorded for every request that is fetched successfully through a data reduction proxy server.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.Quic.DefaultAlternativeProxy
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 5/2017, since the experiment to use default QUIC alternative proxy was deprecated.
histogram.summary: Status of the availability of valid alternative data reduction proxy servers. This metric is recorded only when data reduction proxy delegate is queried for the value of the supported alternative proxy server.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.Quic.OnAlternativeProxyBroken
histogram.summary: Number of times an alternative QUIC proxy was marked as broken.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.Quic.ProxyStatus
histogram.summary: Records the result of the attempt to use a data reduction proxy that supports QUIC. The metric is logged for every request for which the resolved proxy is a data reduction HTTPS proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.RequestCompletionErrorCodes
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 2/2016, since it didn't get recorded for many kinds of error codes when it should have been recorded, and Net.HttpRequestCompletionErrorCodes is a good enough replacement when filtering for clients with the Data Reduction Proxy enabled.
histogram.summary: Reports the different network errors that requests that try to use the data reduction proxy are completing with, including OK and ABORTED.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.RequestCompletionErrorCodes.MainFrame
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 2/2016, since it didn't get recorded for many kinds of error codes when it should have been recorded, and Net.HttpRequestCompletionErrorCodes is a good enough replacement when filtering for clients with the Data Reduction Proxy enabled.
histogram.summary: Reports the different network errors that main frame resource requests that try to use the data reduction proxy are completing with, including OK and ABORTED.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ResourceContentType
histogram.summary: Content type of the resource determined by data reduction proxy. Used for determining the data reduction proxy that should be used for fetching the resource. Logged once per resource for only the resources that are eligible for fetching by data reduction proxies.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ResponseProxyServerStatus
histogram.summary: Reports the state of the proxy server field in the response seen by the Data Reduction Proxy bypass logic.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.SavingsCleared.NegativeSystemClock
histogram.summary: Records if the data reduction savings were cleared because the system clock moved back by more than 1 day. Recorded at Chrome startup if the data reduction proxy is enabled.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.SecureProxyCheck.Latency
histogram.summary: Time from when the Data Reduction Proxy secure proxy check starts until it completes.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.SettingsConversion
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2015, replaced by DataReductionProxy.UIAction.
histogram.summary: Samples of user interactions with the ON/OFF switch in the settings menu for reducing data usage. Only the setting changes between entering the reducing data usage setting menu and leaving the menu will be sampled. So if a user enters the menu with OFF and leaves it with OFF, it is counted as one OFF to OFF conversion regardless of how many times they toggle the ON/OFF switch.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.SnackbarPromo.DataSavings
histogram.summary: Logs the data savings in MB of the data reduction proxy snackbar promo that was shown. The snackbar promo shows the user the amount of data Chrome has saved them using Data Saver.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.StartupState
histogram.summary: Samples of the state of the data reduction proxy on Chrome startup. The proxy will either be unavailable (the feature hasn't been rolled out to this user yet), not enabled (the feature is available but the user doesn't have it turned on), or enabled (the feature is enabled and turned on).

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.SuccessfulRequestCompletionCounts
histogram.summary: Count of the number of requests that were successfully fetched via data reduction proxy. The bucket represents the index of the data reduction proxy in the data reduction proxy list.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.SuccessfulRequestCompletionCounts.MainFrame
histogram.summary: Count of the number of main frame requests that were successfully fetched via data reduction proxy. The bucket represents the index of the data reduction proxy in the data reduction proxy list.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.TimeToFirstDataSaverRequest
histogram.summary: Records the time duration between the data saver initialization and the first HTTP request that is resolved through the data saver proxy. On IP address changes, time duration between the IP address change event and the next subsequent HTTP request that resolves through the data saver proxy is recorded.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.UIAction
histogram.summary:
Samples of user interactions with the Data Reduction Proxy promos, First Run Experience, main menu footer, and settings menu. All samples are mutually exclusive. These samples include:
The user interactions with the First Run Experience. On Android when the user sees the FRE card, the Data Reduction Proxy defaults to ON. The user can disable the proxy via a switch on the card. The state of the proxy is sampled when the First Run Experience is completed and only reported if the Data Reduction Proxy card was shown.
The user interactions with the second run promo. On Android, there are two actions that dismiss this promo (enable or dismiss). This is sampled when the promo leaves view.
The user interactions with the Infobar promo. On Android, there are two actions that dismiss the promo (enable, dismiss). This is sampled when the promo leaves view.
The user interactions with the Snackbar promo. The user can either ignore the promo or click the action to the settings menu. From the settings menu, the user may enable or disable the proxy.
The user interactions with the main menu footer. The user can click the footer to enter the settings menu. From the settings menu, the user may enable or disable the proxy.
Any other user interaction with the ON/OFF switch in the settings menu for reducing data usage. Only the setting changes between entering the reducing data usage setting menu and leaving the menu will be sampled regardless of how many times they toggle the ON/OFF switch. Other samples that report ON/OFF settings menu changes are not also reported here.
The views of and user interactions with the site breakdown in the settings menu. The site breakdown can be sorted by data saved descending or data used descending, and expanded to view more sites. The Data Reduction statistics can also be reset.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.UserViewedOriginalSize
histogram.summary: The total original content size displayed to the user. Computed over the last 30 days. Recorded when the user views the data savings in the UI.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.UserViewedSavingsPercent
histogram.summary: The percentage of data savings displayed to users. Computed over the last 30 days. Recorded when the user views the data savings in the UI.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.UserViewedSavingsSize
histogram.summary: The total data saved displayed to the user. Computed over the last 30 days. Recorded when the user views the data savings in the UI.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.WarmupURL.FetchInitiated
histogram.summary: Number of times the data reduction proxy warm up URL was fetched.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.WarmupURL.FetchSuccessful
histogram.summary: Whether the warm up URL was fetched succesfully.

histogram.name: DataUsage.MatchingRulesCount.Invalid
histogram.summary: The number of invalid matching rules fetched from the platform external data use observer. A sample is recorded everytime fetch done callback is called.

histogram.name: DataUsage.MatchingRulesCount.Valid
histogram.summary: The number of valid matching rules fetched from the platform external data use observer. A sample is recorded everytime fetch done callback is called.

histogram.name: DataUsage.PageLoadSequence
histogram.summary: Records the sequence number of the page load within a data usage tracking session. Logged for each navigation in the tracking session.

histogram.name: DataUsage.Perf.MatchingRuleFirstFetchDuration
histogram.summary: The time taken in milliseconds to fetch the matching rules for the first time from the platform external data use observer. This measures the duration from the start time of Chromium to the time the rules are returned asynchronously. A sample is recorded when the first fetch done callback is called.

histogram.name: DataUsage.Perf.ReportSubmissionDuration
histogram.summary: The time taken in milliseconds to submit the data use reports to the platform external data use observer. This measures the duration from the time of report submission to the time report submission done asynchronous callback is received. A sample is recorded everytime report submission done callback is received.

histogram.name: DataUsage.Perf.URLRegexMatchDuration
histogram.summary: The time taken in milliseconds for a regular expression to parse an URL. A sample is recorded evertime regular expression parsing is done for an URL.

histogram.name: DataUsage.ReportSubmission.Bytes
histogram.summary: Count of bytes in the data use reports that were intended to be submitted to the platform external data use observer.

histogram.name: DataUsage.ReportSubmissionResult
histogram.summary: Result of data usage report submission.

histogram.name: DataUsage.TabModel.ExpiredActiveTabEntryRemovalDuration
histogram.summary:
The duration from the start time of a tab entry's latest data usage tracking session, till when the entry is expired and removed from the tab model. This is for tab entries that are still actively tracking data usage for a Chromium tab.
Tab model maintains the tab entries, each pertaining to tracking sessions of a single Chromium tab. These entries are considered expired after some duration and can be removed from the tab model after that. The sample is taken when an expired tab entry still tracking data usage is removed from the tab model.

histogram.name: DataUsage.TabModel.ExpiredInactiveTabEntryRemovalDuration
histogram.summary:
The duration from the end time of a tab entry's latest data usage tracking session, till when the entry is expired and removed from the tab model. This is for tab entries that are not actively tracking data usage for a Chromium tab.
Tab model maintains the tab entries, each pertaining to tracking sessions of a single Chromium tab. These entries are considered expired after some duration and can be removed from the tab model after that. The sample is taken when an expired inactive tab entry is removed from the tab model.

histogram.name: DataUsage.TabModel.OldInactiveSessionRemovalDuration
histogram.summary:
The duration from the end time of a data usage tracking session, till when the tracking session is removed from the tab model. This is for old tracking sessions that are not actively tracking data usage.
Tab model maintains a limited number of tracking sessions per Chromium tab. When this limit is reached oldest inactive tracking sessions are removed. The sample is taken when an old inactive tracking session of a tab is removed from the tab model.

histogram.name: DataUsage.TabModel.TrackingSessionLifetime
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a data usage tracking session of a Chromium tab, maintained by the tab model. This is the duration between the time tracking started due to an entry event and ended with an exit event. The sample is taken when the data usage tracking session ends.

histogram.name: DataUsage.TabModel.UnexpiredTabEntryRemovalDuration
histogram.summary:
The duration from the end time (start time, if still active) of a tab entry's latest data usage tracking session, till when the entry is removed from the tab model. This is for tab entries that are not expired yet, and removed from the tab model.
Tab model maintains a limited number of entries, each pertaining to tracking sessions of a single Chromium tab. When this limit is reached even after removing expired tab entries, then oldest unexpired tab entries are removed. The sample is taken when an unexpired tab entry is removed from the tab model.

histogram.name: DataUsage.TrackingSessionEndReason
histogram.summary: The reason for ending the data usage tracking session. Logged when the tracking session ends.

histogram.name: DataUsage.TrackingSessionStartReason
histogram.summary: The reason for starting the data usage tracking session. Logged when the tracking session was started.

histogram.name: DataUsage.UIAction
histogram.summary:
Samples of user interactions with the Data Use snackbar and dialog. These samples include:
Displays of the snackbar that indicates the start of data use tracking and clicks on its "More" button. Displays of snackbar that indicates the end of data use tracking and clicks on its "More" button. Displays of the dialog that indicates the end of data use tracking and the user interactions with it, which include: clicking "Continue", clicking "Cancel", clicking "Learn more", and opting out of seeing the dialog. If the user opts out of seeing the dialog, they will see the snackbar that indicates the end of data use tracking from then on.

histogram.name: DataUse.AllServices.Background
histogram.summary: The total background data use of Chrome's services broken down by service name. It is logged only in Android when the URLRequest of a service completes.

histogram.name: DataUse.AppTabState
histogram.summary: Records the data use of Chrome user traffic by the foregound vs. background state of the app and tab.

histogram.name: DataUse.BackgroundToDataRecievedPerByte
histogram.summary: The time since Chrome is in background when background data use happens. Recorded for each byte of background data use. The source of traffic whether from user browsing or chrome services is added as suffix to this histogram.

histogram.name: DataUse.BackgroundToFirstDownstream
histogram.summary: The time since Chrome is in background when first background data use happens. Recorded when first background downstream data use after Chrome is in background. The source of traffic whether from user browsing or chrome services is added as suffix to this histogram.

histogram.name: DataUse.BytesReceived
histogram.summary: Count of total bytes received by the Chrome on the network.

histogram.name: DataUse.BytesSent
histogram.summary: Count of total bytes sent by the Chrome on the network.

histogram.name: DataUse.ContentType.Services
histogram.summary: Data use of Chrome services traffic by different content types. Recorded when network bytes are received by Chrome.

histogram.name: DataUse.ContentType.UserTraffic
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2017/04. Bytes are logged to DataUse.ContentType.UserTrafficKB.
histogram.summary: Data use of user traffic by different content types. Recorded when network bytes are received by Chrome.

histogram.name: DataUse.ContentType.UserTrafficKB
histogram.summary: Data use of user traffic by different content types. Recorded when network bytes are received by Chrome.

histogram.name: DataUse.FavIcon.Downstream
histogram.summary: Records the downstream network data use of favicon requests. Logged when the request is completed or redirected. Zero bytes are recorded when the request is served from cache.

histogram.name: DataUse.FavIcon.Downstream.Non200Response
histogram.summary: Records the downstream network data use of favicon requests with non 200 response code. Logged when the request is completed or redirected.

histogram.name: DataUse.MessageSize
histogram.summary: The request and response size of the messages exchanged by a service. It is logged when the URLRequest of a service is completed. The service name is added as a suffix to this histogram name.

histogram.name: DataUse.MessageSize.AllServices
histogram.summary: The request and response size of the messages exchanged by all the services. Whenever a URLRequest of a service is completed, the number of exchanged bytes is logged in this histogram. The buckets in this histogram are services, so it makes it possible to compare the use of different services in different conditions. Different conditions are added as suffixes to this histogram. If the OS is not Android all the requests are considered foreground.

histogram.name: DataUse.PageTransition.UserTraffic
histogram.summary: Data use of user traffic by different core page transition types. Recorded when the URL request finishes.

histogram.name: DataUse.Sync.Download.Bytes
histogram.summary: Number of downloaded bytes of different data types in Sync service for received updates. It is updated when an update message is received from sync server.

histogram.name: DataUse.Sync.Download.Count
histogram.summary: Number of downloaded entities of different data types in Sync service for received updates. It is updated when an update message is received from sync server.

histogram.name: DataUse.Sync.ProgressMarker.Bytes
histogram.summary: Number of downloaded bytes of ProgressMarker of different data types in Sync service for received updates. It is updated when an update message is received from sync server.

histogram.name: DataUse.Sync.Upload.Bytes
histogram.summary: Number of uploaded bytes of different data types in Sync service for sent commits. Updated when a commit message is sent to sync server.

histogram.name: DataUse.Sync.Upload.Count
histogram.summary: Number of uploaded entities of different data types in Sync service for sent commits. Updated when a commit message is sent to sync server.

histogram.name: DataUse.TrafficSize.System
histogram.summary: The total data use of Chrome's services. There is no ResourceRequestInfo attached to these requests. If the OS is not Android all the requests are considered foreground.

histogram.name: DataUse.TrafficSize.User
histogram.summary: The total amount of data use of Chrome for user traffic. This traffic has content::ResourceRequestInfo attached to its request. If the OS is not Android all the requests are considered foreground.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.ActivateSettings.ErrorHresult
histogram.summary: The HRESULT from ActivateApplication when opening the Win10+ settings page fails.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.AsyncSetAsDefault.Duration
histogram.summary: How long it took to set Chrome as the default browser asynchronously in Windows 10+. The duration is recorded only on Success, Failure, Abandoned and Retry result codes.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.AsyncSetAsDefault.Result
histogram.summary: The count of how many times users were successfully able to set Chrome as the default browser asynchronously in Windows 10+.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.InfoBar.UserInteraction
histogram.summary: Possible user interactions with the default browser info bar.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.InteractionResult
histogram.summary: Results of interaction with set-as-default dialog in Win8+ first run flow.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.SetDefaultAsyncDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016/03. The async set-as-default experiments are finished.
histogram.summary: How long it took to set Chrome as the default browser asynchronously in Windows 10+. The duration is recorded only on Success, Failure, Abandoned, Retry and NoErrorsNotDefault result codes.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.SetDefaultResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of an attempt to set Chrome as the user's default browser.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.SetDefaultResult2
histogram.summary: The outcome of an attempt to set Chrome as the user's default browser.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.SettingsInteraction.ConcludeReason
histogram.summary: The reason why the default browser settings interaction concluded on Windows 10.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.SettingsInteraction.RegistryWatcherDuration
histogram.summary: The registry keys for the default browser protocols (http/https) are monitored to know when the user finished interacting with the system settings. This is how long it took for the last registry watcher to get signaled.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.State
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome was the default browser when it started up.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowserWarning.DontSetAsDefault
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015/11. The same information is available as the value Failure in DefaultBrowser.SetDefaultResult.
histogram.summary: In the make-default infobar, the user explicitly declined to set Chrome as default. Or, on OSes requiring the SetAsDefaultUI, the user explicitly chose another browser as default from the interactive UI. TODO(gab): Split the interactive signal into a separate histogram.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowserWarning.Ignored
histogram.summary: The user ignored the make-default infobar (it was eventually dismissed along with its associated web content without the user interacting with it).

histogram.name: DefaultBrowserWarning.SetAsDefault
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015/11. Renamed to DefaultBrowser.Infobar.UserInteraction. There is no longer a distinction between interactive or not.
histogram.summary: In the make-default infobar, the user clicked a button making Chrome the default.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowserWarning.SetAsDefaultUI
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015/11. Renamed to DefaultBrowser.Infobar.UserInteraction. There is no longer a distinction between interactive or not.
histogram.summary: Same as SetAsDefault, but in Win8+ (resulting in interactive UI instead of automatic takeover). Successes == these reports minus reports for DefaultBrowserWarning.SetAsDefaultUIFailed and some DefaultBrowserWarning.DontSetAsDefault. TODO(gab): Improve reporting here.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowserWarning.SetAsDefaultUIFailed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015/11. The same information is available as the value Failure in DefaultBrowser.SetDefaultResult.
histogram.summary: The user dismissed the interactive SetAsDefaultUI without making an explicit choice (or the UI failed to come up for another reason).

histogram.name: DefaultProtocolClient.SetDefaultResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of an attempt to set Chrome as the user's default client for a protocol.

histogram.name: DefaultProtocolClient.SetDefaultResult2
histogram.summary: The outcome of an attempt to set Chrome as the user's default client for a protocol.

histogram.name: DelayNavigationThrottle.Delay.Actual
histogram.summary: The actual delay added to main frame navigations by DelayNavigationThrottle.

histogram.name: DelayNavigationThrottle.Delay.Delta
histogram.summary: The absolute delta between the specified and actual delays added to main frame navigations by DelayNavigationThrottle.

histogram.name: DelayNavigationThrottle.Delay.Specified
histogram.summary: The specified delay added to main frame navigations by DelayNavigationThrottle.

histogram.name: DesktopIOSPromotion.DismissalReason
histogram.summary: The dimissal reason of the desktop to iOS promotion entry point. DismissalReason will be prefixed by the entry point promotion name that the user interacted with.

histogram.name: DesktopIOSPromotion.ImpressionFromEntryPoint
histogram.summary: The type of the desktop to iOS promotion that was shown to the user. This will be logged every time the user sees the desktop to iOS promotion.

histogram.name: DesktopIOSPromotion.IOSSigninReason
histogram.summary: [IOS] For users who sign-in on Chrome for iOS, log the type of the desktop iOS promotions that was shown to the user. Only recorded if the user has seen at least one desktop iOS promotion in the last 7 days and is signing into chrome on iOS. The last promotion entry point that sent an SMS (if any) is logged as DesktopIOSPromotion.SMSSent.IOSSigninReason; all other promotions that the user has seen are logged as DesktopIOSPromotion.NoSMS.IOSSigninReason.

histogram.name: DesktopIOSPromotion.OAuthTokenCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether getting the OAuth token was successful for a desktop to iOS promotion query.

histogram.name: DesktopIOSPromotion.OAuthTokenResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP Response code returned by the server when trying to fetch the OAuth token for a desktop ios promotion query.

histogram.name: DesktopIOSPromotion.QueryPhoneNumberSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether the SMS service api called from the desktop to iOS promotion returned a phone number or failed. This phone number is presented to the user so they know that Chrome will send the SMS to this number.

histogram.name: DesktopIOSPromotion.SendSMSSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether the SMS service api initiated SMS sending successfully from the desktop to iOS promotion.

histogram.name: DesktopIOSPromotion.SMSToSigninTime
histogram.summary: [IOS] The difference between the client time of triggering the SMS action on a specific entry point promotion on desktop and client time of signing in Chrome iOS app. This will only be logged if at least one promotion was shown to the user on the last 7 days and if at least one SMS was sent. If multiple SMSs were sent (at any time), it uses the time from the most recently sent one. If the is negative due to bad clock on one of the clients it will be logged as 0. SMSToSigninTime will be prefixed by the entry point promotion name that was responsible for the SMS sending.

histogram.name: DesktopIOSPromotion.VariationSigninReason
histogram.summary: [IOS] For users who sign-in on Chrome for iOS, log which variation of the desktop iOS promotions was shown to the user. The variation number is a unique identifier that is set for each group on the DesktopIOSPromotion study, and will be only recorded if the user has seen at least one desktop iOS promotion in the last 7 days and is signing into Chrome on iOS. The last variation that sent an SMS (if any) is logged as DesktopIOSPromotion.SMSSent.VariationSigninReason. If no SMS was sent, then the last variation the user has seen is logged as DesktopIOSPromotion.NoSMS.VariationSigninReason.

histogram.name: DevTools.ActionTaken
histogram.summary: Specified DevTools action has been taken.

histogram.name: DevTools.InspectElement
histogram.summary: Time to load Developer Tools when user clicks Inspect Element in the context menu.

histogram.name: DevTools.PanelShown
histogram.summary: Specified DevTools panel was shown.

histogram.name: DevTools.SettingChanged
histogram.summary: Specified DevTools setting was changed.

histogram.name: Diagnostics.Recovery.ConflictingDlls
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.

histogram.name: Diagnostics.Recovery.DiskSpace
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Shows the success and failure rates of the DiskSpace recovery step that runs on recovery startups. The recovery step attempts to guarantee the DiskSpace test, which checks that the disk space in the volume where the user data directory normally lives is not dangerously low, would pass on the next startup.

histogram.name: Diagnostics.Test.SQLiteIntegrityWebData
histogram.summary: Shows the success and failure rates of the SQLiteIntegrityWebData test that runs on recovery startups. The test checks the integrity of the Web Data database.

histogram.name: Diagnostics.Test.Version
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD - Not run automatically yet, so this is just a placeholder for future metrics collection. Any samples collected here represent users running diagnostics manually.

histogram.name: Diagnostics.TestFailures
histogram.summary: Histogram comparing the various types of diagnostic test failures when diagnostic tests are run. Note that some types of test failures cause the rest of the tests to be skipped.

histogram.name: Dialog.Create
histogram.summary: Counts the number times dialog boxes are created using a particular parent class.

histogram.name: Dialog.Creation
histogram.summary: Counts the number times various types of dialog boxes are created.

histogram.name: Dialog.Delegate.Creation
histogram.summary: Counts the number times dialog boxes are created using DialogDelegate.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.BuildCache.File.Size
histogram.summary: Reports size of font cache file. This is reported every time we rebuild font cache.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.BuildCache.Ignored
histogram.summary: Reports the total number of fonts that will be ignored while building static font cache due to size limitation. During cache building phase if our logic suggests that we need to put more than 70% of font file contents into cache file then we don't cache that particular font file. These ignored font files are directly picked up from system fonts folder during Direct Write cache building process. Our end goal is to minimize costly open and close operations on font files in system folder.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Ignored
histogram.summary: Reports the total number of fonts that will be ignored while loading a custom font collection. With current criteria fonts that are not in system-font location will be ignored.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Loaded
histogram.summary: Reports the total number of fonts to be loaded through a custom font collection. This actually reports total font entries from registry excluding font entries that point to non-system location.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Measures the total time spent in loading a custom font collection in non-cache-file mode. We load system fonts as a custom font collection to avoid any interaction with windows font cache service from sandboxed renderer process. Please note that windows font cache services is different from our cache file approach (later referred here as cache-file mode).

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.LoadTime.Cached
histogram.summary: Measures the total time spent in loading a custom font collection in cache-file mode. We load system fonts as a custom font collection to avoid any interaction with windows font cache service from sandboxed renderer process. Please note that windows font cache services is different from our cache file approach (later referred here as cache-file mode)

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.CreateFontFaceResult
histogram.summary: Records the error returned from CreateFontFace.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.Fallback.CacheSize
histogram.summary: Records how many font families are in the fallback cache.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.FallbackResult
histogram.summary: Measures the effectiveness of the font fallback proxy. This tracks if we were able to find a suitable font to render the character, and whether an IPC was necessary.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.FamilyCount
histogram.summary: The number of font families as seen by the font proxy in the renderer.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.FontProxyError
histogram.summary: The errors encountered by the DirectWrite font proxy while loading fonts.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.GetSystemFontCollectionResult
histogram.summary: Records the error returned from GetSystemFontCollection.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.LastResortFontCount
histogram.summary: The number of last resort fallback fonts found on the system as seen by the browser.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.LastResortFontFileCount
histogram.summary: The number of font files found for a last resort fallback font.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.LoaderType
histogram.summary: The codepath that was used to load a font family. This is logged in the browser every time a renderer attempts to load a font family, once per font file.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.LoadFamilyResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of attempting to load a font family in the renderer (success vs failure and number of families). This is logged in the renderer once per family that is loaded.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.LoadFamilyTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to load a font family, excluding glyph data. This is logged in the renderer once per family that is loaded.

histogram.name: DirectWrite.Fonts.Proxy.MessageFilterError
histogram.summary: Errors, if any, encountered by the DirectWrite font proxy message filter.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptCancelled
histogram.summary: The attempt which completed after the job was already cancelled.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptDiscarded
histogram.summary: The attempt which completed after the job was already cancelled OR the attempt that has finished after host resolution was already completed by an earlier attempt.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFailDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in OS resolutions for actual navigations. These attempts which completed after the job was already canceled OR after the job was already completed by an earlier attempt. Note that cached resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFailure
histogram.summary: The attempt that has not resolved the host successfully.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFirstFailure
histogram.summary: The attempt that resolved the host first and the resolution was not successful.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFirstSuccess
histogram.summary: The attempt that resolved the host first and the resolution was successful.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptSuccess
histogram.summary: The attempt that has resolved the host successfully.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptSuccessDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in OS resolutions that succeeded and were requested for actual navigations. These attempts which completed after the job was already canceled OR after the job was already completed by an earlier attempt. Note that cached resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptTimeSavedByRetry
histogram.summary: This histogram shows the time saved by having spawned an extra attempt, when the first attempt didn't finish before retry attempt.

histogram.name: DNS.CacheEvicted
histogram.summary: The time left to expiration of an entry when it is removed while compacting the HostCache.

histogram.name: DNS.CacheExpired
histogram.summary: The time since expiration of an entry when it is removed while compacting the HostCache.

histogram.name: DNS.CacheExpiredOnGet
histogram.summary: The time since expiration of an entry when it is removed on lookup.

histogram.name: DNS.EmptyAddressListAndNoError
histogram.summary: Error status when an empty address list was found in OnLookupComplete().

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.Erase
histogram.summary: The reason for erasing a DNS entry from the host cache.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.EraseStale.ExpiredBy
histogram.summary: When erasing a stale (expired or old-network) DNS entry from the host cache, how long past the expiration time it is.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.EraseStale.NetworkChanges
histogram.summary: When erasing a stale (expired or old-network) DNS entry from the host cache how many network changes happened between setting and erasing it.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.EraseStale.StaleHits
histogram.summary: When erasing a stale (expired or old-network) DNS entry from the host cache how many hits it received while stale.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.EraseValid.ValidFor
histogram.summary: When erasing a valid DNS entry from the host cache, for how much longer it would have remained valid.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.Lookup
histogram.summary: The outcome of looking up a DNS entry in the host cache.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.LookupStale.ExpiredBy
histogram.summary: When looking up a stale DNS entry in the host cache, how long past the expiration time it is.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.LookupStale.NetworkChanges
histogram.summary: When looking up a stale DNS entry in the host cache, how many network changes happened between setting it and looking it up.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.Set
histogram.summary: The outcome of setting a DNS entry in the host cache.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.UpdateStale.AddressListDelta
histogram.summary: When updating a stale (expired or old-network) DNS entry in the host cache, and both results are successful, how the address list differs between the old and new entries.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.UpdateStale.ExpiredBy
histogram.summary: When updating a stale (expired or old-network) DNS entry in the host cache, how long past the expiration time the old entry was.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.UpdateStale.NetworkChanges
histogram.summary: When updating a stale (expired or old-nework) DNS entry in the host cache, how many network changes happened between setting the old entry and setting the new entry.

histogram.name: DNS.HostCache.UpdateStale.StaleHits
histogram.summary: The number of hits received to an updated stale DNS entry in the host cache while it was stale.

histogram.name: DNS.IndependentFailedNavigation
histogram.summary: When either a pre-resolution was not done recently enough to provide benefit, or the corresponding pre-resolution is still pending, this histogram shows the duration of time used to resolve a hostname as not existing during a failed attempt to navigate to (GET) a URL. In newer versions, if the hostname has never been found as a link during a page scan, and it has a referring URL, then it is added to referrer list data structure (hoping we'll do better next time).

histogram.name: DNS.IndependentNavigation
histogram.summary: When either a pre-resolution was not done recently enough to provide benefit, or the corresponding pre-resolution is still pending, this histogram shows the duration of the duration of time used to resolve a hostname to navigate to (GET) a URL. In newer versions, if the hostname has never been found as a link during a page scan, and it has a referring URL, then it is added to referrer list data structure (hoping we'll do better next time).

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool).

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_HIGHEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_IDLE
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_LOW
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_LOWEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_MEDIUM
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool).

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_HIGHEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_IDLE
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOW
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOWEST
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_MEDIUM
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchCacheEviction
histogram.summary: The duration of time used (most recently) to pre-resolve a hostname, when the prefetched resolution was apparently evicted from the cache. The included samples only list pre-resolution times when the later navigations/fetches took in excess of 15ms.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchCacheEvictionL
histogram.summary: The duration of time used (most recently) to pre-resolve a hostname, when the prefetched resolution was apparently evicted from the cache. The included samples only list pre-resolution times when the later navigations/fetches took in excess of 15ms.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchFoundName
histogram.summary: Replaced by DNS.PrefetchFoundNameL.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchFoundNameL
histogram.summary: The duration of time used by the DNS pre-resolving threads to resolve a host name via the network. Any resolutions that are faster than 15ms are considered to be local cache hits, not requiring network access, and are not included in this histogram. This histogram is most useful for estimating the typical cost of a name resolution, but it also estimates the total number of network-based resolutions induced by this feature. Not all these resolutions prove helpful (i.e., the user does not always actually visit the resolved hostnames).

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchNegativeHit
histogram.summary: Replaced by DNS.PrefetchNegativeHitL.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchNegativeHitL
histogram.summary: The duration of time saved due to DNS pre-resolving in the "name not found" case. Time "savings" shown in the histogram are defined to be the difference between the DNS pre-resolution duration, and the DNS resolution duration seen during a navigation. These cache hits only list events where the DNS pre-resolve duration for a host was in excess of 15ms (i.e., the network was consulted), and the actual DNS resolution (when a user attempted to navigate to a link with the same host name) took less than 15ms (i.e., the network was not consulted), which means the gain was a result of a "cache hit" in the OS cache. For some users with LANs, all negative results (even when the DNS cache might otherwise help) take about 2.5 seconds (due to timeouts for netbios broadcasts), and hence no savings are possible (or shown) for such users in this category.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchPositiveHit
histogram.summary: Replaced by DNS.PrefetchPositiveHitL.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchPositiveHitL
histogram.summary: The duration of time saved due to DNS pre-resolving in the "name was found" case, and induced by either a page scan for a link or an omnibox entry by the user. Time "savings" shown in the histogram are defined to be the difference between the DNS pre-resolution duration, and the DNS resolution duration seen during a navigation. These cache hits only list events where the DNS pre-resolve duration for a host was in excess of 15ms (i.e., the network was consulted), and the actual DNS resolution (when a user attempted to navigate to a link with the same host name) took less than 15ms (i.e., the network was not consulted), which means the gain was a result of a "cache hit" in the OS cache.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchQueue
histogram.summary: The duration of time spent by a proposed resolution waiting in the queue to be resolved. This number is in addition to any DNS resolution time that may come later.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchReferredPositiveHit
histogram.summary: The duration of time saved due to DNS pre-resolving in the "name was found" case, and induced by predicting (using referrer lists) that a resolution was needed. Time "savings" shown in the histogram are defined to be the difference between the DNS pre-resolution duration, and the DNS resolution duration seen during a navigation. These cache hits only list events where the DNS pre-resolve duration for a host was in excess of 15ms (i.e., the network was consulted), and the actual DNS resolution (when a user attempted to navigate to a link with the same host name) took less than 15ms (i.e., the network was not consulted), which means the gain was a result of a "cache hit" in the OS cache.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchResolution
histogram.summary: The duration of time used by the DNS pre-resolving threads to resolve a host name via the network. Any resolutions that are faster than 15ms are considered to be local cache hits, not requiring network access, and are not included in this histogram. This histogram is most useful for estimating the typical cost of a name resolution, but it also estimates the total number of network-based resolutions induced by this feature. Not all these resolutions prove helpful (i.e., the user does not always actually visit the resolved hostnames).

histogram.name: DNS.QueueRecycledDeltaOver2
histogram.summary: When, due to congestion avoidance, a queued pre-resolution is abandoned (recycled) without actually being resolved, this histograms records the age in the queue of that entry. Only times over 2 seconds are recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: DNS.QueueRecycledUnder2
histogram.summary: When, due to congestion avoidance, a queued pre-resolution is abandoned (recycled) without actually being resolved, this histograms records the age in the queue of that entry. Only times less than or equal to 2 seconds are recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveCategory
histogram.summary: Counts of successes and failures of OS resolutions in various categories.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in OS resolutions for actual navigations. Note that cached OS resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail_FAMILY_IPV4
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveFail, but limited to pure IPv4 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail_FAMILY_IPV6
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveFail, but limited to pure IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail_FAMILY_UNSPEC
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveFail, but limited to IPv4/IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSpeculativeFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in speculative OS resolutions. Note that cached OS resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSpeculativeSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in speculative OS resolution that succeeded. Note that cached resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSuccess
DNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV4
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv4 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV6
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_UNSPEC
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to IPv4/IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveUnspecWaste
histogram.summary: Counts of hits and misses in the DNS cache and DNS jobs pool of wasted HostResolverImpl::Jobs that could be avoided by always resolving using AF_UNSPEC.

histogram.name: DNS.StaleHostResolver.NetworkEarly
histogram.summary: When a DNS request made through StaleHostResolver returns, a stale cached result was available, and the network responded before or exactly at the stale delay, how much earlier it responded.

histogram.name: DNS.StaleHostResolver.NetworkLate
histogram.summary: When a DNS request made through StaleHostResolver returns, a stale cached result was available, and the network responded after the stale delay, how much later it responded.

histogram.name: DNS.StaleHostResolver.RequestOutcome
histogram.summary: When a DNS request made through StaleHostResolver returns or is canceled, the outcome of the request.

histogram.name: DNS.StaleHostResolver.StaleAddressListDelta
histogram.summary: When a DNS request made through StaleHostResolver had a stale cached result and both the stale and network results were successful, the difference between the old and new address lists.

histogram.name: DNS.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Excludes speculative requests.

histogram.name: DNS.TotalTime_speculative
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Speculative requests only.

histogram.name: DNS.UnexpectedResolution
histogram.summary: In some cases, such as when content arrives with embedded references to other servers, the prefetch system can't (or doesn't) attempt to pre-resolve the hostnames. As an example, a visit to www.cnn.com will fetch content with references to about 12 additional hostnames, none of which are currently anticipated. Such resolutions are termed "Unexpected Resolutions," and the durations associated with those DNS resolutions are shown below. Future features may attempt to learn (from prior experience locally, or from server provided hints), what secondary hostname resolutions should be done when a primary resolution (or navigation) takes place. This histogram shows what the potential savings are that "remain on the table" until we employ some of these more advanced features.

histogram.name: DNS.UnexpectedResolutionL
histogram.summary: In some cases, such as when content arrives with embedded references to other servers, or when a page (such as one in SSL) preclude scanning and prefetching, the prefetch system can't (or doesn't) attempt to pre-resolve the hostnames. As an example, a visit to www.cnn.com will fetch content with references to about 12 additional hostnames, none of which might be anticipated. Similarly, clicking on a link in an SSL page won't be anticipated (since scanning in not allowed by default). Such resolutions are termed "Unexpected Resolutions," and the durations associated with those navigation induced DNS resolutions are shown below. If a referring URL is available for the navigation, the relationship to the referring URL was recorded, and future navigations to the referring hostname would have induced a pre-resolution of hostname that caused an entry below. Such any entry may facilitate future listing in the ReferredPositiveHit histogram.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.ResultUnknown.Elapsed
