histogram.name: DnsProbe.ProbeDuration
histogram.summary: Time between starting and finishing DNS probe.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.ProbeResult
histogram.summary: Result of DNS probes sent by the probe service.

histogram.name: DocumentActivity.Enabled
histogram.summary: Recorded only for Android. Records on every metrics upload whether document mode is enabled.

histogram.name: DocumentScan.ConverterResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS document scan metric that tracks whether a document scan call to the image conversion process suceeded.

histogram.name: DocumentScan.ScanResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS document scan metric that tracks whether a document scan call to the sane backend process suceeded.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBLoadedCount
histogram.summary: Number of certs loaded from domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBLoadStatus
histogram.summary: The status of loading the Channel ID database from disk. This histogram records why the database failed to load, or that it loaded successfully.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent loading domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size, on disk, of the domain bound cert database as it is being loaded.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBVersion
histogram.summary: The version number of the Channel ID database (before any migrations are run).

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GenerateCertTime
histogram.summary: Time spent generating a domain bound cert.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTime
histogram.summary: Combined time for GetDomainBoundCert retrieval (both synchronous and asynchronous).

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTimeAsync
histogram.summary: Time for asynchronous retrieval (from the GetDomainBoundCert call until completion callback is called).

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTimeSync
histogram.summary: Time for synchronous GetDomainBoundCert cert retrieval.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetDomainBoundCertResult
histogram.summary: Result of GetDomainBoundCert function.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.KillDatabaseResult
histogram.summary: Whether the domain-bound certs sqlite database was killed succesfully when an unrecoverable error was detected.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.Support
histogram.summary: Counts of SSL client sockets broken down by support for Domain Bound Certificates TLS extension. Counts only connections with full handshakes, resumed sessions are not counted.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.TaskMaxWaitTime
histogram.summary: Longest time spent by requests waiting for load of domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.TaskWaitCount
histogram.summary: Number of requests that waited for load of domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.BeaconInterval
histogram.summary: The time between successive Domain Reliability beacons being queued in the same context. (Can be arbitrarily long if no beacons are queued in a while.)

histogram.name: DomainReliability.BeaconIntervalGlobal
histogram.summary: The time between successive Domain Reliability beacons being queued across all contexts. (Can be arbitrarily long if no beacons are queued in a while.)

histogram.name: DomainReliability.BeaconReported
histogram.summary: Whether a beacon added to a Domain Reliability context was saved to be uploaded to the collector.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.OnBeaconDidEvict
histogram.summary: Whether adding a beacon to a Domain Reliability context caused it to evict an older beacon to stay within memory limits.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.ReportedBeaconError
histogram.summary: The Chrome error code included in a beacon saved to be uploaded to the collector.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.ReportedBeaconError_HasServerIP
histogram.summary: The Chrome error code included in a beacon with a non-empty server_ip field saved to be uploaded to the collector.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.ReportedBeaconUploadDepth
histogram.summary: The upload depth included in a beacon saved to be uploaded to the collector. (Zero means the beacon was not about a report upload; n+1 means the beacon was about a report with upload depth n.)

histogram.name: DomainReliability.SetConfigRecreatedContext
histogram.summary: When Domain Reliability receives a valid NEL configuration header for an origin with Domain Reliability active, whether or not it needed to recreate the origin's context to apply a changed config.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadCollectorIndex
histogram.summary: The index of the collector that a Domain Reliability upload was sent to. (Later collectors are only used when earlier collectors have failed.)

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadCollectorRetryDelay
histogram.summary: After an upload to a collector finishes (successfully or not), the delay before the scheduler can send another upload to that collector. (If recent uploads were successful, this will be 0; if not, it will be based on the BackoffEntry and any Retry-After header received.)

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadDuration
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between starting and finishing a Domain Reliability upload.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadFailover
histogram.summary: Whether a Domain Reliability upload was sent to a collector other than the first one listed in the config. (This only happens when an upload to the first collector fails.)

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadInterval
DomainReliability.UploadIntervalGlobal
DomainReliability.UploadLatency
histogram.summary: The time from the first beacon in a Domain Reliability upload being recorded and that upload completing successfully. (Note that if some beacons are never uploaded successfully, they will not feature in this histogram at all.)

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadNetError
histogram.summary: The network error code (or OK if none) returned by the URLFetcher when a Domain Reliability report is uploaded.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadResponseCode
histogram.summary: The HTTP response code returned by the Domain Reliability collector when a report is uploaded.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether a Domain Reliability upload succeeded.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.BarCloseButtonUsage
histogram.summary: Records if the close button was used before or after opening and viewing Reader Mode content.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.DistillabilityRejection
histogram.summary: The reason to reject distillability at PageDistillableAfterParsing time.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.DistillabilityScoreNMF.Negative
histogram.summary: Score of distillability from AdaBoost model, non-mobile-friendly only. The score shown here is multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.DistillabilityScoreNMF.Positive
histogram.summary: Score of distillability from AdaBoost model, non-mobile-friendly only. The score shown here is multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.DistillationQuality
histogram.summary: Whether the perceived quality of the distillation of a web page was good.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.LongArticleScoreNMF.Negative
histogram.summary: Score of long article from AdaBoost model, distillable and non-mobile-friendly only. The score shown here is multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.LongArticleScoreNMF.Positive
histogram.summary: Score of long article from AdaBoost model, distillable and non-mobile-friendly only. The score shown here is multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.PageDistillable
histogram.obsolete: PageDistillableAfterLoading and PageDistillableAfterParsing provide more details since 02/2016.
histogram.summary: Records the "Distillable Type" (not distillable, mobile-friendly distillable, non-mobile-friendly distillable, etc) for each analyzed page.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.PageDistillableAfterLoading
histogram.summary: Records the "Distillable Type" (mobile-friendly not distillable, mobile-friendly distillable, non-mobile-friendly not distillable, non-mobile-friendly distillable) for each analyzed page after loading.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.PageDistillableAfterParsing
histogram.summary: Records the "Distillable Type" (mobile-friendly not distillable, mobile-friendly distillable, non-mobile-friendly not distillable, non-mobile-friendly distillable) for each analyzed page after parsing.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.PageDistilledType
histogram.summary: Records the "Distillable Type" (not distillable, mobile-friendly distillable, non-mobile-friendly distillable, etc) for each distilled page.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.PageHasDistilledData
histogram.summary: Records whether a page has distilled data.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.ReaderShownForPageLoad
histogram.summary: Records if the panel became visible at any point after a page was navigated.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Statistics.FirstPageWordCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of words in a distilled page. This only records the first page of a multi-page article.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Statistics.WordCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of words in a distilled page. For articles with multiple pages, each page is counted separately.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.ArticleProcessing
histogram.summary: Time spent in DomDistiller's identification of text content.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.DistillationTotal
histogram.summary: Complete time spent in DomDistiller's processing of a page.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.DistillPage
histogram.summary: Time spent in DistillPageImpl(), mostly ExecuteJavaScript(), including compilation and execution.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.DocumentConstruction
histogram.summary: Time spent in creating DomDistiller's internal representation of the HTML document.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.Formatting
histogram.summary: Time spent in DomDistiller's final processing of article content/formatting.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.MarkupParsing
histogram.summary: Time spent in DomDistiller's processing of article metadata.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.RunJavaScript
histogram.summary: Time spent in ExecuteJavaScript() in DomDistiller. It includes JavaScript code transmission through IPC, parsing, compilation, execution, and returning the JSON back through IPC.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.SwipeToPaint
histogram.summary: Records the time from a swipe-up gesture on ReaderModePanel to the first paint of the empty template.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.ViewerLoading
histogram.summary: Records the time from the Reader Mode panel opening to the viewer loaded.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.Time.ViewingReaderModePanel
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time between the Reader Mode panel opening and it closing or returning to the peeking state.

histogram.name: DOMStorage.clear
histogram.summary: Duration to execute localStorage.clear() or sessionStorage.clear().

histogram.name: DOMStorage.getItem
histogram.summary: Duration to execute localStorage.getItem() or sessionStorage.getItem().

histogram.name: DOMStorage.key
histogram.summary: Duration to execute localStorage.key() or sessionStorage.key().

histogram.name: DOMStorage.length
histogram.summary: Duration to execute localStorage.length() or sessionStorage.length().

histogram.name: DOMStorage.removeItem
histogram.summary: Duration to execute localStorage.removeItem() or sessionStorage.removeItem().

histogram.name: DOMStorage.setItem
histogram.summary: Duration to execute localStorage.setItem() or sessionStorage.setItem().

histogram.name: Doodle.ConfigDownloadOutcome
histogram.summary: Outcome of downloading the Doodle config.

histogram.name: Doodle.ConfigDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the Doodle config. Recorded only if the download succeeded and the received data was parsed without errors.

histogram.name: Download.AcceptRangesBytes.KBytes
histogram.summary: The length of downloads for serves that accept byte ranges.

histogram.name: Download.AcceptRangesMissingOrInvalid.KBytes
histogram.summary: The length of downloads for serves that do not specify whether the accept ranges, or have invalid ranges specified.

histogram.name: Download.AcceptRangesNone.KBytes
histogram.summary: The length of downloads for serves that do not accept ranges.

histogram.name: Download.ActualBandwidth
histogram.summary: The actual bandwidth (per read) of a download.

histogram.name: Download.ApiFunctions
histogram.summary: Downloads extension API function calls.

histogram.name: Download.AttachmentServices.Duration
histogram.summary: Time taken to invoke IAttachmentExecute::Save() excluding the time taken to instantiate CLSID_AttachmentServices.

histogram.name: Download.AttachmentServices.Result
histogram.summary: Result of invoking (or attempting to invoke) Windows Attachment Services API via IAttachmentExecute::Save().

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthDiskBytesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Disk bandwidth (defined as total bytes divided by the amount of time blocked on write or close on the file descriptor) seen for a single download.

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthOverallBytesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Overall bandwidth seen for the download. Note that this is measured at the point at which the file is written, and so will not take into account the time costs of activities that occur after file write is completed (e.g. safe browsing scanning).

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthUsed
histogram.summary: The percentage of the potential bandwidth actually used (per read) of a download. An entry of 100% implies that Chrome was the limiting factor in download speed.

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthWithoutParallelStreamsBytesPerSecond
histogram.summary: For parallel downloading, average disk bandwidth seen when only 1 stream is actively downloading the content. Other streams may have already finished, or have not been created yet. If a download was ever paused, this is not recorded.

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthWithParallelStreamsBytesPerSecond
histogram.summary: For parallel downloading, average disk bandwidth seen when parallel streams are downloading the content. If a download was ever paused, this is not recorded.

histogram.name: Download.ClearAllSize
histogram.summary: The number of downloads in history at the time it is cleared.

histogram.name: Download.ContentDisposition
histogram.summary: Content-Disposition header features. The presence of a Content-Disposition header, use of 'filename' and 'filename*' parameters, and string encoding schemes are counted for each unthrottled download. The total number downloads is Download.Counts[5] (Initiated and Unthrottled).

histogram.name: Download.ContentImageType
histogram.summary: Types of images that are downloaded.

histogram.name: Download.ContentType
histogram.summary: Content types that are downloaded.

histogram.name: Download.Counts
histogram.summary: Various individual counts in the download system; see DownloadCountType for details.

histogram.name: Download.CountsChrome
histogram.summary: Various individual counts in the download system, for example the number of downloads blocked by throttling from the DownloadRequestLimiter.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousDownloadValidated
histogram.summary: User chose to save a download which was marked dangerous. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousFile.DangerousDownloadValidated
histogram.summary: User chose to save a download which was marked DANGEROUS_FILE. Grouped by the type of file.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousFile.Discard
histogram.summary: A download which was marked DANGEROUS_FILE was discarded without the user directly choosing, because the browser was closed. Grouped by the file extension.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousFile.Reason
histogram.summary: Indicates why a download is marked as DANGEROUS_FILE. Grouped by reason, such as Safe Browsing (SB) service is not available, and SB returns UNKOWN or SAFE verdict. The sum of all reasons should roughly equal to the DANGEROUS_FILE bucket count in Download.DownloadWarningShown.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousFile.UserDiscard
histogram.summary: User chose to discard a download which was marked DANGEROUS_FILE. Grouped by the file extension.

histogram.name: Download.Database.CreateDownloadDuration
histogram.summary: Time taken to create a single download in the history DB.

histogram.name: Download.Database.QueryDownloadDuration
histogram.summary: Time taken to query all downloads from history DB.

histogram.name: Download.Database.UpdateDownloadDuration
histogram.summary: Time taken to update a single download in the history DB.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseDownloadExistsForDownloadSlice
histogram.summary: Whether a download can be found for a download slice in the DB. This histogram is recorded for each download slice row every time the database is loaded.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRecordDropped
histogram.summary: Reason for dropping a record read in from the DB.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRemoveDownloadsCount
histogram.summary: Number of downloads removed from the history at once.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRemoveDownloadsTime
histogram.summary: How long it took to delete a batch of downloads from history.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRemoveDownloadsTimePerRecord
histogram.summary: How long it took to delete some downloads from history, per download.

histogram.name: Download.Discard
histogram.summary: A download which was marked dangerous was discarded without the user directly choosing, because the browser was closed. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.DiskBandwidthUsedPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the available disk bandwidth that was used by the download. 100% indicates that the disk bandwidth was the limiting factor for the download.

histogram.name: Download.DOMEvent
histogram.summary: User actions in chrome://downloads

histogram.name: Download.DownloadDangerPrompt
histogram.summary: Records when user is shown the download danger prompt while attempting to recover a blocked download from chrome://downloads, grouped by the type of file.

histogram.name: Download.DownloadSize
histogram.summary: The size of successfully completed downloads.

histogram.name: Download.DownloadWarningShown
histogram.summary: A download warning was shown in the shelf. Note that some downloads may not be shown on the shelf, e.g., if chrome://downloads is already open when the download completes, or if an extension is using the downloads API. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.EstimatedTimeSavedWithParallelDownload
histogram.summary: Estimated time saved on a download when parallel downloading is enabled. To estimate this, the time spent on a download is classified into two categories. The fist category has only one stream active, while other streams are either finished, not started, or failed. And the second category has multiple streams active. By calculating the average bandwidth during the first category, a rough estimation on the time it will save is obtained by assuming all the bytes downloaded during the second category are downloaded by only one stream. If a download is ever paused, this is not recorded.

histogram.name: Download.EstimatedTimeWastedWithParallelDownload
histogram.summary: Similar to Download.EstimatedTimeSavedWithParallelDownload, but this estimates the time wasted on a download when parallel downloading is enabled.

histogram.name: Download.FeedbackDialogEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether the user enables dangerous download feedback reporting after viewing the opt-in dialog.

histogram.name: Download.FilePickerResult
histogram.summary: How the user interacts with the file chooser when doing a "Save As" for non-full-page saves.

histogram.name: Download.FileThreadBlockedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time in milliseconds the file thread blocks for each set of buffers drained from the incoming pipe (ms).

histogram.name: Download.FileThreadReceiveBuffers
histogram.summary: The number of buffers in a call to DownloadManager::UpdateDownload.

histogram.name: Download.FirstOpenTime
histogram.summary: The time between a download completing and the file being opened for the first time.

histogram.name: Download.HistorySize
histogram.summary: The number of items in the History database, at the time a new download is recorded.

histogram.name: Download.HistorySize2
histogram.summary: The number of items in the History database, at the time a new download is recorded. Higher maximum, more buckets than Download.HistorySize.

histogram.name: Download.HttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: The count of HTTP Response codes for download requests.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedAtEndError
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that caused a download to be interrupted at the *end* of a download (when the number of bytes is known). This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedAtEndReason
histogram.summary: The reason that a download was interrupted at the *end* of a download (when the number of bytes is known). This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedError
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that caused a download to be interrupted.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedOverrunBytes
histogram.summary: The total number of bytes minus the received number of bytes at the time that a download is interrupted. This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedReason
histogram.summary: The reason that a download was interrupted.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedReceivedSizeK
histogram.summary: The number of kilobytes received for a download at the time it is interrupted.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedTotalSizeK
histogram.summary: The reported total size in kilobytes for a download at the time it is interrupted. This is essentially the size reported by the Content-Length header. If no size is specified up-front, it is not recorded in the histogram. For example, a download transferred with chunked encoding will not be recorded.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedUnderrunBytes
histogram.summary: The excessive number of bytes which have been received at the time that a download is interrupted. This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedUnknownSize
histogram.summary: True if the size of an interrupted download is unknown, false if it is known.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadPassKitResult
histogram.summary: Result when a user attempts to download a PassKit file on iOS with WKWebView.

histogram.name: Download.MaliciousDownloadClassified
histogram.summary: A download has been marked as malicious. Grouped by the type of danger. Each download can only be recorded once; it will be labeled with the first type of danger spotted.

histogram.name: Download.MapErrorNetworkFailed
histogram.summary: Network error that produced a DOWNLOAD_INTERRUPT_REASON_NETWORK_FAILED result in DownloadResourceHandler::OnResponseCompleted().

histogram.name: Download.MapWinShErrorAccessDenied
histogram.summary: Windows error that produced a DOWNLOAD_INTERRUPT_REASON_ACCESS_DENIED result in MapShFileOperationCodes().

histogram.name: Download.MapWinShErrorFileFailed
histogram.summary: Windows error that produced a DOWNLOAD_INTERRUPT_REASON_FILE_FAILED result in MapShFileOperationCodes().

histogram.name: Download.MapWinShErrorTransientError
histogram.summary: Windows error that produced a DOWNLOAD_INTERRUPT_REASON_FILE_TRANSIENT_ERROR result in MapShFileOperationCodes().

histogram.name: Download.OnChanged
histogram.summary: Percentage of DownloadItem::Observer::OnDownloadUpdated events that signified a change in the extension API representation of the download.

histogram.name: Download.OpenMethod
histogram.summary: Invocation count for methods of opening a download. For some file types, Chrome defaults to opening the file in the browser instead of invoking the system handler. The user has the option of overriding this behavior.

histogram.name: Download.OpensOutstanding
histogram.summary: The number of unopened downloads, when one is opened.

histogram.name: Download.OpenTime
histogram.summary: The time between a download completing and the file being opened.

histogram.name: Download.OriginStateOnFullResumption
histogram.summary: Changes observed when a response is received for a full download resumption request.

histogram.name: Download.OriginStateOnPartialResumption
histogram.summary: Changes observed when a response is received for a partial (byte-range) download resumption request.

histogram.name: Download.PageTransition
histogram.summary: The core page transition type for navigation initiated downloads. Not recorded for programmatic downloads. This metric is recorded when the response headers were received and processed for a download. The number of samples here should correspond to Download.Counts[8] (Started) - (programmatic downloads that don't have a page transition type).

histogram.name: Download.ParallelDownload.BandwidthRatioPercentage
histogram.summary: Records the ratio of parallel streams bandwidth to single stream bandwidth in parallel download.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelDownload.CreationEvent
histogram.summary: When parallel downloading feature is enabled, a download may be created as parallel download or fall back to normal download based on various factors. Records the total number of parallel and non-parallel downloads created when parallel downloading feature is enabled. Also records the reason why a parallel download falls back to normal download. The reasons are not mutually exclusive.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelDownload.RemainingTimeWhenBuildingRequests
histogram.summary: Records the remaining download time when building parallel requests.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelDownload.TotalTimeRatioPercentage
histogram.summary: Records the ratio of the actual total time of the download to the total time without parallel streams. The total time without parallel streams is calculated as the size of the file divided by the single stream bandwidth.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelDownloadAddStreamSuccess
histogram.summary: Records if the byte stream reader of a subsequent request is successfully added to the download sink.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelDownloadRequestCount
histogram.summary: The total number of requests sent for a parallel download, including the initial request.

histogram.name: Download.Parallelizable.DownloadTime
histogram.summary: The download time for a parallelizable download.

histogram.name: Download.Parallelizable.FileSize
histogram.summary: The download size of a parallelizable download.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelizableDownloadBandwidth
histogram.summary: For parallelizable download, average disk bandwidth seen for different settings. If a download was ever paused, this is not recorded.

histogram.name: Download.PotentialBandwidth
histogram.summary: The maximum bandwidth (per read) that Chrome could have provided for the download. If the actual bandwidth equals the potential bandwidth, that means that Chrome was the limiting factor for download bandwidth.

histogram.name: Download.ResourceHandlerBlockedPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the lifetime of the DownloadResourceHandler for which it was blocked by downstream flow control. 0% indicates that the network bandwidth was the limiting factor for the download.

histogram.name: Download.ResultsRenderedTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to load the downloads Web UI and render (at least) a screen full of items. This is roughly equivalent to 'time to first meaningful paint' for the downloads page.

histogram.name: Download.SavePackage
histogram.summary: Events (e.g. Started, Cancelled, Finished, Write to Completed file, Write to Failed file) occuring within the state machine of a SavePackage operation.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfInProgressSizeOnAutoClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items in progress on the shelf when it closes automatically.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfInProgressSizeOnUserClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items in progress on the shelf when the user closes it.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfSizeOnAutoClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items on the shelf when it closes automatically.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfSizeOnUserClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items on the shelf when the user closes it.

histogram.name: Download.ShowDangerousDownloadConfirmationPrompt
histogram.summary: User saw the confirm prompt to save a download which was marked dangerous. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.Sources
histogram.summary: The initiation source (if initiated within the content layer of chrome) for a download.

histogram.name: Download.SourcesChrome
histogram.summary: The initiation source (if initiated within the above-content layer of chrome) for a download.

histogram.name: Download.Start.ContentType
histogram.summary: Content types of the downloads.

histogram.name: Download.Start.ContentType.NormalProfile
histogram.summary: Content types of the downloads that are started in non-incognito profile.

histogram.name: Download.TargetConnectionSecurity
histogram.summary: The connection security state of a download, indicating whether its final resolved url and the redirects before final url are secure.

histogram.name: Download.Time
histogram.summary: Time between the start of a download and its completion.

histogram.name: Download.TimeToRenameFailureAfterInitialFailure
histogram.summary: Time elapsed until a retried download file rename operation failed for the last time after the initial rename failed.

histogram.name: Download.TimeToRenameSuccessAfterInitialFailure
histogram.summary: Time elapsed until a retried download file rename operation succeeded after the initial rename failed.

histogram.name: Download.UserDiscard
histogram.summary: User chose to discard a download which was marked dangerous. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.WriteLoopCount
histogram.summary: The number of iterations for the write loop in BaseFile::AppendDataTofile().

histogram.name: Download.WriteSize
histogram.summary: The write size for calls to BaseFile::AppendDataTofile().

histogram.name: Drive.BatchUploadResponseCode
histogram.summary: Respose code of batch upload request.

histogram.name: Drive.CacheDBOpenStatus
histogram.summary: Status of drive cache metadata database open.

histogram.name: Drive.DirectoryFeedLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the list of files in a single directory from Google Drive server.

histogram.name: Drive.DownloadFromDriveFileSize
histogram.summary: Sizes of files being downloaded from Drive. Temporary histogram for gathering data for http://crbug.com/229650.

histogram.name: Drive.EntireFeedLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2013 due to the UMA stat bucket layout change. We'll use Drive.FullFeedLoadTime instead.
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the entire file system information from the server

histogram.name: Drive.EntryKind
histogram.summary: Provides breakdown of specific formats for hosted documents. Recorded when feed is loaded from the server.

histogram.name: Drive.FileFormat
histogram.summary: Provides breakdown of specific file formats for regular files. Recorded when feed is loaded from the server.

histogram.name: Drive.FilesListRequestRunner.ApiErrorCode
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by the Drive API for files list requests executed via the FilesListRequestRunner class.

histogram.name: Drive.FilesListRequestRunner.MaxResults
histogram.summary: Maximum number of results for each files list request using the Drive API.

histogram.name: Drive.FullFeedLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the entire file system information from the server

histogram.name: Drive.InitialFeedLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Deperecated 12/2013 since it did not record meaningful information. Drive.DirectoryFeedLoadTime should be checked for measuring the time until the user sees the first response of file lists.
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the initial part of the file system information from the server

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBInitResult
histogram.summary: Result of drive resource metadata database initialization.

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBOpenExistingResult
histogram.summary: Result of attempt to open existing drive resource metadata database.

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBValidityCheckFailureReason
histogram.summary: Reason of drive resource metadata database validity check failure. Recorded when the validity check fails during Drive metadata initialization triggered by profile initialization.

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBVersionBeforeUpgradeCheck
histogram.summary: Version number of drive resource metadata DB found on the disk before checking whether it should be upgraded. Recorded during Drive metadata initialization triggered by profile initialization.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfCacheFilesRecoveredAfterDBCorruption
histogram.summary: Number of files recovered from Drive cache directory. Recorded when file recovery takes place after metadata DB corruption is found during metadata DB initialization.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfHostedDocuments
histogram.summary: Number of hosted documents (spreadsheets etc.) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfRegularFiles
histogram.summary: Number of regualr files on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfTotalFiles
histogram.summary: Number of total files (regualr files + hosted documents) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Drive.PushNotificationInitiallyEnabled
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the push notification is initially enabled for Drive. Recorded when the first notification is processed. Notification is emulated by polling if the push notication is disabled.

histogram.name: Drive.PushNotificationRegistered
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the push notification request is registered correctly for Drive. Recorded when the push notification manager is initialized.

histogram.name: Drive.SearchMetadataTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to perform an incremental search for auto completion of files on Drive. This time is collected for every partial query the user types for auto completion. For instance, if the user types "faq", incremental searches are performed for "f", "fa", and "faq" respectively.

histogram.name: Drive.TotalFileCountInBatchUpload
histogram.summary: Total file count contained in a drive batch upload request.

histogram.name: Drive.TotalFileSizeInBatchUpload
histogram.summary: Total file size contained in a drive batch upload request.

histogram.name: Drive.TransferBlockedOnJobs
histogram.summary: Number of jobs which have to be completed before a newly added download or download from or to Drive is requested. Temporary histogram for gathering data for http://crbug.com/229650.

histogram.name: Drive.UploadProtocol
histogram.summary: Upload protocol for each file. e.g. Batch upload including 5 files triggers the metric 5 times.

histogram.name: Drive.UploadToDriveFileSize
histogram.summary: Sizes of files being uploaded to Drive. Temporary histogram for gathering data for http://crbug.com/229650.

histogram.name: DriveOffline.CrosAutoEnableOutcome
histogram.summary: Outcome of enabling Google Drive offline mode automatically when a user first logs into a Chrome OS device. This process involves opening a hidden web page in the context of the Google Drive hosted app to perform the initialization of offline mode.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.AuthenticationSuccess
histogram.summary: When Easy Unlock attempts to authenticate the secure connection between a Chromebook (or other Chrome device) and an Android phone, whether the authentication succeeded.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.AuthEvent.DidUserManuallyUnlockPhone
histogram.summary: Upon a successful Smart Lock unlock or signin, records whether the user's phone was locked during any point while the lock screen was up. This can be used to get a sense for whether users are using Smart Lock for Chromebook without something like Smart Lock for Android to keep their phones unlocked.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.AuthEvent.SignIn
histogram.summary: Measures the use of Smart Lock on the sign-in screen: records whether a Smart Lock login succeeded or failed; or if a password fallback was used, the reason why. Recorded upon a login attempt for users who have the Smart Lock feature enabled.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.AuthEvent.SignIn.Duration
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between the user focusing their user pod and signing in using Smart Lock.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.AuthEvent.Unlock
histogram.summary: Measures the use of Smart Lock on the lock screen: records whether a Smart Lock unlock attempt succeeded or failed; or if a password fallback was used, the reason why. Recorded upon an unlock attempt for users who have the Smart Lock feature enabled.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.AuthEvent.Unlock.Duration
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between the lock screen being shown and the user unlocking the device using Smart Lock. The lock screen is typically shown when the user opens their Chromebook's lid (or otherwise wakes the computer), but can also be shown when the user manually locks the device.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.AuthProximity.RemoteDeviceModelHash
histogram.summary: The hash of the phone model used to successfully sign in or unlock using Smart Lock.
histogram.details: This hash is calculated by taking the first 4 bytes of the MD5 hash of the device model.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.AuthProximity.RollingRssi
histogram.summary: Measures the exponentially weighted rolling average of the received signal strength indicator (RSSI) of the phone when the user successfully unlocks or signs in using Smart Lock.
histogram.details:
The exponentially weighted averaging formula is:
rollingRssi = (1 - weight) * rollingRssi + weight * currentRssi;
RSSI readings are inherently noisy, so this averaging gives a smoothed RSSI value to work with as a heuristic for proximity.
If no RSSI was read, then a sentinel value of 127 will be recorded.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.AuthProximity.TimeSinceLastZeroRssi
histogram.summary: Measures the time delta in milliseconds since the last zero RSSI value was read to when the user successfully unlocks or signs in using Smart Lock.
histogram.details:
A zero RSSI value is special because both Bluetooth devices in a connection attempt to maintain by adjusting their transmit power levels. This time delta can be used as a possible heuristic to determine that the phone is close to the local device.
If no RSSI was read, then an overflow value will be recorded.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.AuthProximity.TransmitPowerDelta
histogram.summary: Measures the difference between the current transmit power and the maximum transmit power of the local device when the user successfully unlocks or signs in using Smart Lock.
histogram.details:
Devices connected using classic Bluetooth adjust their transmit power dynamically to optimize power and signal strength. The difference between the current transmit power and maximum transmit power can be used as a heurstic to determine if the phone is close to the local device.
According to the Bluetooth specs, there are three classes of devices, with a maximum transmit power of 20, 4, and 0 dBm respectively.
If no transmit power was read, then a sentinel value of 127 will be recorded.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.BluetoothAvailability
histogram.summary: Reports the type of Bluetooth adapter present in the device.
histogram.details:
Statistics about what Bluetooth capabilities are available will determine how the EasyUnlock feature gets developed and deployed across platforms.
This value is logged only once during the lifetime of the Chrome process, shortly after it starts up. If a Bluetooth USB adapter is inserted after that point, the change will not be registered until Chrome restarts.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.ClickedButton
histogram.summary: Button clicked in EasyUnlock app during setup process.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.NotificationEvent
histogram.summary: Tracks events related to notifications used by EasyUnlock feature. For example a specific EasyUnlock notification being shown or clicked.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.RemoteLockScreenState
histogram.summary: Whether a lock screen and a trust agent are enabled on the remote device (Android phone) for Easy Unlock. Recorded once per status update message from the remote device. A status update message is expected to be sent once when the secure channel between the local and the remote device is established, and also each time the user-presence status changes on the remote side.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.Setup.Devices.Count.Eligible
histogram.summary: The number of eligible devices that the CryptAuth server returns during the Smart Lock setup flow.
histogram.details: Note that a single user might report multiple values, for example if they try to complete the setup flow with a device in airplane mode, and then try again taking the device out of airplane mode.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.Setup.Devices.Count.Ineligible
histogram.summary: The number of ineligible devices that the CryptAuth server returns during the Smart Lock setup flow.
histogram.details: Note that a single user might report multiple values, for example if they try to complete the setup flow with a device in airplane mode, and then try again taking the device out of airplane mode.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.Setup.Devices.HasSecureScreenLock
histogram.summary: Whether the user's phone has a secure screen lock installed. Recorded during Smart Lock setup, when the user's phone first connects to the Chromebook.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.Setup.Devices.HasTrustAgentEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether the user's phone has a trust agent -- e.g. Smart Lock for Android -- enabled. Recorded during Smart Lock (for Chrome) setup, when the user's phone first connects to the Chromebook.
histogram.details: Note that this histogram tracks whether the setting under Settings ~> Security ~> Trust agents ~> Smart Lock (Google) (or any other trust agent) is enabled. The Smart Lock trust agent is enabled by default for users who have ascure lock screen. This metric does _not_ measure whether users have any Smart Lock trustlets enabled.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.Setup.Devices.IneligibilityReason
histogram.summary: Records the most actionable reason why none of a user's devices were eligible as unlock keys for Smart Lock. This is recorded during the Smart Lock setup flow, only if the CryptAuth server returns no eligible devices for the user.
histogram.details: To be precise, this metric tracks the _least_ actionable _reason_ why the _most_ actionable _device_ is not eligible as an unlock key. For example, suppose that the user has 10 ineligible devices returned. This metric tries to identify the most likely candidate device for use as a Smart Lock key, and then records the most confounding reason why that device is still not eligible to be used as an unlock key.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.Setup.PromoNotificationEvent
histogram.summary: Measures user interactions with the Smart Lock promo notification.
histogram.details: Due to technical limitations of the implementation, it is hard to track precisely which users opened the setup app as a result of interacting with the promo notification. This metric measures setup app interactions from all users who click on the promo notification, and subsequently launch the setup app.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.SetupStateOnClose
histogram.summary: The state of EasyUnlock setup when the app window was closed by user.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.SignIn.LoginEvent
histogram.summary: Measures the use of Easy sign-in: records whether an Easy sign-in login succeeded or failed; or if a password fallback was used, the reason why. Recorded upon a login attempt for users who have the Easy sign-in feature enabled.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.StartupTimeFromSuspend
histogram.summary: The time it takes after resuming from a suspended state (ie. opening the Chromebook lid) to when a remote device is connected and a request is made. Note that it is possible for the remote device not to be present when resuming from suspend, and the device may be connected at a later time. Therefore, large values for this metric may not be too meaningful due to meddling users.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.TrialRun.Events
histogram.summary: Records when the Easy Unlock trial run is launched, and when the user attempts to click on the lock icon during the trial run.
histogram.details: If a user clicks on the lock icon more than once, then the "clicked lock icon" event counter will be incremented more than once as well. Hence, the "user count" data shows how many users ever clicked on the lock icon during the trial run. From the raw (non-"user count") data, we can also see whether users click on the icon multiple times.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.UnlockEvent
histogram.summary: Screen unlock events detected while EasyUnlock was enabled.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.ExistingProcessAllocation
histogram.summary: The time taken to allocate a process to start the EmbeddedWorkerInstance. Recorded when an existing process was used.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.NewProcessAllocation
histogram.summary: The time taken to allocate a process to start the EmbeddedWorkerInstance. Recorded when a new process was created.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.ProcessAllocation
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 05/2015. Replaced by EmbeddedWorkerInstance.NewProcessAllocation and EmbeddedWorkerInstance.ExistingProcessAllocation.
histogram.summary: The time taken to allocate a process to start the EmbeddedWorkerInstance.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.ProcessCreated
histogram.summary: Whether a new renderer process was created for the EmbeddedWorkerInstance or existing one was used. Only recorded for installed workers.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.ScriptEvaluate
histogram.summary: The time taken to evaluate the script to start the EmbeddedWorkerInstance.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.ScriptLoadWithNetworkAccess
histogram.summary: The time taken to load the script file for the EmbeddedWorkerInstance with network access.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.ScriptLoadWithoutNetworkAccess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2016. Replaced by EmbeddedWorkerInstance.Start.TimeToLoad_HttpCache and EmbeddedWorkerInstance.Start.TimeToLoad_InstalledScript.
histogram.summary: The time taken to load the script file for the EmbeddedWorkerInstance without network access.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.Start.TimeToEvaluateScript
histogram.summary: The time taken for initial evaluation of the service worker script. Specifically, the time between ACK from the renderer that the thread started and ACK that the script evaluation finished. Only recorded for installed workers.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.Start.TimeToLoad.HttpCache
histogram.summary: The time taken to load a new (not installed) service worker, when it came from the HTTP cache.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.Start.TimeToLoad.InstalledScript
histogram.summary: The time taken to load an installed service worker.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.Start.TimeToLoad.Network
histogram.summary: The time taken to load a new (not installed) service worker, when it came from the network.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.Start.TimeToSendStartWorker
histogram.summary: The time taken between deciding to start a worker and sending the start worker IPC. Only recorded for installed workers.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.Start.TimeToStartThread
histogram.summary: The time taken to start the service worker thread. Specifically, the time between ACK from the renderer that load finished and ACK that the thread started. Does not include script evaluation time. Only recorded for installed workers.

histogram.name: EmbeddedWorkerInstance.Start.TimeToURLJob
histogram.summary: The round-trip time between asking the renderer process to start a worker and receiving the corresponding resource request. Only recorded for installed workers.

histogram.name: EnhancedBookmarks.AllBookmarksCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 4/2016 after we no longer show "all bookamrks" in bookmark manager.
histogram.summary: Number of bookmarks the user has. Android only.

histogram.name: EnhancedBookmarks.SyncExperimentState
histogram.obsolete: Removed 3/2015 along with the enhanced bookmarks sync experiment.
histogram.summary: Captures the state the enhanced bookmark experiment is in. Recorded on startup. To be removed once the enhanced bookmark experiment is finished. see crbug/323423.

histogram.name: EnhancedBookmarks.ViewMode
histogram.obsolete: Removed 9/2015 after list view became the only view mode.
histogram.summary: Record which Enhanced Bookmark UI mode users are in. This will be recorded everytime the user opens the bookmark manager UI.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AppRestrictionLoadTime
histogram.summary: Android Only - Time to load the App Restrictions from the O.S..

histogram.name: Enterprise.AppRestrictionsCacheLoad
histogram.summary: Android Only - Whether Chrome was able to read and decode the AppRestrictions policy cache on startup.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AttributesTPMConsistency
histogram.summary: Consistency between TPM lock state and absence/presence of install attributes at boot.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentExtraTime
histogram.summary: Time since the user logged in until the auto-enrollment protocol completed. 0 is sampled when the protocol is done by the time the user logs in.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentProtocolTime
histogram.summary: Total duration time of the auto-enrollment protocol.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentRequestNetworkErrorCode
histogram.summary: Network error code (if applicable) for auto-enrollment requests.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentRequestStatus
histogram.summary: URL fetcher status for auto-enrollment requests.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DevicePolicyInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting device policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DevicePolicyRefresh
histogram.summary: Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing device policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DMServerRequestSuccess
histogram.summary: Number of retries the client did to execute a DeviceManagementServer request. It's recorded after the request has been completed, either successfully after 0 or more retries, with a failure (too many retries or non-retriable error) or with a server error.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DMToken
histogram.summary: Events related to fetching, saving and loading DM server tokens. These are used to retrieve cloud policies.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DomainWhitelistRegexFailure
histogram.summary: Temporary metric tracking which regex caused an icu::RegexMatcher initialization failure, to help figure out the cause of http://crbug.com/365351 which we can't repro locally.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DomainWhitelistRegexFailureStatus
histogram.summary: Temporary metric tracking the type of an icu::RegexMatcher initialization failure, to help figure out the cause of http://crbug.com/365351 which we can't repro locally.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DomainWhitelistRegexSuccess
histogram.summary: Temporary metric tracking the success of icu::RegexMatcher IcuMatcher initialization, to help figure out the cause of http://crbug.com/365351.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrolledPolicyHasDMToken
histogram.summary: Whether loading of device policy from file on an enterprise-enrolled (checked against install_attributes.pb) Chrome OS device yields an enterprise policy with a DM token. Filled once during session startup, after first successful device policy read.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Enrollment
histogram.summary: Events related to device enrollment on new installs of Chrome OS devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForced
histogram.summary: Events related to forced re-enrollment (FRE) of Chrome OS devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentRecovery
histogram.summary: Events related to Chrome OS enterprise enrollment recovery. Note that this only covers cases in which prior to recovery, the "private owner" of the device had UMA stats enabled.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTime.Cancel
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from *after* GAIA login until enrollment was cancelled.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTime.Failure
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from *after* GAIA login until enrollment failed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTime.Success
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from *after* GAIA login until enrollment succeeded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.IOSPolicies
histogram.summary: Number of policies loaded at startup on iOS, and when a change is detected at runtime.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ONC.PolicyValidation
histogram.summary: Result of the OpenNetworkConfiguration policy validation.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies
histogram.summary: A set of enterprise policy rules that are in use. This is recorded every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was earlier than a day before.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policy
histogram.summary: Events related to fetching, saving and loading user policies, and also device policies on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyHasVerifiedCachedKey
histogram.summary: Boolean tracking whether there is a valid policy signing key on disk.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting user policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyInvalidationsStartupTime
histogram.summary: Time since startup of the cloud policy code until the policy invalidation service first reported its online status.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyKeyVerification
histogram.summary: Tracking the results of policy key verification.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyLoadStatus
histogram.summary: Load status from the policy loaders which pull policy settings from the underlying platform, such as Windows Group Policy.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyRefresh
histogram.summary: Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing user policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PublicSession.SessionLength
histogram.summary: A public session starts when a user signs in using the policy configured public account. It stops when the user signs out. Session length is the duration between the start and stop events. It is recorded during signing out and reported on the next chrome run. This metric tracks the recorded session length rounded down to the nearest 10-minute bucket and capped at 24 hours.

histogram.name: Enterprise.RegularUserSession.SessionLength
histogram.summary: A regular user session starts when a user signs in using his/her user account. It stops when the user signs out. Session length is the duration between the start and stop events. It is recorded during signing out and reported on the next chrome run. This metric tracks the recorded session length on an enrolled device rouned down to the nearest 10-minute bucket and capped at 24 hours.

histogram.name: Enterprise.RetrievePolicyResponse
histogram.summary: On Chrome OS, the response obtained to retrieve policy request.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemLogPIILeak
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 01/2016.
histogram.summary: Events for counting sensitive data occurrences in system logs to upload. (Email addresses, IP addresses, SSIDs, URLs). The lines with this data will be removed before upload.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UploadJobSuccess
histogram.summary: Number of retries the client did to execute an UploadJob. It's recorded after the request has been completed, either successfully after 0 or more retries, with a failure because of too many retries or if the UploadJob is interrupted (destroyed before it could succeed or fail).

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserCloudPolicyStore.LoadStatus
histogram.summary: Result of the attempted policy load during profile initialization.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserCloudPolicyStore.LoadValidationStatus
histogram.summary: Result of validating the policy that has just been loaded from disk.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserCloudPolicyStore.StoreValidationStatus
histogram.summary: Result of validating the policy sent down from the server, before writing to disk.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.DelayInitialization
histogram.summary: Initialization delay due to loading the user policy cache.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.ClientError
histogram.summary: Policy client error during initial policy fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayClientRegister
histogram.summary: Delay for registering the client with the policy server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayOAuth2Token
histogram.summary: Delay for minting an OAuth2 acccess token.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayPolicyFetch
histogram.summary: Delay for fetching policy from the policy server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayTotal
histogram.summary: Total delay for the initial policy fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.OAuth2Error
histogram.summary: Service error during OAuth2 access token fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.OAuth2NetworkError
histogram.summary: Network error during OAuth2 access token fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyValidationFailure
histogram.summary: Source of policy validation errors on ChromeOS.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyValidationLoadStatus
histogram.summary: Validation result when loading user policy from the policy store.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyValidationStoreStatus
histogram.summary: Validation result when writing user policy to the policy store.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserSession.Logins
histogram.summary: Tracks the sign-in events on an enrolled device.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserSigninChoice
histogram.summary: Choice the user made when presented with enterprise signin dialog.

histogram.name: Enterprise.VpdCheck
histogram.summary: The status code (exit code or signal) from sanity check of RW_VPD read and matching the contents with data from dump_vpd_log (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Enterprise.VpdUpdateStatus
histogram.summary: The status code (exit code or signal) from VPD update operation (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Enterprise.WildcardLoginCheck.DelayPolicyTokenFetch
histogram.summary: Delay incurred by the token fetching step of the wildcard login check.

histogram.name: Enterprise.WildcardLoginCheck.DelayTotal
histogram.summary: Total delay incurred by the wildcard login check.

histogram.name: Enterprise.WildcardLoginCheck.DelayUserInfoFetch
histogram.summary: Delay incurred by the user info fetching step of the wildcard login check.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.DeprecatedDomainBindSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether we were able to contact the AD Domain Controller. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.DeprecatedDomainCheckFailed
histogram.summary: Enum of possible things that can fail while checking for enterprise env. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InDomain
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is part of an AD domain. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InvalidPolicies
histogram.summary: A set of policy rules that were ignored due to integrity violations while parsing the policy data which happens on start-up and when the policy has changed.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InvalidPoliciesDetected
histogram.summary: The number of disabled policy entries on Windows due to integrity violations while parsing the policy data which happens on start-up and when the policy has changed.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsEnterpriseUser
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is considered an enterprise user. An enterprise user is either in a domain or is managed via MDM. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsManaged
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is managed via MDM. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.OSType
histogram.summary: The rough Windows suite we are running on. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: Event.ActionAfterDoubleTapNoDelay
histogram.summary:
On non-mobile sites, gesture taps are delayed to prevent double taps from sending a click event. This stat tracks the user's first action within 5 seconds after a double tap gesture when the gesture tap delay is disabled.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.ActionAfterDoubleTapWithDelay
histogram.summary:
On non-mobile sites, gesture taps are delayed to prevent double taps from sending a click event. This stat tracks the user's first action within 5 seconds after a double tap gesture when gesture tap events are delayed.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.AggregatedLatency.Renderer2
histogram.summary:
Time between initiation of any input event and the renderer receiving and starting to process it.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.AndroidActionDown.ToolType
histogram.summary:
Tracks the number of Android MotionEvents with ACTION_DOWN or ACTION_POINTER_DOWN or ACTION_BUTTON_PRESS for each ToolType (unknown, finger, mouse or stylus).
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histograms.histogram: tdresser@chromium.org Team: input-dev@chromium.org. Number of Mouse events coalesced.
tdresser@chromium.org Team: input-dev@chromium.org. Number of Touch events coalesced.

histogram.name: Event.CoalescedLatency.Mouse
histogram.summary:
Time between the first and last events in a coalesced mouse events group.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.CoalescedLatency.Touch
histogram.summary:
Time between the first and last events in a coalesced touch events group.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.CompositorThreadEventQueue.CoalescedCount
histogram.summary:
Number of continuous gesture events (GestureScrollUpdate, GesturePinchUpdate) coalesced inside the compositor thread event queue per event. This field is recorded just before the event is processed on the compositor thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.CompositorThreadEventQueue.Continuous.HeadQueueingTime
histogram.summary:
Time between the first event in a coalesced continuous gesture events group (GestureScrollUpdate, GesturePinchUpdate) and when it was processed on the compositor thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.CompositorThreadEventQueue.Continuous.TailQueueingTime
histogram.summary:
Time between the last event in a coalesced continuous gesture events group (GestureScrollUpdate, GesturePinchUpdate) and when it was processed on the compositor thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.CompositorThreadEventQueue.NonContinuous.QueueingTime
histogram.summary:
Time between when a non-continuous gesture event (GestureScrollStart/End, GesturePinchStart/End) was placed into the queue and when it was processed on the compositor thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.DownEventCount.PerDestination
histogram.summary: The number of down events received per destination. Every down event that is targeted to each destination will be counted, including those that don't have an effect. For example: Tapping on a disabled button inside the browser frame will be treated as down events on browser window.

histogram.name: Event.DownEventCount.PerFormFactor
histogram.summary: Counts the number of down events generated by clamshell/touchview.

histogram.name: Event.DownEventCount.PerInput
histogram.summary: Counts the number of down events generated by Mouse/Touch/Stylus.

histogram.name: Event.DragDrop.Cancel
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the user cancelled a drag and drop operation.

histogram.name: Event.DragDrop.Drop
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the user completed a drag and drop operation.

histogram.name: Event.DragDrop.ExternalOriginDrop
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times a drag and drop operation originating outside of a Chrome window successfuly drops.

histogram.name: Event.DragDrop.Start
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the user started a drag and drop operation.

histogram.name: Event.FractionOfTimeWithoutUserInput
histogram.summary: For each 10 second window, reports the fraction of the time there was no user input. We consider there to be no user input if we haven't received any events for > 50ms.

histogram.name: Event.FrameEventRouting.NoGestureTarget
histogram.summary: Record whether we unexpectedly encounter an empty gesture queue while routing gesture events to frames' renderers: true => empty queue, false => non-empty queue.

histogram.name: Event.Frequency.Renderer.FlingAnimate
histogram.summary:
Emitted after a renderer process main-thread fling curve animation terminates, for any reason, reporting the average animation frequency (animations/second) of the fling instance over its lifetime. This is computed as the number of fling animation ticks divided by the fling animation duration.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Frequency.RendererImpl.FlingAnimate
histogram.summary:
Emitted after a renderer process impl-thread fling curve animation terminates, for any reason, reporting the average animation frequency (animations/second) of the fling instance over its lifetime. This is computed as the number of fling animation ticks divided by the fling animation duration.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.GestureCreated
histogram.summary:
The gesture-events recognized and dispatched by the browser gesture recognizer. This replaces Ash.GestureCreated, which did not record events on Android and Windows.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.HitTest
histogram.summary:
For each hit test, records whether it was a hit or miss, and why.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.HitTestValidity
histogram.summary:
For hit tests that are validated, records whether it was correct or not, and why.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.HitTestValidityScore
histogram.summary:
For hit tests that are invalid, records the score (a series of bits indicating what was matched and what wasn't).
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.BlockingTime.KeyPressDefaultAllowed

histogram.name: Event.Latency.BlockingTime.KeyPressDefaultPrevented
histogram.summary: Time between the renderer main thread receiving a keyboard event and acking it, for events which were preventDefaulted. Only recorded for key presses.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.KeyPressAcked
histogram.summary: Time between key events sent from RWH to renderer and acked by renderer. Only monitors key presses.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.KeyPressUI
histogram.summary: Time between key events received by Chrome and sent from RWH to renderer. Only monitors key presses.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.TouchAcked
histogram.summary:
Time between touch events sent from RWH to renderer and acked by renderer.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.TouchUI
histogram.summary:
Time between touch events received by Chrome and sent from RWH to renderer.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.WheelAcked
histogram.summary:
Time between wheel events sent from RWH to renderer and acked by renderer.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.WheelUI
histogram.summary:
Time between wheel events received by Chrome and sent from RWH to renderer.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.EndToEnd.KeyPress
histogram.summary: Time between the OS receiving a keyboard event and the resulting GPU frame swap. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made. Only recorded for key presses.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.HitTest
histogram.summary:
Duration of a non-resurive hitTest operation. The hit test is non-recursive when the AllowChildFrameContent flag is clear. See also Event.Latency.HitTestRecusrive.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.HitTestRecursive
histogram.summary:
Duration of a recursive hitTest operation. The hit test is recursive when the AllowChildFrameContent flag is set. See also Event.Latency.HitTest.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histograms.histogram: tdresser@chromium.org Team: input-dev@chromium.org. Time between input event received by OS and sent to Chrome.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.QueueingTime.KeyPressDefaultAllowed
histogram.summary: Time between sending a keyboard event to the renderer main thread and when the renderer begins to process that event, for events which were not preventDefaulted. Only recorded for key presses.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.QueueingTime.KeyPressDefaultPrevented
histogram.summary: Time between sending a keyboard event to the renderer main thread and when the renderer begins to process that event, for events which were preventDefaulted. Only recorded for key presses.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.QueueingTime.TouchEndDefaultAllowed
histogram.summary:
Time between sending a touchend event to the renderer main thread and when the renderer begins to process that event, for events which were not preventDefaulted.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.QueueingTime.TouchEndDefaultPrevented
histogram.summary:
Time between sending a touchend event to the renderer main thread and when the renderer begins to process that event, for events which were preventDefaulted.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.QueueingTime.TouchMoveDefaultAllowed
histogram.summary:
Time between sending a touchmove event to the renderer main thread and when the renderer begins to process that event, for events which were not preventDefaulted.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.QueueingTime.TouchMoveDefaultPrevented
histogram.summary:
Time between sending a touchmove event to the renderer main thread and when the renderer begins to process that event, for events which were preventDefaulted.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.QueueingTime.TouchStartDefaultAllowed
histogram.summary:
Time between sending a touchstart event to the renderer main thread and when the renderer begins to process that event, for events which were not preventDefaulted.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.QueueingTime.TouchStartDefaultPrevented
histogram.summary:
Time between sending a touchstart event to the renderer main thread and when the renderer begins to process that event, for events which were preventDefaulted.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Renderer
histogram.summary:
Time between initiation of all input events and renderer processing. This is soon to be replaced by Event.Latency.Renderer2.*
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Renderer2
histogram.summary:
Time between input event creation and the renderer receiving and starting to process the event. For touch events on Windows, we measure from when the event reaches Chrome, whereas on other platforms we use the timestamp from the kernel. On Windows, this metric is only reported when |IsHighResolution| is true, which will introduce some sampling bias.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.RendererImpl
histogram.summary:
Time between input event creation and the renderer impl thread receiving and starting to process the event. For touch events on Windows, we measure from when the event reaches Chrome, whereas on other platforms we use the timestamp from the kernel. On Windows, this metric is only reported when |IsHighResolution| is true, which will introduce some sampling bias.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.RendererImpl.GestureScroll
histogram.summary: Time between initial creation of touch event and when the resulting ScrollGesture reaches Impl thread. Maximum is 200ms.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.RendererImpl.GestureScroll2
histogram.summary:
Time between touch event creation and when the resulting GestureScroll reaches the Impl thread. Maximum is 1000ms. On Windows, we measure from when the touch event reaches Chrome, whereas on other platforms we use the timestamp from the kernel. On Windows, this metric is only reported when |IsHighResolution| is true, which will introduce some sampling bias. This supersedes the Event.Latency.RendererImpl.GestureScroll metric.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Touch.BrowserNotifiedToBeforeGpuSwap2
histogram.summary:
Time between the browser receives the notification of the first ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence with touch source induced renderer swap and GPU starts to swap.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Touch.GpuSwap2
histogram.summary:
Time between gpu starts to swap the first ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence with touch source induced frame and the swap finishes.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Touch.HandledToRendererSwap2
histogram.summary:
Time between the first ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence with touch source, is handled on main/impl thread (specified by suffix) and before renderer starts to swap.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Touch.RendererSwapToBrowserNotified2
histogram.summary:
Time between the renderer starts to swap a frame induced by the first ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence with touch source, and browser receives the swap notification.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Touch.TimeToHandled2
histogram.summary:
Time between initial creation of a touch event and the first generated ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence is handled on main/impl thread (specified by suffix). If no swap was induced by the ScrollUpdate gesture event, no recording is made.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Touch.TimeToScrollUpdateSwapBegin2
histogram.summary:
Time between initial creation of a touch event and the start of the frame swap on the GPU service caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event if that ScrollUpdate is the first such event in a given scroll gesture event sequence. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Wheel.BrowserNotifiedToBeforeGpuSwap2
histogram.summary:
Time between the browser receives the notification of the first ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence with wheel source induced renderer swap and GPU starts to swap.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Wheel.GpuSwap2
histogram.summary:
Time between gpu starts to swap the first ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence with wheel source induced frame and the swap finishes.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Wheel.HandledToRendererSwap2
histogram.summary:
Time between the first ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence with wheel source, is handled on main/impl thread (specified by suffix) and before renderer starts to swap.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Wheel.RendererSwapToBrowserNotified2
histogram.summary:
Time between the renderer starts to swap a frame induced by the first ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence with wheel source, and browser receives the swap notification.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Wheel.TimeToHandled2
histogram.summary:
Time between initial creation of a wheel event and the first generated ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence is handled on main/impl thread (specified by suffix). If no swap was induced by the ScrollBegin gesture event, no recording is made.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.ScrollBegin.Wheel.TimeToScrollUpdateSwapBegin2
histogram.summary:
Time between initial creation of a wheel event and the start of the frame swap on the GPU service caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event if that ScrollUpdate is the first such event in a given scroll gesture event sequence. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

Time between the renderer starts to swap a frame induced by ScrollUpdate gesture event with touch source, and browser receives the swap notification.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.X11EventSource.UpdateServerTime
histogram.summary: Time to request a timestamp from the X server.

histogram.name: Event.MainThreadEventQueue.CoalescedCount
histogram.summary:
Number of continuous events (touchmove, mousemove, mousewheel) coalesced inside the main thread event queue per event. This field is recorded just before the event is processed on the main thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.MainThreadEventQueue.Continuous.FreshnessTime
histogram.summary:
Time between when a continuous event (touchmove, mousemove, mousewheel) was placed into the queue (or coalesced with another event) and when it was processed on the main thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.MainThreadEventQueue.Continuous.QueueingTime
histogram.summary:
