Time between when a continuous event (touchmove, mousemove, mousewheel) was placed into the queue and when it was processed on the main thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.MainThreadEventQueue.FlushQueueNoBeginMainFrame
histogram.summary:
Whether the Begin Main Frame was not received and the queue generated a flush queue after a given timeout.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.MainThreadEventQueue.NonContinuous.QueueingTime
histogram.summary:
Time between when a non-continuous event (not touchmove, mousemove, mousewheel) was placed into the queue and when it was processed on the main thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveForcedEventDispatchCancelled
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of event listener invocations that were forced to be passive due to interventions and whether the invocation of the listener called prevent default or not.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveListeners
histogram.summary:
The result of handling of MouseWheel, TouchStart, TouchMove, TouchEnd events in the renderer.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveListeners.ForcedNonBlockingLatency
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2016 in Issue 595327, and replaced by Event.PassiveListeners.ForcedNonBlockingLatencyDueToFling.
histogram.summary: Time between when a forced non-blocking event was generated and the event processed. This histogram tracks the benefit of forcing non-blocking events listeners.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveListeners.ForcedNonBlockingLatencyDueToFling
histogram.summary:
Time between when a touchstart or first touchmove event per scroll was generated and the event processed, for events which were forced non-blocking since they occurred during fling. This histogram tracks the benefit of forcing events non-blocking during fling.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveListeners.ForcedNonBlockingLatencyDueToUnresponsiveMainThread
histogram.summary:
Time between when a touchstart or first touchmove event per scroll was generated and the event processed, for events which were forced non-blocking since they occurred while the main thread was unresponsive. This histogram tracks the benefit of forcing events non-blocking when the main thread is unresponsive.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveListeners.Latency
histogram.summary:
Time between when a cancelable event was generated and the event processed yet no action was executed for the event. This histogram tracks the potential benefit of using passive events listeners.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.RenderView.DiscardInput
histogram.summary:
Whether the input IPC messages were discarded before being fully processed in RenderView's IPC message handler.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Scroll.ScrollerSize.OnLoad
histogram.summary: Record the area of a scroller upon page load. This is intended to help us measure the distribution of scrollers with different sizes. Combined with the other two metrics which measure the size of scrollers on scroll, we may have a better idea of not compositing small scrollers.

histogram.name: Event.Scroll.ScrollerSize.OnScroll
histogram.summary: Record the area of a scroller upon ScrollBegin. This is intended to help us measure the frequencies of different sizes of scrollers getting scrolled. For those small scrollers that users may rarely scroll, there is no need to composite them even if we are able to do so.

histogram.name: Event.SingleTapType
histogram.summary:
On non-mobile sites, gesture taps are delayed to prevent double taps from sending a click event. This stat counts the number of taps that are delayed by the double-tap delay versus those that are sent immediately on mobile sites.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.TimestampHasValidTimebase
histogram.summary:
Whether the timestamps on input events produced by the windowing system appear to be sharing the same time base as TimeTicks, modulo possible roll-over.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TargetAndDispatchResult
histogram.summary: An enumeration identifying 3 properties: 1) a classification of the event target whether it is a root scroll listener (window, document, body) or not; 2) the result of the dispatch; 3) whether the document was scrollable or not.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TargetAndDispatchResult2
histogram.summary:
An enumeration identifying 4 properties: 1) a classification of the current target whether it is a root scroll listener (window, document, body) or not; 2) the result of the dispatch or whether it was previously canceled 3) whether the document was scrollable or not 4) what phase the listener was encountered at. This metric is logged during the dispatch of the touch events. It will only be reported for main frame events that block scrolling, have only one touch point and current targets that fired an event listener at that phase.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TimedOutOnDesktopSite
histogram.summary:
On non-mobile-optimized (desktop) sites, whether the ack response from the renderer for any event in a contiguous touch sequence exceeds the desktop-specific timeout threshold.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TimedOutOnMobileSite
histogram.summary:
On mobile-optimized sites, whether the ack response from the renderer for any event in a contiguous touch sequence exceeds the mobile-specific timeout threshold.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsAfterPageLoad
histogram.summary:
Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart events and the first touchmove events per scroll. Only recorded after the page is fully loaded.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsBeforePageLoad
histogram.summary:
Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart events and the first touchmove events per scroll. Only recorded before the page is fully loaded.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsDuringFling
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2016 in Issue 595327, and replaced by Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsDuringFling2.
histogram.summary: Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart events. Only recorded while there is an active fling animation.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsDuringFling2
histogram.summary:
Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart and first touchmove events per scroll. Only recorded while there is an active fling animation.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsOutsideFling
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2016 in Issue 595327, and replaced by Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsOutsideFling2.
histogram.summary: Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart events. Only recorded while there is no active fling animation.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsOutsideFling2
histogram.summary:
Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart and first touchmove events per scroll events. Only recorded while there is no active fling animation.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchLatencyAfterPageLoad
histogram.summary:
Time between when a touch event was generated and the event was processed. Recorded only for touchstart events and the first touchmove events per scroll that occur after the page is fully loaded.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchLatencyBeforePageLoad
histogram.summary:
Time between when a touch event was generated and the event was processed. Recorded only for touchstart events and the first touchmove events per scroll that occur before the page is fully loaded. This histogram tracks the benefit of forcing passive event listeners before the page is fully loaded.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchLatencyOutsideFling
histogram.summary:
Time between when a touch event was generated and the event was processed. Recorded only for touchstart events and the first touchmove events per scroll when there was no active fling animation.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchStartLatencyDuringFling
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2016 in Issue 595327, and replaced by Event.PassiveListeners.ForcedNonBlockingLatencyDueToFling.
histogram.summary: Time between when a touchstart event was generated and the event was processed. Recorded only when there was an active fling animation. This histogram tracks the benefit of forcing passive event listeners during fling.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchStartLatencyOutsideFling
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2016 in Issue 595327, and replaced by Event.Touch.TouchLatencyOutsideFling.
histogram.summary: Time between when a touchstart event was generated and the event was processed. Recorded only when there was no active fling animation.

histogram.name: Event.TouchDuration
histogram.summary:
The duration of a touch-sequence. Only measured for single finger gestures. This replaces Ash.TouchDuration2, which did not record events on Android and Windows.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.TouchMaxDistance
histogram.summary:
The maximum euclidean distance in dips (device independent pixel) which a touch point has travelled away from its starting point. Only measured for single finger gestures. This replaces Ash.TouchMaxDistance, which did not record events on Android and Windows.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.TouchSelection.Duration
histogram.summary: Duration of touch selection sequence which finished with the user selecting one of the text manipulation actions, such as copy, cut, or paste. The duration is measured from the moment the text selection handles are shown, and until the action is executed.

histogram.name: Event.TouchSelection.EndedWithAction
histogram.summary: Whether the touch selection sequence ended with the user selecting one of the text manipulation actions, such as copy, cut, or paste. after startup). Sequences ending with such action are considered successful.

histogram.name: Event.TouchSelection.WasDraggedDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of touch selection sequence which involved dragging a text selection handle. The duration is measured from the moment the text selection handles are shown, and until they are dismissed.

histogram.name: ExclusiveAccess.BubbleReshowsPerSession.Fullscreen
histogram.summary: The number of times the fullscreen bubble was re-shown due to inactivity during a session of fullscreen mode (not including mouse lock). If the mouse is also locked while a re-show occurs, both this and BubbleReshowsPerSession.MouseLock are incremented. Includes all types of fullscreen (user-triggered, extension-triggered and page-triggered). Only recorded when the simplified-fullscreen-ui flag is enabled.

histogram.name: ExclusiveAccess.BubbleReshowsPerSession.MouseLock
histogram.summary: The number of times the mouse lock bubble was re-shown due to inactivity during a session of mouse lock mode. If also in fullscreen while a re-show occurs, both this and BubbleReshowsPerSession.Fullscreen are incremented. Only recorded when the simplified-fullscreen-ui flag is enabled.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdInjected
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that inject at least one new ad.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdLikelyInjected
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that performed an action that heuristically looks like injecting an ad, but could not be confirmed.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdLikelyReplaced
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that performed an action that heuristically looks like replacing an ad, but could not be confirmed.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdRemoved
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that remove at least one ad.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdReplaced
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that replace at least one ad.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.ContentScript
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that inject a content script.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedDiv
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create divs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedEmbed
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create 'embed' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedIframe
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create iframes to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedInput
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create inputs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedLink
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create links to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedObject
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create 'object' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedScript
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create script tags to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.DocumentWrite
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that use document.write.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.ContentScript
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that inject a content script.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedDiv
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create divs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedEmbed
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create 'embed' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedIframe
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create iframes to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedInput
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create inputs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedLink
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create links to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedObject
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create 'object' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedScript
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create script tags to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.DocumentWrite
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that use document.write.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.InnerHtml
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that set innerHTML.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.InvokedDomMethod
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that invoke DOM methods.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.ModifiedDom
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that set the value of DOM properties via assignments.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.ReadDom
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that read from the DOM.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.InnerHtml
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that set innerHTML.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.InvokedDomMethod
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that invoke DOM methods.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.ModifiedDom
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that set the value of DOM properties via assignments.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.ReadDom
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that read from the DOM.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.BlacklistInstalled
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were blacklisted when already installed, grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService blackists and unloads an installed extension.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.BlockCRX
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that have been blocked from installing grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService refuses to install a blacklisted extension.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.SilentInstall
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that have been silently installed in a blacklisted state, grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService installs a blacklisted extension without blocking it (ExtensionBlacklist.BlockCRX would be logged otherwise). Typically this will be when a user has a blacklisted extension synced.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.UnblacklistInstalled
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were unblacklisted when installed, grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService unblacklists and loads a blacklisted extension.

histogram.name: ExtensionBubble.DevModeUserSelection
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionBubble.ExtensionsInDevModeCount
histogram.summary: The total number of extensions found to be loaded under Developer Mode, logged when the devmode bubble is shown (once per startup per profile, if any devmode extension is found).

histogram.name: ExtensionBubble.ExtensionWipeoutCount
histogram.summary: The total number of extensions found to be wiped by SideloadWipeout, logged when the wipeout bubble is shown, which is once per startup per profile (as long as wiped extensions were found). Not logged if no extensions of that nature were found.

histogram.name: ExtensionBubble.WipeoutUserSelection
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionContentHashFetcher.CreateHashesTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to create the computed_hashes.json file for an extension. This happens once for each extension after we get signed values of the expected root node of a tree hashes for each file from the webstore; we then compute the individual block level hashes of the actual files and cache them in computed_hashes.json (assuming we don't detect any mismatches).

histogram.name: ExtensionContentHashReader.InitLatency
histogram.summary: The time taken to initialize the ContentHashReader for an extension resource load. (The work done is to read in the verified contents and computed hashes data, and compare them to make sure they agree.)

histogram.name: ExtensionContentVerifyJob.TimeSpentUS
histogram.summary: The time taken in computation (hashing actual bytes read and comparing against expected computed hashes values) during an extension resource load.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstalledLoader.ForceDisabled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts whether we force-disabled an installed extension at startup because a policy provider indicated it must remain disabled.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.InvalidCount
histogram.summary: This is a count of the number of ids that we asked to be signed which the server response indicated were not in the webstore.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.RequestCount
histogram.summary: A count of the number of server requests since Chrome started running, recorded each time we do a request. NOTE: when interpreting these values, keep in mind that a user who did 5 server requests during one run of Chrome will log this histogram 5 times with values 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.ResultWasValid
histogram.summary: Whether the server result received by the extensions install signer was valid or invalid.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.SecondsSinceLastRequest
histogram.summary: This records the number of seconds since the last time we've done a request to the server (only during this run of the browser).

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.UptimeAtTimeOfRequest
histogram.summary: Records how many seconds the browser has been running at the time a request to the server is made to get a new install signature.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.ActualStatus
histogram.summary: Logged during InstallVerifier::Init, to indicate the actual enforcement status used (usually determined by the ExtensionInstallVerifier field trial experiment, but possibly modified by command line flags).

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.ExperimentStatus
histogram.summary: Logged during InstallVerifier::Init to indicate the enforcement status as determined by the ExtensionInstallVerifier field trial experiment.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.GetSignatureResult
histogram.summary: The result of the verifier trying to get a new signature.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.InitResult
histogram.summary: The result of initialization for the extension install verifier.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.MustRemainDisabled
histogram.summary: The outcome for each call to InstallVerifier::MustRemainDisabled.

histogram.name: ExtensionOverrideBubble.NtpOverriddenUserSelection
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, notifing them of an extension overriding their new tab page. Logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionOverrideBubble.SettingsApiUserSelectionHomePage
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, notifing them of an extension overriding their homepage. Logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionOverrideBubble.SettingsApiUserSelectionSearchEngine
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, notifing them of an extension overriding their search engine. Logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionOverrideBubble.SettingsApiUserSelectionStartupPage
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, notifing them of an extension overriding their startup page. Logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.DeniedExtensions
histogram.summary: The number of extensions on a page that wanted to execute a script, required explicit user consent, and were denied permission.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.PermittedExtensions
histogram.summary: The number of extensions on a page that wanted to execute a script, required explicit user consent, and were granted permission.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.PreventableAdInjectors
histogram.summary: The number of extensions per page that injected an ad and could have been stopped if the user had declined script injection. This is related to the ActivityLog metrics, ExtensionActivity.Ad*. Recorded upon page close or navigation. Only recorded if there was at least one ad injection detected.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.ShownActiveScriptsOnPage
histogram.summary: The number of extensions which would display an Active Script Running indiciation to the user. Recorded at page close.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.UnpreventableAdInjectors
histogram.summary: The number of extensions per page that injected an ad and that could not have been stopped through script injection permission. This is related to the ActivityLog metrics, ExtensionActivity.Ad*. Recorded upon page close or navigation. Only recorded if there was at least one ad injection detected.

histogram.name: Extensions.AdInjection.AdType
histogram.summary: The type of ad that was injected.

histogram.name: Extensions.AdInjection.InstallLocation
histogram.summary: The install location of an ad-injecting extension. Recorded upon page close for any extension that injected ads on that page.

histogram.name: Extensions.ApiBindingGenerationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to generate the JavaScript API bindings for a particular extension API. This includes the time from when a JavaScript context tries to access the API, triggering the lazy initializion, to the time when the API object is returned. This is only recorded if the binding is successfully generated. See also Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_*.

histogram.name: Extensions.ApiBindingObjectGenerationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to create the JavaScript binding object using the binding.js module. This is a strict subset of Extensions.ApiBindingGenerationTime, which includes this work and more.

histogram.name: Extensions.APIUse_RelativeURL
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Captures the results of URL resolution when relative urls are used in the tabs/windows api.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLaunch
histogram.summary: The number of times v1 apps are launched grouped by extension_misc::AppLaunchBuckets. See also Apps.AppLaunch for v2 apps.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLaunchContainer
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 12/2014, replaced by Apps.HostedAppLaunchContainer.
histogram.summary: The number of times apps are launched grouped by extensions::LaunchContainer.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLaunchSource
histogram.summary: The number of times times apps are launched grouped by extensions::AppLaunchSource.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLoadedInTab
histogram.summary: A platform app ended up in a regular tab either by the app page or its background page. Note that this happens unexpectedly right now and we wish to track its usage before removing the supporting code.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLocation
histogram.summary: The number of apps loaded at startup time grouped by Extension::Location.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppsPromo
histogram.summary: The actions taken in the NTP apps promo grouped by extension_misc::AppsPromoBuckets.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppTabLaunchType
histogram.summary: The number of apps launched grouped by extensions::LaunchType.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundContentsServiceStartupTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to load BackgroundContents for apps at startup when the extension system notifies that it is ready.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundPageLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time for an extension's background page to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundPageLoadTime2
histogram.summary: The time taken for an extension's persistent background page to load its initial URL.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundPageType
histogram.summary: The type (if any) of background page the extension has. Recorded for installed extensions on startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.BadMessageFunctionName
histogram.summary: The number of times each Extension function call sends a bad message, killing the renderer. This may indicate a bug in that API's implementation on the renderer. Note a similar, aggregate metric is BadMessageTerminate_EFD which counts the number of bad messages that are sent overall.

histogram.name: Extensions.BadSyncDataReason
histogram.summary: The reason a valid ExtensionSyncData could not be parsed from a SyncData received from sync.

histogram.name: Extensions.BookmarkAppLaunchContainer
histogram.summary: Records the container used for a bookmark app launch.

histogram.name: Extensions.CheckForExternalUpdatesTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ExtensionService::CheckForExternalUpdates.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionBecameDisabled
histogram.summary: Fired each time an extension was detected to be corrupted (contents not matching an expected content hash from the webstore) and was disabled.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionDisabledReason
histogram.summary: The reason why an extension was detected to be corrupted. Recorded each time an extension is disabled due to corruption detection.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionTotalDisables
histogram.summary: Logged once at startup, this is the value of a counter that is incremented anytime we disable a corrupted extension because its content didn't match an expected content hash.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionWouldBeDisabled
histogram.summary: Simiar to Extensions.CorruptExtensionBecameDisabled, but fires when we're in a bootstrapping mode and would have disabled an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptPolicyExtensionDetected
histogram.summary: Fires when we detect corruption in an enterprise policy forced install extension and begin the process of reinstalling it. Compare to CorruptPolicyExtensionResolved to judge success rate.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptPolicyExtensionResolved
histogram.summary: Fires when we've successfully resinstalled a corrupt enterprise policy force-installed extension, with a value indicating how long it took end-to-end to complete the reinstall (including download time).

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptPolicyExtensionWouldBeDisabled
histogram.summary: Fires when we detect corruption in an enterprise policy forced install extension. See http://crbug.com/447040 for more background on why we don't yet disable these. A useful comparison can be made between this value and the number of policy forced extensions loaded at startup, which is logged in the EXTERNAL_POLICY_DOWNLOAD bucket of the Extensions.ExtensionLocation histogram.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchError
histogram.summary: Net error results from URLFetcher.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchFailureRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchFailureRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchSuccessRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchSuccessRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxInstallDirPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the path to the directory under which an extension is installed. This directory is in the user's profile.

histogram.name: Extensions.Database.Database.Restore
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to recover from an attempt to open a database that failed as a result of corruption.

histogram.name: Extensions.Database.Open
histogram.summary: The result of an open attempt to an Extensions database.

histogram.name: Extensions.Database.Restore
histogram.obsolete: Shipped only in M48. Superceded by Extensions.Database.Database.Restore and Extensions.Database.Value.Restore.
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to recover from an attempt to open a database that failed as a result of corruption.

histogram.name: Extensions.Database.Value.Restore
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to delete a corrupted value from a database.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeAPIFunctionCalls
histogram.summary: Number of calls to the declarative API extension functions. This includes the declarativeContent and declarativeWebRequest APIs. Emitted when the extension function is called.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeRulesStorageInitialization
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent until rules storage delegate gets ready.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeWebRequest.WebViewRequestDeclarativeRules
histogram.summary: Whether a network request from a guest webview has any declarative web request rules that need to be evaluated. Emitted whenever a network request from a guest webview is received at the network layer.

histogram.name: Extensions.DepricatedExternalJsonCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extensions referenced in the depricated external extensions source at path chrome::DIR_DEPRICATED_EXTERNAL_EXTENSIONS.

histogram.name: Extensions.DialogLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: There is no such thing as an extension dialog.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time for a dialog-hosted extension to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_Blessed
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per blessed extension context (chrome-extension://... origins within Extension processes, like background pages, options pages, popups).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_BlessedWebPage
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per blessed web page context (hosted apps).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_ContentScript
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per content script context.

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_Unblessed
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per unblessed extension context (chrome-extension://... origins hosted in iframes).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_Unspecified
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings in an unknown type of context (this should never happen other than in bizarre circumstances).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_WebPage
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per web page context (just the chrome.app, chrome.webstore, and possibly chrome.runtime APIs).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_WebUI
histogram.summary: Part of the suite of Extensions.DidCreateScriptContext_* metrics. Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per WebUI context (chrome://extensions and so forth).

histogram.name: Extensions.DidInitializeServiceWorkerContextOnWorkerThread
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to install Extension JavaScript bindings per service worker context.

histogram.name: Extensions.DidSuppressJavaScriptException
histogram.summary: Records the Chrome channel when JavaScript exceptions are not gracefully dealt with, and suppressed by C++ instead. These are exceptions generated (or simply not caught and gracefully recovered) in our own internal JavaScript, not from JavaScript code written by developers (that which is typically hosted in CRX files). This should be 0 for unstable channels like canary and dev, because we try *not* to suppress errors and instead kill the renderer and generate a crash report. However, at times we need to suppress even those. Note that this histogram is intended to be tracked over time, per channel, to observe crash rates. Comparisons between stable/beta/dev/canary are unlikely to be meaningful.

histogram.name: Extensions.Disabled
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that are disabled at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledForPermissions
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that are disabled at browser startup due to permissions increases.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponse
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 03/2017 because miscounting IGNORE histogram entry. This error is fixed with DisabledUIUserResponse2.
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to an update requiring more permissions.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponse2
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to an update requiring more permissions. A count is recorded when the user takes an action on the dialog (re-enable or remove the extension) or ignores the dialog.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponseRemoteInstall
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 03/2017 because miscounting IGNORE histogram entry. This error is fixed with DisabledUIUserResponseRemoteInstall2.
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to it having been installed remotely.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponseRemoteInstall2
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to it having been installed remotely. A count is recorded when the user takes an action on the dialog (re-enable or remove the extension) or ignores the dialog.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisableReason
histogram.summary: The count of disabled extensions at startup grouped by disble reason from Extension::DisableReason. When an extension is disabled, it can be for one or more reasons (although typically just one), so the sum of these may be greater than 'Extensions.Disabled' which is a count of the number of unique extensions that are disabled.

histogram.name: Extensions.DocsOfflineIconState
histogram.summary: The state of the toolbar icon for the docs offline extension (visible in the toolbar, overflowed in the menu, or the extension is disabled). Recorded once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: Extensions.EnhancedBookmarksManagerNumEventListeners
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete since the enhanced bookmarks manager is no longer using an event page.
histogram.summary: The number of event listeners the Enhanced Bookmarks Manager has, measured at profile startup. A value of 0 implies that Chrome has a general bug with event page management, since the bookmarks manager should always have at least one event listener - but a bug with event page management that affects the bookmarks manager is particularly dire.

histogram.name: Extensions.ErrorCodeFromCrxOpen
histogram.summary: If opening the CRX file for unpacking fails, this integer is the error code given by the OS.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventlessEventPages
Extensions.EventPageActiveTime
histogram.summary: The time an extension's event page has spent loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageActiveTime2
histogram.summary: The time between an extension's event page loading its first URL and the event page later shutting down.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageIdleTime
histogram.summary: The time an extension's event page has spent unloaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time for an extension's event page to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageLoadTime2
histogram.summary: The time taken for an extension's event page to load its initial URL.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.Dispatch
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchToComponent
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to a *component* extension. Otherwise identical to Extensions.Events.Dispatched.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchToComponentWithSuspendedEventPage
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to a *component* extension with a suspended event page. Otherwise identical to Extensions.Events.DispatchWithSuspendedEventPage.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchWithPersistentBackgroundPage
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to an extension with a persistent background page. The event may or may not have been dispatched to the background page itself, for example it may have been dispatched to its popup. When this metric is recorded, Extensions.Events.Dispatch will also be recorded.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchWithRunningEventPage
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to an extension with an event page that was already running (i.e. at some point had been woken from its suspended state, see Extensions.Events.DispatchWithSuspendedEventPage). The event may or may not have been dispatched to the event page itself, for example it may have been dispatched to its popup. When this metric is recorded, Extensions.Events.Dispatch will also be recorded.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchWithSuspendedEventPage
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to an extension with an event page that was suspended. This implies that firing this event woke up the event page. The event may or may not have been dispatched to the event page itself, for example it may have been dispatched to its popup, but regardless it will wake the event page. When this metric is recorded, Extensions.Events.Dispatch will also be recorded.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionCacheCount
histogram.summary: Number of cached extensions on disk. Reported on Chrome OS during user session start.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionCacheSize
histogram.summary: Total size of .crx files in cache on disk. Reported on Chrome OS during user session start.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionCreationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to create a single extension object. This includes parsing all the different extension manifest keys and initializating the associated manifest data.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionFrameMapCacheHit
histogram.summary: True if the cache of the extension frame map was hit during access on the IO thread.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionFrameMapLookupSuccessful
histogram.summary: True if the lookup for a frame in the extension frame map succeeded after a cache miss.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionHostMonitoring.MaxActiveLoading
histogram.summary: The maximum number of ExtensionHosts (primarily background/event pages) that were actively loading at any one time, within the first minute of Chrome startup. Emitted exactly one minute after startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionHostMonitoring.MaxInQueue
histogram.summary: The maximum number of ExtensionHosts (primarily background/event pages) in the queue awaiting being loaded (via an ExtensionHostQueue), within the first minute of Chrome startup. Emitted exactly one minute after startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionHostMonitoring.NumLoaded
histogram.summary: The total number of ExtensionHosts that completed loading in the first minute of Chrome startup. Emitted exactly one minute after startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionHostMonitoring.NumQueued
histogram.summary: The total number of ExtensionHosts (primarily background/event pages) that were added to a queue to start loading, within the first minute of Chrome startup. These may or may not end up starting, let alone finishing, depending on the queue behavior. Emitted exactly one minute after startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionInstalled
histogram.summary: An extension has been installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionLocation
histogram.summary: The number of extensions loaded at startup time grouped by Extension::Location.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionManagement_RefreshTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ExtensionManagement::Refresh.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionRendererStateCacheHit
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 4/2016. ExtensionRendererState was replaced with ExtensionFrameMap.
histogram.summary: True if the cache for the ExtensionRendererState was hit during a lookup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionRootPathLength
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Length of the Extensions dir path inside the profile directory.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime
histogram.summary: Time taken for the ExtensionService to initialize, including the time it takes to load the extensions for the service's profile and parse their manifests. This happens during startup and also any time a new profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionServiceNotifyReadyListenersTime
histogram.summary: Time taken for the ExtensionService to notify all ready listeners that the extension system is now ready. This happens as part of the total initialization time of ExtensionService, measured in Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionUninstalled
histogram.summary: An extension has been uninstalled.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalExtensionEvent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records what happens to extensions that are sideloaded, grouped by the ExternalExtensionEvent enum.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalItemState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of sideloaded apps/extensions loaded on startup grouped by enabled/disabled state.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalJsonCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extensions referenced in the external extensions source at path chrome::DIR_EXTERNAL_EXTENSIONS.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalWarningUninstallationResult
histogram.summary: Whether or not the uninstallation of an external extension succeeded. Triggered when the external install warning is shown to the user and the user selects to remove the extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.FeatureProviderStaticInitTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during extensions::FeatureProvider::Static. Only measured while in the browser process.

histogram.name: Extensions.FileAccessAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been given access to the file:// scheme, and were, for users that have at least one extension that could have been given access. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.FileAccessNotAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.FileAccessNotAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been given access to the file:// scheme, but weren't, for users that have at least one extension that could have been given access. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.FileAccessAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.FileInstallation
histogram.summary: Record the time taken to physically move the extention files from temporary location to the final installation directory. It includes the time to flush the file system if ExtensionUseSafeInstallation field trial is enabled. This is recorded once per extension install/update.

histogram.name: Extensions.FontSettingsEventRouterCtorTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the FontSettingsEventRouter construction.

histogram.name: Extensions.FromWebstoreInconsistency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of apps/extensions loaded on startup with an inconsistent "from webstore" state. This means an item that is flagged as from_webstore, but with either a non-webstore update_url or an external install location.

histogram.name: Extensions.FunctionCalls
histogram.summary: Number of calls to extension functions.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.FailedTime
histogram.summary: Recorded when an extension function call fails and finishes execution. The suffix indicates the exact bucket the function is in. See also Extensions.Functions.FailedTotalExecutionTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.FailedTotalExecutionTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time it took to execute an extension function that failed from the time the extension function is called to the time the function responds. Note that since some extension functions are inherently slow (anything that requires user interaction, for instance), this is not a definitive source for function performance.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.HandleResponseElapsedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to handle a response for an extension API request. Recorded on the renderer side once we receive the response IPC from the browser and have deserialized the arguments and passed them to the JS context. Only recorded if the response is successfully handled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.StartRequestElapsedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to start an extension API request. Recorded on the renderer side after we perform JS pre-processing, but includes all serialization and dispatching. Only recorded if the request is successfully dispatched.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.SucceededTime
histogram.summary: Recorded when an extension function call succeeds and finishes execution. The suffix indicates the exact bucket the function is in. See also Extensions.Functions.SucceededTotalExecutionTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.SucceededTotalExecutionTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time it took to execute an extension function that succeeded from the time the extension function is called to the time the function responds. Note that since some extension functions are inherently slow (anything that requires user interaction, for instance), this is not a definitive source for function performance.

histogram.name: Extensions.Functions.SynchronousExecutionTime
histogram.summary: The synchronous amount of time an extension function takes. Note that many extension functions run asynchronously; see also Extensions.Functions.[Succeeded|Failed]TotalExecutionTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.GetUserDataTempDir
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: What happens when the extensions system tries to get a temp dir to unpack in?

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_AutoDisable3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it is automatically disabled due to a permission increase (e.g., after an extension upgrade). To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument AutoDisable. For Sync users, this may be reported for each device, depending on whether the Sync update or the extension auto-update happen first.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_Install3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it was installed. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Install. For Sync users, this is reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_InstallAbort3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when installation was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument InstallAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_InstallCancel3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when installation was canceled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument InstallCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_Load3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it was loaded (which happens at profile open or extension install). To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Load.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_ReEnable3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it was re-enabled from a confirmation prompt. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnable.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_ReEnableAbort3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when the re-enable prompt was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and manual user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnableAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_ReEnableCancel3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when the re-enable was canceled from the confirmation prompt. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnableCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_Uninstall3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it was uninstalled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Uninstall. For Sync users, this is reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_WebStoreInstall3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when it was installed through the web store. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstall. Contrary to the more-general HasPermissions_Install3 histogram, this one is NOT reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_WebStoreInstallAbort3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstallAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_WebStoreInstallCancel3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was canceled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstallCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostedAppLaunchContainer
histogram.summary: Records the container used for a hosted app launch. The definition of 'launch' for the purposes of this histogram is different to that used for the launch type histograms. This definition is less inclusive, for example it does not include navigations to the hosted app due to normal browsing, which the other definition does include. This definition could be thought of more as explicit launches via a launch surface such as the app launcher, chrome://apps, or a shortcut.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostedAppUnlimitedStoragePersistentStorageUsage
histogram.summary: The usage (in kilobytes) of persistent storage in a hosted app with the unlimitedStorage permission. This is logged each time the storage is used*, so this also serves as a cap of the number of calls that would fail if the app did not have the unlimited storage permission. *Capped at once per 30 seconds so as to not impact performance.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostedAppUnlimitedStorageTemporaryStorageUsage
histogram.summary: The percentage of "normal" (that is, not unlimited) quota that a hosted app with unlimited storage is currently using. This is logged each time the storage is used*, so the number of times the app would use greater than 100% of the default storage can serve as a cap for the number of calls that would fail if the app did not have the unlimitedStorage permission. *Capped at once per 30 seconds so as to not impact performance.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostedAppUnlimitedStorageUsage
histogram.summary: The usage (in kilobytes) of a hosted app with the unlimitedStorage api permission, recorded once per run per app the first time we load storage for the hosted app. This is separate from the other metrics on hosted app unlimited storage usage because it is logged once per extension per run.

histogram.name: Extensions.IncognitoAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been allowed in incognito, and were, for users that have at least one extension that could have been allowed. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.IncognitoNotAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.IncognitoNotAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been allowed in incognito, but weren't, for users that have at least one extension that could have been allowed. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.IncognitoAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.InitExtensionControlledPrefsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ExtensionPrefs::InitExtensionControlledPrefs.

histogram.name: Extensions.InitPrefGetExtensionsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the GetExtensions call within ExtensionPrefs::InitPrefStore.

histogram.name: Extensions.InitPrefStoreTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ExtensionPrefs::InitPrefStore.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectCssTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time for a CSS file to be injected into a page.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectedScriptExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to execute all scripts for one location within an extension. Recorded every time content scripts injected by extensions are executed. Unlike Extensions.InjectScriptTime, this includes execution time of asynchronously injected scripts.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectEnd_BlockingScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of blocking scripts injected at document end by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectEnd_ScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of scripts injected at document end by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectEnd_Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject all scripts at document end by extensions. Not reported if scripts are executed asynchronously.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectIdle_BlockingScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of blocking scripts injected at document idle by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectIdle_ScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of scripts injected at document idle by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectIdle_Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject all scripts at document idle by extensions. Not reported if scripts are executed asynchronously.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectScriptTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject all scripts by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_BlockingScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of blocking scripts injected at document start by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_CssCount
histogram.summary: Number of css files injected by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_ScriptCount
histogram.summary: Number of scripts injected at document start by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectStart_Time
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject css/scripts at document start by extensions. Not reported if scripts are executed asynchronously.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPrompt.Accepted
histogram.summary: Whether the user accepted or aborted an extension installation.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPrompt.Type
histogram.summary: Type of the extension install prompt displayed when an extension installation is triggered.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPromptExperiment.ShowDetails
histogram.summary: Actions on the show details link grouped by action type when the install prompt trial is running.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPromptExperiment.ShowPermissions
histogram.summary: Actions on the show permissions link grouped by action type when the install prompt trial is running.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallSource
histogram.summary: Installs grouped by the location property in prefs.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallType
histogram.summary: Installs grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAll
histogram.summary: The number of extensions and themes loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAllComponentTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to load all component extensions at profile open. This happens as part of the total initialization time of ExtensionService, measured in Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAllTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to load all non-component extensions at profile open. This happens as part of the total initialization time of ExtensionService, measured in Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAllTime2
histogram.summary: Time taken to load all non-component extensions at profile open and record metrics. This happens as part of the total initialization time of ExtensionService, measured in Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadApp
histogram.summary: The number of apps loaded by each user at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAppExternal
histogram.summary: The number of externally managed apps loaded by each user at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAppUser
histogram.summary: The number of user-installed apps loaded by each user at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadBrowserAction
histogram.summary: The number of browser action extensions loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadContentPack
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 4/2015. Replaced by ManagedUsers.Whitelist.Count.
histogram.summary: The number of content-pack extensions loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadCreationFlags
histogram.summary: The creation flags of all extensions loaded at profile open grouped by Extension::InitFromValueFlags.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExtension
histogram.summary: The number of extensions loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExtensionExternal
histogram.summary: The number of externally managed extensions loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExtensionUser
histogram.summary: The number of user-installed extensions loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadExternal
histogram.summary: The number of externally managed extensions and apps loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadHostedApp
histogram.summary: The number of hosted apps loaded by each user at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadNoExtensionAction
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that had neither a page nor browser action specified in their manifest. Recorded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadOffStoreItems
histogram.summary: The number of enabled extensions or apps the user has installed that do not update from the Chrome Web Store. Recorded during profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadPackagedApp
histogram.summary: The number of legacy packaged apps loaded by each user at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadPlatformApp
histogram.summary: The number of platform apps loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadTheme
histogram.summary: The number of themes loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadType
histogram.summary: The number of extensions loaded at profile open grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadUserScript
histogram.summary: The number of converted user scripts loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchFailureRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchFailureRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchSuccessRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestFetchSuccessRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension update manifest with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestReloadNeedsRelocalization
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extension loads on startup where it is necessary to reload the mainfest because the locale has changed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestReloadNotNeeded
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extension loads on startup where it is not necessary to reload the extension's manifest.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestReloadUnpackedDir
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extension loads on startup where it is necessary to reload the manifest because the extension is unpacked.

histogram.name: Extensions.ManifestVersion
histogram.summary: The manifest version of each loaded extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.Messaging.ExtensionPortsCreated
histogram.summary: The number of ports created in a given script context at a specific time. Recorded once at the destruction of the script context (when no more ports could be created) if and only if at least one port was created in the context. Only includes ports to extension contexts (i.e., not ports created to tabs or native apps).

histogram.name: Extensions.Messaging.GetPortIdAsyncTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time between when an extension opens a new channel and when it receives the global port id from the browser and can begin sending messages.

histogram.name: Extensions.Messaging.GetPortIdSyncTime
histogram.summary: The amount of synchronous time taken for the renderer to request an extension message port id from the browser when a new channel is first opened by an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.Messaging.SetPortIdTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time for the renderer to inform the browser process of a new port being created with a certain id. This replaces the flow for Extensions.Messaging.GetPortId[A]SyncTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelay
histogram.summary: Time that network requests were blocked due to extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelayPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of total lifetime a network request was blocked due to an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelayRegistryLoad
histogram.summary: Time that network requests were blocked due to relevant rule registries loading.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelayStartup
histogram.obsolete: Never used. Added to source 06/2012. Removed from source and added here 09/2016.
histogram.summary: Delay of network requests due to waiting for extension declarativeWebRequest rules to be loaded from disk at startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.NonWebstoreLocation
histogram.summary: The number of apps/extensions with a non-webstore update_url loaded at startup time grouped by Extension::Location.

histogram.name: Extensions.NonWebStoreNewTabPageOverrides
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of non-WebStore extensions on startup that override the new tab page.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it is automatically disabled due to a permission increase (e.g., after an extension upgrade).

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it is automatically disabled due to a permission increase (e.g., after an extension upgrade).

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it is automatically disabled due to a permission increase (e.g., after an extension upgrade). To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument AutoDisable. For Sync users, this may be reported for each device, depending on whether the Sync update or the extension auto-update happen first.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Install
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Install2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Install2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Install3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Install3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Install. For Sync users, this is reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was aborted, not including installation errors and user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was aborted, not including installation errors and user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument InstallAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was canceled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was canceled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was canceled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument InstallCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Load
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Load2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Load2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Load3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Load3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was loaded (which happens at profile open or extension install). To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Load.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was re-enabled from a confirmation prompt.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was re-enabled from a confirmation prompt.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was re-enabled from a confirmation prompt. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnable.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable prompt was aborted, not including installation errors and manual user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable prompt was aborted, not including installation errors and manual user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable prompt was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and manual user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnableAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable was canceled from the confirmation prompt.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable was canceled from the confirmation prompt.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable was canceled from the confirmation prompt. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument ReEnableCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was uninstalled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was uninstalled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was uninstalled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument Uninstall. For Sync users, this is reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed through the web store.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed through the web store.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed through the web store. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstall. Contrary to the more-general Permissions_Install3 histogram, this one is NOT reported for each device.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallAbort
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was aborted, not including installation errors and user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallAbort2
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was aborted, not including installation errors and user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallAbort3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstallAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallCancel
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was canceled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallCancel2
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was canceled.
