histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallCancel3
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was canceled. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstallCancel.

histogram.name: Extensions.PopupCreateTime
histogram.summary: The time taken between a user clicking on a button to open a popup, and the popup finishing loading its initial URL. This is a good way to measure the UI responsiveness of extension popups. It will be strictly larger than Extensions.PopupLoadTime2, which only measures the time it takes to load - there may be a delay between clicking and starting to load, for example, if the popup's host got caught in a queue.

histogram.name: Extensions.PopupLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time for an Extension's popup to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.PopupLoadTime2
histogram.summary: The time taken for an extension popup to load its initial URL. This may not include the time taken for an extension process to start, if the extension already has a background page running. It does not necessarily correlate with the amount of time since the popup was *clicked* either, since there may be a delay between the user clicking and the loading started. Extensions.PopupCreateTime measures this instead.

histogram.name: Extensions.ProcessManagerStartupHostsTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to start up persistent background pages for extensions in ExtensionProcessManager when the extension system notifies that it is ready.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResetPermissionsIncrease
histogram.summary: Whether the DISABLE_PERMISSIONS_INCREASE disable reason was removed from an extension while checking for a permissions increase. Recorded during startup and on reload and update, for each extension that has the DISABLE_PERMISSIONS_INCREASE reason.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResourceDirectoryTimestampQueryLatency
histogram.summary: The initialization latency (in milliseconds) introduced to each extension resource request by querying the directory timestamp.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedDelta
histogram.summary: The difference in seconds between an extension resource's last modification time and its extension base directory's creation time. Recorded on each extension resource request if the difference is non-negative (i.e., the resource's last modification time is more recent than the directory's creation time.) For cases where the directory creation date is more recent, see Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedNegativeDelta instead.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedNegativeDelta
histogram.summary: The absolute difference in seconds between an extension resource's last modification time and extension base directory's creation time. Recorded on each extension resource request if the difference is negative (i.e., the directory's creation time is more recent than the resource's last modification time.) For cases where the resource modification time is more recent, see Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedDelta instead.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackFailure
histogram.summary: Count the number of times a sandboxed extension unpack fails.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackFailureReason
histogram.summary: What caused a sandboxed extension unpack to fail?

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackFailureTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to unpack an extension, when the unpack fails.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackHashCheck
histogram.summary: Whether a CRX file hash sum was the same as in an updater manifest.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackInitialCrxPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the initial path to the CRX to be unpacked.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackLinkFreeCrxPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the normalized (link/junction free) path to the temporary copy of a CRX made during unpacking.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate
histogram.summary: Rate at which a CRX file is unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate1To2mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 1MB to 2MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate2To5mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 2MB to 5MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate50kBTo1mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 50kB to 1MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate5To10mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 5MB to 10 MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRateOver10mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files larger than 10MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRateUnder50kB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files under 50 KB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackSuccess
histogram.summary: Count the number of times a sandboxed CRX unpack succeeds.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackSuccessCantGetCrxSize
histogram.summary: Count the number of times a sandboxed CRX unpack succeeds, but we can't get the file size.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackSuccessCrxSize
histogram.summary: Size of the .crx file, in KB, when the unpack succeeds.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackSuccessTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to unpack an extension, when the unpack succeeds.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackTempCrxPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the path of the temporary copy of a CRX made during unpacking.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackUnpackedCrxPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the path under which a CRX is unpacked.

histogram.name: Extensions.SettingsQuotaExceeded.BytesPerSetting
histogram.summary: Emitted when QuotaExceededError was called due to an extension using too many bytes for a given setting. The number has no natural numerator (normalizing factor) and thus is not particularly useful.

histogram.name: Extensions.SettingsQuotaExceeded.KeyCount
histogram.summary: Emitted when QuotaExceededError was called due to an extension using too many keys. The number has no natural numerator (normalizing factor) and thus is not particularly useful.

histogram.name: Extensions.SettingsQuotaExceeded.TotalBytes
histogram.summary: Emitted when QuotaExceededError was called due to an extension using too many bytes. The number has no natural numerator (normalizing factor) and thus is not particularly useful.

histogram.name: Extensions.ShouldAllowOpenURL.Failure
histogram.summary: When the web-accessible resource check in ChromeContentBrowserClientExtensionsPart::ShouldAllowOpenURL fails, this records the reason for the failure. This check is performed on navigations that utilize the OpenURL path as well as on transfers.

histogram.name: Extensions.ShouldAllowOpenURL.Failure.Scheme
histogram.summary: When the web-accessible resource check in ChromeContentBrowserClientExtensionsPart::ShouldAllowOpenURL fails, this records the scheme of the SiteInstance that initiated the blocked load. This check is performed on navigations that utilize the OpenURL path as well as on transfers.

histogram.name: Extensions.StartupDelay
histogram.obsolete: This has not been recorded since at least mid-2013.
histogram.summary: The time one extension delays network requests at startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.StartupDelay_Total
histogram.obsolete: This has not been recorded since at least mid-2013.
histogram.summary: The total time extensions delay network requests at startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.StorageFrontendInitTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during StorageFrontend::Init.

histogram.name: Extensions.SyncGetMessageBundle
histogram.summary: The amount of synchronous time spent retrieving an extension's message bundle (the collection of its i18n resources) from the browser.

histogram.name: Extensions.ThrottledNetworkRequestDelay
histogram.summary: The duration by which a network request was delayed while waiting for extension user script load. Recorded once per request that is delayed, at the time the resource resumes loading.

histogram.name: Extensions.ThrottledNetworkRequests
histogram.summary: The total number of network requests that were delayed by extension user script load. Recorded once each time network requests may have been delayed by user script load (i.e., once at the end of each batch of script loads).

histogram.name: Extensions.ToolstripLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time taken to load a toolstrip.

histogram.name: Extensions.UninstallDialogAction
histogram.summary: The action that was taken from an extension uninstall dialog. Recorded once per dialog shown. Only recorded if all possible actions (including report abuse) were available on the dialog.

histogram.name: Extensions.UninstallSource
histogram.summary: The source for the extension uninstall. This is only recorded if an uninstall dialog is shown to the user (i.e., it is not recorded for internal "cleanups").

histogram.name: Extensions.UninstallType
histogram.summary: Uninstalls grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackFailureInstallCause
histogram.summary: Count failing CRX installs, grouped by the way an extension can be installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackFailureInstallSource
histogram.summary: Count successful CRX installs, grouped by the location property in prefs. installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackSuccessInstallCause
histogram.summary: Count successful CRX installs, grouped by the cause of the install.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackSuccessInstallSource
histogram.summary: Count successful CRX installs, grouped by the location property in prefs.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckApp
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of legacy packaged apps and hosted apps that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckExtension
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckGap
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time in minutes between update checks.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckGoogleUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of crx's with a Google-hosted update URL that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckNoUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of crx's with no update URL checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckOtherUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of crx's with a non-Google update URL that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckPackagedApp
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of packaged apps that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckTheme
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of themes that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateOnLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were updated at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdaterWriteCrx
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: What happened when the extension updater tried to write a file?

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateSource
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Updates grouped by the location property in prefs.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Updates grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequestAction
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times an action is requested by extensions as part of the Web Request API. For a given web request stage, multiple actions may be logged.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequestBlockingCount
histogram.summary: Number of enabled extensions which have requested the "webRequestBlocking" permission. Includes all kinds of extensions, including component and unpacked extensions. Recorded during profile initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequestEventFoundFrame
histogram.summary: Whether or not the render frame lookup for a given webRequest event succeeded.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebstoreDownload.FileDownload
histogram.summary: The time spent to download the crx file from the webstore to local disk. This is recorded once per successful download.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebstoreDownload.InterruptReason
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The reason a webstore download was interrupted.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebstoreDownload.InterruptReceivedKBytes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of KBytes received for a webstore download before it was interrupted.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebstoreDownload.InterruptTotalKBytes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total expected size in KBytes of an interrupted webstore download.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebstoreDownload.InterruptTotalSizeUnknown
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the total size of an interrupted webstore download was known.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebUi.DocumentLoadedInMainFrameTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between starting the provisional load and fully loading the document in the main frame of the chrome://extensions page. This corresponds to the WebContentsObserver::DocumentLoadedInFrame method.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebUi.LoadCompletedInMainFrame
histogram.summary: The amount of time between starting the provisional load and having completed the onload handler in the main frame of the chrome://extensions page. This corresponds to the WebContentsObserver::DocumentOnLoadCompletedInMainFrame method.

histogram.name: ExtensionService.AddVerified
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records whether adding a new/updated extension to the install verifier succeeded.

histogram.name: ExtensionService.VerifyAllSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The outcome of a call to ExtensionService::VerifyAllExtensions, whether it was called for bootstrapping or another reason (extension installed/uninstalled, etc.).

histogram.name: ExtensionSettings.ShouldDoVerificationCheck
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When loading the chrome://extensions page, this records whether we decided to do a verification check against the server (because the user had one or more extensions disabled due to verification failure).

histogram.name: ExtensionToolbarModel.BrowserActionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of icons the Browser Actions Container knows about (visible or in the overflow bucket). Does not count icons that have been permanently hidden by the user. Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: ExtensionToolbarModel.BrowserActionsPermanentlyHidden
histogram.summary: The number of Browser Action icons the user has elected to permanently hide (as opposed to putting them in the overflow bucket). Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: ExtensionToolbarModel.BrowserActionsVisible
histogram.summary: The number of visible icons in the Browser Actions Container (visible as in number of icons not in the overflow bucket). 0 means all icons are in the overflow bucket. MAX_INT means the toolbar is always showing all icons. Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile but only for those profiles that have one or more browser actions showing in the toolbar.

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.Latency
histogram.summary: The time taken to complete an extension url request.

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteError
histogram.summary: The error code for failures of incremental reads of a file stream for a chrome-extension:// URL. (See also ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteResult for the success case).

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteResult
histogram.summary: The result of an incremental read of a file stream for a chrome-extension:// URL, representing a byte count. Logged in success cases (see also ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteError).

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.SeekPosition
histogram.summary: When fetching a chrome-extension:// URL, this indicates the first byte position we read from. This will be greater than 0 in cases such as XHR's with a Range header, but will normally be 0 in the typical case of reading the entire file. This helps identify how frequently partial file reads are taking place.

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.TotalKbRead
histogram.summary: The total number of bytes read for a chrome-extension:// URL, logged when the job is finished (either successfully or not).

histogram.name: FaultTolerantHeap
histogram.summary: Records several bits of information about whether the Windows FaultTolerantHeap might be enabled. This is logged (from a delayed task) when the browser process starts up.

histogram.name: Favicons.CandidatesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of favicon link tags on a page once the page has finished loading. The count includes the automatically added favicon.ico entry.

histogram.name: Favicons.CandidatesWithDefinedSizesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of favicon link tags with a non empty sizes attribute once the page has finished loading.

histogram.name: Favicons.CandidatesWithTouchIconsCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of apple-touch-icon and apple-touch-icon-precomposed link tags once the page has finished loading.

histogram.name: Favicons.DownloadAttempts
histogram.summary: Records the number of icons requested until the best-fitting candidate was found or there were no candidates left to check. More than 15 attempts are unlikely and will be stored in overflow bucket 16. Less than 1 attempt means an error happened; these cases are in bucket 0.

histogram.name: Favicons.DownloadOutcome
histogram.summary: Records whether a download succeeded, failed or was skipped because it has failed previously.

histogram.name: Favicons.LargeIconService.DownloadedSize
histogram.summary: Records the size (concretely the width) in pixel of the favicon downloaded from Google favicon server (size 0 denotes that download has failed).

histogram.name: Favicons.LargeIconService.FallbackSize
histogram.summary: Records the size (concretely the width) in pixel of the favicon that is used to generate a fallback style in the case when large enough favicon is not available (size 0 denotes that no favicon is available at all).

histogram.name: Feedback.RequestSource
histogram.summary: Records the source that requested showing the feedback app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ChangeDirectory
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Counts the number of directory-changed events, bucketed by the RootType of the directory newly displayed.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.CloudImport.UserAction
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser - Specific actions taken by user such initiating cloud import, canceling import, selecting a directory, or opting-in to Drive>Photos sync.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Create
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser opening mode.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DirectoryScan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time to scan a directory. Measured on every File Browser directory change.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadDestination.IsGoogleDrive.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks whether download destination is set to a Google Drive folder when the download destination is changed by the user in the settings page.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadDestination.IsGoogleDrive.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks whether download destination is set to a Google Drive folder on startup.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadsCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of files and directories in the Downloads directory (not including the contents of nested directories). Computed every time the File Browser current directory changes to Downloads.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Add
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user adds a folder shortcut.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Count
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of saved folder shorcuts. This is recorded when the Files app is launched.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Navigate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user clicks or selects a folder shortcut and is navigated to the target folder.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Remove
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user removes a folder shortcut.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.HardUnpluggedAroundSuspend.TimeSinceResume
histogram.obsolete: The bug which the UMA was investigating got fixed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time from the SuspendDone event to the DiskRemoved event. The UMA is added temporarily for crbug.com/433734.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.HardUnpluggedAroundSuspend.TimeUntilSuspend
histogram.obsolete: The bug which the UMA was investigating got fixed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time from the DiskRemoved event to the Suspend event. The UMA is added temporarily for crbug.com/433734.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Load
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser is an built-in extension without a background page. Its main.html file is loaded every time the user opens a File Browser tab or a file chooser dialog. The file is fairly large and the initialization is pretty expensive.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OpeningFileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be opened through browser.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.DisplayTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to display an image. Measured from the moment the user selected the image till the moment it is displayed (not counting the low resolution preview).

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.FileType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the type of the file opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.LoadMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the way the image has been loaded.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to load an image from a file.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.SaveResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the result of a file save operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.SaveTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to save an image to a file.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Size.MB
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: size of an image file in megabytes. Measured on every image load.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Size.MPix
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: size of an image in megapixels. Measured on every image load.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Tool
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the button which the user clicked.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Action
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: action chosen in the Action Choice dialog for the external device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.ImportCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: the number of photos imported. Measured on every successfull import operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.ImportPercentage
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: the percent of photos imported among all the photos on the device. Measured on every successfull import operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Load
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: time to load the action dialog. Measured between the moment window appears and the moment user see all available actions for the device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Scan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: time to scan the external device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.QuickView.DialogType
histogram.summary: File dialog type (e.g. Full page, Save as file) when quick view is launched.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.QuickView.FileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be opened with quick view.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.QuickView.FileTypeOnLaunch
histogram.summary: File types that were selected when quick view is launched.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.QuickView.VolumeType
histogram.summary: The volume type where quick view is opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.QuickView.WayToOpen
histogram.summary: How quick view was opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.SuggestApps.Close
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: the reason why the suggest apps dialog was closed.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.SuggestApps.Install
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: whether the Webstore item user selected was successfully installed or not.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.SuggestApps.Load
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: whether the initialization of the dialog succeeded or not.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.SuggestApps.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time to load the suggest apps dialog. Measured between the moment window appears and the moment all the contents in the dialog including the Chrome Webstore widget are ready.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingFileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be viewed through browser. This is recorded when the user tries to view a file from the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.VolumeType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: counts the number of times volumes are mounted for each volume type.

histogram.name: FileReaderSync.WorkerType
histogram.summary: For each FileReaderSync instance records the type of the web worker that created the instance.

histogram.name: FileSystem.DirectoryDatabaseInit
histogram.summary: The result of FileSystemDirectoryDatabase initialization.

histogram.name: FileSystem.DirectoryDatabaseRepair
histogram.summary: The result of FileSystemDirectoryDatabase repair.

histogram.name: FileSystem.OpenFileSystem
histogram.summary: The success or the cause of failure for each call to OpenFileSystem().

histogram.name: FileSystem.OpenFileSystemDetail
histogram.summary: The result of opening a filesystem.

histogram.name: FileSystem.OpenFileSystemDetailNonthrottled
histogram.summary: The result of opening a non-throttled filesystem.

histogram.name: FileSystem.OriginDatabaseInit
histogram.summary: The result of FileSystemOriginDatabase initialization.

histogram.name: FileSystem.OriginFailedCanCommitURL
histogram.summary: Logged when we fail the permission validation of the filesystem URL origin, from ChildProcessSecurityPolicy::HasPermissionsForFileSystemFile. This is not expected to happen in normal operation.

histogram.name: FileSystem.PersistentOriginsCount
histogram.summary: Number of origins that have persistent filesystem. Measured when the Quota system queries the filesystem subsystem about its entire usage, which usually happens when one of the storage subsystem methods is called for the first time.

histogram.name: FileSystem.TemporaryOriginsCount
histogram.summary: Number of origins that have temporary filesystem. Measured when the Quota system queries the filesystem subsystem about its entire usage, which usually happens when one of the storage subsystem methods is called for the first time.

histogram.name: FirstUserAction.BackgroundTime.MainIntent
histogram.summary: The amount of time (in minutes) that the app was in the background before the user started it (via an ACTION_MAIN intent) and performed a user action that describes the intent of resuming the app. Only recorded if the action took place within the first 10 seconds of starting Chrome. The actions are further described in the FirstUserActionTypes suffix.

histogram.name: GCM.AndroidGcmReceiverError
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 01/2016. The error has been fixed by GCM. (crbug/580367)
histogram.summary: Result of a message received by the GcmReceiver on Android.

histogram.name: GCM.APICallUnregister
histogram.summary: Number of times when gcm.unregister API is called.

histogram.name: GCM.CheckinCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete a GCM checkin request successfully. If the checkin is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: GCM.CheckinRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of a GCM checkin request.

histogram.name: GCM.CheckinRetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before a GCM checkin succeeds.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectedViaProxy
histogram.summary: Whether the GCM connection was made via a proxy or not.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionDisconnectErrorCode
histogram.summary: URL response and error codes from GCM disconnect events.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionEndpoint
histogram.summary: Number of connections made to each specific MCS endpoint.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionFailureErrorCode
histogram.summary: URL response and error codes from GCM connection attempts.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionLatency
histogram.summary: The time between the initiation of a connection and the successful completion of it.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionResetReason
histogram.summary: Reasons for GCM connection resets.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionSuccessRate
histogram.summary: GCM connection success rate. Does not take into account login success. See GCM.ConnectionFailureErrorCode for a breakdown of connection failure reasons.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionUpTime
histogram.summary: Time (from login until reset) that a GCM connection was active.

histogram.name: GCM.Crypto.CreateKeySuccessRate
histogram.summary: Success rate of writing new keying material to the GCM key store.

histogram.name: GCM.Crypto.DecryptMessageResult
histogram.summary: Result of decryption on a received GCM message, which includes unencrypted messages, successfully decrypted messages and decryption failures.

histogram.name: GCM.Crypto.GetKeySuccessRate
histogram.summary: Success rate of reading keying material from the GCM key store.

histogram.name: GCM.Crypto.InitKeyStoreSuccessRate
histogram.summary: Success rate of initializing the LevelDB back-end of the GCM key store.

histogram.name: GCM.Crypto.LoadKeyStoreSuccessRate
histogram.summary: Success rate of loading existing keying material in the GCM key store.

histogram.name: GCM.Crypto.RemoveKeySuccessRate
histogram.summary: Success rate of removing keying material from the GCM key store.

histogram.name: GCM.Database.Open
histogram.summary: The result of a database open attempt by the GCM store.

histogram.name: GCM.DataMessageBurstReceivedInterval
histogram.summary: Interval between two successive received data message bursts.

histogram.name: GCM.DataMessageReceived
histogram.summary: Number of DATA_MESSAGE messages received from Google Cloud Messaging for which a matching registration exists. Recorded when processing the received message. Prior to M56 this also counted received DELETED_MESSAGES messages (whether or not a registration existed).

histogram.name: GCM.DataMessageReceivedHasCollapseKey
histogram.summary: Records whether a non-empty collapse_key token is set for each received DATA_MESSAGE message from Google Cloud Messaging for which a matching registration exists. Recorded while processing the received message.

histogram.name: GCM.DataMessageReceivedHasRegisteredApp
histogram.summary: Records whether a matching registration was found for each received DATA_MESSAGE message from Google Cloud Messaging. Recorded while processing the received message. Prior to M56 this also counted received DELETED_MESSAGES messages.

histogram.name: GCM.DeletedMessagesReceived
histogram.summary: For every DELETED_MESSAGES message received from Google Cloud Messaging (whether or not a matching registration exists), this records the provided count of how many messages were simultaneously deleted, or zero if the count is unknown.

histogram.name: GCM.FirstReceivedDataMessageLatencyAfterConnection
histogram.summary: The time between the successful completion of the connection and the arrival of the first data message.

histogram.name: GCM.HeartbeatMissedDelta
histogram.summary: If a heartbeat was missed, the time delta by which it was missed (in system time, not ticks).

histogram.name: GCM.IncomingSendErrors
histogram.summary: Number of SEND_ERROR messages received from Google Cloud Messaging. Recorded when processing the received message.

histogram.name: GCM.LoadStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of loading from the persistent GCM store.

histogram.name: GCM.LoadSucceeded
histogram.summary: Success indicates successfully loading an initialized persistent GCM store at startup time. Failure indicates a failure loading the store.

histogram.name: GCM.NumThrottledApps
histogram.summary: Number of applications hitting GCM per-app outstanding message limits at startup time.

histogram.name: GCM.NumUsers
histogram.summary: Number of GCM users associated with this client at startup time.

histogram.name: GCM.OutgoingMessageTTL
histogram.summary: Category of TTL specified in the outgoing message: 0, less than or equal to 1 minute, less than or equal to 1 hour and etc.

histogram.name: GCM.PendingConnectionEventsAtShutdown
histogram.summary: Number of connection events which have not been sent to GCM. This is recorded only at the time of shutdown to capture the events which are being lost due to shutdown. Because this is recorded at shutdown, this is not guaranteed to be complete and should be treated as a best effort record.

histogram.name: GCM.ReceivedDataMessageBurstSize
histogram.summary: Number of messages in a received GCM data message burst.

histogram.name: GCM.ReceivedDataMessageIntervalWithinBurst
histogram.summary: Interval between messages within a received GCM data message burst.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete a GCM registration request successfully. If the registration is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationRequest
histogram.summary: Number of registration requests sent to Google Cloud Messaging. Recorded immediately after the request has started.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of a GCM registration request. The Unknown error case was split up in M56 (merged mid-beta to M55) to separate out the Response parsing failed, Internal server error, Quota exceeded, and Device has too many registrations cases.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationRetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before a GCM registration succeeds.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationSenderIdCount
histogram.summary: Number of sender IDs specified in a registration request.

histogram.name: GCM.ResetStore
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M56 in favor of GCM.ResetStoreError
histogram.summary: Reports the problem encountered when resetting the GCM store.

histogram.name: GCM.ResetStoreError
histogram.summary: Reports the problem encountered when resetting the GCM store.

histogram.name: GCM.RestoredIncomingMessages
histogram.summary: Number of unacknowledged incoming messages restored from the persistent store at startup.

histogram.name: GCM.RestoredOutgoingMessages
histogram.summary: Number of pending outgoing messages restored from the persistent store at startup.

histogram.name: GCM.RestoredRegistrations
histogram.summary: Number of registrations restored from the persistent store at startup.

histogram.name: GCM.SendMessageStatus
histogram.summary: Result of sending an upstream message through Google Cloud Messaging. Recorded when the message has either been queued, sent, or has been dropped because it expired or an error happened.

histogram.name: GCM.StoreDestroySucceeded
histogram.summary: Success indicates successfully destroying the GCM persistent store. Failure indicates a failure destroying the persistence store. GCM store will be destroyed when the profile has been signed out.

histogram.name: GCM.StoreSizeKB
histogram.summary: Size of the GCM persistent store in kilobytes at startup.

histogram.name: GCM.StoreUpdateSucceeded
histogram.summary: Success indicates successfully updating the GCM persistent store on message update. Failure indicates a failure updating the persistence store.

histogram.name: GCM.SuspendTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed from machine suspend until resume.

histogram.name: GCM.UnregistrationCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete a GCM unregistration request successfully. If the unregistration is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: GCM.UnregistrationRequest
histogram.summary: Number of unregistration requests sent to Google Cloud Messaging. Recorded immediately after the request has started.

histogram.name: GCM.UnregistrationRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of a GCM unregistration request.

histogram.name: GCM.UnregistrationRetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before a GCM unregistration succeeds.

histogram.name: GCM.UserSignedIn
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the user was signed in when GCM started up.

histogram.name: GCMInvalidations.IncomingMessageStatus
histogram.summary: Status of parsing incoming invalidations message from GCM channel.

histogram.name: GCMInvalidations.OutgoingMessageStatus
histogram.summary: Status of sending outgoing invalidations message through GCM.

histogram.name: GData.AuthSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Result of the authentication for Drive.

histogram.name: GData.EntireFeedLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the entire file system information from the server

histogram.name: GData.EntryKind
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Provides breakdown of specific formats for hosted documents. Recorded when feed is loaded from the server.

histogram.name: GData.InitialFeedLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the initial part of the file system information from the server

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfHostedDocuments
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of hosted documents (spreadsheets etc.) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfRegularFiles
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of regualr files on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfTotalFiles
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of total files (regualr files + hosted documents) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Geolocation.GeolocationDispatcherHostImpl.EnableHighAccuracy
histogram.summary: Whether high accuracy geolocation information was requested.

histogram.name: Geolocation.Header.LocationAge
histogram.summary: For Geolocation requests from the omnibox on Android, the time since the location was most recently acquired. If no location has been acquired, the maximum bucket is incremented.

histogram.name: Geolocation.Header.PermissionState
histogram.summary: Counts Geolocation requests for omnibox searches sliced by various permission combinations. The location mode abbreviations indicate one of: High Accuracy, Battery Saving, GPS On or Location Mode Off.

histogram.name: Geolocation.Header.TimeListening
histogram.summary: For Geolocation requests from the omnibox on Android, the time since the location was first acquired. If no location has been acquired, the minimum bucket is incremented.

histogram.name: Geolocation.InfoBarDelegate.Event
histogram.summary: Events in GeolocationInfoBarDelegate.

histogram.name: Geolocation.InfoBarDelegateAndroid.Event
histogram.summary: Events in GeolocationInfoBarDelegateAndroid.

histogram.name: Geolocation.LocationUpdate.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Error code for the geoposition sent to the renderers.

histogram.name: Geolocation.NetworkLocationRequest.AccessPoints
histogram.summary: The number of WiFi access points used to determine geolocation.

histogram.name: Geolocation.NetworkLocationRequest.Event
histogram.summary: Events in NetworkLocationRequest.

histogram.name: Geolocation.NetworkLocationRequest.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: Http response codes in NetworkLocationRequest.

histogram.name: Geolocation.SettingsDialog.AcceptEvent
histogram.summary: Records the backoff level when the Location Settings Dialog is accepted by the user.

histogram.name: Geolocation.SettingsDialog.DenyEvent
histogram.summary: Records the backoff level when the Location Settings Dialog is rejected by the user.

histogram.name: Geolocation.SettingsDialog.ShowEvent
histogram.summary: Records the backoff level when the Location Settings Dialog is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Geolocation.SettingsDialog.SuppressEvent
histogram.summary: Records the backoff level when the Location Settings Dialog is suppressed due to backoff.

histogram.name: Geolocation.Timeout
histogram.summary: Counts Geolocation request timeout values, bucketing by timeout duration. This is recorded for all requests upon creation, see Geolocation.TimeoutExpired for timeouts that actually expired.

histogram.name: Geolocation.TimeoutExpired
histogram.summary: Counts Geolocation request timeout expirations, bucketing by timeout duration. This means no position was received within the allowed time from the browser process due to e.g. a slow network or an unresponsive system location provider.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.DisclosureResult
histogram.summary: Records the action the user took after the geolocation disclosure has been displayed.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.InfoBarVisibleTime
histogram.summary: Records how long the search geolocation disclosure infobar was visible for.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.PostDisclosureContentSetting
histogram.summary: Records the geolocation content setting for the default search engine's origin after the search geolocation disclosure has been shown and won't be shown again. This metric is only recorded once per client.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.PostDisclosureDSESetting
histogram.summary: Records the geolocation default search engine setting after the search geolocation disclosure has been shown and won't be shown again. This metric is only recorded once per client.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.PostDisclosurePermission
histogram.summary: Records the geolocation permission for the default search engine's origin after the search geolocation disclosure has been shown and won't be shown again. This metric is only recorded once per client.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.PreDisclosureContentSetting
histogram.summary: Records the geolocation content setting for the default search engine's origin immediately before the search geolocation disclosure has been shown. This metric is only recorded once per client.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.PreDisclosureDSESetting
histogram.summary: Records the geolocation default search engine setting immediately before the search geolocation disclosure has been shown. This metric is only recorded once per client.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.PreDisclosurePermission
histogram.summary: Records the geolocation permission for the default search engine's origin immediately before the search geolocation disclosure has been shown. This metric is only recorded once per client.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Card.Button.Clicked0
histogram.summary: Types of cards which received an index 0 button click.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Card.Button.Clicked1
histogram.summary: Types of cards which received an index 1 button click.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Card.Clicked
histogram.summary: Types of cards which received a notification click.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Event
histogram.summary: Events in Google Now component extension.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.MessageCenter.Displayed.NotificationsVisible
histogram.summary: Count of the number of Google Now notifications visible when the message center/notification center is shown.

histogram.name: GooglePlayServices.ConnectionResult
histogram.summary: ConnectionResult error codes resulting from attempts to check whether or not Google Play Services is available. Most of these checks are done lazily, when a user accesses a feature that uses Google Play Services. Added for http://crbug.com/490710.

histogram.name: GooglePlayServices.ErrorHandlerAction
histogram.summary: Types of action taken in response to Google Play Services user-recoverable errors. Added for http://crbug.com/490710.

histogram.name: GoogleSearch.AccessPoint
histogram.summary: Counts number of Google searches from various access points in the browser. WARNING: Do not use this histogram as it currently fails to classify a large percentage of Omnibox searches correctly - http://crbug.com/421631.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.EffectivePolicy
histogram.summary: The effective update policy for Chrome on Windows. Recorded once per startup (following a 45 seconds delay).

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.ErrorHresult
histogram.summary: The HRESULT for a failed on-demand update check.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.InfoBar.ActionTaken
histogram.summary: (Android-only) Records what action the user took (if any) on the InfoBar indicating that a new version of Chrome is available.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.InfoBar.InternalStorageSizeAvailable
histogram.summary: (Android-only) The amount of internal memory storage available on the user's device when the InfoBar or update menu item is shown.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.InfoBar.TimeShown
histogram.summary: (Android-only) The amount of time which the InfoBar indicating a new version is available is visible.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.InstallerExitCode
histogram.summary: The exit code from Chrome's installer following a failed on-demand update check. All values reported for this histogram fall in the GOOGLE_UPDATE_ERROR_UPDATING bucket of the GoogleUpdate.UpdateErrorCode histogram and the GOOPDATEINSTALL_E_INSTALLER_FAILED bucket of the GoogleUpdate.ErrorHresult histogram.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.MenuItem.ActionTakenAfterItemClicked
histogram.summary: (Android-only) Records whether Chrome was updated after the update menu item was clicked.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.MenuItem.ActionTakenOnMenuOpen
histogram.summary: (Android-only) Records whether the update menu item was clicked when the app menu was opened.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.UnexpectedState
histogram.summary: An unrecognized CurrentState value received from Google Update while polling for the status of an on-demand update check.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.UpdateErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code for a failed on-demand update check.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.UpdatePolicyIsOverridden
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: True if the effective update policy for Chrome on Windows is the result of an app-specific override; false if it is the default for all apps. Recorded once per startup (following a 45 seconds delay).

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.UpgradeResult
histogram.summary: The result of an on-demand update check.

histogram.name: GPU.AcceleratedSurfaceRefreshRate
histogram.summary: Refresh rate of the display in Hz. This is recorded every time we present a frame.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.Buffer11CPUMemoryMB
histogram.summary: The sum of the size of the CPU-side memory allocations of Buffer11's copies (vs. GPU memory allocations). These allocations are used when modifying the buffer data on the CPU or when transfering to GPU memory via DMA.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11CreateDeviceError
histogram.summary: An extended Windows error code returned from D3D11CreateDevice on error. Can be almost any valid HRESULT or DXGI error code, which are listed at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb509553.aspx.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11CreateDeviceMS
histogram.summary: The time that elapses for the initial call to D3D11CreateDevice on D3D11 ANGLE. A pure system call, with no ANGLE or Chromium code, called once every GPU process startup.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11FeatureLevel
histogram.summary: The maxmium supported (or currently requested) Direct3D feature level in D3D11 ANGLE. We support as low as 9.3, and as high as 11.1, though Chrome should only use 10.0+ for D3D11. Gives an indication of how new a user's video card is, what features it supports, and it's general speed tier.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11InitializeResult
histogram.summary: The result from initializing a D3D11 device in ANGLE. Can be success, or one of several error codes which indicate different reasons for failing.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D9InitializeResult
histogram.summary: The result from initializing a D3D9 device in ANGLE. Can be success, or one of several error codes which indicate different reasons for failing.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3DCompileMS
histogram.summary: The time ANGLE spends calling the D3D shader compiler. Tracks total time we spend compiling shaders on startup and during Chrome's lifetime.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.DisplayInitializeMS
histogram.summary: Time ANGLE spends in eglInitialize, where it spins up a Renderer. This can gives us insight into how much time we're spending initializing the GPU.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.Renderer11InitializeDeviceMS
histogram.summary: Time ANGLE spends initializing various shaders and internal classes. This is time that isn't purely loading system DLLs and calling OS methods. It might be work we can optimize or defer until later.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.Renderer11InitializeDLLsMS
histogram.summary: Time ANGLE spends loading system DLLs, such as the D3D compiler DLL, and the D3D11 and DXGI DLLs. Probably unavoidable startup costs, though very useful to keep track of.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.SupportsDXGI1_2
histogram.summary: Windows computers running Windows 8+, or running Windows 7 with a platform update, support the newer version of DXGI. This update also indicates the computer is capable of running Direct3D 11.1 if the hardware supports it.

histogram.name: GPU.CheckFramebufferValidDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in GLES2DecoderImpl::CheckFramebufferValid.

histogram.name: GPU.CollectContextGraphicsInfo
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU process spends collecting driver information during startup.

histogram.name: GPU.ContextLost
histogram.summary: The reason a GPU command buffer context of a given type was lost.

histogram.name: GPU.ContextMemory
histogram.summary: The amount of memory used by a GL Context.

histogram.name: GPU.CreateBrowserCompositor
histogram.summary: The time that the browser process takes to create the compositor from its point of view. One of these is created for each top-level window (browser frame, menus, etc.).

histogram.name: GPU.D3DShaderModel
histogram.summary: ANGLE's currently active D3D shader model version. Logged once every startup of the GPU process, on Windows only. Note that Shader Models 2 and 3 map to D3D9 with ANGLE, and 4+ map to D3D11 ANGLE.

histogram.name: GPU.DestroyProgramManagerPrograms.Elapsed
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent destroying programs during ProgramManager::Destroy.

histogram.name: GPU.DestroyProgramManagerPrograms.Programs
histogram.summary: The number of progams destroyed during ProgramManager::Destroy.

histogram.name: GPU.DestroyProgramManagerPrograms.ProgramsPerMs
histogram.summary: The number of programs destroyed per millisecond during ProgramManager::Destroy. Only logged if both the number of programs and the elapsed time are greater than zero.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.CompositionMode
histogram.summary: How the Desktop Window Manager presented Chrome's DirectComposition layers to the screen.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.FramesSinceColorSpaceChange
histogram.summary: How many frames since the last time the layer color format was changed.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlaysSupported
histogram.summary: True if Chrome will try to use DirectComposition overlays.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlaySupportFlags
histogram.summary: These are the flags explaining how well overlays are supported on the current display. The is recorded for every connected display when creating a DirectComposition view context.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlaysUsed
histogram.summary: Whether or not a frame displays an overlay.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapchainFormat
histogram.summary: What type of swapchain was actually created for an overlay.

histogram.name: GPU.DoLinkProgramTime
histogram.summary: The time we spend in GLES2DecoderImpl::DoLinkProgram. Related to how much time we spend compiling shaders during startup.

histogram.name: GPU.DriverBugTestResultsPerEntry
histogram.summary: For every entry in the gpu driver bug list that is hit on a machine, this records the id. Entry 0 is the total number of times that data is recorded. It should be recorded whenever new GPU information is received: on startup, whenever a GPU process launches, and whenever the active GPU changes.

histogram.name: GPU.EGLDisplayType
histogram.summary: The display type used to ask for an EGLDisplay.

histogram.name: GPU.Error
histogram.summary: The error states generated by OpenGL calls.

histogram.name: GPU.FenceSupport
histogram.summary: Whether GLFence support is available. Recorded each time a new context group is initialized and extensions are detected.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessDetailedExitStatus
histogram.summary: Breakdown of exit status for gpu processes. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessExitCode
histogram.summary: Counts for the exit codes returned by the GPU process when it terminated.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessLaunchCause
histogram.summary: Counts enumerating the initial cause for the GPU Process to be launched.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessLaunchTime
histogram.summary: Startup time of the GPU process as measured by the GPU process host.

histogram.name: GPU.InitializeOneOffMediumTime
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU process spends in initializing the GL surface, and collecting graphics information. Records times up to three minutes.

histogram.name: GPU.InitializeOneOffTime
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU process spends in initializing the GL surface, and collecting graphics information.

histogram.name: GPU.IOSurface.CATransactionTime
histogram.summary: The time that it took to update the CALayer tree and commit the transaction. This is often affected by IOSurface paging.

histogram.name: GPU.IOSurface.CreateTime
histogram.summary: The time that it took for a call to IOSurfaceCreate to complete.

histogram.name: GPU.IOSurface.GLFlushTime
histogram.summary: The time that it took for a call to glFlush to complete. This is often affected by IOSurface paging.

histogram.name: GPU.IOSurface.TexImageTime
histogram.summary: The time that it took for a call to CGLTexImageIOSurface2D to complete.

histogram.name: GPU.MaxMSAASampleCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of multisampled anti-aliasing (MSAA) samples per pixel that the user's GPU can render.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.CacheHit
histogram.summary: If a successfully linked program was found in the GPU program cache during a program link call.

histogram.name: GPU.ShaderLoadPrefixOK
histogram.summary: Whether or not the shader prefix loaded from disk matched the expected prefix for the data and system configuration. False indicates either disk corruption or a system configuration change, and should be rare.

histogram.name: GPU.TextureRG
histogram.summary: Whether RG texture support is available. Recorded each time a new context group is initialized and extensions are detected.

histogram.name: Hardware.Display.Count.OnChange
histogram.summary: The number of displays present right after the user has attached or detached a new display. Excludes mirrored displays, but includes sleeping displays.

histogram.name: Hardware.Display.Count.OnStartup
histogram.summary: The number of displays present at start up. Excludes mirrored displays, but includes sleeping displays.

histogram.name: Hardware.Drive.HasSeekPenalty
histogram.summary: Whether a drive has a seek penalty (i.e. is a spinning disk). Emitted 0-2 times shortly after startup when constructing the initial UMA log.

histogram.name: Hardware.Drive.HasSeekPenalty_Success
histogram.summary:
Whether it was possible to determine if a drive has a seek penalty. This can fail for various reasons (device drivers don't offer this information, the drive is still mounting, lack of access, etc.). Emitted twice shortly after startup when constructing the initial UMA log.
Seek penalty detection is disabled on XP/Vista as of 9/24/2015 because it crashes too much. http://crbug.com/514822

histogram.name: Hardware.Drive.HasSeekPenalty_Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to determine whether a drive has a seek penalty. Emitted twice shortly after startup when constructing the initial UMA log.

histogram.name: Hardware.Serial.NewMinusOldDeviceListSize
histogram.summary: On Windows and Mac, we're implementing new methods to enumerate serial devices that provide us more information about the actual devices. This metric measures the difference between the number of devices that the new and old enumeration methods find. Once this metric gives us confidence that the new and old methods are at parity, we can cut out the old method altogether.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.OOBEDevicesDetectedOnContinuePressed
histogram.summary: Which HID were detected when user pressed Continue on OOBE dialog. This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.OOBEDialogShown
histogram.summary: Whether HID detection dialog was shown on OOBE. Logged on screen show or on screen skip respectively. This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.TimesDialogShownPerOOBECompleted
histogram.summary: Records number of times the dialog was shown by the time OOBE is completed. This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: Histogram.BadConstructionArguments
histogram.summary: The hash codes of histograms that were found to have bad construction arguments. These would be DCHECK exceptions in debug builds but have simply been logged and corrected as best as possible rather than crash.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesBrowser
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a browser for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency MAY appear time and again as the same corrupt histogram is examined for each potenital UMA upload.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesBrowserUnique
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a browser for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency will only appear at most one time for each histogram in a single process (i.e., duplicate corruption in a single histogram is not noted in this chart.)

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesChildProcess
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a child process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency MAY appear time and again as the same corrupt histogram is examined for each potenital UMA upload.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesChildProcessUnique
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a child process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency will only appear at most one time for each histogram in a single process (i.e., duplicate corruption in a single histogram is not noted in this chart.)

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesRenderer
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a renderer for transmission to the browser. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted to the browser. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency MAY appear time and again as the same corrupt histogram is examined for each potenital UMA upload.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesRendererUnique
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a renderer for transmission to the browser. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted to the browser. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency will only appear at most one time for each histogram in a single renderer process (i.e., duplicate corruption in a single histogram is not noted in this chart.)

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentCountHigh
histogram.summary: The number of extra samples counted in the redundant_count in a histogram that were not found by summing the samples in the buckets.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentCountLow
histogram.summary: The number of missing samples in the redundant_count in a histogram that were found by summing the samples in the buckets.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentSnapshotBrowser
histogram.summary: The amount of discrepancy found when examining a single histogram's data in the browser process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentSnapshotChildProcess
histogram.summary: The amount of discrepancy found when examining a single histogram's data in a child process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentSnapshotRenderer
histogram.summary: The amount of discrepancy found when examining a single histogram's data in a renderer process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.HistoryNoticeShownInFooterWhenUpdated
histogram.summary: Whether a notice about other forms of browsing history was shown in the footer of the Clear Browsing Data dialog. This is recorded every time the dialog is opened.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.ImportantDeselectedNum
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user presses the 'clear' button when presented with the list of important sites they might want to exclude from clearing browsing data. We record the number of sites the user deselected, or protected, from clearing. The default has all sites selected.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.ImportantDeselectedPercent
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user presses the 'clear' button when presented with the list of important sites they might want to exclude from clearing browsing data. We record the percent of sites the user deselected, or protected, from clearing. The default has all sites selected, which is 0%. Note: To reduce the number of empty buckets, the percent is divided by 5.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.ImportantDialogShown
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user presses the 'clear' button in the clear browsing dialog. We record 'true' if the important sites dialog is shown.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.NumImportant
histogram.summary: Recorded when we successfuly fetched important sites in the clear browsing data screen. This is the number of sites that we think are important to the user.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.PasswordsDeletion.AdditionalDatatypesCount
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user deletes their passwords in the ClearBrowsingData dialog. Counts how many other data types were selected for deletion.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.ShownHistoryNoticeAfterClearing
histogram.summary: Whether a dialog with a notice about other forms of browsing history was shown after the user deleted data from the Clear Browsing Data dialog.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.UserDeletedCookieOrCache
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user deletes their browsing data. Shows whether cookies and/or cache were among the selected data types.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.UserDeletedCookieOrCacheFromDialog
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user deletes their browsing data manually from the ClearBrowsingData dialog. Shows whether cookies and/or cache were among the selected data types.

histogram.name: History.DatabaseAdvancedMetricsTime
histogram.summary: Time spent on advanced History DB metrics calculation (weekly and monthly URL, host, and category counts). Advanced metrics are logged on initialization of the History DB on 0.3% of starts.

histogram.name: History.DatabaseBasicMetricsTime
histogram.summary: Time spent on basic History DB metrics calculation (file size and table counts). Basic metrics are logged on initialization of the History DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.DatabaseFileMB
histogram.summary: Size of History DB file. Duplicate of Profile.HistorySize and Sqlite.SizeKB.History. Logged on initialization of the History DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.DeleteFTSIndexDatabases
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of "History Index *" databases deleted. These databases stored the full-text-search data for history, which was removed at r213442, this histogram tracks cleanup.

histogram.name: History.FaviconDatabaseAdvancedMetricsTime
histogram.summary: The wall-clock time taken to gather favicon database metrics. Metrics are logged on initialization of the Favicon DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.FaviconDatabaseSizeMB
histogram.summary: Size of the Favicons database in MB. This is calculated as the number of pages consumed by the database multiplied by the page size. Logged on initialization of the Favicon DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredPercentage
histogram.obsolete: No longer tracked as of March 2017.
histogram.summary: Size of the recovered Favicons database relative to the original corrupt database. Recovery is VACUUM-like, so the resulting database should always be smaller. Substantial 100% results would indicate empty databases being recovered, substantial low% results would indicate very little data being recovered.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredRowsFaviconBitmaps
histogram.obsolete: No longer tracked as of March 2017.
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [favicon_bitmaps] table in Favicons recovery.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredRowsFavicons
histogram.obsolete: No longer tracked as of March 2017.
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [favicons] table in Favicons recovery.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredRowsIconMapping
histogram.obsolete: No longer tracked as of March 2017.
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [icon_mapping] table in Favicons recovery.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecovery
histogram.obsolete: No longer tracked as of March 2017.
histogram.summary: Track results of SQLite database recovery code in thumbnail_database.cc.

histogram.name: History.FirstSetTopSitesDeltaSize
histogram.summary: The count of differences between cached top sites and up-to-date top sites when function TopSitesImpl::SetTopSites is firstly called at startup.

histogram.name: History.FirstUpdateTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time for function history::TopSitesBackend::UpdateTopSitesOnDBThread to execute when this function is called during startup. Excludes the case where local TopSitesDatabase db_ is unavailable, i.e. where the update doesn't really happen.

histogram.name: History.HistoryPageView
histogram.summary: The page of the MD History page shown to the user. Logged each time the user loads the MD History page or switches pages.

histogram.name: History.HistoryServiceInitTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during HistoryService::Init.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryDBItemCount
histogram.summary: The number of typed URLs in the history database that are read into the "in memory" history database. This in memory copy of the typed URLs is used for synchronous inline autocomplete on the UI thread, while the larger slower service is run off of disk on a background thread. Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryDBKeywordTermsCount
histogram.summary: Number of items in in-memory keyword_search_terms table. Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryDBKeywordTermsPopulate
histogram.summary: Time to load in-memory keyword_search_terms table from disk. Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryDBKeywordURLItemCount
histogram.summary: Number of items in in-memory urls table. Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryDBKeywordURLPopulate
histogram.summary: Time to load in-memory urls table from disk urls table. Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryDBPopulate
histogram.summary: The time it takes to read the typed URLs from the main history database into the "in memory" history database. This in memory copy of the typed URLs is used for synchronous inline autocomplete on the UI thread, while the larger slower service is run off of disk on a background thread. Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryTypedUrlVisitCount
histogram.summary: The sum of the visit_count fields for all URLs in the "in memory" history database. This corresponds to the number of times the user has visited the typed URLs in the last 30 days (excluding page reloads, since the history database does not increment the visit_count in that case). Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryURLCacheSize
histogram.summary: Size of on-disk cache for in-memory url index. Recorded on profile open when restoring from a cache file.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryURLChars
histogram.summary: Number of items in the in-memory url index char_word_map_. Recorded on profile open when restoring from a cache file and again shortly after profile open when rebuilding the in-memory url index from history.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryURLHistoryItems
histogram.summary: Number of history items in the in-memory url index. Recorded on profile open when restoring from a cache file and again shortly after profile open when rebuilding the in-memory url index from history.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryURLIndexingTime
histogram.summary: Time to rebuild in-memory url index from main history database. Recorded once shortly after profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryURLIndexRestoreCacheTime
histogram.summary: Time to restore the in-memory url index from disk cache. Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryURLIndexSaveCacheTime
histogram.summary: Time to write in-memory url index to disk cache. Recorded once shortly after profile open (after rebuilding the in-memory url index from history) and again upon (clean) shutdown.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryURLWords
histogram.summary: Number of items in in-memory url index word_map_. Recorded on profile open when restoring from a cache file and again shortly after profile open when rebuilding the in-memory url index from history.

histogram.name: History.MonthlyHostCount
histogram.summary: Unique hostnames in History database urls table with last-visit times in the last 30 days. Metrics are logged on initialization of the History DB on 0.3% of starts.

histogram.name: History.MonthlyURLCount
histogram.summary: Unique URLs in History database urls table with last-visit times in the last 30 days. Metrics are logged on initialization of the History DB on 0.3% of starts.

histogram.name: History.MonthlyVisitCount
histogram.summary: Number of rows in History visits table with visit times in the last 30 days. Metrics are logged on initialization of the History DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.NumFaviconBitmapsInDB
histogram.summary: The total number of favicon bitmaps (of all sizes) cached in a user's Favicon database. A given favicon URL may be associated with multiple bitmaps (of different sizes). Logged on initialization of the Favicon DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.NumFaviconMappingsInDB
histogram.summary: The number of page URL (e.g., http://www.google.com) to favicon URL (e.g., http://www.google.com/favicon.ico) mappings stored in a user's Favicon database. Logged on initialization of the Favicon DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.NumFaviconsInDB
histogram.summary: The total number of favicon URLs (e.g. http://www.google.com/favicon.ico) tracked in a user's Favicon database. This metric tracks knowledge of a favicon URL not whether there are cached bitmaps for that favicon URL. See History.NumFaviconBitmapsInDB for that. Logged on initialization of the Favicon DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.NumLargeFaviconBitmapsInDB
histogram.summary: The total number of large (>= 64 pixels wide) favicons being tracked in a user's Favicon database. This is a subset of History.NumFaviconBitmapsInDB, which includes all sizes in its count. Logged on initialization of the Favicon DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.NumTouchIconsInDB
histogram.summary: The total number of touch icons being tracked in a user's Favicon database. This is a subset of History.NumFaviconsInDB, which includes all icon types in its count. Logged on initialization of the Favicon DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.ResultsRenderedTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to load the history Web UI and render (at least) a screen full of items. This is roughly equivalent to 'time to first meaningful paint' for the history page.

histogram.name: History.ShownHeaderAboutOtherFormsOfBrowsingHistory
histogram.summary: Whether the notice about other forms of browsing history was shown in the header of the History page when the header was displayed. The header is refreshed with every history query.

histogram.name: History.TopHostsVisitsByRank
histogram.summary: Page visits to each of a user's top 50 hosts. The bucket is the 1-based rank of the host. Visits to all other hosts go into the 51st bucket. Android-only. Only counts the last URL in a redirect chain. The list of top hosts is computed approximately nightly. This means that a given day will likely include a recalculation of top hosts, and therefore a given bucket may represent two different hosts at different times of day.

histogram.name: History.TopSitesRecoveredPercentage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the recovered TopSites database relative to the original corrupt database. Recovery is VACUUM-like, so the resulting database should always be smaller. Substantial 100% results would indicate empty databases being recovered, substantial low% results would indicate very little data being recovered.

histogram.name: History.TopSitesRecoveredRowsThumbnails
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [thumbnails] table in TopSites recovery.

histogram.name: History.TopSitesRecovery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The TopSites recovery code is written conservatively, with successful recovery committed and any failure leading to rollback. This tracks the outcomes to determine which cases are high-frequency enough to warrant adding additional code to handle them (versus simply deleting the data).

histogram.name: History.TopSitesVisitsByRank
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Page visits to each of a user's top 50 sites. Visits to all other sites go into the 51st bucket. Only count the page visit if it came from user browsing and only count it once when cycling through a redirect chain.

histogram.name: History.UpdateTopSitesOnDBThreadTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because only the execution time at startup is of interest. See histogram History.UpdateTopSitesOnDBThread_Startup_Time.
histogram.summary: The amount of time for function history::TopSitesBackend::UpdateTopSitesOnDBThread to execute. Excludes the case where local TopSitesDatabase db_ is unavailable, i.e. where the update doesn't really happen.

histogram.name: History.URLTableCount
histogram.summary: Number of rows in urls table in History DB. Metrics are logged on initialization of the History DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.VisitTableCount
histogram.summary: Number of rows in visits table in History DB. Metrics are logged on initialization of the History DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: History.WeeklyHostCount
histogram.summary: Unique hostnames in History database urls table with last-visit times in the last 7 days. Metrics are logged on initialization of the History DB on 0.3% of starts.

histogram.name: History.WeeklyURLCount
