histogram.summary: Unique URLs in History database urls table with last-visit times in the last 7 days. Metrics are logged on initialization of the History DB on 0.3% of starts.

histogram.name: History.WeeklyVisitCount
histogram.summary: Number of rows in History visits table with visit times in the last 7 days. Metrics are logged on initialization of the History DB on 1% of starts.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.ClickPosition
histogram.summary: Number of entries that the clicked entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is any entry of that value or higher.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.ClickPositionSubset
histogram.summary: Subset of the Click Position histogram. Contains only the first smaller subset of entries on the page. Number of entries that the clicked entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is entries of that value or higher.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.OtherDevicesMenu
histogram.summary: Histogram for usage of the section in the history page that allows the user to access tabs from other devices.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.RemoveEntryPosition
histogram.summary: Number of entries that the deleted entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is any entry of that value or higher. Confirmed removal is not guaranteed, just an initiation of 'Remove selected items'.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.RemoveEntryPositionSubset
histogram.summary: Subset of Remove Entry Position histogram. Contains only the first smaller subset of entries on the page. Number of entries that the deleted entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is any entry of that value or higher. Confirmed removal is not guaranteed, just an initiation of 'Remove selected items'.

histogram.name: Hotword.AudioLoggingEnabled
histogram.summary: The state of the hotword audio logging preference. This value is emitted each time the hotword availability is requested by the extension if the user is also opted in to hotword voice search. This check typically happens each time a hotword search is initiated.

histogram.name: Hotword.Enabled
histogram.summary: The state of the hotword preference. This value is emitted during HotwordService initialization which happens during Profile initialization.

histogram.name: Hotword.ExtensionAvailability
histogram.summary: Whether the external component hotword extension exists (i.e., not pending download, disabled, etc.). This value is emitted each time the hotword availability is requested by the extension which typically happens each time a hotword search is initiated.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordError
histogram.summary: Errors reported by the hotword service when determining if hotwording is available. Non-errors are also reported so that errors can be seen as a percentage of total requests.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordMediaStreamResult
histogram.summary: Success or error when attempting to open a MediaStream for the microphone. At most one success or error will be logged for an attempt to open a stream.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordNaClMessageTimeout
histogram.summary: Timeout occured while waiting for a message from the NaCl hotword detector plugin. This value is the message that was expected to be received from the plugin.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordNaClPluginLoadResult
histogram.summary: Success or error when attempting to load the NaCl hotword detector plugin.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordTriggerSource
histogram.summary: Location of hotword trigger. Emitted every time the hotword is triggered by the user saying 'Ok Google'.

histogram.name: Hotword.SharedModuleReinstallLanguage
histogram.summary: Language, switched to by the user, that triggered a hotword shared module reinstall.

histogram.name: HttpCache.AccessToDone
histogram.summary: For every http cache transaction with a pattern (see HttpCache.Pattern), the time from the first access to the disk cache until the transaction was done.

histogram.name: HttpCache.AsyncValidationDuration
histogram.summary: The time spent performing an asynchronous revalidation that was triggered by a Cache-Control: stale-while-revalidate directive. This is recorded when the asynchronous revalidation completes, either after the response was completely read or an error occurred. One entry is recorded for each asynchronous revalidation that is performed.

histogram.name: HttpCache.BeforeSend
histogram.summary: For http cache transactions in which a network request was sent, the time elapsed between beginning the request and sending it over the network; this is the time spent accessing the disk cache.

histogram.name: HttpCache.CantConditionalizeCause
histogram.summary: For each request that results in an unconditionalizable network request, the cause for the request.

histogram.name: HttpCache.EntryLockWait
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for write lock on a disk cache entry.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ExternallyConditionalized
histogram.obsolete: stale-while-revalidate implementation removed for now, see https://crbug.com/700568.
histogram.summary: Count of the number of external (ie. from Blink) conditionalized requests, and whether or not those requests could have been served from the browser cache.

histogram.name: HttpCache.OfflineStatus
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Result of a main page HttpCacheTransaction if offline mode had been enabled.

histogram.name: HttpCache.Pattern
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction, the recorded pattern.

histogram.name: HttpCache.PercentBeforeSend
histogram.summary: For http cache transactions in which a network request was sent, the percentage of total request time that elapsed before sending the request over the network; this is the time spent accessing the disk cache.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ReadErrorNonRestartable
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Net error results from non-restartable cache read errors.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ReadErrorRestartable
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Net error results from restartable cache read errors.

histogram.name: HttpCache.StaleEntry.FreshnessPeriodsSinceLastUsed
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for which a cache entry exists but it cannot be used because the entry's age is beyond its freshness: counts how many freshness periods have elapsed since the entry was last used (x1000).

histogram.name: HttpCache.StaleEntry.Updated.Age
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for which a validation attempt is made due to a stale entry and is updated (e.g., 200), records the age of the entry in seconds.

histogram.name: HttpCache.StaleEntry.Updated.AgeInFreshnessPeriods
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for which a validation attempt is made due to a stale entry and is updated (e.g., 200), records the age of the entry as percentage of freshness period.

histogram.name: HttpCache.StaleEntry.Validated.Age
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for which a validation attempt is made due to a stale entry and is validated (304), records the age of the entry in seconds.

histogram.name: HttpCache.StaleEntry.Validated.AgeInFreshnessPeriods
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for which a validation attempt is made due to a stale entry and is validated (304), records the age of the entry as percentage of freshness period.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ValidationCause
histogram.summary: For each validation attempt, the cause for the validation.

histogram.name: HttpCache.Vary
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The type of Vary header for a given GET response.

histogram.name: Hyphenation.Open
histogram.summary: The time it takes to open a hyphenation dictionary.

histogram.name: Hyphenation.Open.File
histogram.summary: The time it takes to open a hyphenation dictionary file.

histogram.name: Import.ImportedHistorySize.AutoImportFromIE
histogram.summary: The size of the history on Auto Import from IE. This measure is only logged on a succesfull Auto Import.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.AutoImport
histogram.summary: The importer used on first run Auto Import.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.BookmarksAPI
histogram.summary: The importer used on import from the bookmarks file API.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.ImportDataHandler
histogram.summary: The importer used on import from the chrome://settings/importData UI.

histogram.name: Import.ShowDialog.FromBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import.ShowDialog.FromFloatingBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from NTP floating BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import_ShowDlg.FromBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import_ShowDlg.FromFloatingBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from NTP floating BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.TempFileFailures
histogram.summary: Count of various failures in ImportantFileWrite when manipulating a temp file to write to before moving it into place (replacing another file).

histogram.name: IncognitoModePrefs.WindowsParentalControlsInitThread
histogram.summary: The thread used to initialize the Windows parental controls.

histogram.name: IncognitoModePrefs.WindowsParentalControlsInitTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during a run of PlatformParentalControlsValue::IsParentalControlActivityLoggingOnImpl on Windows 7 and above.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_LINEAR_ACCELERATION was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerIncGravityAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_ACCELEROMETER was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_ACCELEROMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Motion on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.DeviceOrientationSensorAndroid
histogram.summary: Provides a histogram of the base sensors (if any) that are used at the start of the Device Orientation API. Currently Sensor.TYPE_GAME_ROTATION_VECTOR is the default sensor for orientation, if it's not available fall-back options are provided by using either Sensor.TYPE_ROTATION_VECTOR or a combination of Sensor.TYPE_ACCELEROMETER and Sensor.TYPE_MAGNETIC_FIELD.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.GyrometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_GYROMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Motion on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.GyroscopeAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_GYROSCOPE was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.InclinometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_INCLINOMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Orientation on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.MotionDefaultAvailable
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of Device Motion API invocations in the default implementation (Linux and CrOS). The default implementation does not provide any sensors so the result is always false.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.MotionMacAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the sudden motion sensor was available at the start of Device Motion on the MacOS platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.OrientationDefaultAvailable
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of Device Orientation API invocations in the default implementation (Linux and CrOS). The default implementation does not provide any sensors so the result is always false.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.OrientationMacAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the sudden motion sensor was available at the start of Device Orientation on the MacOS platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.RotationVectorAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_ROTATION_VECTOR was available at the start of Device Orientation.

histogram.name: InfoBar.Shown
histogram.summary: Records how many times a particular infobar was shown to the user. On Android, the infobar may be partially hidden due to stacking. On desktop, a tab with a visible infobar will increment this histogram every time the user switches away from the tab and back to it with the infobar still visible.

histogram.name: InfoBar.Shown.Hidden
histogram.summary: Records how many times a particular infobar was displayed in a hidden state due to at least one other infobar existing. If there are no existing infobars, but the user scrolls at the exact moment a new infobar is added, the infobar may be hidden, but not recorded in this metric. Reliably triggering and detecting this combination is tricky so it isn't done. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: InfoBar.Shown.Hiding
histogram.summary: Records how many times a particular infobar was visible and hiding a new infobar behind it. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: InfoBar.Shown.Visible
histogram.summary: Records how many times a particular infobar was displayed in a visible state due to no other infobars existing. If there are no existing infobars, but the user scrolls at the exact moment a new infobar is added, the infobar may be hidden, but recorded here as visible. Reliably triggering and detecting this combination is tricky so it isn't done. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: InputMethod.ActiveCount
histogram.summary: The number of active input methods. Recorded when the user logs in to Chrome OS or each cold start of Chrome on Android. The active input methods are selected by user in the language settings page on Chrome OS and in system language settings on Android.

histogram.name: InputMethod.AutoCorrectLevel
histogram.summary: The auto-correction level for suggestion engine.

histogram.name: InputMethod.Category
histogram.summary: The breakdown of input method usage by input method category. Recorded when the system changes the current input method.

histogram.name: InputMethod.Commit.Index
histogram.summary: The suggestion index (1-based) of the suggestion list item which user chooses to commit.

histogram.name: InputMethod.Commit.Type
histogram.summary: The suggestion accuracy type which the user chooses to commit.

histogram.name: InputMethod.Commit.Type2
histogram.summary: The suggestion accuracy type which the user chooses to commit.

histogram.name: InputMethod.CommitLength
histogram.summary: The number of characters committed with composition text.

histogram.name: InputMethod.ID
histogram.obsolete: This is deprecated since M46, InputMethod.ID2 is used since then.
histogram.summary: The breakdown of input method usage by input method IDs. Recorded when the user presses keys on physical or on-screen keyboard.

histogram.name: InputMethod.ID2
histogram.summary: The breakdown of input method usage by input method IDs. Recorded when the user presses keys on physical or on-screen keyboard.

histogram.name: InputMethod.ImeMenu.ActivationChanged
histogram.summary: Whether the opt-in IME menu in the shelf has been activated.

histogram.name: InputMethod.ImeMenu.EmojiHandwritingVoiceButton
histogram.summary: The number of times users click emoji, handwriting or voice button in opt-in IME menu.

histogram.name: InputMethod.ImeSwitch
histogram.summary: The trigger type of input method switches by user.

histogram.name: InputMethod.MatchesSystemLanguage
histogram.summary: Whether the currently selected keyboard language matches the system language. Recorded once with every cold start of Chrome for Android.

histogram.name: InputMethod.PkCommit.Index
histogram.summary: The suggestion index (1-based) of the suggestion list item which user chooses to commit for physical keyboard autocorrect.

histogram.name: InputMethod.PkCommit.Type
histogram.summary: The suggestion accuracy type which the user chooses to commit for physical keyboard autocorrect.

histogram.name: InputMethod.RegisterProxyView
histogram.summary: The result of registering proxy view to InputMethodManager.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.BackspaceCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the backspace key was pressed on the virtual keyboard, while the virtual keyboard was alive. Recorded when the virtual keyboard is closed.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.BackspaceOnLayout
histogram.summary: The layout type of the virtual keyboard, recorded when backspace is pressed.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.BackwardsMovesPerSwipe
histogram.summary: ChromeOS histogram that counts the number of times the cursor was moved to the previous word by swiping backwards on the selection track. The count is initialized when the user starts swiping from any side of the virtual keyboard, incremented based on how far they swipe backwards on the selection track, and recorded when they release their finger.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.CharactersBetweenBackspaces
histogram.summary: Counts the length of text typed by the virtual keyboard between each backspace. This metric provides a rough approximation of an error rate for the virtual keyboard.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.CharactersCommitted
histogram.summary: The total number of characters committed. Recorded when the virtual keyboard is closed.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.Duration
histogram.summary: How long the virtual keyboard was visible.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.GestureTypingEvent
histogram.summary: Text input events related to gesture typing.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.InitLatency
histogram.summary: The on-screen keyboard initialization latency in milliseconds.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.Layout
histogram.summary: The layout of the on-screen keyboard. Logged when the specific layout is shown.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.LayoutSwitch
histogram.summary: The count of layout switching actions while virtual keyboard is alive. Recorded when the virtual keyboard window is hidden or destroyed.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.MovesPerSwipe
histogram.summary: ChromeOS histogram that counts the number of times the cursor was moved to the next word by swiping forward on the selection track. The count is initialized when the user starts swiping from any side of the virtual keyboard, incremented based on how far they swipe forwards on the selection track, and recorded when they release their finger.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.TapCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the virtual keyboard was tapped while the virtual keyboard was alive. Recorded when the virtual keyboard is closed.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.WordsDeletedPerSwipe
histogram.summary: ChromeOS histogram that tracks the total number of words that were deleted by swiping forward on the deletion track. The count is initialized when the user starts swiping on the backspace key, incremented based on how far they swipe forwards on the deletion track, and recorded when they release their finger.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.WordsPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of words typed per minute. Recorded when the virtual keyboard is closed.

histogram.name: InputMethod.VirtualKeyboard.WordsRestoredPerSwipe
histogram.summary: ChromeOS histogram that tracks the total number of words that were restored by swiping backwards on the deletion track. The count is initialized when the user starts swiping on the backspace key, incremented based on how far they swipe backwards on the deletion track, and recorded when they release their finger.

histogram.name: Installer.AttemptsCount.Total
histogram.summary: The number of update attempts until the update has been applied. This is reported every time the device has completed an update.

histogram.name: Installer.DevModeErrorCodes
histogram.summary: Errors from update_engine process when running in dev mode.

histogram.name: Installer.DownloadOverheadPercentage
histogram.summary: The overhead in downloading extra bytes due to errors/interruptions. Expressed as a percentage of the bytes that are actually needed to be downloaded for the update to be successful.

histogram.name: Installer.DownloadSourcesUsed
histogram.summary: The combinations of protocol and source server that were used to complete a successful update.

histogram.name: Installer.FullPayloadAttemptNumber
histogram.summary: The number of update attempts with a full update payload until the update has been applied. This is reported on every update attempt.

histogram.name: Installer.InstallDateProvisioningSource
histogram.summary: The source used to provision the install-date-days value sent to Omaha with every request. This is reported when OOBE completes (M34 or later) or when upgrading to a version with install-date-days support.

histogram.name: Installer.NormalErrorCodes
histogram.summary: Errors from update_engine process when running in normal mode.

histogram.name: Installer.OSAgeDays
histogram.summary: The age of the OS, defined as the age of the /etc/lsb-release file. This is reported on every update check but at most once a day.

histogram.name: Installer.PayloadAttemptNumber
histogram.summary: The number of update attempts until the update has been applied. This is reported on every update attempt.

histogram.name: Installer.PayloadFormat
histogram.summary: The type of update payload used to update the device. The difference between "Full" and "Forced Full" is that in the latter, the request sent to Omaha included a directive saying that a delta payload wasn't accepted. A "Full" payload is one where a delta payload was accepted but Omaha provided a full payload. This is reported every time the device has completed an update.

histogram.name: Installer.RebootToNewPartitionAttempt
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive times a device has failed to boot an update that successfully applied. This metric is reported every time the firmware fails to boot the slot with the update and fell back to the slot it originally updated from.

histogram.name: Installer.SuccessfulMBsDownloadedFrom
histogram.summary: Number of MBs downloaded from during an update that completed successfully.

histogram.name: Installer.TimeToRebootMinutes
histogram.summary: Wall-clock duration between when an update has successfully completed (and the user is presented with the "reboot arrow") and when the system has booted into the new update. This is reported every time the device is rebooted after an update has been applied.

histogram.name: Installer.TotalMBsDownloadedFrom
histogram.summary: Total number of MBs downloaded since the last successful update. This also includes all the bytes downloaded during any prior failed attempts.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateDurationMinutes
histogram.summary: Absolute wall-clock time duration it took for the update to complete from the time an update first began. It includes not just the time the device was up, but also includes the time the device spent sleeping.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateDurationUptimeMinutes
histogram.summary: Uptime duration it took for the update to complete from the time an update first began. It does not include the time the device spent sleeping, but it does include the uptime spent in waiting for the hourly update checks to happen.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateNumReboots
histogram.summary: Number of times the device was rebooted by the user since an update began and until it completed successfully.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdatesAbandonedCount
histogram.summary: The number of update attempts that didn't complete because a newer update was detected during the update operation. This is reported every time the device has completed an update.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdatesAbandonedEventCount
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive different abandoned update payloads since the last successful update. This is reported every time an update payload is abandoned because a newer update payload is available.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateURLSwitches
histogram.summary: Number of times the download URLs were switched due to failures.

histogram.name: InstallSigner.InvalidCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 4/2015. It appears the code at some point changed to use the histogram name 'ExtensionInstallSigner.InvalidCount' and we forgot to update this histogram name.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This is a count of the number of ids that we asked to be signed which the server response indicated were not in the webstore.

histogram.name: InstallSigner.InvalidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extensions install signer got a well-formed result from the server but the signature check on it failed.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.CallbackInvalidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier tried to get a new signature and received a response but it wasn't properly signed.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.CallbackNoSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier tried to get a new signature but was unable to (network error contacting the server, response from server was malformed, etc.).

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.CallbackValidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier got a new signature from the server that was valid.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitGoodSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier found a valid signature at startup, and this is a count of the number of signed ids it contained.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitInvalidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier found a signature in the prefs at startup, and it parsed properly, but it was invalid (some ids may have been added/removed, could not verify it was signed with the correct private key, etc.).

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitNoSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier did not find any signature in the prefs at startup.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitUnparseablePref
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier found a signature in the prefs at startup, but it wasn't parseable (missing/wrong format of required keys, etc.).

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.SignatureFailedButNotEnforcing
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier would have disabled an extension but is not in enforcement mode.

histogram.name: InstanceID.DeleteToken.CompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete the DeleteToken request successfully. If the request is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: InstanceID.DeleteToken.RequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of DeleteToken request.

histogram.name: InstanceID.DeleteToken.RetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before DeleteToken succeeds.

histogram.name: InstanceID.Enabled
histogram.summary: Whether the Instance ID API is enabled. Checked when a chrome.instanceID function is called.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.CompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete the GetToken request successfully. If the request is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.RequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of GetToken request.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.RetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before GetToken succeeds.

histogram.name: InstanceID.RestoredIDCount
histogram.summary: Number of Instance IDs restored from the persistent store at startup.

histogram.name: InstanceID.RestoredTokenCount
histogram.summary: Number of InstanceID tokens restored from the persistent store at startup.

histogram.name: Instant.InstantControllerEvent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records various events of interest in the InstantController. E.g. When URLs are blacklisted.

histogram.name: Instant.SessionsStorageNamespace
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often an Instant preview is committed onto a different tab than it was created from.

histogram.name: Instant.TimeToFirstShow
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time between the first Omnibox interaction and when the Instant preview shows. If the instant preview was already showing when the user interacted with the omnibox, this histogram is not recorded.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.CacheableNTPLoad
histogram.summary: Records a histogram for how often the Cacheable NTP fails to load.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.FallbackToLocalOverlay
histogram.obsolete: Depcreated as of 10/2013. No longer relevant since the HTML overlay was abandoned.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the cause for falling back to a local overlay at the time of fallback.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.InstantNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 10/2013. This histogram is no longer relevant since the HTML overlay went away.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records a histogram for instant extended (Local NTP and Online NTP) and non-extended navigations.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.NewOptInState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, whether the user has chosen to opt-in to or opt-out of InstantExtended via chrome://flags.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.OptInState
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-06. As of m30 use InstantExtended.NewOptInState.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, whether the user has chosen to opt-in to or opt-out of InstantExtended via chrome://flags.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchQuerytoQuery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to another search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchQuerytoURL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to a url. Example: Accidental search for google.con, then navigation to google.com.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchURLtoQuery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to a search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchURLtoURL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to another url.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_QuerytoQuery
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2016 with the removal of query in the omnibox code.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to another search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_QuerytoURL
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2016 with the removal of query in the omnibox code.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to a url. Example: Accidental search for google.con, then navigation to google.com.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_URLtoQuery
histogram.obsolete: Removed in September 2016 because (i) this measurement was somewhat wrong, (ii) it's difficult to understand the data, and (iii) there are better ways to answer the same question. The measurement is somewhat wrong because reloads, link drops, and pasting URLs and pressing enter are all incorrectly logged to the URLtoQuery histogram, not the URLtoURL histogram. Futhermore, this histogram is difficult to analyze because it's not broken up by input length. Short URLs can by random chance have a sizable percentage match with a query. Finally, there are better source for data like this; ask mpearson for details.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to a search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_URLtoURL
histogram.obsolete: Removed in September 2016 because (i) this measurement was somewhat wrong, and (ii) there are better ways to answer the same question. The measurement is somewhat wrong because reloads, link drops, and pasting URLs and pressing enter are all incorrectly logged to the URLtoQuery histogram, not the URLtoURL histogram. Furthermore, there are better source for data like this; ask mpearson for details.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to another url.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PrefValue
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-06. This preference has not been exposed or used for months, and we do not plan to use it in the future.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, the value of the "Allow your search engine to provide Instant result" preference setting for the first profile loaded.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.PreviewScrollState
histogram.summary: Records the scroll state on the preview page when instant search clicks feature is triggered.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.ReasonForSwap
histogram.summary: Records the reason that triggered the page swap when instant search clicks feature is triggered.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.TimeInPreview
histogram.summary: The time spent by the user in preview page before swapping to original or navigating out of preview page.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.TimeToSwap
histogram.summary: The time it took for swap to trigger for all swaps. The is the time between preview page load start to preview page swap with the original page.

histogram.name: InterProcessTimeTicks.BrowserAhead
histogram.summary: Estimated additive skew between processes, recorded if the browser process is ahead (higher TimeTicks value) than the renderer process.

histogram.name: InterProcessTimeTicks.BrowserBehind
histogram.summary: Estimated additive skew between processes, recorded if the browser process is behind (lower TimeTicks value) than the renderer process.

histogram.name: InterProcessTimeTicks.IsSkewAdditive
histogram.summary: True iff the conversion from the browser process TimeTicks to renderer process TimeTicks is done by adding a constant, without scaling.

histogram.name: interstitial.authority_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_AUTHORITY_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.captive_portal
histogram.summary: User action when the user is shown a captive portal error page.

histogram.name: interstitial.common_name_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.date_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_DATE_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.decision
histogram.summary: User decision when presented with a security interstitial. As of M44, subresource interstitials were split into their own entries. As of M52, social_engineering_ads* and social_engineering_landing* interstitial reasons are split into their own entries from phishing*.

histogram.name: interstitial.decision.repeat_visit
histogram.summary: User decision when presented with a security interstitial, on a site that the user had previously visited. As of M44, subresource interstitials were split into their own entries. As of M52, social_engineering_ads* and social_engineering_landing* interstitial reasons are split into their own entries from phishing*.

histogram.name: interstitial.interaction
histogram.summary: User interactions with a security interstitial. As of M44, subresource interstitials were split into their own entries. As of M52, social_engineering_ads* and social_engineering_landing* interstitial reasons are split into their own entries from phishing*.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by interstitial.ssl_overridable.* and interstitial.ssl_nonoverridable.* in Jan 2015 (M42).
histogram.summary: User action when the user is shown a SSL interstitial. SHOW_ALL and MORE refer to the total number of SSL errors; all of the other numbers pertain to the number of actions related to SSL errors that are overridable. The counts do not sum to 100%; SHOW_ALL is a superset of SHOW_OVERRIDABLE, which in turn will be a supserset of the PROCEED/DONT_PROCEED variables. SHOW_UNDERSTAND is only being used by an experimental field trial. The interstitials due to captive portals are now recorded in the "SSLCaptivePortal".

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.captive_portal
histogram.summary: Record possible states of captive portals. This histogram is emitted (possibly multiple times to different buckets) whenever a ssl interstitial page is displayed and captive portal detection is enabled. The captive portal technique forces a client on a network to see a special web page (usually for authentication purposes) before using the internet normally.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.cause.nonoverridable
histogram.summary: Possible non-attack causes of the non-overridable SSL interstitial. Many errors are not reported in this histogram and new errors may be added over time, therefore one should not look at the breakdown of this histogram (one bucket divided by the sum) because that will be inaccurate. Instead, one should look at each bucket count divided by the count of the ssl errors of that type. E.g. WWW mismatch is recorded only when the ssl error is CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID, so one should look at the bucket count of WWW mismatch divided by the bucket count of CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID in the histogram interstitial.ssl_error_type.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.cause.overridable
histogram.summary: Possible non-attack causes of the overridable SSL interstitial. Many errors are not reported in this histogram and new errors may be added over time, therefore one should not look at the breakdown of this histogram (one bucket divided by the sum) because that will be inaccurate. Instead, one should look at each bucket count divided by the count of the ssl errors of that type. E.g. WWW mismatch is recorded only when the ssl error is CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID, so one should look at the bucket count of WWW mismatch divided by the bucket count of CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID in the histogram interstitial.ssl_error_type.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.clockstate.build_time
histogram.summary: State of the system clock, as inferred from the build timestamp, when an SSL CERT_INVALID_DATE error is seen.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.clockstate.network
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated August 2016. Replaced with interstitial.ssl.clockstate.network2, which records reasons why network time might be unavailable.
histogram.summary: State of the system clock, relative to network time, when an SSL CERT_INVALID_DATE error is seen.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.clockstate.network2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated October 2016. Due to a bug, data in this histogram is mislabelled and should be disregarded. Replaced with interstitial.ssl.clockstate.network3.
histogram.summary: State of the system clock, relative to network time, when an SSL CERT_INVALID_DATE error is seen.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.clockstate.network3
histogram.summary: State of the system clock, relative to network time, when an SSL CERT_INVALID_DATE error is seen.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.connection_type
histogram.summary: The histogram shows the connection types associated with SSL warnings. E.g., do more warnings occur on WiFi?

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.did_user_revoke_decisions
histogram.summary: Specifies when a user enters the page info menu whether or not the user pressed the SSL decisions revoke button. This can only by done if the user is in the "Remember Certificate Error Decisions" experiment. This is logged when the page info UI is closed.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.expiration_and_decision.nonoverridable
histogram.summary: Records when a user has made a decision to proceed on a nonoverridable SSL interstitial. Also records whether a prior decision had been made but the decision expired.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.expiration_and_decision.overridable
histogram.summary: Records when a user has made a decision to proceed on an overridable SSL interstitial. Also records whether a prior decision had been made but the decision expired.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.good_cert_seen
histogram.summary: Emitted when a good certificate is seen, specifying whether the user already gave an exception for a bad certificate for the same host.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.severity_score.authority_invalid
histogram.summary: The likelihood of a |CERT_AUTHORITY_INVALID| error being an attack.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.severity_score.common_name_invalid
histogram.summary: The likelihood of a |CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID| error being an attack.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.severity_score.date_invalid
histogram.summary: The likelihood of a |CERT_DATE_INVALID| error being an attack.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_accept_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, when the user accepts the SSL warning. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_error_handler
histogram.summary: The type of action that the SSL error handler takes.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_error_handler.cert_date_error_delay
histogram.summary: When handling a certificate date error, Chrome (under certain Variations Service experiments) will delay displaying the warning interstitial for up to 3 seconds while querying a network time service. This histogram records the amount of time for which the interstitial was delayed on this check. The histogram is recorded even when a time query is not sent (for example, because Chrome already had an up-to-date network timestamp that it could use, or because the client is not in the experimental group that enables network time queries).

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_error_type
histogram.summary: The type of SSL error that the user encounters. This is recorded for all SSL warnings, regardless of whether they are overridable.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_reject_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, when the user rejects the SSL warning. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: Invalidations.GCMUpstreamRequest
histogram.summary: Status of sending outgoing invalidation message through GCM upsteam.

histogram.name: Invalidations.NetworkChannel
histogram.summary: Network channel used for invalidations.

histogram.name: IOS.MailtoURLRewritten
histogram.summary: Counts the times when a mailto: URL is tapped by user and whether the URL has been rewritten for an available native Mail client app or not.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.ReceivedEntriesCount
histogram.summary: The number of items received simultaneously in Chrome from the IOS share extension.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.ReceivedEntry
histogram.summary: Type of the item received from the iOS share extension.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.ReceivedEntryDelay
histogram.summary: The delay in milliseconds between the item creation in the extension and its processing in Chrome.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.Source
histogram.summary: The source application that sent the external command to Chrome.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.Action
histogram.summary: The Spotlight Action pressed by the user.

histogram.name: IPC.AttachmentBrokerPrivileged.BrokerAttachmentError
histogram.summary: Errors that the privileged attachment broker encounters while trying to broker attachments.

histogram.name: IPC.AttachmentBrokerUnprivileged.BrokerAttachmentError
histogram.summary: Errors that an unprivileged attachment broker encounters while trying to broker attachments.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CharacterCount
histogram.summary: The count of the number of characters in JavaScript dialog messages grouped by site engagement score.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CharacterCountUserSuppressed
histogram.summary: The count of the number of characters in JavaScript dialog messages that were suppressed by the user. Compare with JSDialogs.CountOfJSDialogMessageCharacters.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CountOfJSDialogMessageCharacters
histogram.summary: The count of the number of characters in JavaScript dialog messages.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CountOfJSDialogMessageNewlines
histogram.summary: The count of the number of newlines in JavaScript dialog messages. (This does not count breaks inserted by the UI toolkit in wrapping the messages.)

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CountOfOnBeforeUnloadMessageCharacters
histogram.summary: The count of the number of characters in onbeforeunload messages.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CountOfOnBeforeUnloadMessageNewlines
histogram.summary: The count of the number of newlines in onbeforeunload messages. (This does not count breaks inserted by the UI toolkit in wrapping the messages.)

histogram.name: JSDialogs.DismissalCause
histogram.summary: The cause of dismissal of JavaScript dialogs.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenDialogClosedAndNextDialogCreated
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between closing a Javascript dialog and opening another, to track very frequent dialogs.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenDialogCreatedAndNextDialogCreated
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between opening a Javascript dialog and opening another, to track very frequent dialogs.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenDialogCreatedAndSameDialogClosed
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between opening a Javascript dialog and closing it, to track very short-lived dialogs.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.IsForemost
histogram.summary: For dialogs, whether or not they were spawned by a tab that was foremost.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.OnBeforeUnloadStayVsLeave
histogram.summary: For onbeforeunload dialogs, the user's choice between staying on the page and leaving it.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.SiteEngagementOfBeforeUnload
histogram.summary: The site engagement values of sites showing onbeforeunload dialogs. Logged once per dialog, whether shown or suppressed.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.SiteEngagementOfDialogs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-10. Site engagement needed to be measured in small buckets anyway so it was never high-resolution enough for use.
histogram.summary: The site engagement values of sites showing dialogs. Logged once per dialog, whether shown or suppressed.

histogram.name: Keyboard.KeystrokeDeltas
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 07/2016 in crbug.com/631204 with KeyboardUmaEventFilter removal.
histogram.summary: The time between keystrokes in Aura text fields. The only keystrokes that are measured are ones that produce a printable character and are not over 5 seconds apart.

histogram.name: Keyboard.Shortcuts.CrosSearchKeyDelay
histogram.summary: The time between a user pressing the ChromeOS "Search" key and the second key being pressed down to active a shortcut. e.g. Search + L would record the time between Search key down and L key down. If the user pressed multiple keys after Search, we only record the first key down.

histogram.name: Kiosk.Launch.CryptohomeFailure
histogram.summary: Tracks cryptohome failure during kiosk launch.

histogram.name: Kiosk.Launch.Error
histogram.summary: Tracks kiosk launch errors.

histogram.name: Kiosk.LaunchType
histogram.summary: Records kiosk launches, whether it is an enterprise or consumer kiosk and whether it is an auto launch or manual launch.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.AcceptLanguage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Accept languages.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.ApplicationLanguage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Application languages used for UI.

histogram.name: Launch.FlagsAtStartup
histogram.summary: Logs which Chrome flags from about:flags were active on start up.

histogram.name: Launch.HomeScreen
histogram.summary: Records how Chrome handled a launch from an Android Home screen shortcut.

histogram.name: Launch.HomeScreenSource
histogram.summary:
Records the source of an Android homescreen launch intent used to launch Chrome.
The Menu item bucket is deprecated as of M57, and will only contain records for shortcuts added to the homescreen until M56.
For M57+, the Menu item (standalone) bucket contains all launch intents originating from the add to homescreen menu item that launch to standalone mode and *are not* WebAPKs. These are sites which do not meet the PWA eligibility criteria, but have an app manifest that specifies either standalone or fullscreen display. This bucket also contains PWA *and* non-PWA intents that were added to the homescreen *prior* to M57, as we cannot distinguish between them after they are added.
For M57+, the Menu item (shortcut) bucket contains all launch intents originating from the add to homescreen menu item that launch to a browser tab, regardless of when the intent was added.

histogram.name: Launch.IntentFlags
histogram.summary: Records flags (and combinations of flags) that were attached to the Intent that started ChromeLauncherActivity.

histogram.name: Launch.InvalidIntent
histogram.summary: Records whether or not an invalid Android Intent was fired to launch Chrome. (http://crbug.com/445136)

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerComplexText
histogram.summary: For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were complex text fragments, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerFloat
histogram.summary: For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were floats, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerNode
histogram.summary: For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerPositioned
histogram.summary: For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were fixed or absolute positioned, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerSimpleText
histogram.summary: For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were simple text fragments, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerTD
histogram.summary: For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were table cells, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.AdjustedScrollOffset
histogram.summary: Records the number of times ScrollAnchor adjusts the scroll offset.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.SuppressedBySanaclap
histogram.summary: Records the number of times scroll anchoring is suppressed because of the SANACLAP bit being set on an ancestor (see bit.ly/sanaclap).

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.TimeToFindAnchor
histogram.summary: The time it took to find a suitable anchor element.

histogram.name: LevelDB.Open
histogram.summary: The result of an open attempt of a leveldb.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.All.SafeThreadAccess
histogram.summary: Linux and CrOS use unlocked_stdio(3). If it is used unsafely, record it here. If there is no record of unsafety after chrome 29 has been in the stable channel for a few weeks then revert this change.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.DeleteTableBackupFile
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of deleting an unused leveldb table backup file.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError
histogram.summary: Methods where leveldb's Chromium environment has IO errors.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-05. As of M43 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single leveldb method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE
histogram.summary: Errors (base::File::Error) encountered by a single leveldb method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewLogger
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-05. As of M43 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE.NewLogger.
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewLogger.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewSequentialFile
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-05. As of M43 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE.NewSequentialFile.
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewSequentialFile.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.RandomAccessFile
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-04. As of m28 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewRandomAccessFile.
histogram.summary: File errors in leveldb ChromiumEnv's NewRandomAccessFile method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.WritableFileAppend
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileAppend.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.WritableFileFlush
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-05. As of M43 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE.WritableFileFlush.
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileFlush.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.LockFileAncestorsNotFound
histogram.summary: Number of directories missing when Non-IDB LevelDBEnv tries to create a Lock file.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.MaxFDs
histogram.summary: File descriptor limit recorded every time LevelDB calls NewRandomAccessFile for clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.MissingFiles
histogram.summary: Number of backup files found without corresponding ldb files. As measured by GetChildren when used in LevelDB clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.RetryRecoveredFromErrorIn
histogram.summary: When Non-IDB LevelDBEnv successfully retries an operation that had failed, record the error from the most recent failed attempt.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.Table
histogram.obsolete: As of M54 no longer creating or using table backup files.
histogram.summary: Success indicates a successful backup or restore operation for .ldb table files when used by LevelDB clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.TimeTo
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-04. As of m28 use LevelDBEnv.TimeUntilSuccessFor.
histogram.summary: Time Non-IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.TimeUntilSuccessFor
histogram.summary: Time Non-IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: LevelDBWrapper.CommitDelay
histogram.summary: Delay between the browser process receiving changes and those changes being written to the DB.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.LoadNativeLibraryWindows
histogram.summary: This metric records the LoadLibraryExW and LoadLibraryW Windows API call results, which are used in native_library_win.cc.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.NativeLibraryHack
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 11/2014, removed from code.
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates whether the workaround of a Sony framework bug was used. The metric is Android-specific, and is logged when the browser starts. See more details at http://crbug.com/311644.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.PercentageOfResidentCodeBeforePrefetch
histogram.summary: Percentage of the native library code pages resident in memory. Recorded immediately before the library prefetching kicks in, only on Android.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.PrefetchStatus
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the forking of a child process to prefetch the native library succeeded. This metric is Android-specific, and is logged when the browser starts.

histogram.name: Linux.GlibcVersion
histogram.summary: The version of glibc used. (Linux only) Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Linux.SandboxStatus
histogram.summary: The Linux sandbox status. This describes what sandboxing features are enabled (such as the suid/namespace sandboxes, various namespaces, seccomp bpf, ...). Emitted once at startup.

histogram.name: Linux.WindowManager
histogram.summary: The window manager used. (Linux only) Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Linux.X11.ServerRTT
histogram.summary: RTT between Chrome and the X11 server. Tracked in X11EventSource by measuring the latency to receive a property event after changing a property.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.ClientRestartAttempts
histogram.summary: Records number of attempts to start local discovery.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.DetectorRestartTime
histogram.summary: Time between detector restarts.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.DetectorTriggerTime
histogram.summary: Time before detector trigger notifications.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.DevicesPage
histogram.summary: Records events related to devices page.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.FirewallAccessTime
histogram.summary: Windows only histogram that reports request time spend accessing firewall rules. It's logged once per browser process lifetime, when local discovery is used first time.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.IsFirewallReady
histogram.summary: Windows only histogram that reports, whether a firewall is set, so we can bind inbound sockets. It's logged once per browser process lifetime, when local discovery is used first time.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.PrivetNotificationsEvent
histogram.summary: Records events related to local discovery notifications.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.BrowserLocalStorageCachePurgedInKB
histogram.summary: Total size of the HTML5 LocalStorage browser-side cache purged in KB when memory pressure signal was triggered or cache size hit the limits.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.BrowserLocalStorageCacheSizeInKB
histogram.summary: Total size of the HTML5 LocalStorage databases in KB in the browser-side cache recorded each time a new database is opened in memory.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.BrowserLocalStorageSizeInKB
histogram.summary: Size of the HTML5 LocalStorage DB in KB in the browser-side cache.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.BrowserTimeToPrimeLocalStorage
histogram.summary: Time to load HTML5 LocalStorage into the browser-side cache.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.CommitDelay
histogram.summary: Delay between a page making changes and those changes being written to the DB.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.MojoSizeInKB
histogram.summary: Size of the HTML5 LocalStorage DB in KB in the renderer-side cache using Mojo implementation.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.MojoTimeToPrime
histogram.summary: Time (in ms) to load HTML5 LocalStorage into the renderer-side cache using Mojo implementation.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.MojoTimeToPrimeFor
histogram.summary: Time (in ms) to load HTML5 LocalStorage into the renderer-side cache using Mojo implementation, split by size.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.RendererLocalStorageSizeInKB
histogram.summary: Size of the HTML5 LocalStorage DB in KB in the renderer-side cache.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.RendererTimeToPrimeLocalStorage
histogram.summary: Time to load HTML5 LocalStorage into the renderer-side cache.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.TimeToPrimeLocalStorage
histogram.summary: Time to load HTML5 LocalStorage into the renderer-side cache. Note that the name is not 'Renderer' prefixed for continuity with the old naming.

histogram.name: LocalStorageContext.CommitResult
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to commit localstorage data to the database.

histogram.name: LocalStorageContext.DatabaseOpenError
histogram.summary: The result of a failed attempt to open a LevelDB database for LocalStorage.

histogram.name: LocalStorageContext.DatabaseOpenError.Disk
histogram.summary: The result of a failed attempt to open a LevelDB database for LocalStorage on disk.

histogram.name: LocalStorageContext.DatabaseOpenError.Memory
histogram.summary: The result of a failed attempt to open a LevelDB database for LocalStorage in memory.

histogram.name: LocalStorageContext.DestroyDBResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to delete the LocalStorage database.

histogram.name: LocalStorageContext.DirectoryOpenError
histogram.summary: The reason opening a directory for the LevelDB database that backs LocalStorage failed.

histogram.name: LocalStorageContext.MapLoadError
histogram.summary: The reason loading an initial snapshot of the localstorage data for an origin failed.

histogram.name: LocalStorageContext.OpenError
histogram.summary: The reason opening the LevelDB database that backs LocalStorage failed.

histogram.name: LocalStorageContext.ReadVersionError
histogram.summary: The reason reading the schema version of the LocalStorage database failed.

histogram.name: Login.ConsumerNewUsersAllowed
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram tracking, per consumer sign-in, whether the device owner is allowing arbitrary accounts to be used on the device, or only those on a specific whitelist.

histogram.name: Login.CustomFlags
histogram.summary: A set of chrome flags that required browser restart on Chrome OS user sign in.

histogram.name: Login.FailureReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS login failure reason.

histogram.name: Login.LeastUsedAccountDays
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of the days since the least frequently used account signed in. Reported on every boot and once a day after that.

histogram.name: Login.NewUserPriorityPrefsSyncResult
histogram.summary: Records whether a new user's priority prefs sync timed out.

histogram.name: Login.NewUserPriorityPrefsSyncTime
histogram.summary: Time spent waiting for priority preferences to sync after new user sign in. The operation will time out after 10s.

histogram.name: Login.OfflineFailure.IsKnownUser
histogram.summary: On offline login failure, records whether it is for an existing user.

histogram.name: Login.OfflineSuccess.Attempts
histogram.summary: On offline login success, records number of attempts, including success.

histogram.name: Login.PasswordChangeFlow
histogram.summary: Records the UI flow after a possible password change is detected.

histogram.name: Login.PolicyFilesStatePerBoot
histogram.summary: The state of Chrome OS owner key and device policy files.

histogram.name: Login.PromptToCompleteLoginTime
histogram.summary: Time from first display of the login prompt until the user completes signing in.

histogram.name: Login.ReauthReason
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason why a user was sent through the GAIA re-auth flow.

histogram.name: Login.StateKeyGenerationStatus
histogram.summary: Result of a state key generation operation.

histogram.name: Login.SuccessReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS login success reason.

histogram.name: Login.TokenCheckResponseTime
histogram.summary: Time between sending a request to, and receiving a reply from, GAIA token endpoint to validate TokenInfo.

histogram.name: Login.TokenObtainResponseTime
histogram.summary: Time between sending a request to, and receiving a reply from, GAIA token endpoint to obtain TokenInfo.

histogram.name: Login.UsersActiveWeekly
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of number of users who have logged in in the last 7 days. Reported on every boot and once a day after that.

histogram.name: Login.UsersActiveWeekly.Percent
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of percentage of local users who have logged in in the last 7 days. Reported on every boot and once a day after that.

histogram.name: Login.UserType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of the way a user logs in and whether Chrome OS is running normal or developer mode.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.ChromeOS.PasswordChange
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of supervised user password change result.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.FilteringResult
histogram.summary: The counts of results from supervised user URL filtering. Each entry includes the outcome of the filter (i.e. allowed, blocked, or unknown) and the page transition type (how the user got there, e.g. typed URL, clicked link).

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.SafeSitesDelay
histogram.summary: The extra page load delays introduced by network requests due to the supervised user SafeSites feature, measured once per page load.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.SafetyFilter
histogram.summary: The counts of results from the supervised user safety filter. Each entry includes the outcome of the filter (i.e. allowed, blocked, or unknown) and the page transition type (how the user got there, e.g. typed URL, clicked link). This only includes URL requests that were handled by the SafeSites filter (both online and the static blacklist).

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.Whitelist.Count
histogram.summary: The number of whitelists installed for a supervised user. Recorded at every profile startup.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.Whitelist.JsonParseDuration
histogram.summary: The total amount of time taken to parse the JSON contents of a whitelist out of process.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.Whitelist.ReadDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to read a whitelist file from disk.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.Whitelist.TotalLoadDuration
histogram.summary: The total amount of time taken to load a whitelist from disk and parse it, including jumps to the blocking thread.

histogram.name: Manifest.FetchResult
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the Manifest fetch succeed and why it failed if it failed.

histogram.name: Manifest.HasProperty
histogram.summary: Tracks which properties of a Manifest were present when it was parsed. If a property can't be parsed, it will be recorded as not present. These histograms will only be used if the Manifest was correctly fetched and parsed and the parsed manifest is not empty.

histogram.name: Manifest.IsEmpty
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the parsed Manifest is the empty Manifest.

histogram.name: Manifest.ParseSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks the Manifest parsing result. A failure will be recorded if the Manifest was incorrectly structured. This doesn't take into account parse failures for each individual properties.

histogram.name: Media.AcceleratedCompositingActive
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether accelerated compositing was used for HTML5 media rendering.

histogram.name: Media.Android.BackgroundVideoTime
histogram.summary: Android-specific metric. The time between the moment the backgrounded video playback is started (meaning the user just resumed the backgrounded video allowing playback) and the moment it stops being background playback by the current playing video either going foreground or being paused by the user. Note: on Android, videos are suspended when backgrounded.

histogram.name: Media.Android.IsHttpLiveStreamingMedia
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether a regular media URL is HLS (HTTP Live Streaming) media or not.

histogram.name: Media.Android.IsHttpLiveStreamingMediaPredictionResult
histogram.summary: Android: Records which HLS prediction based on the original URL was best.

histogram.name: Media.Android.MediaPlayerSuccess
histogram.summary: Android: Whether MediaPlayer exited without errors.

histogram.name: Media.Android.NumMediaServerCrashes
histogram.summary: Android: Number of consecutive media server crashes monitored before it is reset to 0. Reset happens if there are no crashes in a minute, or if user hits the "try again" button on the media throttle info bar.

histogram.name: Media.Android.ThrottleInfobarResponse
histogram.summary: Android: The distribution of responses to the media throttle infobar prompt.

histogram.name: Media.ArcGpuVideoDecodeAccelerator.InitializeResult
histogram.summary: Counts of status values returned from calls to ArcGpuVideoDecodeAccelerator::Initialize().

histogram.name: Media.Audible.ConcurrentTabsTime
histogram.summary: Records how long more than one tab is audible at the same time. The concurrent tabs might change during this period. The time recorded starts when the browser goes from one to two audbile tabs and stops when it is back below two.

histogram.name: Media.Audible.ConcurrentTabsWhenStarting
histogram.summary: Records how many tabs were audible when a new tab started to be audible.

histogram.name: Media.Audible.MaxConcurrentTabsInSession
histogram.summary: Records how many tabs are audible at the same time during the session. It is recording the maximum audible tab count everytime it increases. In other words, a session with N concurrent audible tabs will record entries from 1 through N exactly once.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.ActualInputBufferFrameSizeMac
histogram.summary: Size (in audio frames) of native I/O buffers that is set by the audio manager when calling AUAudioInputStream::Open(). I.e., it is the actual buffer size and it can differ from the one that the client requested. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.AudioUnitRenderHasWorkedMac
histogram.summary: Stored in combination with Media.Audio.RenderFailsWhenBufferSizeChangesMac. It is set to true if calls to AudioUnitRender has ever worked, i.e., we did not start to see kAudioUnitErr_CannotDoInCurrentContext error messages directly from start but there has been at least on successful call to AudioUnitRender.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.AutomaticGainControlMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if the Automatic Gain Control (AGC) is enabled or not. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Autoplay
histogram.summary: Records the autoplay source of audios.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Autoplay.Attribute.WaitTime
histogram.summary: Records time from load starts until audio starts based on autoplay attribute.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Autoplay.PlayMethod.WaitTime
histogram.summary: Records time from load starts until audio starts based on play method.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.CallbackError
histogram.summary: A boolean that reflects whether or not an error was reported during audio capture.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.FramesProvided
histogram.summary: The number of captured audio frames that is provided by the operating system in each callback. Typically, Chrome will want to use a 10 ms buffer (e.g. 480 frames for a sample rate of 48 kHz), but the OS may decide to capture e.g. 256 frames of audio at a time. If the desired frame size is used, the emitted value is special-cased to be 0. This histogram then shows how frequent it is that the desired number of frames is used and if not, the number of frames used in practice. The number of frames per callback is normally constant or very rarely changed throughout the lifetime of the audio stream. The first value that differs from the desired value is stored and logged when an audio input stream is closed. Any further differences during the lifetime will be ignored.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.Glitches
histogram.summary: The number of glitches that were detected at the OS level while an audio stream was active. A glitch is detected if the OS has to skip providing a set of frames. This value is logged when an audio input stream is closed.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.HighLatencyCallbackError
histogram.summary: A boolean that reflects whether or not an error was reported during audio capture for a high latency stream.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.LargestGlitchMs
histogram.summary: The length in milliseconds of the largest audio glitch that was detected at the OS level. This value is logged when an audio input stream that has suffered glitches is closed.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.LostFramesInMs
histogram.summary: The combined length in milliseconds of audio glitches that was detected at the OS level. This is useful to know in particular for audio processing such as echo cancellation. This value is logged when an audio input stream that has suffered glitches is closed.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.LowLatencyCallbackError
histogram.summary: A boolean that reflects whether or not an error was reported during audio capture for a low latency stream.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.VirtualCallbackError
histogram.summary: A boolean that reflects whether or not an error was reported during audio capture for a virtual stream.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.Win.InitError
histogram.summary: Error codes from IAudioClient::Initialize() in WASAPIAudioInputStream::InitializeAudioEngine on Windows.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.Win.Open
histogram.summary: Success/error cases for opening an audio input stream on Windows.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputBufferSizeWasChangedAudioWorkedMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if the size of the audio unit's IO buffer was changed when starting an input audio stream. Sampled each time an AUAudioInputStream instance is closed, i.e., we know that input audio has started as it should when this value is stored. Can be compared with Media.Audio.InputBufferSizeWasChangedMac which is only added when input audio fails to start.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputBufferSizeWasChangedMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if the size of the audio unit's IO buffer was changed when starting an input audio stream. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputDevicePropertyChangedMac
histogram.summary: Lists device properties that have been changed during an audio input stream session. We update a map of different property changes during a session and all these values are recorded when an AUAudioInputStream object is closed, hence multiple enum values can be emitted when the histogram is stored.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputDevicePropertyChangedStartupFailedMac
histogram.summary: Lists device properties that have been changed during an audio input stream session. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure' and multiple enum values can be emitted each time that happens.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputRestartAttemptsMac
histogram.summary: Counts the total number of times an attempt to restart input audio has been done. The value is stored once when a stream is closed and updated when it has been detected that input audio callbacks are not generated as expected.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if audio capturing did start after stream startup was requested. Sampled once, a few seconds after a stream has been asked to start.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputStartWasDeferredAudioWorkedMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if audio capturing started with a small delay or not. Sampled each time an AUAudioInputStream instance is closed, i.e., we know that input audio has started as it should when this value is stored. Can be compared with Media.Audio.InputStartWasDeferredMac which is only added when input audio fails to start.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputStartWasDeferredMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if audio capturing started with a small delay or not. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.IsOnBatteryPowerMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if the Mac OSX device is on battery power or not. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.LogicalProcessorsMac
histogram.summary: The number of logical processors/cores available on the Mac OSX device. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.NumberOfBasicInputStreamsMac
histogram.summary: Number of created default input audio streams. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.NumberOfLowLatencyInputStreamsMac
