histogram.summary: Number of created low-latency input audio streams. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.NumberOfOutputStreamsMac
histogram.summary: Number of created output audio streams. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.OutputDeviceAuthorizationTime
histogram.summary: Time delta between the moment output device authorization request is received by the browser and the moment its processessing is finished (and reply is to be sent back to the renderer if IPC is not closed yet).

histogram.name: Media.Audio.PhysicalProcessorsMac
histogram.summary: The number of physical processors/cores available on the Mac OSX device. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.AudioInputsPerMixer.LatencyExact
histogram.summary: Number of simultaneous inputs coming to the AudioRendererMixer which renders audio with user specified latency. The value is logged each time it reaches a new maximum for the mixer. It is useful for evaluating how mixing audio in renderer reduces the number of output audio streams going from the renderer to the browser.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.AudioInputsPerMixer.LatencyInteractive
histogram.summary: Number of simultaneous inputs coming to the AudioRendererMixer which renders audio with interactive latency. The value is logged each time it reaches a new maximum for the mixer. It is useful for evaluating how mixing audio in renderer reduces the number of output audio streams going from the renderer to the browser.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.AudioInputsPerMixer.LatencyPlayback
histogram.summary: Number of simultaneous inputs coming to the AudioRendererMixer which renders audio with playback latency. The value is logged each time it reaches a new maximum for the mixer. It is useful for evaluating how mixing audio in renderer reduces the number of output audio streams going from the renderer to the browser.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.AudioInputsPerMixer.LatencyRtc
histogram.summary: Number of simultaneous inputs coming to the AudioRendererMixer which renders audio with real time latency. The value is logged each time it reaches a new maximum for the mixer. It is useful for evaluating how mixing audio in renderer reduces the number of output audio streams going from the renderer to the browser.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.AudioMixing.LatencyMap
histogram.summary: Subset of audio output latencies encountered by the renderer so far. Logged each time an audio output with a new latency starts playing. The values are bitsets where each bit represents corresponding latency according to AudioLatency::LatencyType. Useful for understanding usecases for audio output mixing in renderer.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.BrowserCallbackRegularity
histogram.summary: Reflects how regularly browser issues audio requests to renderer. Depends on how well the system buffer size the browser side renders audio at and the buffer size it requests from renderer are aligned. When zero, it means renderer buffer size is a multiple of system buffer size, and render calls from browser to renderer are issued evenly. When -1, it means the renderer buffer size is larger than system buffer size, but is not an exact multiple of it; in this case browser periodically skips a call to renderer. When positive, floor(value/2) reflects the number of extra consecutive render requests issued by browser to renderer each time to fulfill the system audio render request; if (value/2) is not integer, then plus one more extra call is issued periodically. The metric is recorded on the edge between browser and renderer. On Mac the system buffer size may vary dynamically, the metric does not capture that: only the buffer size mismatch introduced by audio output device configuration is captured.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.FramesRequested
histogram.summary: The number of frames audio is actually rendered at if the number is different from the desired number of frames. If the desired frame size is used, this value will be 0. Typically, Chrome will want to use a 10ms buffer (e.g. 480 frames for a sample rate of 48kHz), but we might have to render audio 256 frames at a time. This histogram gives us an indication as to how frequent that is and what buffer sizes are used in practice. This value is logged when an audio output stream is stopped.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.GetSourceDataTime.WebRTC
histogram.summary: The time spent to get audio data from the source. For WebRTC, it's the time spent in WebRtcAudioRenderer::SourceCallback. Logged every function call, which is every 10 ms.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.GetSourceDataTimeMax.WebRTC
histogram.summary: The maximum time spent to get audio data from the source during a session. For WebRTC, it's the time spent in WebRtcAudioRenderer::SourceCallback. A session is between Start() and Stop() of WebRtcAudioRenderer.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.Glitches
histogram.summary: The number of glitches that were detected at the OS level while an audio stream was active. A glitch is detected if the OS has to skip rendering a set of frames. This value is logged when an audio output stream is stopped.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.LargestGlitchMs
histogram.summary: The length in milliseconds of the largest glitch that was detected at the OS level. This value is logged when an audio output stream that has suffered glitches is stopped.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.LostFramesInMs
histogram.summary: The combined length in milliseconds of audio glitches. This is useful to know in particular for audio processing such as echo cancellation. This value is logged when an audio output stream that has suffered glitches is stopped.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.OutputDeviceAuthorizationTimedOut
histogram.summary: Whether audio output device timed out waiting for authorization reply from the browser side.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.OutputDeviceStatus
histogram.summary: Device status received in response to device authorization request.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.SinkCache.GetOutputDeviceInfoCacheUtilization
histogram.summary: Whether a cached sink was used to get audio output device information, or a new sink was created for that.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.SinkCache.InfoSinkReusedForOutput
histogram.summary: When a new sink is created to get output device information, it is cached. This metric shows if such a sink is later reused for audio output (can happen no more than once) or deleted unused after timeout expires. Logged when one of the abovementioned events takes place.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.SinkCache.UsedForSinkCreation
histogram.summary: Whether a sink was created through the sink cache or directly.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.RenderFailsWhenBufferSizeChangesMac
histogram.summary: True if a call to AudioUnitRender failed with an error code of kAudioUnitErr_CannotDoInCurrentContext (-10863) and the call was preceded with a change in the native I/O buffer size. This value is logged while input audio is active but it should be a very rare event.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.RequestedInputBufferFrameSizeMac
histogram.summary: Size (in audio frames) the client has asked for when creating an AUAudioInputStream object. It might not be able to fulfill this request. The actual size is given by Media.Audio.ActualInputBufferFrameSizeMac. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.ResumeEventsMac
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the system has resumed from power suspension. Counting is reset each time Chrome restarts. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.UptimeMac
histogram.summary: Reports the system uptime in hours for Mac OS X devices. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.AudioBitsPerChannel
histogram.summary: Bits per channel of HTML5 audio sample data.

histogram.name: Media.AudioCapturerAudioGlitches
histogram.summary: Whether there is input audio glitches due to dropped input audio data or not. Sampled when a low-latency input audio stream is destructed.

histogram.name: Media.AudioCapturerDroppedData
histogram.summary: The percentage of input audio data that was dropped at the browser/renderer boundary due to for example buffer overflow in the writer side buffer or in the socket. Reported at the destruction of low-latency audio input stream.

histogram.name: Media.AudioCapturerMissedReadDeadline
histogram.summary: The percentage of input audio data blocks that had to be buffered because there was not room in the shared memory ring buffer on the browser/renderer boundary. This happens if the reading side hasn't read data in time. Reported at the destruction of low-latency audio input stream.

histogram.name: Media.AudioCapturerRepetition
histogram.summary: Captures bit-exact audio repetitions with pre-defined look back time. As soon as a repetition is detected, its look back time is reported. Ideally, no reports should be generated.

histogram.name: Media.AudioChannelLayout
histogram.summary: Audio channel layout in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.AudioCodec
histogram.summary: Audio codec used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.AudioInputCbErrorMac
histogram.summary: Error codes that AudioUnitRender() returns in AUAudioInputStream on Mac.

histogram.name: Media.AudioInputController
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken for AudioInputController::

histogram.name: Media.AudioInputControllerCaptureStartupSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether capture started successfully after an input stream startup was requested.

histogram.name: Media.AudioInputControllerSessionSilenceReport
histogram.summary: The silence report for an audio input device session.

histogram.name: Media.AudioInputDeviceManager
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken for AudioInputDeviceManager::

histogram.name: Media.AudioOutputController
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken for AudioOutputController::

histogram.name: Media.AudioOutputControllerDataNotReady
histogram.summary: Time spent waiting in AudioOutputController::WaitTillDataReady() if the data was not initially available.

histogram.name: Media.AudioOutputControllerPlaybackStartupSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether playback started successfully after stream startup was requested.

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererAudioGlitches
histogram.summary: Captures if render-side audio glitches are detected or not. Sampled when a low-latency output audio stream is destructed.

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererEvents
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Mar 2016 in favor of a new PipelineStatus code.
histogram.summary: Captures statistics for various AudioRendererImpl events.

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererIpcStreams
histogram.summary: The maximum number of simultaneous audio render streams over IPC created in AudioRendererHost for a render process. Logged at render process shutdown.

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererIpcStreamsTotal
histogram.summary: The maximum number of simultaneous audio render streams over IPC created in AudioRendererHost for all render processes. Logged at render process shutdown.

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererMissedDeadline
histogram.summary: Percentage of AudioSyncReader::Read() calls where the renderer missed its realtime deadline.

histogram.name: Media.AudioSampleFormat
histogram.summary: Audio sample format in HTML5 media. Logged when Audio Decoder initializes.

histogram.name: Media.AudioSamplesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Audio samples per second in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.AudioSamplesPerSecondUnexpected
histogram.summary: Audio samples per second in HTML5 media (atypical values, in Hz).

histogram.name: Media.AudioThreadStatus
histogram.summary: State of the audio thread. A value of "started" is emitted once the hang monitor has been initialized. If the thread is detected as hung later, a value of "hung" is emitted. If the hung thread later recovers a value of "recovered" is emitted.

histogram.name: Media.AudioTrackProcessingStates
histogram.summary: State of the media stream audio track processing, sampled once during the life time of a MediaStreamAudioProcessor.

histogram.name: Media.Autoplay.CrossOrigin.Result
histogram.summary: The result of autoplaying video elements in cross-origin iframes.

histogram.name: Media.AVDA.FrameSentAsOverlay
histogram.summary: Record a count for each frame sent to the client by AVDA. True counts indicate that the frame was an overlay (SurfaceView). False counts are for SurfaceTexture frames.

histogram.name: Media.AVDA.InputQueueTime
histogram.summary: The time that a bitstream buffer spends in AVDA's pending bitstream buffer queue before it is fed to MediaCodec.

histogram.name: Media.AVDA.MissingFormatChanged
histogram.summary: Number of times that AVDA stopped decoding because MediaCodec failed to provide a FORMAT_CHANGED message before sending decoded frames back. True counts indicate instances where FORMAT_CHANGE was missed, while false instances indicate any MediaCodec initialization by AVDA.

histogram.name: Media.AVDA.NumAVDAInstances
histogram.summary: The number of concurrently running AndroidVideoDecodeAccelerators. Logged during each AVDA initialization.

histogram.name: Media.AVDA.VirtualContext
histogram.summary: Number of times that AVDA's deferred rendering encountered a virtual GL context. True counts indicate virtual, false counts indicate not.

histogram.name: Media.AvdaCodecImage.WaitTimeForFrame
histogram.summary: Time spent waiting for a frame to become available in a SurfaceTexture after requesting that MediaCodec renders it.

histogram.name: Media.CacheUseful
histogram.summary: Whether a media response might be used to satisfy a future request.

histogram.name: Media.ChromeCast.DelayedAndDroppedFramesPer5Sec
histogram.summary: The average number of delayed and dropped frames for the ChromeCast application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.ChromeCast.DisplayedFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The average number of displayed frames for the ChromeCast application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.ChromeCast.TimeToBufferAv
histogram.summary: Time needed to pre-buffer A/V data before the actual playback for the ChromeCast application.

histogram.name: Media.ChromeCast.TimeToBufferAvAfterAbort
histogram.summary: Time needed to buffer A/V data after an abort for the ChromeCast application.

histogram.name: Media.ChromeCast.TimeToBufferAvAfterUnderrun
histogram.summary: Time needed to buffer A/V data after an underrun for the ChromeCast application.

histogram.name: Media.Controls.Download
histogram.summary: Records events and user interactions related to the download button shown on media elements.

histogram.name: Media.Controls.Show
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated May 19 2016 in favor of Media.Controls.Show.{Audio,Video}
histogram.summary: Record whether the default media controls were shown and why every time they could be shown.

histogram.name: Media.Controls.Show.Audio
histogram.summary: Record whether the default media controls of an audio element were shown and why every time they could be shown. Note that audio elements that were not insterted to the DOM and do not have a controls attribute are not taken into account.

histogram.name: Media.Controls.Show.Video
histogram.summary: Record whether the default media controls of a video element were shown and why every time they could be shown.

histogram.name: Media.CrosBeamformingDeviceState
histogram.summary: The state of the user selected virtual beamforming audio device on CrOS. It's logged whenever the format of the audio input stream is queried, which at least happens on stream startup, but could happen at other times as well.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedAudioCodec
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Sep 15 2015 in favor of Media.DetectedAudioCodecHash
histogram.summary: Audio codec used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedAudioCodecHash
histogram.summary: Audio codec used in HTML5 media. Reporting corrected in M51 to include all detected audio codecs, not just those up to and including the first one supported.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedContainer
histogram.summary: Container used for HTML5 media. Views that include pre-M34 data will categorize dash (38) and smooth streaming (39) in the "Other" bucket.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedTrackCount.Audio
histogram.summary: Number of detected audio tracks in HTML5 media. Not all may be usable by the player.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedTrackCount.Text
histogram.summary: Number of detected text tracks in HTML5 media. Not all may be usable by the player.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedTrackCount.Video
histogram.summary: Number of detected video tracks in HTML5 media. Not all may be usable by the player.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedVideoCodec
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Sep 15 2015 in favor of Media.DetectedVideoCodecHash
histogram.summary: Video codec used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedVideoCodecHash
histogram.summary: Video codec used in HTML5 media. Reporting corrected in M51 to include all detected video codecs, not just those up to and including the first one supported.

histogram.name: Media.DevicePermissionActions
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the actions taken in the media infobar, which prompts the users for device permission.

histogram.name: Media.DroppedFrameCount
histogram.summary: Count of dropped frames between pipeline start and stop. Media pipeline starts/stops when an HTML5 video is loaded/unloaded respectively in the browser.

histogram.name: Media.Duration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2017 in favor of Media.Duration2 with larger max bucket.
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of HTML5 media (when known).

histogram.name: Media.Duration2
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of HTML5 media (when known).

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmFileIO.FileSizeKBOnError
histogram.summary: Size in KB of the last file successfully read by the CDM through CDM FileIO before a specific error happens. This is reported only when the error happens, which should be rare.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmFileIO.FileSizeKBOnFirstRead
histogram.summary: Size in KB of the first file successfully read by the CDM through CDM FileIO. This is recorded once per CDM instance.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmInterfaceVersion
histogram.summary: Chromium could support multiple versions of CDM interface. This metric records the CDM interface version that the CDM created by Chromium uses. This is recorded once per CDM instance.

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey
histogram.summary: Result of promises for Clear Key key systems that were handled by Chromium code.

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey.addKey
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: addKey result using the Clear Key key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey.cancelKeyRequest
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: cancelKeyRequest result using the Clear Key key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey.CreateCdmTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to create the CDM instance for Clear Key key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey.generateKeyRequest
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: generateKeyRequest result using the Clear Key key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey.KeyAdded
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: KeyAdded event count using the Clear Key key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey.KeyError
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: KeyError event count using the Clear Key key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.ClearKey.TimeTo
histogram.summary: The time it takes to resolve a CDM promise for Clear Key key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.EncryptedMediaEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether encrypted media is enabled when requestMediaKeySystemAccess() is called. User can enable and disable encrypted media in content settings. Recorded when requestMediaKeySystemAccess() is called but will be reported at most once per renderer process.

histogram.name: Media.EME.IsIncognito
histogram.summary: Whether a given WebMediaPlayer instance, with a CDM attached, is played in an incognito window or in ChromeOS guest mode. Players that never started playback are excluded. Recorded once at time of player destruction.

histogram.name: Media.EME.KeySystemSupport.Widevine
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: Key system support query status and result. Each enum value will be reported at most once per renderer process.

histogram.name: Media.EME.NeedKey
histogram.summary: EME NeedKey event count.

histogram.name: Media.EME.OutputProtection
histogram.summary: Output protection query status and result. One query and one positive (no unprotected external links) result (if any) are reported per CDM instance.

histogram.name: Media.EME.RequestMediaKeySystemAccess
histogram.summary: Key system support query status and result, as reported by RequestMediaKeySystemAccess. Each value will be reported at most once per renderer process.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown
histogram.summary: Result of promises for unknown key systems that were handled by Chromium code.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.addKey
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: addKey result using an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.cancelKeyRequest
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: cancelKeyRequest result using an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.CreateCdmTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to create the CDM instance for an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.generateKeyRequest
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: generateKeyRequest result using an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.KeyAdded
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: KeyAdded event count using an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.KeyError
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: KeyError event count using an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.SystemCode
histogram.summary: System code count using an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Unknown.TimeTo
histogram.summary: The time it takes to resolve a CDM promise for an unknown key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine
histogram.summary: Result of promises for Widevine key systems that were handled by Chromium code.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.addKey
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.
histogram.summary: addKey result using the Widevine key system.

histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 with removal of prefixed EME.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.VideoCapability.HasEmptyRobustness
histogram.summary: Whether the robustness level of any video capability in the supported configuration passed into requestMediaKeySystemAccess() is empty. This is specific to the Widevine key system.

histogram.name: Media.FallbackHardwareAudioBitsPerChannel
histogram.summary: Bits per channel of the hardware audio device which failed to open in low latency mode and required high latency fallback.

histogram.name: Media.FallbackHardwareAudioChannelCount
histogram.summary: Channel count of the hardware audio device which failed to open in low latency mode and required high latency fallback.

histogram.name: Media.FallbackHardwareAudioChannelLayout
histogram.summary: Channel layout of the hardware audio device which failed to open in low latency mode and required high latency fallback.

histogram.name: Media.FallbackHardwareAudioSamplesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Samples per second of the hardware audio device which failed to open in low latency mode and required high latency fallback.

histogram.name: Media.FallbackHardwareAudioSamplesPerSecondUnexpected
histogram.summary: Samples per second of the hardware audio device (atypical values, in Hz) which failed to open in low latency mode and required high latency fallback.

histogram.name: Media.FallbackToHighLatencyAudioPath
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome had to fallback to the high latency audio path or not.

histogram.name: Media.Fling.DelayedAndDroppedFramesPer5Sec
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average number of delayed and dropped frames for the Fling application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.Fling.DisplayedFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The average number of displayed frames for the Fling application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.Fling.TimeToBufferAv
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time needed to pre-buffer A/V data before the actual playback for the Fling application.

histogram.name: Media.Fling.TimeToBufferAvAfterAbort
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time needed to buffer A/V data after an abort for the Fling application.

histogram.name: Media.Fling.TimeToBufferAvAfterUnderrun
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time needed to buffer A/V data after an underrun for the Fling application.

histogram.name: Media.GPU.HasEverLostContext
histogram.summary: Records when a context provider is acquired in media, and when it's released because a context loss has been detected.

histogram.name: Media.GpuVideoDecoderError
histogram.summary: Counts of video decode errors reported to GpuVideoDecoder.

histogram.name: Media.GpuVideoDecoderInitializeStatus
histogram.summary: Results of attempts to GpuVideoDecoder::Initialize().

histogram.name: Media.HardwareAudioBitsPerChannel
histogram.summary: Bits per channel of the hardware audio device.

histogram.name: Media.HardwareAudioChannelCount
histogram.summary: Channel count of the hardware audio device.

histogram.name: Media.HardwareAudioChannelLayout
histogram.summary: Channel layout of the hardware audio device.

histogram.name: Media.HardwareAudioSamplesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Samples per second of the hardware audio device.

histogram.name: Media.HardwareAudioSamplesPerSecondUnexpected
histogram.summary: Samples per second of the hardware audio device (atypical values, in Hz).

histogram.name: Media.HasEverPlayed
histogram.summary: Whether a given WebMediaPlayer instance, after preload, started playback; recorded once at time of player destruction.

histogram.name: Media.HighLatencyAudioCaptureStartupSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether capture started successfully after a high-latency input stream startup was requested.

histogram.name: Media.InfoLoadDelay
histogram.summary: The time it takes to perform redirect tracking and a CORS access check while preparing to play a media file.

histogram.name: Media.Initialize.Windows
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2015 in Issue 1141703002. FFmpeg is now statically linked.
histogram.summary: Errors returned by LoadLibraryEx on Windows while attempting to load ffmpegsumo.dll.

histogram.name: Media.InputErrorMac
histogram.summary: Error codes that we encounter while setting up an AUAudioInputStream on Mac.

histogram.name: Media.InputInvalidSampleRateMac
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 02/2016.
histogram.summary: Invalid input sample rate when calling AUAudioInputStream::Open on Mac.

histogram.name: Media.InputStreamDuration
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of low-latency audio input streams. Sampled when the stream is closed by the AudioInputController.

histogram.name: Media.InputStreamDurationWithoutCallback
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of low-latency audio input streams which never got any callbacks.

histogram.name: Media.IsStreaming
histogram.summary: Whether the WMPI data source is streaming (does not support range requests).

histogram.name: Media.LinuxAudioIO
histogram.summary: Audio IO layer used by the Linux OS, sampled once at startup of the browser.

histogram.name: Media.LoadType
histogram.summary: Load type of HTML5 media, such as URL, MediaSource and MediaStream.

histogram.name: Media.LocalRendererSinkStates
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: State of the WebRtc local renderer, sampled once during the lifetime of a local renderer.

histogram.name: Media.LowLatencyAudioCaptureStartupSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether capture started successfully after a low-latency input stream startup was requested.

histogram.name: Media.MediaElement.ContentTypeParseable
histogram.summary: Whether the content type provided to HTMLMediaElement would parse with ParsedContentType or not.

histogram.name: Media.MicrophoneMuted
histogram.summary: Heuristically detects if the user has muted the microphone or not. Measured approximately four times per minute.

histogram.name: Media.MicrophoneVolume
histogram.summary: Level of the microphone volume measured in percent. This value can be larger than 100% on Linux. Measured approximately four times per minute.

histogram.name: Media.Midi.InputPorts
histogram.summary: Connected input port numbers on the initialization.

histogram.name: Media.Midi.OutputPorts
histogram.summary: Connected output port numbers on the initialization.

histogram.name: Media.Midi.ResultOnShutdown
histogram.summary: The final status of MidiManager on browser shutdown.

histogram.name: Media.Midi.SysExMessageSizeUpTo1MB
histogram.summary: Reports sysex message size.

histogram.name: Media.Midi.Usage
histogram.summary: MidiManager usages to understand the API use case.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.AudioCodec
histogram.summary: Audio codec used in Media Source Extensions playback. Set when AddId() is called during playback.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.DetectedTrackCount.Audio
histogram.summary: Number of detected audio tracks in Media Source Extensions playback. Not all may be usable by the player.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.DetectedTrackCount.Text
histogram.summary: Number of detected text tracks in Media Source Extensions playback. Not all may be usable by the player. This count includes only explicitly signalled tracks in MSE initialization segments parsed from WebM or ISO BMFF bytestreams.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.DetectedTrackCount.Video
histogram.summary: Number of detected video tracks in Media Source Extensions playback. Not all may be usable by the player.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.LateAudioFrames
histogram.obsolete: Deleted along with browser side MSE implementation.
histogram.summary: Relative number of late audio frames wrt total number of audio frames in MSE playback, multiplied by one million. The audio frame is considered late if it might cause an underrun, i.e. comes from decoder when audio buffer is already depleted.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.LateVideoFrames
histogram.obsolete: Deleted along with browser side MSE implementation.
histogram.summary: Relative number of late video frames wrt total number of video frames in MSE playback, multiplied by one million. The video frame is late if it missed its presentation time as determined by PTS when it comes from decoder. The rendering policy (i.e. render or skip) does not affect it.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.NumberOfTracks
histogram.summary: Number of tracks specified to AddId() for Media Source Extensions playback. May be called multiple times per element if playback is dynamically altered.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.Playback
histogram.summary: Whether Media Source Extensions is specified for playback of Media elements. Sampled when media pipeline starts.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.PlaybackDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deleted along with browser side MSE implementation.
histogram.summary: Duration of an uninterrupted MSE playback. This is the time interval between the playback starts or resumes and the moment when user stops the playback by pressing pause, initiating a seek etc. Measured in media time in milliseconds.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.Starvations
histogram.obsolete: Deleted along with browser side MSE implementation.
histogram.summary: Relative number of starvations wrt total number of frames in MSE playback, multiplied by one million. Starvation happens when the player interrupts the regular playback and asks for more data, conditions are player-specific.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.VideoCodec
histogram.summary: Video codec used in Media Source Extensions playback. Set when AddId() is called during playback.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.VideoCodec.MP4
histogram.summary: Video codec used in Media Source Extensions playback if the media container is MP4. Set when AddId() is called during playback.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.VideoCodec.WebM
histogram.summary: Video codec used in Media Source Extensions playback if the media container is WebM. Set when AddId() is called during playback.

histogram.name: Media.Netflix.AudioBitrate
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The audio bit rate as reported by the Netflix application. May be reported multiple times as network conditions change during playback.

histogram.name: Media.Netflix.AudioNumChannels
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of audio channels as reported by the Netflix application. May be reported multiple times as network conditions change during playback.

histogram.name: Media.Netflix.DelayedAndDroppedFramesPer5Sec
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average number of delayed and dropped frames for the Netflix application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.Netflix.DisplayedFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The average number of displayed frames for the Netflix application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.Netflix.VideoBitrate
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Video bit rate as reported by the Netflix application. May be reported multiple times as network conditions change during playback.

histogram.name: Media.Netflix.VideoHeight
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Video height as reported by the Netflix application. May be reported multiple times as network conditions change during playback.

histogram.name: Media.Notification.Click
histogram.summary: The type of media notification the user clicked to go back to Chrome.

histogram.name: Media.Pepper.PlayedSound
histogram.summary: Whether Pepper players have played sound through its lifetime.

histogram.name: Media.PepperVideoDecoderError
histogram.summary: Counts of video decode errors reported to plugin.

histogram.name: Media.PepperVideoDecoderPictureCount
histogram.summary: Number of PictureBuffers/textures requested per hardware decoder creation. This value varies by platform and video. A user visible video may trigger multiple decoder creations (sometimes every 5 seconds) but would normally not hold more than 2 sets of buffers at any given time in memory.

histogram.name: Media.PepperVideoDecoderPictureHeight
histogram.summary: Vertical video resolution rounded to the nearest bucket. (Corresponds roughly to the number in 720p.)

histogram.name: Media.PipelineStatus
histogram.summary: Status of the media pipeline at the end of its lifecycle suffixed by stream and video decoder type.

histogram.name: Media.PipelineStatus.Start
histogram.summary: Status of the media pipeline starting process (including demuxer and renderer initialization). If the media pipeline is destroyed during the starting process nothing will be reported, but this should relatively rare.

histogram.name: Media.PlayMovies.DelayedAndDroppedFramesPer5Sec
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average number of delayed and dropped frames for the PlayMovies application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.PlayMovies.DisplayedFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The average number of displayed frames for the PlayMovies application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AllowedByPage
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a web page allows content to be remoted.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AudioBitrate
histogram.summary: Measured audio content transfer bitrate while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AudioChannelLayout
histogram.summary: Audio channel layout used while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AudioCodec
histogram.summary: Audio codec used while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AudioSamplesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Audio sampling rate while remoting audio content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AudioSamplesPerSecondUnexpected
histogram.summary: Audio sampling rate while remoting audio content (atypical values, in Hz).

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.PosterDownloadDuration.Fail
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it took to ultimately fail to download a poster image for an HTML5 video while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.PosterDownloadDuration.Success
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it took to successfully download a poster image for an HTML5 video while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.SessionDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of each remoting session.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.SessionStartTrigger
histogram.summary: Tracks the trigger for starting a remoting session.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.SessionStopTrigger
histogram.summary: Tracks the trigger for stopping a remoting session.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.TimeUntilFirstPlayout
histogram.summary: Measures how long, from the start of a remoting session, until content began playing out on the remote device.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.TimeUntilRemoteInitialized
histogram.summary: Measures how long, from the start of a remoting session, until a message was received from the remote device indicating initialization succeeded.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.TrackConfiguration
histogram.summary: Tracks whether audio or video or both are remoted.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.VideoAspectRatio
histogram.summary: Aspect ratio of video while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.VideoBitrate
histogram.summary: Measured video content transfer bitrate while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.VideoCodec
histogram.summary: Video codec used while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.VideoCodecProfile
histogram.summary: Video codec profile used while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.VideoNaturalWidth
histogram.summary: Video width while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.RTCVideoDecoderError
histogram.summary: Counts of video decode errors reported to RTCVideoDecoder.

histogram.name: Media.RTCVideoDecoderInitDecodeStatus
histogram.summary: Results of attempts to RTCVideoDecoder::InitDecode().

histogram.name: Media.RTCVideoDecoderInitDecodeSuccess
histogram.summary: Indicates whether we were successful in initializing hardware video decoder for use in the RTC pipeline.

histogram.name: Media.RTCVideoEncoderInitEncodeSuccess
histogram.summary: Indicates whether we were successful in initializing hardware video encoder for use in the RTC pipeline.

histogram.name: Media.RTCVideoEncoderProfile
histogram.summary: Video codec profile used in RTC video encoder.

histogram.name: Media.Session.ActiveTime
histogram.summary: Time during which a media session has been active, in other words, the time between an activation and deactivation, without counting time while it was suspended. If a session is activated after being deactivated, there will be two entries. For example, if a user plays a song but is interrupted by a phone call, it will only account for the song playing time.

histogram.name: Media.Session.Pause
histogram.summary: The number of times the user paused playback of a media session using other means than the pause button on the page.

histogram.name: Media.Session.Play
histogram.summary: The number of times the user started playback of a media session using other means than the play button on the page.

histogram.name: Media.Session.RequestAudioFocusResult
histogram.summary: Indicate whether the native requestAudioFocus() call was successful.

histogram.name: Media.Session.Stop
histogram.summary: The number of times the user stopped a media session using other means than the pause button on the page.

histogram.name: Media.Session.Suspended
histogram.summary: The number of times a media session is suspended and why it has been suspended.

histogram.name: Media.Session.UserAction
histogram.summary: The number of times user interacts with MediaSession sorted by action type.

histogram.name: Media.SRC.VideoCodec.MP4
histogram.summary: Video codec used in plain src= (not MSE) HTML5 media if the media container is MP4.

histogram.name: Media.SRC.VideoCodec.WebM
histogram.summary: Video codec used in plain src= (not MSE) HTML5 media if the media container is WebM.

histogram.name: Media.Timeline.DragGestureDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of the user gesture (how long their finger is down), recorded at the end of each drag gesture. This histogram is split according to the width of the slider track in CSS px - see histogram name suffix.

histogram.name: Media.Timeline.DragPercent
histogram.summary: The net distance the media scrubber moved, recorded at the end of each drag gesture, as a percentage of the width of the slider track. This histogram is split according to the width of the slider track in CSS px - see histogram name suffix.

histogram.name: Media.Timeline.DragSumAbsTimeDelta
histogram.summary: The sum of absolute distances the media scrubber incrementally moved, recorded at the end of each drag gesture, each measured as the change in media current time. If the scrubber was dragged back and forth before being released, this will be larger than the value recorded for Media.Timeline.DragTimeDelta (and may even be larger than the media duration), otherwise it will be the same as DragTimeDelta. This histogram is split according to the width of the slider track in CSS px - see histogram name suffix.

histogram.name: Media.Timeline.DragTimeDelta
histogram.summary: The net distance the media scrubber moved, recorded at the end of each drag gesture, measured as the change in media current time. This histogram is split according to the width of the slider track in CSS px - see histogram name suffix.

histogram.name: Media.Timeline.SeekType
histogram.summary: The type of user gesture, recorded at the end of each input sequence. For example holding down the right arrow key with the scrubber focused will only be logged as a single event. This histogram is split according to the width of the slider track in CSS px - see histogram name suffix.

histogram.name: Media.Timeline.Width
histogram.summary: The width of the media timeline track in CSS pixels, recorded the first time a media element with controls starts playing (strictly speaking, it's the width in CSS pixels ignoring CSS transforms, multiplied by pageZoomFactor, but deliberately ignoring pinch zoom's pageScaleFactor).

histogram.name: Media.TimeToPipelineStarted
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from HTML5 media pipeline creation to playing event.

histogram.name: Media.TotalMBytes
histogram.summary: Size of HTML5 media (when known), in MB.

histogram.name: Media.UncacheableReason
histogram.summary: Reasons a media response won't be used to satisfy a future request.

histogram.name: Media.UnderflowCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed Feb 2017. Media.UnderflowDuration provides more useful counts.
histogram.summary: The number of times a src= playback has underflowed; i.e. ran out of data.

histogram.name: Media.UnderflowDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to leave the underflow state (i.e. resume playback) for src= playbacks.

histogram.name: Media.UnderflowDuration.EME
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to leave the underflow state (i.e. resume playback) for Encrypted Media Extensions (EME) based playbacks.

histogram.name: Media.UnderflowDuration.MSE
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to leave the underflow state (i.e. resume playback) for Media Source Extensions (MSE) based playbacks.

histogram.name: Media.URLScheme
histogram.summary: URL scheme used with HTML5 media. (each URL provides one sample)

histogram.name: Media.VAJDA.DecoderFailure
histogram.summary: Error codes reported by jpeg decode using VA-API hardware jpeg decoder.

histogram.name: Media.VAVDA.DecoderFailure
histogram.summary: Error codes reported by video decode using VA-API hardware video decoder.

histogram.name: Media.VAVDAH264.DecoderFailure
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 4/2015, partially replaced by Media.VAVDA.DecoderFailure.
histogram.summary: Error codes reported by video decode using VA-API hardware video decoder.

histogram.name: Media.VAVEA.EncoderFailure
histogram.summary: Error codes reported by video encode using VA-API hardware video encoder.

histogram.name: Media.Video.Autoplay
histogram.summary: Records the autoplay source of videos. This includes Media.Video.Autoplay.Muted.

histogram.name: Media.Video.Autoplay.Attribute.WaitTime
histogram.summary: Records time from load starts until video starts based on autoplay attribute.

histogram.name: Media.Video.Autoplay.Muted
histogram.summary: Records the autoplay source of muted videos.

histogram.name: Media.Video.Autoplay.Muted.Attribute.OffscreenDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as autoplay muted video by attributed is paused when going offscreen since https://crbug.com/683141.
histogram.summary: Records the offscreen playing duration of a muted video autoplaying from autoplay attribute.

histogram.name: Media.Video.Autoplay.Muted.Blocked
histogram.summary: Records the reason why autoplay of muted videos was blocked.

histogram.name: Media.Video.Autoplay.Muted.PlayMethod.BecomesVisible
histogram.summary: Records muted video started playing with play() become visible at some point. The UMA for false is not complete since it is recorded in a destructor which is garbage-collected. Please subtract Media.Video.Autoplay.Muted "play() method" count with the true count of this histogram to obtain the real false count.

histogram.name: Media.Video.Autoplay.Muted.PlayMethod.OffscreenDuration
histogram.summary: Records the offscreen playing duration of a muted video autoplaying from play() method.

histogram.name: Media.Video.Autoplay.Muted.UnmuteAction
histogram.summary: Status of the unmute action on a video that autoplayed because it was muted.

histogram.name: Media.Video.Autoplay.PlayMethod.WaitTime
histogram.summary: Records time from load starts until video starts based on play method.

histogram.name: Media.Video.FullscreenOrientationLock.LockResult
histogram.summary: Result of the orientation lock attempt when a video enters fullscreen.

histogram.name: Media.Video.FullscreenOrientationLock.MetadataAvailability
histogram.summary: Status of the metadata when attempting to lock the screen orientation for a fullscreen video.

histogram.name: Media.Video.KeyFrameDistance
histogram.summary: Records the time distance between consequent keyframes in a video. The new value is recorded for each video key frame decoded.

histogram.name: Media.Video.TimeFromForegroundToFirstFrame
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 01/18/2017 in issue 670150. Replaced by Media.Video.TimeFromForegroundToFirstFrame.DisableTrack and Media.Video.TimeFromForegroundToFirstFrame.Paused.
histogram.summary: Records the time between the moment when the video element is brought to the foreground and when the video frame compositor outputs the next frame.

histogram.name: Media.Video.TimeFromForegroundToFirstFrame.DisableTrack
histogram.summary: Records the time between the moment when the video element that had video track disabled in the background is brought to the foreground and when the video frame compositor outputs the next frame. Recorded even if disabling video track in the background is turned off to collect data for the control group.

histogram.name: Media.Video.TimeFromForegroundToFirstFrame.Paused
histogram.summary: Records the time between the moment when the video element that was paused in the background is brought to the foreground and when the video frame compositor outputs the next frame. Recorded even if disabling pausing video in the background is turned off to collect data for the control group.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.AspectRatio
histogram.summary: Video Capture Device captured aspect ratio, as a rounded integer multiplied by 100. The collection is made in the VideoCaptureController upon reception of the first frame.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.BlacklistedDevice
histogram.summary: Counts appearances of Blacklisted Video Capture devices during enumeration. This collection happens during first enumeration in the appropriate platforms' VideoCaptureDeviceFactory.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.FrameRate
histogram.summary: Video Capture Device frame rate requested by VideoCaptureManager on AllocateAndStart(). The collection is made in the VideoCaptureController upon reception of the first frame.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.FramesReceived
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 10/2014 in issue 422822. Replaced by Media.VideoCaptureManager.Event and the two new values 3 and 4 in the enum VideoCaptureEvent.
histogram.summary: Whether any frames were received during a video capture session. This metric is recorded when a video source is stopped.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.Height
histogram.summary: Video Capture Device captured frame height in pixels. The collection is made in the VideoCaptureController upon reception of the first frame.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.MacBook.HardwareVersionWhenNoCamera
histogram.summary: MacBook hardware version used when Chrome cannot enumerate a video device. This is used for tracking http://crbug.com/582931.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.MacBook.NumberOfDevices
histogram.summary: Number of video capture devices detected by Chrome during device enumeration. Zero devices indicate a problem since all MacBooks should have a built-in camera. This is used for tracking http://crbug.com/582931.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.PixelFormat
histogram.summary: Pixel format provided by a Video Capture Device. The collection is made in the VideoCaptureController upon reception of the first frame.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.Width
histogram.summary: Video Capture Device captured frame width in pixels. The collection is made in the VideoCaptureController upon reception of the first frame.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCaptureApi.Mac
histogram.summary: Video Capture and device enumeration/monitoring API used for Mac OS Lion or later. Collection is made only once when the flags are parsed and the appropriate library selected and/or loaded, successfully or not.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCaptureGpuJpegDecoder.InitDecodeSuccess
histogram.summary: Indicates whether we were successful in initializing hardware jpeg decoder for attempts to VideoCaptureGpuJpegDecoder::Initialize().

histogram.name: Media.VideoCaptureManager
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken for VideoCaptureManager::

histogram.name: Media.VideoCaptureManager.Event
histogram.summary: Counts video capture event, such as start and stop capture. Note that the ideal case is 50% start events and 50% normal stop events.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCodec
histogram.summary: Video codec used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCodecProfile
histogram.summary: Video codec profile used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCodedAspectRatio
histogram.summary: Coded aspect ratio of HTML5 video.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCodedWidth
histogram.summary: Coded width of HTML5 video.

histogram.name: Media.VideoColorRange
histogram.summary: Pixel format color range of HTML5 video. Emitted on video load.

histogram.name: Media.VideoDecoderFallback
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome had to fall back to a secondary video decoder after the primary decoder failed reinitialization.

histogram.name: Media.VideoFormat
histogram.summary: Pixel format used in HTML5 video. Emitted on video load.

histogram.name: Media.VideoFrame.ColorSpace
histogram.summary: Video frame color space. Emitted for each video frame.

histogram.name: Media.VideoFrameColorSpace

histogram.name: Media.VideoFramePixelFormat

histogram.name: Media.VideoPersistence.AttemptResult
histogram.summary: Every time a video persistence session could be triggered, it records the result of the attempt.

histogram.name: Media.VideoPersistence.ControlsType
histogram.summary: Record the type of controls a persisted video is using. This is recorded every time a video enters persistence mode

histogram.name: Media.VideoPersistence.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the length during which a video was in a persistent state. It is recorded once per video persistence session.

histogram.name: Media.VideoPersistence.EndReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason why a video persistence session has ended.

histogram.name: Media.VideoPixelFormat
histogram.summary: Pixel format used in HTML5 video. Emitted on video load.

histogram.name: Media.VideoPixelFormatUnion
histogram.summary: Pixel format used in capture and HTML5 video. Emitted on video load.

histogram.name: Media.VideoRenderer.CadenceChanges
histogram.summary: Indicates how many cadence changes have occurred during playback, a zero value is emitted at the beginning of playback. Subsequent values are emitted during video rendering for each cadence change (up to a maximum of 10).

histogram.name: Media.VideoRenderer.LowDelay
histogram.summary: Indicates whether video is rendering in low delay mode. It's recorded when a video starts playing.

histogram.name: Media.VideoRotation
histogram.summary: Metadata rotation in mp4 videos. Emitted during demuxing.

histogram.name: Media.VideoTrackAdapter.FramesReceived
histogram.summary: If any frames were received during a video capture session. It's recorded when a video source is stopped.

histogram.name: Media.VideoVisibleAspectRatio
histogram.summary: Visible aspect ratio of HTML5 video.

histogram.name: Media.VideoVisibleWidth
histogram.summary: Visible width of HTML5 video.

histogram.name: Media.VirtualAudioCaptureStartupSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether capture started successfully after a high-latency input stream startup was requested.

histogram.name: Media.Vpx.VideoDecoderBuffersInUseByDecoder
histogram.summary: Number of frame buffers used by Vpx decoder.

histogram.name: Media.Vpx.VideoDecoderBuffersInUseByDecoderAndVideoFrame
histogram.summary: Number of frame buffers currently in use by both Vpx decoder and a VideoFrame.

histogram.name: Media.VpxVideoDecoder.Vp9DecodeTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time taken to decode one VP9 frame.

histogram.name: Media.VTVDA.HardwareAccelerated
histogram.summary: Whether a VTDecompressionSession is internally using hardware accelerated decoding.

histogram.name: Media.VTVDA.InitializationFailureReason
histogram.summary: Count of VideoToolbox initialization failure reasons. Successful initializations are counted as a special failure type. The sum of successes and failures gives a lower bound on the number of attempted initializations.

histogram.name: Media.VTVDA.SessionFailureReason
histogram.summary: Count of VTVDA session failure reasons. Successful initializations are counted as a special failure type. Since only successfully initialized session can fail, failures rates are computed as a simple ratio.

histogram.name: Media.WatchTime
histogram.summary:
Watch time is defined as the amount of elapsed media time for audio+video media aggregated per player instance. A minimum of 7 seconds of unmuted, foreground media must be watched to start watch time monitoring. Watch time is checked on a regular basis and reported to UMA upon one of the stop events mentioned below or at player destruction if none occur prior.
Any one of paused, hidden, or muted is sufficient to stop watch time metric reports. Each of these has a hysteresis where if the state change is undone within some time, the watch time will be counted as uninterrupted.
Power events (on/off battery power) have a similar hysteresis, but unlike the aforementioned properties, will not stop metric collection.
Each seek event will result in a new watch time metric being started and the old metric finalized as accurately as possible.

histogram.name: Media.WebAudioSourceProvider.SinkStatus
histogram.summary: Status of audio sink provided to WebMediaPlayer. If not OK, null sink will be used for audio output instead.

histogram.name: Media.WebMediaPlayerImpl.Memory

histogram.summary: The private working set used by the browser process. Recorded once per UMA ping. Note the existence of Memory.Browser.Large, which doesn't have overflow issues. TODO(rkaplow): This should be replaced with Memory.Browser.Large2 in M54.

histogram.name: Memory.Browser.Large
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 07/2016 as it reports wrong numbers. crbug.com/629354. Replaced with Memory.Browser.Large2
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the browser process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.summary: The private working set used by the browser process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.CompressibleStringCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Aug 2016. CompressibleString has been reverted once at https://crrev.com/2227933002.
histogram.summary: This records the frequency with which JavaScript source strings are compressed and decompressed in foreground and background tabs. Compressing runs 10 seconds after the tab goes background and decompressing runs when JavaScript source string is required (e.g. V8 starts to compile). This measurement is a preparation to introduce CompressibleString class for JavaScript source strings to reduce Blink memory usage.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.FreeMemoryUntilCritical
histogram.summary: Available free memory until the system will be in a critical state. Critical is as defined by the OS (swapping will occur, or physical memory will run out, etc).

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.StateDuration

histogram.summary: The global state of memory coordinator when a critical pressure notification is received.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.StateOnModerateNotificationReceived

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.TotalPrivate

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.TrimMemoryLevel.Normal
histogram.summary: Android: Records trim memory level when the global state is NORMAL.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.TrimMemoryLevel.Suspended
histogram.summary: Android: Records trim memory level when the global state is SUSPENDED.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.TrimMemoryLevel.Throttled
histogram.summary: Android: Records trim memory level when the global state is THROTTLED.

histogram.summary: The discardable memory allocation size in KB. Recorded each time a new discardable memory instance is created.

histogram.summary: Amount of reclaimed memory (in terms of the private working set size) after a purge request on the browser process. Recorded 2 seconds after the purge request.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Browser2
histogram.summary: The browser process's memory usage reported by the memory instrumentation service.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.DecompressedPagesPerSecond

This metric also has flaws and is not intended for permanent use. It's an emergency measure added to help debug https://crbug.com/713854. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Gpu.PrivateMemoryFootprint.MacOS
histogram.summary: A rough estimate of the private memory footprint of the GPU process.

histogram.summary: The renderer process's memory usage after a page load.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Renderer.LoadsInMainFrameDuringUptime
histogram.summary: The number of loads in a main frame during the lifetime of a render process (excludes extensions). Emitted when the processes quits.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Renderer.PrivateMemoryFootprint.MacOS
histogram.summary: A rough estimate of the private memory footprint of a renderer process.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Renderer.PurgedMemory
histogram.summary: Amount of reclaimed memory (in terms of Memory.Experimental.Renderer.TotalAllocated) after a purge request on a renderer process. Recorded 2 seconds after the purge request.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Renderer.Uptime
histogram.summary: The uptime of a render process in time ticks (excludes extensions). Emitted when the processes quits.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Renderer2

histogram.summary: The number of swap-ins per second. Recorded every 60 seconds.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.SwapOutPerSecond
