histogram.name: Memory.Extension
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each extension process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.ExtensionProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active extension processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.GlyphPagesPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of glyph pages present in the renderer when it commits a load. Since this is per-sub-process, you can get the average number of glyph pages in the system by multiplying this number with the average number of renderers. Note that this typically won't count the glyph pages added as a result of the load that just committed, since layout will happen after the commit. There are 512 bytes per glyph page, but this number also very closely approximates the number of glyph width map pages in the same renderer. The only difference is that if you have font fallback, it will make a new glyph page and no width page, but in most common cases there is no fallback). Width pages are 1K each (256 floats), so you could think of this value as being the number of "1.5K units related to glyphs per renderer per page load".

histogram.name: Memory.Gpu
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the GPU process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Graphics
histogram.summary: System-wide graphics driver memory consumption. Recorded on Chrome OS for platforms where it is exposed by the kernel (for example, Intel i915 and Exynos Mali). Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.IPCChannelReader.ReceivedMessageSize
histogram.summary: Size of messages received by IPC::ChannelReader.

histogram.name: Memory.NativeClient
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each Native Client loader process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.NativeClientBroker
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each Native Client broker process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.OOMKill.Contents.MemAllocatedMB
histogram.summary: System-wide memory allocation right after a renderer was killed by oom-killer, roughly equivalent to the sum of memory allocated with malloc() in userspace plus graphics driver memory.

histogram.name: Memory.OOMKill.Contents.MemAvailableMB
histogram.summary: System-wide file-backed memory plus free memory right after a renderer was killed by oom-killer, which should be smaller than or close to what the kernel uses to trigger low-memory notifications for tab discards. If this is higher than the kernel's threshold for tab discards, renderers may be killed due to reasons other than out-of-memory.

histogram.name: Memory.OOMKill.Contents.MemGraphicsMB
histogram.summary: Graphics driver (GEM object) memory right after a renderer was killed by oom-killer.

histogram.name: Memory.OOMKill.Contents.MemShmemMB
histogram.summary: System-wide shared memory right after a renderer was killed by oom-killer. Used primarily for shared buffers in the graphics system. Tracked because it's a historical source of leaks on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Memory.OOMKill.Extensions.MemAllocatedMB
histogram.summary: System-wide memory allocation right after a renderer was killed by oom-killer, roughly equivalent to the sum of memory allocated with malloc() in userspace plus graphics driver memory.

histogram.name: Memory.OOMKill.Extensions.MemAvailableMB
histogram.summary: System-wide file-backed memory plus free memory right after a renderer was killed by oom-killer, which should be smaller than or close to what the kernel uses to trigger low-memory notifications for tab discards. If this is higher than the kernel's threshold for tab discards, renderers may be killed due to reasons other than out-of-memory.

histogram.name: Memory.OOMKill.Extensions.MemGraphicsMB
histogram.summary: Graphics driver (GEM object) memory right after a renderer was killed by oom-killer.

histogram.name: Memory.OOMKill.Extensions.MemShmemMB
histogram.summary: System-wide shared memory right after a renderer was killed by oom-killer. Used primarily for shared buffers in the graphics system. Tracked because it's a historical source of leaks on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Memory.OpenFDs
histogram.summary: The total number of open file descriptors opened per process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.OpenFDsSoftLimit
histogram.summary: The limit of open file descriptors that can be opened per process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.OtherProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of other various utility processes (nacl, gpu, sandbox, zygote, utility). Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PepperFlashPlugin
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each Pepper Flash plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PepperPlugin
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each Pepper plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PepperPluginBroker
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each Pepper plugin broker process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PepperPluginBrokerProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of Pepper plugin broker processes, recorded once per metrics services (UMA) update. See MetricsReportingScheduler for details.

histogram.name: Memory.PepperPluginProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active Pepper plugin processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Plugin
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PluginProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active plugin processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PressureLevel
histogram.summary: The memory pressure level, which is recorded periodically. This shows the cumulative number of seconds that systems spend in each of the memory pressure states.

histogram.name: Memory.PressureLevelChanges
histogram.summary: The number of pressure level state changes for each possible pairwise state change.

histogram.name: Memory.ProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of all active processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.ProcessLimit
histogram.summary: The current process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Renderer
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each renderer process. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping. TODO(rkaplow): This should be replaced with Memory.Renderer.Large2 in M54.

histogram.name: Memory.Renderer.Committed
histogram.summary: The total committed memory used by each renderer process. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Renderer.EstimatedDroppableEncodedSize
histogram.summary: The esitimated memory size which would be reduced when reusing disk cache is implemented. If it is 100% sure that the encoded data is in disk cache, the same data in memory can be dropped to reduce memory usage. This is rencorded when an ImageResource is pruned. See crbug/664437.

histogram.name: Memory.Renderer.Large2
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each renderer process. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererAll
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each renderer process, including all renderer types, i.e. this includes Chrome renderer, extensions renderer, as well as regular renderer processes. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererAll.Committed
histogram.summary: The total committed memory used by each renderer process, including all renderer types, i.e. this includes Chrome renderer, extensions renderer, as well as regular renderer processes. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererGrowthIn30Min
histogram.summary: Growth speed of the private working set used by each renderer process per 30 minutes. The usage and growth speed is recorded at most every 30 minutes, not every exact 30 minutes. If the interval is longer than 30 minutes, it is normalized to a speed KB per 30 minutes. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA log unless this is the first time the UMA log is recorded after startup of the renderer, 30 minutes have not passed from the last recording of the renderer or the usage goes down. If the usage goes down, the amount of the shrink will be recorded in the Memory.RendererShrinkIn30Min histogram.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active renderer processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererShrinkIn30Min
histogram.summary: Shrink speed of the private working set used by each renderer process per 30 minutes. The usage and shrink speed is recorded at most every 30 minutes, not every exact 30 minutes. If the interval is longer than 30 minutes, it is normalized to a speed KB per 30 minutes. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA log unless this is the first time the UMA log is recorded after startup of the renderer, 30 minutes have not passed from the last recording of the renderer or the usage goes up. If the usage goes up, the amount of the growth will be recorded in the Memory.RendererGrowthIn30Min histogram.

histogram.name: Memory.SandboxHelper
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each sandbox helper process. Each sandbox helper process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.ShmemDir.AmountOfFreeSpace
histogram.summary: The amount of free space in temporary directory for shared memory files. Recorded each time a new discardable memory manager instance is created.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPageFile
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPageFile2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the maximum amount of memory the current process can commit. This value is equal to or smaller than the system-wide available commit value.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPageFile2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the maximum amount of memory the current process can commit. This value is equal to or smaller than the system-wide available commit value.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPhys
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPhys2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of physical memory currently available. This is the amount of physical memory that can be immediately reused without having to write its contents to disk first. It is the sum of the size of the standby, free, and zero lists.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPhys2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of physical memory currently available. This is the amount of physical memory that can be immediately reused without having to write its contents to disk first. It is the sum of the size of the standby, free, and zero lists.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailVirtual
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.AvailVirtual2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of unreserved and uncommitted memory currently in the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailVirtual2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of unreserved and uncommitted memory currently in the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.MemoryLoad
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the approximate percentage of physical memory that was in use (0 indicates no memory use and 100 indicates full memory use).

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPageFile
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPageFile2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the current committed memory limit for the system or the current process, whichever is smaller.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPageFile2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the current committed memory limit for the system or the current process, whichever is smaller.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPhys
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPhys2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of actual physical memory.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPhys2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of actual physical memory.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalVirtual
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.TotalVirtual2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the size of the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process. This value depends on the type of process, the type of processor, and the configuration of the operating system. For example, this value is approximately 2 GB for most 32-bit processes on an x86 processor and approximately 3 GB for 32-bit processes that are large address aware running on a system with 4-gigabyte tuning enabled.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalVirtual2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the size of the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process. This value depends on the type of process, the type of processor, and the configuration of the operating system. For example, this value is approximately 2 GB for most 32-bit processes on an x86 processor and approximately 3 GB for 32-bit processes that are large address aware running on a system with 4-gigabyte tuning enabled.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Browser
histogram.summary: The swap used by the browser process. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Chrome
histogram.summary: The swap used by each chrome:// renderer process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.CompressedDataSize
histogram.summary: The amount of memory that swap was compressed into. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.CompressionRatio
histogram.summary: The ratio of swapped data original size to compressed size. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Extension
histogram.summary: The swap used by each extension process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Gpu
histogram.summary: The swap used by the GPU process. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.HaveSwapped
histogram.summary: Indicates that the system has swapped memory out at least once since boot. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.MemUsedTotal
histogram.summary: The amount of memory that is used by swap, including bookkeeping. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.NativeClient
histogram.summary: The swap used by each Native Client loader process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.NativeClientBroker
histogram.summary: The swap used by each Native Client broker process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.NumReads
histogram.summary: The number of reads from swap. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.NumWrites
histogram.summary: The number of writes to swap. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.OriginalDataSize
histogram.summary: The amount of memory that was swapped out. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.PepperPlugin
histogram.summary: The swap used by each Pepper plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.PepperPluginBroker
histogram.summary: The swap used by each Pepper plugin broker process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Plugin
histogram.summary: The swap used by each plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Renderer
histogram.summary: The swap used by each renderer process. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.SandboxHelper
histogram.summary: The swap used by each sandbox helper process. Each sandbox helper process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Total
histogram.summary: The sum of all processes' swap. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped. See Memory.Swap.Total2 for the same metric with higher precision bucketing.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Total2
histogram.summary: The sum of all processes' swap. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Utility
histogram.summary: The swap used by each utility process. Each utility process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Worker
histogram.summary: The swap used by each worker process. Each worker process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Zygote
histogram.summary: The swap used by the zygote process. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Total
histogram.summary: The sum of all processes. This is not aware of shared memory so it is just a rough estimate. Recorded once per UMA ping. See Memory.Total2 for the same metric with higher precision bucketing.

histogram.name: Memory.Total2
histogram.summary: The sum of all processes. This is not aware of shared memory so it is just a rough estimate. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Utility
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each utility process. Each utility process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Worker
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each worker process. Each worker process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.WorkerProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active worker processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Zygote
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the zygote process. Each zygote process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.DeviceMemoryClass
histogram.summary: Value of getMemoryClass() recorded once upon startup. This is an integer, device-specific constant correlated with the amount of memory available on Android device.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.EvictionReason
histogram.summary: Reasons behind evictions of individual tabs, recorded upon each tab eviction.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.LowMemoryLoadedTabCount
histogram.summary: Number of loaded (memory-resident) tabs when LowMemory notification is delivered.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.LowMemoryTimeBetween
histogram.summary: Time between two consecutive LowMemory notification in one foreground session.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.LowRamDevice
histogram.summary:
Whether Chrome is running in low ram mode. This histogram is reported on every upload by Android devices. A device is considered low-RAM if it has 512MiB of RAM or lower (see SysUtils.detectLowEndDevice()).
Note: The low-RAM determination has changed in M-49, it used to be given directly by the Android OS.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.NotificationBackground
histogram.summary: Memory notifications delivered through system callbacks to Chrome while in the background.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.NotificationForeground
histogram.summary: Memory notifications delivered through system callbacks to Chrome while in the foreground - we count LowMemory notification vs particular levels of TrimMemory foreground notification.

histogram.name: MemoryPurgeController.ReclaimedPartitionAllocInactiveTab
histogram.summary: The amount of reclaimed memory after a tab became inactive.

histogram.name: MemoryWarning.EvictedTabTimeSinceActive
histogram.summary: [iOS] When the OS sends a memory warning and the app evicts a tab, this histogram records the time since the evicted tab was active.

histogram.name: MemoryWarning.ProtectedTabTimeSinceActive
histogram.summary: [iOS] When the OS sends a memory warning and the app protects a tab, this histogram records the time since the protected tab was active.

histogram.name: Mist.SwitchResult
histogram.summary: The result (e.g. success or the type of failure) of a modem interface switch operation performed by mist on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Mobile.DefaultBrowser.BrowserCount
histogram.summary: Android: The number of browsers installed on the device.

histogram.name: Mobile.DefaultBrowser.State
histogram.summary: Android: Whether or not the device has a default browser and whether or not it is a system installed browser.

histogram.name: Mobile.DefaultBrowser.SystemBrowserCount
histogram.summary: Android: The number of system installed browsers.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.Blocked
histogram.summary: Android: Represents the number of system notifications that were blocked and could not be shown by type.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.BlockedAfterShown
histogram.summary: Android: Represents the type of notification that was last shown before the user disabled notification permissions on Chrome. This is only logged the first time we attempt to show a notification and fail.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.ChannelBlocked
histogram.summary: Android: Represents the number of system notifications by type that we attempted to show but were blocked, due to their notification channel being blocked. Only applies to devices on Android O and above.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.Shown
histogram.summary: Android: Represents the number of system notifications that will be successfully shown to the user by type.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.BytesDownloaded
histogram.summary: Android: Records the total data downloaded by completion status.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.BytesWasted.ChromeNetworkStack
histogram.summary: Android: Records the total data wasted during download due to resumptions.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.CancelReason
histogram.summary: Android: Records the reason that a download is canceled.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.DownloadResumption
histogram.summary: Android: Records user interaction on the download resumption button.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.DownloadTime
histogram.summary: Android: Records the total time for a download by completion status.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.InterceptFailureReason
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 09/2016 in Issue 647755 with all downloads going through Chrome.
histogram.summary: Android: Records the reason that Chrome fails to intercept a download and pass it to the Android DownloadManager.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.InterruptionsCount
histogram.summary: Android: Records the total interruptions for a download by completion status.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Notification.FixingSummaryLeak
histogram.summary: Android: Records the situation where we try to fix a standalone downloads summary notification, which shouldn't be visible to the user. True if the notification was a foreground notification, in which case we can't dismiss it and need to attempt a more drastic workaround. False if it was a normal notification and we can dismiss it easily (this is okay and expected behavior in some scenarios).

histogram.name: MobileDownload.ResumptionsCount
histogram.summary: Android: Records the number of resumptions for a download by resumption type. For all resumption types, this is recorded when a download is finished, completed or cancelled. For automatic resumptions, it is also recorded when user manually resumes the download to clear the auto retry count.

histogram.name: MobileFre.Progress
histogram.summary: Android: Records which states of the "first run experience" have been reached. Each bucket represents a state and recorded everytime the state changed. Pages can be double counted if the user goes backwards in the flow.

histogram.name: MobileFre.SignInChoice
histogram.summary: Android: How the user left the sign-in part of the "first run experience" activity (M-38+).

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.DurationAfterPotraitRotation
histogram.summary: Android: Records the duration that a fullscreen video is played after device rotates from portrait to landscape mode for the first time, and before it exits fullscreen. If there is no device rotation or if the video starts with landscape mode, it is not recorded. If there are mutiple rotations between portrait and landscape mode, only one record is emitted and it is equal to the time period from the first rotation to the moment when the video exits fullscreen.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.LandscapeDuration
histogram.summary: Android: Records the duration that a fullscreen video is played in landscape mode. If a video starts playing in landscape mode, and then it is switched back and forth between landscape and portrait mode, only the time period before the first switch is accounted. If a video starts playing in portrait mode, it is not recorded.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.LandscapeRotation
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether a fullscreen video is switched from landscape to portrait mode at any point during playback.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.OrientationPortrait
histogram.summary: Android: Records the device orientation when a video enters fullscreen. The value is true if device orientation is portrait, or false otherwise. The video doesn't necessarily needs to be in a playing state.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.PortraitDuration
histogram.summary: Android: Records the duration that a fullscreen video is played in portrait mode. If a video starts playing in portrait mode, and then it is switched back and forth between landscape and portrait mode, only the time period before the first switch is accounted. If a video starts playing in landscape mode, it is not recorded.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.PortraitRotation
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether a fullscreen video is switched from portrait to landscape mode at any point during playback.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.VideoPortrait
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether a video has a larger height than width when it enters the fullscreen mode.

histogram.name: MobileOmnibox.PressedClipboardSuggestionAge
histogram.summary:
When a user presses an omnibox suggestion based on the content of the clipboard, this histograms records how long ago Chrome detected a change in the clipboard.
Intended to be compared to Omnibox.ClipboardSuggestionShownAge.
If Chrome never detected a change to the clipboard, no clipboard suggestion is shown, meaning this histogram will never be emitted to.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.IntentToCreationTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes from creating an intent for ChromeActivity to activity creation. This includes activity creation time spent in the framework.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.MainIntentAction
histogram.summary: Android: Records the first action the user does within 10s of starting Chrome. Recorded in DocumentActivity and ChromeTabbedActivity only when the starting intent is of type MAIN.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.MobileMultiWindowInstances
histogram.summary:
Android: Number of instances of Chrome currently open during a MultiWindow session. Emitted every time Chrome is paused. Only emitted on Android MultiWindow devices.
A MultiWindow session is any period of time that Chrome was not used in a full screen mode but together with another Activity that is visible at the same time. This is only supported in a few Android models.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.MobileMultiWindowSession
histogram.summary:
Android: percent of the screen available for Chrome during a multi-window session. Emitted every time chrome is paused. Only emitted on Android MultiWindow devices.
A multiwindow session is any period of time that Chrome was not used in full screen mode but together with some other application that is visible at the same time. This is only supported in a few Android models.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.NonMainIntentAction
histogram.summary: Android: Records the first action the user does within 10s of starting Chrome. Recorded in DocumentActivity and ChromeTabbedActivity only when the starting intent is not of type MAIN, e.g. VIEW, etc.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.TimeSinceLastUse
histogram.summary: Android: The time since last use until Chrome is launched from the home screen. This is measured from the time the last tab is closed until a Main intent is received. Has a minute level precision for first 10 minutes increasing exponentially till 30 days.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.ToolbarFirstDrawTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes from launch to the completion of first draw for Toolbar. This excludes activity creation time spent in framework.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.ToolbarFirstFocusTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes from launch to the first time the user focuses the omnibox if the user does so within first 30s of the launch. This excludes activity creation time spent in framework.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.ToolbarInflationTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time spent performing toolbar layout inflation.

histogram.name: ModuleIntegrityVerification.BytesModified
histogram.summary: Represents the amount of bytes in a module that are different on disk and in memory. Logged when the ModuleIntegrityVerifier determines that a module is different on disk and in memory after being triggered by an incident.

histogram.name: ModuleIntegrityVerification.Difference
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 05/2015.
histogram.summary: Represents the difference in bytes deemed modified by the two ModuleIntegrityVerifier code paths. The suffix indicates which path had a higher value. Logged when the ModuleIntegrityVerifier determines that a module is different on disk and in memory after being triggered by an incident and the reported byte count for both methods is different.

histogram.name: ModuleIntegrityVerification.RelocationsUnordered
histogram.summary: Logged when the relocations in a module are not ordered causing the module verification to abort.

histogram.name: ModuleIntegrityVerification.RelocationsUnorderedModuleIndex
histogram.summary: Logged when the relocations in a module are not ordered causing the module verification to abort. The value is the index of the affected module.

histogram.name: Mojo.MachPortRelay.BrokerError
histogram.summary: Errors that the broker process encounters while trying to send or receive Mach ports from a child process.

histogram.name: Mojo.MachPortRelay.ChildError
histogram.summary: Errors that a child process encounters while trying to receive Mach ports from the broker process.

histogram.name: Mojo.Shell.ChildConnectionTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes for a new child process to receive an initialization request from the Mojo shell. This is precisely the duration of the MojoShellConnectionImpl::BindToMessagePipe() call in ChildThreadImpl.

histogram.name: Mojo.System.GetParentPlatformHandleSyncTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes for a child to receive its parent platform handle synchronously from the broker on startup. This only applies to the subset of platforms on which the sync broker is used.

histogram.name: Mojo.System.MessagesAcceptedPerEvent
histogram.summary: Number of internal Mojo system messages processed synchronously during a single execution of NodeController::AcceptIncomingMessages(). This is called any time an event requires internal Mojo system messages to be pumped. Values below 4 are no longer logged.

histogram.name: Mojo.System.Node.ConnectedPeers
histogram.summary: Number of connected peer nodes tracked by a node. This is emitted any time a peer is added to or dropped from a node.

histogram.name: Mojo.System.Node.PendingChildren
histogram.summary: Number of connected pending child node connections tracked by a node. This is emitted any time a parent-child node connection is initiated or dropped.

histogram.name: MojoLevelDBEnv.IOError
histogram.summary: Methods where leveldb's Mojo environment has IO errors.

histogram.name: MojoLevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE
histogram.summary: Errors (base::File::Error) encountered by a single leveldb method in leveldb's Mojo environment.

histogram.name: Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Changed
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse sensitivity setting changes by the user. This replaces the old Mouse.Sensitivity.Changed metric.

histogram.name: Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Started
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse sensitivity setting on startup. This replaces the old Mouse.Sensitivity.Started metric.

histogram.name: Mouse.Sensitivity.Changed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2013, replaced by Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Changed.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse sensitivity setting.

histogram.name: Mouse.Sensitivity.Started
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2013, replaced by Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Started.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse sensitivity setting on startup.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseDownDuration_Click
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user mousedown-ed a link and when the user clicked a link.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseDownFollowedByClick
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each click handled by an HTML anchor tag link, whether Blink saw a mousedown event preceding it. This is only measured for clicks handled by the anchor tag's default click event handler.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseDowns
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of mousedown events detected at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseOverDuration_Click
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user mouseover-ed a link and when the user clicked a link.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseOverDuration_NoClick
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user mouseover-ed a link and when the user mouseout-ed a link without click.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseOvers
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of mouseover events detected at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.PreTapEventsFollowedByClick
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The tap gesture events detected before click at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.TapDownDuration_Click
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user tapdown-ed a link and when the user clicked a link.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.TapDowns
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of gesturetapdown events detected at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.TapUnconfirmeds
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of gesturetapunconfirmed events detected at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MPArch.ChildProcessLaunchFirst
histogram.summary: The time it takes to spawn the first child subprocess (including sandbox init).

histogram.name: MPArch.ChildProcessLaunchSubsequent
histogram.summary: The time it takes to spawn child sub processes not counting the first one.

histogram.name: MPArch.IIR_InputEventDelta
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2016 due to lack of use (Histogram Eraser).
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for the renderer to acknowledge an input event.

histogram.name: MPArch.RendererLaunchFirst
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time it takes to spawn the first renderer subprocess (including sandbox init).

histogram.name: MPArch.RendererLaunchSubsequent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time it takes to spawn renderer sub processes not counting the first one.

histogram.name: MPArch.RPHCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of RenderProcessHosts (i.e. renderer processes) present when each load completes. This is basically the average number of sub-processes over time. See also Tabs.TabCountPerLoad.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_HangMonitorUnresponsive
histogram.summary: The length of time the renderer is unresponsive according to the hang monitor. Recorded when the renderer regains responsiveness.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_InputEventDelta
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for the renderer to acknowledge an input event.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_OnMsgPaintRect
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time spent inside RenderWidgetHost::OnMsgPaintRect.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_OnMsgScrollRect
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time spent inside RenderWidgetHost::OnMsgScrollRect.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_OnMsgUpdateRect
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_RepaintDelta
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_TabSwitchPaintDuration
histogram.summary: Time from tab switch requested to tab appearing on screen (Aura and Mac only).

histogram.name: MPArch.RWHH_WhiteoutDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that the user sees a blank white page after switching to a different tab, while the RenderWidgetHost receives data to paint from the renderer process.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.DiscardedTabsPerUser
histogram.summary: The relation of discarded tabs vs. the amount of simultaneous users. The counts are the number of discards and the buckets are the number of users. Since the count values are absolute numbers, they need to be normalized before use - so divide the counts by the percentage of users per session found under 'MultiProfile.UsersPerSessionIncremental'.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.SessionMode
histogram.summary: The session counter for different multi profile modes which gets stored once per session at the beginning of the session.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.SigninUserUIPath
histogram.summary: Count the number of times each UI path is taken for signing into a new account in a Chrome OS multiprofile session. UI paths include the system tray and the user account switcher on the browser frame.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.SwitchActiveUserUIPath
histogram.summary: Count the number of times each UI path is taken for switching the active account in a Chrome OS multiprofile session. UI paths include the system tray and the keyboard shortcut.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.TeleportWindow
histogram.summary: Counts the number of window teleportations when using separated desktop mode.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.TeleportWindowType
histogram.summary: Counts the number of teleported windows by types in separated desktop mode.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.UsersPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of users simultaneously signed into a multiprofile session on Chrome OS. This is recorded upon session end.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.UsersPerSessionIncremental
histogram.summary: The number of users simultaneously signed into a multiprofile session on Chrome OS. This is recorded whenever a user gets added to the session. To get the correct count, all following counts must be subtracted. Example: If 100 single user, 20 two user and 5 three user sessions, there were 100-20-5=75 single user sessions, 100-80=20 dual user sessions and so on.

histogram.name: NaCl.Client.Helper.InitState
histogram.summary: When the browser started, what happened with the NaCl helper process?

histogram.name: NaCl.Client.Helper.StateOnFork
histogram.summary: When a NaCl application process was created, what had happened with the NaCl helper process when the browser was started?

histogram.name: NaCl.Client.OSArch
histogram.summary: The OS/Architecture of a nexe that was loaded.

histogram.name: NaCl.HttpStatusCodeClass.Manifest.InstalledApp
histogram.summary: The status code returned when trying to load a manifest inside an installed app.

histogram.name: NaCl.HttpStatusCodeClass.Manifest.NotInstalledApp
histogram.summary: The status code returned when trying to load a manifest from a source other than an installed app.

histogram.name: NaCl.HttpStatusCodeClass.Nexe.InstalledApp
histogram.summary: The status code returned when trying to load a NaCl executable inside an installed app.

histogram.name: NaCl.HttpStatusCodeClass.Nexe.NotInstalledApp
histogram.summary: The status code returned when trying to load a NaCl executable from a source other than an installed app.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.Plugin
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's Chrome plugin.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.Plugin.InstalledApp
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's Chrome plugin, but only for installed apps.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.Plugin.NotInstalledApp
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's Chrome plugin, but excluding installed apps.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.SelLdr
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's sel_ldr.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.SelLdr.InstalledApp
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's sel_ldr, but only for installed apps.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.SelLdr.NotInstalledApp
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's sel_ldr, but excluding installed apps.

histogram.name: NaCl.Manifest.IsDataURI
histogram.summary: Was the manifest specified as a data URI rather than a .nmf file?

histogram.name: NaCl.ManifestDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the manifset file for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.ModuleUptime.Crash
histogram.summary: The time a NaCl module ran before it crashed.

histogram.name: NaCl.ModuleUptime.Normal
histogram.summary: The time a NaCl module ran without crashing, at shutdown.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the main .nexe for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeSize
histogram.summary: The size of the main .nexe file downloaded for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeStartupTime
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when proxied execution of the NaCl module begins. This is the general startup overhead of running as a NaCl module vs a trusted PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeStartupTimePerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when proxied execution of the NaCl module begins. This is the general startup overhead of running as a NaCl module vs a trusted PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: NaCl.Options.PNaCl.OptLevel
histogram.summary: The optimization level set for the initial Portable Native Client translation from bitcode to native code.

histogram.name: NaCl.OSArch
histogram.summary: The OS/Architecture of a nexe that was loaded.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClCache.IsHit
histogram.summary: Did the Portable Native Client translation cache find an executable translated from bitcode?

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.CompileKBPerSec
histogram.summary: The rate for compiling a Portable Native Client bitcode file to an object file in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.CompileTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to compile a Portable Native Client bitcode file to an object file.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.LinkTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to link a Portable Native Client generated object file into a Native Client executable.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.LoadCompiler
histogram.summary: The time it took to load and validate the Portable Native Client compiler.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.LoadLinker
histogram.summary: The time it took to load and validate the Portable Native Client linker.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.PctCompiledWhenFullyDownloaded
histogram.summary: The percentage of a Portable Native Client application that is compiled by the time the application is fully downloaded (compile and download happen in parallel).

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.TotalUncachedKBPerSec
histogram.summary: The rate for completely translating a Portable Native Client bitcode file into a Native Client executable and caching the result in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.TotalUncachedTime
histogram.summary: The total time it took to completely translate a Portable Native Client bitcode file into a Native Client executable, and cache the result.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.ShutdownTime.Total
histogram.summary: The time it took the NaCl module to shut down.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.Size.Manifest
histogram.summary: The size of the manifest file.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.Size.Nexe
histogram.summary: The size of the main .nexe file downloaded for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.Size.Pexe
histogram.summary: The size of the main .pexe bitcode file downloaded for a Portable Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.Size.PexeNexeSizePct
histogram.summary: The size of the main .pexe bitcode file divided by the size of the .nexe that is the result of translating the bitcode file, times 100.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.Size.PNaClTranslatedNexe
histogram.summary: The size of the main .nexe file that is the result of translating a Portable Native Client .pexe bitcode file. This reflects the amount of cache consumed.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.LoadModule
histogram.summary: The time it took to load the NaCl module into sel_ldr.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.LoadModulePerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took to load the NaCl module into sel_ldr. Normalized by the size of the .nexe, in megabytes.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.ManifestDownload
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the manifset file for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.NaClOverhead
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when proxied execution of the NaCl module begins. This is the general startup overhead of running as a NaCl module vs a trusted PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.NaClOverheadPerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when proxied execution of the NaCl module begins. This is the general startup overhead of running as a NaCl module vs a trusted PPAPI plugin. Normalized by the size of the .nexe, in megabytes.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.NexeDownload
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the main .nexe for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.NexeDownloadPerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the main .nexe for a Native Client module. Normalized by the size of the .nexe, in megabytes.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.Total
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when the NaCl module is ready to be used.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.TotalPerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when the NaCl module is ready to be used. Normalized by the size of the .nexe, in megabytes.

histogram.name: NaCl.Startups
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 5/2011, data is duplicated by NaCl.NexeStartupTime, and normalizing to 'tab opens' is unusual.
histogram.summary: The number of times that Native Client has been started by loading a .nexe compared to the number of times that a tab has been opened.

histogram.name: NaCl.ValidationCache.Query
histogram.summary: Did a validation cache query find a previously known validation result?

histogram.name: NaCl.ValidationCache.Set
histogram.summary: Was the validation cache updated with a new validation result?

histogram.name: Navigation.ClearSiteData.Duration
histogram.summary: Recorded when a navigation is deferred while clearing site data. Indicates how much time the clearing took.

histogram.name: Navigation.ClearSiteData.Parameters
histogram.summary: The parameters of the Clear-Site-Data header. Recorded when the header is successfully parsed.

histogram.name: Navigation.DeferredDocumentLoading.StatesV1
histogram.summary: Why and if cross-origin documents would be loaded in a world where we defer loading until they are visible.

histogram.name: Navigation.DeferredDocumentLoading.StatesV2
histogram.summary: Why and if cross-origin documents would be loaded if we were to defer loading as long as possible.

histogram.name: Navigation.DeferredDocumentLoading.StatesV3
histogram.summary: Why and if cross-origin documents would be loaded if we were to defer loading as long as possible. Difference from V2: frames positioned both above and to the left of the page have their own bucket and are no longer counted in the "above" bucket.

histogram.name: Navigation.DeferredDocumentLoading.StatesV4
histogram.summary: Why and if cross-origin documents would be loaded if we were to defer loading as long as possible. Changes from V3: replace detailed reasons with summaries for four strategies. E.g. any document that would load under a strategy of loading when a frame is two screens away is logged to the WouldLoad2Screens AND WouldLoad3Screens bucket. We only record documents below the current viewport, not to the right of it.

histogram.name: Navigation.EngagementTime.HTTP
histogram.summary: The amount of time that an HTTP page was in the foreground. Recorded on every page close/transition.

histogram.name: Navigation.EngagementTime.HTTPS
histogram.summary: The amount of time that an HTTPS page was in the foreground. Recorded on every page close/transition.

histogram.name: Navigation.EngagementTime.Ratio
histogram.summary: The percentage of time that HTTPS pages were in the foreground, as compared to total foreground time. Recorded whenever user metrics are uploaded.

histogram.name: Navigation.FrameHasEmbeddedCredentials
histogram.summary: Whether the navigation was to a URL that had embedded credentials.

histogram.name: Navigation.IOSWKWebViewSlowFastBackForward
histogram.summary: Counts slow/fast back/forward WKWebView navigations on iOS. Fast navigation is a back/forward navigation done with WKBackForwardList.

histogram.name: Navigation.IsMobileOptimized
histogram.summary: Signifies whether a succesfully finished page load for the main frame content width fits within the device width and/or has a fixed page scale.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameHasEmbeddedCredentials
histogram.summary: Whether the main-frame navigation was to a URL that had embedded credentials.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameScheme
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for each main-frame navigation.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameScheme.DataUrl.MimeType
histogram.summary: The mime type of the data: URL for each main-frame navigation. This only contains mime types that can run scripts.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameSchemeDifferentPage
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for each main-frame navigation that replaces a document object. This is not reported for reference fragment navigations, pushState/replaceState or same page history navigation.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameSchemeDifferentPageOTR
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for each main-frame navigation that replaces a document object while in incognito. This is not reported for reference fragment navigations, pushState/replaceState or same page history navigation.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameSchemeOTR
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for each main-frame navigation while in incognito.

histogram.name: Navigation.OnBeforeUnloadOverheadTime
histogram.summary: Overhead time spent handling the OnBeforeUnload event from the browser standpoint. More precisely, it is the total time between dispatch and acknowledgment of the BeforeUnload event on the browser side, minus the actual time spent executing the BeforeUnload handlers on the renderer side.

histogram.name: Navigation.RedirectChainSize
histogram.summary: Total length of the redirect URL strings in navigation entry. Logged when entry is committed.

histogram.name: Navigation.Reload.ReloadMainResourceToReloadDuration
histogram.summary: Reported when a user triggers reload without any other navigations after the previous reload in the same page, and the previous reload variant was RELOAD_MAIN_RESOURCE. Duration time between two reloads is reported.

histogram.name: Navigation.Reload.ReloadToReloadDuration
histogram.summary: Reported when a user triggers reload without any other navigations after the previous reload in the same page. Duration time between two reloads is reported.

histogram.name: Navigation.Scheduled.MaybeCausedAbort
histogram.summary: window.location and other scheduled navigation changes can cause the current provisional load to be aborted. Many times these are initiated without user gesture. This histogram logs counts of the various aborters.

histogram.name: Navigation.Scheduled.MaybeCausedAbort.Time
histogram.summary: window.location and other scheduled navigation changes can cause the current provisional load to be aborted. Many times these are initiated without user gesture. This histogram logs the time between the aborted navigation start and the scheduled navigation start, if the aborted navigation has a non-zero navigationStart value.

histogram.name: Navigation.SchemePerUniqueOrigin
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for the first main-frame navigation per origin per non-OffTheRecord session.

histogram.name: Navigation.SchemePerUniqueOriginOTR
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for the first main-frame navigation per origin per OffTheRecord session.

histogram.name: Navigation.Start.RendererBrowserDifference.Negative
histogram.obsolete: Data collected and posted on issue 675833.
histogram.summary: The difference between Now() in the renderer and browser_navigation_start for browser-initiated navigations if the difference is negative. This value should ideally only reflect the IPC time between the browser process and renderer process, but in practice could be skewed by inter-process timing errors. If the clocks used for TimeTicks are monotonic across processes, all samples should fall into the Positive bucket.

histogram.name: Navigation.Start.RendererBrowserDifference.Positive
histogram.obsolete: Data collected and posted on issue 675833.
histogram.summary: The difference between Now() in the renderer and browser_navigation_start for browser-initiated navigations if the difference is positive. This value should ideally only reflect the IPC time between the browser process and renderer process, but in practice could be skewed by inter-process timing errors. If the clocks used for TimeTicks are monotonic across processes, all samples should fall into the Positive bucket.

histogram.name: Navigation.TimeToCommit
histogram.summary: Time between the start of a browser-started navigation request in and its commit.

histogram.name: Navigation.TimeToURLJobStart
histogram.summary: Time between the start of a browser-started navigation request and the reception of a corresponding ResourceRequest in the network stack.

histogram.name: Navigation.UI_OnCommitProvisionalLoad.Intent
histogram.summary: Time between receiving an Android Intent and the navigation commit.

histogram.name: Navigation.UI_OnCommitProvisionalLoad.Link
histogram.summary: Time between clicking on a link and the navigation commit.

histogram.name: Navigation.UI_OnLoadComplete.Intent
histogram.summary: Time between receiving an Android intent and the document load complete event for a navigation in the main frame.

histogram.name: Navigation.UI_OnLoadComplete.Link
histogram.summary: Time between clicking on a link and the document load complete event for a navigation in the main frame.

histogram.name: NCN.CellularConnectionSubtype
histogram.summary: The connection subtype of the network the client is connected to, when the client is on a cellular connection. This histogram is logged once per UMA record, if the user is on a cellular connection, at the time the record is finalized.

histogram.name: NCN.CM.FastestRTTOn2G
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time seen on a 2G connection, before the NetworkChangeNotifier detected a connectivity change.
This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NCN.CM.FastestRTTOn3G
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time seen on a 3G connection, before the NetworkChangeNotifier detected a connectivity change.
This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NCN.CM.FastestRTTOn4G
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time seen on a 4G connection, before the NetworkChangeNotifier detected a connectivity change.
This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NCN.CM.FastestRTTOnEthernet

This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NCN.CM.FastestRTTOnNone

Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time seen while the NetworkChangeNotifier thought there was no network connection, before the NetworkChangeNotifier detected a connectivity change.
This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time seen on an unknown connection type, before the NetworkChangeNotifier detected a connectivity change.
This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time seen on a Wifi connection, before the NetworkChangeNotifier detected a connectivity change.
This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.
