histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfNonPreconnectAltJob
histogram.summary: This counts number of alternative jobs which are still alive.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfNonPreconnectMainJob
histogram.summary: This counts number of main jobs which are still alive.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfPendingRequest
histogram.summary: This counts number of HttpStreamFactoryImpl::Request which are still alive.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfPreconnect
histogram.summary: This counts number of job controllers which are used for preconnect and are still alive.

histogram.name: Net.LoadPrefetch.Pattern
histogram.summary: The completion status of prefetches that have finished loading.
histogram.details:
Measurement occurs at ResourceLoader::ResponseCompleted so requests canceled before that point are not registered.
This applies to requests with net::LOAD_PREFETCH, used by various prefetching features such as no-state prefetch and RESOURCE_TYPE_PREFETCH.
Note that "success from cache" means that the UrlRequest::was_cached() was true and unused_since_prefetch was false. "success from network" means that was_cached() was false. "success already prefetched" means that both was_cached() and unused_since_prefetch were true. Validated results are considered cached, even though a conditional network request is made.

histogram.name: Net.MainFrameNoStore
histogram.summary:
The distribution of storable vs "cache-control: no-store" main-frame resources.
Counted after response headers have completed and before the content has completed. Redirects are counted. All HTTP cache transactions are counted, not just those that require the network.

histogram.name: Net.MTPR_GetProxyForUrl_Thread_Wait_Time
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that a (non-cancelled) proxy resolution request was stalled waiting for an execution thread, for MultiThreadedProxyResolver.

histogram.name: Net.MTPR_GetProxyForUrl_Time
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that it took for a (non-cancelled) proxy resolution request to complete, for MultiThreadedProxyResolver.

histogram.name: Net.NetInternalsUi.Feature
histogram.summary: Counts the number of browser launches where chrome://net-internals and chrome://net-internals/#tests are used.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsRecovered.MainFrame
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download the main frame of a page in response to specific HTTP network errors succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsRecovered.Subresource
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download a subresource in response to specific HTTP network errors succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsUnrecovered.MainFrame
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download the main frame of a page in response to specific HTTP network errors returns another network error. Histogram includes only the error code that triggered the retry.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsUnrecovered.Subresource
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download a subresource in response to specific HTTP network errors returns another network error. Histogram includes only the error code that triggered the retry.

histogram.name: Net.NotifyAddrChangeFailures
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: On Windows, NetworkChangeNotifierWin calls NotifyAddrChange, which can fail for unknown reasons. This records the number of times it fails in a row before a successful call. If it never succeeds, or takes over 100 tries, a value of 100 is recorded. See http://crbug.com/69198

histogram.name: Net.NumDuplicateCookiesInDb
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-08-17 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/521135).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of duplicate cookies that were present in the cookie store during startup.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPRequestFailedTimeMs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2017-04-21 as it was Linux/CrOS only.
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to make one or more HTTP fetches to OCSP responders in order to get revocation information. This measures the amount of time that failures to get OCSP information take.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPRequestSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2017-04-21 as it was Linux/CrOS only.
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to make one or more HTTP fetches to OCSP responders in order to get revocation information. This records the fraction of successful requests.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPRequestTimeMs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2017-04-21 as it was Linux/CrOS only.
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to make one or more HTTP fetches to OCSP responders in order to get revocation information. This measures the amount of time that each of those requests takes.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPResponseStapled
histogram.summary: When connecting over HTTPS, a server may include an OCSP response as part of the TLS handshake so that clients do not have to fetch it, provided the client requested the server do so. This measures whether or not a server included an OCSP response when it was requested.

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()". This error code is platform specific, so when there is a Windows/Linux conflict, both decodings are shown.

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo_Linux
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()".

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo_Mac
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()".

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo_Win
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()".

histogram.name: Net.PacResultForStrippedUrl
histogram.summary:
Proxy Auto Config (PAC) allows specifying an arbitrary javascript program to pick network proxies on a per-request basis (based on the URL). This works by calling the script's FindProxyForURL() function with the target URL as its first argument.
Traditionally, the URL parameter passed into the script contains the exact URL being loaded, except maybe for having stripped the fragment and embedded identity portions of the URL.
This histogram records what happens when the URL passed into FindProxyForURL() additionally has had its path component stripped. Does it return the same proxy list as when calling FindProxyForURL() with the original (unmodified) URL?
This comparison is done only when the URL scheme implies a secure channel (i.e. https:// and wss://), in order to gather data for crbug.com/593759.

histogram.name: Net.Ping_ResponseStartedTime
histogram.summary: How long it took for an <a ping> request to receive a response. Only recorded if a response was received.

histogram.name: Net.Ping_Result
histogram.summary: The result of an <a ping> request, whether it received a response or timed out or failed for some other reason.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectedLinkNavigations
histogram.summary: Indicate whether a link navigation was preceded by a recent pre-connect trigger (within 10 seconds). There is a high chance that loading the page used a preconnected TCP session.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectedNavigation
histogram.summary: Indicate whether a URLRequest was preceded by a recent pre-connect trigger (within 10 seconds). There is a high chance that loading the resource used a preconnected TCP session.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectMotivation
histogram.summary: When a preconnection is made, indicate what the motivation was.
histogram.details: Currently, the most common (only?) motivations are SELF_REFERAL, LEARNED_REFERAL and OMNIBOX. The SELF_REFERAL indicates that we made sure a second connection was available for a resource that either was never before seen, or has historically had no subresources. The LEARNED_REFERAL indicates that we "learned" that a subresource was commonly needed, and that motivated the TCP/IP preconnect. The OMNIBOX motivation happens when a search is being suggested, and we preconnect to the search provider. (WARNING: Prior to version 7.517.*, enums 7, 8, and 9 may be confused, as EARLY_LOAD_MOTIVATED was inserted new 6 value.)

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectProxyStatus
histogram.summary: Indicate whether there was a proxy to preclude preconnection.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectSkippedToProxyServers
histogram.summary: Indicates number of times a preconnect to proxy server was skipped due to an existing pending preconnection request.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectSubresourceEval
histogram.summary: What did we decide to do about a predicted resource, based on the historical expected number of connection that this subresource will require.
histogram.details: This is basically the current thresholding of the SubresourceExpectation, relative to current static thresholds, and taking into account whether preconnection is enabled (i.e., if preconnection is disabled, we'll never decide to preconnect).

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectSubresourceExpectation
histogram.summary: The expected number of connections, times 100, that we'll make to a given subresource, based on learned history.
histogram.details: By comparing this to thresholds, we decide if we will preconnect, preresolve, or do nothing. This histogram can be used to select those static thresholds.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectTriggerUsed
histogram.summary: Indicate whether if a preconnect trigger is followed by a resource request (from link navigations) to the host or not. This is to measure precision of link-based preconnect triggers.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectUtilization
histogram.obsolete: Sourced data corrected, and replaced by NetPreconnectUtilization2
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicate final utilization for each attempted socket connection.
histogram.details: We also include stats for non-speculative sockets. Some socket connections may never connect, and others may never be used (as the user may abort before then).

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectUtilization2
histogram.summary: Indicate final utilization for each attempted socket connection.
histogram.details: We also include stats for non-speculative sockets. Some socket connections may never connect, and others may never be used (as the user may abort before then).

histogram.name: Net.Predictor.MRUIndex
histogram.obsolete: Dev data was collected which was good enough to make a decision on the size of the predictor database.
histogram.summary: The index into the predictor's MRU on navigation. This is the size the MRU had to be in order to effectively predict subresources for this navigation.

histogram.name: Net.Predictor.Startup.DBSize
histogram.summary: The approximate size in bytes of the predictor's database on startup.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.HitBytes
histogram.summary: Bytes read for requests that were served from a cache entry whose unused_since_prefetch bit is true.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.Pattern
histogram.summary: The completion status of prefetches that have finished loading.
histogram.details:
Measurement occurs at ResourceLoader::ResponseCompleted so requests canceled before that point are not registered.
This applies to requests with RESOURCE_TYPE_PREFETCH.
Note that "success from cache" means that the UrlRequest::was_cached() was true and unused_since_prefetch was false. "success from network" means that was_cached() was false. "success already prefetched" means that both was_cached() and unused_since_prefetch were true. Validated results are considered cached, even though a conditional network request is made.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.PrefilterBytesReadFromNetwork
histogram.summary: Number of bytes read from the network on behalf of prefetch requests. This is prefilter, so before any decompression.
histogram.details: This applies to requests with RESOURCE_TYPE_PREFETCH.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.TimeBeforeCancel
histogram.summary: Time spent on prefetch requests before the request was canceled.
histogram.details: This applies to requests with RESOURCE_TYPE_PREFETCH.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.TimeSpentOnPrefetchHit
histogram.summary: Time spent on requests that were served from a cache entry whose unused_since_prefetch bit is true.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.TimeSpentPrefetchingFromCache
histogram.summary: Time spent on prefetch requests when fetched from cache.
histogram.details: This applies to requests with RESOURCE_TYPE_PREFETCH.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.TimeSpentPrefetchingFromNetwork
histogram.summary: Time spent on prefetch requests when fetched from the network, including validation time.

histogram.name: Net.PrefProxyConfig.GooglezipProxyRemovalCount
histogram.summary: Records how many *.googlezip.net Data Reduction Proxies were removed from the effective proxy configuration when a proxy reconfiguration occurs.

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from the start of the http transaction until the first byte of the response for high priority (currently frame and subframe) requests. Only times under 10 minutes are recorded.

histogram.name: Net.Priority_High_Latency_b
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.Priority_Low_Latency_b
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from the start of the http transaction until the first byte of the response for low priority (non-frame/subframe) requests.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyAuthRequested.HasConnection
histogram.summary: When a PROXY_AUTH_REQUESTED error code is handled in net::HttpStreamFactoryImpl::Job::RunLoop, this is true if connection_ has an associated value.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyPollConfigurationTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time in milliseconds spent fetch the system proxy configuration, when polling it for changes.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.AbandonedExecutionTotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent executing the proxy script during "tracing" runs (executions of the script which discovered a new DNS dependency and were subsequently abandoned).

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.AbandonedExecutionTotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent executing the proxy script during "tracing" runs (executions of the script which discovered a new DNS dependency and were subsequently abandoned).

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent in the non-blocking DNS bindings while executing PAC scripts. This includes the times for abandoned executions.

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.NumErrors
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of errors that were seen in the final execution of the script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.NumRestarts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that the PAC script execution was restarted.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.TotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that the proxy resolution took. This includes all the time spent waiting for DNS, PAC script execution, and restarts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.TotalTimeDNS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.UniqueDNS

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.DnsWaitTotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent in the non-blocking DNS bindings while executing PAC scripts. This includes the times for abandoned executions.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.ExecutionTime

This includes the time spent in the javascript bindings (which is probably dominated by Net.ProxyResolver.DnsWaitTotalTime). This does not include the time spent in abandoned execution passes.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.NumAlerts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that alert() was called in the final execution of the script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.NumErrors
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.NumRestarts

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.OriginThreadLatency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took upon completion to run the final task posted back to the IO thread.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.TotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that the proxy resolution took. This includes all the time spent waiting for DNS, PAC script execution, and restarts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.TotalTimeDNS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that proxy resolution spent waiting for DNS. This also includes any queuing delays on the origin thread waiting for the DNS result to be processed.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.TotalTimeWorkerThread
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that the proxy resolution took, not including the post back to the origin thread. This includes all the time spent waiting for DNS, PAC script execution, and restarts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.UniqueDNS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of unique DNS hostnames that the PAC script tried to resolve. The *Ex() versions of the bindings count separately.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.URLSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The length of the URL that was passed into the PAC script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyScriptFetcher.FirstByteDuration
histogram.summary: The time taken from requesting a PAC script to receiving the first byte, on successful fetches. This does not include time spent doing proxy auto-discovery, or failed attempts at retrieving PAC scripts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyScriptFetcher.SuccessDuration
histogram.summary: The time taken to successfully fetch a PAC script. This does not include time spent doing proxy auto-discovery, or failed attempts at retrieving PAC scripts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.GetProxyUsingScriptResult
histogram.summary: The network error code of resolving a URL by forwarding the request to the proxy resolver and executing the PAC script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.GetProxyUsingScriptTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to resolve a URL by forwarding the request to the proxy resolver and executing the PAC script. This includes PAC script execution, DNS queries, and internal retries. This does not include retries initiated by the user, such as by calling ProxyService::ReconsiderProxyAfterError().

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.ResolvedUsingScript
histogram.summary: Whether proxy resolution occured by forwarding the request to the proxy resolver and executing the PAC script. This histogram records all URLs, regardless of whether a proxy configuration is set. Note that in some cases, the system proxy resolver is used. If so, this histogram indicates whether the request was forwarded to the system resolver. However, on desktop platforms, the number of users using the system resolver should be small since the default is to use V8. Hence, the count of emissions to the 'True' bucket on desktop caused by users of the system resolver should be small.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.ResolveProxyTime
histogram.summary: The total time taken to resolve a URL. This includes PAC script execution, DNS queries, and internal retries. This does not include retries initiated by the user, such as by calling ProxyService::ReconsiderProxyAfterError().

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.ScriptTerminated
histogram.summary: Whether a proxy resolution resulted in the PAC script terminating unexpectedly. This does not include terminations that occured during initialization of a new proxy resolver. This only happens when the resolver process crashes when using out-of-process PAC.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.ScriptTerminatedOnInit
histogram.summary: Whether the creation of a new proxy resolver resulted in the PAC script terminating unexpectedly. This only happens when the resolver process crashes when using out-of-process PAC.

histogram.name: Net.PublicKeyPinFailureDomain
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of November 2016 because of disuse. Historical data is likely inaccurate due to changes in the data structure that calculated domain IDs for this histogram.
histogram.summary: Second-level domains for which we have observed public key pinning failures.

histogram.name: Net.PublicKeyPinReportSendingFailure
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 07/2016. Replaced with Net.PublicKeyPinReportSendingFailure2.
histogram.summary: A validated certificate chain may be subject to additional pinning requirements on a per-domain basis. When pinning requirements are violated, Chrome attempts to send a report about the incident. This records the net error code when sending a pinning violation report fails.

histogram.name: Net.PublicKeyPinReportSendingFailure2
histogram.summary: A validated certificate chain may be subject to additional pinning requirements on a per-domain basis. When pinning requirements are violated, Chrome attempts to send a report about the incident. This records the net error code when sending a pinning violation report fails.

histogram.name: Net.PublicKeyPinSuccess
histogram.summary: A validated certificate chain may be subject to additional "pinning" requirements on a per-domain basis. This records the fraction of successful matches between a certificate chain and a pin list.

histogram.name: Net.QuicActiveSessions
histogram.summary: The number of active QUIC sessions before we activate a new QUIC session.

histogram.name: Net.QuicAlternativeProxy.Usage
histogram.summary: Breakdown of how requests which could potentially make use of an alternative QUIC proxy server use or don't use the QUIC server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicClientHelloRejectReasons
histogram.summary: The reject reasons for QUIC's CHLO (client hello) message from server

histogram.name: Net.QuicClientHelloServerConfig.HowExpired
histogram.summary: How expired server config is for sending inchoate ClientHello to the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicClientHelloServerConfig.InvalidDuration
histogram.summary: The time since expiration of server config when we sent inchoate ClientHello to the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicClientHelloServerConfigState
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 11/2014. Replaced by Net.QuicInchoateClientHelloReason.
histogram.summary: The reason (the state of the server config) for sending inchoate ClientHello to the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicCloseConnection.NullVisitor
histogram.summary: The number of times Connection's visitor is a nullptr when CloseConnection is called.

histogram.name: Net.QuicCryptoClientConfig.PopulatedFromCanonicalConfig
histogram.summary: The number of times CryptoClientConfig's CachedState is populated from canonical config whenever we create a new CryptoClientConfig::CachedState.

histogram.name: Net.QuicDiskCache.APICall
histogram.summary: Tracks number of times data read/parse/write API calls of QuicServerInfo to and from disk cache is called.

histogram.name: Net.QuicDiskCache.EntryState
histogram.summary: Tracks the opening and closing of disk cache entries. Recorded each time a disk cache entry is either opened or closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicDiskCache.FailureReason
histogram.summary: Tracks failure reasons to read/load/write of QuicServerInfo to and from disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicEphemeralPortsSuggested
histogram.summary: The number of ports suggested per server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHandshakeNotConfirmedNumPacketsReceived
histogram.summary: The number of QUIC packets received by a QUIC connection whose handshake was not confirmed when that connection is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHandshakeState
histogram.summary: The state of a QUIC connection's crypto hanshake as it progresses from starting to confirmation or failure.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHpackCompressionPercentage
histogram.summary: The compression percentage, logged for each sent HPACK compressed header frame.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHpackDecoder.IndexedEntryAge
histogram.summary: For each indexed representation decoded, records the time since the corresponding entry was added to the dynamic table. This data is being collected to help analyze a proposed solution to HPACK induced head of line blocking.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHpackDecompressionPercentage
histogram.summary: The decompression percentage, logged for each received HPACK compressed header frame.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHpackEncoder.IndexedEntryAge
histogram.summary: For each indexed representation encoded, records the time since the corresponding entry was added to the dynamic table. This data is being collected to help analyze a proposed solution to HPACK induced head of line blocking.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHttpStream::DoStreamRequest.IsNullSession
histogram.summary: The number of times QuicHttpStream's session_ is a nullptr before StartRequest() is called.

histogram.name: Net.QuicInchoateClientHelloReason
histogram.summary: The reason (the state of the server config) for sending inchoate ClientHello to the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNumSentClientHellos
histogram.summary: The number of client hello messages sent.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNumSentClientHellosCryptoHandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: The number of client hello messages sent when the crypto handshake was confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNumServerConfig.UpdateMessagesIgnored
histogram.summary: The number of times ServerConfigUpdateMessages ignored.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNumStreamFramesInPacket
histogram.summary: The number of stream frames bundled within a received packet.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNumStreamFramesPerStreamInPacket
histogram.summary: The number of stream frames per stream ID within a received packet.

histogram.name: Net.QuicReadAvailableData.NullStream
histogram.summary: The number of times QuicHttpStream's stream_ is a nullptr before IsDoneReading() is called.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.DiskCacheLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to load QUIC server information from disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.DiskCacheReadTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 10/2014. Replaced by DiskCacheWaitForDataReadyTime.
histogram.summary: Time spent to load QUIC server information from disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.DiskCacheState
histogram.summary: The state of the QUIC server information when it's loaded from the disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.DiskCacheWaitForDataReadyTime
histogram.summary: Time spent waiting to load QUIC server information from disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.ExpectConfigMissingFromDiskCache
histogram.summary: The number of times AlternateProtocolMap supports QUIC, but there is no QUIC server information in the disk cache. This is recorded whenever QUIC server information is loaded from the disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.WaitForDataReady.HandshakeConfirmedTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between waiting for reading of QUIC server information from disk cache, and receiving crypto handshake confirmation from the server. Will measure the impact of cancelling the WaitForDataReady callback. Logged after crypto handshake is confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.WaitForDataReadyToRtt
histogram.summary: The ratio of the time spent waiting to load QUIC server information from disk cache to the min rtt. Logged when session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.21CumulativePacketsReceived
histogram.summary: This histogram summarizes information about a 21 packet sequence, indicating for each of the 21 possible prefixes of this pattern, how many packets were received in that prefix. The first range uses buckets 0 and 1, and it describes the 1st packet in the sequence. It indicates if the first packet was missing (bucket 0), or the first packet was present (bucket 1). The second range uses buckets 2 through 4, and describes the first 2 packets in the prefix of this sequence. It indicates if there were no packets received in the first two packets (bucket 2), or there was one out of two packets received (bucket 3), or if there was two out of tow received (bucket 4). etc. etc. Reading this histogram may require post-processing in a spread sheet, but can indicate the potential value of using FEC packets to convey data.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.6PacketsPatternsReceived
histogram.summary: Each of the 64 buckets represents a different binary pattern of 6 consecutive packets that were received by the client. The LSB of the bucket number corresponds to the reception of the oldest packet. A bit in the bucket-number being 1 indicates the packet was received, and a 0 means the packet was never received (by the client).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.AbortedPendingStreamRequests
histogram.summary: The number of pending stream requests aborted when the session is closed. Pending streams are those which could not be created immediately because there were too many active streams.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.AsyncRead
histogram.summary: True if the result of reading a packet from the network was ERR_IO_PENDING. Recorded for each packet when Read() returns.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.BlockedFrames.Received
histogram.summary: The number of BLOCKED frames recevied by a QuicSession when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.BlockedFrames.Sent
histogram.summary: The number of BLOCKED frames sent by a QuicSession when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CertVerifierJob.CompleteTime
histogram.summary: Time spent verifying a certificate when racing cert veriifcation with host resolution.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ClientSideMtu
histogram.summary: The final maximum packet size of the connection used by the client before the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CloseAllSessionsError
histogram.summary: The network error code which resulted in all sessions being closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ClosedDuringInitializeSession
histogram.summary: True if the QUIC session is closed during the call to InitializeSession, logged for each session just after InitializeSession is called.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CloseSessionOnError
histogram.summary: The network error code which resulted in the session being closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.Connect
histogram.summary: Samples of the number of round-trips needed by a QUIC connection before a request could be sent by the client.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectAfterBroken
histogram.summary: True if a QUIC connection connected successfully after having been broken. Only emitted after a QUIC connection attempt to a server that was previous marked as broken.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.HandshakeFailureBlackHole.QuicError
histogram.summary: The QUIC error which caused a QUIC connection to be closed before the hanshake was confirmed, in the case where no packets were received. This provides a breakdown of the entires in Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.HandshakeNotConfirmed.Reason where the value is BLACK_HOLE.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.HandshakeFailureUnknown.QuicError
histogram.summary: The QUIC error which caused a QUIC connection to be closed before the hanshake was confirmed, in the case where at least 1 packet was received. This provides a breakdown of the entires in Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.HandshakeNotConfirmed.Reason where the value is UNKNOWN.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.HandshakeNotConfirmed.Reason
histogram.summary: The reason a QUIC handshake failed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.NumOpenStreams.HandshakeTimedOut
histogram.summary: The number of streams open when a QUIC session crypto handshake timed out.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.NumOpenStreams.TimedOut
histogram.summary: The number of streams open when a QUIC session timed out.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.NumTotalStreams.HandshakeTimedOut
histogram.summary: The number of total streams created when a QUIC session crypto handshake timed out.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionCloseErrorCode
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in the connection being closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionCloseErrorCodeClient
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in the connection being closed by the client.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionCloseErrorCodeServer
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in the connection being closed by the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionFlowControlBlocked
histogram.summary: Whether QUIC session's connection is flow control blocked when a PING message is sent to server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionMigration
histogram.summary: The result of a QUIC connection migration attempt.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionTypeFromPeer
histogram.summary: The IP Address family of this connection, as reported by the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionTypeFromSelf
histogram.summary: The IP Address family of this connection, as seen locally.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectRandomPortRequiringConfirmation
histogram.summary: Samples of the number of round-trips needed by a QUIC connection before a request could be sent by the client, when handshake confirmation was required. (The operating system randomly selected a source port for the connection.)

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CookieSentToAccountsOverChannelId
histogram.summary: Logs whether channel ID was used when a cookie is sent over QUIC to https://accounts.google.com.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CreationError
histogram.summary: Count of errors during attempts to create a QUIC session (before even using the session).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.DuplicatePacketsReceived
histogram.summary: The number of duplicate packets recevied by a QuicSession when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.FinalTcpCwnd
histogram.summary: The value of the TCP cubic sender's CWND when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.GoAwayReceivedForConnectionMigration
histogram.summary: Whether QuicGoAwayFrame is received from server for connection migration due to client's port change. Logged when a QuicGoAwayFrame with error code QUIC_ERROR_MIGRATING_PORT is received.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HandshakeConfirmedTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between starting the crypto handshake, and receiving confirmation from the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HandshakeRoundTrips
histogram.summary: Samples of the number of round-trips needed by a QUIC connection before a request could be sent by the client.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HeadersHOLBlockedTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time that headers are head of line blocked on others, presumably due to lost headers stream packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HeadersStream.EarlyFramesReceived
histogram.summary: The frames received on the headers stream which arrived early.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HostResolution.HandshakeConfirmedTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between the end of resolving the DNS name of the server for a QUIC connection, and receiving crypto handshake confirmation from the server. Logged after crypto handshake is confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HostResolutionTime
histogram.summary: Time spent resolving the DNS name of the server for a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.IncorrectConnectionIDsReceived
histogram.summary: The number packets recevied by a QuicSession with an incorrect connection id when the sesesion is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.InitialRttEsitmateSource
histogram.summary: The source for the initial RTT estimate recorded when a QUIC session is created.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.LocallyTimedOutWithOpenStreams.TimeSinceLastReceived
histogram.summary: If a QUIC connection timed out locally with open streams, this contains the time since any data was read from the network until the connection was closed. The suffix specifies whether there were any unacked packets pending when the connection timed out.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxReordering
histogram.summary: The maximum packet sequence number reordering observed by a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxReorderingTime
histogram.summary: The ratio of the maximum reordering time of a QUIC packet to the min rtt.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxReorderingTimeLongRtt
histogram.summary: The ratio of the maximum reordering time of a QUIC packet to the min rtt, only for those sessions with a min rtt larger than 100 ms.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MinRTT
histogram.summary: The minimum RTT observed during the life of a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MtuProbesSent
histogram.summary: The number of MTU probes sent by the client during the session. Logged when the connection is destroyed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumOpenStreams
histogram.summary: The number of QUIC streams opened when a new QUIC stream is created.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumPendingStreamRequests
histogram.summary: The number of pending stream requests when a new stream request is added to the pending list. Pending streams are those which could not be created immediately because there were too many active streams.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumTotalStreams
histogram.summary: The total number of streams created by the client when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.OutOfOrderGapReceived
histogram.summary: The number of missing packets between the current received packet and the previously largest received packet sequence number, when the current received packet had a lower sequence number than the previously received packet sequence number.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.OutOfOrderLargePacketsReceived
histogram.summary: The number of times the current received packet had a lower sequence number than the previously received packet sequence number, and the size of the current packet is larger than the size of the previous packet.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.OutOfOrderPacketsReceived
histogram.summary: The number of times the current received packet had a lower sequence number than the previously received packet sequence number.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketGapReceived
histogram.summary: The number of missing packets between the current received packet and the previously largest received packet sequence number.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketGapReceivedNearPing
histogram.summary: The number of missing packets between the last received packet before a PING frame sent and the first packet received after PING sent.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketGapSent
histogram.summary: The number of missing packets between the current received packet and the previously largest received packet sequence number, as reported by the remote end of the connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketLossRate
histogram.summary: The ratio of the number of missing packets, to the maximum packet sequence number received, for QUIC connections longer than 21 packets received via

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketReceived
histogram.summary: Each bucket corresponds to a specific packet sequence number that was sent by a server to Chrome at the start of a QUIC connection. This histogram is compared, bucket by bucket, with a second histogram to compute the ratio for each bucket (each packet sequence number).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketRetransmitsPerMille
histogram.summary: The number of packets retransmitted per 1000. Only sessions with packets_sent >= 100 are included. Recorded in session destructor.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketWriteTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to Write() a QUIC packet to the socket. Recorded for each packet when it is sent. The suffix specifies if the write completed synchonously or asynchronously.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PendingStreamsWaitTime
histogram.summary: The wait time of the pending stream when it is finally serviced. Pending streams are those which could not be created immediately because there were too many active streams.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PreferAesGcm
histogram.summary: True if the QUIC session prefers to use AES GCM because of hardware support.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PublicResetAddressMismatch
histogram.summary: When a public reset packet is received, whether the client IP address and port number in it differ from the client IP address and port number in the ServerHello handshake message. In the comparison, the first address is the one in ServerHello and the second address is the one in public reset. Note: this histogram is obsolete because it failed to treat IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses as IPv4 addresses.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PublicResetAddressMismatch2
histogram.summary: When a public reset packet is received, whether the client IP address and port number in it differ from the client IP address and port number in the ServerHello handshake message. In the comparison, the first address is the one in ServerHello and the second address is the one in public reset.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.Pushed
histogram.summary: The number of push streams received when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PushedAndClaimed
histogram.summary: The number of pushed and used streams when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PushedAndUnclaimedBytes
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that is pushed but not used when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PushedBytes
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that is pushed when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.QuicVersion
histogram.summary: Version of the QUIC protocol used for this connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ReadError
histogram.summary: The network error code returned when attempting to read from a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.RejectHasProof
histogram.summary: True if the QUIC REJ message received from the server contains a proof.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.RejectLength
histogram.summary: The length in bytes of a QUIC REJ message received from the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.RstStreamErrorCodeClient
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in a stream being reset by the client.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.RstStreamErrorCodeServer
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in a stream being reset by the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.SecureResourceSecureSession
histogram.summary: The number of request for secure resources over QUIC sessions. True if the session is secure, false if it is not.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ServerSideMtu
histogram.summary: The largest packet which the client received from the server during the session.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.SmoothedRTT
histogram.summary: The final smoothed RTT observed during the life of a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamCloseErrorCodeClient.HandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in the stream (and connection) being closed by the client after the handshake was confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamCloseErrorCodeServer.HandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in the stream (and connection) being closed by the client after the handshake was confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamFlowControlBlocked
histogram.summary: Whether any of QUIC session's streams are flow control blocked when a PING message is sent to server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamFrameDuplicatedLongConnection
histogram.summary: The number of stream frames received which were duplicates, out of every 1000 stream frames received. Only for QUIC sessions which received at least 100 packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamFrameDuplicatedPercentLongConnection
histogram.summary: The percentage of stream frames received which were duplicates. Only for QUIC sessions which received at least 100 packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamFrameDuplicatedPercentShortConnection
histogram.summary: The percentage of stream frames received which were duplicates. Only for QUIC sessions which received fewer than 100 packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StreamFrameDuplicatedShortConnection
histogram.summary: The number of stream frames received which were duplicates, out of every 1000 stream frames received. Only for QUIC sessions which received fewer than 100 packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TimedOutWithOpenStreams.ConsecutiveRTOCount
histogram.summary: If a QUIC connection timed out with open streams, this contains a count of consecutive RTOs.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TimedOutWithOpenStreams.ConsecutiveTLPCount
histogram.summary: If a QUIC connection timed out with open streams, this contains a count of consecutive TLPs.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TimedOutWithOpenStreams.HasUnackedPackets
histogram.summary: If a QUIC connection timed out with open streams, this will be true when the connection has unacked packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TimedOutWithOpenStreams.LocalPort
histogram.summary: If a QUIC connection timed out locally with open streams, this contains the local port number for the connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TooManyOpenStream
histogram.summary: True if more than 100 streams are open when a new stream is activated.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TooManyOpenStreams
histogram.summary: True if more than 100 streams are open when a new stream is activated.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TruncatedAcksReceived
histogram.summary: The number of truncated ACK frames received.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TruncatedAcksSent
histogram.summary: The number of truncated ACK frames sent.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.UndecryptablePacketsReceived
histogram.summary: The number of undecryptable packets recevied by a QuicSession when the sesesion is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.UnexpectedNotGoingAway
histogram.summary: The location in quic_client_session.cc where a session is unexpectedly not going away.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.UnexpectedObservers
histogram.summary: The location in quic_client_session.cc where there were unexpected observers.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.UnexpectedOpenStreams
histogram.summary: The location in quic_client_session.cc where there were unexpected open streams.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.VerifyProofTime
histogram.summary: Time spent verifying the signature and certificate chain. This is logged whenever QUIC verifies the certificate chain and signature during crypto handshake.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.WriteError
histogram.summary: The network error code returned when attempting to write to a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.WriteError.HandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: The network error code returned when attempting to write to a QUIC connection after the handshake has been confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.BadPacketLossEvents5
histogram.summary: A count of how often a user hits 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 bad packet loss events for port 443. Recorded whenever QUIC has bad packet loss (high packet loss on multiple consecutive connections).

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.DisabledReasons
histogram.summary: Rrecords reasons QUIC is disabled (for all ports), if sufficent recent connections experience: public reset post crypto handshake, or timeouts with streams open. QUIC is disabled until the next reboot of Chrome. Logged during session close.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.PublicResetsPostHandshake
histogram.summary: Captures the maximum number of public resets post handshake that occurred within a window of recent connections (default 20). Will help inform the choice of threshold to disable QUIC for clients that experience pathalogical errors. Logged during session close.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.QuicIsDisabled
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever QUIC is disabled for a port due to repeated lossy connections (high packet loss on multiple consecutive connections). QUIC is disabled until next reboot of Chrome.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.TimeoutsWithOpenStreams
histogram.summary: Captures the maximum number of connection timeouts with streams open that occurred within a window of recent connections (default 20). Will help inform the choice of threshold to disable QUIC for clients that experience pathalogical errors. Logged during session close.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.TSVIPCliIsLoaded
histogram.summary: Whether TSVIPCli DLL is loaded or not on windows when the socket is configured.

histogram.name: Net.QuicTimeBetweenTwoPacketSent
histogram.summary: Time duration from last packet sent to a new packet sent in QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicVerifyProofFailed.HandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: Logged whenever proof verification fails and if the failure occurred before or after the crypto handshake is confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.RedirectWithUnadvertisedContentEncoding
histogram.summary: True for redirect responses with unadvertised "Content-Encoding". False for valid redirect responses. See http://crbug.com/714514

histogram.name: Net.RenegotiationExtensionSupported
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: True if the HTTP request was sent to a server which supports the TLS renegotiation extension.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Net.RequestTime2 due to bug in original implementation.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for success and various different errors.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for success and various different errors.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2.ErrAborted.HttpScheme
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for ERR_ABORTED when the request's scheme is http/s.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2.ErrAborted.NetworkContent
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for ERR_ABORTED when the requests TotalReceivedBytes() > 0.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2.ErrAborted.NoBytesRead
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for ERR_ABORTED when the requests TotalReceivedBytes() = 0 and received_response_content_length() = 0.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2.ErrAborted.NoNetworkContent.CachedContent
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for ERR_ABORTED when the requests TotalReceivedBytes() = 0 and received_response_content_length() > 0.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2.ErrAborted.NonHttpScheme
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for ERR_ABORTED when the request's scheme is not http/s.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceDispatcherHost.OutstandingRequests.PerProcess
histogram.summary: The largest number of outstanding requests that are handled by the resource dispatcher host for a single process.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceDispatcherHost.OutstandingRequests.Total
histogram.summary: The largest number of outstanding requests that are handled by the resource dispatcher host across all processes.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceLoader.ExpectedContentSizeResult
histogram.summary: Records how many times expected content size equals/less/more than size of read body/buffer or content size is unkown. Recorded for each resource load.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceLoader.InliningStatus
histogram.obsolete: This experiment was turned down, see https://crbug.com/703188.
histogram.summary: Counts whether the chunk inlining is applicable or not to a resource loading. Counts the reason if inapplicable.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceLoader.ReadDeferral
histogram.summary: When starting a cross-site navigation, the time between reading the headers and body of the response.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceLoader.ResponseStartToEnd
histogram.summary: Time from the start to the end of receiving a response body. Recorded for each resource load.

histogram.name: Net.ResponseSizeByProcess.Browser
histogram.summary: Count of (post-SSL/proxy, pre-filter) kilobytes received per request made by the browser process.

histogram.name: Net.ResponseSizeByProcess.Renderer
histogram.summary: Count of (post-SSL/proxy, pre-filter) kilobytes received per request made by a renderer process.

histogram.name: Net.ResponseSizeByProcess.Unknown
histogram.summary: Count of (post-SSL/proxy, pre-filter) kilobytes received per request made by a process not covered by one of the other ResponseSizeByProcess histograms.

histogram.name: Net.Socket.IdleSocketFate
histogram.summary: Whether an idle socket is reused, timed out, or closed to make room for new sockets.

histogram.name: Net.Socket.IdleSocketReuseTime
histogram.summary: Seconds a socket was idle before it was reused. Emitted upon reuse. Does not record the times sockets were idle before first use.

histogram.name: Net.Socket.IdleSocketTimeSaving
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds an idle socket saved in connection establishment because it is reused.

histogram.name: Net.Socket.NumIdleSockets
histogram.summary: Number of idle sockets when one of them was reused.

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_ReusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an already used socket sat idle before being used.

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_UnusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an unused socket (all HTTP sockets, regardless of any proxy used) sat idle before being used.

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeOnIOError2_ReusedSocket
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time a previously used socket sat idle before encountering a recoverable socket IO error (connection abort/reset/close).

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeOnIOError2_UnusedSocket
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an unused socket sat idle before encountering a recoverable socket IO error (connection abort/reset/close).

histogram.name: Net.SocketInitErrorCodes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Net error codes that socket initializations end with, including net::OK and net::ERR_ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.SocketReceiveBufferUnchangeable
histogram.summary: The size of a socket's receive buffer when the attempt to change it via setsockopt failed.

histogram.name: Net.SocketRequestTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from initial RequestSocket() call until successfully acquiring a connected socket.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ConnectionEstablish
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: The time from the connection start to connection establish.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ConnectionLatency
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: The time waiting to be ready to start connecting.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ConnectionType

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.Duration
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2014-10-28. No longer generated. Replaced by Net.WebSocket.Duration.
histogram.summary: The time a socket stream was open.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ProtocolType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of protocol type on socket stream.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ReceivedBytes

histogram.summary: Number of bytes on a socket stream.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ReceivedCounts

histogram.summary: Number of bytes on a socket stream.

histogram.summary: Number of Write on a socket stream.
