histogram.name: Net.SocketUnchangeableReceiveBuffer
histogram.summary: The size of a socket's receive buffer when the attempt to change it via setsockopt failed.

histogram.name: Net.SocketUnchangeableSendBuffer
histogram.summary: The size of a socket's send buffer when the attempt to change it via setsockopt failed.

histogram.name: Net.SOCKSSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_ReusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an already used SOCKS socket sat idle before being used.

histogram.name: Net.SOCKSSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_UnusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an unused SOCKS socket sat idle before being used.

histogram.name: Net.SOCKSSocketRequestTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from initial SOCKSClientSocketPool::RequestSocket() call until successfully acquiring a connected SOCKS socket.

histogram.name: Net.SocksSocketRequestTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time it takes to request a new (unused) SOCKS proxy socket.

histogram.name: Net.SOCKSSocketType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of sockets returned by the SOCKS pool.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyConnectionLatency
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyConnectionLatency_2
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyFrameStreamAndSessionFlowControlState
histogram.summary: The counts of the flow control state of each frame (with stream and session flow control on).

histogram.name: Net.SpdyFrameStreamFlowControlState
histogram.obsolete: The last protocol which would trigger this was deprecated in 2014 November. This histogram is deprecated in 2016 January.
histogram.summary: The counts of the flow control state of each frame (with stream flow control on).

histogram.name: Net.SpdyHeadersCompressionPercentage
histogram.summary: The percent compression achieved when compressing HEADERS frames.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyHpackDecompressionPercentage
histogram.summary: The compression percentage in received HPACK compressed header frames.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyHpackEncodedCharacterFrequency
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as HTTP/2 standard is finalized.
histogram.summary: Frequencies of characters observed in request and response headers. Temporarily being collected to inform the construction of an optimized Huffman code for the HTTP/2 specification. Buckets are ASCII codes offset by 1.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyIPPoolDomainMatch
histogram.summary: Status of checking if a SPDY domain can handle a IP match. If a match is found, we successfully used the IP Pooling. If a match is not found, we could have used IP Pooling, except the TLS Cert didn't match the IP-pooled domain.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyPing.RTT
histogram.summary: The RTT for SPDY's PING.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyPriorityCount
histogram.summary: The count of streams at each priority over Spdy sessions.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyRecvBytes
histogram.summary: The number of bytes recevied per stream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySendBytes
histogram.summary: The number of bytes sent per stream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.BytesRead.EOF
histogram.summary: Total number of bytes recevied per session before closing session due to EOF.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.BytesRead.OtherErrors
histogram.summary: Total number of bytes recevied per session before closing session due to an error during read.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.ClosedOnError
histogram.summary: Net error codes when SpdySession was closed, doesn't inlcuding net::OK.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.CreateStreamWithSocketConnected
histogram.summary: Socket connected status in SpdySession::CreateStream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.PushedAndUnclaimedBytes
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that is pushed but not used when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.PushedBytes
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that is pushed when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionErrorDetails
histogram.summary:
WARNING: r181910 added an enum value in the middle, so don't trust the counts for values 9 and above for Chrome builds after that revision.
The type of SPDY Protocol error encountered.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionErrorDetails2
histogram.summary: The type of SPDY Protocol error encountered.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionErrorDetails_Google
histogram.summary: The type of SPDY Protocol error encountered when talking to a google.com server.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionErrorDetails_Google2
histogram.summary:
WARNING: r181910 added an enum value in the middle, so don't trust the counts for values 9 and above for Chrome builds after that revision.
The type of SPDY Protocol error encountered when talking to a google.com server.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionGet
histogram.summary: The type of SPDY Session used when looking up a session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionGetPeerAddressNotConnected
histogram.summary: Whether SpdySession::Get{Peer,Local}Address was called when the connection had no socket.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessions_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: The count of SPDY sessions using the data reduction proxy and the count of other SPDY sessions.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionSocketNotConnectedGetLocalAddress
histogram.summary: SpdySession::GetLocalAddress returned ERR_SOCKET_NOT_CONNECTED.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionSocketNotConnectedGetPeerAddress
histogram.summary: SpdySession::GetPeerAddress returned ERR_SOCKET_NOT_CONNECTED.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionsWithStalls
histogram.summary: The count of SPDY Sessions with or without stalls.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsCwnd
histogram.summary: The congestion window (in pkts) received at the end of a SpdySession.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsCwndSent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016 July with removal of SPDY/3.1.
histogram.summary: The congestion window (in pkts) sent at the beginning of a SpdySession.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsReceived
histogram.summary: Percentage of sessions which received settings from the server.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsRetransRate
histogram.summary: The Download Retransmission Rate (%) received at the end of a SpdySession.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsRTT
histogram.summary: The RTT received at the end of a SpdySession.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsSent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sessions which sent settings to the server.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time between receiving the first chunk and the last chunk of data on a Spdy stream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamsAbandonedPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of pushed, but abandoned streams over a single session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamsPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of streams issued over a single session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamsPushedAndClaimedPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of pushed, and used streams over a single session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamsPushedPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of push streams received over a single session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamStallsPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of stream stalls per session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamTime
histogram.summary: The time of a Spdy stream. Measured from sending the first chunk to receiving the last chunk of data.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamTimeToFirstByte
histogram.summary: The time between sending the request and receiving the first chunk of data on a Spdy stream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySynStreamCompressionPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on 2016-11-28, because SPDY/3 and, accordingly, SYN_STREAM frames are no longer used. Compression values are now calculated slightly differently. Replaced by Net.SpdyHeadersCompressionPercentage.
histogram.summary: The percent compression achieved when compression SYN_STREAM frames.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyVersion
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on 2014-09-11, because the uploaded values were changing as protocols were removed, therefore statistics couldn't be combined across different builds. Replaced by Net.SpdyVersion2.
histogram.summary: The SPDY protocol version that is used to talk to SPDY servers.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyVersion2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on 2016-02-01, because the incorrect bucket count caused data corruption. Replaced by Net.SpdyVersion3.
histogram.summary: The SPDY protocol version that is used to talk to SPDY servers. Logged every time a SPDY session is initialized.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyVersion3
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016 July with removal of SPDY/3.1.
histogram.summary: The SPDY protocol version that is used to talk to SPDY servers. Logged every time a SPDY session is initialized.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_AuthRootConsistency
histogram.summary: The results of comparing the built-in list of known Windows roots against the CERT_AUTH_ROOT_SHA256_HASH_PROP_ID certificate property. Recorded for each certificate verification on Windows.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_CipherSuite
histogram.summary: The SSL/TLS cipher suite that was negotiated. Recorded for each SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Error
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned when opening an SSL connection.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Error_FastRadioPadding
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned when opening an SSL connection for an endpoint which is eligible for fastradio padding.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Error_Google
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned when opening an SSL connection for google.com and any subdomain of it.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Error_TLS13Experiment
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned when opening an SSL connection for an endpoint we are using in the initial TLS 1.3 deployment.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_2
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when using the data reduction proxy. This includes certificate retrieval and verification.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Full_Handshake
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for full handshakes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google2
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google_Full_Handshake
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it for full handshakes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google_No_Revocation_Checking
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it. This only includes users in a 50% field trial that disables revocation checking for certificate pinned sites.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google_Resume_Handshake
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it for resumption handshakes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google_Revocation_Checking
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it. This only includes users not in a 50% field trail that disables revocation for certificate pinned sites.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_PostQuantumSupported_Full_Handshake
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes (full handshakes only), for a set of domains that we expect to always offer the experimental post-quantum (CECPQ1) ciphersuites.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Resume_Handshake
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for resumption handshakes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_TLS13Experiment
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for a set of domains that we are using in the initial TLS 1.3 deployment.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_PostQuantum_Negotiated
histogram.summary: For only browsers in the post-quantum (CECPQ1) ciphersuite experiment, counts the full TLS handshakes where CECPQ1 was, or was not, negotiated on hosts where we expect it to be negotiated.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_EVCertificateCTCompliance
histogram.summary: The state of compliance with Certificate Transparency presence requirements for each EV certificate. An EV certificate could be non-compliant (in which case it loses the EV status), comply through inclusion in the EV whitelist or have the required number of Signed Certificate Timestamps. This metric will gauge adoption rate of Certificate Transparency and will help identify when the EV whitelist is no longer needed. Emitted during every SSL connection establishment, but only if the client is checking compliance with Certificate Transparency requirements (currently guarded by a Finch experiment).

histogram.name: Net.SSL_EVCertificateInWhitelist
histogram.summary: Whether an EV certificate is present in the Certificate Transparency whitelist. Emitted once for every EV certificate encountered (during SSL connection establishment), but only if the client has a valid whitelist.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_EVCTCompliance
histogram.summary: The state of compliance with Certificate Transparency presence requirements for each EV certificate. An EV certificate could be non-compliant (in which case it loses the EV status), comply through inclusion in the EV whitelist or comply with the CT certificate policy. This metric will gauge adoption rate of Certificate Transparency and will help identify when the EV whitelist is no longer needed. Emitted during every SSL connection establishment.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_EVWhitelistValidityForNonCompliantCert
histogram.summary: Whether the client holds a valid EV Certificates whitelist or not. Only emitted when an EV cert that is not compliant with the Certificate Transparency requirement is encountered. This histogram is intended to be short-lived and help determine if EV certificates are considered non-compliant because they are not whitelisted or if the client does not hold a valid instance of the whitelist.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_KeyExchange.DHE
histogram.summary: Bit strength of the key exchange for DHE. Recorded for each SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_KeyExchange.ECDHE
histogram.summary: The curve used for key exchange for ECDHE. Recorded for each SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_KeyExchange.RSA
histogram.summary: Bit strength of the key exchange for RSA. Recorded for each SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds. See |SSL_SESSION|'s key_exchange_info for more information.

histogram.name: Net.SSLCertBlacklisted
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 01/2016. Only ever measured blacklisted Comodo serials, not any of the other blacklisted certificates and keys.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times that users have hit blacklisted certificates. The indexes match up to the indexes in net/base/x509_certificate.cc:IsBlacklisted. The details of the certificates in question is confidential.

histogram.name: Net.SSLCertVerificationTime
histogram.summary: Time to complete a certificate verification (success case).

histogram.name: Net.SSLCertVerificationTimeError
histogram.summary: Time to complete a certificate verification (error case).

histogram.name: Net.SSLFallbackErrorCode
histogram.summary: For each successful HTTPS request which used the TLS version fallback, the error code of the last failed attempt.

histogram.name: Net.SSLFallbackFailureState
histogram.summary: For each successful HTTPS request which used the TLS version fallback, the type of handshake failure of the last failed attempt.

histogram.name: Net.SSLHostInfoDNSLookup
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time to complete a DNS lookup for a DNS CAA record.

histogram.name: Net.SSLHostInfoDNSLookupDelayMs
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time that we would have wasted had we waited for a CAA lookup in order to validate a certificate.

histogram.name: Net.SSLHostInfoVerificationTimeMs
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time to complete a speculative certificate verification.

histogram.name: Net.SSLNegotiatedAlpnProtocol
histogram.summary: For each TLS handshake, whether ALPN was negotiated; and if so, the negotiated protocol.

histogram.name: Net.SSLProtocolErrorCipher
histogram.summary: The cipher suite used when the corresponding operation on an SSLClientSocket fails with ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR. This histogram will be removed when https://crbug.com/593963 is resolved.

histogram.name: Net.SSLProtocolErrorReason
histogram.summary: The internal, version-specific BoringSSL error reason reported when the corresponding operation on an SSLClientSocket fails with ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR. This histogram will be removed when https://crbug.com/593963 is resolved.

histogram.name: Net.SSLProtocolNegotiation
histogram.summary: TLS extension used to negotiate protocol (ALPN or NPN); in case of NPN, whether the protocol is indeed supported by both the client and the server or is a fallback because of no overlap; and the negotiated protocol itself.

histogram.name: Net.SSLServerKeyExchangeHash
histogram.summary: For each SSL connection with a full handshake using a DHE- or ECDHE-based key exchange, the hash function used in the ServerKeyExchange signature.

histogram.name: Net.SSLSessionConcurrentLookupCount
histogram.summary: For each SSL connection where we resume a session and negotiate HTTP/2, the simulated minimum number of sessions retained per host it would have required with TLS 1.3 single-use sessions. See https://crbug.com/631988.

histogram.name: Net.SSLSessionVersionMatch
histogram.summary: For each SSL connection that resumed a session, whether the session was resumed at the same version it was established at. This is only recorded in BoringSSL ports.

histogram.name: Net.SSLSignatureAlgorithm
histogram.summary: For each SSL connection with a full handshake using a DHE- or ECDHE-based key exchange, the signature algorithm used to authenticate the peer. In TLS 1.2, this is the signature on the ServerKeyExchange message. (Note: Although the ECDSA values specify a curve, the curve is only enforced in TLS 1.3.)

histogram.name: Net.SSLv3FallbackToRenegoPatchedServer
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that we have performed SSLv3 fallback and found a TLS renegotiation patched server.

histogram.name: Net.SSLVerificationMerged
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Was a speculative certificate verification used?

histogram.name: Net.SSLVerificationMergedMsSaved
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time saved by a speculative certificate vertification.

histogram.name: Net.SSLVersion
histogram.summary: The SSL/TLS version that was negotiated. Recorded for each SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.SSLVersionInterferenceError
histogram.summary: For each detected SSL version interference, what network error the original failed connection reported.

histogram.name: Net.SSLVersionInterferenceProbeTrigger
histogram.summary: For each SSL version interference probe, what network error triggered it. Probes are only triggered for a small set of network errors.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Idle_Sockets
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of idle sockets when the Connect() succeeded.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency_IPv4_No_Race
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when the network address only contains IPv4 addresses. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency_IPv4_Wins_Race
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when the IPv4 fallback connection won the race against IPv6. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency_IPv6_Raceable
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when we race an IPv6 connection against an IPv4 connection with a 300ms delay. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency_IPv6_Solo
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when the network address only contains IPv6 addresses. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TcpFastOpenSocketConnection
histogram.summary: For sockets for which a TCP Fast Open protocol might be used, the result of trying to use it.

histogram.name: Net.TCPForSOCKSSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_ReusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an already used TCP socket sat idle before being used for a SOCKS request.

histogram.name: Net.TCPForSOCKSSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_UnusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an unused TCP socket sat idle before being used for a SOCKS request.

histogram.name: Net.TCPForSOCKSSocketRequestTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from initial SOCKSClientSocketPool::RequestSocket() call until successfully acquiring a connected TCP socket.

histogram.name: Net.TCPForSOCKSSocketType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of sockets returned by the TCP pool used by the SOCKS pool.

histogram.name: Net.TcpRtt.AtDisconnect
histogram.summary: The kernel's estimated TCP round trip time. Recorded for each TCP socket, at the time it is disconnected.

histogram.name: Net.TCPSocketType
histogram.obsolete: Was only used for HTTP[S] connections, renamed to Net.HTTPSocketType.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of TCP socket returned.

histogram.name: Net.ThreadHopResourceThrottleTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to do an IO to UI round-trip in the ThreadHopResourceThrottle. This is part of an experiment to determine the feasibility to moving some high-level resource loading checks to the UI thread.

histogram.name: Net.TokenBinding.HeaderCreationTime
histogram.summary: Time spent creating a Token-Binding header.

histogram.name: Net.TokenBinding.KeyMatch
histogram.summary: Logs on each request that is sent on a connection where Channel ID was sent whether the key that would be used for Token Binding matches the key used for Channel ID.

histogram.name: Net.TokenBinding.StoreEphemerality
histogram.summary: For each request to accounts.google.com on a connection where Channel ID was sent, this logs whether the Cookie store and the Channel ID store were ephemeral or persistent.

histogram.name: Net.TokenBinding.Support
histogram.summary: The number of secure HTTP requests broken down by support for Token Binding, indicating if Token Binding was negotiated and supported by both client and server, or why it wasn't if not.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Bandwidth
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Effective bandwidth in KByte/Second of transactions logged to Transaction_Latency histogram. Note that only samples durations greater than zero ms, and less than 1 hour are tallied into this ratio.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Connected
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from the when the network transaction is requested, until the first byte of the header is received.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Connected_New
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Connected_New_b
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When a new connection is established, the time from the when the network transaction is requested, until the first byte of the header is received.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Connected_Under_10
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from the when the network transaction is requested, until the first byte of the header is received. Only items under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_b

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_Total
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_Total_New_Connection_Under_10
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When an existing TCP/IP connection is NOT reused, the time from when a network transaction is requested until last byte received by the new network stack. Only items under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_Total_Under_10
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from when a network transaction is requested until last byte received by the new network stack. Only items under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_Under_10
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_WinHTTP

histogram.name: Net.TransportSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_ReusedSocket

histogram.name: Net.TransportSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_UnusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.TransportSocketRequestTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.TransportSocketType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of sockets returned by the TCP pool (either for direct or non-socks use).

histogram.name: Net.UdpSocketBindErrorFromPosix
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Posix error code from call to bind() UDP socket.

histogram.name: Net.UdpSocketBindErrorFromWinOS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Windows error code from call to bind() UDP socket.

histogram.name: Net.UdpSocketRandomBindErrorCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chromium error code from call to RandomBind() UDP socket.

histogram.name: Net.UDPSocketWinClose
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time spent in closesocket call in UDPSocketWin::Close.

histogram.name: Net.URLRequest.ReferrerPolicyHeaderPresentOnRedirect
histogram.summary: Records the usage of the Referrer-Policy header on redirect responses. This histogram is recorded on each HTTP redirect response, with the value true if a Referrer-Policy header was present and false otherwise.

histogram.name: Net.URLRequest_SetReferrer_IsEmptyOrValid
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: True if a URLRequest's referrer is empty or valid when set.

histogram.name: Net.URLRequestContext.OutstandingRequests
histogram.summary: Indicates the number of URLRequests that are handed out by a URLRequestContext and are not yet destroyed.

histogram.name: Net.ValidDNSName
histogram.summary: True if a DNS name contains only characters for which |net::IsValidLabelCharacter| returns true. Used to see if we can deprecate and remove support for arbitrary bytes in DNS names. This histogram is recorded when converting dotted DNS names into DNS query form, in preparation for issuing a DNS request.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.DataUse.Downstream
histogram.summary: Records the downstream data use of WebSockets. Logged on every read operation in the WebSocket.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.DataUse.Upstream
histogram.summary: Records the upstream data use of WebSockets. Logged on every write operation in the WebSocket.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.DeflateMode
histogram.summary: Count the number of WebSockets that accepted permessage-deflate extension for each context take over mode. Used by the new Chromium-based WebSocket implementation.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.Duration
histogram.summary: The time from a WebSocket is successfully opened until it's closed. Used to study how WebSockets are used.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.ErrorCodes
histogram.summary: Positive net error codes that WebSockets end with, including OK and ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.HandshakeResult
histogram.summary: Results of WebSocket handshakes. Use this histogram as a baseline for investigating feature usage counters.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: All HTTP status codes seen during WebSocket handshakes.

histogram.name: Net.Wifi.InterfaceCount
histogram.summary: The number of Wi-fi adapters on the computer. Because the histogram is logged each time Chrome performs a Wi-fi scan, it's better to see results in the "user count" view.

histogram.name: Net.Wifi.LbsLatency
histogram.summary: The time that a request to Location Based Services takes.

histogram.name: Net.Wifi.ScanLatency
histogram.summary: The time that a Wi-fi scan takes.

histogram.name: Net.WpadQuickCheckFailure
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time that a failing WPAD QuickCheck takes. WPAD QuickCheck does a name lookup for "wpad" and times out quickly to fail fast when there's no WPAD server on the network.

histogram.name: Net.WpadQuickCheckSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time that a successful WPAD QuickCheck takes. WPAD QuickCheck does a name lookup for "wpad" and times out quickly to fail fast when there's no WPAD server on the network.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.Sent21
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: In this experiment, 21 packets were sent to Google via UDP at port 6121 as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. If no packets (of the 21) were ever ACKed, then the port is assumed to be blocked, and no data is recorded in this histogram. If the port is not blocked, then this histogram shows the number of echo responses received from the first

Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received an ACK for that packet.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.UDP.PacketLoss
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome sends 4 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if packets 1 and 3 are received, but packets 2 and 4 are lost, then we'd record a sample of binary 0101B, or 5.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.UDP.PacketLoss6
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome sends 6 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are responded to, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a wired Ethernet network and configure Layer 3 state (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Ethernet.TimeToOnline
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Ethernet.TimeToPortal
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.MigrationNssToPem
histogram.summary: Chrome OS metric counting the number of network configurations that contained a NSS nickname identifying a CA certificate, which triggered the migration to PEM encoding. This metric doesn't consider whether the migration was successful but once a migration was successful the nickname is removed.

histogram.name: Network.ServiceErrors
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS connection manager service errors seen.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.3GPPRegistrationDelayedDrop
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of cellular network flakes. A network flake occurs when the signal strength goes below detection level for a short duration.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.AutoConnectTotalTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the total amount of time spent from the start of the first auto-connect request until when the cellular modem successfully connects to the network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.AutoConnectTries
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of auto-connect tries that were attempted before the cellular modem successfully connected to the network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.DevicePresenceStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the presence of a Cellular device in the system. A sample is emitted once every 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.DHCPOptionFailureDetected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the number of DHCP option failures encountered by Shill. This indicates that Shill is using minimal DHCP options due to suspected MTU issues on the return path from the DHCP server back to the client.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.Disconnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric that tracks whether the cellular network was disconnected due to an error or was explicitly disconnected by the user.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.Drop
histogram.summary: Chrome OS cellular network metric that tracks the number of drops based on the network technology.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for a cellular network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.IPv6ConnectivityStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the presence of complete IPv6 configuration at the time when cellular connection is established.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.NetworkConnectionIPType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the types of IP configuration used for establishing cellular connections.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.OutOfCreditsReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS cellular network metric that tracks the number of out-of-credits detected based on the cause that triggered the out-of-credits.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.PortalAttempts
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of portal detection attempts per pass for a cellular network. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.PortalAttemptsToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the total number of portal detection attempts performed for a cellular network between the Connected and Online state. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.PortalResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the result of portal detections for a cellular network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.SignalStrengthBeforeDrop
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the signal strength (0-100) of the cellular modem before it dropped from the network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using cellular to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a cellular network and configure Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToConnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to connect a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToDisable
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to disable a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToEnable
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to enable a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToInitialize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a cellular network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a cellular network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToScan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to scan a cellular network and register a modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.ConnectionDiagnosticsIssue
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the connectivity issue diagnosed by the ConnectionDiagnostics class in Shill. This metric is logged each time a ConnectionDiagnostics object completes its diagnostics actions and reports the results to its caller.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.CorruptedProfile
histogram.summary: Chrome OS cellular network metric that tracks the number of corrupted profiles encountered by Shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DarkResumeActionResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of dark resume actions that successfully complete or fail when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DarkResumeActionsTimeTaken
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes dark resume actions to complete when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DarkResumeActionTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes dark resume actions to complete when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DarkResumeScanNumRetries
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the number of times a dark resume scan is retried in a single dark resume.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DarkResumeScanRetryResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks whether dark resume scan retries led to the system suspending from dark resume in a connected state. This metric is only recorded in dark resumes when at least one dark resume scan retry was launched.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DeviceConnectionStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the connection status of the device. A sample is emitted once every 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DeviceRemovedEvent
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the network device removed events for each device type.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DHCPClientMTUValue
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the MTU value proposed by the DHCP server. A sample is emitted each time the DHCP client completes negotiation with a server.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DHCPClientStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the current state of the DHCP client. A sample is emitted each time the DHCP client state changes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DHCPOptionFailureDetected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the number of DHCP option failures encountered by Shill for each network technology. This indicates that Shill is using minimal DHCP options due to suspected MTU issues on the return path from the DHCP server back to the client.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.DevicePresenceStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the presence of an Ethernet device in the system. A sample is emitted once every 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.DHCPOptionFailureDetected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the number of DHCP option failures encountered by Shill. This indicates that Shill is using minimal DHCP options due to suspected MTU issues on the return path from the DHCP server back to the client.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.Disconnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric that tracks whether the Ethernet network was disconnected due to an error or was explicitly disconnected by the user.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for an Ethernet network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.LinkMonitorBroadcastErrorsAtFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of LinkMonitor broadcast errors that were accrued on an Ethernet network at the time that the link was declaired to be failed.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.LinkMonitorFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS metric that signals the type of failure the LinkMonitor encountered which caused it to stop monitoring an Ethernet network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.LinkMonitorResponseTimeSample
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of milliseconds between an ARP request and a received reply on an Ethernet network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.LinkMonitorSecondsToFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of seconds from the start of the LinkMonitor until failure on an Ethernet network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.LinkMonitorUnicastErrorsAtFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of LinkMonitor unicast errors that were accrued on an Ethernet network at the time that the link was declaired to be failed.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.PortalAttempts
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of portal detection attempts per pass for an Ethernet network. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.PortalAttemptsToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the total number of portal detection attempts performed for an Ethernet network between the Connected and Online state. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.PortalResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the result of portal detections for an Ethernet network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using Ethernet to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a wired Ethernet network and configure Layer 3 state (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToInitialize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize an Ethernet device.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.PPPMTUValue
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the MTU value provided by the upstream PPP peer. A sample is emitted each time the client successfully negotiates an MTU value via PPP.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.ServiceErrors
histogram.summary: Chrome OS connection manager service errors seen.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.ServicesOnSameNetwork
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the number of services that are connected to the currently connected network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.SuspendActionResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of suspend actions that successfully complete or fail when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.SuspendActionsTimeTaken
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes suspend actions to complete when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.SuspendActionTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes suspend actions to complete when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of termination actions that successfully complete or fail when shill terminates. Previously deprecated in 10/2012 and brought back in 10/2014.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionResult.OnSuspend
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of termination actions that successfully complete or fail when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionResult.OnTerminate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of termination actions that successfully complete or fail when shill terminates.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionsTimeTaken
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes termination actions to complete when shill terminates.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes termination actions to complete when shill terminates.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionTime.OnSuspend
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes termination actions to complete when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionTime.OnTerminate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes termination actions to complete when shill terminates.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TimeToDrop
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network stability metric sampling the time in seconds between the networking going online to going offline. Offline events due to device shutdown or suspend are ignored (along with the online time before that offline event).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.UserInitiatedEvents
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the number of user-initiated events.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.Driver
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric sampled on each successful VPN connection that tracks the VPN connection type.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.RemoteAuthenticationType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric sampled on each successful VPN connection that tracks the remote authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using VPN to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular). A sample is emitted every time the system transitions from primary connectivity through a VPN to some other type of connectivity. The value of the sample is the time delta in seconds from the instant the system transitioned to VPN connectivity.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on a VPN network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a WiMax network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.UserAuthenticationType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric sampled on each successful VPN connection that tracks the user authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ApDisconnectReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. Reason code reported when the AP disconnects a WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ApDisconnectType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. Broad category of reason AP disconnected a WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.ApMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The AP mode setting for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.AutoConnectableServices
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the number of wifi services available for auto-connect when auto-connect is initiated for wifi device.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.AvailableBSSesAtConnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the number of BSSes (endpoints) available for the currently connecting wifi service.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.Channel
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The channel used for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ClientDisconnectReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. Reason code reported when the client disconnects a WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ClientDisconnectType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. Broad category of reason client disconnected a WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.DarkResumeUnmatchedScanResultsReceived
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks whether any unmatched scan results are received during dark resume cycles. An unmatched scan result is a set of scan results received by shill in response to a scan request that was not sent directly by shill in the same dark resume cycle.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.DarkResumeWakeReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the wake reason for dark resume.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.DevicePresenceStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the presence of a WiFi device in the system. A sample is emitted once every 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.DHCPOptionFailureDetected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the number of DHCP option failures encountered by Shill. This indicates that Shill is using minimal DHCP options due to suspected MTU issues on the return path from the DHCP server back to the client.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.Disconnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric that tracks whether an 802.11 wireless network was disconnected due to an error or was explicitly disconnected by the user.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.EapInnerProtocol
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric sampled on each successful 802.1x wireless connection that tracks the configured inner authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.EapOuterProtocol
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric sampled on each successful 802.1x wireless connection that tracks the configured outer authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for a WiFi network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.FallbackDNSTestResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the result of the fallback DNS test. The fallback DNS test is performed when portal detection failed due to DNS failure.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.FrequenciesConnectedEver
histogram.summary: Chrome OS metric sampling the number of different frequencies (i.e. channels) on which a device has connected to a WiFi network. This value is sampled every time a WiFi connection is established (WPASupplicant::kInterfaceStateCompleted). Note that the word "Ever" in the metric name is misleading. Chrome OS actually ages out historical information, currently after 3 weeks.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.IPv6ConnectivityStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the presence of complete IPv6 configuration at the time when WiFi connection is established.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.LinkMonitorBroadcastErrorsAtFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of LinkMonitor broadcast errors that were accrued on an 802.11 wireiless network at the time that the link was declaired to be failed.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.LinkMonitorFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS metric that signals the type of failure the LinkMonitor encountered which caused it to stop monitoring an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.LinkMonitorResponseTimeSample
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of milliseconds between an ARP request and a received reply on an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.LinkMonitorSecondsToFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of seconds from the start of the LinkMonitor until failure on an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.LinkMonitorUnicastErrorsAtFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of LinkMonitor unicast errors that were accrued on an 802.11 wireless network at the time that the link was declaired to be failed.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.NetworkConnectionIPType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the types of IP configuration used for establishing WiFi connections.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.NetworkProblemDetected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the network problems encountered by TrafficMonitor after WiFi connection is established.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.PhyMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The channel type used for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.PortalAttempts
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of portal detection attempts per pass for an 802.11 wireless network. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.PortalAttemptsToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the total number of portal detection attempts performed for an 802.11 wireless network between the Connected and Online state. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.PortalResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the result of portal detections for an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.RememberedNetworkCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of 802.11 wireless networks known by the connection manager at the time a configuration profile has been loaded. A configuration profile is loaded at each system startup, and when a user logs in.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.RememberedSystemNetworkCount
histogram.summary:
Chrome OS network metric sampling the number of 802.11 wireless networks configured from the system configuration profile. This metric is sampled each time a user configuration profile is loaded, such as when a user logs in.
It might be surprising to have a system configuration profile metric sampled when a user configuration profile is loaded. But this ensures that we have equal numbers of samples for system and user configuration profiles.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.RememberedUserNetworkCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the number of 802.11 wireless networks configured from a user configuration profile. This metric is sampled each time a user configuration profile is loaded, such as when a user logs in.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ScanResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric describing, for a WiFi scan attempt, what scan method is used and whether it ends in a connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ScanTimeInEbusy
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric describing, for a WiFi scan attempt, how many milliseconds were spent waiting to talk to the kernel/drivers.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.Security
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The security setting for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.SignalAtDisconnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric indicating the negative of the dBm received signal strength recorded at the time of a WiFi disconnect.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.SignalStrength
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric indicating the negative of the dBm received signal strength recorded at the time a successful WiFi connection started.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.StoppedTxQueueLength
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric indicating the maximal length of any stopped mac80211 transmit queue. The metric is reported when a queue-status check determines that at least one transmit queue is stopped, and has more than a threshold number of frames queued.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.StoppedTxQueueReason
histogram.summary:
Chrome OS network metric indicating the reason that mac80211 transmit queues were stopped. The metric is reported when a queue-status check determines that at least one queue is stopped, and has more than a threshold number of frames queued.
One measurement is reported per stop reason, per queue-status check. Reasons that apply to multiple queues are reported only once per queue-status check. Reasons that only apply to queues that have a below-threshold number of frames are skipped.
Note that, because we may report multiple stop reasons for a single queue-status check, this histogram is not suitable for determining the number of times a queue-status check found that the queues were stopped. To determine that number, use the count of Network.Shill.WiFi.StoppedTxQueueLength reports.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.SuspendDurationWoWOffConnected
histogram.summary: Time spent in suspended state, on a resume, for the case when wake on wifi is disabled (WoWOff), and after resume, the NIC is found to be already connected.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.SuspendDurationWoWOffDisconnected
histogram.summary: Time spent in suspended state, on a resume, for the case when wake on wifi is enabled (WoWOff), and after resume, the NIC is found to be disconnected.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.SuspendDurationWoWOnConnected
histogram.summary: Time spent in suspended state, on a resume, for the case when wake on wifi is enabled (WoWOn), and after resume, the NIC is found to be already connected.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.SuspendDurationWoWOnDisconnected
histogram.summary: Time spent in suspended state, on a resume, for the case when wake on wifi is enabled (WoWOn), and after resume, the NIC is found to be disconnected.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using WiFi to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeResumeToReady
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time from the resume event to the time when an 802.11 wireless network has configured its Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToConnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to connect to a WiFi Basic Service Set (which consists of the access point and associated stations on a particular WiFi channel for a specific network).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToInitialize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize an 802.11 wireless device.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToJoin
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join (associate plus authenticate) an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an 802.11 wireless network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an 802.11 wireless network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToScan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to scan WiFi until a connection is found.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToScanAndConnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time between the beginning of a WiFi scan (if the scan includes both a progressive scan and a full scan, the TimeToScanAndConnect starts with the first scan of the series) and the completion of a successful connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.TransmitBitrateMbps
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the transmit bitrate in Mbps for the wifi device when it is connected to a network. The bitrate is reported once every minute after the wifi connection is established.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.UnreliableLinkSignalStrength
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the signal strength (0-100) of the wifi network when it becomes unreliable (experiencing multiple link failures in a short period of time).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.UserInitiatedConnectionFailureReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the reasons of failed user-initiated WiFi connection attempts. The result of the user-initiated WiFi connection attempts are being tracked by Network.Shill.WiFi.UserInitiatedConnectionResult.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.UserInitiatedConnectionResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the result of user-initiated WiFi connection attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.VerifyWakeOnWiFiSettingsResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of times NIC wake on WiFi settings verification succeeds or fails in shill. This metric is recorded every time wake on WiFi settings are requested and verified after the NIC is programmed with wake on WiFi settings.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.WakeOnWiFiFeaturesEnabledState
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric that tracks the wake on WiFi features that are enabled in shill. Recorded once every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.WakeOnWiFiThrottled
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks whether wake on WiFi was disabled during a period of system suspension because of too many dark resume wakes. This metric is only recorded for system suspends where wake on WiFi functionality has been programmed into the NIC.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.WakeReasonReceivedBeforeOnDarkResume
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks whether a wake reason was received during dark resume before executing WakeOnWiFi::OnDarkResume.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.WiFiConnectionStatusAfterWake
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric that tracks the WiFi connection status after waking from suspend, both when wake on WiFi is enabled and disabled. Recorded 1 second after waking from suspend.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.DevicePresenceStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the presence of a WiMax device in the system. A sample is emitted once every 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.DHCPOptionFailureDetected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the number of DHCP option failures encountered by Shill. This indicates that Shill is using minimal DHCP options due to suspected MTU issues on the return path from the DHCP server back to the client.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for a WiMax network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on a WiMax network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.TimeToInitialize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize a WiMax device.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a WiMax network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToConfig.Cellular
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a 3G/Cellular network and configure Layer 3 state. Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Cellular.TimeToConfig.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToConfig.Ethernet
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a wired Ethernet network and configure Layer 3 state (typically acquire a DHCP lease). Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Ethernet.TimeToConfig.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToConfig.Wifi
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease). Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Wifi.TimeToConfig.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToDrop
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network stability metric sampling the time in seconds between the networking going online to going offline. Offline events due to device shutdown or suspend are ignored (along with the online time before that offline event).

histogram.name: Network.TimeToJoin.Wifi
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join (associate plus authenticate) an 802.11 wireless network. Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Wifi.TimeToJoin.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.AuthMode
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.BitRate
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Network metric reporting the download speed test results run at setup time. Recorded at least once per day.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.Channel
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The channel used for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.PhyMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The channel type used for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.RoundTripTime
histogram.summary: Network metric reporting the average round trip time to the WiFi gateway. Recorded at least once per day.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.Security
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The security setting for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeOnline
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using WiFi to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeResumeToReady
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time from the resume event to the time when an 802.11 wireless network has configured its Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToConfig
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToJoin
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join (associate plus authenticate) an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToOnline
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an 802.11 wireless network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToPortal
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an 802.11 wireless network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Networks.RememberedShared
histogram.summary: Number of shared remembered (preferred) networks on Chrome OS. Updated any time the network list changes.

histogram.name: Networks.RememberedUnshared
histogram.summary: Number of private remembered (preferred) networks on Chrome OS. Updated any time the network list changes.

histogram.name: Networks.Visible
histogram.summary: Number of visible (in-range) networks on Chrome OS. Updated any time the network list changes.

histogram.name: NetworkTimeTracker.ClockDivergence.Negative
histogram.summary: NetworkTimeTracker observes a tick clock and a wall clock to determine whether a timestamp retrieved from the network in the past can be used to compute a current timestamp. When the tick clock and wall clock diverge from each other, the NetworkTimeTracker must discard the network timestamp because it has no way to compute a reliable current timestamp. Whenever the NetworkTimeTracker discards a network timestamp due to the tick and wall clocks diverging, this histogram records the difference of the tick clock's delta minus the wall clock's delta since the network timestamp was retrieved. For cases where the the tick clock delta is bigger than the wall clock delta, see NetworkTimeTracker.ClockDivergence.Positive.

histogram.name: NetworkTimeTracker.ClockDivergence.Positive
histogram.summary: NetworkTimeTracker observes a tick clock and a wall clock to determine whether a timestamp retrieved from the network in the past can be used to compute a current timestamp. When the tick clock and wall clock diverge from each other, the NetworkTimeTracker must discard the network timestamp because it has no way to compute a reliable current timestamp. Whenever the NetworkTimeTracker discards a network timestamp due to the tick and wall clocks diverging, this histogram records the difference of the tick clock's delta minus the wall clock's delta since the network timestamp was retrieved. For cases where the the wall clock delta is bigger than the tick clock delta, see NetworkTimeTracker.ClockDivergence.Negative.

histogram.name: NetworkTimeTracker.TimeBetweenFetches
histogram.summary: NetworkTimeTracker makes periodic queries to obtain a secure timestamp over the network. This histogram records the delta between each secure timestamp and the previous one, to measure how often time queries are made. The first time query is not recorded, because there is no previous query from which to compute a delta.

histogram.name: NetworkTimeTracker.TimeQueryLatency
histogram.summary: NetworkTimeTracker makes periodic queries to obtain a secure timestamp over the network. This histogram records the latency of each time query.

histogram.name: NetworkTimeTracker.UpdateTimeFetchAttempted
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2016 because it does not provide additional information beyond NetworkTimeTracker.UpdateTimeFetchFailed and NetworkTimeTracker.UpdateTimeFetchValid.
histogram.summary: NetworkTimeTracker makes periodic queries to obtain a secure timestamp over the network. This histogram increments whenever such a query is attempted.

histogram.name: NetworkTimeTracker.UpdateTimeFetchFailed
histogram.summary: NetworkTimeTracker makes periodic queries to obtain a secure timestamp over the network. This histogram records the request's net error code whenever a secure timestamp fetch results in a network error or a non-200 HTTP status code.

histogram.name: NetworkTimeTracker.UpdateTimeFetchValid
histogram.summary: NetworkTimeTracker makes periodic queries to obtain a secure timestamp over the network. Whenever one of these requests results in a successful 200 status code, this histogram records true if the response parsed and validated successfully, and false otherwise.

histogram.name: NetworkTimeTracker.WallClockRanBackwards
histogram.summary: NetworkTimeTracker observes a tick clock and a wall clock to determine whether a timestamp retrieved from the network in the past can be used to compute a current timestamp. When the NetworkTimeTracker observes that the wall clock ran backwards, the NetworkTimeTracker must discard the network timestamp because it has no way to compute a reliable current timestamp. Whenever the NetworkTimeTracker discards a network timestamp due to the wall clock running backwards, this histogram records the magnitude of the difference of the current wall clock time minus the wall clock time when the network timestamp was retrieved.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ActionAndroid
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 01/2017. Replaced by NewTabPage.ActionAndroid2.
histogram.summary: Actions taken by users from the new tab page on Android. These actions may navigate away from the NTP (e.g. searching in the omnibox or opening a bookmark), but can also happen without navigating away from the NTP (e.g. opening a bookmark in a new tab).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ActionAndroid2
