histogram.summary: Actions taken from the new tab page on Android. These actions may navigate away from the NTP (e.g. searching in the omnibox or opening a bookmark), but can also happen without navigating away from the NTP (e.g. opening a content suggestion in a new tab).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.AnimatedLogoDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to download the animated logo. Android only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.AppsPageDragSource
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for the source of app page drags. For any succesful drop onto an apps pane of the NTP, this logs where the drag originated.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.BookmarkActionAndroid
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on M33 with the change to native NTP.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Actions taken by users on partner bookmarks (editing / renaming) on the NTP on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.ArticleFaviconFetchResult
histogram.summary: Android: Result of fetching a favicon for an article suggestion on the New Tab Page.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.ArticleFaviconFetchTime
histogram.summary: Android: Time it takes to fetch a favicon for an article suggestion on the New Tab Page.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BackgroundFetchTrigger
histogram.summary: Android: The type of trigger that caused a background fetch of NTP content suggestions from a suggestion server. Every background fetch is recorded.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.CategoryDismissed
histogram.summary: Android: A category of content suggestions that was dismissed (by swiping away its empty state card).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.CountOnNtpOpened
histogram.summary: Android: The number of suggestion cards that were available at the time an NTP was opened.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.DismissedUnvisited
histogram.summary: Android: The position of a suggestion card on the NTP that is dismissed, typically by swiping it away. The suggestion had a URL that was NOT visited before. We track the position the card had in the list when it was first seen by the user. This tracked position can be different from the position observed by the user, e.g. when the user dismissed some suggestions from the list or requested more that got inserted in the middle of the feed.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.DismissedVisited
histogram.summary: Android: The position of a suggestion card on the NTP that is dismissed, typically by swiping it away. The suggestion had a URL that was visited before. We track the position the card had in the list when it was first seen by the user. This tracked position can be different from the position observed by the user, e.g. when the user dismissed some suggestions from the list or requested more that got inserted in the middle of the feed.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.MenuOpened
histogram.summary: Android: The position of a suggestion card whose long-press menu was opened, analogous to NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.Opened.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.MenuOpenedAge
histogram.summary: Android: The age of a suggestion card on the NTP whose long-press menu was opened, analogous to NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.OpenedAge.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.MenuOpenedScore
histogram.summary: Android: The relevance score of a suggestion card on the NTP whose long-press menu was opened, analogous to NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.OpenedScore.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.MenuOpenedScoreNormalized
histogram.summary: Android: The relevance score of a suggestion card on the NTP whose long-press menu was opened, analogous to NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.OpenedScoreNormalized. Scores (which are typically floats within (0,1]) get reported as discrete integers within [1,10]. For instance, the discrete value 1 represents score values from (0.0, 0.1]. The discrete value 11 is the overflow bucket for unexpectedly high scores.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.MoreButtonClicked
histogram.summary: Android: The position of a "More" suggestion card that was clicked on the NTP. A card is considered shown when at least 1/3 of its height is visible on the screen. We track the position the card had in the list when it was first seen by the user. This tracked position can be different from the position observed by the user, e.g. when the user dismissed some suggestions from the list or requested more that got inserted in the middle of the feed.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.MoreButtonShown
histogram.summary: Android: The position of a "More" suggestion card that was shown on the NTP. A card is considered shown when at least 1/3 of its height is visible on the screen. For each card, at most one impression is recorded per NTP instance. We track the position the card had in the list when it was first seen by the user. This tracked position can be different from the position observed by the user, e.g. when the user dismissed some suggestions from the list or requested more that got inserted in the middle of the feed.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.MovedUpCategoryNewIndex
histogram.summary: Android: The new index of a category on the NTP after it has been moved up due to a click. The index of a category, which has been overtaken, is not recorded here. This tracked index can be different from the position observed by the user, e.g. empty categories are not shown. This metric ignores all other order changes (e.g. dismissing a category or clearing history).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.Notifications.Actions
histogram.summary: Android: The number of actions taken on displayed notifications, either user-initiated (tapping to open or swiping to dismiss), or automatic (hiding due to a change in circumstances).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.Notifications.AutoOptOuts
histogram.summary: Android: The number of times a user opted out, keyed by method: IMPLICIT (user ignored enough notifications consecutively that we think they're not interested), or EXPLICIT (via explicit setting).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.Notifications.Impressions
histogram.summary: Android: The number of notifications that were shown, keyed by category. One bucket counts the server-provided ARTICLES category; the other counts everything else.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.OpenDisposition
histogram.summary: Android: How an article linked from a suggestion card on the NTP was opened (e.g. plain click, open in new tab, open in incognito).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.Opened
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the suggestion card on the NTP, that is clicked through to the host website of the content. We track the position the card had in the list when it was first seen by the user. This tracked position can be different from the position observed by the user, e.g. when the user dismissed some suggestions from the list or requested more that got inserted in the middle of the feed.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.OpenedAge
histogram.summary: Android: The age of a suggestion card on the NTP that is clicked through to the host website of the content. The age is measured from the moment the content has been published.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.OpenedCategoryIndex
histogram.summary: Android: The index of a category on the NTP, whose suggestion card is clicked through to the host website of the content. This tracked index can be different from the position observed by the user, e.g. for the user a category may be at the top of the NTP, but with index 1, because they dismissed the one that was previously at the top.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.OpenedScore
histogram.summary: Android: The score of a suggestion card on the NTP that is clicked through to the host website of the content. The recorded score is from the moment the suggestion was fetched, it could have changed since.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.OpenedScoreNormalized
histogram.summary: Android: The score of a suggestion card on the NTP that is clicked through to the host website of the content. The recorded score is from the moment the suggestion was fetched, it could have changed since. Scores (which are typically floats within (0,1]) get reported as discrete integers within [1,10]. For instance, the discrete value 1 represents score values from (0.0, 0.1]. The discrete value 11 is the overflow bucket for unexpectedly high scores.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.Preferences.RemoteSuggestions
histogram.summary: Whether content suggestions from the remote service are enabled. It is recored at startup. Note: This histogram is not specific to the New Tab Page.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.SectionCountOnNtpOpened
histogram.summary: Android: The number of suggestion sections that were shown at the time an NTP was opened. All shown sections (including empty ones) are counted.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.Shown
histogram.summary: Android: The position of a suggestion card that was shown on the NTP. A card is considered shown when at least 1/3 of its height is visible on the screen. For each card, at most one impression is recorded per NTP instance. We track the position the card had in the list when it was first seen by the user. This tracked position can be different from the position observed by the user, e.g. when the user dismissed some suggestions from the list or requested more that got inserted in the middle of the feed.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.ShownAge
histogram.summary: Android: The age of a suggestion card that was shown on the NTP. A card is considered shown when at least 1/3 of its height is visible on the screen. For each card, at most one impression is recorded per NTP instance.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.ShownScore
histogram.summary: Android: The score of a suggestion card that was shown on the NTP. A card is considered shown when at least 1/3 of its height is visible on the screen. For each card, at most one impression is recorded per NTP instance.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.ShownScoreNormalized
histogram.summary: Android: The score of a suggestion card that was shown on the NTP. A card is considered shown when at least 1/3 of its height is visible on the screen. For each card, at most one impression is recorded per NTP instance. Scores (which are typically floats within (0,1]) get reported as discrete integers within [1,10]. For instance, the discrete value 1 represents score values from (0.0, 0.1]. The discrete value 11 is the overflow bucket for unexpectedly high scores.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeSinceLastBackgroundFetch
histogram.summary: Android: The time since the last successful background fetch of remote content suggestions. Recorded when the user looks at content suggestions on the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeSinceSuggestionFetched
histogram.summary: Android: The time since the displayed content suggestions was fetched. Recorded when the user looks at content suggestions on the NTP. The metric is only recorded for suggestions of the Articles for you section.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeUntilFirstSoftTrigger
histogram.summary: Android: The time since the last fetch, recorded upon the first soft fetch trigger. The first soft trigger does not necessarily cause a fetch (if it comes before the end of the respective scheduling interval). This metric is recorded at most once (per lifetime of a Chrome instance) after each fetch. This is used to understand how changing scheduling intervals will impact traffic of background fetches.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeUntilPersistentFetch
histogram.summary: Android: The time since the last fetch, recorded upon a persistent fetch. This is used to understand what are the real persistent fetching intervals in the wild.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeUntilSoftFetch
histogram.summary: Android: The time since the last fetch, recorded upon a soft fetch. This is used to understand what are the real soft fetching intervals in the wild.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.UIUpdateResult
histogram.summary: Android: The result of updating the list of content suggestions in the UI.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.UIUpdateResult2
histogram.summary: Android: The result of updating the list of content suggestions in one UI section.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.UIUpdateSuccessNumberOfSuggestionsSeen
histogram.summary: Android: The number of content suggestions that have been seen by the user in the UI section before the section was successfully updated. The seen suggestions were not removed in the update so that we do not change visible parts of the UI. This histogram is only recorded when the UIUpdateResult2 is "Success (some suggestions replaced)".

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.UsageTimeLocal
histogram.summary: Android: The time of day (in the local timezone) when the user used content suggestions. Recorded for example when the user scrolls to the articles suggestions or opens an article suggestions.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.VisitDuration
histogram.summary: Android: Time spent reading the page linked by an opened suggestion card. Exit conditions include the tab not being in the foreground or starting a new navigation.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.DefaultPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default pane when the NTP is first opened.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.HoverTimeClicked
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram of the time, in milliseconds, users have the cursor over a most visited thumbnail before clicking.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.HoverTimeNotClicked
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram of the time, in milliseconds, users have the cursor over a most visited thumbnail before moving it away from the thumbnail without clicking.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.IconsColor
histogram.summary: The number of most visited tiles on the new tab page that are displayed using a fallback color (as opposed to having an icon, or simply being gray). Android only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.IconsGray
histogram.summary: The number of most visited tiles on the new tab page that are displayed as gray (as opposed to having an icon, or a fallback color). Android only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.IconsReal
histogram.summary: The number of most visited tiles on the new tab page that are displayed with the site's icon (as opposed using a fallback color or just gray). Android only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Interests.ImageDownloadSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2017-05 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.summary: Android: Whether an attempt to download the image for an interest was successful.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Interests.InterestsFetchSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2017-05 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.summary: Android: Whether an attempt to fetch the interests for a user was successful.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Interests.NumInterests
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2017-05 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.summary: Android: The number of interests fetched for a user to display on the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Languages.UILanguageRatioInTwoTopLanguages
histogram.summary: Android: Percentage of how much in browsing is the UI language of Chrome used compared to overall use of the two top languages that are reported to Chrome content suggestion server.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Layout
histogram.summary: Android: A histogram detailing how the NewTabPageLayout is laid out on the device (eg, whether it fits fully above the fold or not). This is logged once per NewTabPageLayout creation (so once per NTP).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Histogram of the time, in milliseconds, it took for the NTP to load all of its tiles since navigation start.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.LoadType
histogram.summary: Android: the type of load for the NTP, such as cold or warm start. It's a warm start if the native library is already loaded and initialized at the time the activity is created. This might happen if for example a service was already running.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.LogoClick
histogram.summary: Histogram tracking how many users click on the static logo or animated logo on NTP. Android and iOS only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.LogoDownloadOutcome
histogram.summary: Outcome of downloading search provider's logos. It measures whether download/parsing is successful, revalidation and parsing work properly, etc. Android and iOS only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.LogoDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to download the static logo. This includes requests where there was no logo, or where an existing logo was revalidated (so no new image data was downloaded), but it does not include failed requests. Android and iOS only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.LogoImageDownloaded
histogram.summary: A logo image (static or CTA) was downloaded. Recorded only when the image was downloaded and decoded without errors.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.LogoShown
histogram.summary: The number of static logos and animated logos shown to users. Android and iOS only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.LogoShownTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between opening an NTP and the logo appearing. Only recorded when there is a logo, and only recorded once per NTP. Android only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MobileIsUserOnline
histogram.summary: Record the network status when a new tab page is opened. True if user is online and false for offline.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MobilePromo
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on M33 with the change to native NTP.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Android: Tallies counts for how the user interacted with the NTP promo page.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisited
histogram.summary: Histogram for user clicks of the most visited tile. The value is equal to the index of the tile.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisitedAction
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.summary: Action taken by the user on the Most Visited NTP pane. If the user switches panes during this use of the NTP, this action is sometimes not recorded. Ask mpearson@ for details.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisitedScheme
histogram.summary: The schemes of URLs of most visited thumbnails that the user clicked on.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisitedTilePlacementExperiment
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.summary: Records anomalous events for the Most Visited Tile Placement experiment, where it is unable to operate as expected. These are recorded during New Tab Page load time, once for every NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisitedTime
histogram.summary: The time from the New Tab page being shown until the user to clicked on a most visited tile. Only recorded if the user clicked on a tile, as opposed to e.g. searching via the omnibox. Only measured on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NonVisibleScreenshots
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of screenshots that were cached for the non-visible but ranked suggestions on the Suggested NTP pane.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NonVisibleSuggestedSiteRank
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Given that the user has typed a URL, and given that that specific URL was ranked but not visible on the Suggested pane of the NTP, this is the rank that the Suggested pane had for that URL.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfExternalTileFallbacks
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we relied on external tiles as a fallback because a local screenshot was not available to be used as a thumbnail. External tiles are those for which the visuals are handled by the page itself, not by the iframe. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window, or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfExternalTiles
histogram.summary: The number of external tiles that are displayed on the NTP. External tiles are those for which the visuals are handled by the page itself, not by the iframe. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfGrayTileFallbacks
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we displayed a gray tile with the domain name as a fallback because a local screenshot was not available to be used as a thumbnail. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfGrayTiles
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which no thumbnail was specified, but a domain was so we displayed a gray tile with the domain name in it. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfMouseOvers
histogram.summary: The total number of times the user hovered the mouse over Most Visited tile or title elements before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailAttempts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we attempted to use a local screenshot as a thumbnail. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailErrors
histogram.summary: The number of thumbnails for which a local screenshot was not available so we were not able to display them on the Most Visited section of the NTP. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailTiles
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we attempted to use a local screenshot as a thumbnail. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfTiles
histogram.summary: The number of tiles that are displayed on the NTP, no matter if they are thumbnails, gray tiles, or external tiles. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.OfflineUrlsLoadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent waiting for the offline page model to return which New Tab Page URLs are available offline.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.OneGoogleBar.RequestLatency
histogram.summary: The time it took until a request from the New Tab page for the OneGoogleBar script was served. Recorded only on the local NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.OtherSessionsMenu
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for usage of the menu on the NTP that allows the user to access tabs from other devices.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.PreviousSelectedPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The pane that had been previously selected when the user switches panes in the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Promo.Bubble
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for NTP bubble promo activity.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Promo.Notification
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for NTP notification promo activity.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.RecentTabsPage.TimeVisibleAndroid
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time that the "Recent Tabs" page is visible and Chrome is in the foreground on Android. The metric is recorded whenever the "Recent Tabs" page moves out of the foreground. The metric is recorded when the "Recent Tabs" page is closed, when the user switches from the "Recent Tabs" page to a different tab and when Chrome is backgrounded.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.RequestThrottler.PerDay
histogram.summary: Records how many background requests of the given type the browser tried to perform each day where the type is specified by the _suffix of the histogram. The histogram is emitted only after midnight of the given day passes - right before the first following request (which can be several days later if the user does not use Chrome in the meantime). The histogram counts requests with both QUOTA_GRANTED and QUOTA_EXCEEDED status, i.e. the count can easily exceed the daily quota.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.RequestThrottler.PerDayInteractive
histogram.summary: Records how many interactive requests of the given type the browser tried to perform each day where the type is specified by the _suffix of the histogram. The histogram is emitted only after midnight of the given day passes - right before the first following request (which can be several days later if the user does not use Chrome in the meantime). The histogram counts requests with both QUOTA_GRANTED and QUOTA_EXCEEDED status, i.e. the count can easily exceed the daily quota.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.RequestThrottler.RequestStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status w.r.t. the quota for all requests of the given type. The type of request is specified by the _suffix of the histogram.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchAvailableLoadTime.ColdStart
histogram.summary: The time until the search box became available on the NTP in a cold start. It's a cold start if the native library is not already loaded and initialized at the time the activity is created. Only measured on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchAvailableLoadTime.WarmStart
histogram.summary: The time until the search box became available on the NTP in a warm start. It's a warm start if the native library is already loaded and initialized at the time the activity is created. This might happen if for example a service was already running. Only measured on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchAvailableLoadTime2.ColdStart
histogram.summary: The time until the search box became available on the NTP in a cold start. It's a cold start if the native library is not already loaded and initialized at the time the activity is created. Only measured on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchAvailableLoadTime2.WarmStart
histogram.summary: The time until the search box became available on the NTP in a warm start. It's a warm start if the native library is already loaded and initialized at the time the activity is created. This might happen if for example a service was already running. Only measured on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchURLs.Total
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SelectedPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The pane selected when the user switches panes in the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SessionRestore
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for user clicks of the Recently Closed items. The value is the recency of the entry being restored (0 is most recent).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SingleSessionPageSwitches
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram to track how many times a user switched pages in a single NTP session.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClicked
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the snippets card on the NTP, that is clicked through to the host website of the content. We track the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClickedAge
histogram.summary: Android: The age of the snippets card on the NTP, that is clicked through to the host website of the content. The age is measured from the moment the content has been published. In each "_x_y" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \gt;=x and \lt;=y are tracked. We track the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClickedScore
histogram.summary: Android: The score of the snippets card on the NTP, that is clicked through to the host website of the content. The recorded score is from the moment the snippet was fetched, it could have changed since. In each "_x" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \lt;=x are tracked. We track the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClickedScoreNew
histogram.summary: Android: The score of the snippets card on the NTP, that is clicked through to the host website of the content. The recorded score is from the moment the snippet was fetched, it could have changed since. In each "_x" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \lt;=x are tracked. We track the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list. In contrast to CardClickedScore, this histogram has a proper maximal value of 100 000.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardExpanded
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the snippets card on the NTP, that is expanded to reveal more content.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardHidden
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the snippets card on the NTP, for which the expanded content was minimized/hidden.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardLongPressed
histogram.summary: Android: The position of a snippet card when it is long pressed, analagous to NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClicked.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardLongPressedAge
histogram.summary: Android: The time difference between when a snippet card is long pressed and when its content was published. Analagous to NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClickedAge.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardLongPressedScoreNew
histogram.summary: Android: The relevance score of an interest card that is long pressed, analagous to NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClickedScoreNew.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardShown
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the snippets card that is shown on the NTP. Each snippet (its position) is recorded whenever at least 1/3 of its height becomes visible by scrolling through the NTP. Each snippet is recorded at most once for a given instance of NTP and a given data set of snippets that is shown. We track the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list. Previously (in the code before 2016/05/27), this histogram was recorded each time a snippet became visible (e.g. by scrolling up and down) at least by 1px; the first snippet was thus recorded even without scrolling down.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardShownAge
histogram.summary: Android: The age of the snippets card that is shown on the NTP. Each snippet (its age) is recorded whenever at least 1/3 of its height becomes visible by scrolling through the NTP. Each snippet is recorded at most once for a given instance of NTP and a given data set of snippets that is shown. The age is measured from the moment the content has been published. In each "_x_y" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \gt;=x and \lt;=y are tracked. By this, we mean the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardShownScore
histogram.summary: Android: The score of the snippets card that is shown on the NTP. Each snippet (its score) is recorded whenever at least 1/3 of its height becomes visible by scrolling through the NTP. Each snippet is recorded at most once for a given instance of NTP and a given data set of snippets that is shown. The recorded score is from the moment the snippet was fetched, it could have changed since. In each "_x" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \lt;=x are tracked. By this, we mean the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardShownScoreNew
histogram.summary: Android: The score of the snippets card that is shown on the NTP. Each snippet (its score) is recorded whenever at least 1/3 of its height becomes visible by scrolling through the NTP. Each snippet is recorded at most once for a given instance of NTP and a given data set of snippets that is shown. The recorded score is from the moment the snippet was fetched, it could have changed since. In each "_x" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \lt;=x are tracked. By this, we mean the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list. In contrast to CardShownScore, this histogram has a proper maximal value of 100 000.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.DatabaseLoadTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time it took to load the database of persisted content suggestions. Recorded only when the database is loaded successfully.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.EnteredState
histogram.summary: Android: The state of the RemoteSuggestionsProvider. Recorded when the state changes, typically once at startup and rarely afterwards, e.g. on database errors.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.FetchHttpResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes encountered when attempting to fetch snippets.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.FetchResult
histogram.summary: Result of attempting a fetch, logged once per issued trigger.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.FetchTime
histogram.summary: Time spent fetching snippets. Only recorded for fetch attempts that resulted in an actual network request.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.FetchTimeLocal
histogram.summary: Records the time of the day in minutes when a snippets background fetch was initiated. Counts minutes since midnight UTC.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.FetchTimeUTC
histogram.summary: Records the time of the day in minutes when a snippets background fetch was initiated. Counts minutes since midnight local time.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.IncompleteSnippetsAfterFetch
histogram.summary: Whether we discarded any of the snippets after fetching them due to having incomplete metadata.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.Interactions
histogram.summary: Android: A histogram giving an overall summary of important events like impressions, scroll events, clicks etc.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.NumArticles
histogram.summary: Android: The number of snippet articles available to show on the NTP, logged once every time the list is updated.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.NumArticlesFetched
histogram.summary: Android: The number of valid snippet articles fetched from the server, logged every time a fetch finishes successfully.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.NumArticlesOnScrolledBelowTheFoldOnce
histogram.summary: Android: The number of snippet articles available to the user in the UI, logged when the user scrolls below the fold (at max once per NTP load).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.NumArticlesZeroDueToDiscarded
histogram.summary: Android: The number of snippet articles discarded by the user, logged every time the list is updated resulting in an empty list (all articles discarded).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.NumIncompleteSnippets
histogram.summary: The number of snippets that we discard per fetch due to having incomplete data.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.OpenMethod
histogram.summary: Android: A histogram detailing how the articles linked from snippets are opened (eg, plain click, open in new tab, open in incognito).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.VisitDuration
histogram.summary: Android: Time spent reading the page linked by an opened (clicked) snippet card. Exit conditions include the tab not being in the foreground or starting a new navigation.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSite
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for user clicks of the suggested site thumbnails. The value is equal to the index of the thumbnail.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSitesAction
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Action taken by the user on the Suggested Sites NTP pane.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSitesLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time to load the Suggested Sites NTP pane, in milliseconds.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSitesViewTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent on the Suggested Sites NTP pane, in seconds.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestionsImpression
histogram.summary: Histogram for impressions on the various most visited tiles. The value is equal to the index of the thumbnail.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestionsType
histogram.summary: Indicate, for each impression of the New Tab Page, whether the suggestions were obtained from the client or server. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ThumbnailErrorRate
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2014. Replaced by NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailAttempts and NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailErrors.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The percentage of errors per attempts to load image thumbnails on the New Tab Page. When an error occurs, a grey tile is shown instead of a thumbnail image. We measure the rate instead of the number of errors because multiple attempts are made to load images at different times during the NTP's lifetime. Each NTP session's error rate is logged after the user navigates to a new URL from that NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ThumbnailFallbackRate
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2014. Replaced by NewTabPage.NumberOfGrayTileFallbacks and NewTabPage.NumberOfExternalFallbacks.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The percentage of times most visited tiles use the fallback thumbnail. Only requests that actually specify a fallback thumbnail are considered here. We measure the rate instead of the number of errors because multiple attempts are made to load thumbnails at different times during the NTP's lifetime. Each NTP session's error rate is logged after the user navigates to a new URL from that NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TileFaviconFetchSuccess.Popular
histogram.summary: Mobile only. The result of fetching a favicon for a tile on the New Tab Page. This is recorded for each gray PopularSites tile on the New Tab Page once per updating the set of tiles (notably upon each NTP impression).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TileFaviconFetchSuccess.Server
histogram.summary: Mobile only. The result of fetching a favicon for a tile on the New Tab Page. This is recorded for each gray MostVisited tile on the New Tab Page once per lifetime of Chrome (there as an in-memory cache of failed requests).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TileOfflineAvailable
histogram.summary: The number of times a tile was available offline, per tile index - compare to the NewTabPage.SuggestionsImpression.* histograms. This is recorded when the NTP finishes loading. Only measured on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TilesReceivedTime
histogram.summary: Histogram of the time, in milliseconds since navigation start, it took for the NTP most visited iframe to receive the data for all of its tiles. This does not include actually loading the DOM elements for the tiles, in particular the thumbnail images; see NewTabPage.LoadTime for that.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TileType
histogram.summary: The visual type of each most visited tile displayed on the new tab page, e.g. actual thumbnail or placeholder thumbnail. This is recorded for each most visited item when the NTP is opened.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TileTypeClicked
histogram.summary: The visual type of the most visited item that the user clicked on, e.g. actual thumbnail or placeholder thumbnail.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TimeSpent
histogram.summary: The time spent on the new tab page as measured from when it was loaded or last brought to the foreground until it was navigated away from or hidden. Only measured on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.URLState
histogram.summary: Records the status of the New Tab page URL when an NTP is opened.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.UserClassifier.AverageHoursToOpenNTP
histogram.summary: Android: The estimated average number of hours between two successive times when a new tab page is opened. Recorded after each opening of a NTP (and after updating the model used for the estimate).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.UserClassifier.AverageHoursToShowSuggestions
histogram.summary: Android: The estimated average number of hours between two successive times when the list of content suggestions on a new tab page is shown (i.e. when the user scrolls below the fold). Recorded after each time the suggestions are shown (and after updating the model used for the estimate).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.UserClassifier.AverageHoursToUseSuggestions
histogram.summary: Android: The estimated average number of hours between two successive times when the user opens a content suggestion or clicks on the "More" button. Recorded after each time a suggestion or a More button is clicked (and after updating the model used for the estimate).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.VisibleScreenshots
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of screenshots that were cached for the visible suggestions on the Suggested NTP pane.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.VisibleSuggestedSiteRank
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Given that the user has typed a URL, and given that that specific URL was visible on the Suggested pane of the NTP, this is the rank that the Suggested pane had for that URL.

histogram.name: Notifications.Actions
histogram.summary: The actions taken on notifications, recorded every time they happen. This histogram will record every single event that happens separately.

histogram.name: Notifications.AppNotificationStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether notifications are enabled for Chrome, as the Android app, for each Web Notification that is being shown to the user.

histogram.name: Notifications.AuthorDataSize
histogram.summary: The size, in bytes, of the author-provided data associated with a Web Notification. Recorded when a persistent Web Notification is being shown by the developer.

histogram.name: Notifications.AuthorDataSizeKB
histogram.summary: The size, in kilobytes, of the author-provided data associated with a Web Notification. Recorded when a persistent Web Notification is being shown by the developer.

histogram.name: Notifications.Database.DeleteBeforeWriteResult
histogram.summary: Records the result status codes of deleting notification data from the Web Notification database that share their tag (replacement identifier) with a notification that's about to be shown.

histogram.name: Notifications.Database.DeleteResult
histogram.summary: Records the result status codes of deleting notification data from the Web Notification database.

histogram.name: Notifications.Database.DeleteServiceWorkerRegistrationResult
histogram.summary: Records the result status codes of deleting all notification data associated with a Service Worker registration ID.

histogram.name: Notifications.Database.DestroyResult
histogram.summary: Records the result status codes of destroying the Web Notification database altogether.

histogram.name: Notifications.Database.OpenAfterCorruptionResult
histogram.summary: Records the result status codes of opening the Web Notification database after it has been destroyed in response to data corruption.

histogram.name: Notifications.Database.OpenResult
histogram.summary: Records the result status codes of opening the Web Notification database.

histogram.name: Notifications.Database.ReadForServiceWorkerResult
histogram.summary: Records the result status codes of reading data of all notifications associated with a Service Worker from the Web Notification database.

histogram.name: Notifications.Database.ReadResult
histogram.summary: Records the result status codes of reading data of a single notification from the Web Notification database.

histogram.name: Notifications.Database.WriteResult
histogram.summary: Records the result status codes of writing data for a notification to the Web Notification database.

histogram.name: Notifications.DifferentRequestingEmbeddingOrigins
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated July 2015. No longer tracked since M42.
histogram.summary: Records if the requesting and embedding origins are different when requesting permission to display Web Notifications.

histogram.name: Notifications.Display
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times a notification was shown for the various types of sources. The suffix distinguishes between the window state of the app or webpage that sent the notification. This will be used to determine whether a legacy mode is required when we allow apps or webpages to display notifications over fullscreen content in the future.

histogram.name: Notifications.ExtensionNotificationActionCount
histogram.summary: The number of action buttons the developer provided for a notification created using the extensions notification API. Logged when creating the notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.ExtensionNotificationType
histogram.summary: The type of a notification created using the extensions notification API. Logged when creating the notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.Freedesktop.Capabilities
histogram.summary: Whether the notification server supports the capability in question. (Linux only) Logged when the proxy to /org/Freedesktop/Notifications is set up successfully, which happens at most once on startup.

histogram.name: Notifications.Icon.FileSize
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Nov 2016 in favor of Notifications.LoadFileSize.*
histogram.summary: The number of bytes loaded for a Web Notification icon.

histogram.name: Notifications.Icon.LoadFailTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Nov 2016 in favor of Notifications.LoadFailTime.*
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to fail loading an icon for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.Icon.LoadFinishTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Nov 2016 in favor of Notifications.LoadFinishTime.*
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to finish successfully loading an icon for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.Icon.ScaleDownTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Nov 2016 in favor of Notifications.LoadScaleDownTime.*
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to scale down an icon for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.Linux.BridgeInitializationStatus
histogram.summary: The status code for initializing NotificationPlatformBridgeLinux. (Linux only) Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Notifications.LoadFailTime
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to fail loading an icon/image for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.LoadFileSize
histogram.summary: The number of bytes loaded for a Web Notification icon/image.

histogram.name: Notifications.LoadFinishTime
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to finish successfully loading an icon/image for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.LoadScaleDownTime
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to scale down an icon/image for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.PerNotificationActions
histogram.summary: The actions taken on notifications, recorded once per notification, when it is closed. This differs from the Notifications.Actions histogram in that multiple events of the same type on a single notification will only record a single UMA event.

histogram.name: Notifications.PersistentNotificationActionCount
histogram.summary: The number of action buttons the developer provided for a persistent Web Notification. Logged whenever showNotification is called.

histogram.name: Notifications.PersistentNotificationDataDeleted
histogram.summary: Recorded when the data associated with a persistent Web Notification gets deleted. The value will be true if data deletion succeeded, and false if there was an error.

histogram.name: Notifications.PersistentWebNotificationClickResult
histogram.summary: Recorded delivery status for persistent notification clicks to a Service Worker when handling a click on a persistent WebNotification has finished.

histogram.name: Notifications.PersistentWebNotificationCloseResult
histogram.summary: Records delivery status for persistent notification close events sent to a Service Worker when the event has been handled.

histogram.name: Notifications.UsingNativeNotificationCenter
histogram.summary: Indicates if Chrome is using system notifications or the Chrome notification center. Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Notifications.XPCConnectionEvent
histogram.summary: Mac only. Records the different events of a Notification XPC connection. These are recorded by monitoring the different error callbacks provided by the XPC connection object.

histogram.name: NQE.Accuracy.DownstreamThroughputKbps.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated downstream throughput (in kilobits per second) and the observed downstream throughput (in kilobits per second). Downstream throughput estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the downstream throughput observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation.

histogram.name: NQE.Accuracy.EffectiveConnectionType.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated effective connection type and the observed effective connection type. Effective connection type is estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the effective connection type observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation.

histogram.name: NQE.Accuracy.HttpRTT.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated HTTP RTT and the observed HTTP RTT. HTTP RTT estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the HTTP RTT observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation.

histogram.name: NQE.Accuracy.TransportRTT.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated transport RTT and the observed transport RTT. Transport RTT estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the transport RTT observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation.

histogram.name: NQE.CachedNetworkQualityAvailable
histogram.summary: Records if the cached network quality (from memory or from a persistent source) was available. Recorded right after connection change event.

histogram.name: NQE.CellularSignalStrengthAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the signal strength for the cellular network was available or not. Recorded right before a connection change event. Recorded only on cellular connections on Android platform.

histogram.name: NQE.CellularSignalStrengthDifference
histogram.summary: Difference between the minimum and the maximum received signal strength since the last connection change event. Recorded only on cellular connections on Android platform when the cellular signal strength was available. Recorded right before a connection change event.

histogram.name: NQE.Correlation.ResourceLoadTime.0Kb_128Kb
histogram.summary: Records estimated network quality (estimated RTT, estimated downlink bandwidth), resource load size, and the resource load time in a single UMA sample. This metric is recorded randomly when a resource load finishes. Each sample in this sparse histogram consists of multiple metrics (each occupying few bits in the sample). The data in the histogram would be analyzed using custom scripts. A sample is recorded only when the resource size is between 0 Kilobits (inclusive) and 128 Kilobits (exclusive).

histogram.name: NQE.DifferenceRTTActualAndEstimated
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in June 2016 by NQE.Accuracy.HttpRTT.* metrics.
histogram.summary: Difference between the actual RTT observation and the estimated RTT. This metric is recorded on every request when the actual observation is higher than the estimated value.

histogram.name: NQE.DifferenceRTTEstimatedAndActual
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in June 2016 by NQE.Accuracy.HttpRTT.* metrics.
histogram.summary: Difference between the estimated RTT and the actual RTT observation. This metric is recorded on every request when the estimated value is higher than the actual observation.

histogram.name: NQE.EffectiveConnectionType.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: Effective connection type estimated by the network quality estimator. Recorded every time the effective connection type is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.EstimateAvailable.MainFrame
histogram.summary: This histogram records whether the estimate of the network quality metric was available or not. Recorded at every main frame request.

histogram.name: NQE.ExternalEstimateProvider.DownlinkBandwidth
histogram.summary: Records the estimate of the downlink bandwidth (in Kbps) provided by the external estimate provided. Recorded every time the external estimate provider provides a valid downlink bandwidth estimate to the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.ExternalEstimateProvider.RTT
histogram.summary: Records the estimate of the RTT provided by the external estimate provided. Recorded every time the external estimate provider provides a valid RTT estimate to the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.ExternalEstimateProvider.RTT.Accuracy.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the HTTP RTT estimated by the external estimate provider and the observed HTTP RTT. The HTTP RTT estimated by the external estimate provider at the time of navigation start is compared with the HTTP RTT observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation.

histogram.name: NQE.ExternalEstimateProviderStatus
histogram.summary: Records the interaction (availability and query count) of Network Quality Estimator with external estimates provider. Logged on network change events, everytime external estimate provider is queried for an updated estimate, and when it proactively notifies that an updated estimate is available.

histogram.name: NQE.FastestRTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time, before a connectivity change is detected.
This metric is recorded when a connectivity change is detected. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NQE.Kbps.ObservationSource
histogram.summary: Number of Kbps observations indexed by the source of the observation. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time a new observation is made or synthesized.

histogram.name: NQE.Kbps.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: Rough estimate of the downstream peak throughput (in kilobits per second). Recorded by the network quality estimator every time the effective connection type is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.MainFrame.EffectiveConnectionType
histogram.summary:
Effective connection type estimated by network quality estimator. Suffixed with the connection type reported by the operating system.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.MainFrame.Kbps
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the downstream peak throughput at different percentiles.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.MainFrame.RTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the URLRequest layer at different percentiles.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.MainFrame.TransportRTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the transport layer at different percentiles.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.NetworkIdAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the NetworkID (SSID of the Wi-Fi network, or the MCC/MNC operator of the cellular network) was available or not. Recorded only on Wi-Fi and cellular networks. Recorded right after the connection type changes.

histogram.name: NQE.PeakKbps
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of downstream peak throughput, before a connectivity change is detected.
This metric is recorded when a connectivity change is detected. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NQE.Prefs.ReadCount
histogram.summary: Number of times the network quality prefs were read by the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.Prefs.ReadSize
histogram.summary: Count of the number of network IDs in the prefs read by the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.Prefs.WriteCount
histogram.summary: Number of times the network quality prefs were written by the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.RatioEstimatedToActualRTT
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in June 2016 by NQE.Accuracy.HttpRTT.* metrics.
histogram.summary: Ratio of the estimated RTT to the actual RTT observation multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: NQE.RenderThreadNotified
histogram.summary: Count of the number of times renderers were notified of the changes in the network quality estimator. This metric makes sense to compare in frequency relative to other events like the number of page loads or the number of renderers seen. It is expected that we will see at least 1 notification per renderer (on average), and less than 100.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the URLRequest layer at different percentiles.
This metric is recorded immediately after a connectivity change is detected. The metric name is suffixed with the connection type before the connectivity change was detected. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.ObservationSource
histogram.summary: Number of RTT observations indexed by the source of the observation. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time a new observation is made or synthesized.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: Rough estimate of the round trip time at the URLRequest layer. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time the effective connection type is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.RTTObservations
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in May 2016 by NQE.MainFrame.RTT.* metrics.
histogram.summary: RTT observations at the URLRequest layer made by network quality estimator, recorded on every request.

histogram.name: NQE.TransportRTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the transport layer at different percentiles.
This metric is recorded immediately after a connectivity change is detected. The metric name is suffixed with the connection type before the connectivity change was detected. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NQE.TransportRTT.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the transport layer. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time the effective connection type is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.UnweightedAverage.Accuracy.HttpRTT.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated HTTP RTT and the observed HTTP RTT. HTTP RTT estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the HTTP RTT observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation. Both the estimated and the observed RTT are computed using average algorithm that assigns equal weight to all observations.

histogram.name: NQE.UnweightedAverage.MainFrame.RTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the URLRequest layer computed using average algorithm that assigns equal weight to all observations.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.WeightedAverage.Accuracy.HttpRTT.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated HTTP RTT and the observed HTTP RTT. HTTP RTT estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the HTTP RTT observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation. Both the estimated and the observed RTT are computed using weighted average algorithm.

histogram.name: NQE.WeightedAverage.MainFrame.RTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the URLRequest layer computed using weighted average algorithm.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: ntp.searchurls.total
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: NtpHandler.AttachShownPageType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2011. No longer tracked, replaced with NewTabPage.DefaultPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default pane when the NTP is first opened.

histogram.name: NtpHandler.SelectedShownPageType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2011. No longer tracked, replaced with NewTabPage.SelectedPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The pane selected when the user switches panes in the NTP.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.AccountRevoked.IsEmailId
histogram.summary: This histogram records whether the account ID is actually an email if we detect an account that has an account ID but not email.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.AccountRevoked.MigrationState
histogram.summary: This histogram records the account ID migration status from email to GAIA ID if we detect an account that has an account ID but not email.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.GetOAuth2AccessTokenFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final OAuth2 access token retrieval call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.GetOAuth2AccessTokenRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed OAuth2 access token retrieval call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.ListAccountsFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final ListAccounts call failure during Chrome OS login. This data is now included in Signin.ListAccountsFailure.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.ListAccountsRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed ListAccounts call during Chrome OS login. This data is now included in Signin.ListAccountsRetry.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.MergeSessionFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of MergeSession call during Chrome OS login, Chrome Signin or account addition. On all OSes as of M44 (previously CrOS only).

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.MergeSessionRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed MergeSession call during Chrome OS login, Chrome Signin or account addition. On all OSes as of M44 (previously CrOS only).

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginGaiaCredFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final OAuthLogin (with SID+LSID) call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginGaiaCredRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed OAuthLogin (with SID+LSID) call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginUberTokenFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final OAuthLogin (with uber token) call during Chrome OS login. This data is now (M44+) included in Signin.UberTokenFailure.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginUberTokenRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed OAuthLogin (with uber token) call during Chrome OS login. This data is now (M44+) included in Signin.UberTokenRetry.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.PostMergeVerification
histogram.summary: Outcome of Chrome OS GAIA cookie post-merge session verification process. It measures how often /MergeSession request collided with browser session restore process resulting in partially authenticated primary GAIA session.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.PreMergeVerification
histogram.summary: Outcome of Chrome OS GAIA cookie pre-merge session verification process. It measures how often we need to perform /MergeSession request to re-authenticated exisitng user with GAIA.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SeedState
histogram.summary: Only applicable on M47 on Android. Measure the frequency of a suppressed error state when the account is not seeded.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestore
histogram.summary: Outcome of Chrome OS GAIA cookie session restore process.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestoreTimeToFailure
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the session restore to fail.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestoreTimeToSuccess
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the session restore to finish succeessfully.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.AggregatedRequestResult
histogram.summary: Result of servicing requests that may contain offline page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.AggregatedRequestResult2
histogram.summary: Result of servicing requests that may contain offline page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.BackgroundLoadingFailedCode
histogram.summary: The error codes that caused a page load failure.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.CctApiDisableStatus
histogram.summary:
Reason for the Chrome Custom Tabs API prerender call to be ignored.
There are several causes for the Chrome Custom Tabs API calls to be ignored, this tracks the potential causes so we can see how often the prerenderer doesn't prerender due to these being switched off. Since this is checked elsewhere (CCTAPI), this only catches the user switching off the third party cookies or navigation prediction after the CCT API has checked.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.EffectiveConnectionType.OffliningStartType
histogram.summary:
Effective connection type at the start of an offlining attempt for an attempt that eventually failed.
This metric is recorded for RequestCoordinator::SavePageLater API calls.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.EffectiveConnectionType.PauseRequests
histogram.summary:
Effective connection type when pausing one or more background loads is requested.
This metric is recorded for RequestCoordinator::PauseRequests API calls.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.EffectiveConnectionType.RemoveRequests
histogram.summary:
Effective connection type when removing one or more background loads is requested.
This metric is recorded for RequestCoordinator::RemoveRequests API calls.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.EffectiveConnectionType.ResumeRequests
histogram.summary:
Effective connection type when resuming one or more background loads is requested.
This metric is recorded for RequestCoordinator::ResumeRequests API calls.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.EffectiveConnectionType.SavePageLater
histogram.summary:
Effective connection type when a background load is requested.
This metric is recorded for RequestCoordinator::SavePageLater API calls.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.FinalSavePageResult
histogram.summary: Status code of background offlining requests at the final step.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ImmediateStart.AvailableRequestCount
histogram.summary: Number of queued background load requests available for processing when processing starts immediately (vs. scheduled). This is for non-svelte devices (where svelte is determined by base::SysInfo::IsLowEnd()).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ImmediateStart.AvailableRequestCount.Svelte
histogram.summary: Number of queued background load requests available for processing when processing starts immediately (vs. scheduled). This is for svelte devices (where svelte is determined by base::SysInfo::IsLowEnd()).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ImmediateStart.UnavailableRequestCount
histogram.summary: Number of queued background load requests unavailable for processing when processing starts immediately (vs. scheduled). This is for non-svelte devices (where svelte is determined by base::SysInfo::IsLowEnd()).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ImmediateStart.UnavailableRequestCount.Svelte
histogram.summary: Number of queued background load requests unavailable for processing when processing starts immediately (vs. scheduled). This is for svelte devices (where svelte is determined by base::SysInfo::IsLowEnd()).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ImmediateStartStatus
histogram.summary: Status of attempt to immediately start offlining a page in the background while application is still concurrently using the foreground. This may be attempted when an web page download is initially requested or resumed.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.OfflinerRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of background offlining (loading and saving) requests.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.RequestFailure.StartedAttemptCount
histogram.summary: Number of started attempts by failed background load requests.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.RequestSuccess.StartedAttemptCount
histogram.summary: Number of started attempts by successful background load requests.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ScheduledStart.AvailableRequestCount
histogram.summary: Number of queued background load requests available for processing when background scheduled processing starts. This is for non-svelte devices (where svelte is determined by base::SysInfo::IsLowEnd()).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ScheduledStart.AvailableRequestCount.Svelte
histogram.summary: Number of queued background load requests available for processing when background scheduled processing starts. This is for svelte devices (where svelte is determined by base::SysInfo::IsLowEnd()).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ScheduledStart.UnavailableRequestCount
histogram.summary: Number of queued background load requests unavailable for processing when background scheduled processing starts. This is for non-svelte devices (where svelte is determined by base::SysInfo::IsLowEnd()).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ScheduledStart.UnavailableRequestCount.Svelte
histogram.summary: Number of queued background load requests unavailable for processing when background scheduled processing starts. This is for svelte devices (where svelte is determined by base::SysInfo::IsLowEnd()).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.TimeToCanceled
histogram.summary: Time from background request until it was canceled.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.TimeToSaved
histogram.summary: Time from background request until it was successfully saved.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.TimeToStart
histogram.summary: Time from background request until processing it was first started. This is for non-svelte devices.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.TimeToStart.Svelte
histogram.summary: Time from background request until processing it was first started on svelte device. Svelte is determined by base::SysInfo::IsLowEnd().

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.UnsupportedScheme.ConnectionType
histogram.summary:
Connection type when prerenderer reports Unsupported Scheme error.
To give insight about Unsupported Scheme errors that may be due to lost network connection (as data URL used for rendering an error page will manifest as an Unsupported Scheme error by the prerenderer).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.BatchDelete.Count
histogram.summary: Number of offline pages that are deleted in a batch.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.BatchDelete.TotalPageSize
histogram.summary: Total size, in kilobytes, of all offline pages that are deleted in a batch.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.CanSaveRecentPage
histogram.summary: Can a recent page be saved or not? Logged for all attempts to save

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ClearAllStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of wiping out the offline page data.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ClearAllStatus2
histogram.summary: Status code of wiping out the offline page data.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ClearStorageBatchSize
histogram.summary: Number of pages deleted in a batch during one clear-storage request.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ClearStorageResult
histogram.summary: Result of asking storage manager to clear storage.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Consistency.DeleteOrphanedArchivesResult
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to delete archive files without metadata was successful.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Consistency.DeletePagesMissingArchiveFileResult
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to delete pages without archives was successful.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Consistency.ExpirePagesMissingArchiveFileResult
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to expire pages without archives was successful.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Consistency.OrphanedArchivesCount
histogram.summary: Number of archives without metadata entry when checking consistency.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Consistency.PagesMissingArchiveFileCount
histogram.summary: Number of offline pages without archive file when checking consistency.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.AccessCount
histogram.summary: Number of accesses to the offline page since its creation. This is reported when the offline page was deleted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.FreeSpaceMB
histogram.summary:
The amount of free space available, in megabytes, on the user's device after the page is deleted.
Note that before M52 this operation was started before delete operation.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.FreeSpacePercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of free space available on the user's device when the page is being deleted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.LastOpenToCreated
histogram.summary: Length of time between when an offline page was created and was opened last time. This is reported when the page was deleted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.PageSize
histogram.summary: Size of the offline page, in kilobytes, that was deleted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.TimeSinceLastOpen
histogram.summary: Length of time between when an offline page was last opened and was deleted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.TotalPageSizeAsPercentageOfFreeSpace
histogram.summary:
The percentage of space taken by offline pages from the free space that could be available, if the feature was not present. I.e. considering situation where the user has: Free Space, Offline content, other apps and data. This is a percentage of: Offline content / (Offline content + Free Space).
The value will be recorded after user deletes a single or multiple offline pages. In case pages are removed in bulk, this value will be reported once. This value is only reported with deleting, as we are trying to infer if lack of free space might have caused the user to delete.
