histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePageResult
histogram.summary: Result of removing an offline copy for a page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DownloadDeletedPageDuplicateCount
histogram.summary: The number of downloaded pages with the same URL that exist at the time that we delete a downloaded page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DownloadRequestTimeSinceDuplicateRequested
histogram.summary: If at request time there is another request with the same URL, this tracks this amount of time between creation of the most recent request and the current request.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DownloadRequestTimeSinceDuplicateSaved
histogram.summary: If at request time there is another downloaded page with the same URL, this tracks this amount of time between creation of the most recent existing page and the current request.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DownloadSavedPageDuplicateCount
histogram.summary: The number of downloaded pages with the same URL that exist at the time that we save a downloaded page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DownloadSavedPageTimeSinceDuplicateSaved
histogram.summary: If at save time there is another downloaded page with the same URL, this tracks this amount of time between creation of the most recent existing page and the current page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Edit.BookmarkUrlChangedForOfflinePage
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 5/2016. Offline pages no longer depend on bookmarks UI.
histogram.summary: Whether a user-edited bookmark URL had a saved offline page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ExpirePage.BatchSize
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2016. Offline pages no longer use two-step expiration.
histogram.summary: Number of pages that are expired in a batch.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ExpirePage.PageLifetime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2016. Offline pages no longer use two-step expiration.
histogram.summary: Length of time between when an offline page was created and was expired.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ExpirePage.StoreUpdateResult
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2016. Offline pages no longer use two-step expiration.
histogram.summary: Result of updating expired page in store.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ExpirePage.TimeSinceLastAccess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2016. Offline pages no longer use two-step expiration.
histogram.summary: Length of time between when an offline page was last opened and was expired.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Filter.OnlineWhenEntering
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 5/2016. Offline pages no longer depend on bookmarks UI.
histogram.summary: Whether user is connected when entering the filter with offline only content.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Filter.OnlineWhenLeaving
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 5/2016. Offline pages no longer depend on bookmarks UI.
histogram.summary: Whether user is connected when leaving the filter with offline only content.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.FirstOpenSinceCreated
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between creation of the offline page and the first time it was opened.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.IncognitoSave
histogram.summary: Whether the page that was being saved offline was in incognito mode.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.LaunchLocation
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 5/2016. Offline pages no longer depend on bookmarks UI.
histogram.summary: Logs a UI location from which an offline page is launched.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.LoadStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of loading from the offline pages metadata store.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.LoadSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to load the offline pages metadata store was successful.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Model.ArchiveDirCreationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time to create the offline pages archive directory.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Model.ConstructionToLoadedEventTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time to create the offline pages archive directory and load the offline page model.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.OfflinePageCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 5/2016. This was the dup of OfflinePages.SavedPageCount.
histogram.summary: Number of offline pages the user has. Android only.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.OnlineOnOpen
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 5/2016. Offline pages no longer depend on bookmarks UI.
histogram.summary: Whether the user was online when a saved page with offline copy was opened.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.OpenSinceLastOpen
histogram.summary: Length of time between two consecutive opens.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.PageLifetime
histogram.summary: Length of time between when an offline page was created and was removed.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.PageSize
histogram.summary: Size of the saved copy of an offline page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RedirectResult
histogram.summary: Result of automatic redirect to offline version of the page or back. Emitted exactly once when offline-to-online or online-to-offline redirect is determined to be needed and conveys the outcome of redirect.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RedirectToOfflineCount
histogram.summary: Number of times an offline copy was loaded instead when the user is trying to load the online version of a saved page and there is no network connection.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RedirectToOnlineCount
histogram.summary: Number of times an online version was loaded instead when the user is trying to load the offline copy of a saved page and there is network connection. connection.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RequestJob.OpenFileErrorCode
histogram.summary: Positive net error code for opening the underlying file to serve the offline page, including net::OK.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RequestJob.ReadFileErrorCode
histogram.summary: Positive net error code for the failure to read the underlying file to serve the offline page. net::OK is not included.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RequestJob.SeekFileErrorCode
histogram.summary: Positive net error code for the failure to seek the underlying file to serve the offline page. net::OK is not included.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavedPageCount
histogram.summary: Number of saved pages restored from the offline pages metadata store when it is logged.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavePage.FreeSpaceMB
histogram.summary:
The amount of free space available, in megabytes, on the user's device after the page is saved.
Note that before M52 this operation was started before save operation.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavePage.FreeSpacePercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of free space available on the user's device when the page is being saved.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavePage.PercentLoaded
histogram.summary: The percentage of the page load completed when the button to save an offline page is pressed.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavePageResult
histogram.summary: Result of saving an offline copy for a page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavePageTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to save an offline copy for a page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SharedPageWasOffline
histogram.summary: Whether a shared page was an offline page or not.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ShowOfflinePageOnBadNetwork
histogram.summary: Whether an offline page is shown, instead of error page, when the network is disconnected or poor condition.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.TabRestore
histogram.summary: Tracks the reload of contents of an existing tab that is being restored either because that tab is being presented for the first time after Chrome was restarted or because its contents were discarded. All buckets are mutually exclusive (adding up all reported values amounts to the total number of tracked tab restores). This metric is focused on last_n offline pages and is exclusive to Chrome on Android.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.TotalPageSize
histogram.summary:
Total size of all the offline pages saved by the user.
This value is recorded whenever the number of pages change, meaning after a page is added or removed. If pages are removed in bulk, this value will be reported only once.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.TotalPageSizePercentage
histogram.summary:
Total size of all the offline pages saved by the user as a percentage of total storage size.
This value is recorded whenever the number of pages change, meaning after a page is added or removed.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Wakeup.BatteryPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of battery remaining when the offline page background loading task wakes up to check for work.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Wakeup.ConnectedToPower
histogram.summary: Whether the device is plugged in when the offline page background load task wakes up to check or work.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Wakeup.DelayTime
histogram.summary: Time delay from a dinosaur page to connection being available.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Wakeup.NetworkAvailable
histogram.summary: Which network is available (if any) when the offling page background loading task wakes up to check for work.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.WebsiteSettings.ConnectedWhenOpenOnlineButtonClicked
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the browser was connected when Open online button was clicked on Website Settings popup, which causes a reload of an offline page to online version.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.WebsiteSettings.OpenOnlineButtonVisible
histogram.summary: Indicates whether Open online was visible in Website Settings popup, when it was shown for an offline page. (The button is visible only when Chrome is connected when the Website Settings popup is opened for offline page.)

histogram.name: OfflinePolicy.SuccessfulResourceLoadPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When a page is loaded in offline mode, the percentage of resources on that page that were successfully loaded.

histogram.name: Omnibox.AggressiveHistoryURLProviderFieldTrialBeacon
histogram.obsolete: Aggressive HistoryURL provider field trial deleted in spring 2012.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: A number that indicates what omnibox ranking behavior the user is seeing as part of the OmniboxAggressiveHistoryURLProvider field trial (OmniboxAggressiveHistoryURLProvider).

histogram.name: Omnibox.AnswerParseSuccess
histogram.summary: For each answer received in suggest responses, the number that are well-formed and contain all the required elements.

histogram.name: Omnibox.AnswerParseType
histogram.summary: The number of times each omnibox suggestion answer type (e.g., weather, sports score) was received and parsed successfully. Can be normalized with the count of emits to Omnibox.SuggestRequest.Success.GoogleResponseTime, which counts all successful suggest responses from Google, not just those with answers attached. Note that GoogleResponseTime is technically off given that it will still count cases where we fail to extract, deserialize, or parse the response. But these cases are rare to non-existent.

histogram.name: Omnibox.CharTypedToRepaintLatency
histogram.summary:
Records the time taken between a keystroke being typed in the omnibox and the text being painted. If there are multiple keystrokes before a paint, logs the time since the earliest one.
This duration is composed of three parts: a) the time spent processing the initial input event, b) the time spent for the repaint task to be scheduled on the message loop and c) the time spent painting the Omnibox.
To diagnose a regression, check the following breakdown metrics: Omnibox.QueryTime2 is a good proxy for (a) and Omnibox.PaintTime for (c). (b) does not have a corresponding histogram but can be analyzed on the UMA Task Profiler dashboard by looking at "average queue time" of the task DisplayScheduler::ScheduleBeginFrameDeadline.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ClipboardSuggestionShownAge
histogram.summary:
Recorded every time the omnibox is focussed and a recent URL from the user's clipboard is suggested. The value indicates the estimated age of the clipboard. (If Chrome observed the clipboard modification, this age is exact. If Chrome did not observe the modification, then it's a conservative estimate: the last time Chrome observed a clipboard modification, which is certainly older than the current clipboard. If Chrome never observed a clipboard modification, no clipboard suggestion is shown, meaning this histogram will never be emitted to.)
Intended to be compared with MobileOmnibox.PressedClipboardSuggestionAge.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ClipboardSuggestionShownWithCurrentURL
histogram.summary:
Recorded every time the omnibox is focussed and a recent URL from the user's clipboard is suggested. The value indicates whether the current URL was shown (which would appear above the clipboard URL suggestion) or was absent (which ought to only happen when the omnibox is empty / the user is on the NTP).
On Android, the total count for this histogram can be usefully compared with the count of the user action FocusLocation in order to determine the rate at which a clipboard URL suggestion is shown in the omnibox. To determine the same rate on iOS, one needs to compare this histogram's count with the sum of the user actions MobileFocusedOmniboxOnNtp, MobileFocusedFakeboxOnNtp, and MobileFocusedOmniboxNotOnNtp.
Furthermore, on either platform, this histogram's count can be usefully compared with the count in the clipboard bucket of the Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Provider histogram to determine the clickthrough rate on these suggestions.

histogram.name: Omnibox.CutOrCopyAllText
histogram.summary: The number of cut or copy commands on all selected text in the omnibox. Gathered on desktop platforms (Win, Mac, Linux, Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Omnibox.EnteredKeywordMode
histogram.summary: The number of times users enter keyword hint mode "Search ___ for:" and how.

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToEditTime
histogram.summary: The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and first modifies the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToOpenTime
histogram.summary: The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and opened an omnibox match (which could be what they typed or a suggestion).

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToOpenTimeAnyPopupState
histogram.summary: The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and opened an omnibox match (which could be what they typed or a suggestion). This is recorded regardless of whether the omnibox dropdown (a.k.a. popup) is open.

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToOpenTimeAnyPopupState2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Omnibox.FocusToOpenTimeAnyPopupState3 in January, 2017, which only differs in the bucketing and range.
histogram.summary:
The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and opened an omnibox match (which could be what they typed or a suggestion). This is recorded regardless of whether the omnibox dropdown (a.k.a. popup) is open. It is not recorded if a match is opened without triggering a focus event, e.g., when a user drags a URL to the omnibox to navigate.
To know how common this last condition is, compare the total count of this histogram to the total number of omnibox events.

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToOpenTimeAnyPopupState3
histogram.summary:
The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and opened an omnibox match (which could be what they typed or a suggestion). This is recorded regardless of whether the omnibox dropdown (a.k.a. popup) is open. It is not recorded if a match is opened without triggering a focus event, e.g., when a user drags a URL to the omnibox to navigate.
To know how common this last condition is, compare the total count of this histogram to the total number of omnibox events.

histogram.name: Omnibox.HardwareKeyboardModeEnabled
histogram.summary: iOS: Records whether a hardware keyboard is used to input text. This is recorded each time a UIKeyboardWillChangeFrameNotification is sent while editing the omnibox text.

histogram.name: Omnibox.HasLegalDefaultMatchWithoutCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether there was at least one legal default match without an |inline_autocompletion|. Recorded every time AutocompleteResult::SortAndCull() is called, which could happen multiple times on each keystroke.

histogram.name: Omnibox.HistoryQuickHistoryIDSetFromWords
histogram.summary: Times URLIndexPrivateData::HistoryIDSetFromWords(), which is called by the omnibox's HistoryQuick provider. URLIndexPrivateData::HistoryIDSetFromWords() can be called multiple times per keystroke due to, for example, the cursor being in the middle of the input string or SearchProvider's calls to Classify().

histogram.name: Omnibox.InputType
histogram.summary: The kind of input the user provided when using the omnibox to go somewhere. The type can be misleading. For example if the user typed 'http:/', it gets marked as a query because it cannot be opened as a URL even though the user probably wanted and selected a URL from the list of suggestions.

histogram.name: Omnibox.IsPasteAndGo
histogram.summary: Whether an omnibox interaction is a paste-and-search/paste-and-go action. (This histogram records both of these in the "True" bucket for this histogram because both of these are referred to as paste-and-go in the code.) These typically involve right-clicking in the omnibox and selecting that option from the dropdown.

histogram.name: Omnibox.IsPopupOpen
histogram.summary: Whether the omnibox popup (a.k.a. dropdown) is open at the time the user used the omnibox to go somewhere. It can be closed if, for instance, the user clicked in the omnibox and hit return to reload the same page. Also, because paste-and-search/paste-and-go actions ignore the current content of the omnibox dropdown (if it is open) when they happen, we pretend the dropdown is closed when logging these.

histogram.name: Omnibox.JustDeletedText
histogram.summary: Whether the user deleted text immediately before selecting an omnibox suggestion. This is usually the result of pressing backspace or delete.

histogram.name: Omnibox.NumEvents
histogram.summary: The number of times users used the omnibox to go somewhere.

histogram.name: Omnibox.NumTypedTerms
histogram.summary: The number of terms in the text the user entered in the omnibox when they used the omnibox to go somewhere. Terms are defined by splitting on whitespace. All values larger than 6 are recorded in bucket 6.

histogram.name: Omnibox.PageContext
histogram.summary: What the user was viewing when the user used the omnibox to go somewhere.

histogram.name: Omnibox.PaintTime
histogram.summary: Records the time to paint the omnibox contents. This is a subcomponent of Omnibox.CharTypedToRepaintLatency. Implemented on desktop platforms.

histogram.name: Omnibox.Paste
histogram.summary: The number of paste commands on the text in the omnibox. Reported every time a paste command is done.

histogram.name: Omnibox.PasteAndGo
histogram.summary: The number of paste-and-go commands on the text in the omnibox. Reported every time a paste-and-go command is done.

histogram.name: Omnibox.PhysicalWebProvider.SuggestionUsedWithoutOmniboxFocus
histogram.summary: Records a boolean value indicating whether the Physical Web provider was invoked by focusing the omnibox during the current omnibox session. This is unexpected; it's probably a bug somwhere. Recorded when the user selects an omnibox suggestion. Does not record when the Physical Web omnibox provider is disabled.

histogram.name: Omnibox.PhysicalWebProviderMatches
histogram.summary: The number of matches returned by PhysicalWebProvider. Emitted when the omnibox is first focused, unless the user is in incognito mode. Capped at 10.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ProgressBarBreakPointUpdateCount
histogram.summary: The number of progress bar break point updates from page load started to page load finished.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ProgressBarUpdateCount
histogram.summary: The number of progress bar frame updates from page load started to page load finished. If there is no animation, this matches Omnibox.ProgressBarBreakPointUpdateCount. Note that there can be additional updates after page load finished, animating to 100%, but this histogram doesn't include them.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ProviderTime
histogram.summary: The length of time taken by the named provider"s synchronous pass.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ProviderTime2
histogram.summary: The length of time taken by the named provider"s synchronous pass.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryBookmarksTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time the HistoryContentProvider takes to perform a bookmark search.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes for the omnibox to become responsive to user input after the user has typed N characters. This measures the time it takes to start all the asynchronous autocomplete providers (but not wait for them to finish).

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryTime2
histogram.summary: Time it takes for the omnibox to become responsive to user input after the user has typed N characters. This measures the time it takes to start all the asynchronous autocomplete providers (but not wait for them to finish).

histogram.name: Omnibox.SaveStateForTabSwitch.UserInputInProgress
histogram.summary: When a user switches tabs, whether the omnibox had an edit in progress.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchEngine
histogram.obsolete: Made obsolete around Chrome 32. Use Omnibox.SearchEngineType instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of search engine that was used for search in omnibox. See src/chrome/browser/search_engines/template_url_prepopulate_data.cc for more info.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchEngineType
histogram.summary: The type of search engine associated with a match opened from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchProvider.AddHistoryResultsTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes to add all the raw history results to the list of matches.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchProvider.ConvertResultsTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes to convert all the results to matches and add them to a map, to keep the most relevant match for each result.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchProvider.GetMostRecentKeywordTermsDefaultProviderTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes for the omnibox to search the previous query history database for queries that start with the omnibox text.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchProviderMatches
histogram.summary: The number of matches returned by SearchProvider. Emitted on every call to SearchProvider::Start(), which effectively means every key stroke in the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SelectedPosition
histogram.summary: The index of the item that the user selected in the omnibox popup (a.k.a. dropdown) list. 0 means the inline suggestion shown within the omnibox. This is also the same suggestion shown as the top item in the dropdown. The second item in the dropdown will be recorded as bucket 1. The selected position is always set to 0 when the popup is closed at the time of navigation or if the user did a paste-and-search or paste-and-go action.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.NearbyURLCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M58, replaced with Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.NearbyURLCount.AtFocus and Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.NearbyURLCount.AtMatchCreation.
histogram.summary:
The number of nearby Physical Web URLs when the user focused the omnibox. Recorded when the user accepts an omnibox suggestion, regardless of whether the suggestion came from PhysicalWebProvider. Capped at 50.
In M57, the values recorded by this histogram were determined to be bugged. It's believed that it was recording uninitialized values due to a corner case on Android that allows an omnibox suggestion to be selected without first focusing the omnibox. In addition to the new histograms, Omnibox.PhysicalWebProvider.SuggestionUsedWithoutOmniboxFocus was added to detect this case. https://crbug.com/691059

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.NearbyURLCount.AtFocus
histogram.summary:
The number of nearby Physical Web URLs when Physical Web Provider was last focused (i.e., the start of the current session). Recorded when the user accepts an omnibox suggestion, regardless of whether the suggestion came from PhysicalWebProvider. Capped at 50.
Does not record if the omnibox was not focused during the current session. Omnibox.PhysicalWebProvider.SuggestionUsedWithoutOmniboxFocus records true when we hit this case.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.NearbyURLCount.AtMatchCreation
histogram.summary: The number of nearby Physical Web URLs when Physical Web Provider last constructed matches. Recorded when the user accepts an omnibox suggestion, regardless of whether the suggestion came from PhysicalWebProvider. Capped at 50.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Provider
histogram.summary: The provider of the suggestion the user selected when the user used the omnibox to go somewhere.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.ProviderAndResultType
histogram.summary: The provider and result type of the suggestion the user selected when the user used the omnibox to go somewhere.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.Experimental.ForegroundToFirstMeaningfulPaint.Prerender
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the page first appearing in the foreground to its first meaningful paint. Only recorded on navigations that use a prerender that is to a search query suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.Experimental.NavigationToFirstMeaningfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation start to first meaningful paint. Only recorded for a search query suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.ForegroundToFirstContentfulPaint.Prerender
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the page first appearing in the foreground to its first contentful paint. Only recorded on navigations that use a prerender that is to a search query suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation start to first contentful paint. Only recorded for a search query suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.NavigationToFirstForeground.Prerender
histogram.summary: Measures the time from a page being navigated to in prerender to it first showing up in foreground. Only recorded on navigations that used a prerender that was to a search query suggestion selected from the omnibox. This is only recorded on pages that experience a first contentful paint.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.SearchVsUrl
histogram.summary: The rough type of the suggestion the user selected when the user used the omnibox to go somewhere.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.URL.Experimental.ForegroundToFirstMeaningfulPaint.Prerender
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the page first appearing in the foreground to its first meaningful paint. Only recorded on navigations that use a prerender that is to a URL suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.URL.Experimental.NavigationToFirstMeaningfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation start to first meaningful paint. Only recorded for a URL suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.URL.ForegroundToFirstContentfulPaint.Prerender
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the page first appearing in the foreground to its first contentful paint. Only recorded on navigations that use a prerender that is to a URL suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.URL.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation start to first contentful paint. Only recorded for a URL suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.URL.NavigationToFirstForeground.Prerender
histogram.summary: Measures the time from a page being navigated to in prerender to it first showing up in foreground. Only recorded on navigations that used a prerender that was to a URL suggestion selected from the omnibox. This is only recorded on pages that experience a first contentful paint.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestRequest.Failure.GoogleResponseTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of a suggest request to Google until the time the request was returned with status==failed. Ignores requests that were canceled before being returned.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestRequest.Success.GoogleResponseTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of a suggest request to Google until the time the request was returned with status==success. Ignores requests that were canceled before being returned.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestRequests
histogram.summary: Counts about the number of suggest requests the omnibox sent, invalidated, and replies received.

histogram.name: Omnibox.TypedLength
histogram.summary: The length of the text the user entered in the omnibox when they used the omnibox to go somewhere. All values larger than 500 are recorded in bucket 500.

histogram.name: Omnibox.TypingDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time, in milliseconds, since the user first began modifying the text in the omnibox until the user used the omnibox to go somewhere. If at some point after modifying the text, the user reverted the modifications (thus seeing the current web page's URL again), then wrote in the omnibox again, this duration starts from the time of the second series of modification.

histogram.name: Omnibox.UserTextCleared
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of times that the user text is cleared. IME users are sometimes in the situation that IME was unintentionally turned on and failed to input latin alphabets (ASCII characters) or the opposite case. In that case, users may delete all the text and the user text gets cleared. This histogram helps us estimate how often this scenario happens.
Note that since we don't currently correlate "text cleared" events with IME usage, this also captures many other cases where users clear the text; though it explicitly doesn't log deleting all the permanent text as the first action of an editing sequence (see comments in OnAfterPossibleChange()).

histogram.name: Omnibox.ZeroSuggest.Eligible.OnFocus
histogram.summary:
Whether the user has settings configured so that the current page URL can be sent to the suggest server to request contextual suggestions. For example, this is only supported for users who have Google as their default search engine (unmodified version of Google), have search suggest enabled, are signed-in and syncing without a custom passphrase, and don't have an incognito window open. There are other criteria too. Recorded on focus in the omnibox if there is default search provider and we've constructed a suggest URL.
Some additional guidelines: if an incognito window is open, all focus events will go into the "generally ineligible" bucket. Likewise, if the current page is a search results page, we don't allow contextual suggestions either so focus events on those pages go in the "generally ineligible" bucket. The difference between "eligible" and "generally eligible but not this time" depends only the properties of the current URL.
Recorded regardless of whether contextual or non-contextual zero suggest is currently enabled on the user's platform. However, if zero suggest (in all forms) is entirely disabled, the user will be perpetually ineligible.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ZeroSuggest.Eligible.OnProfileOpen
histogram.summary:
Whether the user has settings configured so that the current page URL could be sent to the suggest server to request contextual suggestions. For example, this is only supported for users who have Google as their default search engine (unmodified version of Google), have search suggest enabled, and are signed-in and syncing without a custom passphrase. There are other criteria too. Recorded on profile open. Note that opening an incognito window (if none are currently open under the given profile) counts as opening a new profile.
Some additional guidelines: unlike Omnibox.ZeroSuggest.Eligible.OnFocus, because this is recorded on profile open, users cannot be declared ineligible because they have an incognito window open (it's impossible to have an incognito window open for a given profile at the time of profile open) and also cannot be declared ineligible because the user is viewing a search results page. (We test this on-profile-open using an arbitrary URL.)
Recorded regardless of whether contextual or non-contextual zero suggest is currently enabled on the user's platform. However, if zero suggest (in all forms) is entirely disabled, the user will be perpetually ineligible.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ZeroSuggest.MostVisitedResultsCounterfactual
histogram.summary: The number of most visited suggestions returned when ZeroSuggest would have triggered. The suggestions appear when the user has focused but not modified the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ZeroSuggestRequests
histogram.summary: Counts about the number of zero suggest requests (requests for suggestions when the user has focused but not modified the omnibox) the omnibox sent, invalidated, and replies received.

histogram.name: OOBE.BootToSignInCompleted
histogram.summary: Time from boot to sign-in completed.

histogram.name: OOBE.ErrorScreensTime.Enrollment
histogram.summary: Time spent on error screens during enrollment or autoenrollment.

histogram.name: OOBE.ErrorScreensTime.Signin
histogram.summary: Time spent on error screens during signin.

histogram.name: OOBE.ErrorScreensTime.Supervised
histogram.summary: Time spent on error screens during supervised user creation.

histogram.name: OOBE.ErrorScreensTime.Update
histogram.summary: Time spent on error screens during update.

histogram.name: OOBE.NetworkErrorShown.Enrollment
histogram.summary: Number of times error screen has appeared during enrollment or autoenrollment.

histogram.name: OOBE.NetworkErrorShown.Signin
histogram.summary: Number of times error screen has appeared during signin.

histogram.name: OOBE.NetworkErrorShown.Supervised
histogram.summary: Number of times error screen has appeared during supervised user creation.

histogram.name: OOBE.NetworkErrorShown.Update
histogram.summary: Number of times error screen has appeared during update.

histogram.name: OOBE.StepCompletionTime
histogram.summary: Time spent on specific OOBE screen.

histogram.name: OriginChip.Pressed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated with CL 731423002. OriginChip has been removed.
histogram.summary: The number of clicks on the origin chip.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.FeatureEnabled
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of Chrome 54. Sort of replaced by OriginTrials.ValidationResult.
histogram.summary: Counts the results of origin trial checks to enable experimental features. The result for each feature check is counted at most once per execution context (e.g. page, worker).

histogram.name: OriginTrials.FeatureEnabled.MessageGenerated
histogram.summary: Counts how often an error message is generated for each origin trial check to enable an experimental feature.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.ValidationResult
histogram.summary: Counts the results of token validation checks to enable experimental features. The result for each token validation check is counted once per token per execution context (e.g. page, worker).

histogram.name: OSX.BluetoothAvailability
histogram.summary: The availability and capabilities of the Bluetooth driver on OSX devices. This metric is logged on startup.

histogram.name: OSX.CatSixtyFour
histogram.obsolete: Obselete as of Chrome 43. See OmahaProxy for more relevant statistics.
histogram.summary: The cat's flavor and how many bits there are in it.

histogram.name: OSX.ExceptionHandlerEvents
histogram.summary: Events seen by the OSX NSException swizzle.

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.Enter
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 40. See OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.Style, OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.WindowLocation and OSX.Settings.ScreensHaveSeparateSpaces.
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen for a browser window. The value's bits reflect different parameters. Bit 0: Fullscreen entry mechanism (AppKit vs Immersive). Bit 1: Whether the window was on the primary screen (Primary vs. Secondary). Bit 2: Whether displays have separate spaces options is enabled (Seperate vs Shared). Bit 3: Whether there are multiple screens.

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.Style
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen for a browser window. It indicates the mechanism (immersive vs. AppKit) and the type of AppKit Fullscreen (Presentation Mode vs. Canonical Fullscreen).

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.WindowLocation
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen for a browser window. It indicates the screen in which the window was fullscreened, and the number of screens available.

histogram.name: OSX.Handoff.Origin
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a Handoff is received by Chrome on OSX. The enumeration indicates the source of the Handoff.

histogram.name: OSX.KeychainReauthorizeIfNeeded
histogram.summary: The number of previous times that the keychain reauthorization did not complete, when run during the main browser launch.

histogram.name: OSX.KeychainReauthorizeIfNeededAtUpdate
histogram.summary: The number of previous times that the keychain reauthorization did not complete, when run at update time.

histogram.name: OSX.KeychainReauthorizeIfNeededAtUpdateSuccess
histogram.summary: How many times the keychain reauthorization ran before finally succeeding, when run at update time.

histogram.name: OSX.KeychainReauthorizeIfNeededSuccess
histogram.summary: How many times the keychain reauthorization ran before finally succeeding, when run during the main browser launch.

histogram.name: OSX.RendererHost.SurfaceWaitTime
histogram.summary: This event records the amount of time that the browser process main thread blocks, waiting for a frame with the right dimensions to arrive from the gpu process.

histogram.name: OSX.Settings.ScreensHaveSeparateSpaces
histogram.summary: The configuration of the setting "Screens Have Separate Spaces" available in OSX 10.9+.

histogram.name: OSX.SharedMemory.Mechanism
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 51 since Mach has become the default mechanism.
histogram.summary: A histogram entry is emitted each time a base::SharedMemory object is constructed. The value of the entry indicates the mechanism used to back the shared memory region.

histogram.name: OSX.SystemHotkeyMap.LoadSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to load the system hotkeys on a Mac was successful.

histogram.name: OutdatedUpgradeBubble.NumLaterPerEnableAU
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the user clicked on the later button of the outdated upgrade bubble, before clicking on the enable updates button in the same Chrome session.

histogram.name: OutdatedUpgradeBubble.NumLaterPerReinstall
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the user clicked on the later button of the outdated upgrade bubble, before clicking on the reinstall button in the same Chrome session.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Cancelled
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 59 in favour of Overscroll.Cancelled3.
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures that were aborted before they were completed.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Cancelled3
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures that were aborted before they were completed.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Completed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 44 in favour of Overscroll.Cancelled and Overscroll.Navigated2.
histogram.summary: Completed overscroll gestures.
histogram.details: An overscroll gesture starts when user scrolls past the edge of the web page and continues scrolling in the same direction. An overscroll gesture is completed when user stops scrolling (e.g. by lifting the fingers from the touchscreen or touchpad).

histogram.name: Overscroll.Navigated
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 44 to switch to NavigationDirection enum.
histogram.summary: Navigations that were triggered due to completed overscroll gesture. Note that not all completed overscroll gestures trigger a navigation.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Navigated2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 59 in favour of Overscroll.Navigated3.
histogram.summary: Navigations that were triggered due to completed overscroll gesture. Note that not all completed overscroll gestures trigger a navigation.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Navigated3
histogram.summary: Navigations that were triggered due to completed overscroll gesture. Note that not all completed overscroll gestures trigger a navigation.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Started
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 44 to switch to NavigationDirection enum.
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures initiated by the user. Note that not all overcroll gestures started are completed (e.g. the overscroll gesture is aborted if user clicks or presses a key during the gesture).

histogram.name: Overscroll.Started2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 59 in favour of Overscroll.Started3.
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures initiated by the user. Note that not all overscroll gestures started are completed (e.g. the overscroll gesture is aborted if user clicks or presses a key during the gesture).

histogram.name: Overscroll.Started3
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures initiated by the user. Note that not all overscroll gestures started are completed (e.g. the overscroll gesture is aborted if user clicks or presses a key during the gesture).

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchNoiseFilter.FarApartTapDistance
histogram.summary: The squared distance between taps which occur in quick succession. Only reported when the taps are far apart and touch noise filtering is enabled.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchNoiseFilter.HorizontallyAlignedDistance
histogram.summary: The horizontal distance from a "touch press" to the closest other touch. Only reported if there are two or more fingers onscreen and touch noise filtering is enabled.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchNoiseFilter.TimeSinceLastNoiseOccurrence
histogram.summary: The amount of time between noisy touches. The amount of time since Chrome startup is recorded for the first noisy touch after startup.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchNoiseFilter.TouchesAtSinglePositionDuration
histogram.summary: The time between taps which occur in quick succession at the same screen location. Only reported when touch noise filtering is enabled.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.Canceled.WaitingTimeSeconds
histogram.summary: The wall-clock time spent until a lookup was canceled. This is reported every time p2p is used to find a candidate but the request was canceled.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.Found.CandidateCount
histogram.summary: The number of candidates on the LAN, i.e. the number of peers on the LAN offering at least N bytes of the requested file X. This is reported after examining responses from all peers on the LAN and picking a candidate.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.Found.ConnectionCount
histogram.summary: The number of p2p downloads of the peer that the returned URL points to. This is reported after examining responses from all peers on the LAN and picking a candidate.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.Found.WaitingTimeSeconds
histogram.summary: The wall-clock time spent waiting for the LAN-wide number of p2p downloads (i.e. the sum of p2p downloads from each peer on the LAN) to drop below the threshold. This is reported after examining responses from all peers on the LAN and picking a candidate.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.LookupResult
histogram.summary: The result of the lookup. Possible values include "Found" (if a candidate - i.e. a peer offering at least N bytes of file X - was chosen), "Not Found" (if no candidate could be found), "Vanished" (if a candidate was found but vanished while waiting in line), "Canceled" (if a candidate was found but the request was canceled while waiting in line), and "Filtered" (if it was detected that mDNS was filtered). This is reported after examining responses from all peers on the LAN when p2p is used to find a candidate.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.NumPeers
histogram.summary: The number of peers implementing p2p file sharing on the network. This is reported every time p2p is used to look up a resource on a network where mDNS is not filtered.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.Vanished.WaitingTimeSeconds
histogram.summary: The wall-clock time spent waiting for one or more candidates (i.e. peers offering at least N bytes of file X) that all vanished before the LAN-wide number of p2p downloads dropped below the threshold. This is reported every time candidates were found using p2p but then vanished.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.ClientCount
histogram.summary: The number of currently connected HTTP clients. This is reported every time a HTTP client connects.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.ContentServedInterruptedMB
histogram.summary: Number of megabytes (1,000,000 bytes) served from the device (via HTTP) where the client disconnects prematurely. This is reported every time a file is served and the client disconnects before receiving all data.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.ContentServedSuccessfullyMB
histogram.summary: Number of megabytes (1,000,000 bytes) served from the device (via HTTP). This is reported every time a file have been served successfully.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.DownloadSpeedKBps
histogram.summary: The average speed at which the download was served at, in kB/s. This is reported every time a file have been served successfully.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.FileCount
histogram.summary: The number of files available via p2p. This is reported every time a file is added or removed to the /var/cache/p2p directory.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.RangeBeginPercentage
histogram.summary: When a client resumes a download, the HTTP request includes range specifier to skip the bytes it already has. This metric conveys this as a percentage of the file size. This is reported every time a file is served, even if the request does not include a range specifier (in which case 0 is reported).

histogram.name: P2P.Server.RequestResult
histogram.summary: The result of the HTTP request. Possible values include "Response Sent" (the resource was found and the response was successfully sent), "Response Interrupted" (the resource was found but the client disconnected), "Malformed" (the request was malformed), "Not Found" (the request was for a resource that was not found), and "Index" (the request was for the '/' or '/index.html' resource). This is reported for every HTTP request handled.

histogram.name: PageActionController.ExtensionsWithPageActions
histogram.summary: The number of Extensions that have Page Actions. Measured once per startup per profile.

histogram.name: PageImportanceSignals.HadFormInteraction.OnCommitLoad
histogram.summary: Number of pages that had any HTML form interaction before next page load.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.Background
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted due to being backgrounded.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.ClientRedirect
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a client side redirect (Javascript navigation).

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.Close
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by the user closing the tab or browser.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.ForwardBackNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a forward or back navigation.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.NewNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a new navigation.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.Other
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted. The abort cause is unknown.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.Reload
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a reload.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.Stop
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by the user pressing stop.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.UnknownNavigation
histogram.obsolete: We now have sufficient infrastructure to always characterize aborts that resulted in new navigations.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a navigation with unknown transition type.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.AdFrames.Aggregate.Network
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of the resources loaded for all of the ad frames on the page that loaded over the network.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.AdFrames.Aggregate.PercentNetwork
histogram.summary:
The percentage of bytes loaded for all ad frames that were loaded over the network.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.AdFrames.Aggregate.Total
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of the resources loaded for all of the ad frames on the page.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.AdFrames.PerFrame.Network
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of the resources loaded for an ad frame from the network.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.AdFrames.PerFrame.PercentNetwork
histogram.summary:
The percentage of bytes loaded for a single ad frame that were loaded over the network.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.AdFrames.PerFrame.Total
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of the resources loaded for an ad frame.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.FullPage.Network
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of all of the page's resources that loaded over the network.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.FullPage.Network.PercentAds
histogram.summary:
The percentage of bytes loaded for the page (from the network) that came from resource loads in ad frames (from the network).
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.FullPage.Total
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of all of the page's resources.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.FullPage.Total.PercentAds
histogram.summary:
The percentage of bytes loaded for the page that came from resource loads in ad frames.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Bytes.NonAdFrames.Aggregate.Total
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of all of the page's resources except for those loaded in ad frames.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.FrameCounts.AnyParentFrame.AdFrames
histogram.summary:
The number of frames on the page identified as Google Ad Frames that have loaded more than 0 bytes of content.
For pages with zero ad frames, the other PageLoad.Clients.Ads metrics are not recorded unless otherwise specified.
Child frames of an ad frame are not included in the count.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.FrameCounts.MainFrameParent.AdFrames
histogram.summary:
The number of frames (with parent frame of main frame) that are on the page identified as Google Ad Frames.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Child frames of an ad frame are not included in the count.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.FrameCounts.MainFrameParent.PercentAdFrames
histogram.summary:
The percentage of frames (with parent frame of main frame) on the page that are identified as Google Ad Frames.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.FrameCounts.MainFrameParent.TotalFrames
histogram.summary:
The number of frames (with parent frame of main frame) on the page.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Navigations.AdFrameRenavigatedToAd
histogram.summary:
When a frame that is (or previously was) an ad frame renavigates, record whether it renavigated to an ad frame or a non-ad frame.
An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children. Its children (which may also be ads) are not counted when they renavigate.
This metric is recorded as the event happens. Note that this is unlike most other Clients.Ads metrics, which are recorded when the page load is complete.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Navigations.NonAdFrameRenavigatedToAd
histogram.summary:
When a frame that has never been part of an ad frame renavigates, record whether it renavigated to an ad frame or a non-ad frame.
This metric is recorded as the event happens. Note that this is unlike most other Clients.Ads metrics, which are recorded when the page load is complete.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.ParentExistsForSubFrame
histogram.summary: Records whether or not a parent frame is found for a subframe that finishes navigating.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.ResourceTypeWhenNoFrameFound
histogram.summary: Records the content::ResourceType when a resource finishes loading but the ads metrics aren't aware of a committed frame for the resource.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.AMP.SameDocumentView
histogram.summary: Count of same document page views for AMP pages.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.CompressionRatio
histogram.summary: 100 times the ratio of network bytes received to network bytes the user would have seen without data reduction proxy (not including headers) in a page load that had its main resource loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded as a percent if the data reduction proxy saved the user data. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Inflation
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that the data reduction proxy inflated for the user in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.InflationPercent
histogram.summary: The inflation in network kilobytes (not including headers) the user saw due to using data reduction proxy in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded as a percent when the user saw inflated data. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.NonProxied
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes that were not fetched through the data reduction proxy (not including headers) in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Original
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that the user would have seen without using data reduction proxy in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.PercentProxied
histogram.summary: The percent of network kilobytes (not including headers) in a page load that went through data reduction proxy when the main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Proxied
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes that were fetched through the data reduction proxy (not including headers) in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Savings
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that the data reduction proxy saved the user in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.CompletedResources.Network.PercentProxied
histogram.summary: The percent of completed resources loaded from network in a page load that use data reduction proxy when the main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DelayNavigation.Delay.Actual
histogram.summary: The actual delay added to page loads by DelayNavigationThrottle, for page loads that started in the foreground and reached first paint in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DelayNavigation.Delay.Delta
histogram.summary: The absolute delta between the specified and actual delays added to main frame navigations by DelayNavigationThrottle, for page loads that started in the foreground and reached first paint in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DelayNavigation.Delay.Specified
histogram.summary: The specified delay added to main frame navigations by DelayNavigationThrottle, for page loads that started in the foreground and reached first paint in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DocWrite.Block.Count
histogram.summary: Counts the number of pages where a script loaded via document.write could have been blocked.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DocWrite.Block.DocumentWriteLoadingBehavior
histogram.summary: This metric measures the counts of pages for various loading behaviors of document.written scripts.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DocWrite.Block.ReloadCount
histogram.summary: This metric measures reloads in pages that have synchronous, cross-origin document.written scripts that could be blocked if document.write script blocking feature is enabled.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.GoogleCaptcha.Events
histogram.summary: Events related to Google CAPTCHA pages being seen by users.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.LoFi.Experimental.Bytes.Network.LoFi
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that LoFi resources used in a page load that had at least one LoFi resource. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.LoFi.Experimental.CompletedResources.Network.LoFi
histogram.summary: The number of network LoFi resources in a page load that had at least one LoFi resource. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.SubresourceFilter.ActivationDecision
histogram.summary: Records the policy decision to activate subresource filtering for a page load. 'Activated' indicates that subresource filtering was activated. All other reasons indicate that subresource filtering was not activated. Page loads where subresource filtering was activated ('Activated') and at least one subresource matched the subresource filter are counted in PageLoad.Clients.SubresourceFilter.Count.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.SubresourceFilter.Count
histogram.summary: Records 'true' for page loads where the subresource filter matched a subresource loaded by the page. Includes dryrun matches. To compute the percentage of total page loads affected by subresource filtering, divide by the sum of counts for (PageLoad.ParseTiming.NavigationToParseStart + PageLoad.ParseTiming.NavigationToParseStart.Background).

histogram.name: PageLoad.CSSTiming.Parse.BeforeFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The time spent parsing author style sheets before the first contentful paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.CSSTiming.ParseAndUpdate.BeforeFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The sum of CSSTiming.Update and CSSTiming.Parse variants for this page load.

histogram.name: PageLoad.CSSTiming.Update.BeforeFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The time spent in Document::updateStyle before the first contentful paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.DocumentTiming.NavigationToDOMContentLoadedEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the DOMContentLoaded event is fired, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.DocumentTiming.NavigationToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first layout is performed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.DocumentTiming.NavigationToLoadEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the load event is fired, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.EventCounts
histogram.summary: Captures counts of various page load events. These are enumerated in the enum page_load_metrics::PageLoadEvent, and include events like 'page load aborted before first layout'

histogram.name: PageLoad.Events.Committed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToCommit and PageLoad.AbortTiming.
histogram.summary: Captures counts of load events post-commit, on relevant page loads (i.e. http/https, not same-page, not an error page). These events include aborts before first layout and successful first layouts. Note that the event 'Committed load started' when segmented by background/foreground specifies whether the eventually committed load started in the background or foreground, not whether we backgrounded before the actual commit event. This is because we don't have all the data to filter relevant page loads on provisional loads.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Events.InternalError
histogram.summary: Counts of various internal error conditions in the page_load_metrics system.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Events.Provisional
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Feb 2016 in favor of PageLoad.AbortTiming and PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFailedProvisionalLoad. Note that the corresponding background enumerations are no longer being tracked in the timing histograms.
histogram.summary: Captures counts of provisional load events. These include aborted, failed, and successful (committed) provisional loads.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming.Background
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted due to being backgrounded.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming.ClientRedirect
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a client side redirect (Javascript navigation).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming.Close
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by the user closing the tab or browser.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming.ForwardBackNavigation
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a forward or back navigation.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming.NewNavigation
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a new navigation.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming.Other
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted. The abort cause is unknown.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming.Reload
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a reload.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming.Stop
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by the user pressing stop.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Bytes.Cache
histogram.summary: The number of prefiltered (e.g., compressed) KiloBytes loaded from the cache via the browser process for a page load. Recorded when the page load is terminated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Bytes.Network
histogram.summary: The number of prefiltered (e.g., compressed) KiloBytes loaded over the network via the browser process for a page load. Recorded when the page load is terminated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Bytes.Total
histogram.summary: The number of prefiltered (e.g., compressed) KiloBytes loaded via the browser process for a page load. Recorded when the page load is terminated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Cache.RequestPercent.ParseStop
histogram.summary: The percent of resources loaded from cache for the given page load. Recorded at the end of HTML parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Cache.TotalRequests.ParseStop
histogram.summary: The number of resources a given page finished loading from cache at parse stop.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.CompletedResources.Cache
histogram.summary: The number of completed resources loaded from the cache via the browser process for a page load. Recorded when the page load is terminated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.CompletedResources.Network
histogram.summary: The number of completed resources loaded from the network via the browser process for a page load. Recorded when the page load is terminated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.CompletedResources.Total
histogram.summary: The total number of completed resources loaded via the browser process for a page load. Recorded when the page load is terminated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PageTiming.FirstPaintToFirstBackground
histogram.summary: Measures the total time the page load was active after first paint, up until being backgrounded, prior to the page load terminating. Recorded only for page loads that started in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PageTiming.FirstPaintToPageEnd
histogram.summary: Measures the total time the page load was active after first paint, for page loads that spend the entire time in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PageTiming.NavigationToFirstBackground
histogram.summary: Measures the total time the page load was active, up until being backgrounded, for page loads that started in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PageTiming.NavigationToPageEnd
histogram.summary: Measures the total time the page load was active, for page loads that spend the entire time in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.FirstMeaningfulPaintSignalStatus
histogram.summary: Whether the user had any interaction on the page (except mouse move) after first paint, and whether the user left the page before network stable or not.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.FirstMeaningfulPaintSignalStatus2
histogram.summary: Whether the user had any interaction on the page (except mouse move) after first paint, and whether the user left the page before network stable or not. Not logged if page load was aborted before first paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.FirstMeaningfulPaintStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether the First Meaningful Paint metric was reported for the page load, or why it wasn't if not. See http://bit.ly/ttfmp-doc for the definition of First Meaningful Paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.FirstMeaningfulPaintToNetworkStable
histogram.summary:
Measures the time between when the first meaningful paint (http://bit.ly/ttfmp-doc) was computed to have happened, and when we actually logged the metric.
This metric is useful in helping us tweak when FirstMeaningfulPaintDetector should stop observing layout operations.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstMeaningfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the first meaningful paint (http://bit.ly/ttfmp-doc), for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.ParseStartToFirstMeaningfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when the HTML parser started, to the first meaningful paint (http://bit.ly/ttfmp-doc), for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.ParseDuration.CachedPercent.0-50
histogram.summary: The parse duration of the page load where 0-50% of all subresources (loaded during parsing) were served from the HTTP cache (including 304s).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.ParseDuration.CachedPercent.51-100
histogram.summary: The parse duration of the page load where 51-100% of all subresources (loaded during parsing) were served from the HTTP cache (including 304s).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Renderer.FirstMeaningfulPaintDetector.FirstMeaningfulPaintOrdering
histogram.summary: Whether the two variants of First Meaningful Paint reported different values, and if so, which one was reported first.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Renderer.FirstMeaningfulPaintDetector.HadNetworkQuiet
histogram.summary: Recorded when the page load reached network 0-quiet (no active network connection for 0.5 seconds), or network 2-quiet (no more than 2 active network connections for 2 seconds). PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.FirstMeaningfulPaintSignalStatus2 histogram gives the fraction of page loads that had network 2-quiet, so it can be used as a baseline.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.TotalRequests.ParseStop
histogram.summary: The number of resources a given page finished loading at parse stop.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InputTiming.NavigationToFirstNonScroll.AfterPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time to first non-scroll input after the first paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InputTiming.NavigationToFirstScroll.AfterPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time to first scroll input after the first paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.ClientRedirect.FirstPaintToNavigation
histogram.summary: The delay between first paint and a client-side redirect navigation, for pages that reported a first paint. This metric is only intended to help in choosing a heuristic delay to distinguish between client-side redirects and other client initiated navigations, and will be deprecated in M54. Please contact bmcquade@chromium.org before using this metric.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.ClientRedirect.NavigationWithoutPaint
histogram.summary: Counts how often a client-side redirect was initiated from a page that did not report a first paint. This metric is only intended to help in choosing a heuristic delay to distinguish between client-side redirects and other client initiated navigations, and will be deprecated in M54. Please contact bmcquade@chromium.org before using this metric.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.ClientRedirectDelayAfterPaint
histogram.summary: The delay between first paint and a client-side redirection. This metric is only intended to help in choosing a heuristic delay to distinguish between client-side redirects and other client initiated navigations, and will be deprecated in M54. Please contact bmcquade@chromium.org before using this metric.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.CommitToComplete.NoTimingIPCs
histogram.summary: The delay between commit and completion, for page loads that did not receive any timing IPCs. This metric is only intended to help understand the cases where committed page loads don't receive timing IPCs. Please contact bmcquade@chromium.org before using this metric.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Counts of various internal error conditions in the page_load_metrics system.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.NavigationStartedInForeground
histogram.summary: Whether a navigation started in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.OutOfOrderInterFrameTiming
histogram.summary: The difference in magnitude between existing and updated timing, for inter-frame timings that are received out of order. Page load metrics observes timing updates in all frames on a page. It's possible for timings in different frames to arrive out of order. This metric tracks how often this happens, along with the magnitude of the difference.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.PageLoadCompleted.AfterAppBackground
histogram.summary: Whether a page load completed after the app entered the background. We log a 'Started' value for each PageLoadTracker that is active when the app enters the background, and a 'Completed' value for each of those PageLoadTrackers that successfully runs its destructor. This helps to understand how many trackers are destroyed while the app is in the background before they are able to run their destructor. This metric is only intended to help in understanding how often app background leads to data loss, and will be deprecated in a subsequent release. Please contact bmcquade@chromium.org before using this metric.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.PageLoadTimingStatus
histogram.summary: The status of PageLoadTiming structs received from the render process over IPC.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.Prerender
histogram.summary: Counts the number of prerender navigations. Only logs true values.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.ProvisionalAbortChainSize.ForwardBack
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of provisional loads aborted by other navigations, until a final forward back navigation commits.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.ProvisionalAbortChainSize.NewNavigation
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of provisional loads aborted by new navigations, until a final new navigation commits.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.ProvisionalAbortChainSize.NoCommit
