histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of provisional loads aborted by new navigations. In this case the chain never ends with a commit. This is logged on the next abort signal comes in (e.g. tab close or new navigation).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.ProvisionalAbortChainSize.Reload
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of provisional loads aborted by other navigations, until a final reload navigation commits.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.ProvisionalAbortChainSize.SameURL
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of consecutive provisional loads aborted by other navigations with the same url (before redirects). It's logged when a provisional abort does not share a URL, or when a load finally commits. Note that we don't log chains of length 0.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Navigation.RedirectChainLength
histogram.summary: The number of URLs in the redirect chain for this navigation. This excludes the first URL.

histogram.name: PageLoad.PageTiming.ForegroundDuration
histogram.summary: For page loads that start in the foreground, measures the duration of time until one of the following events occurs: the load of the main resource fails, the page load is stopped, the tab hosting the page is closed, the render process hosting the page goes away, a new navigation which later commits is initiated in the same tab, or the tab hosting the page is backgrounded. This metric has a very long tail, for pages that spend a long period of time in the foreground. As such, use of the mean or tail values are not recommended.

histogram.name: PageLoad.PageTiming.NavigationToFailedProvisionalLoad
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the provisional load failed. Only measures provisional loads that failed in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.PageTiming.NavigationToFirstForeground
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the user first foregrounds an initially backgrounded tab. Only measures navigations that started in the background.

histogram.name: PageLoad.PaintTiming.ForegroundToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from a background tab being switched to the foreground to the time the first paint is performed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The time from navigation start to first "contentful" paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstImagePaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first image is painted, for main frame documents. For images that render progressively, this is recorded as soon as any image pixels have been drawn.

histogram.name: PageLoad.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first paint is performed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstTextPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first non-blank text is painted, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.PaintTiming.ParseStartToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when the HTML parser started, to when the page first paints content.

histogram.name: PageLoad.ParseTiming.NavigationToParseStart
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the parser started, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.ParseTiming.ParseBlockedOnScriptExecution
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the execution of scripts, for main frame documents that finished parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.ParseTiming.ParseBlockedOnScriptExecutionFromDocumentWrite
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the execution of scripts inserted from document.write, for main frame documents that finished parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.ParseTiming.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoad
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts, for main frame documents that finished parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.ParseTiming.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoadFromDocumentWrite
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts inserted from document.write, for main frame documents that finished parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.ParseTiming.ParseDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser was active, for main frame documents that finished parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing.NavigationToDOMContentLoadedEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the DOMContentLoaded event is fired, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing.NavigationToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first layout is performed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing.NavigationToLoadEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the load event is fired, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.DOMLoadingToDOMContentLoadedEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when DOM loading occurs (the time that HTML parsing begins) to the time the DOMContentLoaded event is fired, for main frame documents. This is equivalent to the time that the HTML document resource was being parsed.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.DOMLoadingToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when DOM loading occurs (the time that HTML parsing begins) to first "contentful" paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ForegroundToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from a background tab being switched to the foreground to the time the first paint is performed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToCommit
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the navigation committed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToDOMContentLoadedEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the DOMContentLoaded event is fired, for main frame documents. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.DocumentTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFailedProvisionalLoad
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the provisional load failed. Only measures provisional loads that failed in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstBackground
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the user first backgrounds the tab. Only measures navigations that started in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The time from navigation start to first "contentful" paint. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.PaintTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstForeground
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the user first foregrounds an initially backgrounded tab. Only measures navigations that started in the background.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstImagePaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first image is painted, for main frame documents. For images that render progressively, this is recorded as soon as any image pixels have been drawn. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.PaintTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first layout is performed, for main frame documents. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.DocumentTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first paint is performed, for main frame documents. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.PaintTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstTextPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first non-blank text is painted, for main frame documents. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.PaintTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToLoadEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the load event is fired, for main frame documents. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.DocumentTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoad
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts, for main frame documents that started parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoad.ParseComplete
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts, for main frame documents that finished parsing. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.ParseTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoadFromDocumentWrite
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts inserted from document.write, for main frame documents that started parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoadFromDocumentWrite.ParseComplete
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts inserted from document.write, for main frame documents that finished parsing. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.ParseTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser was active, for main frame documents that finished parsing. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.ParseTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseStartToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when the HTML parser started, to when the page first paints content. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.PaintTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.BrowserWaitForRendererTime.FrameTree
histogram.summary: Total time the browser process waited for all render processes to save their respective frames while saving a page into MHTML.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.BrowserWaitForRendererTime.SingleFrame
histogram.summary: Time the browser process waited on a single frame to be saved by a render processes while saving a page into MHTML.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.EncodingTime.SingleFrame
histogram.summary: Time taken to encode into MTHML the fully serialized contents of a frame.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.FinalSaveStatus
histogram.summary: Final status of the MHTML save operation for a page.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.FullPageSavingTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to save a page into an MHTML file.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.PopupOverlaySkipped
histogram.summary: Recorded when the popup overlays are removed from MHTML serialization.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.RendererMainThreadTime.FrameTree
histogram.summary: Time spent by the main threads of all involved render processes while saving the frame tree of a page to MHTML.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.RendererMainThreadTime.SingleFrame
histogram.summary: Time spent by the renderer main thread while saving one frame of a page to MHTML.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.RendererMainThreadTime.SlowestFrame
histogram.summary: The longest time taken by the main thread of a render processes to save one frame of a page being saved to MHTML. In other words this is the maximum value reported in PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.RendererMainThreadTime.SingleFrame for one page save operation.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.SerializationTime.SingleFrame
histogram.summary: Time taken to fully serialize the contents of a frame, including HTML and CSS and image resources.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.WriteToDiskTime.SingleFrame
histogram.summary: Time spent writing a frame's encoded MHTML data to the file on disk.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.SerializationTime.CSSElement
histogram.summary: Time spent serializing a CSS element (including embedded "sub"-CSS and images).

histogram.name: PageSerialization.SerializationTime.Html
histogram.summary: Time taken to generate HTML data from a frame's DOM and serialize it (without sub-resources like CSS and images).

histogram.name: PageSerialization.SerializationTime.ImageElement
histogram.summary: Time spent serializing an image element.

histogram.name: Parser.AppendBytesDelay
histogram.summary: The delay from when bytes are received on the main thread to when the BackgroundHTMLParser starts tokenizing them. Always a shorter time than the time emitted to Parser.PreloadTokenizeDelay.

histogram.name: Parser.ChunkEnqueueTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to enqueue a ParsedChunk onto the shared parser queue.

histogram.name: Parser.DiscardedTokenCount
histogram.summary: The number of speculative tokens discarded by the parser when a rewind is needed.

histogram.name: Parser.PeakPendingChunkCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of pending Chunks in the ParsedChunkQueue after the parser is detached.

histogram.name: Parser.PeakPendingTokenCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of pending tokens in the ParsedChunkQueue after the parser is detached.

histogram.name: Parser.PreloadTokenizeDelay
histogram.summary: The delay from when bytes are received on the main thread to when they are tokenized and preloads are sent back to the main parser. Always a greater time than the time emitted to Parser.AppendBytesDelay.

histogram.name: PartitionAlloc.CommittedSize
histogram.summary: The committed memory size in PartitionAlloc. The value is reported when we see the highest memory usage we've ever seen in the renderer process.

histogram.name: PasswordBubble.DisplayDisposition
histogram.summary: When the password management bubble opened, what state was it in?

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.Event
histogram.summary:
Measures the frequency of various password generation events.
Note that this histogram is logged from the renderer process, and consequently the numbers should not be directly compared to the other PasswordGeneration.* histograms, which are logged from the browser process. Histograms logged in different processes are lost at different rates, which introduces systematic bias between histograms logged in the renderer process vs. those logged in the browser process.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.SubmissionAvailableEvent
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of submission events for passwords that could have been generated, but the user didn't choose to use the feature. This is to compare with PasswordGeneration.SubmssionEvent.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.SubmissionEvent
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of submission events for generated passwords. This is similar to PasswordManager.ActionsTakenWithPsl but only tracks events which are interesting for generated passwords.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.UploadStarted
histogram.summary: The number of times that we try to upload a form that we believe should trigger password generation. False means that something about the form would not allow us to try upload (not an Autofillable field, uploading disabled, Autofill servers in backoff, etc.). True does not mean that the upload actually completed successfully, just that it was started.

histogram.name: PasswordHash.CreateTime
histogram.summary: Time required to create the local hash of the user's GAIA password.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AcceptedSaveUpdateSubmissionIndicatorEvent
histogram.summary: The type of event that the Password Manager used for detecting a password form submission when saving or updating a password. Recorded each time a user accepts a password save/update prompt.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialog
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 56. See the histograms for one and more accounts.
histogram.summary: The dismissal reason of the account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialogAccounts
histogram.summary: The number of accounts displayed in the account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialogEmptyAvatars
histogram.summary: The count of the placeholder avatars shown in the account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialogMultipleAccounts
histogram.summary: The dismissal reason of the account chooser with multiple accounts.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialogOneAccount
histogram.summary: The dismissal reason of the account chooser with one account.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialogUsability
histogram.summary: Whether the account chooser includes an empty username or any duplicates

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountsPerSite
histogram.summary: The number of accounts stored per site in the password manager (one event per site)

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountsReusingPassword
histogram.summary:
Records, for each account, the number of other accounts (across all sites and usernames) that reuse the same password. Only non-blacklisted, HTML-form-based accounts are considered.
For each account, samples will only be recorded into the histograms that have the first suffix corresponding to whether that account was saved on a secure website or not. The second suffix is used to further categorize the other accounts that reuse the same password based on how they relate to the account in question, and whether they are secure. The number of other accounts in each category will be reported into histogram with the respective second suffixes.
Metrics are collected once per browser start-up. In case of multiple profiles, the counts are for the profile for which a WebContents is first created.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTaken
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 32. See PasswordManagerActionsTakenWithPsl
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTakenOnNonSecureForm
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password on a non-secure page, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTakenV3
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTakenWithPsl
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationBackend.FetchSize
histogram.summary: The number of facets for which affiliation information was requested in a network fetch. Recorded for each network fetch.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationBackend.FirstFetchDelay
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between creation of the AffiliationBackend and the first time it needed to issue a network fetch.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationBackend.SubsequentFetchDelay
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between subsequent network fetches. Recorded whenever the AffiliationBackend initiated a network fetch, regardless of success or failure.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationDummyData.RequestResultCount
histogram.summary: The number of facets affiliated with a dummy Web facet, according to the affiliation information retrieved from the cache. Recorded for each dummy Web facet, once shortly after start-up, and then periodically every hour; but only if getting affiliations succeeded for the Web facet.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationDummyData.RequestSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether or not affiliations of a dummy Web facet could be successfully retrieved from the cache. Recorded for each dummy Web facet, once shortly after start-up, and then periodically every hour.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationFetcher.FetchErrorCode
histogram.summary: The network error code, as reported by the underlying URLFetcher. Recorded only for each network fetch that failed due to network/server errors.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationFetcher.FetchHttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: The HTTP response code, as reported by the underlying URLFetcher. Recorded only for each network fetch that failed due to network/server errors.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationFetcher.FetchResult
histogram.summary: Whether the network fetch succeeded, failed due to network/server errors, or contained malformed data. Recorded for each network fetch.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AllowToCollectURLBubble.UIDismissalReason
histogram.obsolete: The bubble isn't shown anymore. Become obsolete in Feb. 2015.
histogram.summary: Why was "Allow to collect URL?" bubble closed?

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AutocompletePopupSuppressedByGeneration
histogram.summary: If the password manager UI was suppressed because generation UI was already being displayed for the same field.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AutoSigninFirstRunDialog
histogram.summary: The dismissal reason of the auto-signin first run experience.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BlacklistedSites
histogram.summary: The total number of sites that the user has blacklisted. Recorded by iterating over stored passwords once per run of Chrome.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.CountInDatabase
histogram.summary: Number of password forms with empty username in the Login Database. This is recorded on startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.FormWithoutUsernameFieldIsPasswordChangeForm
histogram.summary: When parsing a password form, and no username field is detected, whether this was a password change form.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.OfferedToSave
histogram.summary: When offering to save a password, whether the username is empty.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.ParsedUsernameField
histogram.summary: When parsing a password form, whether a username field is detected.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.PasswordFieldCount
histogram.summary: The number of password fields for password forms that do not have a username field. This is recorded every time such a password form is successfully parsed. Note that the parsing is attempted when the form is encountered (i.e when the document is loaded) and also when it is submitted.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.TextAndPasswordFieldCount
histogram.summary: The total number of text and password fields for password forms that do not have a username field. This is recorded every time such a password form is successfully parsed. Note that the parsing is attempted when the form is encountered (i.e when the document is loaded) and also when it is submitted.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.WithoutCorrespondingNonempty
histogram.summary: Number of password forms with empty username in the Login Database for which there is not another password form from the same realm with a nonempty username. In other words, number of password forms with empty username which we do not suspect to be reauthentication forms.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Enabled
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the password manager is enabled when a tab is opened. This includes prerendered tabs.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ExportedPasswordsPerUserInCSV
histogram.summary: The number of passwords exported in CSV format per user.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FilledCredentialWasFromAndroidApp
histogram.summary: When a credential is filled, whether it comes from an Android app.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FillSuggestionsIncludeAndroidAppCredentials
histogram.summary: When offering to fill the username and password, whether at least one of the credentials in the dropdown comes from an Android app.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.FormDataDeserializationStatus
histogram.summary: The success or failure of deserializing saved FormData. Failure either indicates corrupted data or the presence of bugs in the serialization or deserialization code.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.GeneratedFormHasNoFormManager
histogram.summary: When the generation state of a password was changed, records whether an existing form corresponding to the password was found.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.GetMediated
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 05/2017. This metric has been replaced by PasswordManager.MediationOptional.
histogram.summary: Tracks result of navigator.credentials.get() with unmediated=false. That is the result of account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.GetUnmediated
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 05/2017. This metric has been replaced by PasswordManager.MediationSilent.
histogram.summary: Tracks result of navigator.credentials.get() with unmediated=true. That is the result of auto sign-in.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.HttpPasswordMigrationCount
histogram.summary: Number of HTTP saved passwords that were migrated to HTTPS. Recorded on HTTPS password form load when there are no credentials saved.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.HttpPasswordMigrationMode
histogram.summary: The mode of migration applied to HTTP passwords migrating to HTTPS. Recorded on HTTPS password form load when there are no credentials saved.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ImportedPasswordsPerUserInCSV
histogram.summary: The number of passwords imported in CSV format per user

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ImportPasswordFromCSVResult
histogram.summary: The response code of successful or failed password import attempt from a CSV file.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.InfoBarResponse
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2016. This metric has been replaced by PasswordManager.UIDismissalReason.
histogram.summary: The distribution of responses to the "Do you want Chrome to remember this password"? info bar prompt.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.KeychainMigration.NumChromeOwnedInaccessiblePasswords
histogram.summary: After migration from the Mac Keychain fails, records the number of passwords in the Keychain owned by Chrome but not accessible by it.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.KeychainMigration.NumFailedPasswords
histogram.summary: After migration from the Mac Keychain fails, records the number of passwords in the Chrome Password Manager database for which the corresponding values in the Keychain are not accessible by Chrome.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.KeychainMigration.NumPasswordsOnFailure
histogram.summary: After migration from the Mac Keychain fails, records the number of passwords in the Chrome Password Manager database to be migrated. As there is no partial migration, it's the total number of passwords in the DB.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.KeychainMigration.Status
histogram.summary: The status of passwords migration from the Keychain. It's recorded shortly after startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.KWalletDeserializationStatus
histogram.summary: The success or failure of deserializing PasswordForms in KWallet. Failure either indicates corrupted data or the presense of bugs in the deserialization code.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LinuxBackendStatistics
histogram.summary: Information about usage of password storage backends on Linux. It also includes whether a command line flag for a specific backend is given.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LoginDatabaseFailedVersion
histogram.summary: The version of LoginDatabase if the migration to a new one failed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LoginDatabaseInit
histogram.summary: An error on LoginDatabase initialization.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MediationOptional
histogram.summary: Tracks result of navigator.credentials.get() with mediation="optional". That is the result of account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MediationRequired
histogram.summary: Tracks result of navigator.credentials.get() with mediation="required". That is the result of forced account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MediationSilent
histogram.summary: Tracks result of navigator.credentials.get() with mediation="silent". That is the result of auto sign-in.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MultiAccountPasswordUpdateAction
histogram.summary: A user action when a password update bubble with multiple accounts is shown.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumPasswordsDeletedByBulkDelete
histogram.summary: Number of passwords deleted when the user chooses to clear passwords via the clear browsing data UI.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumPasswordsDeletedDuringRollback
histogram.summary: Number of passwords deleted when browsing data is cleared during rollback.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumPasswordsDeletedWhenBlacklisting
histogram.summary: When the user chooses to never remember passwords for a form, we remove all previously saved credentials for that form. This is the count of those credentials.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumPasswordsNotShown
histogram.summary: The password manager only shows those credentials that are considered the best match for a particular form. This stat keep track of the credentials that were not as good of a match and were suppressed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.OsPasswordStatus
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the user's OS password is blank or not at browser startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.OtherPossibleUsernamesUsage
histogram.summary: Breakdown of how other possible usernames are displayed. Recorded every time we autofill a password form.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordReuse.MainFrameMatchCsdWhitelist
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of May 17 2017. Replaced by PasswordProtection.RequestOutcome.ProtectedPasswordEntry.
histogram.summary:
A password reuse is an event when the user typed a string that is equal to a saved password on another domain, and this saved password is called reused password.
This metric shows whether a password reuse happens on a page whose main frame url matches CSD whitelist.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordReuse.NumberOfMatches
histogram.summary:
A password reuse is an event when the user typed a string that is equal to a saved password on another domain, and this saved password is called reused password.
This metric shows how many saved credentials have password that's equal to the reused password.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordReuse.PasswordFieldDetected
histogram.summary:
A password reuse is an event when the user typed a string that is equal to a saved password on another domain, and this saved password is called reused password.
This metric reports whether a password field had been detected on a page when a password reuse happened.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordReuse.PasswordLength
histogram.summary:
A password reuse is an event when the user typed a string that is equal to a saved password on another domain, and this saved password is called reused password.
This metric shows the length of the reused password.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordReuse.TotalPasswords
histogram.summary:
A password reuse is an event when the user typed a string that is equal to a saved password on another domain, and this saved password is called reused password.
This metric shows how many credentials are stored in Password Manager when a password reuse happened.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordSyncState
histogram.summary: Whether the passwords are syncing and, if not, then what's causing sync failures. Recorded after the first sync attempt either succeeds or fails.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ProvisionalSaveFailure
histogram.summary: Breakdown of cases where a password is submitted, but we don't even try and save it. Recorded for every password form submit.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PslDomainMatchTriggering
histogram.summary: Breakdown on trigger rate of providing a password form autofill entry based on matching stored information using the public suffix list (PSL) for possible matches. In addition, this metric also counts cases where a existing federated entry was successfully matched via PSL. For example, this includes cases where an existing federated credential for https://example.com was used for https://subdomain.example.com.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavePasswordPromptDisappearedQuickly
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the save password prompt disappeared in less than one second. This most likely indicates that the prompt was dismissed automatically, e.g. due to a page navigation, before the user was able to respond to the infobar.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavePasswordPromptDisplayed
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the save password prompt was displayed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavePasswordPromptResponse
histogram.summary: Breakdown of which response the user selected from the save password prompt.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SettingsReconciliation.InitialAndFinalValues
histogram.summary: Tracks the pair of initial values and pair of final values for the legacy preference for controlling the Chrome Password Manager and the new preference for controlling Smart Lock on Android. A single sample is recorded after sync has merged last snapshot and finished initialization for sync users, and on profile initialization for non-sync users.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SettingsReconciliation.InitialValues
histogram.summary: Tracks the pair of initial values for both for the legacy preference for controlling the Chrome Password Manager and new preference for controlling Smart Lock on Android. Sample is recorded on every profile initialization before reconciliation logic is taken place, e.g. when user logs in to browser, on a startup of a browser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ShouldBlockPasswordForSameOriginButDifferentScheme
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded every time Chrome detects a password form submission. The credential might be proposed to be saved, or it might be blocked. It is blocked if the previously detected password form submission was successful, and the current submission is from a URL with the same origin, but a different and insecure scheme. That is, if the previously provisionally saved credential is for https://example.com, a new credential for http://example.com would be blocked. More details can be found in the doc associated with http://crbug.com/571580.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ShouldShowAutoSignInFirstRunExperience
histogram.summary: Records if the user still has to click through the first run experience to benefit from auto sign-in behavior. Recorded on every start-up.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ShowedFormNotSecureWarningOnCurrentNavigation
histogram.summary: Recorded (at most once per main-frame navigation) when a password form shows a warning that the form is not secure.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SignInPromo
histogram.summary: User action on the Chrome Sync promo that appears in the password bubble. The promo offers to sign in to Chrome.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SignInPromoCountTilClick
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 12/16/16. New statistic is PasswordManager.SignInPromoCountTil*.
histogram.summary: The number of times the Sign In promo in the password bubble was shown before user clicked on it.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SignInPromoCountTilNoThanks
histogram.summary: The number of times the Sign In promo in the password bubble was shown before user clicked on "No thanks".

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SignInPromoCountTilSignIn
histogram.summary: The number of times the Sign In promo in the password bubble was shown before user clicked on "Sign in".

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SignInPromoDismissalCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Sign In promo in the password bubble was implcitly dismissed. Recorded each time the promo is implicitly dismissed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StorePasswordImportedFromCSVResult
histogram.summary: Whether password manager stored passwords imported from CSV file successfully.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StoreReadyWhenWiping
histogram.summary: When the user logs in with their sync credential, PasswordManager checks if there are any outdated copies of it in the password store, in order to purge them. This histogram records whether password store data are ready during this check.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SubmitNavigatesToDifferentDomain
histogram.summary: Indicates whether submitting a password login form changes the registry controlled domain of the main frame.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SubmittedFormType
histogram.summary: The type (e.g. signup, login, change password) of all submitted password forms. This is logged on form submission, but doesn't require that the password manager saves.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SubmittedNonSecureFormType
histogram.summary: The type (e.g. signup, login, change password) of all submitted password forms on non-secure pages. This is logged on form submission, but doesn't require that the password manager saves.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SuccessfulSubmissionIndicatorEvent
histogram.summary: The type of event that the Password Manager used for detecting a password form submission. Recorded for each successful password form submission.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SyncCredentialFiltered
histogram.summary: This histogram is reported for those forms on accounts.google.com, on which Chrome is forced by Finch/flags during autofilling to remove sync credentials from password store results. It reports true if sync credentials were indeed removed from the store results, and false if there were no sync credentials in the results to begin with.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SyncingAccountState
histogram.summary: Information about the user's current sync status crossed with whether their synced password is saved.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TimesGeneratedPasswordUsed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 11/11/14. New statistic is PasswordManager.TimesPasswordUsed.AutoGenerated.
histogram.summary: The number of times each generated password has been used to log in. Recorded by iterating over stored passwords once per run. This information is persisted and synced.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TimesPasswordUsed
histogram.summary: The number of times each saved password has been used to log in. Does not include generated passwords. Recorded by iterating over stored passwords once per run. This information is persisted and synced.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TotalAccounts
histogram.summary: The number of accounts stored in the password manager (across all sites)

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TotalAccountsHiRes.WithScheme
histogram.summary: The number of accounts stored in the password manager (across all sites) for origins with the scheme (e.g., HTTP, HTTPS, FTP) as given in the histogram suffix. For each scheme, the count is recorded once per browser start-up. (In case of multiple profiles, the counts are for the profile that first has a WebContents created.)

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UIDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Why was the password manager's UI (bubble or infobar) closed?

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UpdatePasswordSubmissionEvent
histogram.summary: The password submission event happened when the user changes their password on a website, say foo.com or types new password on a sign-in form for saved credential (which might mean that the password was changed in a different browser). The later case called password overriding. This histogram measures whether the user has any passwords saved in the Chrome password manager for foo.com or the password was overriden on sign-in form, and what action the user performed on the offered bubble. It's recorded when the bubble is closed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UserStoredPasswordWithInvalidSSLCert
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 07/2016 because this information is no longer stored in PasswordForm. See also http://crbug.com/413020.
histogram.summary: Whether saved password for HTTPS site had a valid SSL cert when the password was saved.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.NumberOfCachedVerdictBeforeShutdown
histogram.summary: Number of password protection verdicts stored in content settings of a profile before this profile is destructed.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.PasswordProtectionResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes for PasswordProtectionRequest. Logged after chrome receives response of PasswordProtectionRequest from Safe Browsing service.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.PasswordReuseEventVerdict
histogram.summary: Verdict types returned by Safe Browsing server for password reuse events.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.RequestNetworkDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for PasswordProtectionService request. It is not recorded for requests that were canceled.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.RequestOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the password protection request, indicating if request is sent out successfully or if it is skipped or canceled for some reason.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.UnfamiliarLoginPageVerdict
histogram.summary: Verdict types returned by Safe Browsing server for unfamiliar login pages.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.Verdict
histogram.summary: Verdict types returned by Safe Browsing server for a password protection request. Request can be triggered when user focuses on a password field or enters a protected password.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CanMakePayment.NotUsed.WithShowEffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when CanMakePayment was not called by the merchant.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CanMakePayment.Usage
histogram.summary: Whether the merchant used the CanMakePayment method during a Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CanMakePayment.Used.EffectOnShow
histogram.summary: The effect of the CanMakePayment return value on whether Show was called.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CanMakePayment.Used.FalseWithShowEffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when CanMakePayment was called by the merchant and returned false.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CanMakePayment.Used.TrueWithShowEffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when CanMakePayment was called by the merchant and returned true.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.Aborted
histogram.summary: The reason that lead to an abort of the Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.Completed
histogram.summary: When the merchant has processed the user's Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.Initiated
histogram.summary: When a Payment Request gets initiated by the user.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.NoShow
histogram.summary: The reason that leads to the Payment Request not being shown to the user.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.PayClicked
histogram.summary: When the user clicks the "pay" button in the Payment Request UI.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.ReceivedInstrumentDetails
histogram.summary: When the browser retrieves the instrument details from the payment app to complete a purchase.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.Shown
histogram.summary: When the Payment Request UI gets shown after initialization.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.SkippedShow
histogram.summary: When the Payment Request UI gets skipped to go directly to the payment app.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.NumberOfSelectionAdds
histogram.summary: The number of times the user added an entry during a Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.NumberOfSelectionChanges
histogram.summary: The number of times the user changed an entry during a Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.NumberOfSelectionEdits
histogram.summary: The number of times the user edited an entry during a Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.NumberOfSuggestionsShown
histogram.summary: The number of suggestions shown to the user during a payment request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.RequestedInformation
histogram.summary: Tracks what user information is required by merchants to complete a Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.SelectedPaymentMethod
histogram.summary: Tracks what payment method was used to complete a transaction in Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.UserDidNotHaveSuggestionsForEverything.EffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when the user did not have suggestions offered for each requested information.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.UserHadSuggestionsForEverything.EffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when the user had suggestions offered for each requested information.

histogram.name: PDF.DocumentFeature
histogram.summary: Tracks which features are used by documents opened in the PDF viewer, logged when the document finishes loading.

histogram.name: PDF.IsFontSubstituted
histogram.summary: Tracks documents opened in the PDF viewer where substitute fonts need to be used.

histogram.name: PDF.LoadStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks what happens when Chrome tries to load a PDF. This metric tracks all cases, but is focused on measuring failed PDF embeds, which occur if the user is on Android, or if PDF plugin is disabled.

histogram.name: Pepper.Graphics3DHasShareGroup
histogram.summary: True if a non-flash Pepper Graphics3D context has a share group.

histogram.name: Pepper.InterfaceUsed
histogram.summary: The number of out-of-process plugin processes that have loaded a particular PPB interface version.

histogram.name: Pepper.PluginContextSecurity.TCPConnect
histogram.summary: Whether a Pepper TCP connect attempt comes from a plugin in a secure or an insecure origin.

histogram.name: Pepper.PluginContextSecurity.UDPBind
histogram.summary: Whether a Pepper UDP bind attempt comes from a plugin in a secure or an insecure origin.

histogram.name: Pepper.SecureOrigin.MediaStreamRequest
histogram.summary: Whether a Pepper media stream request (mic/cam access) comes from a plugin in a secure or an insecure origin.

histogram.name: PerformanceMonitor.AverageCPU
histogram.summary: Average CPU utilization of a process, read out at each two-minute interval. The utilization is in the 0-100% range per CPU, which is then summed up. I.e. a quadcore system fully loaded would read as 400%.

histogram.name: PerformanceMonitor.HighCPU
histogram.summary: The number of times a process has continuously stayed above a certain threshold of CPU utilization over a certain time period (currently set to two minutes).

histogram.name: Permissions.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Action.InsecureOrigin
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc on an insecure origin. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Action.SecureOrigin
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc on a secure origin. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.AutoBlocker.EmbargoPromptSuppression
histogram.summary:
For every permission request that would show a prompt to the user, this metric tracks whether the request is suppressed by embargo (and the source of that embargo), or whether there is no embargo and the prompt is shown. This is the proportion of permission prompts that the user would have seen that have been blocked due to embargo.
If the (origin, permission) pair was previously placed under embargo, no prompt is displayed and the reason for embargo is recorded. Otherwise, the prompt is shown and a no embargo reason is recorded.

histogram.name: Permissions.AutoBlocker.EmbargoStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason that an (origin, permission) pair has been placed under embargo (blocked from making requests for that permission for a period of time). This is triggered when a permission is placed under embargo for blacklisting (once Safe Browsing has returned a result), when a permission prompt has been shown and it is placed under embargo for repeated dismissals, or when a permission prompt is shown and not embargoed.

histogram.name: Permissions.AutoBlocker.SafeBrowsingResponse
histogram.summary: Tracks the response (if received) from Safe Browsing when the API blacklist is queried for an (origin, permission) pair. The response could be that the origin was blacklisted, not blacklisted, or Safe Browsing timed out before a response was received.

histogram.name: Permissions.AutoBlocker.SafeBrowsingResponseTime
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed time between the client sending a request to Safe Browsing and receiving a result, or the maximum wait time is exceeded and Safe Browsing is deemed to have timed out.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted
histogram.summary: Tracks the permission bubbles (merged and non-merged) that are accepted. Merged bubbles are considered accepted if all permissions are allowed.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.Persisted
histogram.summary: For each granted permission prompt displayed with a persistence toggle (remember my decision), records whether the persistence toggle was enabled (persist) or not enabled (don't persist).

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.PriorDismissCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt accept, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.PriorIgnoreCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt accept, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied
histogram.summary: Tracks the permission bubbles (merged and non-merged) that are denied. Merged bubbles are considered denied if any permission is denied.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied.Persisted
histogram.summary: For each denied permission prompt displayed with a persistence toggle (remember my decision), records whether the persistence toggle was enabled (persist) or not enabled (don't persist).

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied.PriorDismissCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt deny, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied.PriorIgnoreCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt deny, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.DismissCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt dismissal, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data, inclusive of the current dismissal. Every event in a bucket larger than 1 in this histogram will also have an event in each smaller bucket. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Dismissed.PriorDismissCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt dismiss, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the dismiss. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Dismissed.PriorIgnoreCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt dismiss, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the dismiss. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.IgnoreCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt ignore, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data, inclusive of the current ignore. Every event in a bucket larger than 1 in this histogram will also have an event in each smaller bucket. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Ignored.PriorDismissCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt ignore, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the ignore. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Ignored.PriorIgnoreCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt ignore, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the ignore. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.MergedBubbleAccepted
histogram.summary: Tracks acceptance of permission bubble request types that have been merged into coalesced bubbles.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.MergedBubbleDenied
histogram.summary: Tracks denial of permission bubble request types that have been merged into coalesced bubbles.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.MergedBubbleTypes
histogram.summary: Tracks the permission bubble request types that are being merged into coalesced bubbles.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.RequestsPerPrompt
histogram.summary: How many permission requests each permissions prompt shown to the user contains.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Shown
histogram.summary: Tracks how many times permission prompts are shown to users.

histogram.name: Permissions.Requested.CrossOrigin
histogram.summary:
The embedder's permission setting at the time of a cross-origin iframe permission request for a given permission type. See the corresponding histogram suffixes.
A request is when a website makes a permission request and the user has the permission set to prompt (i.e. not blocked or allowed).
Note this is probably not the metric you want - it does not correspond to the total number of times websites request a permission. Also, because specific permissions have code that can automatically block or grant permissions based on things like incognito, installed extensions etc., this does also not correspond to the number of times users are prompted to allow permissions.
See https://crbug.com/638076 for more details.

histogram.name: Permissions.Requested.SameOrigin
histogram.summary:
The permission type (geolocation, and such) of a same-origin permission request.
A request is when a website makes a permission request and the user has the permission set to prompt (i.e. not blocked or allowed).
Note this is probably not the metric you want - it does not correspond to the total number of times websites request a permission. Also, because specific permissions have code that can automatically block or grant permissions based on things like incognito, installed extensions etc., this does also not correspond to the number of times users are prompted to allow permissions.
See https://crbug.com/638076 for more details.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ActivityReferral
histogram.summary: Referer used by user to reach the main Physical Web Activity.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.InitialState.IosChrome
histogram.summary: Initial state of the Physical Web in Chrome for iOS.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ReferralDelay.OptInNotification
histogram.summary: Time between the most recent opt in notification update and when the user arrives at the ListUrlsActivity.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ReferralDelay.StandardNotification
histogram.summary: Time between the most recent standard notification update and when the user arrives at the ListUrlsActivity.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ResolveTime.Background
histogram.summary: Round trip time to the metadata server for a Physical Web URL resolution which the client requests during a background scan.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ResolveTime.Foreground
histogram.summary: Round trip time to the metadata server for a Physical Web URL resolution which the client requests during a foreground scan, that is not explicitly requested via a refresh.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ResolveTime.Refresh
histogram.summary: Round trip time to the metadata server for a Physical Web URL resolution which the client requests during a foreground scan, that is explicitly requested via a refresh.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.RoundTripTimeMilliseconds
histogram.summary: Round trip time to the metadata server for Physical web.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.State.Bluetooth
histogram.summary: Whether bluetooth is on, off, or unknown.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.State.DataConnectionActive
histogram.summary: Whether the data connection is active.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.State.LocationPermission
histogram.summary: Whether location permission has been accepted.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.State.LocationServices
histogram.summary: Whether location services are enabled.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.State.Preference
histogram.summary: Whether the preference is on, off, or if the user is in an onboarding state when Chrome first starts up.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.TotalUrls.OnInitialDisplay
histogram.summary: The number of URLs displayed to a user when a list of nearby URLs is first displayed.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.TotalUrls.OnRefresh
histogram.summary: The number of URLs displayed to a user when a list of nearby URLs is displayed after refreshing.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.WebUI.ListViewUrlPosition
histogram.summary: Count of how many times the user selected a nearby URL at the specified index in the Physical Web WebUI list view (zero-based). Capped at 50.

histogram.name: Platform.AnyCrashesDaily
histogram.summary: Count of crashes (user, kernel, and unclean shutdowns) during the previous day, or the most recent day the device was in use. Reported at most once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.AnyCrashesWeekly
histogram.summary: Count of crashes (user, kernel, and unclean shutdowns) during the previous epoch-week, or the most recent epoch-week the device was in use. Reported at most once a week. Epoch-weeks divide the time in 7-day intervals starting at the UNIX epoch.

histogram.name: Platform.AsvGroup
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (ARM Chromebooks using Exynos 5250 only) Adaptive Support Voltage Group, recorded once per bootup. Indicates which "bin" the SoC is part of, which sets the voltage that different rails on the system will run at. The values 0-11 are valid. A value of 12 indicates an error parsing dmesg and should be investigated. See also Platform.LotIdEnum.

histogram.name: Platform.BatteryAbsent
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the kernel's ACPI Smart Battery System driver logged an error trying to find the battery on boot.

histogram.name: Platform.BootMode.DevSwitch
histogram.summary: Indicates the status of the developer switch on Chrome OS hardware. The developer switch allows users to run their own code on the device.

histogram.name: Platform.BootMode.FirmwareWriteProtect
histogram.summary: On Chrome OS hardware, indicates whether flash write protection is enabled for the firmware indicated by the histogram suffix.

histogram.name: Platform.BootMode.WriteProtectSwitch
histogram.summary: Indicates the status of the hardware write protect switch on Chrome OS hardware. The write protect switch protects firmware from being rewritten.

histogram.name: Platform.BootSectorsRead
histogram.summary: Chrome OS number of disk sectors read at boot from kernel start to login-prompt-ready.

histogram.name: Platform.BootSectorsWritten
histogram.summary: Chrome OS number of disk sectors written at boot from kernel start to login-prompt-ready.

histogram.name: Platform.Cast.MeminfoMemAvailable
histogram.summary: /proc/meminfo's 'MemAvailable' in Mbytes. Collected on Cast devices with kernel version 3.14 and above and capped at 500.

histogram.name: Platform.Cast.MeminfoMemFreeDerived
histogram.summary: free + buffers + cache memory in Mbytes on Cast devices, capped at 500.

histogram.name: Platform.CompressedSwapSize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of allocated swap area in megabytes (before compression)

histogram.name: Platform.CpuFrequencyThermalScaling
histogram.summary: CPU frequency as percent of the baseline frequency, sampled every 30s. This may be throttled down from 100% due to power dissipation issues (too high temperature). It may also be throttled up (turbo), but the kernel does not report the actual turbo frequency, so we put such samples in the 101% bucket.

histogram.name: Platform.CpuUsage
histogram.summary: Peak total (single core) CPU usage for the last sample interval. The sample interval may vary from seconds to several minutes.

histogram.name: Platform.CrOSEvent
histogram.summary: Generic event of interest from Chrome OS. Intended mainly to help assess the frequency of rare error conditions.

histogram.name: Platform.Crouton.Started
histogram.summary: Detects presence of /run/crouton, indicating that crouton has been started since the previous boot. Value 0/"Total count" is reported on boot, 1/"Started" is reported after the file presence is detected (checked periodically).

histogram.name: Platform.CumulativeCpuTime
histogram.summary: Total CPU time accumulated since the last version update. Reported at most once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.CumulativeUseTime
histogram.summary: Total use time (device ON and not asleep) since last version update. Reported at most once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.DailyUseTime
histogram.summary: Total use time (device ON and not asleep) in the previous day, or the most recent day the device was in use. Reported at most once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Cache_Avg
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Average size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Cache_Max
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Maximum size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Downloads_Avg
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Average size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Downloads_Max
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Maximum size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.GCache_Avg
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Average size of user's GCache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.GCache_Max
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Maximum size of user's GCache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.LeastUsedAccountDays
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Days since the least frequently used account signed in. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.NumUserHomeDirectories
histogram.summary: Number of users home directories on the device. Logged once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.OldestUserOnDevice
histogram.summary: Days since last login of the least recently user on device. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.UsersOnDevice
histogram.summary: Number of user home dirs on device. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsageChronos
histogram.summary: Chrome OS KB in use in the /home/chronos filesystem tree. Logged once a day during log file cleanup.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsageVar
histogram.summary: Chrome OS KB in use in the /var filesystem tree. Logged once a day during log file cleanup.

histogram.name: Platform.IntelMaxMicroArchitecture
histogram.summary: The maximum supported micro-architecture on an Intel platform. This value is logged at program start time.

histogram.name: Platform.KernelCrashesDaily
histogram.summary: Count of kernel crashes during the previous day, or the most recent day the device was in use. Reported at most once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.KernelCrashesPerActiveYear
histogram.summary: Count of kernel crashes since the last OS update, normalized as number of crashes per year of active use (active use = device is ON and not asleep). Reported daily.

histogram.name: Platform.KernelCrashesPerCpuYear
histogram.summary: Count of kernel crashes since the last OS update, normalized as number crashes per year of CPU time. Reported daily.

histogram.name: Platform.KernelCrashesSinceUpdate
histogram.summary: Count of kernel crashes since the last OS update, reported daily.

histogram.name: Platform.KernelCrashesWeekly
histogram.summary: Count of kernel crashes during the previous epoch-week, or the most recent epoch-week the device was in use. Reported at most once a week. Epoch-weeks divide the time in 7-day intervals starting at the UNIX epoch.

histogram.name: Platform.KernelCrashInterval
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last two kernel crashes. Sent after every kernel crash.

histogram.name: Platform.KernelWarningHashes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The 32-bit hash of a kernel warning. This is the hash of the "file:line" string corresponding to the location of the warning, for instance: "/mnt/host/source/src/third_party/kernel/files/drivers /gpu/drm/i915/intel_dp.c:351" (ignore spurious spaces). The hash is produced by this code: while (*string) hash = (hash << 5) + hash + *string++; Separately each warning is also collected (with its hash) via the crash reporter, but only its first occurrence in each boot session.

histogram.name: Platform.LogicalCpuCount
histogram.summary: Number of logical processors. This includes Hyperthreaded cores.

histogram.name: Platform.LotIdEnum
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (ARM Chromebooks using Exynos 5250 only) indication about whether we're part of a special lot ID. Special lot IDs are groups of chips that have special case handling in the kernel for the Adaptive Support Voltage code (the normal logic doesn't work). See also Platform.AsvGroup. Note that fused devices are never part of a special lot (currently) and only some unfused lots are "special".

histogram.name: Platform.Mem
histogram.summary: Various memory usage % of total memory on Chrome OS devices (snapshotted every 30s).

histogram.name: Platform.Meminfo
histogram.summary: Various memory usage amount on Chrome OS devices (snapshotted every 30s).

histogram.name: Platform.MemoryBandwidth.ReadWrite
histogram.summary: Peak memory bandwith (read and write) usage during the last sample interval. The sample interval may vary from seconds to several minutes.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon0
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 1 minute after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon1
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 5 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon2
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 30 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon3
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 150 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon4
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 750 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.PageFaultsLong
histogram.summary: Page faults per second averaged over 30s interval, sampled continuously.

histogram.name: Platform.PageFaultsShort
histogram.summary: Page faults per second averaged over 1s interval, sampled every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ReadSectorsLong
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second read by Chrome OS in a long interval (currently 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.ReadSectorsShort
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second read by Chrome OS in a short interval (currently 1s, sampled every 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.SmartTransferErrors
histogram.summary: Disk communication errors (SMART 199), sent at boot.

histogram.name: Platform.SmartUncorrectableErrors
histogram.summary: Uncorrectable disk errors (SMART 187), sent at boot.

histogram.name: Platform.SpringChargerType
histogram.summary:
USB device ID of the charger plugged into a Spring device (if any), sent once a minute. The Device ID is composed from the following 4 8-bit registers of the TSU6721 chip: ADC (07h), Device Type 3 (15h), Device Type 2 (0Bh), Device Type 1 (0Ah). Device Type 1/2/3 is a bitmap and most of bits are mutually exclusive (excepted VBUS debounce). ADC is the 5-bit value of the ID pin, but for most types (as in Device Type), there are only one or two possible ID pin connections/values. The datasheet can be found here: http://www.ti.com/lit/ds/symlink/tsu6721.pdf.
Note that different brand/models of the charger can have the same ID.

histogram.name: Platform.StatefulUsage
histogram.summary: Chrome OS stateful partition usage level.

histogram.name: Platform.Storage.Flash.BadBlocks
histogram.summary: The number of blocks marked bad in an MTD partition. This is relevant for devices with raw NAND flash, such as Chromecast. Sampled once daily, if the Chromecast is on for any significant length of time in the day.

histogram.name: Platform.SwapInLong
histogram.summary: Average pages/second swapped IN over a 30s interval, sampled every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.SwapInShort
histogram.summary: Average pages/second swapped IN over a 1s interval, sampled every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.TPM.AuthErrorCode
histogram.summary: Each sample is the result code of a TPM authorized command issued through tcsd. Success is 0. For the other error codes, see /usr/include/tss/tpm_error.h.

histogram.name: Platform.TPM.DictionaryAttackCounter
histogram.summary: Each sample is the value of the TPM dictionary attack counter reported at boot and hourly while running. Any non-zero value is unexpected.

histogram.name: Platform.TPM.DictionaryAttackResetStatus
histogram.summary: Each sample is the status of an hourly attempt to reset the TPM dictionary attack counter.

histogram.name: Platform.TPM.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Each sample is the result code of a TPM command issued through tcsd. Success is 0. For the other error codes, see /usr/include/tss/tpm_error.h.

histogram.name: Platform.TPMForcedReboot
histogram.summary: Each sample is the number of consecutive reboots performed while attempting to clear a TPM (Trusted Platform Module) error.

histogram.name: Platform.Tps65090Retries
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Retries needed to enable a FET on tps65090 (AKA tpschrome). Tps65090 is a power management unit (PMU) used on many ARM Chromebooks. Until version ES7 was rolled into production we would sometimes run into a problem where FET1 (the FET used to switch on and off the backlight) wouldn't turn on properly. This problem was especially prevalent when the voltage was high (like when the device was plugged into the wall). Retrying by turning the FET off and on again is nearly always effective, so the kernel will retry up to 5 times (currently) and will also log the fact that it needed to retry. On newest kernels (kernel 3.8 and up) a kernel warning will be logged with WARN_ON if the FET still failed to turn on after 5 tries. Refer to the kernel warning reports to find that information. For more details about this bug refer to http://crbug.com/338657 and http://crosbug.com/p/16009. Note that we log retries on all 7 FETs even though we've only ever seen failures of FET1.

histogram.name: Platform.WriteSectorsLong
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second written by Chrome OS in a long interval (currently 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.WriteSectorsShort
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second written by Chrome OS in a short interval (currently 1s, sampled every 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.ZramCompressedSize
histogram.summary: Compressed swap size in megabytes. This is the actual amount of RAM used by the system to compress memory (i.e. after compression). Snapshot every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ZramCompressionRatioPercent
histogram.summary: The ratio of compressed memory (zram) before and after compression when the denominator at least 1 MB. Ratios of interest are between 1 and 6 (typically between 2 and 3), and we express them as a percentage (between 100% and 600%). The size of memory before compression includes zero-filled pages. Values close to 100% indicate low compression effectiveness. Snapshot every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ZramSavings
histogram.summary: RAM savings in megabytes from using memory compression. This is the difference between the RAM size before and after compression. Snapshot every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ZramZeroPages
histogram.summary: Number of zero-filled pages that the OS is compressing. A large number suggests wasteful allocation. Snapshot every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ZramZeroRatioPercent
histogram.summary: The fraction of compressed memory that consists of zero-filled pages. Snapshot every 30s.

histogram.name: PlatformFile.FlushTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2016-07 because the histogram's purpose of adding colour to the description of File::Flush() has been fulfilled.
histogram.summary: The time it takes to run File::Flush().

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Time from "begin" to "first paint." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFirstPaint_Negative
histogram.summary: Magnitude and difference between begin and first paint, when first_paint precedes begin. This is a temporary metric used to better understand the root cause of http://crbug.com/125273.

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.obsolete: The first paint after load is not useful for most documents. Consider using PageLoad.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint instead.
histogram.summary: Time from "big" to "first paint after load." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFinishDoc
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish doc." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish doc" == main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFirstPaint
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.obsolete: The first paint after load is not useful for most documents. Consider using PageLoad.PaintTiming.ParseStartToFirstContentfulPaint instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint after load." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.FinishDocToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "finish doc" to "finish." "Finish doc"== main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.FinishToFirstPaintAfterLoad
