histogram.obsolete: The first paint after load is not useful for most documents. Consider using PageLoad.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "finish " to "first paint after load." "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.LoadType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Probability distribution for enumerated varieties of page loads.

histogram.name: PLT.MissingStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Diagnose error conditions in PLT reporting. A start time should always be present.

histogram.name: PLT.NavStartToLoadEnd
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the Navigation Timing metrics navigationStart and loadEventEnd. Definitions: http://www.w3.org/TR/navigation-timing/

histogram.name: PLT.NavStartToLoadStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the Navigation Timing metrics navigationStart and loadEventStart. Definitions: http://www.w3.org/TR/navigation-timing/

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Connect
histogram.summary: Time from connectStart to connectEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeConnect
histogram.summary: Time from domanLookupEnd to connectStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeDomainLookup
histogram.summary: Time from fetchStart to domainLookupStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeDomLoading
histogram.summary: Time from responseStart to domLoading based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeFetch
histogram.summary: Time from navigationStart to fetchStart based on Navigation Timing when no redirect.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeFetchRedirect
histogram.summary: Time from navigationStart to fetchStart excluding time spent on redirects based on Navigation Timing. Only page loads with redirects are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeLoadEvent
histogram.summary: Time from domContentLoadedEventEnd to loadEventStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeRequest
histogram.summary: Time from connectEnd to requestStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomainLookup
histogram.summary: Time from domainLookupStart to domainLookupEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomContentLoaded
histogram.summary: Time from domContentLoadedEventStart to domContentLoadedEventEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomInteractive
histogram.summary: Time from domInteractive to domContentLoadEventStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomLoading
histogram.summary: Time from domLoading to domInteractive based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_LoadEvent
histogram.summary: Time from loadEventStart to loadEventEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Redirect
histogram.summary: Time from redirectStart to redirectEnd based on Navigation Timing when redirects exist.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Request
histogram.summary: Time from requestStart to responseStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Response
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 7/19/2016. Replaced by PageLoad.ParseTiming.ParseDuration.
histogram.summary: Time from responseStart to responseEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.PageUsed_PrerenderLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Distribution of discarded and displayed prerendered pages.

histogram.name: PLT.PerceivedLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererPLT.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a page. For non-prerendered pages, this is just BeginToFinish. For displayed prerendered pages, this is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: PLT.PerceivedLoadTime_PrerenderLoad
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererPerceivedPLTMatched.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a prerendered page that is displayed. This is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: PLT.Prerender_TimeUntilDisplay
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererTimeUntilDisplay.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between when the prerendering of a page starts and when the page is displayed. Prerendered pages discarded without being displayed are excluded from this count.

histogram.name: PLT.PrerenderIdleTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererIdleTime.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This is the time from when a prerendered page finishes loading to when it is displayed. When a page is displayed before it finishes loading, no value is recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: PLT.PT.NavigationStartToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first document layout is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.PT.ResponseStartToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's response start to the time the first document layout is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToCommit
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToCommit. Commit: responseStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToCommit_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToCommit. Commit: responseStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinish
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinish_SpdyProxy. Finish: loadEventEnd. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinishDoc. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinishDoc_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinishDoc_SpdyProxy. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinish
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinish. Commit: responseStart. Finish: loadEventEnd.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinish. Commit: responseStart. Finish: loadEventEnd. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinishDoc. Commit: responseStart. FinishDoc: loadEventStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinishDoc_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinishDoc. Commit: responseStart. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_FinishDocToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.FinishDocToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. FinishDoc: loadEventStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_FinishDocToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.FinishDocToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToCommit
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and measures the time until the renderer got first byte of document. Commit: time when renderer got first byte of document. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToDomContentLoaded
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and measures the time until the beginning of the DOMContentLoaded event. DOMContentLoaded: domContentLoadedEventStart. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToFinish
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. Request: navigationStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and measures the page load time until the beginning of the load event. Finish: loadEventStart. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToStart. Start: requestStart. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToStart_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToStart. Start: requestStart. Request: navigationStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToCommit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToCommit. Start: requestStart. Commit: responseStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToCommit_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToCommit. Start: requestStart. Commit: responseStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToFinish. Start: requestStart. Finish: loadEventEnd.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToFinish. Start: requestStart. Finish: loadEventEnd. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.RequestToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "finish." "Request" == time when user requested document. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.RequestToStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "start." "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToCommit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "commit." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "finish." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.NoProxy.http
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using http and no proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.NoProxy.https
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using https and no proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.Proxy.http
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using http over a proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.Proxy.https
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using https over a proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.UserTiming_Mark
histogram.summary: This time is based on the User Timing spec and measures the time from Navigation Timing navigationStart until the point where the page called performance.mark().

histogram.name: PLT.UserTiming_MeasureDuration
histogram.summary: This time is based on the User Timing spec and reports the time between two arbitrary points defined by the page being loaded and directly matches the measurement exposed by performance.measure().

histogram.name: Plugin.AvailabilityStatus.WidevineCdm
histogram.summary: The availability status of Widevine CDM. In normal cases, this is reported per render process if EME API is used. This is not reported if EME API is not used. This could be reported multiple times per render process until PLUGIN_AVAILABLE is reported (which should be a rare case).

histogram.name: Plugin.EnabledStatusMigrationDone
histogram.summary: Tracks whether plugins that were disabled were migrated.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.ClickSize.AspectRatio
histogram.summary: Aspect ratio of Flash plugins users click at least once. The aspect ratio is multiplied by 100 and stored as a rounded integer.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.ClickSize.Height
histogram.summary: Height of Flash plugins users click at least once.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.ClickSize.Width
histogram.summary: Width of Flash plugins users click at least once.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.Engagement
histogram.summary: The engagement score of origins which have passed through a site engagement check to permit or block Flash. Recorded every time the Flash plugin is requested with the PreferHtmlOverPlugins feature active.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.TinyContentSize
histogram.summary: Collects the sizes of all loaded Flash plugin instances. This is for determining the prevalence of tiny flash plugin instances.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.YouTubeRewrite
histogram.summary: Records the YouTube Flash embed rewrite status when attempted.

histogram.name: Plugin.FlashNavigateUsage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Record usage of PPB_Flash.Navigate() Pepper API.

histogram.name: Plugin.FlashUsage
histogram.summary: Collects Flash usage data.

histogram.name: Plugin.NpapiRemovalInfobar.Removed.PluginGroup
histogram.summary: The plugin group of an NPAPI plugin that is no longer supported. Recorded when the NPAPI removal infobar is shown for a plugin which is no longer supported.

histogram.name: Plugin.NpapiRemovalInfobar.RemovedSoon.PluginGroup
histogram.summary: The plugin group of an NPAPI plugin that will be unsupported soon. Recorded when the NPAPI removal infobar is shown after an NPAPI plugin first loads to warn the user that NPAPI support for this plugin will be removed soon.

histogram.name: Plugin.NPAPIStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether NPAPI plugins are supported by the platform, and if so, whether they are enabled or disabled. Recorded once at browser startup.

histogram.name: Plugin.PowerSaver.PeripheralHeuristic
histogram.summary: Records each decision of the Plugin Power Saver peripheral content heuristic. This UMA is counted once per peripheral query, and may count a single plugin instance multiple times as it is resized.

histogram.name: Plugin.PowerSaver.PeripheralHeuristicInitialDecision
histogram.summary: Records the initial decision of the Plugin Power Saver peripheral content heuristic for each plugin instance. This is recorded once per plugin instance.

histogram.name: Plugin.PowerSaver.PosterParamPresence
histogram.summary: Record how many plugin object tags use poster param. This is recorded once per plugin instance, and is currently restricted to Flash plugin instances.

histogram.name: Plugin.PowerSaver.Unthrottle
histogram.summary: Record how many throttled plugins are unthrottled, and by what method.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiBrokerLoadErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code of a PPAPI broker load failure.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiBrokerLoadResult
histogram.summary: The result from an attempt to load a PPAPI broker.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiBrokerLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time spent to load a PPAPI broker.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiPluginLoadErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code of a PPAPI plugin load failure.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiPluginLoadResult
histogram.summary: The result from an attempt to load a PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiPluginLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time spent to load a PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiSyncIPCTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to complete a synchronous IPC made from the PPAPI process.

histogram.name: Plugin.RequestObjectResult
histogram.summary: Result of HTMLPluginElement::requestObject in Blink.

histogram.name: Plugin.SyncMessageTime
histogram.summary: Roundtrip times for synchronous IPC calls from the renderer to NPAPI plugin processes.

histogram.name: PluginFinder.BuiltInPluginList.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Error codes when parsing the built-in plugin list. Logged when the PluginFinder singleton is created.

histogram.name: Power.BacklightLevelOnAC
histogram.summary: The level of the backlight as a percentage when the user is on AC. Sampled every 30 seconds.

histogram.name: Power.BacklightLevelOnBattery
histogram.summary: The level of the backlight as a percentage when the user is on battery. Sampled every 30 seconds.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryChargeHealth
histogram.summary: Chrome OS battery charge health percentage. Sampled once when device starts charging.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargePercentPerHour
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2017 in favor of power benchmarks that have less variability than data from users' machines.
histogram.summary: The percentage of battery capacity used per hour relative to a full battery. Reported once when the power adaptor is plugged back in after the system is on battery power for more than 30 minutes. If at any point the system is suspended or all Chrome renderers are closed the measurement is not recorded. Anytime the user unplugs the power adaptor, a new measurement will begin being recorded. Collection of this histogram only starts after 30 minutes of uptime at which point the clock starts (assuming the user is on battery power at that point). The system will need to remain unplugged for at least another 30 minutes in order for any measurement to be recorded. Values are normalized to a percent per hour scale. This measurement is tied tightly to hardware model/OS and is not comparable across different hardware configurations.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS battery discharge rate in mW sampled every 30 seconds while the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRate_15
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2017 in favor of power benchmarks that have less variability than data from users' machines.
histogram.summary: The percent of depleted battery capacity relative to a full battery over the first 15 minutes after battery power collection information starts. Collection of this histogram only starts after 30 minutes of uptime at which point the clock starts (assuming the user is on battery power at that point). The system will need to remain unplugged for at least another 15 minutes in order for any measurement to be recorded. Values are normalized to a percent per hour scale. This measurement is tied tightly to hardware model/OS and is not comparable across different hardware configurations.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRate_30
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2017 in favor of power benchmarks that have less variability than data from users' machines.
histogram.summary: The percent of depleted battery capacity relative to a full battery over the first 30 minutes after battery power collection information starts. Collection of this histogram only starts after 30 minutes of uptime at which point the clock starts (assuming the user is on battery power at that point). The system will need to remain unplugged for at least another 30 minutes in order for any measurement to be recorded. Values are normalized to a percent per hour scale. This measurement is tied tightly to hardware model/OS and is not comparable across different hardware configurations.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRate_5
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2017 in favor of power benchmarks that have less variability than data from users' machines.
histogram.summary: The percent of depleted battery capacity relative to a full battery over the first 5 minutes after battery power collection information starts. Collection of this histogram only starts after 30 minutes of uptime at which point the clock starts (assuming the user is on battery power at that point). The system will need to remain unplugged for at least another 5 minutes in order for any measurement to be recorded. Values are normalized to a percent per hour scale. This measurement is tied tightly to hardware model/OS and is not comparable across different hardware configurations.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRateWhileSuspended
histogram.summary: Chrome OS battery discharge rate in mW while the system was suspended, sampled at resume. Only reported if the system was on battery power both before suspending and after resuming, if the energy level didn't increase while suspended (which would indicate that an AC adapter was connected), and if the system was suspended for at least a minute.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryInfoSample
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times we have read the battery status from sysfs and if it gave us sensible values.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtEndOfSessionOnAC
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the end of a user session when the device is on AC.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtEndOfSessionOnBattery
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the end of a user session when the device is on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtStartOfSessionOnAC
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the start of a user session when the device is on AC.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtStartOfSessionOnBattery
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the start of a user session when the device is on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingCharge
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2012, no longer being generated by powerd.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge sampled when the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingWhenChargeStarts
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled when charging starts.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryTimeToEmpty
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2012, no longer being generated by powerd.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining time to empty battery in minutes sampled when the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BitfixChunks
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (Snow RO firmware 2695.90.0 only) number of 8K chunks that were fixed (memory corruption corrected) for each suspend/resume cycle. Expect 0 around 97% of the time and a non-zero value around 3% of the time.

histogram.name: Power.BitfixFixes
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (Snow RO firmware 2695.90.0 only) number of 4-byte words that were fixed (memory corruption corrected) for each suspend/resume cycle. Expect 0 around 97% of the time and a non-zero value around 3% of the time. Would be exactly equal to Power.BitfixChunks if there were only one corrupted word in each chunk but is sometimes several times higher.

histogram.name: Power.BrightnessAdjustOnAC
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2013. See Accel_BrightnessDown_F6 and Accel_BrightnessUp_F7 user actions instead.
histogram.summary: Number of times the user has adjusted brightness up and down while running on battery power.

histogram.name: Power.BrightnessAdjustOnBattery
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2013. See Accel_BrightnessDown_F6 and Accel_BrightnessUp_F7 user actions instead.
histogram.summary: Number of times the user has adjusted brightness up and down while running on AC power.

histogram.name: Power.ChargerType
histogram.summary: External power supply type such as MAINS_CHARGER, USB_CHARGER, UNCONFIRMED_SPRING_CHARGER, SAFE_SPRING_CHARGER. A sample is reported each time a charger is connected to the device.

histogram.name: Power.ConnectedChargingPorts
histogram.summary: Connected charging ports on Chrome OS. A sample is reported every time that the power manager polls sysfs (typically every 30 seconds). Ordinals are assigned based on the lexicographical ordering of power supply names from sysfs and have no implied correspondence with ports' physical locations. For example, with ports 'CROS_USB_PD_CHARGER0' and 'CROS_USB_PD_CHARGER1', 'first' refers to the former and 'second' to the latter. To determine a port's physical location, see the powerd charging_ports pref in the device's overlay.

histogram.name: Power.DarkResumeWakeDurationMs
histogram.summary: The amount of time a system spent awake every time it woke up in dark resume.

histogram.name: Power.DarkResumeWakeDurationMs.Other
histogram.summary: The amount of time a system spent awake every time it woke up in dark resume triggered by an unknown or unsupported wake trigger.

histogram.name: Power.DarkResumeWakeDurationMs.WiFi.Disconnect
histogram.summary: The amount of time a system spent awake every time it woke up in dark resume triggered by a WiFi disconnect.

histogram.name: Power.DarkResumeWakeDurationMs.WiFi.Pattern
histogram.summary: The amount of time a system spent awake every time it woke up in dark resume triggered by a WiFi packet pattern match.

histogram.name: Power.DarkResumeWakeDurationMs.WiFi.SSID
histogram.summary: The amount of time a system spent awake every time it woke up in dark resume triggered by a net detect SSID match.

histogram.name: Power.DarkResumeWakeupsPerHour
histogram.summary: The number of times a system woke up in dark resume in an hour. Note that this value is scaled up or down to an hour based on the amount of time the system spent in suspend. So if the system suspended for 20 minutes and woke up 3 times, it would report a value of 9.

histogram.name: Power.ExternalBrightnessReadResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to read an external display's brightness on Chrome OS. A read attempt is made after successfully requesting the brightness (see Power.ExternalBrightnessRequestResult).

histogram.name: Power.ExternalBrightnessRequestResult
histogram.summary: The result of requesting an external display's brightness on Chrome OS. A request is sent when the user presses a brightness key and the current brightness is not already cached. A successful request is followed shortly thereafter by a read attempt (see Power.ExternalBrightnessReadResult).

histogram.name: Power.ExternalBrightnessWriteResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to change an external display's brightness on Chrome OS. A request is sent when the user presses a brightness key and the current brightness is either already cached or successfully loaded.

histogram.name: Power.ExternalDisplayOpenResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to open an I2C device to control an external display's brightness on Chrome OS. An attempt is made when a display is connected to a device that lacks an internal display.

histogram.name: Power.FirmwareResumeTimeOnAC
histogram.summary: The time that the firmware took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on AC at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.FirmwareResumeTimeOnBattery
histogram.summary: The time that the firmware took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on battery at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterDimOnAC
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen dimmed sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on AC.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterDimOnBattery
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen dimmed sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterScreenOffOnAC
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen turned off sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on AC.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterScreenOffOnBattery
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen turned off sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeOnAC
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on AC.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeOnBattery
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.KernelResumeTimeOnAC
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on AC at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.KernelResumeTimeOnBattery
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on battery at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.KernelSuspendTimeOnAC
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to suspend-to-RAM the Chrome OS device when running on AC.

histogram.name: Power.KernelSuspendTimeOnBattery
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to suspend-to-RAM the Chrome OS device when running on battery.

histogram.name: Power.KeyboardBacklightLevel
histogram.summary: The level of the keyboard backlight as a percentage. Sampled every 30 seconds.

histogram.name: Power.LengthOfSession
histogram.summary: The length of time, in seconds, that a user spent in a single session. Values for this metric are clamped to 12 hours, so the last bucket should be considered to be including all metrics above 12 hours.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourIosOnActive
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, when sync invalidator listens to on_application_active events. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourOthers
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, for other sync invalidator methods. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourP2P
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, when sync invalidator uses peer-to-peer notifications. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourServer
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, when sync invalidator uses server-based non-blocking invalidator. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.NumberOfAlsAdjustmentsPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of times that the Automatic Light Sensor (ALS) adjusted the brightness during a session. Values for this metric are clamped to 10k count, so the last bucket should be considered to be including all metrics above 10k.

histogram.name: Power.NumberOfSessionsPerCharge
histogram.summary: The number of user sessions that occured since the last time that the device was charged. Values for this metric are clamped at 10k, so the last bucket should be considered to include all metrics about 10k.

histogram.name: Power.PowerButtonAcknowledgmentDelay
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the user pressing the power button and Chrome acknowledging the button-down event on Chrome OS. Values for this metric are capped to two seconds.

histogram.name: Power.PowerButtonDownTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the user pressing the power button and releasing it on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Power.PowerSupplyMaxPower
histogram.summary: The maximum power supported by the connected power supply on Chrome OS. A sample is reported every time that the power manager polls sysfs (typically every 30 seconds) and sees a connected supply.

histogram.name: Power.PowerSupplyMaxVoltage
histogram.summary: The maximum voltage supported by the connected power supply on Chrome OS. A sample is reported every time that the power manager polls sysfs (typically every 30 seconds) and sees a connected supply.

histogram.name: Power.PowerSupplyType
histogram.summary: The type of the connected power supply on Chrome OS. A sample is reported every time that the power manager polls sysfs (typically every 30 seconds) and sees a connected supply.

histogram.name: Power.RetrySuspendCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Feb 2014 by Power.SuspendAttemptsBeforeCancel and Power.SuspendAttemptsBeforeSuccess.
histogram.summary: The number of times Chrome OS retried suspend due to previous failure.

histogram.name: Power.ShutdownReason
histogram.summary: The reason for the Chrome OS power manager shutting down or rebooting the system.

histogram.name: Power.SuspendAttempt
histogram.summary: The number of suspend attempts on Chrome OS. Samples are reported before each attempt, so this histogram may include cases where the system crashed instead of suspending.

histogram.name: Power.SuspendAttemptsBeforeCancel
histogram.summary: The number of suspend attempts performed for a single suspend request (e.g. triggered by the lid being closed) that was eventually canceled on Chrome OS. This also includes requests that were canceled due to the system eventually shutting down due to repeated suspend failures.

histogram.name: Power.SuspendAttemptsBeforeSuccess
histogram.summary: The number of suspend attempts performed for a single suspend request (e.g. triggered by the lid being closed) that eventually succeeded on Chrome OS. This includes the successful attempt.

histogram.name: Power.SuspendResult
histogram.summary: The results of suspend attempts on Chrome OS. Samples are reported after each attempt.

histogram.name: Power.SuspendStatus
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Jan 2014 by Power.SuspendAttempt and Power.SuspendResult.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS suspend status.

histogram.name: Power.ThermalAbortedFanTurnOn
histogram.summary: The percentage of aborted fan attempts out of total fan attempts per session, where an abort is due to hysteresis. This value is computed from boot and sent when powerd starts and then every 15 minutes afterwards.

histogram.name: Power.ThermalMultipleFanTurnOn
histogram.summary: The percentage of fan trip point passes that are more than one trip point. This value is computed from boot and sent when powerd starts and then every 15 minutes afterwards.

histogram.name: Power.TimeInSuspendAtBoot
histogram.summary: Chrome OS time in minutes spent in suspend-to-RAM mode sampled at boot (i.e., the device most likely ran out of battery while in suspend).

histogram.name: Power.TimeInSuspendAtResume
histogram.summary: Chrome OS time in minutes spent in suspend-to-RAM mode sampled at resume.

histogram.name: Power.UserBrightnessAdjustmentsPerSessionOnAC
histogram.summary: The number of times that the user adjusted the brightness during a session when on AC. Values for this metric are clamped to 10k count, so the last bucket should be considered to be including all metrics above 10k.

histogram.name: Power.UserBrightnessAdjustmentsPerSessionOnBattery
histogram.summary: The number of times that the user adjusted the brightness during a session when on battery. Values for this metric are clamped to 10k count, so the last bucket should be considered to be including all metrics above 10k.

histogram.name: Precache.BatteryPercentage.Start
histogram.summary: The battery level in percentage when the precache task was started.

histogram.name: Precache.BatteryPercentageDiff.End
histogram.summary: Measures the difference between the battery level percentage when the precache task is started and ended. This value indicates the possible battery usage due to the precache task. Logged when the precache task ends, which could be due to successful completion, time-out, error conditions, max download limit exceeded, etc.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheSize.AllEntries
histogram.summary: The size in kilobytes occupied by all the entries existing in the cache at the time of the last precache.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch
histogram.summary: Like HttpCache.Pattern but only for requests not made during precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch.FromPrecache
histogram.summary: Like Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch but only for requests which having a matching URL in the precache. Measures the amount of precache misses due to expiration or eviction. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch.NonTopHosts
histogram.summary: Like Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch, but only for requests with a referer not in the user's top visited hosts. See History.TopHostsVisitsByRank for details on the top hosts computation.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch.TopHosts
histogram.summary: Like Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch, but only for requests with a referer in the user's top visited hosts. See History.TopHostsVisitsByRank for details on the top hosts computation.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheStatus.Prefetch
histogram.summary: Like HttpCache.Pattern but only for requests made during precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.DownloadedNonPrecache
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that were downloaded over the network for HTTP/HTTPS fetches that were not motivated by precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.DownloadedPrecacheMotivated
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that were downloaded because of precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.Events
histogram.summary: Enumerates the various failure reasons and events of interest for precaching. The events are persisted when the native library is not loaded, and recorded when the library loads next time.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.FailureReasons
histogram.summary: A bit vector of reasons why the precache fetch failed to start. Bit values are documented in the FailureReason Java enum.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.MinWeight
histogram.summary: The minimum resource weight that is fetched in a given precache run. Reported if the precache completed successfully or was canceled due to the byte cap, but not if it was cancelled due to an ill-formed manifest or exceeding the time limit. Reported only if global_ranking is true.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.PercentCompleted
histogram.summary: The percent of manifests for which all resources have been downloaded. Logged per prefetch run.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.ResponseBytes
histogram.summary: The total number of response bytes received from all prefetch requests, including config, manifests, and resources. Logged per prefetch run.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.ResponseBytes.Daily
histogram.summary: The total number of response bytes in 24 hours received over the network from all prefetch requests, including config, manifests, and resources. Logged during the next precache run after the 24 hours has elapsed.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.ResponseBytes.Network
histogram.summary: The total number of response bytes received over the network from all prefetch requests, including config, manifests, and resources. Logged per prefetch run.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.ResponseBytes.NetworkWasted
histogram.summary: The total number of response bytes received over the network for a wasted resource precache fetch. Logged when a partially downloaded resource precache fetch gets cancelled due to per-resource size limit or max precache size limit.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.ResponseBytes.Total
histogram.summary: The total number of response bytes contained in all prefetch requests, including config, manifests, and resources. Logged per prefetch run.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.TimeToComplete
histogram.summary: The time, in milliseconds, to complete a prefetch run. Only applies to non-cancelled runs (those for which PercentCompleted is 100).

histogram.name: Precache.Freshness.Prefetch
histogram.summary: The freshness lifetimes of the resources that were precached from the moment they were fetched or revalidated as described in RFC 2616 13.2.4. Logged per precache request.

histogram.name: Precache.Latency.NonPrefetch
histogram.summary: The latency for requests that were not made during precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.Latency.NonPrefetch.NonTopHosts
histogram.summary: Like Precache.Latency.NonPrefetch, but limited to requests with a referer not in the user's top visited hosts. See History.TopHostsVisitsByRank for details on the top hosts computation.

histogram.name: Precache.Latency.NonPrefetch.TopHosts
histogram.summary: Like Precache.Latency.NonPrefetch, but limited to requests with a referer in the user's top visited hosts. See History.TopHostsVisitsByRank for details on the top hosts computation.

histogram.name: Precache.Latency.Prefetch
histogram.summary: The latency for requests that were made during precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.PeriodicTaskInterval
histogram.summary: The time between successive precache periodic GCM task invocations. When precache task is started, the time interval from previous task invocation is logged.

histogram.name: Precache.Saved
histogram.summary: The number of bytes during user browsing that were served from the cache, but would have been downloaded over a network if precaching was disabled. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.Saved.Freshness
histogram.summary: The freshness lifetimes (RFC 2616 13.2.4) of the resources that were precached and later used (and thus served from the cache). This is computed at serving time and thus possibly different from the precached value if the cache entry was revalidated. Logged per-request but only once per URL and precaching cycle (as Precache.Saved).

histogram.name: Precache.TimeSinceLastPrecache
histogram.summary: The time between the the beginning of the last precache session and each of the URL fetches made by the user ever since. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: PrefService.CreateProfilePrefsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during CreateProfilePrefs.

histogram.name: PrefService.PersistentLogRecallProtobufs
histogram.summary: The status when loading PersistedLogs from Prefs.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.Counts
histogram.summary: The number of preloads generated by the preload scanner.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.Counts.Miss
histogram.summary: The number of unused preloads generated by the preload scanner. Note that some link rel preloads are not referenced until after this point, so they will be falsely marked as preload misses. These will show up in the Raw bucket.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.Counts2
histogram.summary: The number of preloads generated by the preload scanner.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.Counts2.Miss
histogram.summary: The number of unused preloads generated by the preload scanner. Note that some link rel preloads are not referenced until after this point, so they will be falsely marked as preload misses.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.DocumentWrite.ExecutionTime.Failure
histogram.summary: Time spent executing a script tag in the blink preload scanner, for the purpose of preloading scripts that will be fetched via a call to document.write. The execution failed to generate a preload request.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.DocumentWrite.ExecutionTime.Success
histogram.summary: Time spent executing a script tag in the blink preload scanner, for the purpose of preloading scripts that will be fetched via a call to document.write. The execution successfully resulted in a preload request.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.DocumentWrite.GatedEvaluation
histogram.summary: The reason a particular inline script was blocked from evaluation.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.DocumentWrite.InitializationTime
histogram.summary: Time spent initializing a new V8 context for the purpose of evaluating it and preloading document.written strings.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.DocumentWrite.ScriptLength
histogram.summary: The length of the inline script that is being considered for document write evaluation.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.ExternalCSS.PreloadCount
histogram.summary: The number of preloads generated by scanning an external preloaded CSS resource. As of 4/25/2016 this only includes @import declarations.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.ExternalCSS.ScanTime
histogram.summary: Microseconds it took to scan the first chunk of external CSS for preloads.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.ReferenceTime
histogram.summary: The time between preload discovery and when the resource is actually referenced. This is implemented by marking when a preload is discovered by the scanner, and when it has its first ResourceClient added to it. Note that for link rel preloads, this tracks the time from scanner discory to DOM discovery of the link declaration, not the actual resource.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.TTFB
histogram.summary: The time between preload discovery and when the first bytes of the response data arrive.

histogram.name: Prerender.AbandonTimeUntilUsed
histogram.summary: Time from when a prerendered page is abandoned to when it is first used due to user navigation. If the page is swapped before begin abandoned, a zero is recorded.

histogram.name: Prerender.CookieSendType
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what types of cookies were sent for a prerender.

histogram.name: Prerender.CookieStatus
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what cookie actions a prerender caused.

histogram.name: Prerender.Event
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what events related to prerendering have occurred.

histogram.name: Prerender.Events
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Hover Event counts for prerendering.

histogram.name: Prerender.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: Final status for prerender pages - either success, or why it was canceled.

histogram.name: Prerender.FinalStatusMatchComplete
histogram.summary: Final status for prerender pages - either success, or why it was canceled. This is for the MatchComplete set of pages (including some pages that were not actually prerendered), to match the control group.

histogram.name: Prerender.FractionPixelsFinalAtSwapin
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For prerenders that are swapped in, the percentage of pixels that is already final at swap-in time compared to when the spinner stops.

histogram.name: Prerender.HoverStats_TimeUntilClicked
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Duration that a user hovers a link before clicking on it.
This is recorded for all pages loaded in a session.

histogram.name: Prerender.HoverStats_TimeUntilDiscarded
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Duration that the mouse pointer hovers on a link before the mouse pointer moves off of it.
This is recorded for all pages loaded in a session.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorEvent
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what events related to the local predictor have occurred

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorLoggedInLookupTime
histogram.summary: Time to perform the LoggedIn Lookup for the local predictor. This operation checks whether a user is likely logged into a page that we would like to prerender.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorPrefetchMatchPLT
histogram.summary: The PrerenderLocalPredictor uses local browsing history and the prerender service to predict pages likely visited soon. Some of these URLs are prefetched. When such prefetched likely next pages are visited, this histogram records the PLT for such pages. In particular, this also happens if prefetch is actually disabled, allowing (by pivoting on whether or not prefetch is enabled) to compare the effect of prefetch on PLT.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorServiceLookupTime
histogram.summary: Time to perform the Service Lookup for the local predictor. This operation queries a Google service to obtain pages to prerender, as well as whether prerender candidate pages are likely safe for prerendering.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorTimeUntilUsed
histogram.summary: Time from when a prerendered page is started to when it is first used due to user navigation. If the page is never used, it is not included in this histogram. This only refers to prerenders based on the local predictor.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorURLLookupTime
histogram.summary: Time to perform the URL Lookup for the local predictor. This operation retrieves from the user's local browsing history the URLs corresponding to URLIDs.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalVisitCoreTransition
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The transition type for each new visit as recorded in the local visits database.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalVisitDatabaseSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the local visits database (number of entries).

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalVisitEvents
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what events related to local visits have occurred

histogram.name: Prerender.ModPagespeedHeader
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Previous version of the Prerender.PagespeedHeader.* histograms.

histogram.name: Prerender.NetworkBytes.TotalForProfile
histogram.summary: Number of bytes transferred on the network for URLRequests (not including HTTP/TLS/TCP/IP overhead). Reported on event of a PrerenderContents deletion. Includes prerender bytes. Bytes are only counted when prerendering is enabled and not in a control group. The sum of the distribution for a single user represents all of that user's network transfers for resource for that time period while prerendering was enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.NetworkBytes.Used
histogram.summary: Number of bytes transferred on the network for URLRequests (not including HTTP/TLS/TCP/IP overhead) for a prerender that was used (or would have been used).

histogram.name: Prerender.NetworkBytes.Wasted
histogram.summary: Number of bytes transferred on the network for URLRequests (not including HTTP/TLS/TCP/IP overhead) for a prerender that was not used.

histogram.name: Prerender.NetworkBytesTotalForProfile
histogram.summary: Number of bytes transferred on the network for URLRequests (not including HTTP/TLS/TCP/IP overhead). Reported on event of a PrerenderContents deletion. Includes prerender bytes. Bytes are only counted when prerendering is enabled and not in a control group. The sum of the distribution for a single user represents all of that user's network transfers for resource for that time period while prerendering was enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.NetworkBytesUsed
histogram.summary: Number of bytes transferred on the network for URLRequests (not including HTTP/TLS/TCP/IP overhead) for a prerender that was used (or would have been used).

histogram.name: Prerender.NetworkBytesWasted
histogram.summary: Number of bytes transferred on the network for URLRequests (not including HTTP/TLS/TCP/IP overhead) for a prerender that was not used.

histogram.name: Prerender.NoStatePrefetchAge
histogram.summary: Time between the prefetch and the actual load of the page.

histogram.name: Prerender.NoStatePrefetchMainResourceRedirects
histogram.summary: Length of the redirect chain for main resources loaded by NoStatePrefetch. Recorded when the final response in the chain is received.

histogram.name: Prerender.NoStatePrefetchResponseTypes
histogram.summary: Type of responses received by NoStatePrefetch, distinguishing cacheable resources from no-store resources, and main resources from sub-resources. Recorded when a response is received, including on each redirect.

histogram.name: Prerender.NoStatePrefetchSubResourceRedirects
histogram.summary: Length of the redirect chain for sub-resources loaded by NoStatePrefetch. Recorded when the final response in the chain is received.

histogram.name: Prerender.OmniboxNavigationsCouldPrerender
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates whether the Omnibox navigation being committed could have been prerendered by the Omnibox Prerender system. This provides an upper bound for Prerender.OmniboxNavigationsUsedPrerenderCount and allows the potential for Omnibox Prerendering coverage to be understood. If Omnibox Prerendering is disabled, this histogram will register a 'false' entry. The total count is the equivalent of the deprecated NetworkActionPredictor.NavigationCount histogram.

histogram.name: Prerender.OmniboxNavigationsUsedPrerenderCount
histogram.summary: The number of navigations that use a prerender initiated from the Omnibox. The count is incremented when the Prerendered tab is swapped in if the Prerender was initiated by the Omnibox, which obviously requires Prerendering from the Omnibox to be enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.OmniboxPrerenderCount
histogram.summary: The number of prerenders initiated from the Omnibox. This is incremented when the NetworkActionPredictor suggests Prerendering as an optimal strategy given the text the user has entered and the Autocomplete suggestion currently selected. It is only incremented if Prerendering from the Omnibox is enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PagespeedHeader.ServerCounts
histogram.summary: The number of responses received bucketed into the range [0,4]: bucket 0 is the total number of responses received; bucket 1 is the number of responses received with an X-Mod-Pagespeed header [indicating a mod_pagespeed server]; bucket 2 is the number of responses received with an X-Page-Speed header and a header value in the X-Mod-Pagespeed format (a.b.c.d-e) [indicating an ngx_pagespeed server]; bucket 3 is the number of responses received with an X-Page-Speed header and a header value in the PageSpeed Service format (a_b_c) [indicating a PSS server]; and bucket 4 is the number of responses received with an X-Page-Speed header and a header value in neither of the preceding formats [indicating some other server; IISpeed is the only known one at this stage].

histogram.name: Prerender.PagespeedHeader.VersionCounts
histogram.summary: The number of responses received that either have an X-Mod-Pagespeed header or have an X-Page-Speed header with a value in the X-Mod-Pagespeed format (a.b.c.d-e), bucketed into the range [1,99]: bucket 1 is for header values that aren't in the a.b.c.d-e format, the remaining buckets are an encoding of the value: 2 + 2 * (max(c, 10) - 10) + (d > 1 ? 1 : 0). The rationale is that 'c' is incremented with each new release and 'd' is initially 0 but is incremented for each patch to a release.

histogram.name: Prerender.PageviewEvents
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Types of pages rendered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PageVisitedStatus
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the user has ever visited (in the past) a URL for which a prerender is launched.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_Control
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This particular histogram is for all page loads for users who do not have prerendering enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_PrerenderMatchControl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This particular histogram is only for pages that would have been prerendered if the user had prerender enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_PrerenderMatchTreatment
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This particular histogram is for all prerendered page loads for users who have prerender enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_Treatment
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This particular histogram is for all page loads for users who have prerendering enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_WindowControl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This particular histogram is for all page loads within 30 seconds after a prefetch tag is seen for users who do not have prerendering enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_WindowTreatment
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load pre navigation.
This particular histogram is for all page loads within 30 seconds after a prefetch tag is seen for users who have prerendering enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLT
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for all pages loaded in a session.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMiss
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for the first page load completing immediately after a prerender.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissAnyOnly
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
"FirstAfterMiss" means the first pageload after a prerender miss. There are two types: Any, and Non-overlapping. The latter only applies to page loads initiated after the prerender. This variable records cases where only Any triggered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissBoth
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
"FirstAfterMiss" means the first pageload after a prerender miss. There are two types: Any, and Non-overlapping. The latter only applies to page loads initiated after the prerender. This variable records cases where both triggered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissNonOverlapping
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for the first page load completing immediately after a prerender, but which has also started after the prerender has been initiated.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissNonOverlappingOnly
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
"FirstAfterMiss" means the first pageload after a prerender miss. There are two types: Any, and Non-overlapping. The latter only applies to page loads initiated after the prerender. This variable records cases where only Non-overlapping triggered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTMatched
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded only for prerendered pages, or for pages which would have been prerendered in the control case.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTMatchedComplete
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded only for prerendered pages, or for pages which would have been prerendered in the control case.
In MatchedComplete, the prerender group also contains cancelled prerenders, so as to produce a perfect match of page views attributed this group in the prerender group with those attributed to this group in the control group.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTWindowed
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for all page loads which happen within 30 seconds after a prefetch tag is observed.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTWindowNotMatched
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for all page loads which happen within 30 seconds after a prefetch tag is observed and which do not correspond to a prerender tag.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedTTFCPRecorded
histogram.summary: Whether the perceived Time to First Contentful Paint (TTFCP) was recorded successfully for a prerendered page. Since a prerendered page will start loading before a user navigates to it, the perceived TTFCP does not include an time prior to the user navigation. If true, there is an associated PrefetchTTFCP that records the TTFCP from the swapped-in navigation start. If false, no PrefetchTTFCP was recorded.

histogram.name: Prerender.PercentLoadDoneAtSwapin
histogram.summary: For prerenders that are swapped in, the percentage of the time from load start until the onload event fires that has elapsed at the time of the swapin.

histogram.name: Prerender.PeriodicCleanupDeleteContentsTime
histogram.summary: How long the cleanup portion of PrerenderManager::PeriodicCleanup takes, to measure jank.

histogram.name: Prerender.PeriodicCleanupResourceCheckTime
histogram.summary: How long the resource check portion of PrerenderManager::PeriodicCleanup takes, to measure jank.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrefetchAge
histogram.summary: Time between a prefetch or effective prefetch and the actual load of the page. For NoState prefetch, this is the time of the actual prefetch. For prerendering, it is the time that prerender began. For control groups in NoState prefetch experiments, it is the time that prefetch would have occurred.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrefetchTTFCP
histogram.summary: Time to first contentful paint (TTFCP) for navigations related to prefetch (including prerender, no-state prefetch, and associated experiments). This measures user-visible TTFCP. For no-state prefetch this is standard navigation-to-FCP; for prerender this is the time from navigation start when the prerender is swapped in to FCP.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrerenderCountOf3Max
histogram.summary: After launching a prerender, how many simultanious prerenders are recorded as running, out of a maximum of three.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrerenderNotSwappedInPLT
histogram.summary: For prerenders that finish loading before they are ever swapped in, their page load time until the onload event fires.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrerendersPerSessionCount
histogram.summary: The number of sessions that have at least X successful prerenders.

histogram.name: Prerender.RelTypesLinkAdded
histogram.summary: For each prerender link added to a document, records the rel types present on the link element.

histogram.name: Prerender.RelTypesLinkStarted
histogram.summary: For each prerender in a document which starts prerendering, records the rel types present on the link element.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererIdleTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This is the time from when a prerendered page finishes loading to when it is displayed, as measured by the renderer process. When a page is displayed before it finishes loading, no value is recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererPerceivedPLT
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a page, as measured by the renderer process. For non-prerendered pages, this is just BeginToFinish. For displayed prerendered pages, this is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererPerceivedPLTMatched
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a prerendered page that is displayed, as measured by the renderer process. This is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererTimeUntilDisplay
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between when the prerendering of a page starts and when the page is displayed, as measured by the renderer process. Prerendered pages discarded without being displayed are excluded from this count.

histogram.name: Prerender.SchemeCancelReason
histogram.summary: The detailed reason why a prerender is canceled with FINAL_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_SCHEME

histogram.name: Prerender.Sessions
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Enumeration of how prerender was used per session.

histogram.name: Prerender.SessionStorageNamespaceMergeTime
histogram.summary: Time to perform the session storage namespace merge.

histogram.name: Prerender.SimulatedLocalBrowsingBaselinePLT
histogram.summary: For simulated local browsing prerendering, the baseline PLT of pages without any prerendering for pages that would be prerendered.

histogram.name: Prerender.SimulatedLocalBrowsingPLT
histogram.summary: For simulated local browsing prerendering, the estimated PLT of pages with prerendering enabled for pages that would be prerendered.

histogram.name: Prerender.TabContentsDeleterSuppressedDialog
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates how often we suppress a dialog from a tab when swapping it with a prerender.

histogram.name: Prerender.TabContentsDeleterTimeout
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates how often we fail to delete an old prerendered tab before the timeout.

histogram.name: Prerender.TabHelperEvent
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what events related to the TabHelper class have occurred.

histogram.name: Prerender.TimeBetweenPrerenderRequests
histogram.summary: Time between subsequent prerender requests.

histogram.name: Prerender.TimeSinceLastRecentVisit
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the most recent visit to a URL and when an attempted prerender of the same URL is cancelled with FINAL_STATUS_RECENTLY_VISITED.

histogram.name: Prerender.TimeToClick
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration that a user hovers a link before clicking on it.

histogram.name: Prerender.TimeUntilUsed
histogram.obsolete: deprecated Nov 16 2012. See Prerender.TimeUntilUsed2, which has a larger range.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from when a prerendered page is started to when it is first used due to user navigation. If the page is never used, it is not included in this histogram.

histogram.name: Prerender.TimeUntilUsed2
histogram.summary: Time from when a prerendered page is started to when it is first used due to user navigation. If the page is never used, it is not included in this histogram.

histogram.name: Previews.ContentLength
histogram.summary: The actual data used for a page load using a preview optimization.

histogram.name: Previews.ContextMenuAction.LoFi
histogram.summary:
User interactions with the Lo-Fi context menu options. These include:
Displays and clicks on the "Load image" and "Load images" context menu options. Count of pages where the user has clicked "Load image" at least once.

histogram.name: Previews.DataInflation
histogram.summary: The estimated amount that the content was inflated for a page load using a previews optimization. Recorded when a page load using a previews optimization inflates the data used.

histogram.name: Previews.DataInflationPercent
histogram.summary: The estimated percent of data used that a page load would have otherwise cost for a page load using a previews optimization. Recorded when a page load using a previews optimization inflates the data used.

histogram.name: Previews.DataSavings
histogram.summary: The estimated data savings for a page load using a previews optimization. Recorded when a page load using a previews optimization reduces the data used.

histogram.name: Previews.DataSavingsPercent
histogram.summary: The estimated percent of data savings for a page load using a previews optimization. Recorded when a page load using a previews optimization reduces the data used.

histogram.name: Previews.EligibilityReason
histogram.summary: When evaluating whether to show a user a preview, the preview might be disallowed for various reasons. If the preview is disallowed, then this reports the reason for disallowing it. If the preview is allowed, then this reports "Previews Allowed".

histogram.name: Previews.InfoBarAction
histogram.summary:
User interactions with the previews "Saved data" infobar. These include:
Displays of the infobar and clicks on the "Load original" link. Whether the infobar was dismissed by navigation or the user clicking on "X" close button.

histogram.name: Previews.OptOut.DBRowCount
histogram.summary: The number of rows in the Previews opt out SQLite table at profile startup.

histogram.name: Previews.OptOut.UserOptedOut
histogram.summary: Whether the user chose to reload the original page when shown a preview.

histogram.name: Previews.OriginalContentLength
histogram.summary: The estimated content length of a page load using a preview optimization.

histogram.name: PrinterService.PrinterServiceEvent
histogram.summary: Count of events in PrinterService on ChromeOS related to USB printers.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.DestinationAction
histogram.summary: Actions performed by the user when the print destination search widget is shown to the user.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.FontType
histogram.summary: Count of font file formats embeeded in print preview PDFs. These numbers are biased by what the platforms supports in terms of detection.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.GcpPromo
histogram.summary: Actions performed by the user when the Google Cloud Print add-printers promotion is shown to the user.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.InitialDisplayTime
histogram.summary: Time from when print preview is intiated until the intial preview is sent to the preview tab for rendering.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.InitializationTime
histogram.summary: Time from when print preview is intiated until the preview PDF generation is started.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.InitiatedByScript
histogram.summary: Logged when a document calls the window.print() API. The boolean value indicates whether it is invoked by the main frame. It will be false for documents in subframes.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.ManagePrinters
histogram.summary: Count the number of requests received to show the manage printers dialog.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.NumberOfPrinters
histogram.summary: Count the total number of printers shown in destination drop down list.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.OutOfProcessSubframe
histogram.summary: Logged when a document calls the window.print() API in any frame. The boolean value will be true when the API call is invoked by a document which is in a process different than the top level document. It will be false in all other cases.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.Initial
histogram.summary: The page count of the initial print preview, a.k.a. the total number of pages in documents to be printed.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintToCloudPrint
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to a cloud printer.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintToCloudPrintWebDialog
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to a cloud printer using web dialog.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintToPDF
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to PDF.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintToPrinter
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to a printer.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintWithExtension
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to an extension printer (using printerProvider API).

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintWithPrivet
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to a privet printer.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.SystemDialog
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed using system dialog.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PreviewEvent
histogram.summary: Print preview events.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PrintDocumentType
