histogram.summary: Track type of documents printed (HTML vs PDF). Recorded immediately after a user requests that a document be printed.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PrintSettings
histogram.summary: Track the popularity of print settings. (Settings when printing to PDF are excluded from this statistic.)

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PrintSettingsUi
histogram.summary: Actions performed by the user interacting with print settings UI elements.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.RegeneratePreviewRequest.BeforeCancel
histogram.summary: The number of times regenerate preview requests received before the user clicked the cancel button.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.RegeneratePreviewRequest.BeforeFirstData
histogram.summary: The number of times regenerate preview requests received before the first preview data is availible.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.RegeneratePreviewRequest.BeforePrint
histogram.summary: The number of times regenerate preview requests received before the user clicked the print button.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.RenderAndGeneratePDFTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to render and generate PDF for print preview. (Includes time to reflow the page back to normal, but not the time to reflow the page to prepare for printing.)

histogram.name: PrintPreview.RenderAndGeneratePDFTimeAvgPerPage
histogram.summary: Time taken to render and generate PDF for print preview divided by the number of pages. (Includes time to reflow the page back to normal, but not the time to reflow the page to prepare for printing.)

histogram.name: PrintPreview.RendererError
histogram.summary: Count how frequently a set of pre-defined print preview errors occur.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.RenderPDFPageTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to render each PDF page for print preview.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.RenderToPDFTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to render to PDF for print preview.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.UserAction
histogram.summary: Action taken by the user in the preview tab such as print, cancel, print to pdf and show advanced print settings dialog.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.FlagOverrodeRemoteSessionCheck
histogram.summary: Measure how often the automatic recognition for terminal services environment would have incorrectly decided that the job object should be applied, when it shouldn't have been as dictated by the flag --allow-no-sanbox-job. This histogram will guide the final removal of the flag, which will be possible when the number of false values becomes insignificant.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.Launch.Error
histogram.summary: Errors returned while launching sandboxed process on Windows. For decoding error code please refer to http://goo.gl/fJJiAv.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.Launch.Warning
histogram.summary: Warnings returned while launching sandboxed process on Windows. For decoding error code please refer to http://goo.gl/fJJiAv. This will only be logged when SpawnTarget succeeds with SBOX_ALL_OK but the last warning result does not equal SBOX_ALL_OK.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.Launch.WarningResultCode
histogram.summary: The warning launch error returned while launching sandboxed process on Windows. This will only be logged when SpawnTarget succeeds with SBOX_ALL_OK but the last warning result does not equal SBOX_ALL_OK.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.Lowbox.Launch.Error
histogram.summary: Errors returned while launching lowbox enabled sandboxed process on Windows. For decoding error code please refer to http://goo.gl/fJJiAv.

histogram.name: Profile.AddNewUser
histogram.summary: The frequency of ways that new user profiles are added.

histogram.name: Profile.AndroidAccountManagementMenu
histogram.summary: Track user interactions that can be performed in the Android account management menu.

histogram.name: Profile.AppCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of installed apps when a profile is opened.

histogram.name: Profile.AuthResult
histogram.summary: Counts of authorization results when trying to open a locked profile from the User Manager.

histogram.name: Profile.Avatar
histogram.summary: The frequency of selection of each avatar.

histogram.name: Profile.BookmarksSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the bookmarks database.

histogram.name: Profile.CookiesSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the cookies database.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateAndInitializeProfile
histogram.summary: Length of time to setup profile.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateBrowserContextServicesTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the CreateBrowserContextServices call within OnPrefsLoaded.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateProfileHelperTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ProfileManager::CreateProfileHelper. This is called when a profile is created synchronously (usually at startup).

histogram.name: Profile.CreateResult
histogram.summary: Result (final status) when creating a new profile.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Back-end time elapsed while creating a new profile. The max is 30 seconds, when an external timeout was applied.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateTimeCanceled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed before the user decided to cancel creation of a new profile. Since only managed-user profile creation can be canceled, this time comes from managed-user registration. The max is 30 seconds, when an external timeout was applied.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateTimeCanceledNoTimeout
histogram.summary: Time elapsed from when the handler received the message that a user clicked 'Create' until the user decided to cancel creation of a new profile. Since only managed-user profile creation can be canceled, this time comes from managed-user registration.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateTimeNoTimeout
histogram.summary: Time elapsed from when the handler received the message that a user clicked 'Create' until the creation either failed with a local error (see Profile.CreateResult), was canceled (also recorded in Profile.CreateTimeCanceledNoTimeout), or completed successfully.

histogram.name: Profile.Delete
histogram.summary: This histogram tracks the deletion of the profile. This tracks when the cleanup actually takes place, not the UI interaction. The parameter indicates if the profile was signed in or not; true means the profile was signed in, false means the profile was not signed in.

histogram.name: Profile.DeleteProfileAction
histogram.summary: This histogram tracks which UI screen was used to initiate and confirm the deletion of a profile. This does not track when the profile is actually deleted, which is an asynchronous process that happens later.

histogram.name: Profile.DesktopMenu
histogram.summary: Track user interactions that can be performed in the user menu and user manager. The origin of the action, whether the an interaction in the content area or some other source, is noted in the histogram suffix.

histogram.name: Profile.ExtensionSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the extension cookies database.

histogram.name: Profile.FaviconsSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the favicons database.

histogram.name: Profile.GetProfile
histogram.summary: Length of time to retrieve profile.

histogram.name: Profile.GetProfileInfoPath.OutsideUserDir
histogram.summary: Whether Profile::GetProfileInfoPath is called with a profile outside the user data directory. We expect this to never happen but need to verify in stable. This metric may be removed after M54.

histogram.name: Profile.HistorySize
histogram.summary: Size of the history database.

histogram.name: Profile.InitProfileUserPrefs.OutsideUserDir
histogram.summary: Whether Profile::InitProfileUserPrefs is called with a profile outside the user data directory. We expect this to never happen but need to verify in stable. This metric may be removed after M54.

histogram.name: Profile.LaunchBrowser
histogram.summary: Number of times users launch a browser window from either a primary or secondary profile (i.e., each time a browser window is opened we log which type of profile it belongs to).

histogram.name: Profile.LockedProfilesDuration
histogram.summary: How long locked profiles have been locked for. This is logged each time any profile is loaded. Note that this does not track the total time the profile was locked, but rather the span from when the profile was locked to when the measurement takes place.

histogram.name: Profile.NetUserCount
histogram.summary: Counts of users added and deleted. Percentages are not meaningful. Please look at the ratio of the counts/percentages.

histogram.name: Profile.NewAvatarMenu.NotYou
histogram.summary: Tracks user interactions with the 'Not You?' bubble that users can navigate to from the Upgrade bubble after upgrade to the New Avatar Menu.

histogram.name: Profile.NewAvatarMenu.Signin
histogram.summary: Tracks user interactions with the signin bubble that appears in the New Avatar Menu upon signin. This bubble appears after the user signs in using the Inline Signin flow.

histogram.name: Profile.NewAvatarMenu.Upgrade
histogram.summary: Tracks user interactions with the bubble that appears for users in the new avatar menu after upgrade.

histogram.name: Profile.NotifyProfileCreatedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the Notify() of NOTIFICATION_PROFILE_CREATED during ProfileImpl::DoFinalInit().

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfAccountsPerProfile
histogram.summary: Counts the number of Google-managed accounts linked to a profile. This may be counted multiple times per profile. Please review with the "Show user counts" option enabled on the dashboard.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfManagedProfiles
histogram.summary: Counts the number of locally managed profiles on a user's machine at least every 24 hours while Chrome is running, among cases with at least one profile. Always de-dupe the results with Show User Counts.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfProfiles
histogram.summary: Counts the number of profiles on a user's machine at least every 24 hours while Chrome is running. Always de-dupe the results with Show User Counts.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfProfilesAfterAddOrDelete
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-04-09. No longer tracked. See Profile.NumberOfProfiles.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of profiles on a user's machine whenever a profile is added or deleted.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfProfilesOnStartup
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated; replaced by Profile.NumberOfProfiles on 2013-04-09. Data are suspect, especially after 2012-02-24: see https://crbug.com/189213.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of profiles on a user's machine when Chrome starts up.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfProfilesWithAuthErrors
histogram.summary: Counts the type GAIA authentication errors on a user's machine when Chrome starts up. The types of errors are broken down in Signin.AuthError.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfSignedInProfiles
histogram.summary: Counts the number of signed-in profiles on a user's machine at least every 24 hours while Chrome is running. Always de-dupe the results with Show User Counts.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfSignedInProfilesOnStartup
histogram.summary: Counts the number of profiles that are signed in to Chrome when Chrome starts up.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfSignedInProfilesWithGAIAIcons
histogram.summary: Counts the number of signed-in profiles that are using the GAIA image as the avatar icon. This is counted at least every 24 hours while Chrome is running, so always de-dupe the results with Show User Counts.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfSwitches
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times profiles were switched in a browser session. This value is incremented when a profile is switched to and the result is logged during shutdown.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfUnusedProfiles
histogram.summary: Counts the number of profiles unused within the past 28 days on a user's machine. This is counts at least every 24 hours while Chrome is running, so always de-dupe the results with Show User Counts.

histogram.name: Profile.OnLocaleReadyTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ProfileImpl::OnLocaleReady. This happens once after profile was loaded.

histogram.name: Profile.OnPrefsLoadedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ProfileImpl::OnPrefsLoaded.

histogram.name: Profile.Opening
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it did not present the information clearly.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The frequency of ways that the profiles are opened.

histogram.name: Profile.OpenMethod
histogram.summary: The frequency with which the user opens the different profile menus or switches profiles. For the open statistics, this does not mean the user necessarily opened a profile after clicking. The switch statistics indicate how often and how the user switches profiles. They are provided together for comparison of how often the user actually switches after opening the avatar bubble menu.

histogram.name: Profile.PercentageOfManagedProfiles
histogram.summary: Tracks the percentage (0-100) of profiles that are locally managed, recorded when Chrome starts up.

histogram.name: Profile.ProfileError
histogram.summary: The error with the current user profile that caused an error dialog to be shown. This dialog is shown usually when there is some sort of corruption in the user's profile data.

histogram.name: Profile.ProfileImplDoFinalInit
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the ProfileImpl::DoFinalInit().

histogram.name: Profile.SupervisedProfileCreateError
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The error code generated in the final step (registration step) of creating a new supervised profile.

histogram.name: Profile.SupervisedProfileImportError
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The error code generated in the final step (registration step) of importing a supervised profile.

histogram.name: Profile.SupervisedProfileTotalCreateTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed from when the handler received the message that a user clicked 'Create' to create a new supervised user profile until the registration ends either successfully or with a failure (both recorded in Profile.SupervisedProfileCreateResult).

histogram.name: Profile.SupervisedProfileTotalImportTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed from when the handler received the message that a user clicked 'Import supervised user' until the registration ends either successfully or with a failure (both recorded in Profile.SupervisedProfileImportResult).

histogram.name: Profile.SwitchGaiaPhotoSettings
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts of when users switch to using their GAIA photo instead of an avatar icon or the opposite when they switch back to an avatar icon instead of their GAIA photo.

histogram.name: Profile.Sync
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it did not present the information clearly.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Activity of the user with regards to sync.

histogram.name: Profile.SyncCustomize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times and ways the user customized the sync options of their profile. Percentages are not meaningful. To determine percentages, take the count of a given action over the count of number of customizations.

histogram.name: Profile.SyncSignIn
histogram.summary: Number of times the user signed into sync from original or secondary profile.

histogram.name: Profile.ThumbnailsSize
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the thumbnails database.

histogram.name: Profile.TimeToOpenUserManager
histogram.summary: Time required to open the UserManager, from when it started to show until when its javascript started executing.

histogram.name: Profile.TopSitesSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the top sites database.

histogram.name: Profile.TotalHistorySize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Total size of all history databases.

histogram.name: Profile.TotalSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Total size of the profile data (excluding sub-folders).

histogram.name: Profile.TriggeredReset
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a profile had a reset trigger that caused it to launch a reset flow. The presence of this trigger is recorded during profile creation.

histogram.name: Profile.Update
histogram.summary: Times a profile name and/or avatar was updated.

histogram.name: Profile.UpgradeEnrollment
histogram.summary: The process which leads a user to enroll in New Profile Management. Also tracks if the user chooses to opt out, and tutorials which guide the user into New Profile Management.

histogram.name: Profile.ValidateMenuItemInvalidIndex.IsGuest
histogram.summary: Whether the active profile is a guest profile when -validateMenuItem in the ProfileMenuController gets an invalid value for the current profile's index.

histogram.name: Profile.ValidateMenuItemInvalidIndex.ProfileCount
histogram.summary: The count of profiles in the avatar menu when -validateMenuItem in the ProfileMenuController gets an invalid value for the current profile's index.

histogram.name: Profile.ValidateMenuItemInvalidIndex.Selector
histogram.summary: The selector associated with the menu item when -validateMenuItem in the ProfileMenuController gets an invalid value for the current profile's index.

histogram.name: Profile.VisitedLinksSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the visited links database.

histogram.name: Profile.WebDataSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the web data database.

histogram.name: ProfileReset.ResetRequestOrigin
histogram.summary: Encodes from where the request for resetting the profile settings originated.

histogram.name: ProfileReset.SendFeedback
histogram.summary: Signifies if the user selected "Send feedback" checkbox in the Reset Profile dialog.

histogram.name: Protector.DefaultSearchProvider
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Errors that Protector detects about default search provider in Web Data. Reported once when Web Data is loaded.

histogram.name: Protector.Preferences
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Errors that Protector detects about protected settings in Preferences. Reported once when profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Protector.SearchProvider
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When the default search provider setting is changed outside of Chrome, which is detected by the Protector, this histogram reports the new setting.

histogram.name: Protector.StartupSettings
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When the startup settings are changed outside of Chrome, which is detected by the Protector, this histogram reports the new setting.

histogram.name: ProxyOverriddenBubble.ExtensionCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 9/2016. Never added to histograms.xml and value is always 1.
histogram.summary: The number of extensions overriding the proxy, triggering the proxy override extension warning bubble.

histogram.name: ProxyOverriddenBubble.UserSelection
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when the "proxy overridden" extension warning bubble is shown. Logged immediately after the action is taken.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Experimental.MemoryGrowth
histogram.summary: The growth of the background renderer's memory usage after a background renderer is purged. This is recorded 5, 10 and 15 minutes after the purge.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Experimental.TimeToFirstActivePaint
histogram.summary: Time elapsed from when the backgrounded and purged renderer is foregrounded until the renderer is painted. This is recorded every time the backgrounded and purged renderer is foregrounded.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.BlinkGCKB
histogram.summary: The memory usage of the BlinkGC allocator after a background renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.DiscardableKB
histogram.summary: The memory usage of the discardable memory after a background renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.MallocMB
histogram.summary: The memory usage of the malloc after a background renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.PartitionAllocKB
histogram.summary: The memory usage of PartitionAlloc after a background renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.TotalAllocatedMB
histogram.summary: The sum of the memory usages of PartitionAlloc, malloc, discardable memory, mainThreadIsolate() and BlinkGC allocator after a backgrounded renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.V8MainThreadIsolateMB
histogram.summary: The memory usage of mainThreadIsolate() after a backgrounded renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.PendingTaskCount
histogram.summary: This records how many tasks are still in task queues when a backgrounded renderer is suspended.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.BackgroundBudget
histogram.summary: Whenever a Service Worker receives a push message, this records the budget available to the service worker, which is an internal Chrome value for the amount of background processing a service worker is allowed to do without visibly alerting the user. Scale for the budget is 0 to 100.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.DeliveryStatus
histogram.summary: When a Service Worker receives a push message, this records whether the overall operation was successful, or otherwise the type of error encountered.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.DeliveryStatus.FindServiceWorker
histogram.summary: When attempting to deliver a push message to a Service Worker, this records the result of finding the Service Worker registration given its ID and origin.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.DeliveryStatus.ServiceWorkerEvent
histogram.summary: When a Service Worker receives a push message, this records the precise result received from the Service Worker code.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.GetRegistrationStatus
histogram.summary: When a webpage asks for details about its current push messaging registration, this records whether the request is successful, or otherwise the type of error encountered.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.ReceivedMessageInBackground
histogram.summary: Whenever a Service Worker receives a push message, this records whether Chrome is completely running in the background. A successful report means that the message was received when Chrome was in complete background mode, without UI, while a failure means it was in some other state: in background with some apps running, showing browser windows, etc.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.RegistrationStatus
histogram.summary: When a webpage registers for push messaging, this records whether the request is successful, or otherwise the type of error encountered.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.SESForLowBudgetOrigin
histogram.summary: When a Service Worker hits low budget when servicing a push message, this records what the Site Engagement Service score is at that time.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.SESForNoBudgetOrigin
histogram.summary: When a Service Worker hits zero budget when servicing a push message, this records what the Site Engagement Service score is at that time.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.UnregistrationGCMResult
histogram.summary: When unregistering a legacy non-InstanceID push messaging subscription, this records the result returned by the GCMDriver (note that exceeding the maximum number of retries due to network errors is logged as SERVER_ERROR).

histogram.name: PushMessaging.UnregistrationIIDResult
histogram.summary: When unregistering an InstanceID push messaging subscription, this records the result returned from deleting the InstanceID (note that exceeding the maximum number of retries due to network errors is logged as SERVER_ERROR).

histogram.name: PushMessaging.UnregistrationReason
histogram.summary: When unregistering a website from push messaging, this records the reason why it is being unregistered.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.UnregistrationStatus
histogram.summary: When unregistering a website from push messaging, this records whether the request is successful, or otherwise the type of error encountered.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.UserVisibleStatus
histogram.summary: When a Service Worker receives a push message, this records whether it showed user-visible UX (like a notification), or whether we showed a forced notification on its behalf.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.csvFormattedCellCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of cells that contain formatting data in the default worksheet when a comma separated value spreadsheet is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.csvNonEmptyCellCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of non-empty cells in the default worksheet when a comma separated value spreadsheet is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.csvSheetCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of worksheets when a comma separated value spreadsheet is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.docPageCount
histogram.summary: Records the page count when a compound binary format document is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.docParagraphCount
histogram.summary: Records the paragraph count when a compound binary format document is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.docSectionCount
histogram.summary: Records the section count when a compound binary format document is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.docxPageCount
histogram.summary: Records the page count when an OOXML format document is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.docxParagraphCount
histogram.summary: Records the paragraph count when an OOXML format document is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.docxSectionCount
histogram.summary: Records the section count when an OOXML format document is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.ErrorTypes
histogram.summary: Records the various different error types encountered when opening and reading MS Office file formats in the Quickoffice viewer. These range from Nacl crashes and uncaught javascript exceptions to document errors inside Quickoffice Web Toolkit (eg QOWT). The errors are recorded against the file format in which they occurred.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.FileFormat
histogram.summary: Records the various different file types supported by Quickoffice (like MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint files) when they opened in the browser to measure which file formats are most popular.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.pptMasterCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of slide masters when a compound binary format presentation is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.pptSlideCount
histogram.summary: Records the slide count when a compound binary format presentation is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.pptxMasterCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of slide masters when an OOXML format presentation is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.pptxSlideCount
histogram.summary: Records the slide count when an OOXML format presentation is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.xlsFormattedCellCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of cells that contain formatting data in the default worksheet when a compound binary format spreadsheet is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.xlsNonEmptyCellCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of non-empty cells in the default worksheet when a compound binary format spreadsheet is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.xlsSheetCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of worksheets when a compound binary format spreadsheet is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.xlsxFormattedCellCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of cells that contain formatting data in the default worksheet when an OOXML format spreadsheet is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.xlsxNonEmptyCellCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of non-empty cells when an OOXML format spreadsheet is opened.

histogram.name: Quickoffice.xlsxSheetCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of worksheets when an OOXML format spreadsheet is opened.

histogram.name: Quota.AgeOfDataInDays
histogram.summary: How many kilobytes are how old. Similar to |AgeOfOrigin| except a sample is added for each kilobyte of an origin's data. Logged hourly for all origins with stored data.

histogram.name: Quota.AgeOfOriginInDays
histogram.summary: How many days it's been since an origin's temporary storage has been accessed. Logged hourly for all origins with stored data.

histogram.name: Quota.AvailableDiskSpace
histogram.summary: Amount of free disk space for the storage directory. Logged at irregular intervals.

histogram.name: Quota.DaysBetweenRepeatedOriginEvictions
histogram.summary: The number of days since an origin was last chosen to be evicted from the storage, recorded each time the origin is evicted (except for the first eviction).

histogram.name: Quota.DaysSinceLastAccess
histogram.summary: The number of days since an origin's data was last accessed. Logged upon access when the time since last access is at least 24 hours.

histogram.name: Quota.DiskspaceShortage
histogram.summary: Difference between acceptable lower limit of diskspace and actual free diskspace at beginning of an eviction round.

histogram.name: Quota.ErrorsOnEvictingOriginPerHour
histogram.summary: Number of errors on evicting origin by QuotaTemporaryStorageEvictor in an hour.

histogram.name: Quota.ErrorsOnGettingUsageAndQuotaPerHour
histogram.summary: Number of errors on getting usage and quota by QuotaTemporaryStorageEvictor in an hour.

histogram.name: Quota.EvictedBytesPerRound
histogram.summary: Amount of usage used by evicted origins in an eviction round.

histogram.name: Quota.EvictedOriginAccessCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the evicted origin was accessed. Logged when the origin is evicted.

histogram.name: Quota.EvictedOriginDaysSinceAccess
histogram.summary: The number of days since the evicted origin was last accessed. Logged when the origin is evicted.

histogram.name: Quota.EvictedOriginsPerHour
histogram.summary: Number of evicted origins in an hour.

histogram.name: Quota.EvictedOriginTimeSinceAccess
histogram.summary: The time since the evicted origin was last accessed. Logged when the origin is evicted.

histogram.name: Quota.EvictionRoundsPerHour
histogram.summary: Number of eviction rounds in an hour.

histogram.name: Quota.FreeDiskSpaceForProfile
histogram.summary: Amount of free disk space for profile directory.

histogram.name: Quota.GlobalTemporaryPoolSize
histogram.summary: The size of the global temporary storage pool. Logged at irregular intervals.

histogram.name: Quota.GlobalUsageOfPersistentStorage
histogram.summary: Global usage of persistent storage.

histogram.name: Quota.GlobalUsageOfTemporaryStorage
histogram.summary: Global usage of temporary storage.

histogram.name: Quota.InitialTemporaryGlobalStorageQuota
histogram.summary: Initial quota for global temporary storage.

histogram.name: Quota.LRUOriginTypes
histogram.summary: Types of origins that are initially selected for eviction via LRU. Some of these types are exempt from eviction.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfEvictedOriginsPerRound
histogram.summary: Number of evicted origins per round.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfPersistentStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of origins using persistent storage.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfProtectedPersistentStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of protected origins using persistent storage.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfProtectedTemporaryStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of protected origins using temporary storage.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfTemporaryStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of origins using temporary storage.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfUnlimitedPersistentStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of unlimited origins using persistent storage.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfUnlimitedTemporaryStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of unlimited origins using temporary storage.

histogram.name: Quota.OSAccomodationDelta
histogram.summary: If our hardcoded OS accomodation is too large for the volume size, we define the value as a fraction of the total volume size instead. The OSAccomodationDelta is the difference between the hardcoded and computed values.

histogram.name: Quota.PercentDiskAvailable
histogram.summary: Percentage of the storage device that is free. Logged at irregular intervals.

histogram.name: Quota.PercentUsedByOrigin
histogram.summary: Percentage of an origin's quota that is being used by the origin. Logged at irregular intervals.

histogram.name: Quota.PercentUsedForTemporaryStorage
histogram.summary: Percentage of the storage device that ia being use for temporary storage. Logged at irregular intervals.

histogram.name: Quota.QuotaForOrigin
histogram.summary: The quota value computed for an origin using temporary storage. Logged at irregular intervals. (In the process of writing new data, storage systems consult the quota system for "usage and quota" to determine if there is sufficient space available for the new data. This value is logged at the time of that consultation. The frequency is dependent on how individual websites use the various storage apis.)

histogram.name: Quota.SkippedEvictionRoundsPerHour
histogram.summary: Number of skipped eviction rounds in an hour.

histogram.name: Quota.TimeBetweenRepeatedOriginEvictions
histogram.summary: Time since an origin was last chosen to be evicted from the storage, recorded each time the origin is evicted (except for the first eviction).

histogram.name: Quota.TimeDeltaOfEvictionRounds
histogram.summary: Time between two consecutive active eviction rounds.

histogram.name: Quota.TimeSpentToAEvictionRound
histogram.summary: Time spent to an eviction round.

histogram.name: Quota.TimeToGetSettings
histogram.summary: Time spent querying the embedder for the settings values. Logged at irregular intervals as the values are refreshed.

histogram.name: Quota.TimeToInitializeGlobalQuota
histogram.summary: Time spent initializing the global quota. Logged when the storage partition's quota manager is initialized.

histogram.name: Quota.TotalDiskSpace
histogram.summary: Total disk space for the storage directory. Logged at irregular intervals.

histogram.name: Quota.UsageOverageOfTemporaryGlobalStorage
histogram.summary: Overage of the temporary global storage usage at beginning of an eviction round.

histogram.name: Rappor.DailyEvent.IntervalType
histogram.summary: Counts how often daily interval events were fired.

histogram.name: Rappor.DiscardReason
histogram.summary: For each Rappor log that is discarded, the reason that it was discarded.

histogram.name: Rappor.FailedUploadErrorCode
histogram.summary: Net error codes for failed Rappor uploads.

histogram.name: rappor.last_daily_sample
histogram.summary: Rappor.DailyEvent.IntervalType reported under the wrong name.

histogram.name: Rappor.LoadCohortResult
histogram.summary: Success or errors encountered when loading Rappor cohort pref.

histogram.name: Rappor.LoadSecretResult
histogram.summary: Success or errors encountered when loading Rappor secret pref.

histogram.name: Rappor.UploadResponseCode
histogram.summary: For each upload to the Rappor server, log the response received from the server.

histogram.name: ReadingList.ContextMenu
histogram.summary: The action chosen by the user after displaying the reading list context menu.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Download.Failures
histogram.summary: Number of tries before the download of the entry is successful.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Download.Status
histogram.summary: Final status of the download of a reading list entry.

histogram.name: ReadingList.FirstReadAgeOnDeletion
histogram.summary: Time since the first read of the reading list entry getting deleted. 0 if it has never been read.

histogram.name: ReadingList.OfflineVersionDisplayed
histogram.summary: Whether the displayed version is the offline one.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Read.AgeOnDeletion
histogram.summary: Time since the creation of the read reading list entry getting deleted.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Read.Number
histogram.summary: Number of read entries in reading list.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Unread.AgeOnDeletion
histogram.summary: Time since the creation of the unread reading list entry getting deleted.

histogram.name: ReadingList.Unread.Number
histogram.summary: Number of unread entries in reading list.

histogram.name: RecoveryComponent.Event
histogram.summary: Log each stage of a recovery component event.

histogram.name: Render.Workers.MaxWorkerCountInRendererProcess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated Dec 2016. This metric did not report the number of shared workers correctly, since it used the RenderProcessHostImpl ref counts, which in the shared worker case is more like a boolean flag (zero or one or maybe two) than the number of shared workers. So its results can be thought of as roughly the number of service workers only.
histogram.summary: Maximum number of workers (SharedWorker or ServiceWorker) that are simultaneously hosted in a single renderer process. Recorded when the renderer process host is being destructed.

histogram.name: Renderer.AcceleratedFixedRootBackground
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Keeps track of the number of main frame scrolls with an accelerated fixed root background, the number of main frame scrolls with an unaccelerated fixed root background, and the total number of main frame scrolls.

histogram.name: Renderer.CompositedScrolling
histogram.summary: Total count of the number of RenderLayers which are scrollable areas, need to be promoted to stacking containers, and will use composited scrolling. Each bucket is sampled at most once per RenderLayer, when the RenderLayer first becomes scrollable, first needs to become a stacking container, and first uses composited scrolling, respectively.

histogram.name: Renderer.DrawDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Scheduling.Renderer.DrawDuration. This metric did not differentiate between processes.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the compositor to draw a frame.

histogram.name: Renderer.DrawDurationOverestimate
histogram.summary: The amount by which the compositor's draw duration was overestimated in a particular frame (0 if the duration was perfectly predicted or underestimated).

histogram.name: Renderer.DrawDurationUnderestimate
histogram.summary: The amount by which the compositor's draw duration was underestimated in a particular frame (0 if the duration was perfectly predicted or overestimated).

histogram.name: Renderer.GpuLatency
histogram.summary: The delay between the compositor submitting a command to the GPU and that command executing on the GPU. This delay is measured once per frame.

histogram.name: Renderer.GpuLatencyOverestimate
histogram.summary: The amount by which GPU latency was overestimated in a particular frame (0 if the latency was perfectly predicted or underestimated).

histogram.name: Renderer.GpuLatencyUnderestimate
histogram.summary: The amount by which GPU latency was underestimated in a particular frame (0 if the latency was perfectly predicted or overestimated).

histogram.name: Renderer.Hung.MobileInfoBar.UserEvent
histogram.summary: Android: Records the terminal event associated with a hung renderer infobar. This includes both the explicit user actions as well as implicit dismissals, e.g., when the renderer regains responsiveness before the infobar is interactively dismissed.

histogram.name: Renderer.LayoutMs
histogram.summary: Duration of the FrameView::performLayout trace event, which occurs at most once per frame.

histogram.name: Renderer.LineLayoutMs
histogram.summary: Amount of time spent doing line layout during FrameView::performLayout.

histogram.name: Renderer.PixelIncreaseFromTransitions
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: A lower-bound on the percentage increase in memory that would result from promoting all layers that have a webkit-transition on opacity or transform.

histogram.name: Renderer.unloadEventsDurationMS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This measures how long all unload event handlers required to run whenever an unload event is processed.

histogram.name: Renderer.ViewportZoomBugCount
histogram.summary: [iOS] A boolean that is used to indicate that the WebKit rendering bug in http://crbug.com/583231 has occurred. This occurs when a page with no viewport tag is rendered with an unusable zoom scale. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: Renderer2.FinishDocToFinish
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a document finished loading to when all it's resources are also loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to when it is fully loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToFinish_L
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to when it is fully loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToFirstLayout
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to its first layout.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToStart
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to when it starts loading.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFinish
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page started loading to when it is fully loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFinishDoc
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page starts loading to when the main document is finished loading.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFirstLayout
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page starts loading to its first layout.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Abandoned
histogram.summary: Distribution of actual finished pages, vs abandoned pages, where we needed to declare a finish time prematurely since the page was being closed (exited).

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelContentPaintDurationMS
histogram.summary: Time spent by WebKit painting the page, in milliseconds, when the GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect non-root layers.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelContentPaintMegapixPerSecond
histogram.summary: WebKit paint throughput, measured in megapixels per second, when GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect non-root layers.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelDoDeferredUpdateDelay
histogram.summary: Time between frames when GPU acceleration is active.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelRootPaintDurationMS
histogram.summary: Time spent by WebKit painting the page, in milliseconds, when the GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect the root layer.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelRootPaintMegapixPerSecond
histogram.summary: WebKit paint throughput, measured in megapixels per second, when GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect the root layer.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AnimationCallbackDelayTime
histogram.summary: Time from when the animation callback was posted to when it ran.

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToCommit
histogram.summary: Time from "begin" to "commit." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document.

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFinish
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Time from "begin" to "first paint." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.summary: Time from "big" to "first paint after load." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Browser.PartialRasterPercentageSaved
histogram.summary: Percentage of pixels which would have been rastered, but were skipped due to the partial raster optimization. Logged for each raster task run in a Browser process. The histogram is suffixed by the RasterBufferProvider which is in use.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish doc." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish doc" == main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint after load." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CompositorScrollHitTestResult
histogram.summary: It's possible for compositor hit testing to determine conclusively that compositor thread scrolling can or cannot be done. It's also possible that the hit testing result is inconclusive. We would like to see the I-don't- know result as little as possible. This histogram tracks the ratios.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CompositorThreadImplDrawDelay
histogram.summary: Time between frames, as measured on the compositor thread. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CompositorTouchScrollUpdateThread
histogram.summary: Whether the scroll from touch is executed on main thread.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CompositorWheelScrollUpdateThread
histogram.summary: Whether the scroll from mouse wheel is executed on main thread.

histogram.name: Renderer4.drawPixelCountCulled
histogram.summary: Number of pixels that culling prevented being drawn to the screen, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.drawPixelCountOpaque
histogram.summary: Number of pixels drawn to the screen and known opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.drawPixelCountTranslucent
histogram.summary: Number of pixels drawn to the screen and not known opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.FinishDocToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "finish doc" to "finish." "Finish doc"== main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.FinishToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.summary: Time from "finish " to "first paint after load." "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GestureScrollingThreadStatus
histogram.summary: For every gesture, we record whether the scroll occurred on the main thread, on the compositor thread, or on the compositor thread but blocked on the main thread. The last case will happen when there is a blocking event listener.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuImageDecodeState
histogram.summary: Gpu image decode usage statistics. Images are decoded and locked prior to upload; this indicates how that decode is used during tile management.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuImageDecodeState.FirstLockWasted
histogram.summary: Indication whether the first lock of an image decode was wasted (image was not used). Images are decoded and locked prior to raster; this indicates whether the decode was used or not during the first lock.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuImageUploadState.FirstRefWasted
histogram.summary: Indication whether the first ref of a GPU image upload was wasted (not used in raster). Images are uploaded prior to raster; this indicates whether the upload was used during the first ref.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuImageUploadState.Used
histogram.summary: Indication whether the GPU image upload was used in raster. Images are uploaded prior to raster; this indicates whether the upload was used during raster.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuRasterizationEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether gpu rasterization is enabled (checked once after the page is painted for the first time).

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuRasterizationSuitableContent
histogram.summary: If gpu rasterization is enabled, whether the page contents are suitable for gpu rasterization (checked once after the page is painted for the first time).

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuRasterizationTriggered
histogram.summary: If gpu rasterization is enabled, whether it was triggered (checked once after the page is painted for the first time).

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuRasterizationUsed
histogram.summary: If gpu rasterization is enabled, whether it was actually used for the page (checked once after the page is painted for the first time).

histogram.name: Renderer4.IdealContentsScale
histogram.summary: The contents scale at which picture layer impl should be rasterized in order to appear crisp. This is also known as ideal contents scale. This value is recorded any time the ideal contents scale changes. Some examples of this are pinch-zoom and JavaScript transform changes.

histogram.name: Renderer4.ImageDecodeTaskDurationUs
histogram.summary: This metric records the duration of an image decode in the compositor. It is recorded every time we decode an image. It is suffixed by the type of rasterization we're in (either Gpu or Software).

histogram.name: Renderer4.InvalidationRegionApproximateRectCount
histogram.summary: Number of rects inside of a PictureLayer's invalidation region per commit.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LanguageDetection
histogram.summary: Time to determine the page language. This is done after the page has been loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LCDText.PercentageOfAALayers
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 02/2015. No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The ratio of LCDText CC Layers / candidate LCDText layers. Recorded in LayerTreeHost, after LayerTreeHostCommon::CalculateDrawProperties() has computed the properties we need. Only recorded for the first 50 frames of every page.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LCDText.PercentageOfCandidateLayers
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 02/2015. No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The ratio of CC Layers which are candidates for LCDText AA / total picture or content Layers. Recorded in LayerTreeHost, after LayerTreeHostCommon::CalculateDrawProperties() has computed the properties we need. Only recorded for the first 50 frames of every page.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LoadType
histogram.summary: Probability distribution for enumerated varieties of page loads.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LockExistingCachedImage
histogram.summary: For each attempted lock of a cached image, records whether it was successful.

histogram.name: Renderer4.MainThreadGestureScrollReason
histogram.summary: Ideally we'd always scroll on the impl thread, but there are a variety of situations where we need to scroll on main. We should try to drive these down. For every gesture, we record whether or not the scroll occurred on the main thread, and if it did, what the reason was.

histogram.name: Renderer4.MainThreadWheelScrollReason
histogram.summary: Ideally we'd always scroll on the impl thread, but there are a variety of situations where we need to scroll on main. We should try to drive these down. For every wheel tick, we record whether or not the the scroll occurred on the main thread, and if it did, what the reason was.

histogram.name: Renderer4.pixelCountCulled_Draw
histogram.summary: Number of pixels that culling prevented being drawn to the screen, recorded as 10 times the percentage of the viewport that these pixels cover. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.pixelCountOpaque
histogram.summary: Number of pixels known to be opaque, recorded as 10 times the percentage of the viewport that these pixels cover.

histogram.name: Renderer4.pixelCountPainted
histogram.summary: Number of pixels painted by WebKit into main memory, recorded as 10 times the percentage of the viewport that these pixels cover. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.pixelCountTranslucent
histogram.summary: Number of pixels not known to be opaque opaque, recorded as 10 times the percentage of the viewport that these pixels cover.

histogram.name: Renderer4.ReadyToDrawTileDrawStatus
histogram.summary: For each tile that was ready to draw at some point, logs whether the tile was actually used in a draw. This is logged at tile destruction time.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Renderer.PartialRasterPercentageSaved
histogram.summary: Percentage of pixels which would have been rastered, but were skipped due to the partial raster optimization. Logged for each raster task run in a Renderer process. The histogram is suffixed by the RasterBufferProvider which is in use.

histogram.name: Renderer4.renderPassCount
histogram.summary: The number of render passes (or render targets) in the renderer's frame. If the value is more than one, then an intermediate rendering target must be used during the rendering of the frame for each render pass greater than one.

histogram.name: Renderer4.RequestToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "finish." "Request"== time when user requested document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.RequestToStart
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "start." "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document.

histogram.name: Renderer4.ResourcePoolMemoryUsage
histogram.summary: Size of the in-use portion of the ResourcePool. Recorded each time resources are reclaimed after tile work completes.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Snapshot
histogram.summary: Time to capture a renderer snapshot.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwareCompositorThreadImplDrawDelay
histogram.summary: Time between frames when the software renderer is being used, as measured on the compositor thread. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwareDoDeferredUpdateDelay
histogram.summary: Time between frames when the page is not GPU accelerated.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwareImageDecodeState
histogram.summary: Software image decode usage statistics. Images are decoded and locked prior to raster; this indicates how that decode is used during tile management.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwareImageDecodeState.FirstLockWasted
histogram.summary: Indication whether the first lock of an image decode was wasted (image was not used). Images are decoded and locked prior to raster; this indicates whether the decode was used or not during the first lock.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwarePaintDurationMS
histogram.summary: Time spent by WebKit painting the page, in milliseconds, when the page is not GPU accelerated.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwarePaintMegapixPerSecond
histogram.summary: WebKit paint throughput, measured in megapixels per second, when the page is not GPU accelerated.

histogram.name: Renderer4.StartToCommit
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "commit." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document.

histogram.name: Renderer4.StartToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "finish." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.TextureCopyLatency
histogram.summary: Time between the issue of a texture copy operation and detecting that it has completed as measured by the GPU process.

histogram.name: Renderer4.TextureGpuUploadTimeUS
histogram.summary: The number of microseconds it took to upload a tile's full texture as measured on the GPU process.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Thumbnail
histogram.summary: Time to capture a renderer thumbnail.

histogram.name: Renderer4.tileCountCulled_Upload
histogram.summary: Number of tiles that culling prevented being uploaded to texture memory. This is an approximation and is recorded as a 100 times the percentage of the number of tiles, of default size, needed to cover the viewport. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.uploadPixelCountCulled
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2012, replaced with Renderer4.tileCountCulled_Upload.
histogram.summary: Number of pixels that culling prevented being uploaded to texture memory, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.uploadPixelCountOpaque
histogram.summary: Number of pixels uploaded to texture memory and known to be opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.uploadPixelCountTranslucent
histogram.summary: Number of pixels uploaded to texture memory and not known opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.WheelScrollingThreadStatus
histogram.summary: For every wheel tick, we record whether the scroll occurred on the main thread, on the compositor thread, or on the compositor thread but blocked on the main thread. The last case will happen when there is a blocking event listener.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.BackgroundRendererMainThreadLoad
histogram.summary:
Renderer main thread load when renderer is backgrounded, i.e. percentage of time spent on running tasks.
This metric is emitted when the renderer main thread task is completed or renderer is backgrounded or foregrounded, at most once per minute per renderer amortized.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.BackgroundRendererMainThreadLoad2
histogram.summary:
Renderer main thread load when renderer is backgrounded, i.e. percentage of time spent on running tasks.
This metric is emitted when the renderer main thread task is completed or renderer is backgrounded or foregrounded, at most once per minute per renderer amortized.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration
histogram.summary: The estimated queueing duration which would be observed for additional high priority tasks posted to the RendererScheduler. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ForegroundRendererMainThreadLoad
histogram.summary:
Renderer main thread load when renderer is foregrounded, i.e. percentage of time spent on running tasks.
This metric is emitted when the renderer main thread task is completed or renderer is backgrounded or foregrounded, at most once per minute per renderer amortized.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ForegroundRendererMainThreadLoad2
histogram.summary:
Renderer main thread load when renderer is foregrounded, i.e. percentage of time spent on running tasks.
This metric is emitted when the renderer main thread task is completed or renderer is backgrounded or foregrounded, at most once per minute per renderer amortized.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.NumberOfTasksPerQueueType
histogram.summary: The number of completed renderer tasks split per task queue type. Used to monitor usage of each type of task queue. Reported each time when task is completed.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.NumberOfTasksPerQueueType2
histogram.summary:
The number of completed renderer tasks split per task queue type. Used to monitor usage of each type of task queue. Reported each time when task is completed.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerQueueType
histogram.summary:
Total duration of renderer tasks split per task queue type. Used to monitor usage of each type of task queues. Reported each time when task is completed and current accumulated duration is longer than 1ms.
This metric is susceptible to problematic outliers and should be analyzed with custom scripts accounting for that rather than from a dashboard.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerQueueType2
histogram.summary:
Total duration of renderer tasks split per task queue type. Used to monitor usage of each type of task queues. Reported each time when task is completed and current accumulated duration is longer than 1ms.
This metric is susceptible to problematic outliers and should be analyzed with custom scripts accounting for that rather than from a dashboard.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskQueueManager.DelayedTaskLateness
histogram.summary: The delta between when a delayed task was scheduled to run and when the RendererScheduler actually ran it. Note: to reduce overhead only 10% of tasks are sampled.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskQueueManager.ImmediateTaskQueueingDuration
histogram.summary: The queueing duration for non-delayed tasks posted to the RendererScheduler. This metric is only recorded if TrackingInfo::time_posted is set (i.e. not on android). Note: to reduce overhead only 10% of tasks are sampled.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskTime
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskTime2 as of May 2017.
histogram.summary: The duration of every task queued in the _renderer_ scheduler to see the distribution of the task duration.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskTime2
histogram.summary:
The duration of every task queued in the _renderer_ scheduler to see the distribution of the task duration.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.UserModel.GestureDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of gestures (scrolls and pinches).

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.UserModel.GesturePredictedCorrectly
histogram.summary: Whether a user gesture was predicted correctly.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.UserModel.GestureStartTimeSinceModelReset
histogram.summary: Time between when the UserModel was last reset (which happens on navigation) and a gesture starting.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.UserModel.TimeBetweenGestures
histogram.summary: Time between subsequent gestures (scrolls and pinches).

histogram.name: RendererSyncIPC.ElapsedTime
histogram.summary: Roundtrip times for synchronous IPC calls from the renderer to browser.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.OpenLinkAsUser
histogram.summary: State of the profile that is activated via the "Open Link as User" menu. Logged when one of the "Open Link as User" context menu options is selected.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.OpenLinkAsUserProfilesState
histogram.summary: Whether or not other profiles are active when the "Open Link as User" context menu is shown. Logged when the context menu is created.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.OpenLinkAsUserShown
histogram.summary: Count of the profiles shown for the "Open Link as User" context menu. Logged when the context menu is created.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.Shown
histogram.summary: Count of renderer view context menu items shown.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.Used
histogram.summary: Count of renderer view context menu items (Only commands now) used.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.DismissalState
histogram.summary: The state of the requestAutocomplete() dialog when it was dismissed.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.InitialUserState
histogram.summary: The initial state of a user that's interacting with a freshly shown requestAutocomplete() dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.PopupInDialog
histogram.summary: User interactions with the Autofill popup shown while filling an requestAutocomplete() dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.Security
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of security warnings and errors in the RequestAutocomplete dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration.Cancel
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up canceling out of the dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration.Submit
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up accepting the dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiEvents
histogram.summary: Measures how users are interacting with the requestAutocomplete() dialog UI.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiLatencyToShow
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of time it takes for the requestAutocomplete() UI to be actionable by the user after it is shown.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.WalletErrors
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of errors in communicating with the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.WalletRequiredActions
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of required user actions returned by the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: Reset.ChromeOS.PowerwashDialogShown
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the factory reset dialog was shown. Grouped by the viewtype.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.CachePattern
histogram.summary: Like HttpCache.Pattern but only for requests made during speculative prefetch. Logged per successful request.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.DatabaseReadiness
histogram.summary: This metric measures the host coverage of the predictor database: On each navigation, it records what percentage of the top X history entries are found in the predictor DB. Caveats: (1) This metric is only recorded once the user has accumulated enough browsing history, implemented as a minimum threshold of total page visits by the user. (2) This metric is sampled, so it's actually only recorded for 1 out of every K navigations.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.DbStringTooLong
histogram.summary: A boolean that used to indicate a corner case when certain resources are not written to the Predictor database becuase their URLs are too long. We monitor this number to ensure that we do not discard too many resources.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HavePredictionsForUrl
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates if the speculative resource prefetch predictor has predictions for a Navigation. This is updated on each navigations and helps us determine the coverage of the predictor.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HavePrefetchResults
histogram.summary: A boolean that used to indicate a corner case when we may not have prefetch results even though prefetching is enabled and predictions are present, because another navigation in the same tab canceled the prefetching of the previous load.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HistoryVisitCountForUrl
histogram.summary: The visit count of a URL in the history database, measured when the onload fires for the URL. Helpful in figuring out what visit count should be used to start learning about a URL.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchCount
histogram.summary:
Assuming a fixed number (25 or 50) of URLs could be prefetched max, how many would be available for prefetch (after we apply our heuristics for picking subresources to prefetch for a navigation).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the host of the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchFromCache
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the cache restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the host of the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchFromNetwork
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the network restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the host of the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchFromNetworkPercentOfTotalFromNetwork
histogram.summary:
Similar to ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchFromNetwork but as a percent of the total number of resources the page actually fetched from the network. This depcits the major gains that we can get.
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the host of the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchMisses
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page not used by the page, restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the host of the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchCancelled
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of prefetches cancelled as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFailed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of prefetches failed as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromCacheNotUsed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching but were not requested by the page, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromCacheUsedFromCache
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching and also came from the cache when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromCacheUsedFromNetwork
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching but came from the network when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromNetworkNotUsed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from network while prefetching but were not requested by the page, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromNetworkUsedFromCache
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from network while prefetching but came from the cache when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromNetworkUsedFromNetwork
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching and also came from the network when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchNotStarted
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of resources that were prefetchable but were not prefetched as a percentage of prefetchable resources.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HostTableHostCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated January 2017. This is effectively the same as ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HostTableRowCount2 after refactoring of the predictor database.
histogram.summary: The count of number of unique hosts in the HostTable, i.e. the number of hosts that the database has prediction data for. This data is useful for determining the recall/precision as a function of the number of hosts that need to be tracked by the database. Measured at startup.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HostTableRowCount
histogram.summary: The count of number of rows in the HostTable. This is effecively the number of (host, resource URL) pairs in the database. This is measured at startup and used to get an estimate of the data size.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HostTableRowCount2
histogram.summary: The number of rows in the HostTable. This is effectively the number of hosts in the database. This is measured at startup and used to get an estimate of the data size.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.LearningCount
histogram.summary: When the prefetch predictor has resources in the local database for a given navigation, the count of predicted urls.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.LearningPrecision
histogram.summary: When the prefetch predictor has resources in the local database for a given navigation, the precision of the predictions, in percentage. This is computed as 100 \times \frac{correct predictions}{predictions}.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.LearningRecall
histogram.summary: When the prefetch predictor has resources in the local database for a given navigation, the recall of the predictions, in percentage. This is computed as 100 \times \frac{correct predictions}{all prefetchable subresources}.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.MainFrameRequestStats
histogram.summary: Records stats about main frame navigations. Records the total number of requests/responses/redirects for main frame urls along with the numbers for how often the predictor can process such events. This is useful to figure out what percentange of requests are handled by the predictor and also for sanity checking the other stats.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.NavigationEvent
histogram.summary: Records stats about various interesting events such as - request start, response start, redirect, onload, etc during the load of a main frame. Essential for understanding the complete life of a navigation request start to the onload fire and the events that occur in between.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.NavigationStatus
