histogram.summary: The status of various navigations from the view point of the 'onload' event. Since we measure the prediction accuracy and learn navigation subresources on the onload event, it is useful to know how many of the navigations are abandoned before 'onload' fires.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.NetworkType
histogram.summary: Records the number of pages on each type of network after a page is loaded.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PLT
histogram.summary:
Page load time. It starts from when the main frame URL request is sent out to when the main frame document load is completed.
This is recorded for both prefetched and non-prefetched pages.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PredictedPrefetchCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2013. Replaced with specific ones for Url and Host.
histogram.summary: Assuming a fixed number of URLs could be prefetched max, how many would be available for prefetch (after we apply our heuristics for picking subresources to prefetch for a navigation).

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PredictedPrefetchFromCache
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2013. Replaced with specific ones for Url and Host.
histogram.summary: When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the cache restricted to some max predictions.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PredictedPrefetchFromNetwork
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2013. Replaced with specific ones for Url and Host.
histogram.summary: When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the network restricted to some max predictions.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PredictedPrefetchFromNetworkPercentOfTotalFromNetwork
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2013. Replaced with specific ones for Url and Host.
histogram.summary: Similar to ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Predicted.PrefetchFromNetwork but as a percent of the total number of resources the page actually fetched from the network. This depcits the major gains that we can get.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PredictedPrefetchMisses
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2013. Replaced with specific ones for Url and Host.
histogram.summary: When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page not used by the page, restricted to some max predictions.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchedCount
histogram.summary: The count of successfully prefetched subresources for a single page. Recorded after all subresource prefetches have reached a terminal success/failure state.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchedSizeKB
histogram.summary: The total amount of data consumed by predictor for a single page. Only successfully finished requests taken into account. Recorded after all subresource prefetches have reached a terminal success/failure state.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchHitsCount.Cached
histogram.summary: Number of resources that were prefetched and requested by a page load, for cached requests. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchHitsCount.NotCached
histogram.summary: Number of resources that were prefetched and requested by a page load, for non cached requests. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchHitsSizeKB
histogram.summary: Amount of useful data fetched from the network for a prefetch request. This is the total size of the resources accounted for in ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchHitsCount.NotCached. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchingDuration
histogram.summary: Amount of time available for prefetching. Specifically, this is a time interval between corresponding StartPrefetching() and StopPrefetching() calls. This is recorded for both prefetched and non-prefetched pages.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchMissesCount.Cached
histogram.summary: Number of resources that were prefetched but not requested by a page load, for cached requests. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchMissesCount.NotCached
histogram.summary: Number of resources that were prefetched but not requested by a page load, for non cached requests, that is waste. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchMissesSizeKB
histogram.summary: Amount of wasted data fetched from the network for a prefetch request. This is the total size of the resources accounted for in ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchMissesCount.NotCached. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.RedirectStatus
histogram.summary: When the prefetch predictor has resources in the local database for a given navigation, records stats about whether redirect was predicted correctly or incorrectly.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.ReportingEvent
histogram.summary: Records stats about various interesting events such as - when partial or all of history is cleared. It will include events which do not necessarily happen during a navigation (which are reported in ResourcePrefetchPredictor.NavigationEvent).

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.RequestStats
histogram.summary: Records stats about requests, redirects, and responses observed by the ResourcePrefetchPredictorObserver. These stats are useful as a baseline for other stats.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.ResourceStatus
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2016 with the removal of the recording code.
histogram.summary: The distribution of the reasons for which subresources are ignored during prefetching. This helps us prioritze reasons we should further investigate to increase coverage. This is reported as a bit map and every status will be a bitwise or of the underlying reasons.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchCount
histogram.summary:
Assuming a fixed number of URLs could be prefetched max (25 or 50), how many would be available for prefetch (after we apply our heuristics for picking subresources to prefetch for a navigation).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchFromCache
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the cache restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchFromNetwork
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the network restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchFromNetworkPercentOfTotalFromNetwork
histogram.summary:
Similar to ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchFromNetwork but as a percent of the total number of resources the page actually fetched from the network. This depcits the major gains that we can get.
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchMisses
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page not used by the page, restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchCancelled
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of prefetches cancelled as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFailed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of prefetches failed as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromCacheNotUsed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching but were not requested by the page, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromCacheUsedFromCache
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching and also came from the cache when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromCacheUsedFromNetwork
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching but came from the network when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromNetworkNotUsed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from network while prefetching but were not requested by the page, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromNetworkUsedFromCache
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from network while prefetching but came from the cache when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromNetworkUsedFromNetwork
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching and also came from the network when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchNotStarted
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of resources that were prefetchable but were not prefetched as a percentage of prefetchable resources.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableMainFrameUrlCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated September 2016. This is effectively the same as ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableRowCount2 after refactoring of the predictor database.
histogram.summary: The count of number of unique main frame urls in the UrlTable, i.e. the number of webpages that the database has prediction data for. This data is useful for determining the recall/precision as a function of the number of webpages that need to be tracked by the database. Measured at startup.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableMainFrameUrlsDeletedNotInHistory
histogram.summary: The count of number of unique main frame urls that are deleted from the URL table at startup because they are no longer in history. Essential to figure out how much data we are loosing out.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableMainFrameUrlsDeletedNotInHistoryPercent
histogram.summary: Same as ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableMainFrameUrlsDeletedNotInHistory but recording percentage of URLs in the table rather than absolute numbers.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableRowCount
histogram.summary: The count of number of rows in the UrlTable. This is effecively the number of (main frame URL, resource URL) pairs in the database. This is measured at startup and used to get an estimate of the data size.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableRowCount2
histogram.summary: The number of rows in the UrlTable. This is effectively the number of main frame URLs in the database. This is measured at startup and used to get an estimate of the data size.

histogram.name: ResourceReporter.BrowserProcess.CpuUsage
histogram.summary: The cpu usage range reported for the browser process when the chromeos device memory pressure (which is the percentage of total memory used by the system) is critical. This is emitted only when memory pressure changes from a low pressure to a higher pressure.

histogram.name: ResourceReporter.BrowserProcess.MemoryUsage
histogram.summary: The system memory usage range reported for the browser process when the chromeos device memory pressure (which is the percentage of total memory used by the system) is critical. This is emitted only when memory pressure changes from a low pressure to a higher pressure.

histogram.name: ResourceReporter.GpuProcess.CpuUsage
histogram.summary: The cpu usage range reported for the GPU process when the chromeos device memory pressure (which is the percentage of total memory used by the system) is critical. This is emitted only when memory pressure changes from a low pressure to a higher pressure.

histogram.name: ResourceReporter.GpuProcess.MemoryUsage
histogram.summary: The system's RAM memory usage range reported for the GPU process when the chromeos device memory pressure (which is the percentage of total memory used by the system) is critical. This is emitted only when memory pressure changes from a low pressure to a higher pressure.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.ClientLoadedTime.Active
histogram.summary:
The amount of time between when the ResourceScheduler is informed of a Client's creation or starts loading and when that Client finishes loading in a Client which has been user-observable the entire time.
Note: Will not include time for the main resource if PlzNavigate is in use.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.ClientLoadedTime.Background
histogram.summary:
The amount of time between when the ResourceScheduler is informed of a Client's creation or starts loading and when that Client finishes loading in a Client which has been background the entire time.
Note: Will not include time for the main resource if PlzNavigate is in use.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.ClientLoadedTime.Other
histogram.summary:
The amount of time between when the ResourceScheduler is informed of a Client's creation or starts loading and when that Client finishes loading in a Client which has switched between Active and Background.
Note: Will not include time for the main resource if PlzNavigate is in use.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.ClientLoadedTime.Other.SwitchedToActive
histogram.summary:
The amount of time between the last time that a Client becomes user-observable and when that Client finishes loading in a Client that was user-observable when the load completed.
Note: Will not include time for the main resource if PlzNavigate is in use.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.NumSkippedScans.ScheduleStart
histogram.summary: The number of LoadAnyStartablePendingRequests scans that were skipped due to smarter task scheduling around reprioritization.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeDeferred.Active
histogram.summary: The amount of time the ResourceScheduler is throttling a request after WillStartRequest is called for a request in a client that was user-observable at creation and start time.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeDeferred.Background
histogram.summary: The amount of time the ResourceScheduler is throttling a request after WillStartRequest is called for a request in a client that was background at creation and start time.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeDeferred.Other
histogram.summary: The amount of time the ResourceScheduler is throttling a request after WillStartRequest is called on a request without a Client or a request in a Client which is in a different state since the request was made. Note that this won't capture requests which have switched state an even number of times. Switching from Active to Background back to Active will be recorded in the Active version of this histogram.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeThrottled.Active
histogram.summary: The amount of time between when the request was created and when the ResourceScheduler stops throttling the request in a client that was user-observable at creation and start time.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeThrottled.Background
histogram.summary: The amount of time between when the request was created and when the ResourceScheduler stops throttling the request in a client that was background at creation and start time.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeThrottled.Other
histogram.summary: The amount of time between when the request was created and when the ResourceScheduler stops throttling a request without a client or a request in a Client which is in a different state since the request was made. Note that this won't capture requests which have switched state an even number of times. Switching from Active to Background back to Active will be recorded in the Active version of this histogram.

histogram.name: SadTab.Created
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Track number of times we built a sad tab page for a renderer crash or kill. The user may not have seen the page if it was not the frontmost tab.

histogram.name: SadTab.Displayed
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Track number of times the user actually saw a sad tab page for a renderer crash or kill.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.EnabledSettingChanged
histogram.summary: Records the user action that enables/disables safe browsing feature in the Settings page on Android.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.DynamicUpdateResult
histogram.summary:
The result of reading/parsing/accepting a new proto for the FileTypePolices repo of file extensions and their meta data.
This is for the file types loaded from the component-update system. This includes both those loaded from disk shortly after startup, and those received over the network when the component version changes

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.DynamicUpdateTypeCount
histogram.summary:
Number of file types (aka file extensions) present in the FileTypePolicies proto loaded.
This is for the file types loaded from the component-update system. This includes both those loaded from disk shortly after startup, and those received over the network when the component version changes

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.DynamicUpdateVersion
histogram.summary:
Integer version number citing which version of the proto data chrome just loaded. Latest version is in download_file_types.asciipb.
This is for the file types loaded from the component-update system. This includes both those loaded from disk shortly after startup, and those received over the network when the component version changes

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.ResourceBundleResult
histogram.summary:
The result of reading/parsing/accepting a new proto for the FileTypePolices repo of file extensions and their meta data.
This is for the file types loaded from the resource bundle packaged with Chrome, which is always loaded at startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.ResourceBundleTypeCount
histogram.summary:
Number of file types (aka file extensions) present in the FileTypePolicies proto loaded.
This is for the file types loaded from the resource bundle packaged with Chrome, which is always loaded at startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.ResourceBundleVersion
histogram.summary:
Integer version number citing which version of the proto data chrome just loaded. Latest version is in download_file_types.asciipb.
This is for the file types loaded from the resource bundle packaged with Chrome, which is always loaded at startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GetV4HashHttpResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from the SafeBrowsing Pver4 service. Logged after a GetHash or request finishes to capture the response code or error code for that call.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GetV4HashNetwork
histogram.summary: The time that it took to receive a response from the Safe Browsing servers for a V4 GetHash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GetV4HashResult
histogram.summary: Track return status from V4 GetHash attempts. The buckets of this histogram overlap, so the counts cannot be used as percentages.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ModuleBaseRelocation
histogram.summary: A windows only historgram. Records when an unknown base relocation type is encountered while reading the reloc table of a loaded module.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NavigationObserver.IPAddressCleanUpCount
histogram.summary: Count of how many ResolvedIPAddresses get removed in each periodic clean up. This is a rough estimation of the number of IPs associated with main frame and sub-frame navigations every two minutes.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NavigationObserver.NavigationEventCleanUpCount
histogram.summary: Count of how many NavigationEvents get removed in each periodic clean up. This is a rough estimation of the number of navigations every two minutes.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NotificationImageReporter.NetError
histogram.summary: The net error code for failed reports sent by NotificationImageReporter, or net::OK if successful.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ParseV4HashResult
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of a status 200 GetV4Hash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ParseV4UpdateResult
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of a status 200 GetV4Update request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Extended
histogram.summary: Whether the Safe Browsing extended reporting service is currently enabled. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles on profile startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.General
histogram.summary: Whether the Safe Browsing service is currently enabled. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles on profile startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.SawInterstitial
histogram.summary: Whether the current user has ever seen a security interstitial. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles on profile startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Scout
histogram.summary: Tracks the Extended Reporting preference transition. Suffixes track which opt-in text users are viewing and the values of each Extended Reporting preference. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles on profile startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Scout.Decision
histogram.summary: Tracks user decisions about the Extended Reporting opt-in on security interstitials by comparing the initial and final states of the preference. Suffixes specify the type of change that was made. Recorded when a user closes a security interstitial or navigates away.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Scout.SetPref
histogram.summary: Tracks the Extended Reporting preference being changed. Suffixes track which Extended Reporting preference was changed, and the specific UI that the change was made on. Recorded when a user changes the preference on any UI.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Scout.Transition
histogram.summary: Tracks reasons for the Extended Reporting preference transition, such as a user entering an experiment group or seeing a security interstitial for the first time. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles on profile startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ReferrerAttributionResult
histogram.summary: The result of referrer attribution, including different types of success or failure. This is incremented each time a safe browsing ping or download ping is generated.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ReferrerHasInvalidTabID
histogram.summary: Number of times referrer attribution encounters an invalid tab ID. This is incremented a safe browsing ping or download ping is generated and an invalid tab ID is encountered during attribution.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ReferrerURLChainSize
histogram.summary: The length of referrer URL chain we get from referrer attribution. This is incremented each time a safe browsing ping or download ping is generated.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ThreatReport.DomIsAmbiguous
histogram.summary: A threat report contains a DOM hierarchy that is ambiguous. This indicates that the parent/child relationship among the elements in the DOM may not be accurate.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.Allowed
histogram.summary: File types that were allowed to be downloaded without verifying their content nor their source URLs with Safe Browsing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.AllowedByWhitelist
histogram.summary: File types that were allowed to be downloaded without verifying their content nor their source URLs with Safe Browsing due to the requestor URL being on the Safe Browsing whitelist. Each sample recorded on this histogram is also recorded in SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.Allowed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.AllowedDueToDisabledService
histogram.summary: File types that were allowed to be downloaded without verifying their content nor their source URLs with Safe Browsing due to the SafeBrowsing service being disabled. Each sample recorded on this histogram is also recorded in SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.Allowed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.AlternateExtensionCount
histogram.summary: Count of alternate extensions that were supplied when attempting to download a file without verifying their content nor their source URLs with Safe Browsing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.Blocked
histogram.summary: File types that were blocked from downloaded without verifying their content nor their source URLs with Safe Browsing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4AddUnlumpedHashes.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to copy the SafeBrowsing list update as a string, into a map which contains the hash prefixes that are looked up when a client queries for the reputation of a resource (URL, full hash, etc.).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4AddUnlumpedHashesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to copy the SafeBrowsing list update as a string, into a map which contains the hash prefixes that are looked up when a client queries for the reputation of a resource (URL, full hash, etc.).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ApplyUpdateResult
histogram.summary: Track the result of applying the update fetched from the PVer4 service for a particular store.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ApplyUpdateResultWhenReadingFromDisk
histogram.summary: Track the result of applying an update read from disk after parsing it successfully as a protobuf.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Database.Size
histogram.summary: The size of the SafeBrowsing database or file on disk in kilobytes, after reading it from disk on startup and after a database update has occurred.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4DatabaseOpen.Time
histogram.summary: The time it takes to parse and load the SafeBrowsing database from disk, in milliseconds.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4DecodeAdditionsResult
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of additions of 4-byte hash prefixes. This is logged once per store, per update containing Rice-encoded additions.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4DecodeAdditionsTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded additions to the blacklist into raw format.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4DecodeRemovalsResult
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of indexes of hash prefixes to remove since the last update. This is logged once per store, per update containing Rice-encoded removals.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4DecodeRemovalsTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded removals from the blacklist into raw format.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4FullHashCacheResult
histogram.summary: Track cache hits for V4 full hashes.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.CacheHit.Result
histogram.summary: Track cache hits for V4 full hashes.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Check.Result
histogram.summary: Track get hash response hits for V4 full hash requests.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Network.Result
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from the SafeBrowsing Pver4 service. Logged after a GetHash or request finishes to capture the response code or error code for that call.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Network.Time
histogram.summary: The time that it took to receive a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a full hash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Parse.Result
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of a status 200 GetV4Hash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHash.Result
histogram.summary: Track return status from V4 GetHash attempts. The buckets of this histogram overlap, so the counts cannot be used as percentages.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHashCheckResult
histogram.summary: Track get hash response hits for V4 full hash requests.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHashNetwork.Time
histogram.summary: The time that it took to receive a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a full hash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetPrefixMatches.Time
histogram.summary: The time that it took to check a URL against our in-memory database. It is dominated by the time to perform checks for CheckBrowseUrl.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4MergeUpdateTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to merge the existing state of the list with the update. The update may have been received from the server, or it may have just been read from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.ApplyUpdate.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of applying a full update for a store received from PVer4 SafeBrowsing service.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.ApplyUpdate.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to process a SafeBrowsing list full update. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashes.Time for each prefix-sized list, and V4ProcessFullUpdate.MergeUpdate.Time. Additionally, if the update is Rice-encoded, it includes V4ProcessFullUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Time for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of additions of 4-byte hash prefixes. This is logged once per store, per update containing Rice-encoded additions. This histogram is specific to processing full updates received from the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded additions to the blacklist into raw format when applying a full update to a store.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.MergeUpdate.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to merge the existing state of the list with a full update received from the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdateTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to process a SafeBrowsing list full update. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashesTime for each prefix-sized list, and V4MergeUpdateTime. Additionally, if the update is Rice-encoded, it includes V4DecodeAdditionsTime for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.ApplyUpdate.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of applying a partial update for a store received from PVer4 SafeBrowsing service.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.ApplyUpdate.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to process a SafeBrowsing list partial update. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashes.Time for each prefix-sized list, and SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.MergeUpdate.Time. Additionally, if the update is Rice-encoded, it includes V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeRemovals.Time, and V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Time for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of additions of 4-byte hash prefixes. This is logged once per store, per update containing Rice-encoded additions. This histogram is specific to processing partial updates received from the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded additions to the blacklist into raw format when applying a partial update to a store.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeRemovals.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of indexes of hash prefixes to remove since the last update. This is logged once per store, per update containing Rice-encoded removals.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeRemovals.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded removals from the blacklist into raw format when applying a partial update to a store.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.MergeUpdate.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to merge the existing state of the list with a partial update received from the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdateTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to process a SafeBrowsing list partial update. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashesTime for each prefix-sized list, and V4MergeUpdateTime. Additionally, if the update is Rice-encoded, it includes V4DecodeRemovalsTime, and V4DecodeAdditionsTime for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.ApplyUpdate.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of applying an ListUpdateResponse read from disk after parsing it successfully as a protobuf.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.ApplyUpdate.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to read, parse, and process a SafeBrowsing list stored on disk. This happens at Chromium start-up. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashes.Time for each prefix-sized list, and SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.MergeUpdate.Time. Additionally, if the file is Rice-encoded, it includes V4ReadFromDisk.DecodeAdditions.Time for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.DecodeAdditions.Result
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of additions of 4-byte hash prefixes. This is logged once per store, per Chrome launch. It is specific to processing V4StoreFileFormat proto read from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.DecodeAdditions.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded additions to the blacklist into raw format when reading a store file from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.MergeUpdate.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to perform in-memory copy of the map of raw hash prefixes read from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDiskTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to read, parse, and process a SafeBrowsing list stored on disk. This happens at Chromium start-up. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashesTime for each prefix-sized list, and V4MergeUpdateTime. Additionally, if the file is Rice-encoded, it includes V4DecodeAdditionsTime for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4StoreRead.Result
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of reading the SafeBrowsing V4 store file from disk. Recorded every time a store is read from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4StoreReadResult
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of reading the SafeBrowsing V4 store file from disk. Recorded every time a store is read from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4StoreVersionRead
histogram.summary: Version of V4Store read from a store file. This would be useful in tracking the usage and rollout of new V4Store versions.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4StoreWrite.Result
histogram.summary: Track the results of writing the SafeBrowsing V4 store file to disk. Recorded every time a store is written to disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4StoreWriteResult
histogram.summary: Track the results of writing the SafeBrowsing V4 store file to disk. Recorded every time a store is written to disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Update.Network.Result
histogram.summary: Response or error codes when fetching updates from the SafeBrowsing PVer4 service.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Update.Parse.Result
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of a status 200 GetV4Update request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Update.ResponseSizeKB
histogram.summary: The size of the response sent by the SafeBrowsing PVer4 service, in KB.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Update.Result
histogram.summary: Track return status from V4 update attempts. The buckets of this histogram overlap, so the counts cannot be used as percentages.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Update.TimedOut
histogram.summary: True if a PVer4 update request timed out.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4UpdateHttpResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes when fetching updates from the SafeBrowsing PVer4 service.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4UpdateResponseSizeKB
histogram.summary: The size of the response sent by the SafeBrowsing PVer4 service, in KB.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4UpdateResult
histogram.summary: Track return status from V4 update attempts. The buckets of this histogram overlap, so the counts cannot be used as percentages.

histogram.name: SB.BloomFilter
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The first stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our in-memory bloom filter.

histogram.name: SB.BuildBloom
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: SB.Database
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The second stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our SQLite database.

histogram.name: SB.DBCheck
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The second stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our SQLite database. This time includes the filter check time.

histogram.name: SB.Delay
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This measures the time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB.FilterCheck
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The first stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our in-memory hash table.

histogram.name: SB.Network
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The third and final stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to get a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a particular URL.

histogram.name: SB.NetworkCheck
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The third and final stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to get a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a particular URL. This time includes the filter and database check time.

histogram.name: SB.PauseSafe
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This measures the time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB.Update
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: SB2.AddPrefixes
histogram.summary: The number of add prefixes stored in the database after the last update.

histogram.name: SB2.BloomFailure
histogram.obsolete: Bloom filter support deleted in October 2012.

histogram.name: SB2.BloomFilterFalsePositives

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: All prefix misses (server returned no full hashes) and prefix misses due to false positives in the bloom filter.

histogram.obsolete: Bloom filter support deleted in October 2012.

histogram.summary: The size of the browsing SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after an update has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildFilter
histogram.summary: The time that it took to regenerate the filter after we have received all the update chunks.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildReadBytes

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildReadKilobytes
histogram.summary: The number of kilobytes read by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildReadOperations
histogram.summary: The number of read operations issued by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildWriteBytes

histogram.name: SB2.BuildWriteKilobytes
histogram.summary: The number of kilobytes written by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildWriteOperations
histogram.summary: The number of write operations issued by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.ChunkInsert
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to write one redirect URL (which can contain multiple chunks) to the database.

histogram.name: SB2.ChunkRequest
histogram.summary: The network time between the request and response for a chunk.

histogram.name: SB2.ChunkSize
histogram.summary: The size of one chunk URL.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseBytes
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it was exceeding the range. Replaced by SB2.DatabaseKilobytes.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The size of the SafeBrowsing database file on disk.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseFailure
histogram.summary: Track failures when updating the safe-browsing database.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseOpen
histogram.summary: The time it takes to initialize the SafeBrowsing storage backend, in milliseconds.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseSizeKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of one of the SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after a database update has occurred (once a few minutes after startup, and every thirty minutes or so thereafter).

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseUpdateKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the update file before merging with the database file, in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.Delay
histogram.summary: The time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadBinhashAddsDeleted
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.summary: Records results of SafeBrowsing download check, including both url check and downloaded file hash check.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the downloads SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after an update has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2017. Was measuring the lifetime of a network request corresponding to a download, which may or may not correspond to the total duration of a download.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a download to finish.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadHashCheckDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for SafeBrowsing to check hash of a download file.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadUrlCheckDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for SafeBrowsing to check a download url.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadUrlChecks

histogram.summary: Records results of SafeBrowsing download url check.

histogram.name: SB2.ExtendedReportingIsEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether the user has Safe Browsing extended reporting enabled at the time a Safe Browsing warning was dismissed. This tracks the fraction of all SB interstitials that had reporting enabled.

histogram.name: SB2.FailedUpdate
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times an update failed when being committed to the database.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterCheck
histogram.summary: The time that it took to check a URL against our in-memory filter.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterKilobytes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The size of the current bloom filter in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterLoad
histogram.summary: Which filter file the database loaded from disk.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterMissing
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterReadFail
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterSize
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it was exceeding the range. Replaced by SB2.FilterKilobytes.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterWriteFail
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SB2.FormatEvent
histogram.summary: Collection of boolean events for SafeBrowsingFileStore instances. Includes corruptions detected, old versions detected, and various failures detected.

histogram.name: SB2.GetChunkResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from the SafeBrowsing service. Logged after a GetChunk request finishes to capture the response code or error code for that call. Split out from SB2.GetHashErrorResponseOrErrorCode in M49.

histogram.name: SB2.GetHash200
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult STATUS_200.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests that returned data (valid requests).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHash204
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult STATUS_204.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests that returned empty data (false positives).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from the SafeBrowsing service. Logged after a GetHash request finishes to capture the response code or error code for that call. Split out from SB2.GetHashErrorResponseOrErrorCode in M49.

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResult
histogram.summary: Track return status from GetHash attempts (STATUS_200, STATUS_204, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, BACKOFF_ERROR), whether parsing a 200 result failed (PARSE_ERROR), and dispensation of returned values (EMPTY, HIT, MISS). EMPTY means the response had no full hashes, and should contain all of the 204 responses plus all *_ERROR cases. HIT means that one of the full hashes matched. MISS means that none of the hashes matched (there was a prefix collision). (PARSE_ERROR, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, and BACKOFF_ERROR were added in M36.)

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResultDownload
histogram.summary: Track return status from GetHash attempts (STATUS_200, STATUS_204, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, BACKOFF_ERROR), whether parsing a 200 result failed (PARSE_ERROR), and dispensation of returned values (EMPTY, HIT, MISS). EMPTY means the response had no full hashes, and should contain all of the 204 responses plus all *_ERROR cases. HIT means that one of the full hashes matched. MISS means that none of the hashes matched (there was a prefix collision). (PARSE_ERROR, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, and BACKOFF_ERROR were added in M36.)

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashServerMiss
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult FULL_HASH_* and SB2.BloomFilterFalsePositives. It is unclear if this histogram ever reported useful data.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests returning full hashes that didn't match the URL that initiated the request.

histogram.name: SB2.HandleCorrupt
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times a database was found corrupt and reset.

histogram.name: SB2.InterstitialAction
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated, replaced by: interstitial.malware.* and interstitial.phishing.*.
histogram.summary: Track number of times Safe Browsing interstitials have been shown, and how many times they have been clicked through or not.

histogram.name: SB2.InterstitialActionDetails
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated, replaced by: interstitial.malware.* and interstitial.phishing.*.
histogram.summary: Tracks the click-through rate for specific cases of the interstitial.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeClosed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user navigating away by for example, closing the tab, clicking the browser back button or typing another URL in the address bar.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeDiagnostic
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on diagnostic page link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeExpandedSeeMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user expanding the "see more info" section of the page. (Only applies to field trial version 2 of the interstitial.)

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeLearnMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the learn more about malware link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimePrivacyPolicy
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the privacy policy link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeProceed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the proceed link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeTakeMeBack
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the big green back button.

histogram.name: SB2.Network
histogram.summary: The time that it took to receive a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a GetHash request.

histogram.name: SB2.OldDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: Size of v1 database deleted from client profile.

histogram.name: SB2.OutShardShifts
histogram.summary: Indicates how sharded safe-browsing on-disk stores are. Values like 0 to 4 are reasonable.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeClosed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user navigating away by for example, closing the tab, clicking the browser back button or typing another URL in the address bar.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeExpandedSeeMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user expanding the "see more info" section of the page. (Only applies to field trial version 2 of the interstitial.)

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeLearnMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the learn more link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeProceed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the proceed link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeReportError
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the report error link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeTakeMeBack
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the big green back button.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetBitsPerPrefix
histogram.summary: The size of the PrefixSet storage in bits, divided by the number of prefixes represented. Should almost always be 16.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetEvent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 9/2012. No longer generated, BloomFilter being removed.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records how well the PrefixSet implementation matches the BloomFilter implementation.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of one of the PrefixSet files in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetLoad
histogram.summary: Time to load one of the PrefixSet files.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetRestoredExcess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How many extra results GetPrefixes returns.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetRestoredShortfall
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How many fewer results GetPrefixes returns.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetSizeKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of one of the PrefixSet files in kilobytes. Logged after a database update has occurred and the PrefixSet has been flushed to disk (once a few minutes after startup, and every thirty minutes or so thereafter).

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedDelta
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How far unsorted deltas are from expected value.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedDifference
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. Distance of unsorted elements from expected location.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedPercent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How far into the results unsorted elements were found. Interesting values would be 0%, 50%, or 100%.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. Size of unsorted sets. To see if there is a problem with a particular size of dataset.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetVersionRead
histogram.summary: Version read from one of the PrefixSet files.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetWrite
histogram.summary: Time to store one of the PrefixSet files.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.CanCheckUrl
histogram.summary: Count of how many URLs were actually checked vs skipped via RemoteSafeBrowsingDatabaseManager because the scheme is not supported by Safe Browsing. Incremented each time a resource load is initiated.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.ChecksPending
histogram.summary: Number of outstanding calls for URLs getting classified through RemoteSafeBrowsingDatabaseManager. The size of the queue is logged before initiating each request.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.Elapsed
histogram.summary: Latency of URL-classification API calls from Chrome via RemoteSafeBrowsingDatabaseManager, logged per-request. This includes the time to go through JNI, check the URL, and return the result and includes several thread hops betwetween IO and UI threads. The resource-load will not necessarily be delayed this much (see SB2.Delay for that).

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.Result
histogram.summary: Result of URL-classification API calls from Chrome via RemoteSafeBrowsingApiHandler. Logged after each URL is judged safe/not-safe, or hits a deadline.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.ThreatSubType.PotentiallyHarmfulApp
histogram.summary: The threat sub-type annotated for URLs classified as PHA via remote calls through RemoteSafeBrowsingApiHandler. "PHA" classifications generate "malware" interstitials.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.ThreatSubType.SocialEngineering
histogram.summary: The threat sub-type annotated returned for URLs classified as social engineering via remote calls through RemoteSafeBrowsingApiHandler. "Social engineering" classifications generate "phishing" interstitials.

histogram.name: SB2.ReportingIsEnabled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether the user has Safe Browsing extended reporting enabled at the time a Safe Browsing warning was dismissed. This tracks the fraction of all SB interstitials that had reporting enabled.

histogram.name: SB2.ResourceTypes
histogram.summary: Resource types of resources that were inspected by Safe Browsing in the SafeBrowsingResourceThrottle.

histogram.name: SB2.ResourceTypes2
histogram.summary: Resource types of resources that were inspected by Safe Browsing in the SafeBrowsingResourceThrottle.

histogram.name: SB2.SetExtendedReportingEnabled
histogram.summary: Tracks changes to the Safe Browsing extended reporting opt-in which is shown in the Safe Browsing interstitial.

histogram.name: SB2.SetReportingEnabled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks changes to the Safe Browsing extended reporting opt-in which is shown in the Safe Browsing interstitial.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreePrefixSetWrite
histogram.summary: Time to store the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file. Note: this histogram was intended to be stored as SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistPrefixSetWrite but was actually reported as SB2.SideEffectFreePrefixSetWrite from its inception to its deprecation...

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the Side Effect Free Whitelist SaafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after an update has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistPrefixSetKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file in kilobytes, after an udpate has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistPrefixSetLoad
histogram.summary: Time to load the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistStatus
histogram.summary: The instantiation status of the SideEffectFreeWhitelist.

histogram.name: SB2.StoreVersionRead
histogram.summary: Version read from the store file.

histogram.name: SB2.SubPrefixes
histogram.summary: The number of sub prefixes stored in the database after the last update.

histogram.name: SB2.Update
histogram.summary: The time from the receipt of the update request to the receipt of the final update chunk.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateRequestSize
histogram.summary: The payload size of update requests to the server.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateResult
histogram.summary: Result from trying to update the SafeBrowsing data.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateSize
histogram.summary: The size of all the chunk URLs in an update response.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateSizeBackground
histogram.obsolete: Was used for an experiment in late 2014.
histogram.summary: The size of all the chunk URLs in an update response when Chrome is in the background.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateSizeForeground
histogram.obsolete: Was used for an experiment in late 2014.
histogram.summary: The size of all the chunk URLs in an update response when Chrome is in the foreground.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateUrls
histogram.summary: The number of chunk URLs in an update response.

histogram.name: SB2.VolunteerPrefixesRemoved
histogram.obsolete: The operation this is tracking has been deleted as of 09/2014.
histogram.summary: Older versions of the safe-browsing code incorrectly added additional SBPrefix items when receiving full hashes. This caused errors when calculating when to send gethash requests to the server. An additional pass over the data has been added to remove the excess prefixes. This histogram tracks progress of that code for purposes of informing a decision on when to remove the additional pass. See http://crbug.com/361248 .

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ArchivedArchiveExtensions
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of archive file types that were found while examining a downloaded ZIP file. Each archive file type in a single ZIP file is recorded at most once. The relative incidence rate of each filetype in this histogram should indicate the probability of finding that file type in a ZIP file given that that ZIP file contains an archive file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.CheckDownloadStats
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of the reason why downloads are marked as being malicious or clean by the improved SafeBrowsing binary download protection. Note that UNSUPPORTED_URL_SCHEME was split out of the INVALID_URL bucket in M41. The NOT_BINARY_FILE check was moved before the UNSUPPORTED_URL_SCHEME check in M42.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.CheckWhitelistResult
histogram.summary: For each download supported by the SafeBrowsing download protection service, records if it matches a certain whitelist (e.g. matches URL whitelist, matches signature whitelist, or does not match any whitelists).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileFailureByType
histogram.summary: Counts of DMG-like file types that failed to be successfully analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileHasExecutable
histogram.summary: For each DMG file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records if the DMG contained an executable file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileHasExecutableByType
histogram.summary: Counts of DMG-like file types which were analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service that contained an executable file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileHasNoExecutableByType
histogram.summary: Counts of DMG-like file types which were analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service that did NOT contain an executable file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileSuccess
histogram.summary: For each DMG file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records true if the analysis was successful, or false if there was an error analyzing the file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileSuccessByType
histogram.summary: Counts of DMG-like file types that were successfully analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadExtensions
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of how often users download a file with a file extension that is possibly dangerous (e.g., exe, class).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestDuration
histogram.summary: Records the total time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to check whether the content of a download is malicious or not, including file feature extraction, whitelist checking, and server ping. This histogram only includes checks that sent a ping to the SafeBrowsing server. It does not include requests that were cancelled, but does include requests that received a bad response.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestNetError
histogram.summary: The net error code for all CheckClientDownloadRequest URLFetchers.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestNetworkDuration
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service ping. It is not recorded for requests that were cancelled.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestNetworkStats
histogram.summary: Records the results of SafeBrowsing binary download checks which caused a server ping.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The size of the upload data for CheckClientDownloadRequest URLFetchers.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestResponseCode
histogram.summary: For CheckClientDownloadRequest URLFetchers with successful status, the HTTP response code that was received.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestTimeoutDuration
histogram.summary: Records the portion of the SafeBrowsing download service check starting with the point CheckClientDownloadRequest::StartTimeout() is called. It is recorded regardless if a ping was sent or not. It is not recorded for requests that were cancelled.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestTimeoutStats
histogram.summary: For SafeBrowsing binary download checks which reached the CheckClientDownloadRequest::StartTimeout() call, records the final result (once the check finishes or is cancelled).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractDmgFeaturesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract info from a downloaded DMG file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractImageHeadersTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract image headers from a downloaded binary.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractSignatureFeaturesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract signature info from a downloaded binary. This includes both unsigned and signed binaries.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractZipFeaturesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract info from a downloaded zip file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.PPAPIDownloadRequest.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: Time taken to complete a PPAPIDownloadRequest.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.PPAPIDownloadRequest.RequestOutcome
histogram.summary: Outcome of running CheckPPAPIDownloadRequest. Most failure modes cause an UNKNOWN result to be returned to the caller. If the attempt succeeds, the result returned to the caller is based on the SafeBrowsing resopnse. The final result returned is counted in SBClientDownload.PPAPIDownloadRequest.Result.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.PPAPIDownloadRequest.Result
histogram.summary: Result returned to the caller of CheckPPAPIDownloadRequest.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SignedBinaryDownload
histogram.summary: Records the number of signed vs. unsigned executables that are downloaded.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SignedOrWhitelistedDownload
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in Chrome 50. Replaced by SBClientDownload.CheckWhitelistResult.*.
histogram.summary: Counter which is incremented whenever an executable is downloaded which is either signed or whose URL matches the download whitelist.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.UnsupportedScheme
histogram.summary: Records how often different file extensions are downloaded with schemes that aren't supported by Safe Browsing (e.g. ftp, gopher, content, cid, etc).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileHasArchiveButNoExecutable
histogram.summary: For each zip file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records true if the zip did not contain any executables but did contain another zip file, false otherwise.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileHasExecutable
histogram.summary: For each zip file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records if the zip contained an executable file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileSuccess
histogram.summary: For each zip file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records if the unpacking was 100% successful.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.ClassificationStart
histogram.summary: The number of pages that we could have possibly classified (essentially the number of top page navigations by users with SBClientMalware enabled). The name is slightly misleading as it is recorded before "Preclassification" happens.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.IPBlacklistRequestNetError
histogram.summary: The net error code for all ClientMalwareRequest URLFetchers.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.IPBlacklistRequestPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The size of the upload data for ClientMalwareRequest URLFetchers.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.IPBlacklistRequestResponseCode
histogram.summary: For ClientMalwareRequest URLFetchers with successful status, the HTTP response code that was received.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.PreClassificationCheckFail
histogram.summary: Records the number of malware classifications that were skipped because a pre-classification check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.ResourceUrlMatchedBadIp
histogram.summary: True if at least one resource url matched the malware IP list. Recorded when client side malware feature extraction is done.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.SentReports
histogram.summary: Measures the success rate of sending malware reports. Sending a report can fail due to a client reaching the limit on the number of reports it can send per day or due to the report failing to be serialized.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.ServerDeterminesMalware
histogram.summary: The counts for malware verdicts given by server side model.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.UnexpectedPageId
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 03/2014. That part of the code got deleted.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the page ID that completed the page load does not match the browse info page ID. We expect that number to be zero.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CancelClassificationReason
histogram.summary: The counts for various reasons why an in-progress phishing classification was canceled.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CheckNoPendingClassificationFailed
histogram.summary: The number of times client-side phishing classifier expected to have no pending classifications running but that check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClassificationStart
histogram.summary: The number of pages that we could have possibly classified (essentially the number of top page navigations by users with SBClientPhishing enabled). The name is slightly misleading as it is recorded before "Preclassification" happens.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClientDeterminesPhishing
histogram.summary: The counts for phishing verdicts given by client side model.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClientModelDownloadResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from the SafeBrowsing service. Logged after a request for the client side model finishes to capture the response code or the error code for that HTTP request.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClientModelStatus
histogram.summary: The counts for various model status codes that we get after loading a new client-side phishing model.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureChunkTime
histogram.summary: The time that an individual chunk of DOM feature extraction work took.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureFrameRemoved
histogram.summary: The number of times that DOM feature extraction finished early because the active WebDocument's frame was removed during traversal.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureIterations
histogram.summary: The number of iterations that the DOM feature extractor took to finish.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureResumeTime
histogram.summary: The time that it took to resume DOM feature extraction for the phishing classifier. Longer times may indicate that the page DOM changed between chunks of work and the extractor had to re-traverse up to the saved position.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureTimeout
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were aborted because DOM feature extraction took too long.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureTotalTime
histogram.summary: The time that the DOM feature extarctor took to finish, summed across all chunks of work.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.GrabPhishingThumbnail
histogram.summary: Time spent generating the thumbnail.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.IllegalFeatureValue
histogram.summary: The number of features which were omitted from phishing classification because they were added with an illegal value. This would indicate a bug.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.InitPrivateNetworksFailed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in Chrome 37, which now uses //net's internal matching.
histogram.summary: The number of times that the phishing detection service could not be initialized due to an error parsing the private IP networks. This would indicate a bug.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.InvalidWhitelistExpression
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2011. Whitelist entries are no longer part of ClientPhishingResponse.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of whitelist_expression entries in a ClientPhishingResponse that could not be canonicalized.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PreClassificationCheckFail
histogram.summary: Records the number of phishing classifications that were skipped because a pre-classification check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ReportLimitSkipped
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were previously cached as being phishing but that will get re-classified (to possibly fix false positives).

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RequestNotSerialized
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifier pingbacks that were skipped because serializing the request protocol buffer to string failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RequestSatisfiedFromCache
histogram.summary: The number of times that a cached phishing classification result was used, rather than pinging the server.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ScorerCreationStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status when we create a scorer object for the client-side phishing detection classifier.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ServerDeterminesPhishing
histogram.summary: The counts for phishing verdicts given by server side model.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.SkipClassificationReason
histogram.summary: The counts for various reasons why a phishing classification is skipped.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureBreakIterError
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were aborted because the term feature extractor failed to initialize an ICU break iterator.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureChunkTime
histogram.summary: The time that an individual chunk of term feature extraction work took.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureIterations
histogram.summary: The number of iterations that the term feature extractor took to finish.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureTimeout
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classification that were aborted because term feature extraction took too long.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureTotalTime
histogram.summary: The time that the term feature extarctor took to finish, summed across all chunks of work.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TooManyFeatures
histogram.summary: The number of times that the limit on the number of phishing classifier features for a page was reached. This may indicate a bug, or that kMaxFeatureSize is too small.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.URLFeatureTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to extract URL features for the phishing classifier.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Activations
histogram.summary: Count of times download feedback has been started, broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.ActiveFeedbacks
histogram.summary: When a new download feedback request is added, records the number of download requests currently active and/or pending.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Eligible
histogram.summary: Count of times eligible download notifications are shown. Broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.EmptyFilePathFailure
histogram.summary: Count of times download feedback cannot be sent due to empty file path.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Shown
histogram.obsolete: Starting with M32, replaced by SBDownloadFeedback.Eligible.
histogram.summary: Count of times download feedback button has been shown, broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeEligibleKB
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that were of the correct danger type, regardless if they meet the max file size check or if they are actually uploaded or not.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeFailure
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that failed to be uploaded to the feedback service.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeSuccess
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that were successfully uploaded to the feedback service.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.UploadRequestedByServer
histogram.summary:
For each non-SAFE file, records whether the server requested that that file be uploaded.
Logged before checking the file size, so it may be dropped there.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.UploadResult
histogram.summary: Final result of attempt to upload binary to download feedback service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.BLAHashTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to compute the hash of a blacklisted module.

histogram.name: SBIRS.BLASignatureTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to validate the signature of a blacklisted module.

histogram.name: SBIRS.DiscardedIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident discarded by the safe browsing incident reporting service as a result of profile or service destruction.

histogram.name: SBIRS.DownloadMetadata.DeleteSuccess
