histogram.summary: The result of deleting a profile's download metadata file.

histogram.name: SBIRS.DownloadMetadata.ReadResult
histogram.summary: The result of reading a profile's download metadata file.

histogram.name: SBIRS.DownloadMetadata.WriteResult
histogram.summary: The result of writing a profile's download metadata file.

histogram.name: SBIRS.DroppedIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident given to the safe browsing incident reporting service but dropped as a result of not participating in safe browsing.

histogram.name: SBIRS.EnvCollectionTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to collect environmental data for a safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.FindDownloadedBinaryTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to find the most recent binary download from all loaded profiles when creating a safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.Incident
histogram.summary: The type of incident included in an incident report by the safe browsing incident reporting service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.IncidentCount
histogram.summary: The number of incidents collated into a single safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.InterIncidentTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between two successive incidents collated into the same incident report by the safe browsing incident reporting service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.NoDownloadIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident pruned by the safe browsing incident reporting service as a result of not having a matching binary download.

histogram.name: SBIRS.PrunedIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident pruned from a report in the safe browsing incident reporting service as a result of having previously been reported.

histogram.name: SBIRS.PruneRatio
histogram.summary: The percentage of incidents pruned from a safe browsing incident report on account of having been previously reported.

histogram.name: SBIRS.PSSDataStoreSize
histogram.summary: The size, in bytes, of a profile's platform state store. This hisogram is logged on each write, which always replaces any previous contents.

histogram.name: SBIRS.PSSLoadResult
histogram.summary: The result of loading data from the platform state store.

histogram.name: SBIRS.ReceivedIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident received by the safe browsing incident reporting service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.ReportPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The size, in bytes, of a safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.ReportUploadTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to upload a safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.StateStoreInitResult
histogram.summary: The result of initializing the state store and comparing the preferences to the platform-specific state store.

histogram.name: SBIRS.SuspiciousModuleDetectionTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to check loaded modules against the module whitelist.

histogram.name: SBIRS.SuspiciousModuleReportCount
histogram.summary: The number of suspicious modules found.

histogram.name: SBIRS.SuspiciousModuleReportingTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to create incidents for suspicious modules.

histogram.name: SBIRS.UploadResult
histogram.summary: The result of an attempted report upload by the safe browsing incident reporting service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.VerifyBinaryIntegrity.0
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to verify the binary integrity of chrome.exe.

histogram.name: SBIRS.VerifyBinaryIntegrity.1
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to verify the binary integrity of chrome.dll.

histogram.name: SBIRS.VerifyBinaryIntegrity.2
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to verify the binary integrity of chrome_child.dll.

histogram.name: SBIRS.VerifyBinaryIntegrity.3
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to verify the binary integrity of chrome_elf.dll.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.Abort
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis was aborted. This histogram is suffixed with the abort reason.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.Detected
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which an off-domain inclusion was detected by the OffDomainInclusionDetector.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.EmptyMainFrameURL
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the main frame URL was unexpectedly empty in the OffDomainInclusionDetector.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.InHistory
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis concluded in no inclusion whitelist hit but a browsing history hit.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.InvalidMainFrameURL
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2015 (was never reported, confirming experiment that handling it is irrelevant).
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the main frame URL was unexpectedly invalid (and not empty) in the OffDomainInclusionDetector.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.RequestAnalyzed
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request analyzed by the OffDomainInclusionDetector.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.Suspicious
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which an off-domain inclusion was detected by the OffDomainInclusionDetector and considered suspicious.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.Whitelisted
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis concluded in an inclusion whitelist hit.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion2.Abort
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-05 as the OffDomainInclusionDetector was removed.
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis was aborted. This histogram is suffixed with the abort reason.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion2.InHistory
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-05 as the OffDomainInclusionDetector was removed.
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis concluded in no inclusion whitelist hit but a browsing history hit.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion2.RequestAnalyzed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-05 as the OffDomainInclusionDetector was removed.
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request analyzed by the OffDomainInclusionDetector.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion2.Suspicious
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-05 as the OffDomainInclusionDetector was removed.
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which an off-domain inclusion was detected by the OffDomainInclusionDetector and considered suspicious.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion2.Whitelisted
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-05 as the OffDomainInclusionDetector was removed.
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis concluded in an inclusion whitelist hit.

histogram.name: Scheduling.ActivateDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by ActivateDuration2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the compositor to simply activate the pending tree. Does not include any PrepareTiles or raster time.

histogram.name: Scheduling.ActivateDuration2
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the compositor to simply activate the pending tree. Does not include any PrepareTiles or raster time.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginImplFrameLatency2
histogram.summary: The time from v-sync to when the main side actually starts the BeginImplFrame.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameIntervalCritical
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameIntervalCritical2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary:
This is the time delta between back-to-back BeginMainFrames completions on the compositor side when the on_critical_path flag is set, regardless of whether they abort (have no updates) or commit (have updates).
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running continuously; sepcifically when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after a) an abort or b) activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameIntervalCritical2
histogram.summary:
This is the time delta between back-to-back BeginMainFrames completions on the compositor side when the on_critical_path flag is set, regardless of whether they abort (have no updates) or commit (have updates).
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running continuously; sepcifically when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after a) an abort or b) activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameIntervalNotCritical
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameIntervalNotCritical2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary:
This is the time delta between back-to-back BeginMainFrames completions on the compositor side when the on_critical_path flag is not set, regardless of whether they abort (have no updates) or commit (have updates).
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running continuously; sepcifically when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after a) an abort or b) activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameIntervalNotCritical2
histogram.summary:
This is the time delta between back-to-back BeginMainFrames completions on the compositor side when the on_critical_path flag is not set, regardless of whether they abort (have no updates) or commit (have updates).
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running continuously; sepcifically when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after a) an abort or b) activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameQueueDurationCritical
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameQueueDurationCritical2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the main side to start the BeginMainFrame in response to the compositor's SendBeginMainFrame when the on_critical_path flag is set.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameQueueDurationCritical2
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the main side to start the BeginMainFrame in response to the compositor's SendBeginMainFrame when the on_critical_path flag is set.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameQueueDurationNotCritical
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameQueueDurationNotCritical2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the main side to start the BeginMainFrame in response to the compositor's SendBeginMainFrame when the on_critical_path flag is not set.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameQueueDurationNotCritical2
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the main side to start the BeginMainFrame in response to the compositor's SendBeginMainFrame when the on_critical_path flag is not set.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: The time from when the main side actually starts the BeginMainFrame to when the commit completes on the impl side.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration2
histogram.summary: The time from when the main side actually starts the BeginMainFrame to when the commit completes on the impl side.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameToCommitDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameQueueDurationCritical, BeginMainFrameQueueDurationNotCritical, and BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration.
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the blink main thread to respond to the compositor's SendBeginMainFrame.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.BeginMainFrameStartToCommit
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration. This was recorded as a result of a typo in the code that didn't include "Duration".
histogram.summary: The time from when the main side actually starts the BeginMainFrame to when the commit completes on the impl side.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.BeginMainFrameStartToCommit2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration2. This was recorded as a result of a typo in the code that didn't include "Duration".
histogram.summary: The time from when the main side actually starts the BeginMainFrame to when the commit completes on the impl side.

histogram.name: Scheduling.CommitInterval
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by CommitInterval2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the *draw* times of back-to-back BeginMainFrames that result in a commit.
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running and committing continuously, where continuously means when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.CommitInterval2
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the *draw* times of back-to-back BeginMainFrames that result in a commit.
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running and committing continuously, where continuously means when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.CommitToReadyToActivateDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by CommitToReadyToActivateDuration2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the compositor to rasterize pending tree content after a commit before it is ready for activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.CommitToReadyToActivateDuration2
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the compositor to rasterize pending tree content after a commit before it is ready for activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.DrawDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by DrawDuration2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes the compositor to draw a frame.

histogram.name: Scheduling.DrawDuration2
histogram.summary: How long it takes the compositor to draw a frame.

histogram.name: Scheduling.DrawInterval
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by DrawInterval2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the draw times of back-to-back BeginImplFrames, regardless of whether or not they result in a swap.
The interval is only recorded when every BeginImplFrame wants to draw.

histogram.name: Scheduling.DrawInterval2
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the draw times of back-to-back BeginImplFrames, regardless of whether or not they result in a swap.
The interval is only recorded when every BeginImplFrame wants to draw.

histogram.name: Scheduling.MainAndImplFrameTimeDelta
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by MainAndImplFrameTimeDelta2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: Recorded every time the compositor draws with a new active tree. A value of 0 indicates the main-side started and finished within the same frame interval as the impl-side. Positive values correspond to how old any main-side updates are compared to the impl-side updates. If there are no mid-frame updates, this metric is a good proxy for how well the main and impl threads are synchronized.

histogram.name: Scheduling.MainAndImplFrameTimeDelta2
histogram.summary: Recorded every time the compositor draws with a new active tree. A value of 0 indicates the main-side started and finished within the same frame interval as the impl-side. Positive values correspond to how old any main-side updates are compared to the impl-side updates. If there are no mid-frame updates, this metric is a good proxy for how well the main and impl threads are synchronized.

histogram.name: Scheduling.PendingTreeDuration
histogram.summary:
Time between creating a pending tree and activating that tree. This differs from Scheduling.ActivateDuration in that it includes time taken to raster the pending tree, not just the time to activate it.
The interval is recorded each time a pending tree is activated.

histogram.name: Scheduling.PrepareTilesDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by PrepareTIlesDuration2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes the compositor to PreapreTiles, which determines what rasterization work to do.

histogram.name: Scheduling.PrepareTilesDuration2
histogram.summary: How long it takes the compositor to PreapreTiles, which determines what rasterization work to do.

histogram.name: Scheduling.SwapAckWasFast
histogram.summary: True if the swap ack was received within approximately 8 seconds of the swap. Although 8 seconds isn't exactly fast, it is a threshold that represents a hang or the appearance of a hang.

histogram.name: Scheduling.SwapToAckLatency
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SwapToAckLatency2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes the swap ack to return after a swap.

histogram.name: Scheduling.SwapToAckLatency2
histogram.summary: How long it takes the swap ack to return after a swap.

histogram.name: ScreenLocker.AuthenticationFailure
histogram.summary: What type of authentication was attempted when the user failed to unlock the lock screen.

histogram.name: ScreenLocker.AuthenticationSuccess
histogram.summary: What type of authentication was attempted when the user successfully unlocked the lock screen.

histogram.name: Sdch3.AdvertisedWithSecureScheme
histogram.obsolete: Experiment complete, histogram gathering code removed.
histogram.summary: Whether an SDCH dictionary was advertised over a secure scheme or not. This histogram is logged inside SdchManager at advertisement time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Advertisement_Count
histogram.summary: The number of dictionaries advertised in an HTTP GET transaction that supports SDCH. Note that only non-zero advertisements are logged.

histogram.name: Sdch3.BlacklistReason
histogram.summary: The reason why a blacklist blocking a request from advertising SDCH was implemented. There is one entry in this histogram per inhibited request.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Dictionary size loaded
histogram.summary: Each sample is the byte count for a dictionary that is loaded by Chrome. A dictionary is loaded shortly after the first Google query performed in each session, and allows future SDCH transactions to be encoded/decoded using that dictionary.

histogram.name: Sdch3.DictionaryFate
histogram.summary: The fate, both on input and output, of dictionary requests. There is intended to be two entries in this histogram for each Get-Dictionary seen (except failed requests are not currently tracked).

histogram.name: Sdch3.DictionaryUseCount
histogram.summary: The number of times a dictionary has been successfully used for decoding, recorded at the time it is evicted from the manager.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment2_Decode
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of an SDCH encoded transmission made after the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment2_Holdback
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment3_Decode
histogram.summary: Duration in time from the first byte of a request was received, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of an SDCH encoded transmission made after the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment3_Holdback
histogram.summary: Duration in time from the first byte of a request was received, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Decode
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of an SDCH encoded transmission made after the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_1st_To_2nd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 1st **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 2nd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_1st_To_Last_a
histogram.summary: The duration between receipt of the 1st holdback (non-SDCH encoded) packet and receipt of the last packet. Only groups that are part of the holdback (i.e., could have been sdch encoded) are sampled.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_2nd_To_3rd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 2nd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 3rd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_3rd_To_4th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 3rd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 4th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_4th_To_5th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 4th **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 5th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.FilterUseBeforeDisabling
histogram.summary: If SDCH decoding was disabled client side, this records how many URLs were processed by the SDCH filter before disabling this feature. The most common number is 1, which happens when there is one home-page tab that contains SDCH encoded data, for which there is no dictionary loaded into the Chrome process (yet), since Chrome was just restarted. Large values in this histogram are indicative of flaky decompression, that works for a while, and then is disabled. Values of 2 or 3 may appear if a user has more than one home page with a query, and restarts there browser.

histogram.name: Sdch3.FirstUseInterval
histogram.summary: The amount of time between creation/load of an SDCH dictionary and its first use.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_1st_To_2nd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 1st SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 2nd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_1st_To_Last_a
histogram.summary: The duration between receipt of the 1st SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the last packet, for processing by the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_2nd_To_3rd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 2nd SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 3rd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_3rd_To_4th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 3rd SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 4th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_4th_To_5th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 4th SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 5th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_Processed_a
histogram.summary: (discontinued 7/29/2009, and replaced by Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_Processed_b) The number of bytes processed (received over the net or from cache) by the SDCH filter chain.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_Processed_b
histogram.summary: The number of bytes processed (received over the net or from cache) by the SDCH filter chain.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_VcdiffOut_a
histogram.summary: The number of bytes emitted after decoding by the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Latency_F_a
histogram.summary: The duration between putting the first byte of a request (such as a GET) on the wire, until the last by of compressed SDCH encoded content is received (with durations over 10 minutes discarded). During a planned latency experiment, some clients will receive encoded SDCH data, and other will received mere gzip'ed data (that passes through the SDCH filter unchanged).

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Packets_b
histogram.summary: An approximation to the total number of SDCH encoded packets received for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Ratio_a
histogram.summary: The ratio of the number of bytes read from the network (or cache) and fed to the filter chain (usually the gunzip filter) vs. the number of bytes emitted by the SDCH filter to be rendered. This is commonly described as the SDCH compression ratio.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_1st_To_2nd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 1st **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 2nd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_1st_To_Last_a
histogram.summary: The duration between receipt of the 1st **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the last packet, for processing by the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_2nd_To_3rd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 2nd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 3rd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_3rd_To_4th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 3rd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 4th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_4th_To_5th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 4th **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 5th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_Latency_F_a
histogram.summary: The duration between putting the first byte of a request (such as a GET) on the wire, until the last by gzip compressed content is received and passed-through unchanged by the SDCH filter (with durations over 10 minutes discarded). During a planned latency experiment, some clients will receive encoded SDCH data, and other will received mere gzip'ed data (that passes through the SDCH filter unchanged).

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_Packets_b
histogram.summary: The total number of **NON**-SDCH encoded packets received for processing by the SDCH filter in one URL fetch. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.NetworkBytesSavedByCompression
histogram.summary: The absolute difference in bytes between the amount of data entering the SDCH filter and the amount of data exiting the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.NetworkBytesSpent
histogram.summary: Absolute sizes, in bytes, of SDCH dictionaries fetched over the network. These are logged in SdchOwner when dictionary fetches complete.

histogram.name: Sdch3.PartialBytesIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode INCOMPLETE_SDCH_CONTENT reports that the VCDIFF decoder still has internally buffered data that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to the start of the filter chain (usually to the gunzip filter).

histogram.name: Sdch3.PartialVcdiffIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode INCOMPLETE_SDCH_CONTENT reports that the VCDIFF decoder still has internally buffered data that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to VCDIFF decoder (usually after gunzipping).

histogram.name: Sdch3.PartialVcdiffOut
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode INCOMPLETE_SDCH_CONTENT reports that the VCDIFF decoder still has internally buffered data that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were output by the VCDIFF decoder (and sent toward the renderer).

histogram.name: Sdch3.PersistenceFailureReason
histogram.summary: Tracks failures that occur when reading in or writing out persisted dictionary information.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ProblemCodes_3
histogram.summary: Each sample is the report of a distinct problem code.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ProblemCodes_4
histogram.summary: Each sample is the report of a distinct problem code.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ProblemCodes_5
histogram.summary: Each sample is the report of a distinct problem code.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ResponseCorruptionDetection.Cached
histogram.summary: Attempted SDCH decoding can fail at the Read() filter processing stage. In some of those cases, the request is corrupted enough that it must be either retried or failed completely. This histogram records the details of why the request was considered corrupted, for results returned from the cache.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ResponseCorruptionDetection.Uncached
histogram.summary: Attempted SDCH decoding can fail at the Read() filter processing stage. In some of those cases, the request is corrupted enough that it must be either retried or failed completely. This histogram records the details of why the request was considered corrupted for results returned from the network.

histogram.name: Sdch3.TimeWeightedMemoryUse
histogram.summary: Measures the time-weighted memory use of SDCH dictionaries, in bytes. The numerator is bytes of dictionary times seconds that dictionary was in memory, and the denominator is seconds that the Chrome process lives.

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedBufferSize
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were in that buffer.

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedBytesIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to the start of the filter chain (usually to the gunzip filter).

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedVcdiffIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to VCDIFF decoder (usually after gunzipping).

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedVcdiffOut
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were output by the VCDIFF decoder (and sent toward the renderer).

histogram.name: Sdch3.UsageInterval
histogram.summary: The amount of time from the last time an SDCH dictionary was used. For the first use of a dictionary, the maximum time is used.

histogram.name: Sdch3.UsageInterval2
histogram.summary: The amount of time from the last time an SDCH dictionary was used. Not recorded on first dictionary use. First use is recorded as Sdch3.FirstUseInterval.

histogram.name: Search.AddSearchProvider
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Search.AddSearchProvider2, which is also now obsolete.
histogram.summary: Measures how much the user modifies their search engines, whether through window.external.AddSearchProvider or chrome://settings.

histogram.name: Search.AddSearchProvider2
histogram.summary: Measures usage of window.external.AddSearchProvider and user interaction with the resulting confirmation dialog (if any). Only works on Views platforms (Win, Linux, CrOS).

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchAllCapsResultsSeen
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2017 because it's no longer ever used.
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen during a contextual search where the selected text consisted of all capital letters. Only logged when contextual search is triggered due to a tap. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchBarOverlap
histogram.summary: Whether a Tap was suppressed because the Bar overlapped the selection area. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchBarOverlapSeen
histogram.summary: Whether the Bar overlapped the selection area and whether the results were seen. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchBasePageProtocol
histogram.summary: The protocol of the base page, logged at the time that any Search Term Resolution Response is recieved.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchBlacklistSeen
histogram.obsolete: Discontinued on 5/2017 due to experiment being completed.
histogram.summary: The details (blacklist reason and whether the results were seen) of every search term issued by a tap gesture. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchContextualCardsIntegration.DataShown
histogram.summary: Whether Contextual Cards data was shown in the Contextual Search Bar. Contextual Cards data is included with the search term resolution response. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchContextualCardsIntegration.ResultsSeen
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen as part of a Contextual Search when Contextual Cards data was shown. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchDurationBetweenTriggerAndScrollNotSeen
histogram.summary: The duration between the panel being triggered and the panel being dismissed due to a scroll when search results were not seen. Implemented for Android. Prior to M57 this was recorded on tap and longpress; on M57+ it is only recorded on tap.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchDurationBetweenTriggerAndScrollSeen
histogram.summary: The duration between the panel being triggered and the panel being dismissed due to a scroll when search results were seen. Implemented for Android. Prior to M57 this was recorded on tap and longpress; on M57+ it is only recorded on tap.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchDurationNonPrefetched
histogram.obsolete: Discontinued on 2/2017 Due to data being buggy and not useful.
histogram.summary: The time from opening the panel until the SERP is fully loaded. Applies only to non-prefetched requests. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchDurationPrefetched
histogram.obsolete: Discontinued on 2/2017 Due to data being buggy and not useful.
histogram.summary: The time from opening the panel until the SERP is fully loaded. Applies only to prefetched requests. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchDurationSeen
histogram.summary: The time from initiating to ending a contextual search, when results were seen as part of the search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchDurationUnseen
histogram.summary: The time from initiating to ending a contextual search, when results were not seen as part of the search and the search did not end with the beginning of another contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchDurationUnseenChained
histogram.summary: The time from initiating to ending a contextual search, when results were not seen as part of the search and the search ended with the beginning of another contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchEnterClosed
histogram.summary: The details (previous state and reason) of the first entry into the closed panel state within a contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchEnterExpanded
histogram.summary: The details (previous state and reason) of the first entry into the expanded panel state within a contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchEnterMaximized
histogram.summary: The details (previous state and reason) of the first entry into the maximized panel state within a contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchEnterPeeked
histogram.summary: The details (previous state and reason) of the first entry into the peeked panel state within a contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchExitClosed
histogram.summary: The details (destination state and reason) of the first exit out of the closed panel state within a contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchExitExpanded
histogram.summary: The details (destination state and reason) of the first exit out of the expanded panel state within a contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchExitMaximized
histogram.summary: The details (destination state and reason) of the first exit out of the maximized panel state within a contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchExitPeeked
histogram.summary: The details (destination state and reason) of the first exit out of the peeked panel state within a contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchFallbackSearchRequestStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the Contextual Search fallback Search request. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchFirstRunFlowOutcome
histogram.summary: The state of the Contextual Search Preference after the first run flow. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchFirstRunPanelSeen
histogram.summary: Whether the first run flow's panel was seen as part of a contextual search. Only logged when the user triggered the first run flow yet exited the search still in the undecided preference state. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchIconSpriteAnimated
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen, whether the search provider icon sprite was animated when the panel first appeared, and the triggering gesture. If animation is disabled due to a field trial, we still log "animated" if the animation would have run otherwise.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchLiteralSearchDuration
histogram.summary: The time from starting a literal search until the results in the SERP start to become viewable. Applies only to prefetched requests. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchLowPrioritySearchRequestStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the Contextual Search low priority Search request. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchMandatoryPromoOutcomeByGesture
histogram.summary: The outcome of the mandatory Promo broken down by original triggering gesture. Logged for each view of the promo. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchNormalPrioritySearchRequestStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the Contextual Search normal priority Search request. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPanelOpenDuration
histogram.summary: The time from opening the panel beyond peek until the panel is closed. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPeekPromoCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Peek Promo was seen. This histogram will be emitted when the Panel closes. The panel is always visible when the Peek Promo is shown, so this histogram will always be emitted after a Promo is shown (except in the case of a crash). This histogram does not care whether the Panel was opened.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPeekPromoCountUntilOpened
histogram.summary: The number of times the Peek Promo was seen until the Panel was opened. This histogram will be emitted when the Panel closes, if the Panel was opened with the Peek Promo visible. If the Panel is not opened, nothing will be emitted.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPeekPromoOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of the Contextual Search Peek Promo for those who have seen the promo and for those who would have seen the promo if it was enabled, so we can compare the effect of the promo on users opening the Panel. This histogram will be emitted when the Panel closes, if the conditions to display the Peek Promo are met, regardless of whether the Peek Promo was actually visible (the Promo is controlled by Finch) and regardless of whether the Panel was opened.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPreferenceState
histogram.summary: The state of the Contextual Search Preference. Can be logged multiple times. Used to determine the population size (user view). Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPreferenceStateChange
histogram.summary: The Contextual Search preference state after a modification from the preference menu. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPrefetchSummary
histogram.obsolete: Discontinued on 2/2017 Due to data not being useful.
histogram.summary: A summary histogram for prefetch timings, indicating fully preloaded, etc. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPrevious28DayCtr
histogram.summary: The CTR from the previous 28 day period for each user, expressed as a percentage. Logged the first time the panel is closed in each new week. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPrevious28DayImpressions
histogram.summary: The number of user impressions of the Bar from the previous 28 day period. Logged the first time the panel is closed in each new week. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPreviousWeekCtr
histogram.summary: The CTR from the previous week for each user, expressed as a percentage. Logged the first time the panel is closed in each new week. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPreviousWeekImpressions
histogram.summary: The number of user impressions of the Bar from the previous week. Logged the first time the panel is closed in each new week. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPromoOpenCount
histogram.summary: The total count of times that the bar with the promo has been opened. Once the user decides, this counter is no longer updated.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPromoOutcomeByGesture
histogram.summary: The outcome of the promo broken down by original triggering gesture. Logged for each view of the promo. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPromoSeenByGesture
histogram.summary: Whether the promo was seen, broken down by original triggering gesture. Logged each time the promo was activated. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPromoTapsBeforeFirstOpen
histogram.summary: The historic number of taps that showed a peeking bar with the opt-out promo before the first time the user opened the panel.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPromoTapsForNeverOpened
histogram.summary: The historic number of taps that showed a peeking bar with the opt-out promo for users who have never opened the panel. This count may be limited by the Finch config param promo_on_limited_taps.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPromoTapsRemaining
histogram.summary: The number of remaining taps that can trigger the promo for this user. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchQuickActions.Category
histogram.summary: The category of quick actions shown in the Contextual Search bar. Recorded when the quick action is set. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchQuickActions.Clicked
histogram.summary: Whether a quick action in the Contextual Search bar was clicked. Recorded when Contextual Search is dismissed. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchQuickActions.IntentResolution
histogram.summary: Whether a Contextual Search quick action intent resolved to zero, one, or many apps. Recorded when the quick action intent URI is resolved. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchQuickActions.ResultsSeen
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen as part of a Contextual Search when a quick action was shown. Recorded when Contextual Search is dismissed. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchQuickActions.Shown
histogram.summary: Whether a quick action was shown in the Contextual Search bar. Recorded when the quick action is set. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchQuickAnswerSeen
histogram.summary: Whether a Quick Answer was activated, considered an answer, and seen. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchRecentScrollNotSeen
histogram.summary: The duration since a recent scroll when the results were not seen. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchRecentScrollSeen
histogram.summary: The duration since a recent scroll when the results were seen. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchRecentScrollSuppression
histogram.summary: Whether showing the Tap to Search UX in response to a Tap was suppressed by a recent scroll. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchResolutionDuration
histogram.summary: The time from starting a resolving search until the Search Term Resolves. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchResolvedSearchDuration
histogram.summary: The time from starting a resolving search until the results in the SERP start to become viewable. Applies only to prefetched requests. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchResolvedTermWords
histogram.summary: Whether the search term was single or multi-word, logged at the time that any Search Term Resolution Response is recieved.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchResultsSeen
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen as part of a contextual search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchResultsSeenByGesture
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen, broken down by original triggering gesture. Only includes users that have enabled. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchResultsSeenSelectionWasUrl
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2017 because it's no longer ever used.
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen (Contextual Search panel was opened) when the selection was part of a URL, broken down by original triggering gesture. Includes both users that have enabled Contextual Search and users that are undecided (have neither enabled or disabled the feature). Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchScreenTopSuppressed
histogram.summary: Whether Taps near the top of the screen was suppressed. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchSecondTapSeen
histogram.summary: Whether results were seen for a Tap during suppression when Tap Suppression is enabled. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchSelectionLengthNotSeen
histogram.summary: The length of the triggering selection when search results were not seen. Only logged when contextual search is triggered due to a tap. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchSelectionLengthSeen
histogram.summary: The length of the triggering selection when search results were seen. Only logged when contextual search is triggered due to a tap. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchSelectionLengthSuppression
histogram.summary: Whether a Tap was suppressed because the selection length was less than the minimum selection length. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchSelectionValid
histogram.summary: Whether a Contextual Search selection was valid. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchSerpLoadedOnClose
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2017 because the data is no longer valuable.
histogram.summary: Whether the SERP was fully loaded when an opened panel was closed.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchShouldTranslate
histogram.summary: Emitted when a translate one-box should be forced, to indicate if it actually was forced or simply would have been forced if not disabled by a flag in the variations_service.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchStartedWithCapitalResultsSeen
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2017 because the data is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen during a contextual search where the selected text started with a capital letter but was not all capital letters. Only logged when contextual search is triggered due to a tap. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTapsSinceOpenDecided
histogram.summary: The count of taps that showed a peeking bar without the opt-out promo since this user has last opened the panel.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTapsSinceOpenUndecided
histogram.summary: The count of taps that showed a peeking bar with the opt-out promo since this user has last opened the panel.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTapSuppressionSeen
histogram.summary: Whether results were seen for a Tap before suppression when Tap Suppression is enabled. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTapSuppressionSeen.AnyHeuristicSatisfied
histogram.summary: Whether results were seen for a Tap and whether any suppression heuristic was satisifed. Recorded when the UX is still shown (suppression not enabled, only logged). Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTimeToSearch
histogram.summary: The time between tapping on a word and performing a search. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTopLocationNotSeen
histogram.summary: The DPs count histogram for Taps that were not seen. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTopLocationSeen
histogram.summary: The DPs count histogram for Taps that were seen. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.DefaultSearchChangeOrigin
histogram.summary: The origin/cause of a change to the default search provider.

histogram.name: Search.DefaultSearchProvider
histogram.obsolete: Made obsolete around Chrome 32. Use Search.DefaultSearchProviderType instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of the default search engine that is loaded after Chrome startup. See src/chrome/browser/search_engines/prepopulate_engines.json for more info.

histogram.name: Search.DefaultSearchProviderType
histogram.summary: The type of the default search engine that is loaded when a profile is opened or after a profile reset. Note that at least one profile is opened on startup. Due to an error, there was a period from roughly May 9 2014 to May 23 2014 during which this was not being logged.

histogram.name: Search.DesktopSearch.RedirectionInfobarCloseAction
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2016 because desktop searches are no longer opened in the default browser.
histogram.summary: The action performed by the user to close the infobar explaining that a desktop search has been redirected to the default search engine.

histogram.name: Search.DesktopSearch.URLAction
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2016 because desktop searches are no longer opened in the default browser.
histogram.summary: The action performed when a desktop search URL is passed to the browser through the command line.

histogram.name: Search.GsaAccountChangeNotificationSource
histogram.summary: On Android, when GSA tells Chrome about an account change, what is the notification mechanism used, which is either the service connection, or a broadcast. Recorded once per account change.

histogram.name: Search.GsaBroadcastsAccountChanges
histogram.summary: On Android, whether GSA tells Chrome about account changes through the service or through a broadcast. This is reported at most once per Chrome startup.

histogram.name: Search.GsaProcessMemoryPss
histogram.summary: On Android, when Chrome connects to a bound service exposed by GSA, the memory footprint of the GSA process in KB, as measured by PSS. Reported at most once per Chrome startup.

histogram.name: Search.MigratedPrefToDictionaryValue
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated after migrator is deleted in 12/2016.
histogram.summary: The number of times that a user-selected DSE was migrated from separate String/List/..Value preferences to the new single DictionaryValue used in M36.

histogram.name: SearchAnswer.AnswerVisibleTime
histogram.summary: Time between showing and hiding the answer card.

histogram.name: SearchAnswer.LoadingTime
histogram.summary: Time between sending an answer server request and the end of loading of the answer card. Failed requests and requests not returning an answer are not counted.

histogram.name: SearchAnswer.NavigationTime
histogram.summary: Time between sending an answer server request and successful finish of navigation. Failed requests and requests not returning an answer are not counted.

histogram.name: SearchAnswer.RequestResult
histogram.summary: Result of a answer server request.

histogram.name: SearchAnswer.ResizeAfterLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time between successfully loading an answer card request and updating its preferred size. There might be no or more than one size update per card load. Size updates that happen before the card finishes loading are ignored since they are not visible.

histogram.name: Security.HTTPBad.NavigationStartedAfterUserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput
histogram.summary: Records the time from when a page was put into a warning state because of a sensitive input on an HTTP page until a navigation starts. Recorded at most once per main-frame navigation. The Finch trial 'mark-non-secure-as' controls whether the user sees an omnibox warning for this state, or just a console warning.

histogram.name: Security.HTTPBad.UserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on 2016-11-10 because this is replaced by two separate metrics: Security.HTTPBad.UserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput.CreditCard and Security.HTTPBad.UserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput.Password.
histogram.summary: Whether a "Not Secure" warning was shown in the omnibox because a security-sensitive form field was rendered in a non-secure context. Logged at most once per main-frame navigation.

histogram.name: Security.HTTPBad.UserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput.CreditCard
histogram.summary: Whether a "Not Secure" warning was shown in the omnibox because a credit card form field was rendered in a non-secure context. Logged at most once per main-frame navigation.

histogram.name: Security.HTTPBad.UserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput.Password
histogram.summary: Whether a "Not Secure" warning was shown in the omnibox because a password form field was rendered in a non-secure context. Logged at most once per main-frame navigation.

histogram.name: Security.HTTPBad.WebContentsDestroyedAfterUserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput
histogram.summary: Records the time delta between when a page was put into a warning state because of a sensitive input on an HTTP page and when the WebContents was destroyed. Recorded at most once per main-frame navigation, and it is not recorded if the user starts a navigation before the WebContents is destroyed. The Finch trial 'mark-non-secure-as' controls whether the user sees an omnibox warning for this state, or just a console warning.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Dangerous
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on an HTTPS URL that has been marked dangerous or not secure (such as for malware or broken HTTPS).

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Downgraded
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on a valid HTTPS URL that has a security issue (e.g. mixed content).

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Valid
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on a valid HTTPS URL with no security issues (e.g. no mixed content).

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpUrl.Dangerous
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on an HTTP URL that has been marked dangerous (such as for malware).

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpUrl.Neutral
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on an HTTP URL that does not have an omnibox security indicator warning associated with it.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpUrl.Warning
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on an HTTP URL that has been given a "Not secure" warning in the omnibox.

histogram.name: Security.XFrameOptions
histogram.summary: Record uses of the X-Frame-Options header when a page is loaded as an iframe.

histogram.name: SequencedWorkerPool.ShutdownDelayTime
histogram.summary: How long it takes to wait for tasks that block shutdown to complete.

histogram.name: SequencedWorkerPool.TaskCount
histogram.obsolete: Histogram wasn't even reported anymore when ownership was taken in 11/2015.
histogram.summary: How many pending tasks there are on each request for work from a worker thread.

histogram.name: SequencedWorkerPool.UnrunnableTaskCount
histogram.obsolete: Histogram wasn't even reported anymore when ownership was taken in 11/2015.
histogram.summary: How many tasks we skip over to find the next runnable task.

histogram.name: ServicesCustomization.LoadResult
histogram.summary: Records result of fetching and parsing OEM customization manifest. See ServicesCustomizationDocument class for more info. Used only on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken for the browser to find and possibly start an active worker to dispatch a FetchEvent for a main frame resource request. For context, a FetchEvent can only be dispatched to an ACTIVATED worker that is running (it has been successfully started). The measurements starts when the browser process receives the request. The browser then finds the worker appropriate for this request (if there is none, this metric is not recorded). If that worker is already started, the browser process can send the request to it, so the measurement ends quickly. Otherwise the browser process has to start the worker and the measurement ends when the worker is successfully started (we do not include in the time it takes for the worker to become ACTIVATED). The metric is not recorded in the following situations: 1) The worker was in state INSTALLED or ACTIVATING, and the browser had to wait for it to become ACTIVATED. This is to avoid including the time to execute the activate event handlers in the worker's script. 2) The worker was started for the fetch AND DevTools was attached during startup. This is intended to avoid including the time for debugging. 3) The request is for New Tab Page. This is because it tends to dominate the stats and makes the results largely skewed.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Type
histogram.summary: The type of preparation needed for the browser to find and possibly start an active worker to dispatch a FetchEvent for a main frame resource request. See details at ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The suffixed histograms for .Time record the time required for each type.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ActivateEvent.Time
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onactivate. Includes the time for waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ActivateEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onactivate. Includes the time for waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ActivateEventStatus
histogram.summary: The result of dispatching the activate event to the worker. This is recorded to both ServiceWorker.ActivateEventStatus and whichever of ServiceWorker.ActivateEventStatus_InShutdown ServiceWorker.ActivateEventStatus_NotInShutdown is appropriate. (InShutdown means the context was null or ServiceWorkerProcessManger::Shutdown was called.)

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.BackgroundFetchAbortEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a BackgroundFetchAbortEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.BackgroundFetchClickEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a BackgroundFetchClickEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.BackgroundFetchedEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a BackgroundFetchedEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.BackgroundFetchFailEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a BackgroundFetchFailEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.BackgroundSyncEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a SyncEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ContextRequestHandlerStatus
histogram.summary: The result of ServiceWorkerContextRequestHandler handling a request for a service worker script. The histogram is suffixed to distinguish new vs installed workers and main vs imported scripts.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Database.DestroyDatabaseResult
histogram.summary: Records result of destroy database operations in ServiceWorkerDatabase.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Database.OpenResult
histogram.summary: Records result of opening a database for ServiceWorkerDatabase.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Database.ReadResult
histogram.summary: Records result of read operations in ServiceWorkerDatabase.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Database.WriteResult
histogram.summary: Records result of write operations in ServiceWorkerDatabase.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCache.InitResult
histogram.summary: Records result of opening a disk cache for ServiceWorkerDiskCache.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCache.ReadResponseResult
histogram.summary: Records result of reading response from ServiceWorkerDiskCache.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCache.WriteResponseResult
histogram.summary: Records result of writing response into ServiceWorkerDiskCache.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCacheMigrator.MigrationResult
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because the migrator was removed as of 12/2015.
histogram.summary: Records result of ServiceWorkerDiskCacheMigrator::Start that migrates resources in BlockFile backend to Simple backend.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCacheMigrator.MigrationTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because the migrator was removed as of 12/2015.
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerDiskCache migration from BlockFile to Simple.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCacheMigrator.NumberOfMigratedResources
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because the migrator was removed as of 12/2015.
histogram.summary: The counts of resources migrated by ServiceWorkerDiskCacheMigrator. This includes the main script and imported scripts.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.EventDispatchingDelay
histogram.summary: The time taken between sending an event IPC from the browser process to a Service Worker and executing the event handler in the Service Worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.EventHandledRatioType.Fetch
histogram.summary: Records the proportion of (non foreign) fetch events that are handled compared to the number of events that are fired for a ServiceWorker. Recorded each time the ServiceWorker is stopped when at least one event was fired.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.EventHandledRatioType.ForeignFetch
histogram.summary: Records the proportion of foreign fetch events that are handled compared to the number of events that are fired for a ServiceWorker. Recorded each time the ServiceWorker is stopped when at least one event was fired.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ExtendableMessageEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching an ExtendableMessageEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ExternalRequest.Time
histogram.summary: The duration an external request spent to keep a service worker alive. Currently, extension service workers use external requests to keep the worker alive during the time the worker requests an extension API.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.Fallback.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a FetchEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a fallback-to-network reply.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.HasResponse.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a FetchEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a response. Includes the time for the respondWith() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.MainResource.Status
histogram.summary: The result of dispatching a fetch event to a Service Worker for a main resource request.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.Subresource.Status
histogram.summary: The result of dispatching a fetch event to a Service Worker for a subresource request.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.Time
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on 2015-07-13; please use ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.HasResponse.Time or ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.Fallback.Time.
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onfetch. Includes the time for the respondWith() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.WaitUntil.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a FetchEvent to a Service Worker and finishing the FetchEvent. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle. If there is no waitUntil promise, this will be almost the same with HasResponse.Time or Fallback.Time.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.FetchEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onfetch. Includes the time for the respondWith() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ForeignFetch.OriginCount
histogram.summary: The number of origins a particular service worker with foreign fetch registrations will intercept fetches from. A value of zero indicates that the foreign fetch service worker intercepts requests from any origin. Recorded at the end of a successful install event, if the service worker registered for foreign fetch. A service worker that registers for foreign fetch must always intercept fetches from at least one origin or intercept fetches from all origins.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ForeignFetch.ScopeCount
histogram.summary: The number of foreign fetch scopes a particular service worker registered for. Recorded at the end of every successful install event. A value of zero indicates that the service worker did not register for foreign fetch.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ForeignFetchEvent.Fallback.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a ForeignFetchEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a fallback-to-network reply. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle, if any.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ForeignFetchEvent.HasResponse.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a ForeignFetchEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a response. Includes the time for the respondWith() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ForeignFetchEvent.WaitUntil.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a ForeignFetchEvent to a Service Worker and finishing the ForeignFetch. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle. If there is no waitUntil promise, this will be almost the same with HasResponse.Time or Fallback.Time.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.InstallEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching an InstallEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.InstallEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.oninstall. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.InstallEventStatus
histogram.summary: The result of dispatching the install event to the worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.MainFramePageLoad
histogram.summary: Counts main frame page loads controlled by a service worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.MainFramePageLoad.CoreTransition
histogram.summary: The transition type for main frame page loads controlled by a service worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.MainFramePageLoad.RedirectChainLength
histogram.summary: Total length of the server redirects during main frame page loads controlled by a service worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.MessageEvent.Time
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onmessage.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.MessageEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onmessage.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationHintPrecision
histogram.obsolete: This experiment was turned down, see https://crbug.com/616502.
histogram.summary: The precision of the speculative launch of Service Workers for navigation hints. Recorded when the worker is stopped. If there was no main/sub frame fetch event fired on the worker, this value is false. This means that the speculative launch wasn't helpful.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.ConcurrentTime
histogram.summary: The duration of time when both (1) a service worker is being found and possibly started up, (2) the navigation preload request is in-flight. The measurement ends once either the worker is prepared, or the navigation preload response is received (OnReceiveResponse() is called). This is a rough estimate of the performance win of using navigation preload, ignoring concurrency overhead. This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event, with the same restrictions as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is additionally recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.FinishedBeforeStartWorker
histogram.summary: Whether the navigation preload response arrived before the activated and running service worker was prepared. This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event, with the same restrictions as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is additionally recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.HeaderSize
histogram.summary: The size of Service-Worker-Navigation-Preload header when the navigation preload request is to be sent. The default value of the header is "true", so the default size is 4.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.NavPreloadAfterSWStart
histogram.summary:
This is recorded in the case where the activated and running service worker was prepared before the navigation preload response arrived. It is the remaining time it took to receive the response after the worker was prepared.
This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event (for the case mentioned above), with the same restrictions as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is additionally recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.ResponseTime
histogram.summary: The time taken for the navigation preload response to start, i.e., when OnReceiveResponse() is called. This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is successfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event, with the same restrictions as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is additionally recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.SWStartAfterNavPreload
histogram.summary:
This is recorded in the case where the navigation preload response arrived before the activated and running service worker was prepared. It is the remaining time it took to prepare the worker after the response arrived.
This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event (for the case mentioned above), with the same restrictions as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is additionally recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NotificationClickEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a NotificationClickEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NotificationClickEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onnotificationclick.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NotificationCloseEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a NotificationCloseEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Counts page loads controlled by a service worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.PaymentRequestEvent.Time
