histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching an PaymentRequestEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.PushEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a PushEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.PushEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onpush.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.RequestTimeouts.Count
histogram.summary: The number of Service Worker request timeouts, by request type.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Runtime
histogram.summary: The amount of time a service worker ran for (wall time). Starts recording when the service worker finished starting, and stops when the service worker finished stopping. Not recorded if DevTools was attached to the service worker at some point while it was running.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ScriptCachedMetadataSize
histogram.summary: The length of cached metadata of Service Worker scripts. Logged on each load of Service Worker script only when the cached metadata is available. It doesn't include the size of imported scripts.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ScriptCachedMetadataTotalSize
histogram.summary: The total length of cached metadata of Service Worker scripts. Logged on each start of Service Worker only when the cached metadata is available. It includes the main script and imported scripts.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ScriptCount
histogram.summary: The counts of scripts per Service Worker. Logged on each start of Service Worker. It includes the main script and imported scripts.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ScriptLoadSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether loading the service worker script succeeded. Only recorded for installed service workers. Recorded by the browser process when reported back by the renderer during worker startup.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ScriptSize
histogram.summary: The length of Service Worker scripts. Logged on each load of Service Worker script. It doesn't include the size of imported scripts.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ScriptTotalSize
histogram.summary: The total length of Service Worker scripts. Logged on each start of Service Worker. It includes the main script and imported scripts.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.SendStopWorker.Status
histogram.summary: The result of trying to send the IPC message to a renderer process telling it to stop an embedded worker. Recorded in EmbeddedWorkerInstance::Stop. This was previously recorded for both the IPC and Mojo service worker implementations, but as of Jan 2017, this is only recorded for the IPC implementation. This histogram will be removed after the IPC implementation is removed.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartNewWorker.Status
histogram.summary: The result of trying to start a Service Worker that has not yet installed. See also ServiceWorker.StartWorker.Status for installed workers.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartNewWorker.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken to start a Service Worker that has not yet installed, from process allocation to ACK of started from the renderer (which occurs after script execution). This may include script download time. The metric is not recorded if DevTools was ever attached to the Service Worker during startup. See also ServiceWorker.StartWorker.Time for installed workers.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartWorker.AfterFailureStreak
histogram.summary: The result of trying to start a service worker after it has failed consecutively. Recorded only for installed workers.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartWorker.FailureStreak
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive startup failures of a service worker. Recorded each time the service worker failed (so there is double counting: failing twice results in 1 and 2 being logged). Only for installed workers.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartWorker.FailureStreakEnded
histogram.summary: When a worker startup succeeded after failing, the number of times the worker had consecutively failed. Recorded only for installed workers.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartWorker.Purpose
histogram.summary: The purpose for starting up a service worker. Recorded only for installed workers.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartWorker.Status
histogram.summary: The result of trying to start a Service Worker that is already installed. See also ServiceWorker.StartNewWorker.Status for new workers. See also ServiceWorker.StartWorker.StatusByPurpose_* for the breakdown by event type.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartWorker.StatusByPurpose
histogram.summary: The result of trying to start a service worker for a particular event type (see ServiceWorker.StartWorker.Status for the total). Only recorded for installed workers. For event type:

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartWorker.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken to start a Service Worker that is already installed, from process allocation to ACK of started from the renderer (which occurs after script execution). The metric is not recorded if DevTools was ever attached to the Service Worker during startup. See also ServiceWorker.StartNewWorker.Time for new workers.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartWorker.Timeout.StartPurpose
histogram.summary: Records the start purpose for a service worker that timed out while starting up. Recorded only for installed workers.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartWorker.TimeoutPhase
histogram.summary: The phase the EmbeddedWorker was in when ServiceWorker startup timed out.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StopWorker.Status
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code in Oct 2015, replaced with ServiceWorker.WorkerStopped.
histogram.summary: The result of trying to stop a Service Worker. Recorded only for installed Service Workers that succesfully stopped or were detected as stalling. If a worker stalled and later stopped, it will be recorded as both STALLED and STALLED_THEN_STOPPED.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StopWorker.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken to stop a Service Worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Storage.DeleteAndStartOverResult
histogram.summary: Records result of storage recovery operations in ServiceWorkerStorage.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Storage.DiskCacheMigrationResult
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because the migrator was removed as of 12/2015.
histogram.summary: Records the final result of diskcache migration in ServiceWorkerStorage. ServiceWorker.DiskCacheMigrator.MigrationResult records more detailed status of migration operations.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Storage.PurgeResourceResult
histogram.summary: Records successes and failures of purging a stale resource in ServiceWorkerStorage.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.TerminateThread.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken in the renderer process between the main thread asking the worker thread to terminate and getting ACK that it terminated.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.TimeBetweenEvents
histogram.summary: Called at the beginning of each ServiceWorkerVersion::Dispatch*Event function: the time elapsed since idle. Generally this is the time between one event ending and one event starting, if the worker remained running in the interim.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.UnhandledEventRatio
histogram.summary: Records the ratio of unhandled events to all events that are dispatched to each ServiceWorker. Recorded when each ServiceWorkerVersion is destructed.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.FallbackedRequestMode
histogram.summary: Records the the mode of request that was fallbacked to the network by the Service Worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.MainResource.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of a main resource request forwarded to a Service Worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.MainResource.StatusZeroError
histogram.summary: Records the error provided when the renderer returns a response with status code zero to a main resource request forwarded to a Service Worker (i.e., ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.MainResource.Result was REQUEST_JOB_ERROR_RESPONSE_STATUS_ZERO).

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.Subresource.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of a subresource request forwarded to a Service Worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.Subresource.StatusZeroError
histogram.summary: Records the error provided when the renderer returns a response with status code zero to a subresource request forwarded to a Service Worker (i.e., ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.Subresource.Result was REQUEST_JOB_ERROR_RESPONSE_STATUS_ZERO).

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.WorkerForMessageFound
histogram.summary: True if a message from the renderer intended for a browser-side embedded worker instance found its recipient. False if the instance did not exist when the message was received (e.g., it was a detached worker). Recorded in EmbeddedWorkerRegistry::GetWorkerForMessage.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.WorkerStopped
histogram.summary: The mechanism by which a service worker entered running status STOPPED.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Cache
histogram.summary: The time to perform operations on the Cache object in the ServiceWorker Cache API.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Cache.AddResponseType
histogram.summary: Records the response type to be added in the Cache by Cache.add()/addAll().

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Cache.AllWritesResponseType
histogram.summary: Records the response type to be added in the Cache by all operations that write to the cache.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.CacheStorage
histogram.summary: The time to perform operations on the CacheStorage object in the ServiceWorker Cache API.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.CreateCacheStorageResult
histogram.summary: Whether a new ServiceWorkerCacheStorage and its directory were successfully created on disk.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.IndexSizeDifference
histogram.summary: The absolute difference between the ServiceWorker Cache size saved to the CacheStorage index and the actual cache size when opened.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.InitBackendResult
histogram.summary: The result of opening the backend in the ServiceWorker Cache API.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Response.HasDeprecatedURL
histogram.summary: True if a response read from the CacheStorage has a url field. This field was deprecated in M57.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Scheduler.IsOperationSlow
histogram.summary: An operation is slow (true) if it takes at least 10 seconds to run. If an operation never completes, it will still be recorded as slow.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Scheduler.OperationDuration
histogram.summary: The time in ms from when an operation is started until it completes.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Scheduler.QueueDuration
histogram.summary: The time in ms from when an operation was queued until its task is posted.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Scheduler.QueueLength
histogram.summary: The number of operations in the scheduling queue just before enqueuing a new operation.

histogram.name: Session.ClosedTabCounts
histogram.summary:
The number of tabs closed by the user during the current session (launch/foregrounding to backgrounding).
This histogram is only logged on iOS when the application is backgrounded.

histogram.name: Session.NewTabCounts
histogram.summary:
The number of tabs created by the user during the current session (launch/foregrounding to backgrounding).
This histogram is only logged on iOS when the application is backgrounded.

histogram.name: Session.OpenedTabCounts
histogram.summary:
The number of times the user changed the active tab (this can happen when manually selecting a new tab, when a pre-rendered tab is made active, when closing the current tab and the next one is selected) during the current session (launch/foregrounding to backgrounding).
This histogram is only logged on iOS when the application is backgrounded.

histogram.name: Session.TotalDuration
histogram.summary:
The length of a session (launch/foregrounding to backgrounding) in milliseconds.
Desktop: This also takes into account user interaction and audio events. Starting from M55 the session length is recorded by discounting for default inactivity timeout.
Android: There is a known issue where JavaScript dialogs and other things that take focus away from the Chrome activity can cause this metric to record a session end prematurely. See: crbug.com/678276.

histogram.name: SessionCrashed.Bubble
histogram.summary: How did the user interact with the SessionCrashed Bubble?

histogram.name: SessionRestore.Actions
histogram.summary: The actions that have occurred in a session restore timeline. These are to be interpreted as raw event counts. Tabs are almost certainly deferred due to the existence memory pressure, but this may not always be the case.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.AllTabsLoaded
histogram.summary: The time from SessionRestore start until all tabs have finished loading.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.command_size
histogram.summary: The size of the commands written to disk. See SessionBackend for details.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.FirstTabPainted
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2014-10 in favor of SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint and ultimately SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint3.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstLoaded
histogram.summary: The time from SessionRestore start until a visible tab has finished loading.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-03-13 in favor of SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint2 and ultimately SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint3.
histogram.summary: Deprecated 2015-03-13 in favor of SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint2 and ultimately SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint3.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint2
histogram.summary: The time from SessionRestore start until a visible tab's first paint. This metric only records paints that have occurred after a tab has loaded.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint3
histogram.summary: The time from SessionRestore start until a visible tab's first paint.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.FrameUniqueNameLength
histogram.summary: Records the length of unique names for web frames that are saved as part of session restore data. It is logged each time the unique name changes, which typically happens when a web frame is first created or its name is changed by mutating window.name.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.last_session_file_size
histogram.summary: The size, in k, of the last session file on disk.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.NavEntryCommittedLongPeriod
histogram.summary: Like NavEntryCommittedPeriod, but specifically to provide a clearer breakdown of samples in the 10 minutes - 8 hours range.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.NavEntryCommittedPeriod
histogram.summary: Milliseconds between subsequent Save() operations due to a nav entry being committed (new tab created + nav initiated).

histogram.name: SessionRestore.NavigationListPrunedLongPeriod
histogram.summary: Like NavListPrunedPeriod, but specifically to provide a clearer breakdown of samples in the 10 minutes - 8 hours range.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.NavigationListPrunedPeriod
histogram.summary: Milliseconds between subsequent Save() operations due to the navigation list being pruned (typically a change in back/forward stacks).

histogram.name: SessionRestore.ParallelTabLoads
histogram.summary: The number of tabs that were loaded simultaneously when restoring a session.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.read_session_file_time
histogram.summary: Amount of time to read and assemble the commands from the last session.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.RestoredSubframeURL
histogram.summary: How often history navigations in subframes restore a different URL than the frame's default src URL. This indicates how much users rely on subframe session history items.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.RestoreSubframeFramePathLength
histogram.summary: Records the length of unique names that include frame paths, for subframes that are restoring a different URL than the frame's default src URL during a history navigation. Large values here would indicate a possible challenge for the plan to truncate frame unique names (to save memory).

histogram.name: SessionRestore.SaveLongPeriod
histogram.summary: Like SavePeriod, but specifically to provide a clearer breakdown of samples in the 10 minutes - 8 hours range.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.SavePeriod
histogram.summary: Amount of time between subsequent SessionService Save() operations (aka updates to session data).
histogram.details: Periods longer than 10 minutes are grouped together; see SaveLongPeriod for resolution.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.SubFrameUniqueNameChangedBeforeFirstCommit
histogram.summary: How often a subframe is assigned a new name between the initial empty document and the first navigation.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.TabActions
histogram.summary: A breakdown of key events that occur to individual tabs as they are processed by an ongoing session restore.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.TabClosedLongPeriod
histogram.summary: TabClosedPeriod, but specifically to provide a clearer breakdown of samples in the 10 minutes - 8 hours range.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.TabClosedPeriod
histogram.summary: Milliseconds between subsequent Save() operations due to a tab being closed.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.TabCount
histogram.summary: The number of tabs involved in a single session restore event.

histogram.name: SessionStorageDatabase.Commit
histogram.summary: The result of a commit to the sessionStorage database.

histogram.name: SessionStorageDatabase.Open
histogram.summary: The result (success, failure, or database recreated) of trying to open the LevelDB database for sessionStorage.

histogram.name: Settings.DefaultSearchProvider
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in Chrome 30. Use Search.DefaultSearchProviderType instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of the default search engine domain that is specified in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.EnforcementGroupDeterminedFromTrial
histogram.summary: Whether the SettingsEnforcement group was successfully determined from the field trial or if it had to revert to the hardcoded default.

histogram.name: Settings.FilterOnLoadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to run PrefHashFilter::FilterOnLoad on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.FilterSerializeDataTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to run PrefHashFilter::FilterSerializeData on the UI thread prior to writing the Preferences file to disk. Only logged when PrefHashFilter::FilterSerializeData actually had work to do.

histogram.name: Settings.GivenShowHomeButton_HomePageIsNewTabPage
histogram.summary: Whether or not the home page user preference is set to the default NTP value when a profile is loaded. This is only logged if the home button is shown.

histogram.name: Settings.HashesDictionaryTrusted
histogram.summary: Logged on profile load. Indicates whether the hashes dictionary for this profile is trusted.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageDomain
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in Chrome 30. Replaced by Settings.HomePageEngineType.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of the home page domain that is specified in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageEngineType
histogram.summary: Tries to pretend the home page URL is a search URL, and records the search engine type of that URL by comparing the TLD+1 of the home page URL with those of the different known search engines. Recorded when a profile is opened, if a home page URL has been set. Note that at least one profile is opened on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether or not the home page user preference is set to the default NTP value when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage.PulledFromSync
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The value of the home-page-is-new-tab-page pref when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage.PushedToSync
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The value of the home-page-is-new-tab-page pref when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.InitializedFromMasterPrefs
histogram.summary: Logged on first run when generating the Preferences file from master_preferences. True if serializing the generated Preferences file to disk was successful, false otherwise. Note: this event does not occur if there is no master_preferences file on first run.

histogram.name: Settings.JsonDataReadSizeKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size (in kilobytes) of the JSON settings read from disk on startup. Suffixed with the name of the corresponding JSON file.

histogram.name: Settings.JsonDataSizeKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the JSON settings content about to be written to disk in kilobytes. Suffixed with the name of the JSON file being written to disk.

histogram.name: Settings.JsonDataWriteCount
histogram.summary: The number of writes of a JSON file that occur in every 5 minute period of running Chrome. Suffixed with the name of the corresponding JSON file.

histogram.name: Settings.LegacyMachineIdGenerationSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether generation of the RLZ deterministic machine-specific device id was successful when creating the ProfilePrefStore.

histogram.name: Settings.LoadCompletedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the render frame host StartProvisionalLoad event and the render frame DocumentOnLoadCompleted event for the settings page.

histogram.name: Settings.LoadCompletedTime.MD
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the render frame host StartProvisionalLoad event and the render frame DocumentOnLoadCompleted event for the md-settings page.

histogram.name: Settings.LoadDocumentTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the render frame host StartProvisionalLoad and DidFinishDocumentLoad events for the settings page.

histogram.name: Settings.LoadDocumentTime.MD
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the render frame host StartProvisionalLoad and DidFinishDocumentLoad events for the md-settings page.

histogram.name: Settings.MachineIdGenerationSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether generation of the deterministic machine-specific device id was successful when initializing the PrefHashStore.

histogram.name: Settings.MigratedHashesFromLocalState
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in Chrome 54, as we stopped legacy migration of preferences.
histogram.summary: Whether, while loading a profile, any preference hashes were migrated from Local State to either Preferences or Protected Preferences.

histogram.name: Settings.PinnedTabEngineTypes
histogram.summary: Tries to pretend pinned tab URLs are search URLs, and records the search engine types of those URLs by comparing the TLD+1s of the URLs with those of the different known search engines. Recorded when a profile is opened, if there are pinned tabs. Note that at least one profile is opened on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.PinnedTabs
histogram.summary: The number of pinned tabs opened when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.PinUnlockSetup
histogram.summary: The users progress through the pin unlock setup wizard. Each type corresponds to the user completeing a different stage of the setup wizard.

histogram.name: Settings.RegisterProfilePrefsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during RegisterProfilePrefs.

histogram.name: Settings.SearchLength
histogram.summary: The number of characters typed in the chrome://settings page search box. Intended to determine if we are making the user type too much to find what they are looking for (the search is incremental).

histogram.name: Settings.SearchLengthNoMatch
histogram.summary: If no matches are found when searching within the chrome://settings page, record the length of the search text.

histogram.name: Settings.SearchPageMatchCount
histogram.summary: The number of search page hits within the chrome://settings page. This is especially important when the count is zero (i.e. we returned no hits for a given search in settings). A search is considered complete via timeout since there is no concrete way to define the end of a search (the search is incremental).

histogram.name: Settings.SearchSections
histogram.summary: If there is no further activity in the search box for 1 second, this records one tick each time a settings section is shown as a result of searching withing the chrome://settings page. If multiple matches are found within the same section, the section match is only recorded once.

histogram.name: Settings.SearchSubpageMatchCount
histogram.summary: The number of search subpage hits within the chrome://settings page. This is different from Settings.SearchPageMatchCount in that it is tracking hits in subpages rather than top level pages. See also Settings.SearchPageMatchCount.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton
histogram.summary: Whether or not the home button is enabled in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton.PulledFromSync
histogram.summary: The enabled state of the Home button pref when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton.PushedToSync
histogram.summary: The enabled state of the Home button pref when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.StartSetAsDefault
histogram.summary: The user clicked "Make Google Chrome the default browser" on the settings page.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageDomains
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in Chrome 30. Replaced by Settings.StartupPageEngineTypes.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The ids of startup page domains that are specified in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageEngineTypes
histogram.summary: Tries to pretend the startup page URLs are search URLs, and records the search engine types of those URLs by comparing the TLD+1s of the URLs with those of the different known search engines. Recorded when a profile is opened, if startup page URLs have been set. Note that at least one profile is opened on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings
histogram.summary: The startup page settings when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings.PulledFromSync
histogram.summary: The startup page setting when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings.PushedToSync
histogram.summary: The startup page setting when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadURLs
histogram.summary: The number of URLs to be loaded on startup when a profile is loaded, if the startup page setting is set to load URLs.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupURLsMigration
histogram.summary: The startup URLs pref migration steps.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupURLsResetTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed in milliseconds in between startup URLs pref migration. A value of 0 indicates that the last migration time was in the future due to e.g. an incorrect system time.

histogram.name: Settings.TimeToFirstSearch
histogram.summary: The time between when the chrome://settings page is opened to the first time a search is done within that page. This is intended to evaluate how long a user looks for a setting before giving up and searching for it.

histogram.name: Settings.TimeUntilInteractive
histogram.summary: The time until the settings Web UI is loaded, rendered, and interactive for users (as in they can change a setting). Automatically logged each time the settings page is opened (if not closed before interactive).

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceChanged
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference whose value has been changed since the last time Chrome set it. Without a suffix, this histogram stands for preference validation using MACs in the JSON pref files.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceCleared
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference whose value has been cleared since the last time Chrome set it. Without a suffix, this histogram stands for preference validation using MACs in the JSON pref files.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceInitialized
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference whose last value isn't known. We may be just starting to track the preference, or local state may have been changed outside of Chrome. This should only happen once per pref per profile. Without a suffix, this histogram stands for preference validation using MACs in the JSON pref files.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceMigrated
histogram.summary: Logs the tracked preference id when it is migrated to the new MAC algorithm. This should only happen once per pref per profile.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceMigratedLegacyDeviceId
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference whose value has not changed since the last time Chrome set it, but which was last set using a legacy device ID. Each user should report this at most once per preference id and immediately be migrated to the latest hashing model. Without a suffix, this histogram stands for preference validation using MACs in the JSON pref files.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceNullInitialized
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference which was initialized despite the absence of a MAC as its value was NULL. Without a suffix, this histogram stands for preference validation using MACs in the JSON pref files.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceReset
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference which was reset by Chrome.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesAlternateStoreVersion
histogram.summary: The version of a PrefHashStore, reported once for each alternate PrefHashStore (not associated to the default profile) from a delayed task on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesAlternateStoreVersionUpdatedFrom
histogram.summary: The previous version of an alternate PrefHashStore (not associated to the default profile) that was updated from a delayed task on startup. This should match Settings.TrackedPreferencesAlternateStoreVersion fairly closely for all versions but VERSION_LATEST which should never be reported here.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesInitializedForUnloadedProfile
histogram.summary: Preference tracking was initialized for an unloaded profile. This should happen at most once per profile.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesNoEnforcementOnDomain
histogram.summary: Whether settings enforcement was cancelled for a machine joined to a domain. Reported once per session on browser startup (note: this histogram was disabled for part of M40).

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceTrustedInitialized
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference which was initialized despite the absence of a MAC as the current MACs are trusted, inferring that this is a newly tracked pref. Without a suffix, this histogram stands for preference validation using MACs in the JSON pref files.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceUnchanged
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference whose value has not changed since the last time Chrome set it. Without a suffix, this histogram stands for preference validation using MACs in the JSON pref files.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceWantedReset
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference which Chrome would have reset had the config allowed it.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedSplitPreferenceChanged
histogram.summary: The number of items that had changed in a dictionary pref when Settings.TrackedPreferenceChanged is reported for that pref.

histogram.name: Settings.ZoomLevelPreferencesMigrated
histogram.summary: Tracks migration to per-partition zoom-level preferences during profile initialization.

histogram.name: SettingsAppMonitor.InitializationResult
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not the Windows Settings app monitor was initialized.

histogram.name: SettingsResetBubble.NumNoThanksPerReset
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the user clicked on the No Thanks button of the settings reset bubble before clicking on the Reset button in the same Chrome session.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.ConfigError
histogram.summary: Indicates if an error was detected in the settings reset prompt config data while initializing the reset prompt configuration.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.DelayBeforePromptParam
histogram.summary: The feature parameter determining the amount of time to wait after startup before attempting to show the settings reset prompt. Logged once after startup.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.DialogShown
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the settings reset prompt dialog was shown to the user.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.NumberOfExtensionsDisabled
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were disabled after the user accepted the settings reset prompt.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.NumberOfExtensionsToDisable
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that will be disabled if the user accepts the settings reset prompt. Logged once after startup.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.PromptAccepted
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the user accepted the settings reset prompt.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.PromptRequired
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the settings reset prompt should be shown to the user based on the state of the user's settings.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.ResetState
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the settings reset prompt is enabled for the user's setting, or the reason for it being disabled. Logged once after startup.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.SettingsReset
histogram.summary: Indicates which settings were reset after the user accepted the settings reset prompt.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.TimeUntilAccepted
histogram.summary: The time between the settings reset prompt dialog being shown and the user accepting the prompt.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.TimeUntilCanceled
histogram.summary: The time between the settings reset prompt dialog being shown and the user declining the prompt by clicking the cancel button.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.TimeUntilDeclined
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M59 in April 2017 and replaced by SettingsResetPrompt.TimeUntilCanceled and SettingsResetPrompt.TimeUntilDismissed.
histogram.summary: The time between the settings reset prompt dialog being shown and the user declining the prompt.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.TimeUntilDismissed
histogram.summary: The time between the settings reset prompt dialog being shown and the user dismissing the prompt, for example by clicking on the 'x' in the dialog or pressing the Escape key.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.ApplyArchivePatchTime
histogram.summary: The elapesed time to apply a patch to a previous version's chrome.7z archive to generate a new chrome.7z archive. This histogram only applies to diff updates.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.DeleteAppHost
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the legacy "app_host.exe" binary is deleted from the filesystem.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.DeleteAppLauncherClientsKey
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the legacy "app launcher" Clients key is deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.DeleteBinariesClientsKey
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the legacy "binaries" Clients key is deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.DeleteIExecuteCommandClassKey
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the COM registration for the legacy "IExecuteCommand" implementation class key is deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.DeleteInstallExtensionCommand
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the legacy "install-extension" app command is deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.HasArchivePatch
histogram.summary: True if the chrome.packed.7z archive contains a patch (in which case a diff update is taking place) or false if it contains a full archive (in which case a new install or a full update is taking place).

histogram.name: Setup.Install.LzmaUnPackNTSTATUS
histogram.summary: Record the NTSTATUS code of unpacking the contents of a 7z file.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.LzmaUnPackStatus
histogram.summary: Record the status of unpacking the contents of a 7z file.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.MultiChromeFrameRemoved
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when data from a legacy multi-install Chrome Frame is deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeAbort
histogram.summary: Number of calls to DeleteOldVerions() made by a --delete-old-versions process that didn't delete all files that belong to old versions of Chrome. A --delete-old-versions process exits when another process tries to acquire the SetupSingleton or after too many unsuccessful attempts to delete all old files. A --delete-old-versions process that successfully acquires the SetupSingleton records to either the Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeAbort histogram or the Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeSuccess histogram.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeSuccess
histogram.summary: Number of calls to DeleteOldVersions() made by a --delete-old-versions process that successfully deleted all files that belong to old versions of Chrome. A --delete-old-versions process that successfully acquires the SetupSingleton records to either the Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeAbort histogram or the Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeSuccess histogram.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.PeakPagefileUsage
histogram.summary: The peak page file usage by setup.exe in KB during install or uninstall attempt.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.PeakWorkingSetSize
histogram.summary: The peak working set size of setup.exe in KB during install or uninstall attempt.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.Result
histogram.summary: The final exit-result of the entire run of setup.exe on Windows.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.SingletonAcquisitionResult
histogram.summary: The result of trying to acquire a setup singleton. On Windows, a setup.exe process must hold the setup singleton of a Chrome installation when it makes changes to it.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.StrandedChromeIsUsed
histogram.summary: The disposition of a stranded Chrome install discovered while updating multi-install Chrome Binaries. This metric is only logged in an edge case. The buckets indicate whether or not the "stranded" Chrome install has been used in the last 28 days. If so, it respresents a Chrome that has not been updating due to a logic flaw in the installer and will be repaired in the current update. If not, it likely represents Chrome Binaries that were previously used by Chrome Frame that has since been uninstalled and that will be uninstalled in a future update.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.UncompressArchivePatchTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to uncompress a chrome.7z patch. This histogram only applies to diff updates.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.UncompressFullArchiveTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to uncompress a full chrome.7z archive. This histogram only applies to new installs and to full updates.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.UnpackFullArchiveTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to unpack the uncompressed chrome.7z archive. This histogram applies to all installs and updates.

histogram.name: SharedMemory.CreateError
histogram.summary: A histogram entry is emitted each time a base::SharedMemory object is constructed. The value of the entry indicates the type of error encountered during construction.

histogram.name: SharedMemory.CreateWinError
histogram.summary: A histogram entry is emitted each time a base::SharedMemory object could not be created due to a failed Windows system call. The value of the entry indicates the result of the GetLastError() API call.

histogram.name: SharedMemory.TimeSpentMakingAnonymousMemory
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-06 because the Finch experiment SharedMemoryCreateStrategy has finished running.
histogram.summary: The time spent making a new region of shared, anonymous memory. This metric is not emitted if the shared memory region is read only.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.RendererSurviveForWorkerTime
histogram.summary: A survival time of RenderProcessHostImpl for the In-renderer Shared Worker from when FastShutdownIfPossible() is called.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.TimeToDeleted
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a SharedWorkerHost. This roughly corresponds to the lifetime of SharedWorker.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.TimeToScriptLoaded
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of SharedWorkerHost until when WorkerScriptLoaded is called.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.TimeToScriptLoadFailed
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of SharedWorkerHost until when WorkerScriptLoadFailed is called.

histogram.name: ShortcutsProvider.DatabaseSize
histogram.summary: The number of entries in shortcuts backend's database when initialized, which happens during profile load.

histogram.name: ShortcutsProvider.QueryIndexTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the ShortcutsProvider to perform a query after the user has typed N characters.

histogram.name: Shutdown.browser_exit.time
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Shutdown.browser_exit.time2 to get more resolution into the tail of the distribution (10/2016).
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by the browser exit menu command.

histogram.name: Shutdown.browser_exit.time2
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by the browser exit menu command.

histogram.name: Shutdown.browser_exit.time_per_process
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by the browser exit menu command per renderer process.

histogram.name: Shutdown.end_session.time
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Shutdown.end_session.time2 to get more resolution into the tail of the distribution (10/2016).
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by an end session (user logs off, shuts down or reboots without explicitly exiting).

histogram.name: Shutdown.end_session.time2
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by an end session (user logs off, shuts down or reboots without explicitly exiting).

histogram.name: Shutdown.end_session.time_per_process
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by an end session (user logs off, shuts down or reboots without explicitly exiting) per renderer process.

histogram.name: Shutdown.renderers.slow
histogram.summary: The number of renderer processes that couldn't be shutdown quickly due to onbeforeunload or onunload listeners.

histogram.name: Shutdown.renderers.total
histogram.summary: The number of renderer processes running when shutdown was called.

histogram.name: Shutdown.ShutdownType
histogram.summary: The type of the last shutdown.

histogram.name: Shutdown.window_close.time
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Shutdown.window_close.time2 to get more resolution into the tail of the distribution (10/2016).
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by the last browser window being closed.

histogram.name: Shutdown.window_close.time2
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by the last browser window being closed.

histogram.name: Shutdown.window_close.time_per_process
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by the last browser window being closed per renderer process.

histogram.name: Signin
histogram.summary: Tracks user interactions as they sign in through a flow. The suffix of the histogram indicates what UI widget or application flow triggered the signin flow.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountEquality
histogram.summary: There are two separate ways to test for account equality, using the account id or the email. Historically the email was always used, but going forward email will be modifiable. Now when we check account equality we use both approaches and emit this metric to capture if they agreed or not.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountReconcilorState.OnGaiaResponse
histogram.summary: Records the state of the account reconcilor when GAIA returns a specific response.

histogram.name: Signin.AddAccount
histogram.summary: Track when chrome successfully adds an account. Failures are not tracked.

histogram.name: Signin.AndroidGetAccountsTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to retrieve the list of accounts from the system.

histogram.name: Signin.AndroidSigninPromoAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed this histogram since we have had newly designed histograms Signin.SigninStartedAccessPoint, Signin.SigninCompletedAccessPoint, and Signin.SigninReason.
histogram.summary: Track how a user interfacts with the android signin promo.

histogram.name: Signin.AuthError
histogram.summary: Log the type of GAIA authentication error that occur whenever the error state changes.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.ChromeAccountRelation
histogram.summary: The relation between the account signed into chrome, and the account(s) in the cookie jar. This metric is never recorded when not signed into chrome.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.SignedInCount
histogram.summary: The number of signed in accounts in the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.SignedOutCount
histogram.summary: The number of signed out accounts in the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.StableAge
histogram.summary: The amount of time since the cookie jar last changed.

histogram.name: Signin.CookieJar.TotalCount
histogram.summary: The total number of accounts in the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.DuringFirstRun
histogram.summary: Track if the profile sign in took place during First Run or not. Logged at signin time. True means signin took place during First Run, False means anytime after.

histogram.name: Signin.ElapsedTimeFromInstallToSignin
histogram.summary: Track how many minutes of local system time elapsed from when Chrome was installed to when Signin occured for this profile.

histogram.name: Signin.InvestigatedScenario
histogram.summary: Records the general type of signin that is occuring in relation to previous signin and local data.

histogram.name: Signin.IsShared
histogram.summary: Current best guess if this device is shared between multiple users.

histogram.name: Signin.ListAccountsFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of ListAccounts call failure during account reconciliation, ChromeOS login, or signin internals queries.

histogram.name: Signin.ListAccountsRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed ListAccounts call during Chrome OS login during account reconciliation, ChromeOS login, or signin internals queries.

histogram.name: Signin.OAuth2TokenGetFailure
histogram.summary: Reason fetching an OAuth2 Token failed. Available on all OSes.

histogram.name: Signin.OAuth2TokenGetRetry
histogram.summary: Reason fetching an OAuth2 Token is being retried. Available on all OSes.

histogram.name: Signin.OneClickConfirmation
histogram.summary: Count of the ways users interact with the confirmation dialogs of the new web based sign in to Chrome flow (accessed via the one click signin).

histogram.name: Signin.Reauth
histogram.summary: Tracks events related to the reauthentication Gaia page.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.AddedToChrome
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2014-09 because chrome no longer tries to reconcile from the cookie jar to the browser.
histogram.summary: How many accounts were added to the browser's token service because they were in the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.AddedToCookieJar
histogram.summary: How many accounts were added to the cookie jar because they were in the browser's token service.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.AllExternalCcResultCompleted
histogram.summary: Records whether all external connections have been successfully checked (a value of "true") or not ("false") when the reconciler attempts to perform MergeSession.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.DifferentPrimaryAccounts
histogram.summary: After execution of the account reconcilor, compares the primary account in the token service to the primary GAIA account of the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the execution time of the account reconciler.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.ExternalCcResultTime.Completed
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to successfully check all external connections whenever the reconciler performs a reconciliation.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.ExternalCcResultTime.NotCompleted
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to check only a portion of external connections whenever the reconciler performs a reconciliation. This means that either a network error occured while checking some sites or the site did not respond before the check timeout.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.RemovedFromCookieJar
histogram.summary: How many accounts were removed from the cookie jar because they were not in the browser's token service.

histogram.name: Signin.RefreshTokenAnnotationRequest
histogram.summary: Track when chrome successfully sends RefreshTokenAnnotationRequest.

histogram.name: Signin.SignedInDurationBeforeSignout
histogram.summary: Track how many minutes of real time (not browser active time) elapsed between profile signin and signout.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninCompletedAccessPoint
histogram.summary: Logs the original access point of each completed sign in.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninReason
histogram.summary: Logs the reason of each completed sign in.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninSource
histogram.obsolete: Removed this histogram since we have had newly designed histograms Signin.SigninStartedAccessPoint, Signin.SigninCompletedAccessPoint, and Signin.SigninReason.
histogram.summary: Logs the original source that displayed the signin or reauth Gaia page, before the page is displayed.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninStartedAccessPoint
histogram.summary: Logs the original access point that displayed the signin or reauth Gaia page, before the page is displayed.

histogram.name: Signin.SignoutDeleteProfile
histogram.summary: If the user chose to delete their profile or not when signing out of an unmanaged account. When the user is not given a choice this metric is not recorded.

histogram.name: Signin.SignoutProfile
histogram.summary: Track how a profile gets signed out.

histogram.name: Signin.TokenTable.GetAllTokensSqlStatementValidity
histogram.summary: Counts how many times the SQL statements to get all tokens is valid.

histogram.name: Signin.TokenTable.ReadTokenFromDBResult
histogram.summary: Counts the results of loading a refresh token from the token database.

histogram.name: Signin.UberTokenFailure
histogram.summary: Reason of failure to acquiring an ubertoken based on an already-minted access token. Available on all OSes.

histogram.name: Signin.UberTokenRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failure to acquire an ubertoken based on an already-minted access token. Available on all OSes.

histogram.name: Signin.XDevicePromo.BrowsingSessionDuration
histogram.summary: How long a browsing session was measured to be. Logged when a Browser window becomes active if the previous activation was longer than the minimum configured in the "CrossDevicePromo" experiment. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Signin.XDevicePromo.BrowsingSessionDurationComputed
histogram.summary: How often browsers are considered activated, which in turn triggers the CrossDevicePromo. Logged every time a Browser window becomes active. We need this to estimate QPS for RPC calls. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Signin.XDevicePromo.Eligibility
histogram.summary: The reasons for which a profile is or is not eligible for the Desktop Cross Device Sign In Promo. Logged every time a new Browsing session is detected as part of a Browser window becoming active. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Signin.XDevicePromo.Initialized
histogram.summary: Tracks if profiles initialized the XDevicePromo, and if not, why. Logged at Profile startup and (if not initialized then) when a new browsing session is detected during Browser window activation. Desktop only.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.CacheSizeOnInit
histogram.summary: The size of the cache at the time that the index has finished initializing.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.CheckCRCResult
histogram.summary: Whether or not the CRC was checked at the moment when the last reference to a read-only entry stream is closed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.CreationToIndex
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of the simple cache backend until the index has been loaded from disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.CreationToIndexFail
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of the simple cache backend until the index fails to load.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.DiskCloseLatency
histogram.summary: The time to close (write out footers and close the file) the cache entry on disk. Includes only successful operations.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.DiskCreateLatency
histogram.summary: The time to access (open for creation and write initial headers) the cache entry on disk. Includes only successful operations.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.DiskOpenLatency
histogram.summary: The time to access (open and read headers from all files) the cache entry on disk. Includes only successful operations.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.DiskWriteLatency
histogram.summary: The time to write a chunk to the cache entry on disk. Includes only successful operations.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryCreatedAndStream2Omitted
histogram.summary: Whether, upon creation of a new cache entry, the file for stream 2 was omitted since that stream was empty.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryCreationResult
histogram.summary: For entry creation operations that were sent to the disk, the result of creation.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryCreationTime
histogram.summary: The time, in ms, spent creating a new entry on disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryOpenedAndStream2Removed
histogram.summary: Whether, upon opening of an existing cache entry, stream 2 was empty and the file for that stream was therefore removed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryOperationsPending
histogram.summary: At the time that operations are run, the number of pending operations on a particular entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.CacheSizeOnStart
histogram.summary: The size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.CacheSizeOnStart2
histogram.summary: The size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.EntryCount
histogram.summary: The number of entries to be erased in an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.MaxCacheSizeOnStart
histogram.summary: The maximum allowed size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.MaxCacheSizeOnStart2
histogram.summary: The maximum allowed size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.Result
histogram.summary: The result of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.SizeOfEvicted
histogram.summary: The number of bytes to be erased in an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.SizeOfEvicted2
histogram.summary: The amount of memory freed in an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.SizeWhenDone
histogram.summary: The size of the cache after running an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.SizeWhenDone2
histogram.summary: The size of the cache after running an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.TimeToDone
histogram.summary: Time spent completing an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.TimeToSelectEntries
histogram.summary: Time spent selecting entries for eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.FileDescriptorLimitHard
histogram.summary: The maximum limit of how many file descriptors a process can open. Emitted each time the browser is launched, if the limit could be retrieved. (This is the highest value we could raise the current limit to if we liked.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.FileDescriptorLimitSoft
histogram.summary: The current limit of how many file descriptors a process can open. Emitted each time the browser is launched, if the limit could be retrieved. (We can raise this to the maximum limit if we like, without root access.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.FileDescriptorLimitStatus
histogram.summary: The result of trying to get the file descriptor limit. Emitted each time the browser is launched.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.GlobalOpenEntryCount
histogram.summary: The number of open entries across all caches backed by the Simple Cache. An entry is opened whenever a caller asks to open it to read or write cache data, and remains open until the last caller asks to close it. Logged whenever an entry is opened or closed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSize
histogram.summary: The size of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are written or rewritten.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeChange
histogram.summary: How the header size has changed in a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time a write operation occurs on the header stream. (This includes the initial write, rewrites, and other writes that we couldn't classify.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeDecreaseAbsolute
histogram.summary: The absolute size decrease of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a smaller size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeDecreasePercentage
histogram.summary: The relative size decrease of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a smaller size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeIncreaseAbsolute
histogram.summary: The absolute size increase of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a larger size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeIncreasePercentage
histogram.summary: The relative size increase of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a larger size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexCorrupt
histogram.summary: For each index load, whether the index file was corrupt.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexCreatedEntryCount
histogram.summary: The number of entries in a newly created index file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexEntriesLoaded
histogram.summary: Number of entries loaded from the index file on start.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexEntriesRestored
histogram.summary: Number of entries restored from disk when there was no index or the index was corrupted.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexFileStateOnLoad
histogram.summary: The state the index file is at when an attempt is made to load from it.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexInitializationWaiters
histogram.summary: At the time of index initialization, the number of enqueued jobs awaiting index initialization.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexInitializeMethod
histogram.summary: The method used to initialize the simple cache index.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time (as measured on the worker pool) spent loading the index file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexNumEntriesOnInit
histogram.summary: The number of entries in the index at the time that the index has finished initializing.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexNumEntriesOnWrite
histogram.summary: The number of entries written to the index on a flush.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexRestoreTime
histogram.summary: Time (as measured on the worker pool) spent restoring the index file by iterating directory entries.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexStale
histogram.summary: For each index load, whether the index file was stale.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteInterval.Background
histogram.summary: The interval between index saves, for apps in the background.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteInterval.Foreground
histogram.summary: The interval between index saves, for apps in the foreground.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteReason
histogram.summary: The reason an index was written to disk. Recorded every time an index is saved.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteReasonAtLoad
histogram.summary: Recorded immediately after loading a fresh index (INDEX_STATE_FRESH or INDEX_STATE_FRESH_CONCURRENT_UPDATES), the reason the loaded index was written to disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteToDiskTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteToDiskTime.Background
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, for apps in the background, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteToDiskTime.Foreground
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, for apps in the foreground, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.KeyMatchedOnOpen
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-05 as the match checking was moved back into the entry itself, so this result is now reported in the SimpleCache.x.SyncOpenResult histograms.
histogram.summary: For each call to OpenEntry, whether the key on disk matched the request key.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.LastClusterLossPercent
histogram.summary: For each file in the Simple Cache, the percentage of disk space used by the cluster loss, the unused disk space in the last 4096 byte cluster of the file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.LastClusterSize
histogram.summary: For each file in the Simple Cache, the number of bytes in the last 4096 byte cluster when the entry is saved to disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.MaxCacheSizeOnInit
histogram.summary: The maximum allowed size of the cache at the time that the index has finished initializing.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.OpenEntryIndexState
histogram.summary: At the time that an entry is opened, the state of that entry in the index.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.PercentFullOnInit
histogram.summary: The fullness (in percent) of the cache at the time that the index has finished initializing. The percentage is calculated as (cache_size * 100) / max_cache_size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.QueueLatency.CreateEntry
histogram.summary: Delay between when the I/O portion of CreateEntry is enqueued and when its execution begins.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.QueueLatency.OpenEntry
histogram.summary: Delay between when the I/O portion of OpenEntry is enqueued and when its execution begins.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.ReadIsParallelizable
histogram.summary: For each Read operation, whether it could have been issued in parallel of a previous Read operation.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.ReadResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::ReadData in the simple cache.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.StaleIndexExtraEntryCount
histogram.summary: Count of the number of entries recorded in the index, but not actually present in the cache. Recorded each time a stale index is found and a directory rescan is required.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.StaleIndexMissedEntryCount
histogram.summary: Count of the number of entries present in a cache, but not recorded in the index. Recorded each time a stale index is found and a directory rescan is required.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.StaleIndexQuality
histogram.summary: The quality of a "stale" index compared to a full directory rescan. Recorded immediately after every directory scan for stale indexes.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCheckEOFHasCrc
histogram.summary: For each EOFRecord found with a valid magic number, indicates if the record also contains a CRC.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCheckEOFResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, of checking the EOF record of a cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCloseResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, of closing a cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCreatePlatformFileError
histogram.summary: The platform error reported when attempting to create a new cache entry at the synchronous layer.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCreateResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, reported when attempting to create a new cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncKeySHA256Result
histogram.summary: The result of the the key SHA256 check done when opening stream 0 for each entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenEntryAge
histogram.summary: The age of the entry (time since last modified), when opened at the synchronous layer.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenPlatformFileError
histogram.summary: The platform error reported when attempting to create a new cache entry at the synchronous layer.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, reported when attempting to open a new cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncWriteResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, of writing to a cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.WriteDependencyType
histogram.summary: Shows whether a write operation depends on the previous operation in queue particularly in the aspect of its possibility to run in parallel.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.WriteResult
histogram.obsolete: Replaced 2013/09/03 by WriteResult2, which adds "fast empty return", which previously showed up as "success".
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::WriteData in the simple cache.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.WriteResult2
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::WriteData in the simple cache.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.Event
histogram.summary: Events in reqests processing of IP-based SimpleGeolocation.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.HasCellTowers
histogram.summary: This boolean histogram counts SimpleGeolocationRequests carrying a nonzero number of cell towers.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.HasWiFiAccessPoints
histogram.summary: This boolean histogram counts SimpleGeolocationRequests carrying nonzero number of WiFi access points.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: Http response codes in IP-based SimpleGeolocation.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.ResponseFailureTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (failed) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.ResponseSuccessTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (successfull) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.Result
histogram.summary: Result of SimpleGeolocationRequest.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.Retries
histogram.summary: Number of retries until the final response was recorded.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.DaysSinceLastShortcutLaunch
histogram.summary: The number of days between launches of an origin saved to homescreen or as a bookmark app shortcut. Recorded at the second and each following launch of a specific origin from a shortcut, independently per origin.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementPercentageForHTTPS
histogram.summary: The percentage of total site engagement accumulated by this profile for HTTPS URLs as a proportion of all engagement for HTTPS and HTTP URLs. Recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore
histogram.summary: Distribution of the engagement scores accumulated by a user, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore.HTTP
histogram.summary: Distribution of the engagement scores accumulated by a user, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Limited specifically to HTTP URLs.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore.HTTPS
histogram.summary: Distribution of the engagement scores accumulated by a user, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Limited specifically to HTTPS URLs.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore.IsZero
histogram.summary: The distribution of zero versus non-zero engagement scores accumulated by the user, recorded at the same time as SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScoreBucket
histogram.summary: The percentage of sites on a user's profile that have engagement scores that fall in these buckets, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementType
histogram.summary: The type of engagement (navigation, user input, etc.) which led to an accumulation in site engagement.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.MeanEngagement
histogram.summary: The mean site engagement per origin accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.MedianEngagement
histogram.summary: The median site engagement per origin accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsEngaged
histogram.summary: The total number of origins with a non-zero site engagement score for this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsWithMaxDailyEngagement
histogram.summary: The number of origins which have reached the daily site engagement point cap, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Thus, each bin N contains the number of clients where at least N origins have reached the maximum daily site engagement point cap.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsWithMaxEngagement
histogram.summary: The number of origins which have reached the absolute site engagement point cap, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Thus, each bin N contains the number of clients where at least N origins have reached the maximum absolute site engagement point cap.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.PercentOriginsWithMaxEngagement
histogram.summary: The percentage of all origins recorded by the site engagement service which have reached the absolute site engagement point cap, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.TotalEngagement
histogram.summary: The total site engagement accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.AllResponses
histogram.summary: The count of all network responses received by a renderer. Each response is corresponding to one URL requested by a renderer. Incremented when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.BrowsingInstanceCount
histogram.summary: The count of all current BrowsingInstances. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CurrentRendererProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of all renderer processes, including WebUI and extensions. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Happens to be the number of unique sites. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateExtensionsProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only Chrome extensions, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateExtensionsProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only Chrome extensions, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateExtensionsProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated only Chrome extensions and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateExtensionsTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated only Chrome extensions, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Happens to be the number of isolated sites. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateNothingProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the estimated renderer process count if we isolated no sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateNothingProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated no sites, subject to the process limit. Happens to be the number of isolated sites. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateNothingProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated no sites and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateNothingTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated no sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.OutOfProcessIframes
histogram.summary: The count of all out-of-process iframes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ProxyCount
histogram.summary: The count of all RenderFrameProxyHosts. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ProxyCountPerBrowsingInstance
histogram.summary: The count of RenderFrameProxyHosts in each BrowsingInstance. Recorded each UMA ping, once per BrowsingInstance.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.SiteInstancesPerBrowsingInstance
histogram.summary: The count of SiteInstances in a single BrowsingInstance. Recorded each UMA ping, once per BrowsingInstance.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.DataLength
histogram.summary: The number of bytes in the first network packet for a response with headers that imply potential illegal cross-site access. Recorded when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked
histogram.summary: The count of blocked cross-site document responses due to having HTML content type header and contents sniffed as HTML. Sampled with value of 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to their HTML contents. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.) among blocked cross-site document responses due to their HTML contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode2
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.) among blocked cross-site document responses due to their HTML contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-17) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.NoSniffBlocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
