histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to having HTML content type and nosniff headers. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.NoSniffBlocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to having HTML content type and nosniff headers. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.NoSniffBlocked.RenderableStatusCode2
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to having HTML content type and nosniff headers. Sampled with a resource type (0-17) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.NotBlocked
histogram.summary: The count of not blocked responses despite having an HTML content type header due to the failure of content sniffing. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.NotBlocked.MaybeJS
histogram.summary: The count of responses that may be parsed as JavaScript among not blocked responses. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.Blocked
histogram.summary: The count of blocked cross-site document responses due to having JSON content type header and contents sniffed as JSON. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.Blocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to their JSON contents. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to their JSON contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode2
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to their JSON contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-17) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.NoSniffBlocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to having JSON content type and nosniff headers. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.NoSniffBlocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to having JSON content type and nosniff headers. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.NoSniffBlocked.RenderableStatusCode2
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to having JSON content type and nosniff headers. Sampled with a resource type (0-17) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.NotBlocked
histogram.summary: The count of not blocked responses despite having an JSON content type header due to the failure of content sniffing. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.NotBlocked.MaybeJS
histogram.summary: The count of responses that may be parsed as JavaScript among not blocked responses with a JSON content type header. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.MimeType
histogram.summary: MIME type codes for content type header values of potentially cross-site document responses, excluding same-site or not http(s) urls. Sampled with a MIME type code (0-4) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.HTML.Blocked
histogram.summary: The count of blocked cross-site document responses due to having Plain content type header and contents sniffed as HTML. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.HTML.Blocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked responses due to their Plain.HTML contents. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.HTML.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to their Plain.HTML contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to their Plain.HTML contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-17) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.JSON.Blocked
histogram.summary: The count of blocked cross-site document responses due to having Plain content type header and contents sniffed as JSON. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.JSON.Blocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to their Plain.JSON contents. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.JSON.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to their Plain.JSON contents. histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to their Plain.JSON contents. histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to having Plain content type and nosniff headers. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to having Plain content type and nosniff header. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.NoSniffBlocked.RenderableStatusCode2
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to having Plain content type and nosniff header. Sampled with a resource type (0-17) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.NotBlocked
histogram.summary: The count of not blocked responses despite having an Plain content type header due to the failure of content sniffing. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.NotBlocked.MaybeJS
histogram.summary: The count of responses that may be parsed as JavaScript among not blocked responses with a Plain content type header. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.XML.Blocked
histogram.summary: The count of blocked cross-site document responses due to having Plain content type header and contents sniffed as XML. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.XML.Blocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to their Plain.XML contents. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.XML.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with renderable HTTP status codes sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to their Plain.XML contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.summary: The count of responses with renderable HTTP status codes sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to their Plain.XML contents. histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to having XML content type and nosniff headers. histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.XML.NotBlocked.MaybeJS

histogram.name: Skia.DrawScaleFactor
histogram.summary: The scale factor of any images drawn by Skia.

histogram.name: Skia.DrawTiled
histogram.summary: Whether a call to drawBitmap(Rect) or drawImage(Rect) used the tiled or non-tiled rasterization path.

histogram.name: Skia.FilterQuality
histogram.summary: The count of images drawn by Skia with a given filter quality.

histogram.name: Skia.LockTexturePath
histogram.summary: The path taken by Skia when it attempts to lock a texture for use.

histogram.name: Snackbar.Shown
histogram.summary: Records how many times a particular snackbar was shown to the user.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Cleaner.HasCompleted
histogram.summary: The state of software reporter cleaner tool runs. A value of "Not Completed" can mean either the tool crashed, or the tool was still running when Chrome checked.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Cleaner.HasRebooted
histogram.summary: Whether a reboot happened since the software reporter cleaner tool has finished execution with a pre-reboot exit code.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Cleaner.RunningTime
histogram.summary: How long it took to run the software reporter cleaner tool.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Cleaner.Version
histogram.summary: The build version of the software reporter cleaner tool.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.ExperimentErrors
histogram.summary: Whether a configuration error prevented the experimental Software Reporter from running.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.FoundUwSReadError
histogram.summary: Whether there was an error reading the registry key containing UwS found by the Software Removal Tool.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.LastUploadResult
histogram.summary: The result of the most recent SRT log upload.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.LogsUploadEnabled
histogram.summary: If logs uploads are enabled in the Software Reporter or the reason why it is disabled. Recorded before each run of the Software Reporter.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.LogsUploadResult
histogram.summary: The result of the most recent Software Reporter logs upload. Written by the Software Reporter in the registry and sent by Chrome after the reporter finishes.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.LogsUploadResultRegistryError
histogram.summary: Error encountered when reading the software reporter logs upload result from the registry.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.MajorVersion
histogram.summary: As SoftwareReporter.MinorVersion, but a double word combination of the other components of the version of the software reporter. The high word is the first component when there are more than one, and the low word is either the second or third one, depending if there are at least 3, or 4 components.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.MemoryUsed
histogram.summary: The memory used by the software reporter tool as reported by the tool itself via the registry. Logged just after the software reporter tool has finished.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.MinorVersion
histogram.summary: The last component of the version of the software reporter that was executed so we can identify when users are not getting their component updated as quickly as we expect it.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.PromptUsage
histogram.summary: Usage of the Software Removal Tool (SRT) Prompt.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.RunningTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to run the software reporter tool as reported by the tool itself via the registry. Logged just after the software reporter tool has finished.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.RunningTimeAccordingToChrome
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took for the software reporter to run as measured by chrome. Logged just after the software reporter tool has finished.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.RunningTimeRegistryError
histogram.summary: Error encountered when reading the software reporter tool's start and end times from the registry.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Step
histogram.summary: The registration and execution steps for the software reporter.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.UploadFailureCount
histogram.summary: The total count of SRT log upload failures experienced by this machine for all time. This value is reported at startup by Chrome and is capped at 64.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.UploadLongestFailureRun
histogram.summary: The longest run of upload failures logged by SRT runs. This value is reported at startup by Chrome and is capped at 64.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.UploadSuccessCount
histogram.summary: The total count of successful SRT log uploads experienced by this machine for all time. This value is reported at startup by Chrome and is capped at 64.

histogram.name: SpecialLocale.PromotionDialog
histogram.summary: Records how users interact with the special locale promotion dialog.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Android.Available
histogram.summary: Whether the Android spellchecking service was available at the start of a new spellchecking session. Note that the user can disable the Android spellchecking service in settings, in which case it will show up as not available in the histogram.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.Android.Latency
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to receive results from the spellchecking service on Android. More precisely this is the SystemClock.elapsedRealtime() between the SpellCheckerSession.getSentenceSuggestions() and the invocation of the onGetSentenceSuggestions() callback.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SpellingService.Enabled
histogram.summary: Whether the user has opted in to asking Google for spelling suggestions. Recorded both when spelling is initialized and when the preference is changed.

histogram.name: Sqlite.AppCache.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the appcache db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.AutoCommitTime
histogram.summary: Record times for INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE statements run outside of an explicit transaction.

histogram.name: Sqlite.CloseFailure
histogram.summary: Error which prevented database close.

histogram.name: Sqlite.CommitTime
histogram.summary: Record time spent in explicit COMMIT statements.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Cookie.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite the cookie db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.DatabaseTracker.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite the websqldb tracker db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.DeprecationVersionResult
histogram.summary: Annotations for which bits of sql::MetaTable::CheckDeprecated() fire.

histogram.name: Sqlite.DomainBoundCerts.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the domain-bound certs db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.DomStorageDatabase.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the domstorage db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Error
histogram.summary: SQLite extended error codes.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Error.IOERR
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: SQLite extended SQLITE_IOERR codes for all databases.

histogram.name: Sqlite.History.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the history db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.MemoryKB.OneDay
histogram.summary: SQLite memory footprint from sqlite3_memory_used() recorded 1 day after first database is opened by sql::Connection.

histogram.name: Sqlite.MemoryKB.OneHour
histogram.summary: SQLite memory footprint from sqlite3_memory_used() recorded 1 hour after first database is opened by sql::Connection.

histogram.name: Sqlite.MemoryKB.OneWeek
histogram.summary: SQLite memory footprint from sqlite3_memory_used() recorded 1 week after first database is opened by sql::Connection.

histogram.name: Sqlite.MemoryKB.TenMinutes
histogram.summary: SQLite memory footprint from sqlite3_memory_used() recorded 10 minutes after first database is opened by sql::Connection.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Migration.History
histogram.summary: Time used to migrate History database schema to a new version.

histogram.name: Sqlite.OpenFailure
histogram.summary: Error which prevented database open.

histogram.name: Sqlite.OpenProbeFailure
histogram.summary: Error from first read of the database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.QueryTime
histogram.summary: Record times for all statements run against the database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Quota.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the quota db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RazeDatabase
histogram.summary: Errors attempting to Raze() database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RazeDatabase2
histogram.summary: Errors on second attempt to Raze() database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RazeDatabaseTruncate
histogram.summary: Errors truncating database for Raze().

histogram.name: Sqlite.RecoveryAttachError
histogram.summary: SQLite error code from failed ATTACH in sql::Recovery::Init().

histogram.name: Sqlite.RecoveryEvents
histogram.summary: Records specific failure and success cases in sql::Recovery implementation, to determine which cases warrant further development. This histogram tracks detected errors, some of which may cause multiple results. See recovery.cc for details.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RecoveryHandle
histogram.summary: Error from sqlite3_backup_init() in sql::Recovery.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RecoveryStep
histogram.summary: Error from sqlite3_backup_step() in sql::Recovery.

histogram.name: Sqlite.SizeKB
histogram.summary: Size in kilobytes of pre-existing database at startup.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Stats
histogram.summary: Stats for different API calls in sql/.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Text.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite the full text db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Thumbnail.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite for the thumbnail db.

histogram.name: Sqlite.UpdateTime
histogram.summary: Record times for statements which could update the database file. Includes commit and autocommit time.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Version
histogram.summary: Version of pre-existing database at startup.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Vfs
histogram.summary: Buffer sizes passed to browser-process SQLite VFS functions.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Vfs_Events
histogram.summary: I/O operations measured by browser-process SQLite VFS wrapper.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Web.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error codes returned by sqlite the web db.

histogram.name: sri.resource_integrity_mismatch_event
histogram.summary: When resources are checked for mismatching integrity and whether the mismatch forces a refetch.

histogram.name: SSL.CertificateErrorReportFailure
histogram.summary: Users can opt in to send reports of certificate validation errors to Google. This records the error code whenever Chrome fails to send such a report.

histogram.name: SSL.ExpectCTReportFailure
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 07/2016. Replaced with SSL.ExpectCTReportFailure2.
histogram.summary: Sites can opt in to Expect CT, a reporting feature that sends a report whenever a TLS connection does not have valid Certificate Transparency information associated with it. This records the error code when Chrome fails to send an Expect CT report.

histogram.name: SSL.ExpectCTReportFailure2
histogram.summary: Sites can opt in to Expect CT, a reporting feature that sends a report whenever a TLS connection does not have valid Certificate Transparency information associated with it. This records the error code when Chrome fails to send an Expect CT report.

histogram.name: SSL.ExpectCTReportSendingAttempt
histogram.summary: Sites can opt in to Expect CT, a reporting feature that sends a report whenever a TLS connection does not have valid Certificate Transparency information associated with it. This metric fires whenever Chrome attempts to send an Expect CT report.

histogram.name: SSL.InsecureContent
histogram.summary: Keeps track of various insecure content events, such as loading an HTTP script from an HTTPS page.

histogram.name: SSL.MarkHttpAsStatus
histogram.summary: Reports whether the user has selected to mark HTTP origins with an experimental UI treatment (such as showing a warning on HTTP pages that collect sensitive information). This histogram is recorded whenever the security level (the overall security state of a page, roughly corresponding to the lock icon) is computed for an HTTP page.

histogram.name: SSL.MarkNonSecureAsStatus
histogram.summary: Reports whether the user has selected to mark non-secure origins as Neutral (the status quo), Dubious, or Non-Secure.

histogram.name: Stability.Android.PendingMinidumpsOnStartup
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M60. Roughly 50% of Chrome startups that had *any* pending minidumps had at least one pending minidump without any logcat output. About 5% had multiple minidumps without any logcat output.
histogram.summary: The number of un-uploaded minidumps present in the Android Crash Reports directory. Each minidump file (should) correspond to a crash. This is recorded on startup, just prior to initiating uploading for these minidumps. This is intended as a temporary metric, to be removed around M60: http://crbug.com/699785

histogram.name: Stability.Android.PendingMinidumpsOnStartup.SansLogcat
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M60. Roughly 50% of Chrome startups that had *any* pending minidumps had at least one pending minidump without any logcat output. About 5% had multiple minidumps without any logcat output.
histogram.summary: The number of un-uploaded minidumps present in the Android Crash Reports directory that do not yet have logcat output attached. Each minidump file (should) correspond to a crash. This is recorded on startup, just prior to initiating uploading for all pending minidumps. This is intended as a temporary metric, to be removed around M60: http://crbug.com/699785

histogram.name: Stability.BadMessageTerminated.Chrome
histogram.summary: Count of processes killed by chrome/browser because they sent an IPC that couldn't be properly handled. Categories are the reasons (code locations) for the kills.

histogram.name: Stability.BadMessageTerminated.Content
histogram.summary: Count of child processes killed because they sent an IPC that couldn't be properly handled. Categories are the reasons (code locations) for the kills.

histogram.name: Stability.BadMessageTerminated.Extensions
histogram.summary: Count of extension processes killed because they sent an IPC that couldn't be properly handled. Categories are the reasons (code locations) for the kills.

histogram.name: Stability.BadMessageTerminated.NaCl
histogram.summary: Count of processes killed because they sent a NaCl IPC that couldn't be properly handled. Categories are the reasons (code locations) for the kills.

histogram.name: Stability.BadMessageTerminated.PasswordManager
histogram.summary: Count of processes killed because they sent a bad IPC that couldn't be properly handled. Categories are the reasons (code locations) for the kills.

histogram.name: Stability.BrowserExitCodes
histogram.summary: Records the exit code of the browser process (on Windows) from the previous launch. On crash, the exit code will indicate the exception code of the crash. This is emitted in stability data with the first report on a subsequent launch.

histogram.name: Stability.ExitFunnel
histogram.summary: Temporary instrumentation to record the Windows browser's exit path. See http://crbug.com/412384.

histogram.name: Stability.Internals.DataDiscardCount
histogram.summary: Number of times stability data was discarded. This is accumulated since the last report, even across versions. This is logged during stability metric recording for the following log sent.

histogram.name: Stability.Internals.InitialStabilityLogDeferredCount
histogram.summary: Number of times the initial stability log upload was deferred to the next startup. This is logged during stability metric recording for the following log sent.

histogram.name: Stability.Internals.VersionMismatchCount
histogram.summary: Number of times the version number stored in prefs did not match the serialized system profile version number. This is logged during stability metric recording.

histogram.name: Stability.MobileSessionShutdownType
histogram.summary: Type of the shutdown. This histogram is recorded at startup and logs a sample for the previous session. A clean shutdown is one where the app enters the background before being killed. Other shutdowns are all some sort of crash. The absence of a crash log indicates that the app was killed by the OS, normally due to memory pressure. If memory pressure is extremely high, the app may not have had a chance to response to a memory warning before being killed. For first launch after upgrade, the crash reports may be discarded before this histogram is written to so it's not possible to determine if there's a valid crash log present or not.

histogram.name: Stars.Goog_Related
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with Google related urls (points to internal Google resources). Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Goog_Related_20_Percent
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with Google related urls within first 20 (points to internal Google resources). Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Images_Percent
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with images. Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Images_Percent_First20
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with images within first 20. Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.LaunchLocation
histogram.summary: Logs a UI location from which a bookmark is launched.

histogram.name: Stars.No_Images_Snippets
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips without images or snippets. Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.No_Img_No_Snippet_20_Percent
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips without images or snippets within first 20. Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Startup.AfterStartupTaskCount
histogram.summary: The number of after-startup tasks that were queued prior to startup completion and deferred until that time.

histogram.name: Startup.AfterStartupTaskDelayedUntilTime
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation until deferred after-startup tasks began running.

histogram.name: Startup.AppListFirstPaintColdStart
histogram.summary: Time for a newly created browser process to perform the first paint of the app launcher, when started with the --show-app-list flag and with no currently running Chrome processes.

histogram.name: Startup.AppListFirstPaintWarmStart
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to perform the first paint of the app launcher. Measured from the time a second Chrome process started, which sent its --show-app-list command line argument to the already-running process and will soon exit.

histogram.name: Startup.BlockForCrashpadHandlerStartupTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during in crash_report::BlockUntilHandlerStarted().

histogram.name: Startup.BringToForegroundReason
histogram.summary: Records the cause, each time Chrome is brought to the foreground. Currently only checks if a NotificationUIManager notification was shown in the last 5 seconds (includes Web Notifications, but not media or Cast).

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserLaunchURLCount
histogram.summary: Measured when Chrome is invoked, this counts the number of URLs passed via command line. Note that this handles the case of a URL passed to Chrome starting up, or when a running Chrome is given the message to open a new URL.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMainRunnerImplInitializeLongTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during BrowserMainRunnerImpl::Initialize.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMainRunnerImplInitializeStep1Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the first section of BrowserMainRunnerImpl::Initialize.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMainRunnerImplInitializeStep2Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the second section of BrowserMainRunnerImpl::Initialize.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMainToRendererMain
histogram.summary: Time from the ChromeMain() entry in the browser process to the first RendererMain() entry.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStart.To.MainNavigationStart
histogram.summary: Time between Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime and Startup.FirstWebContents.MainNavigationStart. Recorded explicitly to allow easy breakdown of Startup.FirstWebContents.MainNavigationStart when diagnosing issues.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStart.To.NonEmptyPaint2
histogram.summary: Time between Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime and Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint2. Recorded explicitly to allow easy breakdown of Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint2 when diagnosing issues.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartHardFaultCount
histogram.summary: The number of hard faults incurred in the browser process from startup to start of the main thread's message loop, not including first runs of the browser. This is only reported on Windows 7 and greater.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartHardFaultCount.FirstRun
histogram.summary: The number of hard faults incurred in the browser process from startup to start of the main thread's message loop on first run. This is only reported on Windows 7 and greater.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartHardFaultCount.Success
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2015. No longer tracked because values collected on stable show that the function pretty much never fails (succeeds 99.9996% of the time).
histogram.summary: If OS support was detected (Windows 7 and greater) indicates whether it was possible to determine the number of hard faults that have occurred in the process from startup to start of the main thread's message loop. This can fail because the underlying call is inherently racy.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime
histogram.summary: Time from browser startup to the start of the main thread's message loop.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop. This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted. Replaced with Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry2 which is recorded all the time.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry.FirstRun
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop on first run. This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted. Replaced with Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry.FirstRun2 which is recorded all the time.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry.FirstRun2
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop on first run.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry2
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserOpenTabs
histogram.summary: Time taken to open the initial tab or to restore tabs from previous session.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserProcessImpl_PreMainMessageLoopRunTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during BrowserProcessImpl::PreMainMessageLoopRun.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserWindow.FirstPaint
histogram.summary: Time from browser startup to the time the first Browser window has finished painting its children.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserWindow.FirstPaint.CompositingEnded
histogram.summary: Time from browser startup to the time the GPU has finished compositing after first Browser window has finished painting its children. At this point the Browser interface is visible on screen. Measures how much time does it take for GPU to actually paint the first time.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserWindowDisplay
histogram.summary: Time from browser startup to the time the browser window initially becomes visible.

histogram.name: Startup.ChromeCast.TimeToDisplayVideo
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 7/2015. To be replaced with Cast events.
histogram.summary: The elapsed time from the ChromeCast application launch to the first video frame displayed.

histogram.name: Startup.CreateFirstProfile
histogram.summary: How long it takes to load the original profile synchronously on the UI thread.

histogram.name: Startup.Experimental.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad.ManyBuckets
histogram.summary: An experimental metric only collected on the dev and canary channels. Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first main frame load of the first web contents. Uses significantly more buckets, with reduced ranges.

histogram.name: Startup.Experimental.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad.StandardBuckets
histogram.summary: An experimental metric only collected on the dev and canary channels. Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first main frame load of the first web contents. Uses standard bucket ranges.

histogram.name: Startup.Experimental.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint.ManyBuckets
histogram.summary: An experimental metric only collected on the dev and canary channels. Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first non-empty paint of the first web contents. Uses significantly more buckets, with reduced ranges.

histogram.name: Startup.Experimental.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint.StandardBuckets
histogram.summary: An experimental metric only collected on the dev and canary channels. Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first non-empty paint of the first web contents. Uses standard bucket ranges.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstCommitNavigationTime
histogram.summary: [Android only] The time from the earliest entry point in the browser process to the moment the first navigation is committed, i.e. when renderer gets the first byte of the document.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstCommitNavigationTime2
histogram.summary: [Android only] The time from the first foreground entry point in the app to the moment the first navigation is committed, i.e. when renderer gets the first byte of the document.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.FinishReason
histogram.summary: [Desktop] The reason for which startup profiling was deemed complete. Logged once per session on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad
histogram.summary: [Desktop] DEPRECATED (but kept as a known basis until M48 is phased out). Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first main frame load of the first web contents. Deprecated in favor of Startup.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad2 which now avoids counting ill-cases (ref. FirstWebContentsProfiler::FinishReason).

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad2
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first main frame load of the first web contents. Only comprised of cases where the initial foreground tab gets to complete its rendering task unimpeded (an improvement over Startup.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad).

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.MainNavigationFinished
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the moment when the navigation is committed (first bytes received) in the first web contents' main frame.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.MainNavigationStart
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the beginning of navigation in the first web contents' main frame.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint
histogram.summary: [Desktop] DEPRECATED (but kept as a known basis until M48 is phased out). Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first non- empty paint of the first web contents. Deprecated in favor of Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint2 which now avoids counting ill-cases (ref. FirstWebContentsProfiler::FinishReason).

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint2
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first non- empty paint of the first web contents. Only comprised of cases where the initial foreground tab gets to complete its rendering task unimpeded (an improvement over Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint).

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UINotResponsive
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the execution time for a single task to execute on UI if it was not possible to execute UI tasks under 1/60s within certain limits, after WebContents was painted at least once. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UINotResponsive_10sec
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the elapsed time for a single task to execute on UI if it was not possible to execute it under 1/60s within certain limits, 10 second after first WebContents was painted at least once. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UINotResponsive_1sec
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the elapsed time for a single task to execute on UI if it was not possible to execute it under 1/60s within certain limits, 1 second after first WebContents was painted at least once. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UIResponsive
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the elapsed time it takes for a task to execute on UI under 1/60s after first WebContents was painted at least once. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UIResponsive_10sec
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the elapsed time it takes for a task to execute on UI under 1/60s, 10 second after the first WebContents was painted. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UIResponsive_1sec
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the elapsed time it takes for a task to execute on UI under 1/60s, 1 second after the first WebContents was painted. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.Fling.TimeToDisplayVideo
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 7/2015. To be replaced with Cast events.
histogram.summary: The elapsed time from the Fling application launch to the first video frame displayed.

histogram.name: Startup.IsResume
histogram.summary: Whether a startup is a resume (vs a cold start).

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ExeMainToDllMain
histogram.summary: Time from the main() function in chrome.exe to chrome.dll's main(). This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted. Replaced with Startup.LoadTime.ExeMainToDllMain2 which is recorded all the time.

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ExeMainToDllMain2
histogram.summary: Time from the main() function in chrome.exe to chrome.dll's main().

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToDllMain
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to chrome.dll's main(). This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted. Replaced with Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToDllMain2 which is recorded all the time.

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToDllMain2
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to chrome.dll's main().

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToExeMain
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to executing the main() function in chrome.exe. This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted. Replaced with Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToExeMain2 which is recorded all the time.

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToExeMain2
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to executing the main() function in chrome.exe.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.AwakeFromNib
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of -[AppControllerMac awakeFromNib].

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.DockIconWillFinishBouncing
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of -[AppControllerMac didFinishLaunching:]. At that point, the dock icon will finish its current animation and stop bouncing.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PostMainMessageLoopStart
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PostMainMessageLoopStart.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PostProfileInit
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PostProfileInit.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PreMainMessageLoopStart
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PreMainMessageLoopStart.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PreProfileInit
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PreProfileInit.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.WillFinishLaunching
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of -[AppControllerMac willFinishLaunching:].

histogram.name: Startup.PreMainMessageLoopRunImplLongTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ChromeBrowserMainParts::PreMainMessageLoopRunImpl.

histogram.name: Startup.PreMainMessageLoopRunImplStep1Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the first untracked section of ChromeBrowserMainParts::PreMainMessageLoopRunImpl.

histogram.name: Startup.PreMainMessageLoopRunImplStep2Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the second untracked section of ChromeBrowserMainParts::PreMainMessageLoopRunImpl. Not written for Android.

histogram.name: Startup.PreMainMessageLoopRunImplStep3Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the third untracked section of ChromeBrowserMainParts::PreMainMessageLoopRunImpl. Not written for Android.

histogram.name: Startup.PreMainMessageLoopRunImplTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ChromeBrowserMainParts::PreMainMessageLoopRunImpl.

histogram.name: Startup.SameVersionStartupCount
histogram.summary: The number of startups the current version has been through. Reported once per Chrome session, on startup. Any user that reports X for this version will also have previously reported [1,X-1] for this version through the previous X-1 Chrome sessions.

histogram.name: Startup.ShowAppListColdStart
histogram.summary: Time for a newly created browser process to reach the code that starts showing the app launcher, when started with the --show-app-list flag and with no currently running Chrome processes.

histogram.name: Startup.ShowAppListWarmStart
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to reach the code that starts showing the app launcher. Measured from the time a second Chrome process started, which sent its --show-app-list command line argument to the already-running process and will soon exit.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupBookmarksLoad
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load bookmarks from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupExtensionServiceInitAfterImport
histogram.summary: Time it takes to finish initialization of the extension service including loading built-in extensions. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupFinalProfileInit
histogram.summary: Time the final stages of profile initialization taking including initialization of profile keyed services. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupNSSInit
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load the NSS libraries and initialize it. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupPreferenceLoading
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load preferences from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupProfileIODataInit
histogram.summary: Time it takes to initialize the ProfileIOData object - this includes initialization of the cookie store. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSafeBrowsingGetDatabase
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load the safe browsing database from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSafeBrowsingServiceInitialize
histogram.summary: Time it takes to initialize the safe browsing service. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSessionServiceCreateTabsAndWindows
histogram.summary: Time it takes for session restore to finish initiating creation of restored tabs and windows. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.StartupBrowserCreator_ProcessCmdLineImplTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during StartupBrowserCreator::ProcessCmdLineImpl.

histogram.name: Startup.StartupBrowserCreator_Start
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during StartupBrowserCreator::Start().

histogram.name: Startup.SystemUptime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between system boot and Chrome browser process launch. This is recorded just before the main message loop starts.

histogram.name: Startup.Temperature
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not the given startup was warm, cold or unable to be determined. This is based off observing the number of hard faults that occur during startup prior to Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime.

histogram.name: Startup.TimeSinceLastStartup
histogram.summary: Time elapsed since the last startup that went up to the main message loop start. This is recorded just before the main message loop starts.

histogram.name: Startup.WarmStartTimeFromRemoteProcessStart
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to start processing the command line passed in by a second Chrome process, which just sent its command line arguments to the already-running process and will soon exit. Measured from the time the second Chrome process started.

histogram.name: StartupTimeBomb.Alarm
histogram.summary: Time duration measured from the time the startup timebomb was started and when it went off.

histogram.name: Storage.BlacklistedImportantSites.Reason
histogram.summary: This is recorded for every site that the user blacklists when they when they clear browsing data. It indicates which signals were used to show the given site to the user that the user then chose to exclude from clearing.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.Broken
histogram.summary: If a newly constructed blob is broken. See Storage.Blob.BrokenReason for a the broken reasons.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.BrokenReason
histogram.summary: The reason a blob is broken, reported only for broken blobs upon construction. See Storage.Blob.Broken for the breakdown of blobs broken vs unbroken.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.CleanupSuccess
histogram.summary: Recorded when the old blob storage directories are cleared. This occurs on storage partition initialization, and is not recorded if there are no directories to clear. The value indicates if the file operations were a success.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.CreateDirectoryResult
histogram.summary: Recorded when we create the blob storage directory for the blob storage system. When we need to write blob data to files, we create this directory if it doesn't exist. We write blob data to files when either we have a new blob that's larger than our memory limit, or we're approaching our in-memory limit for blob storage.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.ExceededMemory
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2016. Use Storage.Blob.Broken to see the fraction of blobs that are broken, and Storage.Blob.BrokenReason for the number of broken blobs that are broken because of memory constraints.
histogram.summary: True if a created blob exceeded the internal in-memory storage memory limit for blobs.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.InvalidReference
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times we have an invalid refcount operation. An invalid increment means the blob didn't exist, and an invalid decrement means we don't have any record of the blob in our host.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.InvalidURLRegister
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times we have an invalid url registration operation. An invalid increment means the blob isn't in use by the host yet or the url is already mapped. An invalid decrement means the url isn't registered.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.ItemCount
histogram.summary: The number of blob items in a blob, recorded at blob construction. (Blobs are immutable, so this won't change afterwards).

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.MaxDiskSpace
histogram.summary: Records the calculated max disk space the blob storage system can use. Recorded on storage partition initialization.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.MaxDiskSpaceAdjustment
histogram.summary: Recorded when the blob system changes adjustment types on its disk size. The disk can either be Frozen, Adjusted (near min external available disk space), or Normal. We record when we transition between these states, which can happen after any file operations in the blob system (paging data to disk or saving a new blob directly to disk).

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.PageFileSize
histogram.summary: Size of a page file created for blob data by the blob storage system. Recorded before we create the file and write the blob items. We page blob data to files when we get close to our maximum blob memory usage.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.PagingDisabled
histogram.summary: Recorded when we disable paging blobs to file in the blob storage system. This occurs when we experience a filesystem error during writing blob data to disk. We write blob data to files when either we have a new blob that's larger than our memory limit, or we're approaching our in-memory limit for blob storage. The relevant error is recorded here.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.RegisterBlobTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to complete the synchronous BlobStorageMsg_RegisterBlob IPC.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.RegisterPublicURLTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to complete the synchronous BlobStorageMsg_RegisterPublicURL IPC.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.RendererFileSeekFailed
histogram.summary: Whether seeking within a file (in order to write a part of a blob) failed in the renderer.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.RendererFileWriteFailed
histogram.summary: Whether writing part of a blob to a file failed in the renderer.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.ReusedItem
histogram.summary: True if we reuse an item for a blob created from using Blob.slice, recorded in BlobStorageContext on blob creation.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.SizeEvictedToDiskInKB
histogram.summary: Records the total size of in-memory blobs evicted to disk.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.StorageSizeAfterAppend
histogram.summary: Records the total in-memory storage size of blobs before a blob item is appended. Can be subtracted by Storage.Blob.StorageSizeBeforeAppend to find the true distribution of blob storage sizes.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.StorageSizeBeforeAppend
histogram.summary: Records the total in-memory storage size of blobs before a blob item is appended. Can be subtracted from Storage.Blob.StorageSizeAfterAppend to find the true distribution of blob storage sizes.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.TotalSize
histogram.summary: The total in-memory size in KB of finished blobs. Recorded in BlobStorageContext when the blob is finished being created. This can include memory that is shared with other blobs or memory from repeated internal items.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.TotalUnsharedSize
histogram.summary: The total amount of unique memory used to create a blob. Recorded in BlobStorageContext when the blob is finished being created. This does not include memory that is shared with other blobs. If multiple of the same blob item is present, then this number will reflect the size of the single item.

histogram.name: Storage.BlobItemSize
histogram.summary: The size in KB of items (or parts of items) appended to blobs.

histogram.name: Storage.BlobItemSize.BlobSlice
histogram.summary: The size in KB of items (or parts of items) appended to blobs that come from the slicing of other blobs. This happens when using Blob.slice, where we are using a part of an item in the original blob (not the whole item).

histogram.name: Storage.BlobItemSize.File.Unknown
histogram.summary: True if the file size on blob append is unknown (which means the full file), or false if a specific file length was populated. Recorded in BlobStorageContext when we are adding a file item to a blob.

histogram.name: Storage.BlobItemSize.FileSystem.Unknown
histogram.summary: True if the file size of a filesystem object on blob append is unknown (which means the full file), or false if a specific file length was populated. Recorded in BlobStorageContext when we are adding a filesystem item to a blob.

histogram.name: Storage.BytesRead
histogram.summary: The number of bytes read. Recorded on each read.

histogram.name: Storage.BytesWritten
histogram.summary: The number of bytes written. Recorded on each write.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.CBDChosenReason
histogram.summary: When a user chooses to blacklist one or more sites when they clear browsing data, this is recorded for every reason each chosen site was marked as important. It indicates which signals were used to show the given site to the user that the user then chose to exclude from clearing.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.CBDChosenReasonCount
histogram.summary: This records the number of reasons each important site had that the user chose to blacklist when clearing browsing data.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.CBDIgnoredReason
histogram.summary: When a user chooses to blacklist one or more sites when they clear browsing data, this is recorded for every reason each unchosen site was marked as important. It indicates which signals were used to show the given site to the user, which the user then ignored and did not select to blacklist from clearing data.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.CBDIgnoredReasonCount
histogram.summary: This records the number of reasons each important site had that the user chose to NOT blacklist when clearing browsing data.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.GeneratedReason
histogram.summary: Recorded when we generate a list of important sites. This can happen when the user opens the Clear Browsing Data dialog on Android, views the Storage tab in Site Settings on Android, or launches 'Manage Storage' from Android System Settings for Chrome. We record every reason each site was chosen in this metric. This means that we can report this metric multiple times for a single site.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.GeneratedReasonCount
histogram.summary: This records the number of reasons qualifying a site for being 'important'. We record this for every site when we generate a list of important sites, described in "Storage.ImportantSites.GeneratedReason".

histogram.name: Storage.IndexedDB.PutBlobSizeKB
histogram.summary: Records the size of a blob used in an IndexedDB add/put operation. Recorded for every put operation that contains a blob.

histogram.name: Storage.IndexedDB.PutValidBlob
histogram.summary: Records if a blob intended to be used in an IndexedDB add/put operation is a valid blob. Recorded for every put operation that contains a blob.

histogram.name: Style.AuthorStyleSheet.ParseTime
histogram.summary: Microseconds spent in StyleSheetContents::parseAuthorStyleSheet.

histogram.name: Style.LazyUsage.Percent
histogram.summary: Tracks % of lazy rules that ended up needing to be parsed. A sheet logs counts into this histogram as it is parsed (i.e. as properties are parsed lazily). Once a certain percent of rules have been parsed, we log a count immediately. Note that this implies that a stylesheet which uses all of its rules will log counts in every bucket.

histogram.name: Style.TotalLazyRules
histogram.summary: Tracks the total number of rules that have parsing lazily deferred in an author style sheet.

histogram.name: Style.TotalLazyRules.FullUsage
histogram.summary: Tracks the total number of rules that have parsing lazily deferred in an author style sheet, for sheets that ended up needing all their rules.

histogram.name: Style.UpdateTime
histogram.summary: Microseconds spent in Document::updateStyle.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.Actions
histogram.summary: Counts of various UI and user action events related to the SubresourceFilter. This will be triggered in response to Content Settings changes, as well as when portions of the UI are shown or interacted with. Main frame navigations are also tracked for ease of comparison and analysis.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.Activation.CPUDuration
histogram.summary: Records how much thread CPU time it takes to decide whether subresource filtering should be activated for a main frame or subframe.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.Activation.WallDuration
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes to decide whether subresource filtering should be activated for a main frame or subframe.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.ActivationComputingDelay
histogram.summary: Records the total time the activation state navigation throttle within a document is delayed while calculating activation. Recorded at resume time.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.ActivationComputingDelay.MainFrame
histogram.summary: Records the total time the activation state navigation throttle within a main frame document is delayed while calculating activation. Recorded at resume time.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.ActivationState
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is committed in a main frame or subframe, records whether subresource filtering should be activated for that load.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.Disallowed
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have been disallowed. This only differs from `MatchedRules` when filtering is performed in dry-run mode.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.Evaluated
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have been evaluated. This only differs from 'Total' when the document is subject to a deactivating rule with DOCUMENT activation type.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.MatchedRules
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have matched filtering rules. This only differs from `Disallowed` when filtering is performed in dry-run mode.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.Total
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have gone through the subresource filtering pipeline.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.RulesetIsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is committed in a main frame or subframe and subresource filtering should be activated, records whether the filtering rules are available.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.SubframeFilteringDelay.Allowed
histogram.summary: Records the total time a subframe navigation was delayed while calculating whether it should be disallowed or not. Logged for all navigations that were allowed.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.SubframeFilteringDelay.Disallowed
histogram.summary: Records the total time a subframe navigation was delayed while calculating whether it should be disallowed or not. Logged for all navigations that were disallowed.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.SubresourceEvaluation.TotalCPUDuration
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total thread CPU time spent on processing subresource requests in allowLoad.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.SubresourceEvaluation.TotalWallDuration
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total real time spent on processing subresource requests in allowLoad, including the time spent on waiting or being descheduled.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.IndexRuleset.CPUDuration
histogram.summary: The total CPU time it took to parse and index all rules. Does not include time when the indexing thread was not doing actual work, e.g. waiting for I/O or being descheduled. Recorded every time the RulesetService kicks off a ruleset indexing process.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.IndexRuleset.NumUnsupportedRules
histogram.summary: The number of rules that could be not be successfully indexed and therefore have been ignored. Recorded every time the RulesetService kicks off a ruleset indexing process and it reaches the point where rules are getting indexed.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.IndexRuleset.WallDuration
histogram.summary: The total time it took to read and index all rules. Includes I/O time for reading the unindexed rules, but not for writing the indexed ruleset. Recorded every time the RulesetService kicks off a ruleset indexing process.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.FinalURLMatch
histogram.summary: Records, for each main frame navigation, whether the last URL in the redirect chain matched the Safe Browsing blacklist specified by the histogram suffix.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.Disallowed
histogram.summary: Whenever a page load is finished with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have been disallowed. This only differs from `MatchedRules` when filtering is performed in dry-run mode.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.Evaluated
histogram.summary: Whenever a page load is finished with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have been evaluated. This only differs from 'Total' when some of subdocuments is subject to a deactivating rule with DOCUMENT activation type.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.MatchedRules
histogram.summary: Whenever a page load is finished with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have matched filtering rules. This only differs from `Disallowed` when filtering is performed in dry-run mode.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.Total
histogram.summary: Whenever a page load is finished with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have gone through the subresource filtering pipeline.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.RedirectChainLength
histogram.summary: Total number of server redirects during the navigation. This histogram is recorded in several for every list where subresource fiter is active.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.RedirectChainMatchPattern
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of April 2017, since the don't have correct data to record anymore.
histogram.summary: For each main frame navigation, records a pattern that indicates which URLs in the redirect chain matched Safe Browsing blacklists, and which did not. For example, for the redirect chain A-B-C-D metric tracks: 1. If initial URL (A) was on a Safe Browsing blacklist. 2. If any if middle urls (B, C) were on a Safe Browsing blacklist. 3. If committed URL (B) was on a Safe Browsing blacklist. This histogram is recorded in several flavours: with prefix SubresourceFilterOnly in case the redirect chain contains url from the Safe Browsing SubresourceFilter list and without the prefix for all other redirect chains.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.SafeBrowsingDelay
histogram.summary: The navigation delay imposed by the subresource filter on a given navigation due to Safe Browsing checks.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.SafeBrowsingDelay.NoRedirectSpeculation
histogram.summary: The navigation delay that would have been imposed by the subresource filter on a given navigation due to Safe Browsing checks if redirect speculation was removed. Removing this feature would cause more delay if a navigation has redirects.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.SubresourceEvaluation.TotalCPUDuration
histogram.summary: Whenever a page load is finished with subresource filtering activated, records the total thread CPU time spent on evaluating subresource requests, aggregated across all frames.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.SubresourceEvaluation.TotalWallDuration
histogram.summary: Whenever a page load is finished with subresource filtering activated, records the total real time spent on evaluating subresource requests, aggregated across all frames. This includes the time spent on waiting or being descheduled.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.Prompt.NumReloads
histogram.summary: Number of times the user has requested a reload for the page by clicking on the reload button.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.Prompt.NumVisibility
histogram.summary: Number of times Safebrowsing Subresource Filter decided to toggle visibility of the prompt.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.SafeBrowsing.CheckTime
histogram.summary: The time an individual Safe Browsing URL check took before finishing. Logged when a check is complete or cancelled due to a timeout.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.SubresourceLoad.Evaluation.CPUDuration
histogram.summary: Whenever a subresource of a document is evaluated against the ruleset, records the thread CPU time spent on calculating whether it should be allowed to load.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.SubresourceLoad.Evaluation.WallDuration
histogram.summary: Whenever a subresource of a document is evaluated against the ruleset, records how much time was spent on calculating whether it should be allowed to load.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.WriteRuleset.ReplaceFileError
histogram.summary: Records the exact error whenever writing a ruleset fails at the step where the ruleset would be moved from the scratch directory to its final location.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.WriteRuleset.Result
histogram.summary: Whether indexing a version of the ruleset and writing it to disk succeeded, or failed at a particular step. Recorded every time the RulesetService kicks off a ruleset indexing process.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FailedRequestErrorCode
histogram.summary: The counts of network error codes encountered by SuggestionsService when an attempt to fetch suggestions from the server fails.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FetchResponseCode
histogram.summary: The counts of HTTP response codes encountered by SuggestionsService when attempting to fetch suggestions from the server.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FetchSuccessLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a SuggestionsService fetch that results in a success response.

histogram.name: Suggestions.LocalBlacklistSize
histogram.summary: Number of URLs present in the Suggestions local blacklist when the Suggestions service is created.

histogram.name: Suggestions.ResponseState
histogram.summary: The counts of response states (such as empty or invalid) encountered by SuggestionsService when attempting to fetch suggestions from the server.

histogram.name: SupervisedUserContentProvider.ChromeNotStartedRequestTime
histogram.summary: Time to get the response to requesting whether a URL should be accessible to the supervised user, when Chrome was not previously running.

histogram.name: SupervisedUserContentProvider.ChromeStartedRequestTime
histogram.summary: Time to get the response to requesting whether a URL should be accessible to the supervised user, when Chrome was already running.

histogram.name: SupervisedUserContentProvider.RequestTimedOut
histogram.summary: True if a request to find out whether a URL should be accessible to a supervised user timed out.

histogram.name: Sync.AppAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during app association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.AppRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of apps run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.AppsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during app association.

histogram.name: Sync.AppsConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of app configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AppSettingsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during app settings association.

histogram.name: Sync.AppSettingsConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of app settings configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AppSettingsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of app settings association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AppsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of app association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AppStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of app association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.Attachments.DownloadChecksumResult
histogram.summary: Whether attachment checksums match on download or not.

histogram.name: Sync.Attachments.DownloadResponseCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from downloading sync attachments.

histogram.name: Sync.Attachments.DownloadTotalTime
histogram.summary: The total time a download takes including request and server overhead.

histogram.name: Sync.Attachments.StoreInitResult
histogram.summary: The result of initializing the sync attachment store.

histogram.name: Sync.Attachments.UploadResponseCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from uploading sync attachments.

histogram.name: Sync.AttemptNigoriMigration
histogram.summary: Enumeration of results from attempting to migrate Sync's nigori node and its encryption keys to support keystore.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthInvalidationRejectedTokenAgeLong
histogram.summary: Age of all auth tokens rejected by the invalidation server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthInvalidationRejectedTokenAgeShort
histogram.summary: Age of auth tokens younger than one hour that were rejected by the invalidation server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthorizationTimeInNetwork
histogram.summary: Time taken during initial authorization.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthServerRejectedTokenAgeLong
histogram.summary: Age of all auth tokens rejected by the sync server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthServerRejectedTokenAgeShort
histogram.obsolete: No longer relevant since transition to OAuth.
histogram.summary: Age of auth tokens younger than one hour that were rejected by the sync server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during autofill association.

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of autofill configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfileAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during autofill profile association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfileRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of autofill profiles run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfilesAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during autofill profile association.

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfilesConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of autofill profile configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfilesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of autofill profile association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfileStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of autofill profile association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of autofill (autocomplete) run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of autofill association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AutoNigoriOverwrites
histogram.summary: Number of times this client has overwritten the nigori node to update the encryption keys without a user action (during this instantiation of Chrome).

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeFirstTime
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization time during initial sync setup.

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeFirstTimeSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization success rate during initial sync setup.

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreState
histogram.summary: Compares sync's has_setup_completed pref against the set of types actually restored from the sync DB. Mismatches should be rare.

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization success rate in cases where sync was previously initialized.

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreTime
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization time in cases where sync was previously initialized.

histogram.name: Sync.BadRequestCountOnSignInNeedsUpdateInfoBar
histogram.summary: Number of bad requests since application startup, when the Sync error infobar asking the user to update their account details is displayed.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarkAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during bookmark association.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarkRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of bookmark run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during bookmark association.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of bookmark configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksDuplicationsAtAssociation
histogram.summary: Estimated number of bookmark duplications after bookmark association.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksModelSyncStateAtNewDuplication
histogram.summary: Tracks state of local bookmark model version relative to the sync version when a new bookmark duplication occurs during bookmark association.
