histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksNewDuplicationsAtAssociation
histogram.summary: Estimated number of new bookmark duplications after bookmark association.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of bookmark association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarkStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of bookmark association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ClearServerDataEvents
histogram.summary: Records events encountered during sync's ClearServerData flow.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureDataTypes
histogram.summary:
Breakdown of sync data types being configured at first time signin, restart, or user-initiated reconfiguration. This is different from Sync.CustomTypes in that this captures all active devices, not just those that are choosing a custom sync configuration.
Note that not all platforms support all data types. As such, comparing across platforms should only look at the common data types.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureFailed
histogram.summary: Count of model association failures for each type.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime.ABORTED
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration is aborted.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime.OK
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration succeeds.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime.PARTIAL_SUCCESS
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where only some data types succeed.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime.UNRECOVERABLE_ERROR
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration encounters an unrecoverable error.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.ABORTED
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration is aborted.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.OK
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration succeeds.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.PARTIAL_SUCCESS
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where only some data types succeed.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.UNRECOVERABLE_ERROR
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration encounters an unrecoverable error.

histogram.name: Sync.ConflictFixCircularity
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2011. No longer tracked. See crbug.com/107816.
histogram.summary: Number of times we fix a circularity sync conflict. This is not expected to be hit anymore.

histogram.name: Sync.ConflictFixRemovedDirectoriesWithContent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2011. No longer tracked. See crbug.com/107816.
histogram.summary: Number of times we fix a removed directory with content sync conflict. This is not expected to be hit anymore

histogram.name: Sync.CookieJarEmptyOnMismatch
histogram.summary: Whether the gaia cookie jar was empty. Recorded on every SESSIONS commit where the gaia cookie jar does not include the signed in user ( CookieJarMatchOnNavigation == false).

histogram.name: Sync.CookieJarMatchOnNavigation
histogram.summary: Whether the gaia cookie jar included the signed in user (matched) or not. Recorded on every SESSIONS commit.

histogram.name: Sync.CredentialsLost
histogram.summary: Whether or not we detected missing credentials during startup. This may be related to crbug.com/121755.

histogram.name: Sync.CryptographerPendingKeys
histogram.summary: Breakdown of sync users whose cryptographer has pending keys.

histogram.name: Sync.CryptographerReady
histogram.summary: Breakdown of sync users whose cryptographer is fully ready for encryption and decryption (initialized and no pending keys).

histogram.name: Sync.CustomEncryption
histogram.summary: Histogram that keeps track of how users encrypt their sync data. All users start off with default encryption during initial setup, while a subset of users go on to encrypt their sync data with a custom passphrase.

histogram.name: Sync.CustomPassphrase
histogram.summary: Boolean histogram for whether a custom passphrase was entered during sync setup. Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users entered a custom passphrase.

histogram.name: Sync.CustomSync
histogram.summary: Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users explicitly chose to sync this data type via the "Advanced Sync Preferences" dialog.

histogram.name: Sync.DatatypePrefRecovery
histogram.summary: Number of clients that have fixed themselves up from a datatype preference loss. Clients are not expected to have this happen more than once. This value can be compared to Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreSuccess to determine what percentage of users are still recovering.

histogram.name: Sync.DataTypeRunFailures
histogram.summary: Histogram of the run failures for the different sync datatypes. These are failures that occur after startup while the datatype is syncing. Note: Due to an enumeration reordering, pre-M23 labels are inaccurate (see sync/base/model_type.h).

histogram.name: Sync.DataTypeStartFailures
histogram.summary: Histogram of the startup failures for the different sync datatypes. These are failures due to missing top level sync nodes or model association Note: Due to an enumeration reordering, pre-M23 labels are inaccurate (see sync/base/model_type.h).

histogram.name: Sync.DeviceCount
histogram.summary: The largest number of active syncing devices known to any profile. May be 0 when there are no signed in/syncing profiles open.

histogram.name: Sync.DeviceIdMismatchDetails
histogram.summary: When signin_scoped_device_id from pref doesn't match the one in DeviceInfoSpecfics this histogram tells if sync or pref copy was empty. This will indicate how often such mismatch happens and what was the state before.

histogram.name: Sync.DictionaryAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during dictionary association.

histogram.name: Sync.DictionaryConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of dictionary configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.DictionaryStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of dictionary association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryCatastrophicError
histogram.summary: Whether the Sync Directory encountered a catastrophic error.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenFailedMac
histogram.summary: Number of failures trying to open the sync database on mac.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenFailedNotWinMac
histogram.summary: Number of failures trying to open the sync database on a non-windows non-mac platform.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenFailedWin
histogram.summary: Number of failures trying to open the sync database on windows.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenResult
histogram.summary: Tracks success of failure of sync directory initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.EncryptAllData
histogram.summary: Boolean histogram for whether the "Encrypt all synced data" radio button was selected during sync setup. Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users chose to encrypt their sync data.

histogram.name: Sync.EventCodes
histogram.summary: A UI event occured.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during extension association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of extension run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during extension association.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionsConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionSettingsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during extension settings association.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionSettingsConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension settings configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionSettingsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension settings association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ExtraSyncDataCount
histogram.summary: Counts the total number of extra copies of sync data in memory. This count is emitted once, after loading Sync Directory. The count will indicate how many Directory entities fail to share client and server specifics.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconCacheLookupSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether a sync favicon cache lookup succeeded or not.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconCount
histogram.summary: Number of synced favicons at initialization time.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconImagesAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during favicon images association.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconImagesConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of favicon images configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconImagesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of favicon images association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconsAvailableAtMerge
histogram.summary: Number of client that have filled their sync favicon cache and must evict old favicons vs those whose cache is not full.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconTrackingAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during favicon tracking association.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconTrackingConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of favicon tracking configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconTrackingStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of favicon tracking association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconVisitPeriod
histogram.summary: Time between updates to a synced favicon's visit time.

histogram.name: Sync.FirstBackendInitializeSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2011. Was counted incorrectly. Replaced by Sync.BackendInitializeFirstTimeSuccess.
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization success rate during initial sync setup.

histogram.name: Sync.FirstSyncDelayByBackup
histogram.obsolete: Backup logic has been removed since 02/2016.
histogram.summary: First sync delay casued by backing up user data.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqApps
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for apps. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for apps.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqAutofill
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for autofill entries. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for autofill entries.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqAutofillProfiles
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for autofill profiles. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for autofill profiles.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqBookmarks
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for bookmarks. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for boomarks.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqDictionary
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for dictionary. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for dictionary.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqExtensions
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for extensions. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for extensions.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqFaviconImages
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for favicon images. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for favicon images.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqFaviconTracking
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for favicon tracking. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for favicon tracking.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqNigori
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for nigori. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for nigori.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqPasswords
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for passwords. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for passwords.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqPreferences
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for preferences. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for preferences.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqSearchEngines
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for search engines. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for search engines.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqSessions
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for sessions. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for sessions.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqSyncedNotifications
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for synced notifications. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for synced notifications.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqThemes
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for themes. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for themes.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqTypedUrls
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for typed urls. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for typed urls.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqWifiCredentials
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for WiFi credentials. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for WiFi credentials.

histogram.name: Sync.InitialState
histogram.summary: An approximate state of sync at startup. Logs a few reasons sync definitely wouldn't be able to start, or that it probably can start. The user having turned off sync on mobile will be logged as "turned off by user". A dashboard stop and clear will fall under "turned off and setup not completed". See the SyncInitialState enum in profile_sync_service.h for more information.

histogram.name: Sync.InvalidationSessionsAndroid
histogram.summary: Count of the number of session sync invalidations. The goal of the metric is to track how the number of session sync invalidations changes over time.

histogram.name: Sync.KeystoreDecryptionFailed
histogram.summary: The reason for a failure decrypting the keystore decryptor token.

histogram.name: Sync.Local.Enabled
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times the local sync backend was enabled by the user.

histogram.name: Sync.Local.FileSize
histogram.summary: Tracks the size of the local sync backend database file.

histogram.name: Sync.Local.RoamingProfileUnavailable
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times the Roaming profile cannot be retrieved.

histogram.name: Sync.LocalDataFailedToLoad
histogram.summary: Counts cases when a sync type failed to load the local data during startup.

histogram.name: Sync.LocalModelOutOfSync
histogram.summary: Counts instances of out of sync local models detected during startup.

histogram.name: Sync.LostNavigationCount
histogram.summary: Counts instances of navigations that are recorded locally but not synced. Recorded once per active tab for every inferred sync cycle. Sync cycles are inferred by examining the is_synced and is_syncing flags of sync directories when recording local changes to tabs or windows. Sync cycles that occur without changes to tabs or windows won't cause this metric to be logged.

histogram.name: Sync.MemoryPressureWarningBeforeCleanShutdown
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times a user's sync service received a MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_CRITICAL warning before the sync service shut down cleanly. The sync service emits this number the next time the user's sync service is started, which will likely happen the next time the user's profile is opened after a Chrome restart. This count is emitted once per user/profile. Things like browser crashes that implicitly bring down all users' sync services will cause unclean shutdown tags to appear on all open profiles, meaning that there will be multiple emissions to this histogram as those profiles are re-opened.

histogram.name: Sync.MemoryPressureWarningBeforeUncleanShutdown
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times a user's sync service received a MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_CRITICAL warning before the sync service shut down uncleanly. The sync service emits this number the next time the user's sync service is started, which will likely happen the next time the user's profile is opened after a Chrome restart. This count is emitted once per user/profile. Things like browser crashes that implicitly bring down all users' sync services will cause unclean shutdown tags to appear on all open profiles, meaning that there will be multiple emissions to this histogram as those profiles are re-opened.

histogram.name: Sync.ModelTypeCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of entries for each model type in sync DB at startup.

histogram.name: Sync.ModelTypeStoreInitResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of ModelTypeStoreBackend initialization. Used to analyze frequency and causes of backend initialization failures.

histogram.name: Sync.NigoriMigrationState
histogram.summary: Breakdown of sync's nigori node keystore migration state.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitBookmarksDuration
histogram.summary: The client side execution time to check for revisits with bookmarks data.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitBookmarksMatchAge
histogram.summary: Age of bookmark that matches a navigation event, where matching means the urls match. If multiple bookmarks match, the most recently created is used.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitBookmarksMatchTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type to a page that matched a bookmark.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitBookmarksMissTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type to a page that didn't match a bookmark.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitNavigationMatchAge
histogram.summary: Difference in time between finding the match and the creation of the most recent foreign modification of the parent tab. The parent tab's modification will not always be indicative of when the matching navigation occurred.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitNavigationMatchOffset
histogram.summary: The number of navigations forward or backwards the matching noncurrent navigation is from the current navigation in its tab. Negative values represent backwards and positive values represent forwards. Zero should not occur since it would cease to be noncurrent.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitNavigationMatchTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that matched a synced navigation.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitNavigationMissTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that didn't match a synced navigation.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitSessionDuration
histogram.summary: The client side execution time to check for revisits with session data.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTabMatchAge
histogram.summary: Difference in time between finding the match and the creation of the most recent foreign modification of the given tab.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTabMatchTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that matched a synced tab.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTabMissTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that didn't match a synced tab.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTypedUrlDuration
histogram.summary: The client side execution time to check for revisits with typed URL data.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTypedUrlMatchAge
histogram.summary: Difference in time between finding the match and the last time this URL was typed on a foreign client.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTypedUrlMatchTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that matched a typed URL.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTypedUrlMissTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that didn't match a typed URL.

histogram.name: Sync.PartiallySyncedTypes
histogram.summary: Number of partially synced types (those with a progress marker but no initial sync ended bit) that exist at sync startup.

histogram.name: Sync.PassphraseDecryptionSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether a passphrase decryption attempt succeeded or not.

histogram.name: Sync.PassphraseDialogDismissed
histogram.summary: Enumeration of how a user dismissed the passphrase dialog.

histogram.name: Sync.PassphraseType
histogram.summary: The active sync passphrase type at sync startup.

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during password association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of passwords run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during password association.

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordsConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of password configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of password association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of password association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.PreferenceAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during preference association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.PreferenceRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of preferences run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.PreferencesAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during preference association.

histogram.name: Sync.PreferencesConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of preference configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.PreferencesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of preference association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.PreferenceStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of preference association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ReauthorizationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken from startup for the user to reauthorize.

histogram.name: Sync.RefreshTokenAvailable
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as not useful since it always logged true.
histogram.summary: Whether OAuth2 refresh token was available at the time when ProfileSyncService was starting backend.

histogram.name: Sync.RequestContentLength.Compressed
histogram.summary: The request content size for a single HTTP/HTTPS call from sync client to server. The content is compressed by gzip.

histogram.name: Sync.RequestContentLength.Original
histogram.summary: The original request content size for a single HTTP/HTTPS call from sync client to server. It is the size before content got compressed.

histogram.name: Sync.ResolveConflict
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of conflict resolutions. Recorded every time a conflict is resolved for a data type that has been converted to USS.

histogram.name: Sync.ResolveSimpleConflict
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of simple conflict resolutions.

histogram.name: Sync.ResponseContentLength.Compressed
histogram.summary: The response content size for a single HTTP/HTTPS call from sync server to client. The content is compressed by gzip.

histogram.name: Sync.ResponseContentLength.Original
histogram.summary: The original response content size for a single HTTP/HTTPS call from sync server and client. It is the size after content got uncompressed.

histogram.name: Sync.RestoreBackendInitializeSucess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2011. Was counted incorrectly. Replaced by Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreSuccess.
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization success rate in cases where sync was previously initialized.

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEngineAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during search engine association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEngineRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of search engine run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEnginesAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during search engine association.

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEnginesConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of search engine configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEnginesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of search engine association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEngineStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of search engine association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ServiceInitialConfigureTime
histogram.summary: Time spent on first-time configure. May include time spent on retries.

histogram.name: Sync.ServiceSubsequentConfigureTime
histogram.summary: Time spent on non-first-time configure. May include time spent on retries.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during session association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.SessionRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of sessions run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.SessionsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during session association.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionsBadForeignHashOnMergeCount
histogram.summary: Number of foreign sessions entries detected with bad client tag hash value during MergeDataAndStartSyncing. These will be immediately deleted. The overwhelming majority of clients should report a value of 0 upon startup.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionsConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of session configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionsRefreshDelay
histogram.summary: Delay from the time chrome://history is loaded until the other devices' sessions data became available.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of session association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of session association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.SessionTabs
histogram.summary: For each Chrome window, records the number of tabs present at the time Sync associates the SESSIONS datatype.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionWindows
histogram.summary: The number of windows present within Chrome at the time Sync associates the SESSIONS datatype.

histogram.name: Sync.Shutdown.BackendDestroyedTime
histogram.summary: Time taken from the start of sync shutdown (in ProfileSyncService) until the backend (SyncEngine) is fully destroyed.

histogram.name: Sync.Shutdown.StopRegistrarTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time the UI thread waits (at shutdown) to stop the SyncBackendRegistrar.

histogram.name: Sync.Shutdown.StopSyncThreadTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time the UI thread waits (at shutdown) to stop the sync thread.

histogram.name: Sync.Startup.DeferredInitTrigger
histogram.summary: The type of event that triggered sync initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.Startup.TimeDeferred
histogram.summary: Time spent after ProfileSyncService *creation* but before SyncEngine initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.Startup.TimeDeferred2
histogram.summary: Time spent after ProfileSyncService *creation* but before SyncEngine initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.Startup.TypeTriggeringInit
histogram.summary: Data type that first requests sync initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.StopSource
histogram.summary: Tracks how sync was turned off. Logged every time sync is told to stop permanently by the user (e.g. it won't come back on by itself).

histogram.name: Sync.SyncAuthError
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times sync clients have encountered an auth error and number of times auth errors are fixed.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncedNotificationsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during synced notifications association.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncedNotificationsConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of synced notifications configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncedNotificationsStartFailure
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in M53. Replaced by SyncedNotificationsConfigureFailure. See crbug.com/478226.
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of synced notifications association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncerConflictStuck
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2011. No longer tracked. See crbug.com/107816.
histogram.summary: Number of times the sync conflict resolver gets stuck. This is not expected to be hit anymore.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncErrorInfobarDisplayed
histogram.summary: Enumeration of error conditions that displays an infobar to the user.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncEverything
histogram.summary: Boolean histogram for whether the "Sync Everything" option was selected during sync setup. Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users chose to sync all available data types.

histogram.name: Sync.ThemeAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during theme association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ThemeRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of theme run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.ThemesAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during theme association.

histogram.name: Sync.ThemesConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of theme configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ThemesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of theme association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ThemeStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of theme association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during typed url association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlChangeProcessorErrors
histogram.summary: The percentage of history DB operations initiated by the typed URL change processor that return an error. The cumulative count for the current sync session is logged after every typed URL change.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlMergeAndStartSyncingErrors
histogram.summary: The percentage of history DB operations during merge data that return an error. This is logged at the end of typed URL merge data, which happens once each time sync starts up.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlModelAssociationErrors
histogram.summary: The percentage of history DB operations during model association that return an error. This is logged at the end of typed URL model association, which happens once each time sync starts up.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of typed url run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during typed url association.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlsConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of typed url configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of typed url association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of typed url association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.UnrecoverableErrors
histogram.summary: Enumeration of the different reasons for unrecoverable errors and how often they have occurred.

histogram.name: Sync.URLFetchResponse
histogram.summary: Counts of responses (both http code and net error code) for Sync URL fetches.

histogram.name: Sync.URLFetchTime
histogram.summary: Time spent waiting for a sync cycle to complete the url fetch.

histogram.name: Sync.URLFetchTimedOut
histogram.summary: Whether a url fetch timed out or not. Timing out implies the fetch was stalled for an unknown reason.

histogram.name: Sync.UserPerceivedAuthorizationTime
histogram.summary: Time the user spends looking at the authorization dialog.

histogram.name: Sync.UserPerceivedBookmarkAssociation
histogram.summary: Time taken during bookmark association.

histogram.name: Sync.USSLoadModelsTime
histogram.summary: Time it took sync to load models for USS datatypes.

histogram.name: Sync.USSMigrationFailure
histogram.summary: Counts directory to USS migration failures per model type.

histogram.name: Sync.USSMigrationSuccess
histogram.summary: Counts directory to USS migration successes per model type.

histogram.name: Sync.WifiCredentialsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during WiFi credentials association.

histogram.name: Sync.WifiCredentialsConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of WiFi credentials configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.WifiCredentialsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of WiFi credentials association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.WorkerApplyHasEncryptedUpdates
histogram.summary: Whether there are still encrypted updates that the cryptographer cannot decrypt during ApplyUpdates in the ModelTypeWorker (USS Only). Emitting true is an invalid state that hopefully never happens, as it is a potential data loss scenario.

histogram.name: Sync.YoungestForeignTabAgeOnNTP
histogram.summary: Upon NTP load, the age of the youngest synced foreign tab.

histogram.name: SyncedNotifications.Actions
histogram.summary: The actions taken on synced notifications, recorded every time they happen. This histogram will record every single event that happens separately.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.ConflictResolutionPolicy
histogram.summary: Overridden conflict resolution policy of Sync FileSystem API. Recorded for each API call to override the policy.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.Database.Open
histogram.summary: The result of opening the Sync FileSystem backend database.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.MetadataNumber
histogram.summary: The number of cached backing remote file metadata in the Sync FileSystem database. Recorded at the initialization phase of Sync FileSystem.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.RegisteredAppNumber
histogram.summary: The number of Chrome Apps that uses Sync FileSystem with V2 backend. Recorded at the initialization phase of Sync FileSystem.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.RegisterOriginResult
histogram.summary: The result of the registration of Chrome App to Sync FileSystem.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.RegisterOriginTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed to register a Chrome App to SyncFilesystem. Recorded for each registration request by apps.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.TrackerDB.Open
histogram.summary: The result of opening the Sync FileSystem tracker database.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.TrackerNumber
histogram.summary: The number of the directory tree node that maps backing files to local files in the Sync FileSystem database. Recorded at the initialization phase of SyncFileSystem.

histogram.name: SyncPromo.NTPPromo
histogram.summary: Shows actions taken on the "Not signed in? You're misssing out" link on the top right of chrome://apps. Logged once per visit of chrome://apps as well as on each click of the sync promo.

histogram.name: Syzyasan.DeferredFreeWasEnabled
histogram.summary: Record whether the deferred free mechanism was successfully enabled or not. This is only recorded in syzyasan builds with the feature enabled.

histogram.name: Tab.AgeUponRestoreFromColdStart
histogram.summary: Age (time since the last display in previous sessions) of a tab being restored due to the first tab switch after the browser cold start, recorded upon such restore. When the browser is started from cold, this metric is not recorded for the foreground, automatically restored tab, so that the metric tracks only the restores triggered by direct user decision to switch tabs.

histogram.name: Tab.AndroidCrashUpload
histogram.summary: Count of upload success/failures by crash type.

histogram.name: Tab.BackgroundLoadStatus
histogram.summary: Mobile-specific metric: when a tab that was opened in background (via "Open link in new tab") is switched to, we record whether the eagerly loaded tab was still memory resident, or we lost the loaded page due to memory pressure.

histogram.name: Tab.BackgroundTabShown
histogram.summary: Whether a tab which was opened in the background (e.g. via "Open link in new tab") is foregrounded prior to being closed.

histogram.name: Tab.BackgroundTabsOpenedViaContextMenuCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of background tabs opened via the context menu per page URL. The count is reset on each navigation of the parent tab. Zero counts are not recorded.

histogram.name: Tab.Close
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from trying to close the tab to actually closing it. Includes time that's spent in JS OnUnload handlers.

histogram.name: Tab.Close.UnloadTime
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from when JS OnUnload handlers have finished to actually closing tab. Doesn't include time that's spent in JS OnUnload handlers. If there are no UnLoad handlers, should be idential to Tab.Close.

histogram.name: Tab.Deactivation.Bookmarked
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2016. No longer useful after finding out that it has no effect on tab reactivation rates.
histogram.summary: A tab was deactivated. Closing tabs are not included. This histogram also records if the tab's URL was bookmarked.

histogram.name: Tab.Deactivation.HadFormInteraction
histogram.summary: A tab was deactivated. Closing tabs are not included. This histogram also records if the tab had any form interaction.

histogram.name: Tab.Deactivation.Pinned
histogram.summary: A tab was deactivated. Closing tabs are not included. This histogram also records if the tab was pinned to the tab strip or not.

histogram.name: Tab.Discarding
histogram.summary: Metric to track counts of actions related to tab discarding. Namely, we get an event for every tab switch, split into two groups, whether it was a discarded tab not. We also get an event whenever a tab gets discarded as well as when a tab that's playing audio gets discarded.

histogram.name: Tab.Discarding.DiscardCount
histogram.summary: Metric to track the number of discards tabs have gone through. Each time a tab is discarded, this histogram is recorded. Therefore, this metric is cumulative, ie. as a tab gets discarded over and over, it gets a hit in each bin (1, 2, 3...).

histogram.name: Tab.EvictedTabWasActive
histogram.summary: [iOS] When switching to an evicted tab, this histogram records whether or not the tab had ever been active. For example, the tab was opened via "Open in new tab" but evicted before being viewed for the first time.

histogram.name: Tab.FormActivityCountEvictedHistogram
histogram.summary: A count of form activity (e.g. fields selected, characters typed) in a tab. Recorded only for tabs that are evicted due to memory pressure and then selected again.

histogram.name: Tab.LostTabAgeWhenSwitchedToForeground
histogram.summary: [Android] When a tab that was opened in the background (e.g. via "Open link in new tab") is evicted prior to the first time that it is shown, we record the tab's age at the time that the tab is shown.

histogram.name: Tab.NewTab
histogram.summary: Tracks the different ways users are opening new tabs. Does not apply to opening existing links or searches in a new tab, only to brand new empty tabs. Note: Currently the "Regular menu option" includes some programmatic actions in addition to user actions.

histogram.name: Tab.NewTabDOMContentLoaded
histogram.summary: The time for the new tab page to fire the "DOMContentLoaded" event.

histogram.name: Tab.NewTabOnload
histogram.summary: The time for the new tab page to fire the "load" event. Note: This is usually recorded with a suffix (.Local*/Google/Other). The base version is recorded only on Android, as well as for the old NTP ("NTP4") on other platforms. Recorded only once per tab, i.e. excluding back/forward navigations.

histogram.name: Tab.NewTabScriptStart
histogram.summary: The time for the new tab page to start executing JavaScript.

histogram.name: Tab.PerceivedRestoreTime
histogram.summary: User-perceived load time for a successful tab restore, measured from the first time the user sees the tab being restored until the load completes.

histogram.name: Tab.Reactivation.Bookmarked
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2016. No longer useful after finding out that it has no effect on tab reactivation rates.
histogram.summary: A tab was reactivated after being hidden. This histogram also records if the tab's URL was bookmarked.

histogram.name: Tab.Reactivation.HadFormInteraction
histogram.summary: A tab was reactivated after being hidden. This histogram also records if the tab had any form interaction.

histogram.name: Tab.Reactivation.Pinned
histogram.summary: A tab was reactivated after being hidden. This histogram also records if the tab was pinned to the tab strip.

histogram.name: Tab.RendererCrashStatus
histogram.summary: The status of a tab and an application when a renderer crashes. This is recorded only for Android when a renderer crashes.

histogram.name: Tab.RendererDetailedExitStatus
histogram.summary: Breakdown of renderer exit status for renderers that have strong bindings. An extension of the counts in Tab.RendererExitStatus. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Tab.RendererDetailedExitStatusUnbound
histogram.summary: Breakdown of renderer exit status for renderers that do not have strong bindings. An extension of the counts in Tab.RendererExitStatus. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Tab.RendererExitStatus
histogram.summary: The status of a renderer when the browser notices that the process has exited. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Tab.RestoreResult
histogram.summary: When the browser restores a tab, whether the load was successful. Loads can fail for instance when there is no connectivity.

histogram.name: Tab.RestoreTime
histogram.summary: Load time for a successful tab restore.

histogram.name: Tab.RestoreUserPersistence
histogram.summary: When the browser restores a tab, whether the user waits for completion of the load or if the user gives up by switching to another tab or leaving Chrome.

histogram.name: Tab.StatusWhenDisplayed
histogram.summary: The status of a tab collected each time the tab is displayed on Android, including user switching to the tab and displays of newly created tabs, such as NTP or tabs opened to handle intents.

histogram.name: Tab.StatusWhenSwitchedBackToForeground
histogram.summary: The status of a tab collected each time the user switches to it on mobile. That does not include tabs being created at the time the user switches to them, such as NTP or tabs opened to handle intents.

histogram.name: Tab.StatusWhenSwitchedBackToForegroundDataProxyEnabled
histogram.summary: The status of a tab collected each time the user switches to it on mobile with the data reduction proxy enabled. This is populated identically, and in addition to Tab.StatusWhenSwitchedBackToForeground for any given tab switching event if the proxy is enabled.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundAge
histogram.summary: Age (in ms) when the tab was switched to foreground.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundLaunchedWithURL
histogram.summary: Each time a tab is brought to the foreground, this histogram indicates if chrome was launched without an URL (i.e., from the launcher), or with an URL (i.e., from another app).

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundMRURank
histogram.summary: Rank in MRU order (0 being first) when the tab was switched to foreground.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundNumTabs
histogram.summary: Count of all tabs when a tab is switched.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundRevisit
histogram.summary: Each time a tab is brought to the foreground, this histogram indicates if this is the first viewing of the tab since Chrome was put into foreground, or if it was a return to a tab that has already been shown in this session.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeSinceActive
histogram.summary: [iOS] When an existing tab becomes active, this histogram records the time since it was made inactive.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeSinceActiveEvicted
histogram.summary: [iOS] When an evicted tab becomes active, this histogram records the time since it was made inactive.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeSinceFormActivityEvictedHistogram
histogram.summary: Time elapsed since there was form activity (e.g. fields selected, characters typed) in a tab. Recorded only for tabs that are evicted due to memory pressure and then selected again.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeToReactivation.Important
histogram.summary: The time elapsed from the moment a tab was deactivated until it was reactivated. Only recorded for tabs that are pinned or had form interaction.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeToReactivation.Normal
histogram.summary: The time elapsed from the moment a tab was deactivated until it was reactivated. Only recorded for tabs that are not pinned nor had form interaction.

histogram.name: Tab.TotalTabCount.BeforeLeavingApp
histogram.summary: The total count of tabs which were kept while Chrome process is in the foreground. This is recorded only for Android right before Chrome process goes into the background.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.DiscardCount
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of tabs discarded due to low memory conditions, recorded once per tab discard event. For example, a user who had 3 tabs discarded records a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more tab discard events.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.DiscardedEngagementScore
histogram.summary: Site engagement score of a discarded tab. Recorded for each discard if the score is available.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.DiscardedTabHasBeforeUnloadHandler
histogram.summary: Recorded for each discarding, allowing us to know whether the discarded tab had a before unload handler or not.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.DiscardToReloadTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time between a tab getting discarded to eventually being reloaded by the user.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.InactiveToReloadTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time between the time a tab switched from being active to inactive (that eventually gets discarded) until it gets reloaded.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.ReloadCount
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of discarded tabs that have been reloaded by the user, recorded once per tab discard event. For example, a user who had 3 tabs reloaded records a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more tab reload events.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.ReloadedEngagementScore
histogram.summary: Site engagement score of a reloaded tab. Recorded for each reload if the score is available. Note that this will be the same score the tab had when discarded (which could have changed by the time it gets reloaded).

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.ReloadToCloseTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time between the last time a discarded tab was reloaded and the time it gets closed.

histogram.name: Tabs.CountAtResume
histogram.summary: The number of tabs open when the app comes out of the background.

histogram.name: Tabs.CountAtStartup
histogram.summary: The number of tabs open at cold launch.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.DiscardCount
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of tabs discarded due to low memory conditions, recorded once per tab discard event. For example, a user who had 3 tabs discarded records a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more tab discard events.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.DiscardInLastMinute
histogram.summary: Whether or not a tab was discarded in the last minute of usage. Total count is number of minutes of device usage. 100 / discard percentage gives the average number of minutes between discard events.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.InitialTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated May 4, 2012. Replaced by Tabs.Discard.InitialTime2 because this stat had too low of a range maximum. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Time in seconds between system startup and when the first tab is discarded due to low memory conditions. Higher is better.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.InitialTime2
histogram.summary: Time in seconds between system startup and when the first tab is discarded due to low memory conditions. Higher is better. Range maximum is approximately one day.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.IntervalTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated May 4, 2012. Replaced by Tabs.Discard.IntervalTime2 because this stat had too low of a range maximum. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Time in seconds between tab discard events after the first one, recorded once per discard event. Higher is better.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.IntervalTime2
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds between tab discard events after the first one, recorded once per discard event. Should occur no faster than once every 750 ms. Higher is better.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.MemAllocatedMB
histogram.summary: System-wide memory allocation at the time a tab was discarded, roughly equivalent to the sum of memory allocated with malloc() in userspace plus graphics driver memory.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.MemAnonymousMB
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated December 7, 2012. Replaced by Tabs.Discard.MemAllocatedMB because this stat has insufficient precision in the 2-4 GB range and does not properly account for graphics memory on ARM.
histogram.summary: System-wide anonymous memory allocation at the time a tab was discarded, roughly equivalent to memory allocated with malloc().

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.MemAvailableMB
histogram.summary: System-wide file-backed memory plus free memory, roughly equivalent to what the kernel uses to trigger low-memory notifications for tab discards. If lower than the kernel's threshold then we are not effectively freeing memory in response to the initial notification and are repeatedly being notified.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.MemGraphicsMB
histogram.summary: Graphics driver (GEM object) memory at the time of a tab discard.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.MemShmemMB
histogram.summary: System-wide shared memory at the time of a tab discard. Used primarily for shared buffers in the graphics system. Tracked because it's a historical source of leaks on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.ReloadCount
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of times a tab was reloaded because it was discarded and the user clicked on it later, recorded once per reload event. For example, a user who clicks on 3 discarded tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more reload events. Compare to Tabs.Discard.DiscardCount.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.TabCount
histogram.summary: The number of tabs open across all browser windows when a tab was discarded due to low memory conditions.

histogram.name: Tabs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenTabClosedAndNextTabCreated
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between closing a tab and opening another, to track very frequent tabs.

histogram.name: Tabs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenTabCreatedAndNextTabCreated
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between opening a tab and opening another, to track very frequent tabs.

histogram.name: Tabs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenTabCreatedAndSameTabClosed
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between opening a tab and closing it, to track very short-lived tabs.

histogram.name: Tabs.FirstSwitchedToForegroundCreationRank
histogram.summary: Records the "Tab Creation Rank" for the first background tab which was switched to the foreground. The "Tab Creation Rank" is relative to other background tabs which were opened from the same URL via the context menu. The oldest background tab has a rank of zero.

histogram.name: Tabs.FirstSwitchedToForegroundCreationReverseRank
histogram.summary: Records the "Reverse Tab Creation Rank" for the first background background tab which was switched to the foreground. The "Reverse Tab Creation Rank" is relative to other background tabs which were opened from the same URL via the context menu. The newest background tab has a "Reverse Tab Creation Rank" of zero.

histogram.name: Tabs.ForegroundTabAgeAtStartup
histogram.summary: Age (time since the last display in previous sessions) of the foreground tab being restored on the browser cold start.

histogram.name: Tabs.iOS_PostRedirectPLT
histogram.summary: Page load time (PLT) for iOS that does not include time spent following redirects. On other platforms this is calculated from Navigation Timings but on iOS Navigation Timings are not available so we're recreating a calculation similar to PLT.PT_RequestToFinish but not including time spent following redirects. This metric represents the time between when navigation is initiated (prior to DNS, TCP connect, etc but after following redirects) until loading ends (i.e. JS onload event). On non-iOS Chrome this is (performance.timing.loadEventEnd - performance.timing.redirectEnd). On Chrome for iOS we're calculating the time between the creation of the top-level URLRequest and when webDidFinishWithURL is called.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.CrashCreated
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of times a tab crashed with "Aw, Snap!", recorded once per tab crash event. For example, a user who crashed 3 tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more crash events. The user may not have actually seen the sad tab page, as it might have been an inactive tab. Compare to Tabs.SadTab.CrashDisplayed.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.CrashDisplayed
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of times a tab crashed with "Aw, Snap!" and the user saw the page, recorded once per tab crash event. For example, a user who crashed 3 tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more crash events. Compare to Tabs.SadTab.CrashCreated.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.Feedback.Event
histogram.summary: Counts of events from the style of sad tab which has a feedback button as its primary action. Currently, events include being displayed (actually visible in a window), and the actions a user can take on the page.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.KillCreated
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of times a tab was killed with a "He's dead, Jim!" page, which is usually due to the renderer being killed, recorded once per tab kill event. For example, a user who loses 3 tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more kill events. The user may not have actually seen the sad tab page, as it might have been an inactive tab. Compare to Tabs.SadTab.KillDisplayed. This can happen due to out of memory, malformed IPC messages, or a SIGINT/TERM/KILL signal sent by a user.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.KillCreated.OOM
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of times a tab was killed with a "He's dead, Jim!" page due to the kernel out-of-memory killer, recorded once per tab kill event. For example, a user who loses 3 tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more kill events. The user may not have actually seen the sad tab page, as it might have been an inactive tab. Compare to Tabs.SadTab.KillDisplayed.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.KillDisplayed
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of times a tab was killed with a "He's dead, Jim!" page and the user saw the page, recorded once per tab kill event. For example, a user who loses 3 tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more kill events. Compare to Tabs.SadTab.CrashCreated.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.KillDisplayed.OOM
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of times a tab was killed with a "He's dead, Jim!" page due to the kernel out-of-memory killer and the user saw the page, recorded once per tab kill event. For example, a user who loses 3 tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more kill events. Compare to Tabs.SadTab.CrashCreated.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.OomCreated
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of times a tab crashed with "Aw, Snap!", recorded once per tab oom event. For example, a user who ran out of memory in 3 tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more oom events. The user may not have actually seen the sad tab page, as it might have been an inactive tab. Compare to Tabs.SadTab.OomDisplayed.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.OomDisplayed
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of times a tab ran out of memory with "Aw, Snap!" and the user saw the page, recorded once per tab oom event. For example, a user who ran out of memory in 3 tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more oom events. Compare to Tabs.SadTab.OomCreated.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.Reload.Event
histogram.summary: Counts of events from the style of sad tab which has a reload button as its primary action. Compare to Tabs.SadTab.Feedback.Event.

histogram.name: Tabs.SadTab.ReloadCount
histogram.summary: The number of times a tab was reloaded because it was killed (usually by the kernel OOM killer) and the user clicked on it later, recorded once per reload event. For example, a user who clicks on 3 discarded tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more reload events. Compare to Tabs.Discard.DiscardCount.

histogram.name: Tabs.ScrubDistance
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The distance a user 3 finger scrubbed to change tabs. Always positive (ignores left / right).

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreApplicability
histogram.summary: Applicability of speculative tab restore, recorded every time a tab is switched. This allows to estimate the fraction of tab restores experienced on mobile that can be mitigated using speculative restore. Options higher in the enum take precedence over the lower ones (i.e. low-memory tablet will be accounted as tablet).

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestorePredictionAccuracy.SideSwipe
histogram.summary: Accuracy of the tab switch predictions made when the user begins the side swipe gesture.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestorePredictionAccuracy.TabSwitcher
histogram.summary: Accuracy of the tab switch predictions made when the user enters the tab switcher.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreTargetStatus
histogram.summary: Status of a tab recorded when the tab is targeted with speculative restore.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreTimeAhead.SideSwipe
histogram.summary: Time between starting the speculative load and actual tab switch for correct speculative load predictions made when the user begins the side swipe gesture.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreTimeAhead.TabSwitcher
histogram.summary: Time between starting the speculative load and actual tab switch for correct speculative load predictions made when the user enters the tab switcher.

histogram.name: Tabs.StateTransfer.NumberOfOtherTabsActivatedBeforeMadeActive
histogram.summary: Recorded once per tab activation. The number of tabs that were activated while the tab was inactive.
histogram.details: This metric is to be removed after M46 hits stable. We don't expect this metric to change over release, so we will remove this once we have the numbers from stable.

histogram.name: Tabs.StateTransfer.TabDistanceInactiveToActive
histogram.summary: Number of tabs between the previously active tab and the new active tab.
histogram.details: This metric is to be removed after M46 hits stable. We don't expect this metric to change over release, so we will remove this once we have the numbers from stable.

histogram.name: Tabs.StateTransfer.Target
histogram.summary: The state to which a tab transitioned. Recorded when a tab transitions from the state in the histogram name to a new state.
histogram.details: kouhei@ and tzik@ will remove some variation of these once M46 hits stable.

histogram.name: Tabs.StateTransfer.Time
histogram.summary: Tabs.StateTransfer.TimeA_B measures the time a tab was in state A before it transferred to state B.

histogram.name: Tabs.SwitchFromCloseLatency
histogram.summary: Time between the event that closes a tab and the start of rendering.

histogram.name: Tabs.SwitchFromExitLatency
histogram.summary: Time between the event that exits an app and the start of rendering.

histogram.name: Tabs.SwitchFromNewLatency
histogram.summary: Time between the event that creates a tab and the start of rendering.

histogram.name: Tabs.SwitchFromUserLatency
histogram.summary: Time between the event that selects a tab and the start of rendering.

histogram.name: Tabs.TabCountActiveWindow
histogram.summary: The number of tabs open in the active window when a load completes.

histogram.name: Tabs.TabCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of tabs open in all browsers (counting app-mode windows) when a load completes.
histogram.details:
This is basically the average number of tabs over time.
See also MPArch.RPHCountPerLoad for the number of processes used by these tabs.

histogram.name: Tabs.TabCountPerWindow
histogram.summary: The number of tabs open per window (counting app-mode windows) when a load completes.
histogram.details: This value will be recorded multiple times per load if more than one window is open.

histogram.name: TabsApi.RequestedWindowState
histogram.summary: The requested window creation state from the tabs extensions API when it's used to create a new window or update the state of an existing one.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.BlockShutdownTasksPostedDuringShutdown
histogram.summary: Number of BLOCK_SHUTDOWN tasks that were posted to a base::TaskScheduler after its Shutdown() method was called but before it returned.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.DetachDuration
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between when the thread managed by a SchedulerWorker is detached and when the main function of a new thread managed by the same SchedulerWorker is entered (following a wake up). Recorded each time that a thread is recreated for a given SchedulerWorker.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.NumTasksBeforeDetach
histogram.summary: Number of tasks executed by a SchedulerWorker before it detached. Recorded when a SchedulerWorker detaches.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.NumTasksBetweenWaits
histogram.summary: Number of tasks executed by a SchedulerWorker between two waits on its WaitableEvent. This should be maximized without affecting perceived browser performance.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.TaskLatency
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 4/2017. Units changed from milliseconds to microseconds.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between when a task is posted and when it starts to run. Recorded for each task that runs inside the TaskScheduler.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.TaskLatencyMicroseconds
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between when a task is posted and when it starts to run. Recorded for each task that runs inside the TaskScheduler.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Certificates.Microsoft
histogram.summary: The total number of certificates for modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process that are signed by Microsoft. A catalog counts as a single certificate, and may refer to many modules. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Certificates.Total
histogram.summary: The total number of certificates for modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. A catalog counts as a single certificate, and may refer to many modules. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Loaded
histogram.summary: The total number of third-party modules (neither Microsoft nor Google) that are loaded in the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.NotLoaded
histogram.summary: The total number of third-party modules (neither Microsoft nor Google) that are not yet loaded in the browser process, but may potentially be (shell extensions, for example). Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Signed
histogram.summary: The total number of signed modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Signed.Catalog
histogram.summary: The total number of modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process that are signed via a catalog. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Signed.Microsoft
histogram.summary: The total number of modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process that are signed by Microsoft. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Total
histogram.summary: The total number of modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThreadWatcher.ResponseTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes indicated thread to respond with a pong message for a ping message from WatchDog thread.

histogram.name: ThreadWatcher.ResponsiveThreads
histogram.summary: This is the total number of watched threads that are responding when we got no response from the watched thread.

histogram.name: ThreadWatcher.Unresponsive
histogram.summary: This is the total unresponsive time since last pong message for the indicated thread when we got no response from the watched thread.

histogram.name: ThreadWatcher.UnresponsiveThreads
histogram.summary: This is the total number of watched threads that are not responding when we got no response from the watched thread.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.CopyFromSurfaceTime
histogram.summary: While taking a screenshot of the current tab for use as a thumbnail on the New Tab page, the time it took to copy the tab's contents into a bitmap.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.ProcessBitmapTime
histogram.summary: While taking a screenshot of the current tab for use as a thumbnail on the New Tab page, the time it took to post-process the captured bitmap.

histogram.name: TileManager.ExceededMemoryBudget
histogram.summary: Measures whether the tile manager exceeded the hard GPU memory budget (OOMed). Recorded each time the tile manager assigns GPU memory to tiles.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Event
histogram.summary: Events in TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: Http response codes in TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseFailureTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (failed) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseSuccessTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (successfull) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Result
histogram.summary: Result of TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Retries
histogram.summary: Number of retries until the final response was recorded.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ActionsModel.ComponentActionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of component action icons the Browser Actions Container knows about (visible or in the overflow bucket). Does not count icons that have been permanently hidden by the user. Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ActionsModel.OverallActionsCount
histogram.summary: The total number of action icons the Browser Actions Container knows about (visible or in the overflow bucket). Does not count icons that have been permanently hidden by the user. Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ActionsModel.ToolbarActionsVisible
histogram.summary: The number of visible toolbar icons in the Browser Actions Container (visible as in number of icons not in the overflow bucket). 0 means all icons are in the overflow bucket. MAX_INT means the toolbar is always showing all icons. Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile but only for those profiles that have one or more browser actions showing in the toolbar.

histogram.name: Toolbar.AppMenuTimeToAction
histogram.summary: The number of millseconds between when the user opens the app menu and when the app menu is closed. Logged once per app menu run when the menu closes. Not recorded for menu runs that are initiated by a drag-and-drop sequence. Note that the code paths for Views-platforms vs Mac are different, so cross- platform comparison may not always be reasonable.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ShowToolsMenuResponsiveness
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between the event that triggers the presentation of the tools menu (the main menu of actions accessed from the toolbar), and the actual appearance of the menu on screen. Includes the animation duration.

histogram.name: TopSites.NumberOfApplyBlacklist
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times TopSitesImpl::ApplyBlacklist is called.

histogram.name: TopSites.NumberOfBlacklistedItems
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of items in the user Most Visited blacklist every time TopSitesImpl::ApplyBlacklist is called.

histogram.name: TouchBar.Default.Metrics
histogram.summary: Tracks the usage of the default touch bar buttons.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Device
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad device state.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Metrics
histogram.summary: Tracks unusual CrOS touchpad operational states (e.g. running into the noisy ground issue). This is sampled at every touchpad event.

histogram.name: Touchpad.NaturalScroll.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad natural scroll setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.NaturalScroll.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad natural scroll setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting changes by the user. This replaces the old Touchpad.Sensitivity.Changed metric.

histogram.name: Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting on startup. This replaces the old Touchpad.Sensitivity.Started metric.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Sensitivity.Changed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2013, replaced by Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Changed.
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Sensitivity.Started
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2013, replaced by Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Started.
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapDragging.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapDragging setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapDragging.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapDragging setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapToClick.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapToClick setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapToClick.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapToClick setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchscreen.TapDisambiguation
histogram.summary: How the user interacted with the tap disambiguation feature on Android.

histogram.name: Touchscreen.TouchEventsEnabled
histogram.summary:
Tracks whether Touch Event Feature Detection is enabled. This is based on the touch events enabled flag and the presence of a touchscreen.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.
histogram.details: NOTE: This metric was incorrectly recorded on ChromeOS for versions 42 through 45, see http://crbug.com/499476 for more details. As of http://crbug.com/644318, we changed the internal name to TouchEventFeatureDetection, but we still keep the old histogram name here to keep consistensy.

histogram.name: TPM.EarlyResetDuringCommand
histogram.summary: Reported at boot if the previous boot session was interrupted in the middle of a TPM command during the first 30 seconds of uptime.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.FinalizingTraceSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size, in kilobytes, of a finalized trace ready to be uploaded.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.ScenarioState
histogram.summary: Records state of the Background Tracing system, from when scenarios are attempted to be activated until they're completed (successfully or failed)

histogram.name: TrackedObjects.GetRetiredOrCreateThreadData
histogram.summary: Time spent in base::ThreadData::GetRetiredOrCreateThreadData(). This method is called at most once per thread, when its name is set, when it posts a task or when it runs a task (whichever comes first).

histogram.name: TrafficStatsAmortizer.AmortizationDelay
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent waiting to perform an amortization run. This is logged at the end of each amortization run, before passing any DataUse objects to their respective callbacks.

histogram.name: TrafficStatsAmortizer.BufferSizeOnFlush
histogram.summary: The number of DataUse objects processed in an amortization run.

histogram.name: TrafficStatsAmortizer.ConcurrentTabs
histogram.summary: The number of unique tabs seen across all DataUse objects buffered for a single amortization run by the TrafficStatsAmortizer. This is recorded even if TrafficStats byte counts are unavailable, but not recorded if no DataUse objects have been buffered.

histogram.name: TrafficStatsAmortizer.PostAmortizationRunDataUseBytes
histogram.summary: The total bytes after performing amortization across all DataUse objects buffered for a single amortization run by the TrafficStatsAmortizer. This is recorded even if TrafficStats byte counts are unavailable, but not recorded if no DataUse objects have been buffered.

histogram.name: TrafficStatsAmortizer.PreAmortizationRunDataUseBytes
histogram.summary: The total bytes before performing amortization across all DataUse objects buffered for a single amortization run by the TrafficStatsAmortizer. This is recorded even if TrafficStats byte counts are unavailable, but not recorded if no DataUse objects have been buffered.

histogram.name: Translate.AlwaysTranslateLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the always translate option was selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.BubbleUiEvent
histogram.summary: Tracks UI events related to the translate bubble.

histogram.name: Translate.CaptureText
histogram.summary: The time spent capturing plain text from the DOM. This is reported by ChromeRenderViewObserver when a page is loaded completely.

histogram.name: Translate.CLD2.LanguageAccuracy
histogram.summary: Accuracy of the language detected by CLD2. Only recorded if the detection returned a "known" result.

histogram.name: Translate.CLD2.LanguageDetected
histogram.summary: Language of page detected by CLD2.

histogram.name: Translate.CLD3.LanguageDetected
histogram.summary: Language of the input page detected by CLD3. This information is logged on every page load.

histogram.name: Translate.CLD3.LanguagePercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of the bytes that are associated with the most popular language on the input page. Only recorded if the detection returned a "known" result.

histogram.name: Translate.CompactInfobar.Event
histogram.summary: Various user actions performed in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.CompactInfobar.Language.AlwaysTranslate
histogram.summary: Records the hashcode of the source language when always translate this language option is clicked in the menu.

histogram.name: Translate.CompactInfobar.Language.MoreLanguages
histogram.summary: Records the hashcode of the language clicked on the more languages menu.

histogram.name: Translate.CompactInfobar.Language.NeverTranslate
histogram.summary: Records the hashcode of the source language when never translate this language option is clicked in the menu.

histogram.name: Translate.CompactInfobar.Language.PageNotIn
histogram.summary: Records the hashcode of the language clicked on the menu to indicate the page is not in the selected language.

histogram.name: Translate.CompactInfobar.Language.Translate
histogram.summary: Records the hashcode of the language clicked on the infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.CompactInfobar.TranslationsPerPage
histogram.summary: Records the number of times a page is translated, every time the page is translated. For instance on a page a) translation from A to B, we record "1" b) from A to B - we record "1" and revert from B to A - we record "2" c) from A to B - we record "1", then translation to C - we record "2". d) from A to B - we record "1", then translation to C - we record "2" and then revert to A - we record "3". We increment the translation count: a) every time the target language is changed. b) every time we revert to the original language (user can only revert to original language and not intermediate target languages). This essentially means 1 denotes >= 1 translations, 2 is >=2 translations per page and so on. This will give us a sense of how often people try out several translates on a page, or flip back and forth.

histogram.name: Translate.ContentLanguage
histogram.summary: A page may provide a Content-Language HTTP header or a META tag. For each page load, measures whether the Content-Language header exists and is valid.

histogram.name: Translate.DeclineTranslate
histogram.summary: The number of times the "Nope" (don't translate) or the infobar's X button was clicked in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.DeclineTranslateCloseInfobar
histogram.summary: The number of times the translate infobar was closed by clicking the X button without the user translating the page.

histogram.name: Translate.DeclineTranslateDismissUI
histogram.summary: The number of times the translate UI was closed without translating in the way that the user doesn't deny translating explicityly, like pressing 'Nope' button.
