This is counted on both the infobar and the bubble UI. We are comparing this on infobar to that on bubble by A/B testing and expecting that the user will click 'Nope' button on bubble less times than infobar. We won't delete this histogram after the experiment.

histogram.name: Translate.HtmlLang
histogram.summary: A page may provide a lang attribute in html tag. For each page load, measures whether the lang attribute exists and is valid.

histogram.name: Translate.InitiationStatus
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 11/2013, and replaced by Translate.InitiationStatus.v2.
histogram.summary: The reason why Chrome decided to perform the next action (e.g., to show infobar, to translate a page without any prompting, and so on) when Chrome Translate is ready to translate a page.

histogram.name: Translate.InitiationStatus.v2
histogram.summary: The reason why Chrome decided to perform the next action (e.g., to show infobar, to translate a page without any prompting, and so on) when Chrome Translate is ready to translate a page.

histogram.name: Translate.LanguageDetectionConflict
histogram.summary:
This metric logs CLD3-detected languages for pages that specify a conflicting English language in their markup. In these cases, we must decide on a language source to favor.
Bucket names are of the form "x,y", where x is the common English language code specified in the page markup (or "other" if the English language code is uncommon), and y is the CLD3-detected language.
This histogram only logs detection conflicts. Hence, "matching" buckets (e.g. "en,en", "en-AU,en") will never be populated.

histogram.name: Translate.LanguageDetectionTiming
histogram.summary: For each page load, records whether language detection occurs on time or gets deferred. If deferred language detection later completes, this is also recorded. This allows measuring the UX impact of using a non-static CLD data source.

histogram.name: Translate.LanguageVerification
histogram.summary: For each page load, measures whether the provided HTML language (i.e. the page lang attribute if it exists, otherwise the header Content-Language value) matches the language determined by CLD. Beyond directly matching or mismatching the HTML language, CLD can complement the HTML language. For example, suppose the HTML language is 'zh' (general Chinese), a language code that the Translate server does not support. In this case, CLD can detect a subcode like '-TW' or '-CN', resulting in language codes 'zh-TW' and 'zh-CN', which the Translate server supports. This is referred to as "complementing a language subcode".

histogram.name: Translate.LocalesOnDisabledByPrefs
histogram.summary: Logs the user locale when the Translate feature is disabled by the user. This is recorded each time a webpage is loaded and prefs for translation is checked. This allows us to investigate the correlation between the user locale and the usage rates of the Translate.

histogram.name: Translate.ModifyOriginalLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the original language in the translate infobar has been changed.

histogram.name: Translate.ModifyTargetLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the target language in the translate infobar has been changed.

histogram.name: Translate.NeverTranslateLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the never translate option was selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.NeverTranslateSite
histogram.summary: The number of times the never translate site was selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.PageScheme
histogram.summary: Counts translation target page schemes.

histogram.name: Translate.Ranker.Model.Status
histogram.summary: Tracks the outcome of attempts to download a Translate Ranker Model.

histogram.name: Translate.Ranker.Model.Version
histogram.summary: The date tamp (e.g., 20160916 -> 15 Sept 2016) which denotes the TranslateRankerModel's version.

histogram.name: Translate.Ranker.QueryResult
histogram.summary: Whether the TranslateRanker accepts or denies to show the translation prompt.

histogram.name: Translate.Ranker.Timer.CalculateScore
histogram.summary: Time taken for the TranslateRanker to use the translate ranker model to calculate a score for the translation, in ms.

histogram.name: Translate.Ranker.Timer.DownloadModel
histogram.summary: Time taken for the Translate Ranker Model Loader to download its model from the configured URL, in ms.

histogram.name: Translate.Ranker.Timer.ParseModel
histogram.summary: Time taken for the Translate Ranker Model Loader to parse its model, in ms.

histogram.name: Translate.Ranker.Timer.ReadModel
histogram.summary: Time taken for the Translate Ranker Model Loader to read its model from local storage (cache), in ms.

histogram.name: Translate.Ranker.Timer.ShouldOfferTranslation
histogram.summary: Time taken for the TranslateRanker to decide if a given translation should be offered or not, in ms. This includes the time taken to extract the relevant features upon which to base the decision, as well as the time taken to calculate the result.

histogram.name: Translate.Ranker.Timer.WriteModel
histogram.summary: Time taken for the Translate Ranker Model Loader to write its model to local storage, in ms.

histogram.name: Translate.ReportLanguageDetectionError
histogram.summary: The number of times the "report this error" of options menu is selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.RevertTranslation
histogram.summary: The number of times the show original button was clicked in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.ServerReportedUnsupportedLanguage
histogram.summary: The number of times the detected language is not supported by Translate Element.

histogram.name: Translate.ShowBeforeTranslateInfobar
histogram.summary: The number of times an infobar proposing to translate a page has been shown.

histogram.name: Translate.ShowErrorInfobar
histogram.summary: Chrome Translate shows an error infobar when an error happens on translation and the infobar message depends on what kind of error happens. This metric counts how often each error message is shown.

histogram.name: Translate.ShowErrorUI
histogram.summary: Chrome Translate shows an error UI (infobar or bubble) when an error happens on translation and the UI message depends on what kind of error happens. This metric counts how often each error message is shown.

histogram.name: Translate.SimilarLanguageMatch
histogram.summary: This metrics is logged whenever a page is loaded. The logged value is "Mathced" when the CLD-detected language differs from the page language code , and the two languages are such similar languages. In that case, Chrome ignore the CLD-determined language and instead uses the page language code. The page language code is decided by Content-Language and HTML lang attribute.

histogram.name: Translate.TimeToBeReady
histogram.summary: The time from injecting scripts for Chrome Translate to being ready to perform translation.

histogram.name: Translate.TimeToLoad
histogram.summary: The time from injecting scripts for Chrome Translate to the finishing loads of all depending libraries.

histogram.name: Translate.TimeToTranslate
histogram.summary: The time from starting translation to the completion.

histogram.name: Translate.Translate
histogram.summary: The number of times the translate button was clicked in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.UndisplayableLanguage
histogram.summary: Logs an undisplayable language included in the language list sent by the Translate server. The Translate server sends the list each time the user runs Chrome. This metrics tells us that there is a language which UI should support but doesn't.

histogram.name: Translate.UnsupportedLanguageAtInitiation
histogram.summary: Logs an unsupported source language detected during initiation of the Translate feature. This is reported when the language detector successfully detects the language of the webpage, but the language is not supported by the translation server because it is too minor. This metric allows us to assess how important the unsupported language is for Google translate.

histogram.name: Translate.UserActionDuration
histogram.summary: The time from a page content language being determined to user requesting Chrome Translate.

histogram.name: TryScroll.SlowScroll
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 02/2016 in Issue 1741103002, and replaced by Renderer4.CompositorWheelScrollUpdateThread and Renderer4.CompositorTouchScrollUpdateThread.
histogram.summary: Whether a scroll is executed on main thread.

histogram.name: UI.DeviceScale
histogram.summary: The device scales available on the system at startup. A system may report more than one if it has multiple displays with varying device scales. Only logged on Windows.

histogram.name: UKM.ActualLogUploadInterval
histogram.summary: The actual interval between log upload start and previous log upload finished within the same process.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.Dropped
histogram.summary: Number of UKM entries that are dropped. Categorized by the cause of it being dropped.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.SerializedCount
histogram.summary: Number of serialized UKM entries when storing a UKM log.

histogram.name: UKM.InitSequence
histogram.summary: Logged during UkmService initialization whether the init task or the initial log timer completed first. The expectation is the vast majority of the time, the init task should complete first. If metrics show otherwise, then it may indicate there's a bug in the UkmService init sequence and that it should be investigated.

histogram.name: UKM.LogSize.OnSuccess
histogram.summary: Size in kilobytes (after compression) of an uploaded UKM log. Recorded after a successful UKM upload.

histogram.name: UKM.LogUpload.Canceled.CellularConstraint
histogram.summary: Logs whether a log was not uploaded due to cellular log throttling logic. Android only.

histogram.name: UKM.LogUpload.ResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes and network errors encountered by UKM when attempting to upload logs to the server.

histogram.name: UKM.PersistentLogRecall.Status
histogram.summary: The status when loading UKM PersistedLogs from Prefs.

histogram.name: UKM.Sources.Dropped
histogram.summary: Number of UKM sources that are dropped. Categorized by the cause of it being dropped.

histogram.name: UKM.Sources.SerializedCount
histogram.summary: Number of serialized UKM sources when storing a UKM log.

histogram.name: UKM.UnsentLogs.DroppedSize
histogram.summary: Number of bytes in an excessively large log that was discarded while persisting UKM logs to disk to retry during next chrome run.

histogram.name: UKM.UnsentLogs.NumDropped
histogram.summary: Counter for number of UKM unsent logs removed from persistent storage.

histogram.name: UKM.Upload.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: For each upload to the UKM server, log the response received from the server.

histogram.name: UMA.ActualLogUploadInterval
histogram.summary: The actual interval between log upload start and previous log upload finished within the same process.

histogram.name: UMA.AntiVirusMetricsProvider.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of the attempt to enumerate the installed AntiVirus on the machine. This is recorded once during metrics initialization.

histogram.name: UMA.CleanExitBeaconConsistency
histogram.summary: Reports the combined state of distinct clean exit beacons stored in Local State and the Windows registry. They are normally expected to be identical.

histogram.name: UMA.ClientIdBackupRecoveredWithAge
histogram.summary: Recorded when we are somehow missing the client ID stored in Local State yet are able to recover it from a backup location along with the backed up installation date. This report carries the age in hours of the recovered client id.

histogram.name: UMA.ClientIdMigrated
histogram.summary: Recorded when the one-time UMA client id reset was performed (and the client id of this user was migrated).

histogram.name: UMA.CollectExternalEventsTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of August 2015. The histogram showed no unexpected slowness, and a profiler is a better tool for identifying any future issues.
histogram.summary: The time to run the external metrics collection task (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UMA.ComputeCurrentSigninStatus
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Jun 2016. The histogram was added for debugging purpose and is not needed anymore.
histogram.summary: Records attempts to compute the current the signin status and error encountered when computing.

histogram.name: UMA.CreatePersistentHistogram.Result
histogram.summary: Records attempts to create histograms in presistent space and any errors encountered when doing so.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUpAsyncTaskDuration
histogram.summary: Measures how much time it took to complete all async deferred startup tasks on the background thread. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUpCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since application was first in foreground till all deferred tasks are done. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUpDuration
histogram.summary: Measures how much time it took to complete deferred startup tasks on the UI thread. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUpDurationAsync
histogram.summary: Measures how much time it took to complete async deferred startup tasks on the background thread. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUpMaxTaskDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the maximum amount of time a single deferred startup task took.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUptime
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since start up it took for onDeferredStartup() to be called, which schedules enablePotentialCrashUploading() to be executed on an async task. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUptime2
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since application was first in foreground till deferred tasks are initialized and queued on the idle handler. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.PostDeferredStartUptime
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since start up it took before ChromeActivity's postDeferredStartupIfNeeded() was called. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.PostDeferredStartUptime2
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since application was first in foreground till ChromeActivity's postDeferredStartupIfNeeded() was called exactly once. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.Uptime
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since start up it took before crash reporting was enabled via enablePotentialCrashUploading() as part of deferred start up. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.Uptime2
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since start up it took before crash reporting was enabled via enablePotentialCrashUploading() as part of deferred start up. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.Uptime3
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since application was first in foreground till crash reporting was enabled as part of deferred start up. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Discarded Log Events
histogram.summary: The number of events that would be discarded at log transmission time because the event count was already too large. Note that this doesn't measure actual discards - in case the UMAThrottleEvents feature is disabled, the discards won't occur.

histogram.name: UMA.EnrollmentStatus
histogram.summary: Logs the device enrollment status for Chrome OS device. Logged with every UMA upload.

histogram.name: UMA.EntropySourceType
histogram.summary: Logs the entropy source type that was used for field trial randomization. Logged once at each start up.

histogram.name: UMA.ExternalExperiment.GroupCount
histogram.summary: Logged on Android whenever an external experiment is registered. The logged value is the number of groups in the experiment. This will not be logged at all if there are no external experiments, but will be logged on group transitions (e.g. when going from 1 to 0 groups).

histogram.name: UMA.FieldTrialAllocator.Size
histogram.summary: Size, before padding, of objects allocated from persistent memory in the browser process for field trials. Updated on each subprocess launch.

histogram.name: UMA.FieldTrialsEnabledBenchmarking
histogram.summary: Log whether the --enable-benchmarking flag was set, which causes field trials to only use the default group.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.AccessResult
histogram.summary: Records attempts to access a file for the purpose of extracting metrics.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.DeletedFiles
histogram.summary: The number of old metrics files for which a delete was attempted. This is logged once with each upload operation. Values greater than 1 indicate that the files are not deletable by the browser and must be cleaned up by whatever process is creating them.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.DirectoryFiles
histogram.summary: The number of metrics files in a directory that need to be uploaded. This is logged once with each upload operation.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.InitialAccessResult
histogram.summary: Records attempts to access a file for the purpose of extracting initial stability metrics.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.InitialCheckTime.File
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent checking and mapping an initial metrics file on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.InitialCheckTime.Total
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent checking and mapping initial metrics from all files on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.InitialSnapshotTime.File
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent collecting initial stability metrics from a file on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.InitialSnapshotTime.Total
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent collecting initial stability metrics from all files on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.SnapshotTime.File
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent collecting metrics from a file on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.SnapshotTime.Total
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent collecting metrics from all files on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.GeneratedLowEntropySource
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of August 2015. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: For each attempt to generate the low entropy source, log whether or not the load required generating a new low entropy source.

histogram.name: UMA.Histograms.Activity
histogram.summary: Type and flags of every histogram created plus other activities. Counts are not mutually-exclusive except for the different types.

histogram.name: UMA.InitSequence
histogram.summary: Logged during MetricsService initialization whether the init task or the initial log timer completed first. The expectation is the vast majority of the time, the init task should complete first. If metrics show otherwise, then it may indicate there's a bug in the MetricsService init sequence and that it should be investigated.

histogram.name: UMA.IsClonedInstall
histogram.summary: This is logged with a value of true in every log when the UMA client code has detected that this is a potentially cloned install and has set the pref to reset its UMA client id on the next startup.

histogram.name: UMA.Large Accumulated Log Not Persisted
histogram.summary: Number of bytes in an excessively large log that was discarded at shutdown instead of being saved to disk to retry during next chrome run.

histogram.name: UMA.Large Rejected Log was Discarded
histogram.summary: Number of bytes in a log was was rejected by server, and then discarded.

histogram.name: UMA.LoadLogsTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of August 2015. The histograms showed no unexpected slowness, and a profiler is a better tool for identifying any future issues.
histogram.summary: The time spent to load (de-serialize) unsent logs from local state, recorded during the MetricsService startup sequence.

histogram.name: UMA.LocalPersistentMemoryAllocator.Failures.Posix
histogram.summary: Failures, as reported in errno, encountered while allocating local persistent memory under Posix.

histogram.name: UMA.LocalPersistentMemoryAllocator.Failures.Win
histogram.summary: Failures, as reported by GetLastError(), encountered while allocating local persistent memory under Windows.

histogram.name: UMA.LogLoadComplete called
histogram.summary: Simple counter of the number of times LogLoadComplete was called (bug demonstration, as we're called more often than once per page load :-/ )

histogram.name: UMA.LogSize.OnSuccess
histogram.summary: Size in kilobytes (after compression) of an uploaded UMA log. Recorded after a successful UMA upload.

histogram.name: UMA.LogUpload.Canceled.CellularConstraint
histogram.summary: Logs whether a log was not uploaded due to cellular log throttling logic. Android only.

histogram.name: UMA.LogUpload.ConnetionType
histogram.obsolete: Used for analyzing UMA log uploads on cellular connection, but necessary after the analysis is finished.
histogram.summary: The network connection type for each successful metrics log upload.

histogram.name: UMA.LogUpload.ResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes and network errors encountered by UMA when attempting to upload logs to the server.

histogram.name: UMA.LowEntropySourceValue
histogram.summary: Distribution of the low entropy source value used for field trial randomization, recorded on startup.

histogram.name: UMA.MachineIdState
histogram.summary: Tracks if the machine ID is generated successfully and if it changes from one run to the next. The machine ID is a 24-bit hash of machine characteristics. It is expected to change if an install of Chrome is copied to multiple machines. This check happens once per browser startup.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsIDsReset
histogram.summary: A count of the number of times the metrics ids (client id and low entropy source) have been reset due to a cloned install being detected.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsReporting.Toggle
histogram.summary: Logged when user successfully enables/disables MetricsReporting or when an error occurs.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsService.RecordCurrentHistograms.Time
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent merging, taking snapshots, and recording histograms for reporting to UMA.

histogram.name: UMA.NegativeSamples.Reason
histogram.summary: Reasons why a negative sample count would have been created. Currently, only negative samples from persistent sparse histograms are being checked.

histogram.name: UMA.Perf.GetData
histogram.summary: A count of successes and various failure modes related to collecting and processing performance data obtained through "perf" on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentAllocator.Allocs
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2/2017 for Issue 689315 which indicated they weren't being used.
histogram.summary: Size, before padding, of objects allocated from persistent memory. This is updated with every allocation.

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentAllocator.Errors
histogram.summary: Errors detected by the persistent memory allocator. These are set when they occur.

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentAllocator.UsedPct
histogram.summary: Percentage of persistent memory segment that has been allocated. This is updated only once per reporting cycle.

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentHistograms.InitResult
histogram.summary: A count of successes and failures for the creation of various forms of persistent memory used to store histograms.

histogram.name: UMA.ProfilesCount.AfterErase
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Jun 2016. The histogram was added for debugging purpose and is not needed anymore.
histogram.summary: Record the number of loaded profiles when a profile is erased from the profiles map kept by profile manager.

histogram.name: UMA.ProfileSignInStatus
histogram.summary: An enum representing the signin status of all opened profiles during one UMA session.

histogram.name: UMA.ProtoCompressionRatio
histogram.summary: Compression ratio of the serialized protobuf that will be uploaded to the UMA server. This serialized protobuf is compressed using gzip.

histogram.name: UMA.ProtoGzipped
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Sep, 2013. Gzipping protobufs is now the default.
histogram.summary: Was the UMA protobuf uploaded earlier compressed or not.

histogram.name: UMA.ProtoGzippedKBSaved
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of August 2015. See UMA.ProtoCompressionRatio instead.
histogram.summary: Kilobytes saved from gzipping the protobufs before uploading them.

histogram.name: UMA.SamplingRatePerMille
histogram.summary: Sample rate applied to this client, expressed as number of clients per 1000 that are in the sample. Recorded on every log upload.

histogram.name: UMA.StoreLogsTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of August 2015. The histograms showed no unexpected slowness, and a profiler is a better tool for identifying any future issues.
histogram.summary: The time spent to store unsent logs to local state, which is done periodically and also during start up if there was an initial stability log.

histogram.name: UMA.SubprocessMetricsProvider.SubprocessCount
histogram.summary: The number of subprocesses from which persistent metrics were collected, logged once with every reporting cycle.

histogram.name: UMA.SubprocessMetricsProvider.UntrackedProcesses
histogram.summary: The number of subprocesses, by type, from which persistent metrics are NOT collected because there is no information about this (likely new) process type.

histogram.name: UMA.SyntheticTrials.Count
histogram.summary: The number of synthetic field trials added to the UMA log when the system profile is recorded. Since this is done prior to capturing the histograms from the current process, this will generally be logged once per UMA log.

histogram.name: UMA.Unacceptable_Log_Discarded
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of May, 2012 (i.e. Chrome 21+). Replaced by the UMA.UploadResponseStatus.XML and UMA.UploadResponseStatus.Protobuf histograms.
histogram.summary: The server returned a 400 code, and we discarded a log.
histogram.details: This tends to indicate that a syntax error is present in a log, such as would appear when a bogus XML tag is included, or the XML is not balanced and well structured.

histogram.name: UMA.UnsentLogs.Dropped
histogram.summary: Counter for number of UMA unsent logs removed from persistent storage.

histogram.name: UMA.UploadCreation
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of August 2015. This failure case no longer exists.
histogram.summary: For each attempted UMA upload, log whether the upload was successfully constructed. An upload might fail to be constructed, for example, if we try to upload before the system is fully initialized; or if serialization of the data fails.

histogram.name: UMA.UploadResponseStatus.Protobuf
histogram.summary: For each upload to the protocol buffer (v2) UMA server, log whether the upload was successful, or whether there was an error.

histogram.name: UMA.UploadResponseStatus.XML
histogram.summary: For each upload to the XML (v1) UMA server, log whether the upload was successful, or whether there was an error.

histogram.name: UMA.UsedResetVariationsFlag
histogram.summary: Log whether the --reset-variation-state flag was set before the low entropy source was requested.

histogram.name: UMA.XMLNodeDumpTime
histogram.summary: The time spent in converting the XML tree into a character buffer when closing a metrics log (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UMA.XMLWriterDestructionTime
histogram.summary: The time spent in freeing the XML writer and tree when closing a metrics log (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.ConnectionType
histogram.summary:
The network connection type when the attempt begins. Possible values include "Unknown", "Ethernet", "Wifi", "Wimax", "Bluetooth", "Cellular", "Tethered Ethernet", "Tethered Wifi".
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.DownloadErrorCode
histogram.summary:
A more detailed description of the last Payload transfer error when downloading the payload.
This is reported when an attempt ends with the "Payload Download Error" result.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.DownloadSource
histogram.summary:
The download source used, possible values include "HTTPS Server", "HTTP Server" and "HTTP Peer".
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.DurationMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes the update attempt took including the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.DurationUptimeMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes the update attempt took excluding the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.InternalErrorCode
histogram.summary:
A more detailed description of the last internal error. The possible values correspond to the ErrorCode enumeration in the update_engine source code.
This is reported when an attempt ends with the InternalError result.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.Number
histogram.summary:
The attempt number which starts at 0 for the initial attempt and keeps increasing for subsequent attempts.
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.PayloadBytesDownloadedMiB
histogram.summary:
The number of payload mebibytes (1048576 bytes) actually download.
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.PayloadDownloadSpeedKBps
histogram.summary:
The payload download speed, in kilobytes per second (1000 bytes/second). This is calculated as the number of bytes downloaded divided by the duration of the attempt (excluding time spent sleeping).
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.PayloadSizeMiB
histogram.summary:
The payload size, in mebibytes (1048576 bytes).
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.PayloadType
histogram.summary:
The payload type, possible values include "Delta" (if Omaha specified to download a delta payload); and "Full" (if Omaha specified to download a full payload); and "ForcedFull" (if the client specified that it would only accept a full payload).
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.Result
histogram.summary:
The result of the update attempt.
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.TimeSinceLastAttemptMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes since the last attempt including the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported when an update attempt ends but only if there was a previous attempt for the same update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.TimeSinceLastAttemptUptimeMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes since the last attempt excluding the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported when an update attempt ends but only if there was a previous attempt for the same update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.CertificateCheck.Download
histogram.summary:
The status of the certificate check done when downloading a payload over HTTPS. Note that most downloads are done over HTTP.
This is reported on every HTTPS connection to the payload download server. Connection drops on the same payload may report different values.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.CertificateCheck.UpdateCheck
histogram.summary:
The status of the certificate check done when querying Omaha for a new version.
This is reported on every update check.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Check.DownloadErrorCode
histogram.summary:
If unable to download a response from Omaha, a more detailed error code is reported in this metric.
This is reported on every update check resulting in "Download error".
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Check.Reaction
histogram.summary:
If there is an update available, this metric will track what the device does with the information. Possible values include "Applying update", "Deferring update", "Ignoring update", and "Backing off".
This is reported on update checks resulting in "Update available".
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Check.Result
histogram.summary:
The response from Omaha. Possible values include "No update available", "Update available", "Download error", "Response parsing error", and "Reboot pending".
This is reported on every update check.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Check.TimeSinceLastCheckMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes since the last check including the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported on every update check except for the first one.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Check.TimeSinceLastCheckUptimeMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes since the last check excluding the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported on every update check except for the first one.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Daily.OSAgeDays
histogram.summary:
The age of the OS in days, defined as the age of the /etc/lsb-release file.
This is reported on every update check but at most once a day.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Daily.RecoveryCount
histogram.summary:
The number of times the device has been recovered.
This is reported on every update check but at most once a day.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.FailedUpdateCount
histogram.summary:
The number of consecutive times a device has failed to boot an update that successfully applied.
This is reported every time the firmware fails to boot the slot with the update and fell back to the slot it originally updated from.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.InstallDateProvisioningSource
histogram.summary:
The source used to provision the install-date-days value sent to Omaha with every request.
This is reported when OOBE (Out Of Box Experience) completes (M34 or later) or when upgrading to a version with install-date-days support.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Rollback.Result
histogram.summary:
Whether rollback worked.
This is reported every time there's a rollback request.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.AttemptCount
histogram.summary:
The total number of update attempts required to update the device.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.BytesDownloadedMiB
histogram.summary:
The total number of bytes downloaded in mebibytes (1048576 bytes) using all available sources (e.g. HTTP, HTTPS, HTTP Peer).
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.BytesDownloadedMiBHttpPeer
histogram.summary:
The total number of bytes downloaded in mebibytes (1048576 bytes) using HTTP from a local peer.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.BytesDownloadedMiBHttpServer
histogram.summary:
The total number of bytes downloaded in mebibytes (1048576 bytes) using HTTP.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.BytesDownloadedMiBHttpsServer
histogram.summary:
The total number of bytes downloaded in mebibytes (1048576 bytes) using HTTPS.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.DownloadOverheadPercentage
histogram.summary:
The ratio between bytes downloaded and payload size minus 100.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.DownloadSourcesUsed
histogram.summary:
The various download sources used - this is a combination of the values "HTTPS Server", "HTTP Server" and "HTTP Peer".
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.PayloadSizeMiB
histogram.summary:
The size of the payload, in mebibytes (1048576 bytes).
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.PayloadType
histogram.summary:
The payload type ("Delta", "Full", "ForcedFull") used.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.RebootCount
histogram.summary:
The total number of reboots during the update.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.TotalDurationMinutes
histogram.summary:
The total number of minutes from when an update was detected until an update (possibly another update) was applied. This includes the time waiting for update checks and time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.UpdatesAbandonedCount
histogram.summary:
The total number of updates that were abandoned since the last successful update.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.UrlSwitchCount
histogram.summary:
The total number of times the URL was switched (from e.g. HTTPS to HTTP) because of failures.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.TimeToRebootMinutes
histogram.summary:
The duration between when an update has successfully completed and the user is presented with the "reboot arrow" and when the system has booted into the new update.
This is reported every time the device is rebooted after an update has been applied.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: Uptime.ChromeExecToLoginPromptVisibleAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when Chrome is started, and when the login prompt is again visible after a logout. This statistic is only collected when preceeded by a logout.

histogram.name: Uptime.DBusCrash
histogram.summary: The system uptime on Chrome OS when the dbus-daemon process crashes, resulting in a reboot.

histogram.name: Uptime.LoginPromptSetupTimeAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS for setting up for a login after a logout. More specifically, it is the time between when the Cryptohome is unmounted (the last step in the logout process) and when the login prompt is again visible after a logout.

histogram.name: Uptime.Logout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS when performing a logout. More specifically, it is the time between when a logout is initiated and when the Cryptohome is unmounted, signaling the last step in the logout process. This statistic is not collected when the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: Uptime.LogoutToLoginPromptVisible
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between initiating a logout and the next time the login prompt is visible again. This statistic is not collected if the machine is shutdown between the logout initiation and the prompt becoming visible.

histogram.name: Uptime.LogoutToUIStopAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when a logout is initiated and the UI has stopped (and Chrome has exited) during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: Uptime.ProcessesTerminatedToXTerminatedAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when all user-associated processes (including the X server) have been terminated during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: Uptime.UIStopToProcessesTerminatedAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when the UI has stopped (Chrome has exited), and when all other associated processes have been terminated during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: Uptime.XTerminatedToChromeExecAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when the X server has been terminated from a previous logout and when Chrome is started again to show the login screen.

histogram.name: UrlFetcher.StringResponseSize
histogram.summary: Size (in kilobytes) of response bodies retrieved as strings from URLFetcher.

histogram.name: UserCert.ContentDisposition
histogram.summary: Distribution of Content-Disposition headers sent with x-x509-user-cert content types.

histogram.name: UserImage.ChangeChoice
histogram.summary: Distribution of the default images that users choose in Change Picture dialog (Chrome OS). One sample is taken each time the user changes picture.

histogram.name: UserImage.FirstTimeChoice
histogram.summary: Distribution of the default images chosen on user image screen during out-of-the-box experience (Chrome OS). One sample is taken each time the user confirms the choice by clicking OK button.

histogram.name: UserImage.LoggedIn
histogram.summary: Distribution of the default images that existing users login with (Chrome OS). One sample is taken each time the user logs in.

histogram.name: UserImage.ProfileDownloadResult
histogram.summary: Profile image download result for UserManager (either on behalf of the Change Picture prefs page, OOBE or scheduled refresh after user login).

histogram.name: UserImage.ProfileDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to download user's profile picture.

histogram.name: UserImage.ScreenIsShownTime
histogram.summary: Time histogram of the "Choose Picture" OOBE screen display delay.

histogram.name: UserManager.LoginUserType
histogram.summary: The number of users of different types that log in to the system (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UserManager.LogoutToLoginDelay
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time between one regular user logging out and a different regular user logging in (Chrome OS). Delays above thirty minutes or which span system reboots or non-regular-user logins are not reported.

histogram.name: UserSessionManager.RestoreOnCrash.AccountIdValid
histogram.summary: The result of restoring account id on Chrome restart after crash.

histogram.name: UserSessionManager.UserPodsDisplay
histogram.summary: Whether the user pods were enabled during login, and what could disable them.

histogram.name: V8.ArrayBufferBigAllocations
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 5/2017 in Issue 704922. Replaced by V8.ArrayBufferLargeAllocations.
histogram.summary: Number of bytes requested in an array buffer allocation.

histogram.name: V8.ArrayBufferLargeAllocations
histogram.summary: Number of bytes requested in array buffer allocations greater than one megabyte.

histogram.name: V8.ArrayBufferNewSizeFailures
histogram.summary: Array buffer sizes for which V8 failed to allocate memory.

histogram.name: V8.AsmWasmTranslationMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time to convert asm.js code to WebAssembly.

histogram.name: V8.ASTOptimization
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: V8.CodeCacheRejectReason
histogram.summary: Reason code data has been rejected when attempting to deserialize.

histogram.name: V8.CodeCacheSizeRatio
histogram.summary: Cache size to source size ratio when caching compiled code.

histogram.name: V8.CodeCreation
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: V8.CodeGeneration
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: Time spent generating native code for functions.

histogram.name: V8.CodegenFractionCrankshaft
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total generated code which was generated using the Crankshaft optimizing compiler, after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.Compile
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent in V8 compiler (full codegen).

histogram.name: V8.CompileCacheableMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent compiling a script that may be subject to caching.

histogram.name: V8.CompileDeserialize
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileDeserializeMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent deseriailzing code, used by V8 code caching.

histogram.name: V8.CompileDeserializeMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent deseriailzing code, used by V8 code caching.

histogram.name: V8.CompileEval
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileEvalMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent in V8 compiler (full codegen) for eval.

histogram.name: V8.CompileEvalMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent in V8 compiler (full codegen) for eval.

histogram.name: V8.CompileInlineScriptMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent compiling an inline script.

histogram.name: V8.CompileLazy
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileLazyMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent compiling functions lazily on first run.

histogram.name: V8.CompileLazyMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Aggregated time spent compiling functions lazily during a single script execution.

histogram.name: V8.CompileMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent in V8 compiler (full codegen) excluding parser.

histogram.name: V8.CompileNoncacheableMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent compiling a script that cannot be subject to caching.

histogram.name: V8.CompileScript
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileScriptMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Total time spent in compiling a script (incl. parsing/caching).

histogram.name: V8.CompileScriptMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Total time spent in compiling a script (incl. parsing/caching).

histogram.name: V8.CompileSerialize
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileSerializeMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent serializing code, used by V8 code caching.

histogram.name: V8.CompileSerializeMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent serializing code, used by V8 code caching.

histogram.name: V8.DebugFeatureUsage
histogram.summary: Debugger feature used at least once per isolate, recorded on first use.

histogram.name: V8.DeferredCodeGeneration
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8
histogram.summary: Time spent generating deferred code stubs.

histogram.name: V8.DetachedContextAgeInGC
histogram.summary: Number of garbage collections that a detached global context survives, recorded after each major garbage collection. Values greater than 7 indicate a memory leak.

histogram.name: V8.ErrorsThrownPerContext
histogram.summary: The amount of JavaScript errors thrown by V8 per context. It does not count custom errors and ignores catched errors thrown by V8. This is collected after the context is detached.

histogram.name: V8.ExecutableMemoryMax
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8
histogram.summary: The maximum memory used to store V8 compiled code on a given process.

histogram.name: V8.Execute
histogram.summary: Time spent in JavaScript Execution, including runtime calls, callbacks, and lazy compilation.

histogram.name: V8.GCCompactor
histogram.summary: Time spent in mark-sweep phase of GC.

histogram.name: V8.GCContext
histogram.summary: Time spent doing a full GC during an IdleNotification.

histogram.name: V8.GCFinalizeMC
histogram.summary: Time spent in finalize incremental mark-sweep phase of GC.

histogram.name: V8.GCFinalizeMCReduceMemory
histogram.summary: Time spent in finalize incremental memory-reducing mark-sweep phase of GC.

histogram.name: V8.GCFinalzeMC
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.GCFinalizeMC because of typo in the name.
histogram.summary: Time spent in finalize incremental mark-sweep phase of GC.

histogram.name: V8.GCIdleNotification
histogram.summary: Time spent in IdleNotifications.

histogram.name: V8.GCIdleTimeAllottedInMS
histogram.summary: Idle time passed to V8 via IdleNotifications.

histogram.name: V8.GCIdleTimeLimit.Overshot
histogram.summary: Milliseconds the idle time limit was overshot by the IdleNotification.

histogram.name: V8.GCIdleTimeLimit.Undershot
histogram.summary: Milliseconds the idle time limit was undershot by the IdleNotification.

histogram.name: V8.GCIncrementalMarking
histogram.summary: Time spent doing incremental marking steps during GC.

histogram.name: V8.GCIncrementalMarkingFinalize
histogram.summary: Time spent in finalizing incremental marking.

histogram.name: V8.GCIncrementalMarkingReason
histogram.summary: Reason an incremental marking was started in V8.

histogram.name: V8.GCIncrementalMarkingStart
histogram.summary: Time spent in starting incremental marking.

histogram.name: V8.GCLowMemoryNotification
histogram.summary: Time spent in LowMemoryNotifications.

histogram.name: V8.GCMarkCompactReason
histogram.summary: Reason a mark-compact garbage collection was started in V8.

histogram.name: V8.GCScavenger
histogram.summary: Time spent in scavenging phase of GC.

histogram.name: V8.GCScavengeReason
histogram.summary: Reason a scavenge garbage collection was started in V8.

histogram.name: V8.GCYoungGenerationHandling
histogram.summary: Type of garbage collection strategy used to collect the young generation.

histogram.name: V8.Initializer.LoadV8Snapshot.Result
histogram.summary: Results from snapshot loading.

histogram.name: V8.Initializer.OpenV8File.Result
histogram.summary: Results from opening V8 snapshot files.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationCellSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the cell space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationCodeSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the code space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationLoSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the large object space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationMapSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the map space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldDataSpace
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldSpace.
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the old data space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldPointerSpace
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldSpace.
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the old pointer space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the old space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationTotal
histogram.summary: Total external memory fragmentation after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapCommitted
histogram.summary: The committed memory used by V8 in KB averaged over time, logged before each GC.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionCellSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the cell space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionCodeSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the code space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionLoSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the lo space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionMapSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the map space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionNewSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the new space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionOldDataSpace
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.MemoryHeapFractionOldSpace.
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the old data space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionOldPointerSpace
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.MemoryHeapFractionOldSpace.
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the old pointer space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionOldSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the old space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleCellSpaceCommitted
histogram.summary: The size of committed memory in the cell space after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleCodeSpaceCommitted
histogram.summary: The size of committed memory in the code space after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleMapSpaceCommitted
histogram.summary: The size of committed memory in the map space after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleTotalCommitted
histogram.summary: The total size of committed memory used by V8 after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleTotalUsed
histogram.summary: The total size of live memory used by V8 after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapUsed
histogram.summary: The live memory used by V8 in KB averaged over time, logged before each GC.

histogram.name: V8.Parse
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.ParseMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent in V8 parser.

histogram.name: V8.ParseLazy
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.ParseLazyMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent parsing functions when they are lazily compiled on first run.

histogram.name: V8.ParseLazyMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent parsing functions when they are lazily compiled on first run.

histogram.name: V8.ParseMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent in V8 parser.

histogram.name: V8.PreParse
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.PreParseMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent preparsing source code.

histogram.name: V8.PreParseMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent preparsing source code.

histogram.name: V8.Rewriting
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: Time spent on rewriting ASTs before compilation.

histogram.name: V8.RSetLO
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: V8.RSetPaged
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: V8.ScriptCache
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: The generation a compiled script was found in the compilation cache.

histogram.name: V8.UsageAnalysis
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: Time spent analysing the usage of variables.

histogram.name: V8.VariableAllocation
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: V8.WasmCompileFunctionMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time to compile a WebAssembly function.

histogram.name: V8.WasmCompileFunctionPeakMemoryBytes
histogram.summary: Peak memory used to compile a WebAssembly function.

histogram.name: V8.WasmCompileModuleMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time to compile a WebAssembly module.

histogram.name: V8.WasmDecodeFunctionMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time to decode a WebAssembly function.

histogram.name: V8.WasmDecodeModuleMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time to decode a WebAssembly module.

histogram.name: V8.WasmDecodeModulePeakMemoryBytes
histogram.summary: Peak memory used to decode a WebAssembly module.

histogram.name: V8.WasmFunctionSizeBytes
histogram.summary: Size of a WebAssembly function.

histogram.name: V8.WasmFunctionsPerModule
histogram.summary: Function count in each WebAssembly module.

histogram.name: V8.WasmInstantiateModuleMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time to instantiate a WebAssembly module.

histogram.name: V8.WasmMaxMemPagesCount
histogram.summary: Number of 64KiB pages a WebAssembly module declares as its maximum requirement.

histogram.name: V8.WasmMinMemPagesCount
histogram.summary: Number of 64KiB pages a WebAssembly module declares as its minimum requirement.

histogram.name: V8.WasmModuleSizeBytes
histogram.summary: Size of a WebAssembly module.

histogram.name: Variations.CreateTrials.SeedExpiry
histogram.summary: The result of verifying if the variations seed is expired, recorded before trials are created from the seed. Expired seeds are treated as not existing.

histogram.name: Variations.DisabledNoEntropyProvider
histogram.summary: A count of the number of times we hit the code where a field trial is disabled because no entropy provider was provided.

histogram.name: Variations.FailedRequestErrorCode
histogram.summary: The counts of network error codes encountered by VariationsService when an attempt to fetch a variations seed from the server fails.

histogram.name: Variations.FetchNotModifiedLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a VariationsService seed fetch that results in a not modified response.

histogram.name: Variations.FetchOtherLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a VariationsService seed fetch that results in neither a success nor not modified response.

histogram.name: Variations.FetchSuccessLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a VariationsService seed fetch that results in a success response.

histogram.name: Variations.FirstRun.SeedConnectTime
histogram.summary: The latency of connection to the variations server when fetching an initial variations seed during Android Chrome first run. This is included in the Variations.FirstRun.SeedFetchTime measurement. Only considers cases where an HTTP 200 result was received.

histogram.name: Variations.FirstRun.SeedFetchResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to fetch an initial variations seed during Android Chrome first run. Records both the HTTP code and various error values in one enumeration.

histogram.name: Variations.FirstRun.SeedFetchTime
histogram.summary: The latency of fetching an initial variations seed during Android Chrome first run. Only considers cases where an HTTP 200 result was received.

histogram.name: Variations.FirstRunResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to import an initial variations seed during Android Chrome first run. Logged from VariationsSeedStore::LoadSeed when seed prefs do not exist.

histogram.name: Variations.GoogleUpdateRegistryLabelsNeedClearing
histogram.summary: If the registry value for Google Update experiment labels contains Variations experiments, and therefore needs to have them cleared. This will be recorderd once per sessions, right before attempting to clear the value.

histogram.name: Variations.HeaderConstructionTime
histogram.summary: How long it took to create the X-Client-Data header.

histogram.name: Variations.Headers.ExperimentCount
histogram.summary: Records number of experiment ids in the X-Client-Data header at the time the header is constructed.

histogram.name: Variations.Headers.URLValidationResult
histogram.summary: The result of the check of whether to append Variations headers to a url.

histogram.name: Variations.LoadPermanentConsistencyCountryResult
histogram.summary: Records how the country code saved in prefs used for filtering permanent consistency studies compares to the country code in the variations seed. This is recorded each time the saved country code is loaded from the pref.

histogram.name: Variations.LoadSeedSignature
histogram.summary: The result of verifying the variations seed signature, recorded when the variations seed is stored to Local State after being retrieved from the server.

histogram.name: Variations.NetworkAvailability
histogram.summary: Whether or not the network was available when requested by the VariationsService.

histogram.name: Variations.RequestCount
histogram.summary: Number of previous requests to the variations server in the same session, logged each time a new request is attempted to the variations server. For example, the value of the 0th bucket indicates the number of initial requests to the server that took place.

histogram.name: Variations.ResourceRequestsAllowed
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the VariationsService is allowed or not allowed to make a request due to the ResourceRequestAllowedNotifier.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateChange
histogram.summary: Counts if a response from the variations server is the first response of the day or not. This is counted when a new valid seed or a 304 is received. The date line is computed in UTC and the times being compared are the server time from the server response and the stored server time from the last successful request.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateSkew.BuildTimeAheadBy
histogram.summary: Logged on startup when creating field trials from the variations seed if the build time is ahead of or within 24 hours of the kVariationsSeedDate. Used as an experiment to see whether the build time could be used to discard very old seeds.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateSkew.BuildTimeBehindBy
histogram.summary: Logged on startup when creating field trials from the variations seed if the build time is behind the kVariationsSeedDate by a day or more. Used as an experiment to see whether the build time could be used to discard very old seeds.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateSkew.SystemClockAheadBy
histogram.summary: Logged on startup when creating field trials from the variations seed if the system clock is ahead of or within 24 hours of the kVariationsSeedDate. Used as an experiment to see whether the system clock could be used to discard very old seeds.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateSkew.SystemClockBehindBy
histogram.summary: Logged on startup when creating field trials from the variations seed if the system clock is behind the kVariationsSeedDate by a day or more. Used as an experiment to see whether the system clock could be used to discard very old seeds.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedEmpty
histogram.summary: Records whether the variations seed in local state is empty (does not exist) on startup.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFetchResponseCode
histogram.summary: The counts of HTTP response codes encountered by VariationsService when attempting to fetch a variations seed from the server.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFetchResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes and network error encountered by VariationsService when attempting to fetch a variations seed from the server.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFreshness
histogram.summary: The time interval between when the variations seed was last downloaded and when it was used.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedStoreResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of storing the variations seed that was received from the server.

histogram.name: Variations.ServerStudyExpiredUniformity1Percent
histogram.summary: Whether or not the 1-Percent uniformity trial from the Variations server was expired when loaded.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.Duration
histogram.summary:
Records the time taken to perform variations seed simulation.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.KillBestEffortChanges
histogram.summary:
Records the result of variations seed simulation. Logs the number of experiment groups in the "kill best effort" category that are expected to change on a restart of the browser with the received seed.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.KillCriticalChanges
histogram.summary:
Records the result of variations seed simulation. Logs the number of experiment groups in the "kill critical" category that are expected to change on a restart of the browser with the received seed.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.NormalChanges
histogram.summary:
Records the result of variations seed simulation. Logs the number of experiment groups in the "normal" category that are expected to change on a restart of the browser with the received seed.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.DeltaSize
histogram.summary: On successful save of a delta-compressed variations seed, records the size of the delta in KiB.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.DeltaSize.ReductionPercent
histogram.summary: On successful save of a delta-compressed variations seed, records the size of the delta as a percentage of the decoded seed size.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.GzipSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the gzip-compressed variations seed in KiB.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.GzipSize.ReductionPercent
histogram.summary: Records the size of the gzip-compressed variations seed as a percentage of the decoded seed size. Note that variations seed could be first delta-compressed and then gzip-compressed. In this case we record gzip-compressed seed size as a percentage of the delta-compressed seed size.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.Size
histogram.summary: On successful save of a non-delta-compressed variations seed, records the size of the received seed in KiB.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeedSignature
histogram.summary: The result of verifying the variations seed signature, recorded when the variations seed is loaded from Local State.

histogram.name: Variations.StringsOverridden
histogram.summary: Records the number of UI strings overriden for each study that overrides strings. Recorded at start up when each study is evaluated.

histogram.name: Variations.TimeSinceLastFetchAttempt
histogram.summary: The time since the previous attempt to fetch the variations seed within the same session, with 0 indicating that this is the first attempt. Recorded when a variations seed fetch is attempted by the VariationsService.

histogram.name: Variations.UniformityTrialExpired
histogram.summary: A count of the number of times we hit the code where the UMA-Uniformity-Trial-1-Percent field trial is disabled as a result of the expiration check.

histogram.name: Variations.UniformityTrialGroupNotActive
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the UMA-Uniformity-Trial-1-Percent field trial was not active and which factors contributed to it.

histogram.name: Variations.UserChannel
histogram.summary: Log the user channel assigned at browser startup used for evaluating the variations seeds.

histogram.name: Vibration.Context
histogram.summary: Records instances of navigator.vibrate. Includes whether or not it comes with a user gesture, same-origin subframe or cross-origin subframe.

histogram.name: VideoPlayer.CastAPIExtensionStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Video Player: the results of the cast API extension load. This is recorded after the initialization of the extension is finished.

histogram.name: VideoPlayer.CastedVideoLength
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Video Player: the length of casted video (in seconds).

histogram.name: VideoPlayer.NumberOfCastDevices
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Video Player: the number of cast devices. This is recorded when the cast extension finishes the discovery.

histogram.name: VideoPlayer.NumberOfOpenedFiles
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Video Player: the number of files being opened on launch.

histogram.name: VideoPlayer.PlayType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Video Player: type of playback (eg. local play, cast). This is recorded when a video starts playing.

histogram.name: Viewport.DidScalePage
histogram.summary: Tracks the proportion of non-mobile optimized (i.e. zoom disabled or layout width matches viewport) page views that had a user-initiated page scale (e.g. pinch-zoom, double-tap). Recorded on navigation to a new page - on Android only.

histogram.name: Viewport.MaxPageScale
histogram.summary: Tracks the maximum scale factor that a user has scaled to over the lifetime of the page. The scale is counted at pinch end (e.g. zooming to 300% and back out to 150% in one gesture would count as 150%). Reported only on non-mobile optimized pages (i.e. zoom disabled or layout width matches viewport) which have had a page scale changing gesture. Recorded on navigation to a new page - on Android only.

histogram.name: Viewport.MetaTagType
histogram.summary: The viewport meta tag type seen on each page load. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Viewport.OverviewZoom
histogram.summary: The screen width as a percentage of viewport width (i.e. zoom at which we can see the whole page). Only recorded on Android and for viewport meta tags with constant width.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.InitLatency.FirstLoad
histogram.summary: Latency of the keyboard being loaded for the first time.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.KeyboardControlEvent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: A count of various control events that can occur on the virtual keyboard, such as showing and hiding.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.KeystrokesBetweenBackspace
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of keys typed by the virtual keyboard between each backspace. This metric provides a rough approximation of an error rate for the virtual keyboard.

histogram.name: VRDisplayPresentResult
histogram.summary: The result of calls to VRDisplay::requestPresent(). Reported twice per requestPresent() call, once to record the call, and once to record the result.

histogram.name: VRSessionNavigationCount
histogram.summary: Count of navigations while in a VR session. Logged when a new disjoint session has begun, or when the session has ended in a non-continuable way.

histogram.name: VRSessionTime
histogram.summary: The duration of the VR session. Logged when a new disjoint session has begun, or when the session has ended in a non-continuable way.

histogram.name: VRSessionVideoCount
histogram.summary: Number of videos watched in a VR session. Logged when a new disjoint session has begun, or when the session has ended in a non-continuable way.

histogram.name: VRSessionVideoTime
histogram.summary: The duration of a single session spent watching video in VR. Logged when a new disjoint session has begun, or when the session has ended in a non-continuable way.

histogram.name: VRViewerType
histogram.summary: The type of headset being used for VR.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.AcceptLegalDocuments
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's accept legal document API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.AuthenticateInstrument
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's authenticate instrument API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.GetFullWallet
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's get full wallet API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.GetWalletItems
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's get wallet items API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveAddress
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's save address API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveInstrument
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's save instrument API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveInstrumentAndAddress
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's save instument and address API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's save to wallet API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SendStatus
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's send status API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.UnknownApiCall
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's unknown API calls.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.UpdateAddress
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's update address API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.UpdateInstrument
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's update instument API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.MalformedResponse
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each Wallet API failed due to being unable to parse the response.

histogram.name: Wallet.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes seen by Wallet client.

histogram.name: Web.CertVerifyAgreement
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 08/2016 because CertVerifier is not used for web view cert verification.
histogram.summary: [iOS] Reports certificate verification mismatch between SecTrust API and CertVerifier. SecTrust API is used for making load/no-load decision and CertVerifier is used for getting the reason of verification failure. It is expected that mismatches will happen for those 2 approaches (e.g. SecTrust API considers cert as good, but CertVerifier considers same cert as bad). This metric helps to understand how common mismatches are.

histogram.name: Web.CurrentURLEqualsLastCommittedURL
histogram.summary: [iOS] Reports URL matches between the return value from the WebState's GetLastCommittedURL and GetCurrentURL methods. It is expected the values will be equal to confirm that GetCurrentURL can now be replaced with GetLastCommittedURL. This will be called each time WebStateImpl:: GetCurrentURL(URLVerificationTrustLevel* trust_level) is called, which is an old method of obtaining the url and trust level. The trust level was only relevant with UIWebView, so this method is only called from code which has not yet been updated since UIWebView was removed.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.GooglePlayInstallResult
histogram.summary: Records whether installing a WebAPK from Google Play succeeded. If not, records the reason that the install failed.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.GooglePlayInstallState
histogram.summary: On web app and WebAPK installation, records whether a WebAPK could be installed via the Google Play flow. If not, records why the WebAPK could not be installed via the Google Play flow (and a web app was added to the homescreen instead). Warning: This metric is recorded whenever a site is added to the homescreeen as a web app, not just for sites with a WebAPK compatible Web Manifest.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.InfoBarShown
histogram.summary: WebAPKs are PWAs wrapped in an Android apk, installed from an app banner or the add to homescreen menu item. This stat tracks whether the installation is triggered by an app banner or by the add to homescreen menu.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.InstallDuration
histogram.summary: How long it takes to install a WebAPK. The time is measured from the time that the user initiates the install to the time that the Open button is shown in the infobar. This metric is only recorded when install succeeds.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.InstallEvent
histogram.summary: WebAPKs are PWAs wrapped in an Android apk, installed from an app banner or the add to homescreen menu item. This stat tracks the WebAPKs installation events, including whether the infobar is ignored, whether the infobar is dismissed by the user before or during the installation, as well as whether the installation was successful.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.InstallSource
histogram.summary: WebAPKs are PWAs wrapped in an Android apk, installed from an app banner or the add to homescreen menu item. If the installation is via an app banner, user could either accept to install or dismiss the infobar; while via the add to homescreen menu, the installation will start automatically. This stat tracks the ways that user accepts to install a WebAPK.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.UserAction
histogram.summary: WebAPKs are PWAs wrapped in an Android apk, installed from an app banner or the add to homescreen menu item. If the user clicks the add to homescreen menu, and a WebAPK has been installed before, an infobar with an open button will show. The open button will also show on the infobar after a successful installation. This stat tracks whether user clicks the open button on the infobar or dismiss it.

histogram.name: WebApk.OpenFromMenu
histogram.summary: When a user visits a PWA for which they have a WebAPK installed, the menu item changes from 'Add to homescreen' to 'Open WebAPK'. This stat tracks whether the opening of the WebAPK is successful when this menu item is clicked.

histogram.name: WebApk.Session.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: The length of a WebAPK session (launch/foregrounding to backgrounding) in milliseconds.

histogram.name: WebApk.ShellApkVersion
histogram.summary: Records WebAPK "Shell APK version" when the WebAPK is launched. The "Shell APK version" is documented in shell_apk_version.gni

histogram.name: WebApk.Update.GooglePlayUpdateResult
histogram.summary: Records whether updating a WebAPK from Google Play succeeded. If not, records the reason that the update failed.

histogram.name: WebApk.Update.RequestQueued
histogram.summary: Records the number of times that a WebAPK update request was queued (i.e. waiting for the WebAPK to be backgrounded) before being sent to the server.

histogram.name: WebApk.Update.RequestSent
histogram.summary: Records the time point when a request to update a WebAPK is sent to the WebAPK Server.

histogram.name: Webapp.InstallabilityCheckStatus.MenuItemAddToHomescreen
