histogram.summary: Records whether or not the check that a site is or isn't a Progressive Web App (PWA) has completed when the user taps the add to homescreen menu item on Android.

histogram.name: Webapp.InstallabilityCheckStatus.MenuOpen
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the check that a site is or isn't a Progressive Web App (PWA) has completed when the user opens the menu on Android.

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.BackgroundColor
histogram.summary: Records the status of the splashscreen's background color (default or custom).

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the time during which the splashscreen was visible.

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.Hides
histogram.summary: Records the signal that was used to hide the splashscreen.

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.Icon.Size
histogram.summary: Records the size of the icon used to construct the splashscreen in device pixels (ie. real size divided by device pixel density). This is only recording one dimension, the icon being square.

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.Icon.Type
histogram.summary: Records the origin of the icon used to construct the splashscreen.

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.ThemeColor
histogram.summary: Records the status of the splashscreen's theme color (default or custom).

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.Length
histogram.summary: The length (in frames) requested by createBuffer(). Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.NumberOfChannels
histogram.summary: The number of channels requested by createBuffer(). Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.SampleRate
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SampleRate384kHz in Issue 644683 on 2016/10 due to higher supported sample rates.
histogram.summary: The sample rate (in Hz) requested by createBuffer(). Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.SampleRate384kHz
histogram.summary: The sample rate (in Hz) requested by createBuffer(). Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.SampleRateRatio
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SampleRateRatio384kHz in Issue 644683 on 2016/10 due to higher supported sample rates.
histogram.summary: The ratio of the buffer sample rate from createBuffer() to the context sample rate. This indicates if the buffer needs to be resampled. Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.SampleRateRatio384kHz
histogram.summary: The ratio of the buffer sample rate from createBuffer() to the context sample rate. This indicates if the buffer needs to be resampled. Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContext.HardwareSampleRate
histogram.summary: The hardware sample rate (in Hz) used by an AudioContext. Recorded for every WebAudio AudioContext that is created; probably only one or two per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContext.MaxChannelsAvailable
histogram.summary: The maximum number of (hardware) channels available in an AudioContext. Recorded for every WebAudio AudioContext that is created; probably only one or two per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.CallbackBufferSize
histogram.summary: The callback buffer size (in audio frames) for WebAudio rendering between the WebAudio graph and the audio device thread. This can differ from the value recommended by the audio hardware due to internal constraints in WebAudio. Recorded for every WebAudio AudioContext that is created.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.HardwareBufferSize
histogram.summary: The buffer size (in audio frames) for WebAudio rendering recommended by the audio hardware. Recorded for every WebAudio AudioContext that is created.

histogram.name: WebAudio.Autoplay.CrossOrigin
histogram.summary: The autoplay status of an AudioContext when destroyed.

histogram.name: WebAudio.BiquadFilter.Q.Highpass
histogram.summary: The Q value (in 0.25 dB steps) used for a highpass BiquadFilter. Recorded each time the value is set for a highpass filter via the .value setter or the automation methods linearRampToValueAtTime, exponentialValueAtTime, and setValueAtTime.

histogram.name: WebAudio.BiquadFilter.Q.Lowpass
histogram.summary: The Q value (in 0.25 dB steps) used for a lowpass BiquadFilter. Recorded each time the value is set for a lowpass filter via the .value setter or the automation methods linearRampToValueAtTime, exponentialValueAtTime, and setValueAtTime.

histogram.name: WebAudio.BiquadFilter.Type
histogram.summary: The type of the BiquadFilterNode. Recorded each time the type is set. This recorded once (to lowpass) when a biquad filter is created and also recorded whenever the filter type changes due to user action or programatically. It is unlikely the type will change more than once.

histogram.name: WebAudio.IIRFilterNode.Order
histogram.summary: The order of the WebAudio IIRFilterNode. The order is one less than the number of feedback coefficients used in the denominator of the IIRFilter transfer function. Recorded each time an IIRFilter is constructed.

histogram.name: WebAudio.OfflineAudioContext.ChannelCount
histogram.summary: The number of channels specified for the offline audio context. Recorded for every offline context created. Probably only a few per page, but could be potentially much more (thousands).

histogram.name: WebAudio.OfflineAudioContext.Length
histogram.summary: The length (in frames) specified for the offline audio context. Recorded for every offline context created. Probably only a few per page, but could be potentially much more (thousands).

histogram.name: WebAudio.OfflineAudioContext.SampleRate
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SampleRate384kHz in Issue 644683 on 2016/10 due to higher supported sample rates.
histogram.summary: The sample rate (in Hz) specified for the offline audio context. Recorded for every offline context created. Probably only a few per page, but could be potentially much more (thousands).

histogram.name: WebAudio.OfflineAudioContext.SampleRate384kHz
histogram.summary: The sample rate (in Hz) specified for the offline audio context. Recorded for every offline context created. Probably only a few per page, but could be potentially much more (thousands).

histogram.name: WebAudio.PannerNode.PanningModel
histogram.summary: The panning model for the PannerNode. Recorded once with the default value at creation and once again whenver it is changed. Once changed, it is unlikely to be changed again. If there are any PannerNodes created at all, then there is probably one for each source (AudioBufferSourceNode, OscillatorNode, or other source).

histogram.name: WebAudio.UserGesture
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2016-09. As of M55, this is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Records whether WebAudio had a user gesture requirement and whether it was fulfilled.

histogram.name: WebController.CertVerificationErrorsCacheHit
histogram.summary: [iOS] Report cache hit/miss for WKWebView cert verification. WKWebView Web Controller has a cache of pending cert verification results to avoid extra verifications when presenting SSL interstitial. This metric helps to understand whether or not cache miss is possible.

histogram.name: WebController.EmptyNavigationManagerCausedByStopLoading
histogram.summary: [iOS] Chrome for iOS crashes because NavigationManager does not have any navigation items and visible navigation item is dereferenced (crbug.com/565457). The assumption is that crash occurs if pending load was stopped for a child window. This metric will prove or disprove that assumption.

histogram.name: WebController.ExternalURLRequestBlocking
histogram.summary: [iOS] Measures the proportion of external URL requests that originate from a subframe without any user interaction (e.g. an advertisement contains an iframe directed at the App Store).

histogram.name: WebController.StartProvisionalNavigationExitedWithEmptyNavigationManager
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2017-02. This metric disproved the assumption mentioned in the summary and it is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome for iOS crashes in |didCommitNavigation:| if Navigation Manager is empty. It's unclear how the app can get into this state and one assumption is that didStartProvisionalNavigation: does not add a pending navigation. This metric is logged when didStartProvisionalNavigation: fails to add a pending item.

histogram.name: WebCore.Animation.CSSProperties
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each CSS property is animated. There is no limit on the number of times each property is counted per page view -- a property that is animated multiple times during a single page view is counted each time it animates.

histogram.name: WebCore.CanvasContextUsage
histogram.summary: The usage of Canvas 2D Context API. Logged when the particular API is used.

histogram.name: WebCore.DistillabilityUs
histogram.summary: The time spent on collecting the statistics of the document in the main frame. These statistics would be used as features to classify whether the page is suitable for DOM distiller.

histogram.name: WebCore.Document.execCommand
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each document.execCommand is executed. This doesn't count commands not supported by Blink.

histogram.name: WebCore.Editing.Commands
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each Editor::Command::execute is called. This doesn't count commands not supported by Blink.

histogram.name: WebCore.FeatureObserver
histogram.summary:
NOTE: As of M57 this has been superseded by Blink.UseCounter.Features which fixes a number of issues. See https://crbug.com/676837.
Count of how many page loads use various features. The PageVisits bucket is incremented for each page load, and the other buckets incremented at most once per PageVisit via the WebCore::UseCounter class.

histogram.name: WebCore.FeatureObserver.CSSProperties
histogram.summary:
NOTE: As of M57 this has been superseded by Blink.UseCounter.Features which fixes a number of issues. See https://crbug.com/676837.
Records usage of CSS properties used on a page, either statically or dynamically, from the time the page is initialised to when it is closed or navigated away from. Each property is counted at most once per page per view.
histogram.details:
Every time a CSS property is parsed on a page, that property is recorded as having been used. The histogram is updated with this data whenever a page is closed, or a page navigation happens. Each histogram bucket corresponds to a CSS property (eg width, border-radius). The exception is the bucket numbered '1' - this counts the number of pages that CSS properties were counted on.
These numbers give the percentage of pages that use a CSS property. For example, if the 'border-radius' histogram bucket has a count of 250, and the page count bucket (i.e. bucket number 1) has a count of 1000 - this means that 1000 pages were recorded, and border-radius was used on 25% of those pages.
Internally, each WebCore::Page has a WebCore::UseCounter instance, with booleans recording use of each CSS property - one boolean per property. Upon destruction of the WebCore::Page (e.g. by the user closing the tab), or a page navigation happening, the histogram is updated. For each boolean that is set to True, the corresponding histogram bucket for that CSS property is incremented by 1. The page count bucket (i.e. bucket number 1) is always incremented by 1 on each histogram update.

histogram.name: WebCore.Framebust
histogram.summary: Records instances of child frames navigating the top frame. Includes whether or not the navigation would have been permitted if not for our special case for 'framebusting', the practice of ensuring a given document is never displayed in a frame.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.BackingStore.ConsistencyError
histogram.summary: Methods that encountered consistency errors. Such errors probably point to a bug in our code.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.BackingStore.InternalError
histogram.obsolete: As of chrome 26, use {Consistency, Read, Write}Error instead.
histogram.summary: Count of internal IndexedDB errors (data corruption, I/O errors, etc) encountered.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.BackingStore.OpenStatus
histogram.summary: Count of the different success and failure modes when opening an IndexedDB backing store - clean open, successful open with recovery, failed recovery, etc. Includes all hosts.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.BackingStore.OpenStatus.Docs
histogram.summary: Count of the different success and failure modes when opening an IndexedDB backing store - clean open, successful open with recovery, failed recovery, etc. Only for docs.google.com.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.BackingStore.OverlyLargeOriginLength
histogram.summary: Length of leveldb directories that cause paths to not fit in the filesystem, either because the individual component is too long or the overall path is larger than MAX_PATH.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.BackingStore.ReadError
histogram.summary: Methods that encountered leveldb errors while trying to read from disk.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.BackingStore.WriteError
histogram.summary: Methods that encountered leveldb errors while trying to write to disk.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Context.ForcedCloseReason
histogram.summary: The reason that a forced-close of a backing store occurred.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Database.OutstandingTransactionCount
histogram.summary: Number of outstanding transactions (running, blocked) in database when a new transaction is created.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.FrontEndAPICalls
histogram.summary: Count total number of front end API calls of IndexedDB methods.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.CloseTime
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to close IndexedDB's LevelDB backing store.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.FreeDiskSpaceFailure
histogram.summary: Count of how many times LevelDBDatabase got an error trying to check free disk space.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.OpenFailureFreeDiskSpace
histogram.summary: Amount of free disk space on the partition/volume/etc where LevelDB failed to open.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.OpenSuccessFreeDiskSpace
histogram.summary: Amount of free disk space on the partition/volume/etc where LevelDB was successfully opened.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.OpenTime
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to open IndexedDB's LevelDB backing store.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.PutTime
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to write the data IndexedDB to the LevelDB backing store for a put operation.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.Transaction.CommitTime
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to commit an IndexedDB transaction to its LevelDB backing store.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.WriteTime
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to write data to an IndexedDB's LevelDB backing store.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors
histogram.summary: Error classes returned by LevelDB when it failed to open a database.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.BFE
histogram.summary: Errors (base::File::Error) encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when opening an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.Corruption
histogram.summary: Types of corruption that LevelDB encounters when opening a database.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.EnvMethod
histogram.summary: LevelDBEnv methods that generated IO errors when opening a database.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.Errno
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: Errno errors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when opening an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.PFE
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when opening an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors
histogram.summary: Error classes returned by LevelDB when it failed to read a database.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.BFE
histogram.summary: Errors (base::File::Error) encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when reading from an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.Corruption
histogram.summary: Types of corruption that LevelDB encounters when reading a database.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.EnvMethod
histogram.summary: LevelDBEnv methods that generated IO errors when reading a database.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.Errno
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: Errno errors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when reading an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.PFE
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when opening an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors
histogram.summary: Error classes returned by LevelDB when it failed to write to a database.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.BFE
histogram.summary: Errors (base::File::Error) encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when writing to an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.Corruption
histogram.summary: Types of corruption returned by LevelDB when it failed to write to a database.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.EnvMethod
histogram.summary: LevelDBEnv methods that generated IO errors when writing to a database.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.Errno
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: Errno errors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when writing to an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.PFE
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when writing to an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.ObjectStore.IndexEntry.KeyType
histogram.summary: The type of key (number, string, etc.) used for an index entry for a record being newly stored or updated in an Indexed DB object store. For array keys, the types of sub-keys are not recorded.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.ObjectStore.Record.KeyType
histogram.summary: The type of key (number, string, etc.) used for a record being newly stored or updated in an Indexed DB object store. For array keys, the types of sub-keys are not recorded.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.OpenTime.Blocked
histogram.summary: The delay between the receipt of the request to open an IndexedDB database and the firing of the blocked event.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.OpenTime.Error
histogram.summary: The delay between the receipt of the request to open an IndexedDB database and the firing of the error event.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.OpenTime.Success
histogram.summary: The delay between the receipt of the request to open an IndexedDB database and the firing of the success event.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.OpenTime.UpgradeNeeded
histogram.summary: The delay between the receipt of the request to open an IndexedDB database and the firing of the upgradeneeded event.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Schema.Index.KeyPathType
histogram.summary: Records the 'keyPath' type (none, string, or array) during IDBObjectStore's createIndex operation. See http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Schema.Index.MultiEntry
histogram.summary: Records the 'multiEntry' flag value during IDBObjectStore's createIndex operation. See http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Schema.Index.Unique
histogram.summary: Records the 'unique' flag value during IDBObjectStore's createIndex operation. See http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Schema.ObjectStore.AutoIncrement
histogram.summary: Records the 'autoIncrement' flag value during IDBDatabase's createObjectStore operation. See http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Schema.ObjectStore.KeyPathType
histogram.summary: Records the 'keyPath' type (none, string, or array) during IDBDatabase's createObjectStore operation. See http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/

histogram.name: WebCore.PreloadDelayMs
histogram.summary: The delay between when the preload scanner discovers a resource on the parser thread and when the preload request is issued on the main thread.

histogram.name: WebCore.ResourceFetcher.ActionUponResourceRequest
histogram.summary: The resulting action (e.g. load resource, use resource from in-memory cache...) upon a resource request.

histogram.name: WebCore.ResourceFetcher.HitCount
histogram.summary: Number of dead resources found in the memory cache over the lifetime of the ResourceFetcher.

histogram.name: WebCore.ResourceFetcher.LoadCount
histogram.summary: Number of resources that needed to be loaded by the ResourceFetcher over its lifetime.

histogram.name: WebCore.ResourceFetcher.ResourceHasClientUponCacheHit
histogram.summary: Whether the resource in the cache is being used by at least one client (live resource) or not (dead resource) upon a cache hit.

histogram.name: WebCore.ResourceFetcher.ResourceTypeUponCacheHit
histogram.obsolete: This metric has been not recorded at least since 2016/01. The displayed enum labels might be unreliable because C++ enum values of blink::Resource::Type have been changed over time.
histogram.summary: The type of the resource (e.g. image, script...) upon a cache hit.

histogram.name: WebCore.ResourceFetcher.RevalidateCount
histogram.summary: Number of dead resources that needed to be revalidated by the ResourceFetcher over its lifetime.

histogram.name: WebCore.ScriptedIdleTaskController.IdleCallbackDeadline
histogram.summary: The amount of time allotted to a requestIdleCallback callback, i.e., the difference between the time when it is called and when its deadline expires.

histogram.name: WebCore.ScriptedIdleTaskController.IdleCallbackOverrun
histogram.summary: The amount of time by which a requestIdleCallback callback overran its deadline. Callbacks which don't overrun their deadline will report an overrun of 0.

histogram.name: WebCore.Scripts.Async.NotStreamingReason
histogram.summary: Reason for not streaming an async script.

histogram.name: WebCore.Scripts.Async.StartedStreaming
histogram.summary: Whether an async script was streamed or not.

histogram.name: WebCore.Scripts.Deferred.NotStreamingReason
histogram.summary: Reason for not streaming a deferred script.

histogram.name: WebCore.Scripts.Deferred.StartedStreaming
histogram.summary: Whether a deferred script was streamed or not.

histogram.name: WebCore.Scripts.ParsingBlocking.AlreadyLoaded
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as this data was needed for streaming investigations, no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Whether a parsing blocking script was already preloaded from the net or the cache by the time it was needed.

histogram.name: WebCore.Scripts.ParsingBlocking.NotStreamingReason
histogram.summary: Reason for not streaming a parsing blocking script.

histogram.name: WebCore.Scripts.ParsingBlocking.StartedStreaming
histogram.summary: Whether a parsing blocking script was streamed or not.

histogram.name: WebCore.Scripts.ParsingBlocking.TimeBetweenLoadedAndCompiled
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as this data was needed for streaming investigations, no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Time between the events "script is loaded" and "script is compiled" for parsing blocking scripts.

histogram.name: WebCore.SpellChecker.RequestInterval
histogram.summary: The amount of time between consecutive spellcheck requests made by Blink, with the exception that requests made simultaneously checking different parts of the same editing host count as only one request.

histogram.name: WebCore.V8DOMWindowShell.createContext.IsolatedWorld
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2013, we no longer have the code that uses this metric.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to create a V8 Context for an isolated world.

histogram.name: WebCore.V8DOMWindowShell.createContext.MainWorld
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 05/2013, we no longer have the code that uses this metric.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to create a V8 Context for the main world.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.BinaryTypeChangesAfterOpen
histogram.summary: Count the number of changes to WebSocket.binaryType after the connection opened, per connection. Assignments that match the existing binaryType are not counted. This is recorded after WebSocket close, whether explicit or due to error or navigation. It is not recorded if the render process is destroyed before the WebSocket is closed.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.HandshakeResult
histogram.summary: Count the number of WebSocket handshake for each result. Use this histogram as a baseline for investigating feature usage counters.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.MessageSize.Receive
histogram.summary: The sizes of binary WebSocket messages received, broken down by type. One entry per message. Clamped to 100 MB.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.MessageSize.Send
histogram.summary: The sizes of binary WebSocket messages sent, broken down by type. One entry per message. Clamped to 100 MB.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.PerMessageDeflateContextTakeOverMode
histogram.summary: Count the number of WebSockets that accepted permessage-deflate extension for each context take over mode. Used by the old Blink-based WebSocket implementation.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.ReceiveType
histogram.summary: Count the number of messages for each message type and set binary type.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.SendType
histogram.summary: Count the number of send() method calls on WebSockets for each argument type.

histogram.name: WebCore.XHR.send.ArrayBufferOrView
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 7/2014. This histogram was used to determine when it would be ok to remove the deprecated XMLHttpRequest.send(ArrayBuffer) overload. The support for ArrayBuffer was un-deprecated in the WHATWG spec for XHR, and subsequently un-deprecated in Blink.
histogram.summary: Count the number of XHR.send() calls for each argument type to see when we can deprecate the ArrayBuffer type support.

histogram.name: WebFont.BlankTextShownTime
histogram.summary: A histogram tracking the time we spent showing blank text because a web font wasn't available by the time we needed it. Measured once per @font-face that ended up showing blank text.

histogram.name: WebFont.CacheHit
histogram.summary: Recorded upon web fonts load. Counts the number of times web font is loaded from cache (disk cache or memory cache), fetched over network, or served from data URL.

histogram.name: WebFont.CORSSuccess
histogram.summary: The success or failure of web fonts CORS-enabled fetching.

histogram.name: WebFont.DecodeSpeed
histogram.summary: Uncompressed font image size divided by the duration of time OTS takes to decode the font image, in kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: WebFont.DiskCache.EntryAge.Evict
histogram.summary: Recorded upon an eviction of a cache entry for a font in Google Fonts. Records the age of the cache entry.

histogram.name: WebFont.DiskCache.EntryAge.Hit
histogram.summary: Recorded upon a cache hit for a font in Google Fonts. Records the age of the cache entry.

histogram.name: WebFont.DiskCache.ReuseCount.Evict
histogram.summary: When a cache entry for a font in Google Fonts is evicted, records the reuse count of the cache entry.

histogram.name: WebFont.DiskCache.ReuseCount.Hit
histogram.summary: Recorded upon a cache hit for a font in Google Fonts. Records the reuse count of the cache entry.

histogram.name: WebFont.DiskCacheHit
histogram.summary: Whether the font was in the cache or not. "Previously in the cache" means there was an evicted entry for the font in the cache. Recorded upon a disk cache query for a font in Google Fonts.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.0.Under10KB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of under 10KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.1.10KBTo50KB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 10KB-50KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.2.50KBTo100KB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 50KB-100KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.3.100KBTo1MB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 100KB-1MB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.4.Over1MB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of over 1MB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.LoadError
histogram.summary: The time taken for a webfont download that failed. Includes aborted requests.

histogram.name: WebFont.FontDisplayValue
histogram.summary: The value of font-display @font-face descriptor. Counted only when explicitly specified in the @font-face rule.

histogram.name: WebFont.HadBlankText
histogram.summary: This metrics is logged when a page that use web fonts is loaded. The value is whether we had to wait on at least one web font and ended up showing blank text, or not.

histogram.name: WebFont.InterventionResult
histogram.summary: For each WebFont load attempt, records whether User Agent Intervention was triggered, and whether the request (would have) timed out or not. The intervention takes adaptive behaviors to handle loading timeouts to improve user experiences on slow networks.

histogram.name: WebFont.InterventionResult.MissedCache
histogram.summary: Like InterventionResult, this records whether User Agent Intervention was triggered, and whether the request (would have) timed out or not. But this version records only when data actually comes from network, not from disk or memory cache, and is not provided in a data URL format.

histogram.name: WebFont.LayoutLatency
histogram.summary: The time from when the webfont was referenced by a calculated style for the first time to the start of the font download.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadLimitOnDiskCacheMiss
histogram.summary: The load limit state when the first disk-cache-only request fails by cache miss, if WebFonts cache-aware timeout adaptation is enabled and applicable.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.0.Under10KB
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.0.Under10KB.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of under 10KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.1.10KBTo50KB
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.1.10KBTo50KB.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 10KB-50KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.2.50KBTo100KB
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.2.50KBTo100KB.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 50KB-100KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.3.100KBTo1MB
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.3.100KBTo1MB.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 100KB-1MB.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.4.Over1MB
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.4.Over1MB.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of over 1MB.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.LoadError
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.LoadError.
histogram.summary: The time taken for a webfont download that failed. Includes aborted requests.

histogram.name: WebFont.LocalFontUsed
histogram.summary: Whether a locallly installed font is actually used when @font-face had local sources.

histogram.name: WebFont.PackageFormat
histogram.summary: The packaging format of the font file (e.g. SFNT, WOFF ...) upon a webfont load.

histogram.name: WebFont.Resource.StyleRecalcToDownloadLatency
histogram.summary: The time from when the webfont was referenced by a calculated style for the first time to the start of the font download. Recorded at most once for each FontResource object (not recorded if the font is retrieved from the memory cache).

histogram.name: WebFont.Resource.UsageType
histogram.summary: For each webfont, this records (a) if the font was 'styled', i.e. referenced by a calculated style for a RenderText before the font data was used, and (b) if the font was actually used or not, i.e. the renderer requested the font data or not. (A Font can be used without being styled, for example when drawn by a Canvas 2D Context.) This is recorded upon a download request of a webfont, or destruction of a FontResource object. Recorded at most once for each FontResource object in the renderer's memory cahce.

histogram.name: WebFont.StyleRecalcToDownloadLatency
histogram.summary: The time from when the webfont was referenced by a calculated style for the first time to the start of the font download.

histogram.name: WebFont.UsageType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2013, replaced by WebFont.Resource.UsageType.
histogram.summary: For each webfont, this records (a) if the font was 'styled', i.e. referenced by a calculated style for a RenderText before the font data was used, and (b) if the font was actually used or not, i.e. the renderer requested the font data or not. (A Font can be used without being styled, for example when drawn by a Canvas 2D Context.) This is recorded upon a download request of a webfont, or destruction of a CSSFontFaceSource object. Recorded at most once for each url() source of @font-face CSS rule.

histogram.name: WebFont.WebFontsInPage
histogram.summary: The number of webfonts used in a page. This is recorded when the first layout is done, and so will not count webfonts dynamically loaded by scripts.

histogram.name: WebHistory.LocalResultMissingOnServer
histogram.summary: Percentage of results that are present locally but are not returned by the web history API call. Recorded every time a signed-in user visits the chrome://history page and the results from the web history are received.

histogram.name: WebHistory.OAuthTokenCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether getting the OAuth token was successful for a web history query. On visits to the chrome://history page this token is obtained and then used to get the user's synced web history.

histogram.name: WebHistory.OAuthTokenResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP Response code returned by the server when trying to fetch the OAuth token for a web history query.

histogram.name: WebHistory.QueryCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the web history API call was successful. Every time a signed-in user visits the chrome://history page this query is executed to get the user's synced web history. If successful, the local and remote results are merged and shown in the history page.

histogram.name: WebHistory.ResponseTime
histogram.summary: Time it took for the web history to reply. Recorded when the web history API call triggered by visiting chrome://history receives the data, measuring how much time it took for the server to reply.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AecDelayBasedQuality
histogram.summary: Captures if the estimated delay between rendered and captured audio is out of bounds which can cause the Echo Cancellation to fail. This is logged roughly once every 5 seconds. The values are logged in four buckets reflecting how well the Echo Cancellation likely performs based on the estimated delay.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AecFilterHasDivergence
histogram.summary: The percentage of measurement periods during a capture stream's lifetime when the echo canceler's filter is considered to have diverged at least once. A diverged filter could mean that there was echo och ducking experienced. The measurement period size is fixed and in the order of one second. The first measurement period is larger, typically 2-3 seconds. Capture streams with shorter lifetimes (i.e. no data available) are not recorded here.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ApplicationMaxConsecutiveBytesDiscard
histogram.summary: The maximum consecutive discarded bytes caused by not enough buffer available in WebRTC's socket implementation. This happens when WebRTC IpcPacketSocket's throttling mechanism kicks in.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ApplicationMaxConsecutiveBytesDiscard.v2
histogram.summary: The maximum consecutive discarded bytes caused by not enough buffer available in WebRTC's socket implementation. This happens when WebRTC IpcPacketSocket's throttling mechanism kicks in. The maximum bucket is expanded from previous version to provide more insight when upper layer feeds a lot of packets.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ApplicationPercentPacketsDiscarded
histogram.summary: The percentage of packets discarded by WebRTC's socket layer due to EWOULDBLOCKs when WebRTC IpcPacketSocket's throttling mechanism kicks in.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AecDelayAdjustmentMsAgnosticValue
histogram.summary: The AEC in WebRTC will sometimes realign the far- and near-end signal buffers to keep in sync with delay changes in the echo path. This metric logs each such realignment, storing the delay change in ms, when the change is triggered by a shift in the signal based delay estimation (a.k.a delay-agnostic).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AecDelayAdjustmentMsSystemValue
histogram.summary: The AEC in WebRTC will sometimes realign the far- and near-end signal buffers to keep in sync with delay changes in the echo path. This metric logs each such realignment, storing the delay change in ms, when the change is triggered by a shift in system reported delay.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AecSystemDelayJump
histogram.summary: The AEC in WebRTC keeps a buffer to mimic the audio buffers in the lower layers. This histogram logs a sudden positive jump in buffer size. Since we detect jumps in the capture thread, only positive values are feasible. Note that the difference in milliseconds is logged and not the actual AEC system delay value. Sampled every time the AEC system delay changes more than 50 milliseconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AgcClippingAdjustmentAllowed
histogram.summary: The automatic gain control (AGC) in WebRTC tries to adjust the microphone gain to maintain a strong audio level, but without clipping (saturation). The histogram will log a value every time input clipping is detected. The value is a boolean, with "true" meaning that the gain was in fact adjusted in response to the detected clipping, and "false" meaning that adjustment was not allowed due to limiting boundaries in the algorithm.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AgcSetLevel
histogram.summary: The automatic gain control (AGC) in WebRTC tries to adjust the microphone gain to maintain a strong audio level, but without clipping (saturation). The histogram will log a new value every time the AGC changes the target level.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ApmCaptureInputLevelAverageRms
histogram.summary: This histogram reports the average RMS of the signal coming in to WebRTC's Audio Processing Module, prior to any WebRTC processing. A new value is reported every 10 seconds, and the average is over the latest interval. The metric is negated dBFS, meaning that 0 is a full-scale signal, while 127 corresponds to -127 dBFS (very faint).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ApmCaptureInputLevelPeakRms
histogram.summary: This histogram reports the peak RMS of the signal coming in to WebRTC's Audio Processing Module, prior to any WebRTC processing. A new value is reported every 10 seconds, and the peak is the RMS of the strongest 10 ms block over the latest interval. The metric is negated dBFS, meaning that 0 is a full-scale signal, while 127 corresponds to -127 dBFS (very faint).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ApmCaptureOutputLevelAverageRms
histogram.summary: This histogram reports the average RMS of the signal in the output of WebRTC's Audio Processing Module, after all audio WebRTC processing. A new value is reported every 10 seconds, and the average is over the latest interval. The metric is negated dBFS, meaning that 0 is a full-scale signal, while 127 corresponds to -127 dBFS (very faint).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ApmCaptureOutputLevelPeakRms
histogram.summary: This histogram reports the peak RMS of the signal in the output of WebRTC's Audio Processing Module, after all WebRTC audio processing. A new value is reported every 10 seconds, and the peak is the RMS of the strongest 10 ms block over the latest interval. The metric is negated dBFS, meaning that 0 is a full-scale signal, while 127 corresponds to -127 dBFS (very faint).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AverageExcessBufferDelayMs
histogram.summary: Measures the average waiting time in the buffer for each packet. The waiting time is the time elapsed from the packet arrives until it is decoded. The metric is calculated as the average over one minute, and is logged at the end of each such interval. A well tuned target buffer level should lead to a low value.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.DelayedPacketOutageEventMs
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of each packet loss concealment (a.k.a. expand) event that is not followed by a merge operation. The outage is measured in milliseconds, with a range between 0 and 2000 ms. This gives an indication of how well the jitter buffer's level adaptation is working. If the chosen target level is too low, this value will increase.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.DelayedPacketOutageEventsPerMinute
histogram.summary: Counts the number of delayed packet outage events per minute. The range is between 0 and 100 (corresponds to more 1.6 events per second). See WebRTC.Audio.DelayedPacketOutageEventMs for the definition of a delayed packet outage event, and the interpretation of such events.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ActiveRender
histogram.summary: This histogram logs a value indicating whether the WebRTC echo canceller detects that there is active content in the render signal. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is averaged over this period.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.BufferDelay
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the applied render buffer delay used in the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value constitutes the current buffer delay at the time when the value is logged.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.CaptureSaturation
histogram.summary: This histogram logs a value every time the WebRTC echo canceller has detected saturation in the capture signal. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value indicates whether the capture signal has been saturated during the last 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ComfortNoiseBand0
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the level of the comfort noise in the WebRTC echo canceller in the lower 4 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ComfortNoiseBand1
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the level of the comfort noise in the WebRTC echo canceller between 4 and 8 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.DelayChanges
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the frequency of echo path delay changes that are detected by the delay estimator in the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value indicates how frequent delay changes have been during the last 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.EchoPathDelay
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the estimated echo path delay in 64 sample blocks as seen by the delay estimator in the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is the estimate of the delay of the echo path at the time when the value is logged.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ErlBand0
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the echo return loss achieved by the WebRTC echo canceller in the lower 4 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ErlBand1
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the echo return loss achieved by the WebRTC echo canceller between 4 and 8 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ErleBand0
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the echo return loss enhancement achieved by the WebRTC echo canceller in the lower 4 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ErleBand1
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the echo return loss enhancement achieved by the WebRTC echo canceller between 4 and 8 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.FilterDelay
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the estimated echo path delay in 64 sample blocks as seen by the linear filter delay in the WebRTC echo canceller. The value 0 means that no delay could be estimated from the linear filter, otherwise the logged delay corresponds to the actual delay + 1. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is the estimate of the filter delay at the time when the value is logged.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ModelBasedAecFeasible
histogram.summary: This histogram logs a value every time the WebRTC echo canceller deems that echo path is possible to model using any of the the echo canceller echo path models. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is the feasibility assessment at the time when the value is logged.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ReliableDelayEstimates
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the assessed reliability of the delay estimates produced by the delay estimator in the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is a meausure based on how often during that period the delay estimate was reliable.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.RenderOverruns
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the frequency of overruns in the render buffer of the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is a meausure that indicates how often overruns occurred.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.RenderUnderruns
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the frequency of underruns in the render buffer of the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is a meausure that indicates how often underruns occurred.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.SuppressorGainBand0
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the echo suppressor gain in the WebRTC echo canceller in the lower 4 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.SuppressorGainBand1
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the echo suppressor gain in the WebRTC echo canceller between 4 and 8 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.UsableLinearEstimate
histogram.summary: This histogram logs a value every time the WebRTC echo canceller deems that the linear filter in the echo canceller is sufficiently well adapted to be usable. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is the assessment of whether the filter is usable at the time when the value is logged.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.Encoder.CodecType
histogram.summary: Histogram of audio codec usage. Every sample corresponds to 5 seconds of encoding with that codec.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.NumOfAecSystemDelayJumps
histogram.summary: Number of triggered WebRTC.Audio.AecSystemDelayJump during a call. This is recorded when a WebRTC based call has ended. AecSystemDelayJump can be triggered when, for example, the capture thread is stalled, which can harm the AEC. NumOfAecSystemDelayJumps shows how often this occurs in general as well as during a call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.NumOfPlatformReportedStreamDelayJumps
histogram.summary: Number of triggered WebRTC.Audio.PlatformReportedStreamDelayJump during a call. This is recorded when a WebRTC based call has ended. PlatformReportedStreamDelayJump can be triggered when, for example, the capture thread is stalled, which can harm the AEC. NumOfPlatformReportedStreamDelayJumps shows how often this occurs in general as well as during a call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.PlatformReportedStreamDelayJump
histogram.summary: The difference in stream delay reported to WebRTC by Chrome. Since we detect jumps in the capture thread, only positive values are feasible. Note that the difference in milliseconds is logged and not the actual stream delay value. Sampled every time the stream delay changes more than 50 milliseconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ResidualEchoDetector.EchoLikelihood
histogram.summary: The estimated likelihood percentage of echo as detected by the residual echo detector. The residual echo detector can be used to detect cases where the AEC (hardware or software) is not functioning properly. The detector can be non-causal and operates on larger timescales with more delay than the regular AEC.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.TargetBitrateInKbps
histogram.summary: The target bitrate in kbps that the audio codec should try to produce on average. Sampled every time the rate is updated.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioCaptureTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of WebRTC audio capture session.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioInputChannelLayout
histogram.summary: Audio input channel layout in WebRTC.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioInputFramesPerBuffer
histogram.obsolete: No longer exists in the code as of 2014/2/25.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of WebRTC audio input buffers (in audio frames).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioInputFramesPerBufferUnexpected
histogram.obsolete: No longer exists in the code as of 2014/2/25.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of WebRTC audio input buffers (atypical values, in audio frames).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioInputSampleRate
histogram.summary: Audio input sample rate for WebRTC (in Hz).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioInputSampleRateUnexpected
histogram.summary: Audio input sample rate for WebRTC (atypical values, in Hz).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioOutputChannelLayout
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Audio output channel layout in WebRTC.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioOutputFramesPerBuffer
histogram.summary: Size of WebRTC audio output buffers (in audio frames).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioOutputFramesPerBufferUnexpected
histogram.summary: Size of WebRTC audio output buffers (atypical values, in audio frames).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioOutputSampleRate
histogram.summary: Audio output sample rate for WebRTC (in Hz).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioOutputSampleRateUnexpected
histogram.summary: Audio output sample rate for WebRTC (atypical values, in Hz).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioRenderTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of WebRTC audio render session.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioRenderTimes
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Aug 2016, replaced by Media.Audio.Render.GetSourceDataTime.WebRTC.
histogram.summary: Measures the time spent in WebRtcAudioRenderer::SourceCallback. Sampled 10 times per second.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.InitialBandwidthEstimate
histogram.summary: The bandwidth estimate 2 seconds into a WebRTC call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.InitiallyLostPackets
histogram.summary: The number of video packets lost durig the first 2 seconds in a WebRTC call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.InitialRtt
histogram.summary: The round-trip time as measured 2 seconds into a WebRTC call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.InitialVsConvergedDiff
histogram.summary: The difference between the bandwidth estimate at 2 seconds and 20 seconds into a WebRTC call, with a min at 0, which is supposed to capture the how much the initial bandwidth estimate overshot the actual bandwidth available.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.MidCallProbing.Initiated
histogram.summary: The bitrate that will be probed, triggered by an update to the max configured bitrate.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.MidCallProbing.ProbedKbps
histogram.summary: The resulting bitrate probed, triggered by an update to the max configured bitrate.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.MidCallProbing.Success
histogram.summary: A successful probing attempt for a given bitrate, triggered by an update to the max configured bitrate. NOTE! This is not the resulting bitrate from a probing attempt, see WebRTC.BWE.MidCallProbing.ProbedKbps.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.RampUpTimeTo1000kbpsInMs
histogram.summary: The time it takes the estimated bandwidth to reach 1000 kbps from the first RTCP packet received. Used to measure the bandwidth ramp-up time.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.RampUpTimeTo2000kbpsInMs
histogram.summary: The time it takes the estimated bandwidth to reach 2000 kbps from the first RTCP packet received. Used to measure the bandwidth ramp-up time.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.RampUpTimeTo500kbpsInMs
histogram.summary: The time it takes the estimated bandwidth to reach 500 kbps from the first RTCP packet received. Used to measure the bandwidth ramp-up time.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.Types
histogram.summary: The bandwidth estimation used in WebRTC calls. Records whether the BWE is running on the sender or the receiver and what BWE related RTP header extensions are in use.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.AudioBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: Average audio bitrate received during a call, counted from first packet received until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.BitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: Average total bitrate received during a call (audio + video + RTCP), counted from first packet received until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.EstimatedSendBitrateInKbps
histogram.summary: Average estimated send bitrate during a call, counted from first packet sent until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.LifetimeInSeconds
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a call. Recorded when a Call instance is destroyed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.PacerBitrateInKbps
histogram.summary: Average pacer bitrate during a call, counted from first packet sent until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.RtcpBitrateReceivedInBps
histogram.summary: Average RTCP bitrate received during a call, counted from first packet received until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.VideoBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: Average video bitrate received during a call, counted from first packet received until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelCounters
histogram.summary: Counters on creation, opening, and a few main attributes of data channels.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelMaxRetransmits
histogram.summary: The maximum number of retransmissions that are attempted in unreliable mode. It is set to the value used in the configuration when a RTCDataChannel is created.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelMaxRetransmitTime
histogram.summary: The length of the time window during which transmissions and retransmissions may occur in unreliable mode. It is set to the value used in the configuration when a RTCDataChannel is created.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCaptureCounters
histogram.summary: Counters on creation of DesktopCaptureDevice and the first capture call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ICE.TcpSocketWriteErrorCode
histogram.summary: Counters on different types of TCP socket error code. Collected when we hit the error code when writing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ICE.UdpSocketWriteErrorCode
histogram.summary: Counters on different types of UDP socket error code. Collected when we hit the error code when writing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.NAT.Metrics
histogram.summary: Counters on various types of NAT observed. This is logged once per session.

histogram.name: WebRTC.NumDataChannelsPerPeerConnection
histogram.summary: Number of data channels created per PeerConnection. Sample added to the histogram when the PeerConnection is destroyed. Note that this is done purely on the renderer side, so no sample will be generated when the renderer process is destroyed (as in the fast shutdown path for the renderer) before the PeerConnection is destroyed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.CandidatePairType
histogram.summary: Counters of various ICE Endpoint types. These values are logged for the first selected candidate pair of a PeerConnection.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.ConnectionState
histogram.summary: Counters of ICE Connection states. These values are logged when the PeerConnection gets into that state for the first time or after the ICE restart.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.DtlsHandshakeError
histogram.summary: Records the error whenever the Dtls handshake fails. There are only two types of errors, incompatitable cipher suite and unknown error, for now.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IceRegatheringReason
histogram.summary: Records the reasons for ICE re-gathering.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IceRestartState
histogram.summary: Records the transport channel states when ICE restart happens.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPMetrics
histogram.summary: Counters on IPv4 and IPv6 usage in PeerConnection. These values are logged once per PeerConnection.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPPermissionStatus
histogram.summary: Whether the permission to collect the local IP addresses in WebRTC has been requested and/or granted. This is collected the first time when networks updated event is reported or if never reported, during the destruction phase of a call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPv4Interfaces
histogram.summary: Number of IPv4 network interfaces discovered in a PeerConnection Session.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPv4LocalCandidates
histogram.summary: Number of IPv4 local Candidates gathered in a PeerConnection Session once the ICE address gathering process reaches the Completed status. To avoid miscounting, this only includes the first m line's first component.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPv6Interfaces
histogram.summary: Number of IPv6 network interfaces discovered in a PeerConnection Session.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPv6LocalCandidates
histogram.summary: Number of IPv6 local Candidates gathered in a PeerConnection Session once the ICE address gathering process reaches the Completed status. To avoid miscounting, this only includes the first m line's first component.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.RtcpMux
histogram.summary: Whether RTCP-mux is used for the PeerConnection (both the local and remote description enable RTCP-mux). Recorded after SetLocalDescription and SetRemoteDescription are called, once per PeerConnection.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SelectedRtcpMuxPolicy
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on Dec 2016. This histogram is used to gauge the risk of making the change for issue 6030. The decision has been made and this is not needed any more.
histogram.summary: Whether the application specified a value for RTCP-mux policy, and if so, which value, "Require" or "Negotiate". Recorded after parsing the configuration when creating the RTCPeerConnection.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SrtpCryptoSuite
histogram.summary: Counters on the type of SRTP crypto suites used by WebRTC. This is collected whenever the transport signals the OnCompleted event.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SslCipherSuite
histogram.summary: Counters on the type of SSL cipher suites used by WebRTC. This is collected whenever the transport signals the OnCompleted event.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.TimeToConnect
histogram.summary: Time to setup a peer to peer call with PeerConnection.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.TimeToNetworkUpdated
histogram.summary: Time to receive the first SignalNetworksChanged from the request to start updating network in PeerConnection.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ReceivedAudioTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of audio tracks received over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ReceivedVideoTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of video tracks received over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ReliableDataChannelMessageSize
histogram.summary: Sizes of messages sent over reliable data channels. The size of an individual message is added to the histogram as a sample immediately when a message is sent.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ScreenCaptureTime
histogram.summary: Time for capturing one frame in screen capturing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.SentAudioTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of audio tracks sent over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter.

histogram.name: WebRTC.SentVideoTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of video tracks sent over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Stun.BatchSuccessPercent
histogram.summary: For clients using a shared source port per STUN binding request toward the specified servers, success rate for requests which received a response with various intervals between requests. Only the first instance of renderers will conduct the trial and log this result. The STUN binding requests are grouped into multiple batches and the success rate is calculated for an individual batch.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Stun.ResponseLatency
histogram.summary: For clients using a shared source port per STUN binding request, average RTT for requests which received a response with various intervals between requests. Only the first instance of renderers will conduct the trial and log this result.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Stun.SuccessPercent
histogram.summary: For clients using a shared source port per STUN binding request, success rate for requests which received a response with various intervals between requests. Only the first instance of renderers will conduct the trial and log this result.

histogram.name: WebRTC.SystemMaxConsecutiveBytesDelayed
histogram.summary: The maximum of consecutive delayed bytes caused by EWOULDBLOCKs from system. This happens when system can't send any packet synchronously at that moment.

histogram.name: WebRTC.SystemPercentPacketsDelayed
histogram.summary: The percentage of packets delayed due to ERR_IO_PENDING from system in a WebRTC socket. This happens when system can't send any packet synchronously at that moment.

histogram.name: WebRTC.SystemSendPacketDuration
histogram.summary: The duration that it takes to send out a packet in system layer. This includes both the queuing time (under the condition when socket returns EWOULDBLOCK from system) as well as the time system takes to finish the asynchronous send. For UDP, it's the time from P2PSocketHostUdp::Send to P2PSocketHostUdp::HandleSendResult. Tcp part is to be implemented.

histogram.name: WebRTC.UnreliableDataChannelMessageSize
histogram.summary: Sizes of messages sent over unreliable data channels. The size of an individual message is added to the histogram as a sample immediately when a message is sent.

histogram.name: WebRTC.UserMediaRequest.NoResultState
histogram.summary:
The state of a UserMediaRequest when it gets destroyed before having a result.
Note: "Explicitly Cancelled" means MediaStreamImpl::cancelUserMediaRequest was called and not necessarily that the user cancelled. Those are likely tracked as UserMediaRequest with a result of permission denied.

histogram.name: WebRTC.UserMediaRequest.Result
histogram.summary: Counters for UserMediaRequests results such as failure reasons.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.AdaptChangesPerMinute
histogram.summary: The average number of adaptation changes per minute for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.AverageRoundTripTimeInMilliseconds
histogram.summary: The average round-trip time of a WebRTC call in milliseconds. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.AVSyncOffsetInMs
histogram.summary: The absolute value of the sync offset between a rendered video frame and the latest played audio frame is measured per video frame. The average offset per received video stream is recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BadCall.Any
histogram.summary: Fraction of time the call was classified as bad because of any reason.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BadCall.FrameRate
histogram.summary: Fraction of time the call was classified as bad because of low framerate.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BadCall.FrameRateVariance
histogram.summary: Fraction of time the call was classified as bad because of high framerate variance.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BadCall.Qp
histogram.summary: Fraction of time the call was classified as bad because of high qp.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BandwidthLimitedResolutionInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent frames that are limited in resolution due to bandwidth for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BandwidthLimitedResolutionsDisabled
histogram.summary: For frames that are limited in resolution due to bandwidth, the average number of disabled resolutions is recorded for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of received bits per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent bits per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.CompleteFramesReceivedPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of complete frames received per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.CpuLimitedResolutionInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of frames that are limited in resolution due to cpu for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.CurrentDelayInMs
histogram.summary: Average current delay for a received video stream. This is the actual delay imposed on frames (where the goal is to reach the target delay (see WebRTC.Video.TargetDelayInMs)). Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Decoded.Vp8.Qp
histogram.summary: The average QP (quantizer value) per frame for a received VP8 video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DecodedFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of decoded frames per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DecodeTimeInMs
histogram.summary: The average decode time per frame for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DelayedFramesToRenderer
histogram.summary: Percentage of delayed frames to renderer for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DelayedFramesToRenderer_AvgDelayInMs
histogram.summary: The average delay of delayed frames to renderer for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DiscardedPacketsInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of discarded packets by the jitter buffer due to arriving too late for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DuplicatedPacketsInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of duplicated packets in the jitter buffer for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Encoded.Qp
histogram.summary: The average QP (quantizer value) per frame for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Encoder.CodecType
histogram.summary: Configured video codec for a sent video stream. Recorded when a VideoSendStream is destroyed (for streams whose lifetime is longer than 10 seconds).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.EncodeTimeInMs
histogram.summary: The average encode time per frame for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.EndToEndDelayInMs
histogram.summary: The average end-to-end delay per frame for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.EndToEndDelayMaxInMs
histogram.summary: The maximum end-to-end delay per frame for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.FecBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of received FEC bits per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.FecBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent FEC bits per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.FirPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP FIR packets per minute for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.FirPacketsSentPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of sent RTCP FIR packets per minute for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.H264DecoderImpl.Event
histogram.summary: The number of |H264DecoderImpl| events, such as an initialization or decoding error, that have occurred. At most one Init and one Error is reported per |H264DecoderImpl| instance. This is to avoid the same event from being reported multiple times (e.g. if there is an error you might re-initialize or get a decode error every frame which would otherwise pollute the data).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.H264EncoderImpl.Event
histogram.summary: The number of |H264EncoderImpl| events, such as an initialization or encoding error, that have occurred. At most one Init and one Error is reported per |H264EncoderImpl| instance. This is to avoid the same event from being reported multiple times (e.g. if there is an error you might re-initialize or get an encode error every frame which would otherwise pollute the data).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.InputFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of incoming frames per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.InputHeightInPixels
histogram.summary: The average input height per frame (for incoming frames to video engine) for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.InputWidthInPixels
histogram.summary: The average input width per frame (for incoming frames to video engine) for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.JitterBufferDelayInMs
histogram.summary: Average jitter buffer delay for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.KeyFramesReceivedInPermille
histogram.summary: Permille of frames that are key frames for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.KeyFramesSentInPermille
histogram.summary: Permille of frames that are key frames for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.MediaBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of received media payload bits per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.MediaBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent media payload bits per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.NackPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP NACK packets per minute for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.NackPacketsSentPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of sent RTCP NACK packets per minute for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.NumberOfPauseEvents
histogram.summary: The number of times a video stream has been paused/resumed during a call. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.OnewayDelayInMs
histogram.summary: Average delay (network delay (rtt/2) + jitter delay + decode time + render delay) for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.PaddingBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of received padding bits per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.PaddingBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent padding bits per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.PausedTimeInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of time that the video has been paused for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.PliPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP PLI packets per minute for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.PliPacketsSentPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of sent RTCP PLI packets per minute for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.QualityLimitedResolutionDownscales
histogram.summary: For frames that are downscaled in resolution due to quality, the average number of downscales is recorded for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.QualityLimitedResolutionInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent frames that are downscaled in resolution due to quality for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ReceivedFecPacketsInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of received FEC packets for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ReceivedHeightInPixels
histogram.summary: The average received height per frame for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ReceivedPacketsLostInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of received packets lost for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ReceivedWidthInPixels
histogram.summary: The average received width per frame for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ReceiveStreamLifetimeInSeconds
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a video receive stream. Recorded when a VideoReceiveStream instance is destroyed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RecoveredMediaPacketsInPercentOfFec
histogram.summary: Percentage of recovered media packets from FEC packets for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RenderFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of sent frames to the renderer per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RenderSqrtPixelsPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of pixels (sqrt(width*height)) of sent frames to the renderer per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of pixels is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RetransmittedBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of retransmitted bits per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RetransmittedBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of retransmitted bits per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RtpToNtpFreqOffsetInKhz
histogram.summary: The absolute value of the difference between the estimated frequency during RTP timestamp to NTP time conversion and the actual value (i.e. 90 kHz) is measured per received video frame. The max offset during 40 second intervals is stored. The average of these stored offsets per received video stream is recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RtxBitrateReceivedInKbps
