histogram.summary: The number of received bits over RTX per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RtxBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent bits over RTX per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.BandwidthLimitedResolutionInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent frames that are limited in resolution due to bandwidth for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.BandwidthLimitedResolutionsDisabled
histogram.summary: For frames that are limited in resolution due to bandwidth, the average number of disabled resolutions is recorded for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.BitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent bits per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.EncodeTimeInMs
histogram.summary: The average encode time per frame for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.EndToEndDelayInMs
histogram.summary: The average end-to-end delay per frame for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.EndToEndDelayMaxInMs
histogram.summary: The maximum end-to-end delay per frame for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.FecBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent FEC bits per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.FirPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP FIR packets per minute for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.FramesPerDrop
histogram.summary: Ratio of sent frames to dropped frames at the encoder. The value is reported when a stream is removed and is calculated as the total number frames sent divided by the number of dropped frames.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.FramesPerOvershoot
histogram.summary: Ratio of sent frames to number of re-encoded frames (due to target bitrate overshoot). The value is reported when a stream is removed and is calculated as the total number frames sent divided by the number of re-encoded frames.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.InputFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of incoming frames per second for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.InputHeightInPixels
histogram.summary: The average input height per frame (for incoming frames to video engine) for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.InputWidthInPixels
histogram.summary: The average input width per frame (for incoming frames to video engine) for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.KeyFramesSentInPermille
histogram.summary: Permille of frames that are key frames for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.Layer0
histogram.summary: Stats for the lower layer (TL0) of a screenshare stream in conference mode.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.Layer1
histogram.summary: Stats for the higher layer (TL1) of a screenshare stream in conference mode.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.MediaBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent media payload bits per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.NackPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP NACK packets per minute for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.PaddingBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent padding bits per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.PliPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP PLI packets per minute for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.QualityLimitedResolutionDownscales
histogram.summary: For frames that are downscaled in resolution due to quality, the average number of downscales is recorded for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.QualityLimitedResolutionInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent frames that are downscaled in resolution due to quality for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.RetransmittedBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of retransmitted bits per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.RtxBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent bits over RTX per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SendSideDelayInMs
histogram.summary: The average delay (of average delays) of sent packets for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The delay is measured from a frame is input to video engine until a packet is sent to the network. For each sent packet, the average delay of all sent packets over the last second is reported. The average of these reported delays is recorded.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SendSideDelayMaxInMs
histogram.summary: The average delay (of max delays) of sent packets for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The delay is measured from a frame is input to video engine until a packet is sent to the network. For each sent packet, the maximum delay of all sent packets over the last second is reported. The average of these reported delays is recorded.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SentFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of sent frames per second for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SentHeightInPixels
histogram.summary: The average sent height per frame for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SentPacketsLostInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent packets lost for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SentWidthInPixels
histogram.summary: The average sent width per frame for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.UniqueNackRequestsReceivedInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of unique RTCP NACK requests that are received in response to a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SendDelayInMs
histogram.summary: The average send delay of sent packets for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The delay is measured from a packet is sent to the transport until leaving the socket.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SendSideDelayInMs
histogram.summary: The average delay (of average delays) of sent packets for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The delay is measured from a frame is input to video engine until a packet is sent to the network. For each sent packet, the average delay of all sent packets over the last second is reported. The average of these reported delays is recorded.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SendSideDelayMaxInMs
histogram.summary: The average delay (of max delays) of sent packets for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The delay is measured from a frame is input to video engine until a packet is sent to the network. For each sent packet, the maximum delay of all sent packets over the last second is reported. The average of these reported delays is recorded.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SendStreamLifetimeInSeconds
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a video send stream. Recorded when a VideoSendStream instance is destroyed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SentFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of sent frames per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SentHeightInPixels
histogram.summary: The average sent height per frame for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SentPacketsLostInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent packets lost for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SentWidthInPixels
histogram.summary: The average sent width per frame for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.TargetDelayInMs
histogram.summary: Average target delay (jitter delay + decode time + render delay) for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.UniqueNackRequestsReceivedInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of unique RTCP NACK requests that are received in response to a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.UniqueNackRequestsSentInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of unique RTCP NACK requests that are sent in response to a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.VP8DecoderImpl.TooManyPendingFrames
histogram.summary: Counts occurences of if the VP8 software decoder runs out of buffers due to that they are not returned to the buffer pool. See http://crbug/652923 and http://crbug/542522.

histogram.name: WebRTC.webkitApiCount
histogram.summary: Counts number of calls to WebRTC APIs from JavaScript.

histogram.name: WebRTC.webkitApiCountPerSession
histogram.summary: Counts the number of calls to WebRTC APIs from JavaScript once per session. A session is a crude estimate since its implemented as the lifetime of the render process that called the WebRTC API.

histogram.name: WebRTC.webkitApiCountUniqueByOrigin
histogram.summary: Counts number of calls to WebRTC APIs from JavaScript, once per origin per renderer process.

histogram.name: WebRTC.WindowCaptureTime
histogram.summary: Time for capturing one frame in window capturing.

histogram.name: WebShare.ApiCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of calls to navigator.share. Includes both successful and failed shares.

histogram.name: WebShare.ShareOutcome
histogram.summary:
Records the outcome of calls to navigator.share. This will not count any calls that never complete (e.g., if the page closes while the picker is open). Therefore, DO NOT look at the raw percentages of this histogram; instead, compare these numbers with the WebShare.ApiCount.Share total.
NOTE: At the moment, if the user cancels the picker, its recording will be delayed, and possibly never recorded (https://crbug.com/636274), so that will account for a discrepancy between ShareOutcome and ApiCount.Share.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks actions with the website setting (a.k.a. page info / origin info) bubble, such as opening it up or clicking on the Connection tab.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Action.HttpsUrl
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated October 2016 in favor of Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Valid, Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Dangerous, and Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Downgraded.
histogram.summary: Tracks WebsiteSettings actions that take place on an HTTPS URL. This completely disregards security status.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Allowed
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Allowed' using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Blocked
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Blocked' using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Reset
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is reset to the default value using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged.Allowed
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Allowed' using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged.Blocked
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Blocked' using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.PermissionChanged
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2014 in Issue 433776, and replaced by WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged.
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed using the Page Info UI.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: websql.Async.OpenTime.Error
histogram.summary: The time required to try (and fail) to open a Web SQL database.

histogram.name: websql.Async.OpenTime.Success
histogram.summary: The time required to successfully open a Web SQL database.

histogram.name: websql.OpenDatabase
histogram.summary: Counts the number of WebSQL databases opened for secure vs insecure origins.

histogram.name: Webstore.ExtensionInstallResult
histogram.summary: The success or failure of all extension installs from the webstore. This includes those initiated by sync.

histogram.name: WebstoreWidgetApp.Close
histogram.summary: Webstore Widget app: the reason why the suggest apps dialog was closed.

histogram.name: WebstoreWidgetApp.Install
histogram.summary: Webstore Widget app: whether the Webstore item user selected was successfully installed or not.

histogram.name: WebstoreWidgetApp.Load
histogram.summary: Webstore Widget app: whether the initialization of the dialog succeeded or not.

histogram.name: WebstoreWidgetApp.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Webstore Widget app: time to load the widget contained in the app. Measured between the moment window appears and the moment all the contents in the app including the Chrome Webstore widget are ready.

histogram.name: WebUI.CreatedForUrl
histogram.summary: URLs for which Chrome creates WebUIControllers.

histogram.name: WebUsb.ChooserClosed
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the WebUSB device chooser was closed.

histogram.name: WebUsb.DetectorInitialization
histogram.summary: Records the time spent initializing the WebUSB detector module.

histogram.name: WebUsb.NotificationClosed
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the "WebUSB device detected" notification was dismissed.

histogram.name: WebUsb.PermissionRevoked
histogram.summary: Records when the user revokes permission for an origin to connect to a USB device using the WebUSB API.

histogram.name: Welcome.SignInPromptResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of promoting sign-in via the Welcome page.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.DefaultPromptResult
histogram.summary: Records whether or not Chrome was the default browser when the user left the Win10-specific Welcome page.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.NewPromoPageAdded
histogram.summary: Emits a "true" sample when the revamped WebUI-based welcome page is added to the startup tabs list. This means that barring an error on startup, it was shown to the user. This histogram can only be recorded during first-run flow, when the EnableWelcomeWin10 experiment is enabled.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.OriginalPromoPageAdded
histogram.summary: Emits a "true" sample when the old external welcome page is added to the startup tabs list. This means that barring an error on startup, it was shown to the user. This histogram can only be recorded during first-run flow, when the EnableWelcomeWin10 experiment is disabled.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.PinCheckTimedOut
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the check that verifies if Chrome is pinned to the taskbar has timed out. This check is done when the welcome page is opened in order to determine which instructions to display to the user.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.PinnedPromptResult
histogram.summary: Records whether or not Chrome was pinned to the taskbar when the user left the Win10-specific Welcome page.

histogram.name: Win8.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Count of page loads in each of the 2 different environments (metro/desktop) on Windows 8.

histogram.name: WindowManager.AppWindowCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of app windows open when a load completes. This includes windows opened by an app shortcut, or apps opened in a popup. This only counts v1 apps.

histogram.name: WindowManager.PanelWindowCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of panel windows open when a load completes. Panels are windows docked to the bottom of the OS desktop, which are visible to the user even while the user is interacting with other applications.

histogram.name: WindowManager.PopUpWindowCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of popup windows open when a load completes. Popup windows only have one content area (no multiple tabs) and a stripped down toolbar consisting only of a read-only address bar.

histogram.name: WindowManager.TabbedWindowCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of tabbed windows open when a load completes. A tabbed window is a normal browser window which can have one or more tabs.

histogram.name: Windows.GetVersionExVersion
histogram.summary: The Windows version (base::win::Version) as reported by GetVersionEx(). This is queried shortly after startup.

histogram.name: Windows.InCompatibilityMode
histogram.summary: A boolean used to indicate when the Windows version reported by GetVersionEx() and the Windows version reported by VerQueryValue() on kernel32 do not match. This is queried shortly after startup.

histogram.name: Windows.IsPinnedToTaskbar
histogram.summary: Indicates whether Chrome is pinned to the Windows taskbar for the current user. Recorded shortly after startup.

histogram.name: Windows.IsPinnedToTaskbar.ProcessError
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a connection error occured between the browser and the shell handler process. This is usually caused by a crash in the utility process. This is logged every time the pinned state is queried.

histogram.name: Windows.Kernel32Version
histogram.summary: The Windows version (base::win::Version) as reported by VeryQueryValue() on kernel32.dll. This is queried shortly after startup.

histogram.name: Windows.ParentProcessNameHash
histogram.summary: The 32-bit hash of the lower-case parent process basename (e.g. explorer.exe) of the main Chrome executable. Reported once during startup as part of install verification.

histogram.name: Windows.Tablet
histogram.summary: Count of browser launches from a Windows tablet pc.

histogram.name: Windows.Win32kRendererLockdown
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2016 as this is enabled by default so provides no useful data.
histogram.summary: Count of browser launches where Win32k renderer lockdown is enabled.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.Action
histogram.summary: The type of category clicked in the Windows Jumplist

histogram.name: WinJumplist.CreateIconFilesCount
histogram.summary: The number of jumplist icons requested to create per jumplist update. It is recorded whenever UpdateJumpList() is called.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.CreateIconFilesDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in CreateIconFiles(). This method is called whenever there is a jumplist update and the JumpListIcons folder is empty.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DeleteDirectoryContentDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in DeleteDirectoryContentAndLogRuntime().

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DeleteDirectoryDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/25/2016 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: Time spent in DeleteDirectoryAndLogResults().

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DeleteStatusJumpListIcons
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/25/2016 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: This metric records the detailed delete result of JumpListIcons directory.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DeleteStatusJumpListIconsOld
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/25/2016 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: This metric records the detailed delete result of JumpListIconsOld directory.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DetailedFolderMoveResults
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 12/13/2016 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when folder JumpListIcons is moved (can be rename or copy and delete) to JumpListIconsOld. This happens when tabs are closed, mostly visited URLs get updated, etc. There are several key steps in this folder move operation. Before the move operation, there is another step that JumpListIconsOld folder is deleted. The status of these steps are put together and recorded in this metric. The failure of any of these steps is suspected to be related to a known issue.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DetailedFolderResults
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 03/10/2017 as it is replaced by DetailedFolderResultsDeleteUpdated.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when folders JumpListIcons and JumpListIconsOld get updated. These two folders are updated when tabs are closed, mostly visited URLs get updated, etc. These two folders are updated as follows 1) JumpListIconsOld with its content get deleted; 2) if step 1 succeeds, JumpListIcons is moved, 3) if any of the previous steps fails, JumpListIcons is deleted, 4) A new JumpListIcons folder is created. The status of these 4 file operations are put together and recorded in this metric. The failure of any of these file operations is suspected to be related to a known issue.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DetailedFolderResultsDeleteUpdated
histogram.obsolete: Obselete 03/20/2016. New metrics named WinJumplist.DeleteStatusJumpListIcons and WinJumplist.DeleteStatusJumpListIconsOld are used instead.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when folders JumpListIcons and JumpListIconsOld get updated. These two folders are updated when tabs are closed, mostly visited URLs get updated, etc. These two folders are updated as follows 1) JumpListIconsOld with its content get deleted; 2) if step 1 succeeds, JumpListIcons is renamed to JumpListIconsOld, 3) if any of the previous steps fails, JumpListIcons is deleted, 4) A new JumpListIcons folder is created if deletion of JumpListIcons' content succeeds (only fail to delete the directory is okay). The status of these 4 file operations are put together and recorded in this metric. The failure of any of these file operations is suspected to be related to a known issue.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DirectoryStatusJumpListIcons
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/25/2016 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: This metric records whether the folder JumpListIcons exists; and if it does, whether it is empty or non-empty.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DirectoryStatusJumpListIconsOld
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/25/2016 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: This metric records whether the folder JumpListIconsOld exists; and if it does, whether it is empty or non-empty.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.FolderMoveResults
histogram.obsolete: Obselete 12/08/2016. DetailedFolderMoveResults is used for more detailed analysis.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when folder JumpListIcons is moved (can be rename or copy and delete) to JumpListIconsOld. This happens when tabs are closed, mostly visited URLs get updated, etc. There are 3 possible steps in this folder move operation. Before the move operation, there is another step that JumpListIconsOld folder is deleted. The status of these steps are put together and recorded in this metric. The failure of any of these steps is suspected to be related to a known issue listed below. https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=179576

histogram.name: WinJumplist.FolderResults
histogram.obsolete: Obselete 12/13/2016, as we are now recording DetailedFolderResults.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when folders JumpListIcons and JumpListIconsOld get updated. These two folders are updated when tabs are closed, mostly visited URLs get updated, etc. These two folders are updated as follows 1) JumpListIconsOld with its content get deleted; 2) JumpListIcons is moved, 3) A new JumpListIcons folder is created. The status of these three file operations are put together and recorded in this metric. The failure of any of these file operations is suspected to be related to a known issue.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.OnFaviconDataAvailableDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in OnFaviconDataAvailable().

histogram.name: WinJumplist.StartLoadingFaviconDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in StartLoadingFavicon().

histogram.name: WinJumplist.UpdateJumpListDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/20/2017 as it's no longer accurate due to the code change.
histogram.summary: Time spent in UpdateJumpList(). This method is called whenever there is a jumplist update.

histogram.name: WinJumplistUpdater.AddCustomCategoryDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in JumpListUpdater::AddCustomCategory.

histogram.name: WinJumplistUpdater.AddTasksDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in JumpListUpdater::AddTasks.

histogram.name: WinJumplistUpdater.BeginUpdateDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in JumpListUpdater::BeginUpdate.

histogram.name: WinJumplistUpdater.CommitUpdateDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in JumpListUpdater::CommitUpdate.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.FailedToChangeCores
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Incremented each time the TimeTicks field trial runs on a machine with multiple cores, but failed to change thread affinity. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.MinResolutionNanoseconds
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The smallest non-zero delta reported by subsequent calls to QueryPerformanceCounter.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.NonStopTsc
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: True if the CPU's timestamp counter ticks at a constant rate regardless of CPU frequency.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.TickedBackwards
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the TimeTicks field trial failed because QueryPerformanceCounter ticked backwards. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.VersionSuccessful
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the TimeTicks field trial succeeded. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.VersionTotal
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the TimeTicks field trial ran for comparison with WinTimeTicks.VersionSuccess. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WorkerScheduler.WorkerThreadLoad
histogram.summary: Worker thread load, i.e. percentage of time spent on running tasks. This metric is emitted at most once per kWorkerThreadLoadTrackerReportingInterval sec per worker thread amortized. E.g. if a worker ran a single task for X seconds and then went to idle for Y seconds before it shuts down, and assuming the interval rate was 1 sec, we get X samples for 100% and Y samples for 0%.

histogram.name: WorkerThread.DebuggerTask.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken for running a debugger task on WorkerThread.

histogram.name: WorkerThread.ExitCode
histogram.summary: Records the exit code of WorkerThread.

histogram.name: WorkerThread.Runtime
histogram.summary: The amount of time a worker thread ran for. Starts recording when a worker scheduler for the thread is created, and stops when the scheduler is shut down.

histogram.name: WorkerThread.Task.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken for running a worker task on WorkerThread.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.MenuAction
histogram.summary: Number of times that each menu item is clicked.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.OpeningAnimationFrameTimes
histogram.summary: Frame times of the Android wrench menu opening animation. For example, if the menu opening animation runs exactly at 60fps for a second, then each frame time is 16ms, and a total of 60 values of 16ms are recorded. If the animation is janky, we will see values greater than 16ms in the histogram.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.RecentTabsSubMenu
histogram.summary: The number of times each tab or window restore option in the Recent Tabs submenu is clicked.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.TimeToAction
histogram.summary: The time a user takes to select a menu item after opening the menu.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.TouchDuration
histogram.summary: Time difference between touch down and touch up on Android wrench button.

histogram.name: ZeroSuggest.AllResults
histogram.summary: The number of results (either query or URL) from ZeroSuggest. This is set every time a successful response from ZeroSuggest is recieved, which can be every time the user focuses on the omnibox.

histogram.name: ZeroSuggest.QueryResults
histogram.summary: The number of query results returned from ZeroSuggest. This is set every time a successful response from ZeroSuggest is recieved, which can be every time the user focuses on the omnibox.

histogram.name: ZeroSuggest.URLResults
histogram.summary: The number of URL results returned from ZeroSuggest. This is set every time a successful response from ZeroSuggest is recieved, which can be every time the user focuses on the omnibox.

histogram_suffixes.name: CertificateTypeBRValidity
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013. This histogram only considered the leaf certificate expiry date as a proxy for whether a certificate was in-scope for the BRs, but did not consider the issuance date. As some CAs have issued long-lived certs prior to the BRs, this disproportionately reported those certs as being subject to the BRs, but non-compliant, when in reality they're not subject.

suffix.name: BR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires after 2013-12-31, meaning that it should be in scope for the Baseline Requirement's key size requirements

suffix.name: NonBR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires on or before 2013-12-31

suffix.name: BR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires after 2013-12-31 and was issued on or after 2012-07-01, as judged by the notBefore, meaning that it should be in scope for the Baseline Requirement's key size requirements

suffix.name: NonBR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires on or before 2013-12-31 or was issued before 2012-07-01

histogram_suffixes.name: CertIo

suffix.name: ReadFailure
suffix.label: failure rate of reading a certificate from the disk cache

suffix.name: WriteSuccess
suffix.label: success rate of writing a certificate to the disk cache

suffix.name: WriteFailure

histogram_suffixes.name: ClockResolution

After collecting a few months of data it was determined that clock resolution doesn't adversely impact our metrics, and that these histograms were no longer needed.

suffix.label: downloads with ws or wss scheme

suffix.name: Normal
suffix.label: Created during any time other than the 'unload' or 'beforeunload' handlers.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 05/2015.

suffix.name: InBeforeUnload
suffix.label: Created during an event handler for the 'beforeunload' event.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 05/2015.

suffix.name: InUnload
suffix.label: Created during an event handler for the 'unload' event.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 05/2015.

suffix.name: Total
suffix.label: The total number of ports created.

suffix.name: Extension
suffix.label: A port opened to an extension context.

suffix.name: NativeApp
suffix.label: A port opened to a native application.

suffix.name: Tab
suffix.label: A port opened to a tab context.

suffix.name: NonWebstore
suffix.label: sideloaded extensions that don't update from the webstore

suffix.name: Webstore
suffix.label: sideloaded extensions that update from the webstore

suffix.name: BasedOnAutocomplete
suffix.label: Quality metrics based on autocomplete attributes.

suffix.name: Construct
suffix.label: Time spent constructing the main Javascript object.

suffix.name: FileSystem
suffix.label: Time to get access to the local file system.

suffix.name: Parse
suffix.label: Time to parse Javascript and CSS (Deprecated).

suffix.name: Roots
suffix.label: Time to enumerate file system roots.

suffix.name: Total
suffix.label: Total load time from the moment the Javascript started parsing till the moment the empty file list is displayed.

suffix.name: Script
suffix.label: Time to parse Javascript and CSS.

suffix.name: BackgroundScript
suffix.label: Time to initialize backend script to wait for events.

suffix.name: BackgroundLaunch
suffix.label: Time from onLaunched event is called to the window is created.

suffix.name: BackgroundRestart
suffix.label: Time to create a window on restart.

suffix.name: ImportElements
suffix.label: Time to initialize the polymer elements.

suffix.name: InitBackgroundPage
suffix.label: Time to initialize the background page.

suffix.name: InitDocuments
suffix.label: Time to initialize the background page and the elements.

suffix.name: InitUI
suffix.label: Time to initialize all UI after all elements are initialized.

suffix.name: first_packet_intact
suffix.label: with GET/POST headers often using only 1 packet

suffix.name: first_packet_split
suffix.label: with all GET/POST requests using at least 2 packets

suffix.name: Backgrounded
suffix.label: The user sent Chrome to the background

suffix.name: Continuation
suffix.label: The user continued the task from the last time they used the app

suffix.name: NtpCreated
suffix.label: The user action open a NTP.

suffix.name: Omnibox
suffix.label: The user interacted with the omnibox.

suffix.name: FromGWS
suffix.label: Only page loads that are a result of a navigation from a web search are considered.

suffix.name: Wheel
suffix.label: Measure the size of scroller that users wheel scroll

suffix.name: Touch
suffix.label: Measure the size of scroller that users touch scroll

suffix.name: TexImage2D
suffix.label: All GL APIs that allocate a 2D texture.

suffix.name: TexImage3D
suffix.label: All GL APIs that allocate a 3D texture.

suffix.name: global_enable_sdch
suffix.label: with SDCH support for applicable sites

suffix.name: _PrerenderDisabled
suffix.label: Counts number of Google searches from various access points in the Android Chrome browser when prerendering is disabled via "Bandwidth management" settings or "Privacy" settings. Only recorded on Android.

suffix.name: _PrerenderEnabled
suffix.label: Counts number of Google searches from various access points in the Android Chrome browser when prerendering is enabled via "Bandwidth management" settings or "Privacy" settings. Only recorded on Android.

suffix.name: Pressure
suffix.label: Sampled on CRITICAL memory pressure signal.

suffix.name: PrivateMemoryFootprint
suffix.label: Only counting private resident + swapped/compressed memory.

suffix.name: SentRequest
suffix.label: The request was sent over the network.

suffix.name: Used
suffix.label: A cache entry was used without using the network.

suffix.name: CantConditionalize
suffix.label: A cached resource existed but no conditional request could be written.

suffix.name: NotCached
suffix.label: There was no pre-existing disk cache entry.

suffix.name: Updated
suffix.label: A cached resource existed and was updated over the network.

suffix.name: Validated
suffix.label: A cached resource existed and was validated over the network.

suffix.name: Cache
suffix.label: For requests served from the cache.

suffix.name: Net
suffix.label: For requests served from the network.

suffix.name: BackgroundSettingsFetched
suffix.label: Latency for settings fetched from background

suffix.name: HtmlLoaded
suffix.label: Latency for the page is loaded

suffix.name: KeyboardCreated
suffix.label: Latency for the keyboard is created

suffix.name: KeysetLoaded
suffix.label: Latency for keyset config is loaded

suffix.name: LayoutLoaded
suffix.label: Latency for layout definition is loaded

suffix.name: Immediate
suffix.label: Logged immediately after a timing update is observed, unlike normal PageLoad timing metrics, which are logged at the end of a page's lifetime. This metric is temporary and is intended to help loading-dev to understand the impact of logging metrics at the end of a page load.

histogram_suffixes.name: InstantExtended_QuerytoQuery
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: All relevant histograms have been marked as obsolete as of Sep 2016.

suffix.name: WithPreview
suffix.label: Only page loads through data reduction proxy that are result of navigation from web search and preview version of the page shown are considered.

suffix.name: Preview
suffix.label: Only page loads through data reduction proxy that are result of navigation from web search and preview version of the page shown are considered.

suffix.name: NoPreview
suffix.label: Only page loads through data reduction proxy that are result of navigation from web search and preview version of the page shown are considered.

suffix.name: ZoomedIn
suffix.label: Zoomed in view: shorter range, more buckets.

suffix.name: ZoomedOut
suffix.label: Zoomed out view: longer time range, less buckets.

suffix.name: Interval
suffix.label: Interval between two consecutive connects is

suffix.name: Interval_20ms_Minus
suffix.label: Interval between two consecutive connects is less than 20ms.

suffix.name: Interval_20ms_Plus
suffix.label: Interval between two consecutive connects is greater than or equal to 20ms.

suffix.name: LessThanOrEqual_20ms
suffix.label: more than 10ms, and less than or equal to 20ms.

suffix.name: IPv6_probe_skipped
suffix.label: with IPv6 not probed, and default OS settings used

suffix.name: IPv6_probe_done
suffix.label: with IPv6 probed for and possibly disabled

suffix.name: MainFrame
suffix.label: dialog spawned by the main frame

suffix.name: Leave
suffix.label: user opted to leave the page

suffix.name: Stay
suffix.label: user opted to stay on the page

suffix.name: Success
suffix.label: This histogram shows the limit when open succeeded.

suffix.name: TooManyOpened
suffix.label: This histogram shows the limit when open failed because the limit had been reached.

suffix.name: OtherError
suffix.label: This histogram shows the limit when open failed for reasons other than exceeding the limit.

suffix.name: UsageReportsBufferBackend
suffix.label: The result of the first attempt to open the usage reports buffer backend database.

suffix.name: BudgetManager
suffix.label: Database for storing budget information for origins.

suffix.name: AggressivePurgeTriggered
suffix.label: Aggressive purge was triggered on memory pressure.

suffix.name: InactiveOnLowEndDevice
suffix.label: Inactive areas found in low end device.

suffix.name: ModeratePurgeTriggered
suffix.label: Moderate purge was triggered on memory pressure.

suffix.name: LocationAttached
suffix.label: This histogram is for when the location was successfully attached to the request.

suffix.name: LocationNotAttached
suffix.label: This histogram is for when the location was not attached to the request. A location may not be attached if it is too old or if the permissions do not allow it.

suffix.name: BatterySaving
suffix.label: This histogram is for location mode Battery Saving.

suffix.name: GpsOnly
suffix.label: This histogram is for location mode GPS Only.

suffix.name: HighAccuracy
suffix.label: This histogram is for location mode High Accuracy.

suffix.name: default
suffix.label: Low memory margin set to the system default

suffix.name: HighLatency
suffix.label: Measures the standard Mac audio driver (i.e. not low-latency).

suffix.name: CloseTime
suffix.label: Measures the time taken for DoClose().

suffix.name: CreateTime
suffix.label: Measures the time taken for DoCreate().

suffix.name: RecordTime
suffix.label: Measures the time taken for DoRecord().

suffix.name: OpenOnDeviceThreadTime
suffix.label: Measures the time taken for OpenOnDeviceThread().

suffix.name: EnumerateOnDeviceThreadTime
suffix.label: Measures the time taken for EnumerateOnDeviceThread().

suffix.name: CloseTime
suffix.label: Measures the time taken for DoClose().

suffix.name: CreateTime
suffix.label: Measures the time taken for DoCreate().

suffix.name: DeviceChangeTime
suffix.label: Measures the time taken for OnDeviceChange().

suffix.name: PauseTime
suffix.label: Measures the time taken for DoPause().

suffix.name: PlayTime
suffix.label: Measures the time taken for DoPlay(). Technically only the worker method AudioOutputController::PollAndStartIfDataReady().

suffix.name: ChromeSystem
suffix.label: Chrome is a system installed browser.

suffix.name: ChromeNotSystem
suffix.label: Chrome is not a system installed browser.

suffix.name: OtherDefault
suffix.label: Another browser is the default browser.

suffix.name: WithoutByteSet
suffix.label: The version of the Module Integrity Verifier that doesn't use a hash set to track relocations.

suffix.name: WithByteSet
suffix.label: The version of the Module Integrity Verifier that uses a hash set to track relocations.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 05/2015.

suffix.name: ExistingRenderer_BeforeUnloadDiscounted
suffix.label: Navigation reused an existing renderer process. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.

suffix.name: NewRenderer_BeforeUnloadDiscounted
suffix.label: Navigation spawned a new renderer process. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.

suffix.name: SessionRestored_BeforeUnloadDiscounted
suffix.label: Navigation caused by restoring a tab from a previous session (whether from a crash or a continued session) either spawning or reusing a renderer. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.

suffix.name: SessionRestored
suffix.label: Navigation caused by restoring a tab from a previous session (whether from a crash or a continued session) either spawning or reusing a renderer. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.
suffix.obsolete: Replaced by the likely named entry. It had a misleading name as it also has the before-unload time discounted.

suffix.name: SWStartFirst
suffix.label: The service worker finished preparing before the navigation preload response arrived.

suffix.name: NavPreloadFirst
suffix.label: The navigation preload response arrived before the service worker finished preparing.

suffix.name: QUIC
suffix.label: Bidirectional streams that use QUIC protocol

suffix.name: HTTP2
suffix.label: Bidirectional stream that use HTTP2 protocol

suffix.name: Insecure
suffix.label: for insecure QUIC.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 10/2015.

suffix.name: TooMany
suffix.label: for secure QUIC when there were too many rejects.

suffix.name: First21
suffix.label: Only the first group of 21 packets in a connection via

suffix.name: Some21s
suffix.label: After the first 21, this records data for some groups of 21 consecutive sequence nmubers, arriving via.

suffix.name: First6
suffix.label: Only the first group of 6 packets in a connection via

suffix.name: Some6s
suffix.label: After the first 6, this records patterns for some groups of 6 consecutive sequence numbers, arriving via.

suffix.name: Ack
suffix.label: Only packets that were received by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: Nack
suffix.label: Only packets that were missed by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: IsAnAck
suffix.label: Only packets that were probably solo ACK packets when recieved by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: IsNotAck
suffix.label: Only packets that were probably NOT solo ACK packets when recieved by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: CONNECTION_WIFI

suffix.name: CONNECTION_WIFI_ANCIENT
suffix.label: 802.11 that are no longer standard are tallied.

suffix.name: CONNECTION_NONE
suffix.label: NO(?) network are tallied (should be empty).

suffix.name: CONNECTION_BLUETOOTH
suffix.label: Bluetooth are tallied, but this may include connections to a mobile hotspot.

suffix.name: NonPacedPacket
suffix.label: In this histogram results are only shown if at least two packets were ACKed in the Startup Test. Packets were sent as rapidly as possible.

suffix.name: PacedPacket
suffix.label: In this histogram results are only shown if at least two packets were ACKed in the Startup Test. Packets are sent at equal intervals. The interval is selected to match the bandwidth discovered during the StartPacket test.

suffix.name: StartPacket
suffix.label: Packets are sent as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. If no packets (of the 21) were ever ACKed, then the port is assumed to be blocked, and no data is recorded in this histogram.

suffix.name: Sent21
suffix.label: This histogram shows the number of echo responses received from the first

suffix.name: Sent21.AckReceivedForNthPacket
suffix.label: Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received an ACK for that packet.

suffix.name: Sent21.GotAnAck
suffix.label: The histogram shows if we ever got an ACK for a packet in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.443
suffix.label: This histogram shows the difference between the time when we have received 1st byte from the server and the last time when we have received data from the server on port 443.

suffix.name: Sent21.6121
suffix.label: This histogram shows the difference between the time when we have received 1st byte from the server and the last time when we have received data from the server on port 6121.

suffix.name: 443.100B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.1200B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.500B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 6121.100B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.1200B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.500B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: Sent21.Success.RTT
suffix.label: The histogram shows the RTT for

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketsSent
suffix.label: This histogram records how many packets (out of 21 attempted) were sent to the server via UDP.

suffix.name: Send6.SeriesAcked
suffix.label: Chrome sends 6 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are responded to, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

suffix.name: 443.100B
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.500B
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.1200B
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 6121.100B
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.500B
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.1200B
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 443.100B
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.100B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443 with no proxy.

suffix.name: 443.500B
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.500B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443 with no proxy.

suffix.name: 443.1200B
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.1200B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443 with no proxy.

suffix.name: 6121.100B
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.100B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121 with no proxy.

suffix.name: 6121.500B
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.500B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121 with no proxy.

suffix.name: 6121.1200B
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.1200B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121 with no proxy.

suffix.name: NATBind.Sent2
suffix.label: Two packets were sent spreading over a random period, to test if the NAT dropped the binding. Afterwords, an extra (short) packet was sent with renewed NAT binding to test whether the network that was used to deliver the first packet is still connected. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least ten packets were received in the StartPacket test.

suffix.name: NonPacedPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent as rapidly as possible. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least two packets were received in the StartPacket Test.

suffix.name: PacedPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent at equal intervals, which were selected to match the bandwidth discovered during the StartPacket test. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least two packets were received in the StartPacket Test.

suffix.name: StartPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent as rapidly as possible, just after the client successfully sent a UMA upload. Each packet was numbered when it was sent by Google.

suffix.name: Bind.Failure
suffix.label: Only when the second packet never arrived (we wait for 10 extra seconds) and the first and the extra (short) packets arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Bind.Success
suffix.label: Only when all three packets including the extra (short) packet arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Connectivity.Failure
suffix.label: Only when the extra (short) packet (with renewed NAT binding) never arrived (we wait for 10 extra seconds) did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Connectivity.Success
suffix.label: Only when the extra (short) packet arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: SendToLastRecvDelay
suffix.label: This histogram records the time duration (in milliseconds) between the client sending the request and the receiving of the second packet sent from the server, excluding the idle time between sendings of the first two packets. Results are only shown if the first two packets are both received.

suffix.name: First6.SeriesRecv
suffix.label: This histogram records a bit vector of the first 6 packets sent, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are received, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

suffix.name: Sent21
suffix.label: This histogram shows the number of packets received from the first

suffix.name: Sent21.GotAPacket
suffix.label: The histogram shows if we ever got at least one packet in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketDelay
suffix.label: The histogram shows the average inter-arrival time between every two consecutive packets we receive in our series of 21 multiplied by 20 (so this is essentially the time duration between the first and the last received packets).

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketsRecv
suffix.label: The histogram shows how many packets we receive in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.RecvNthPacket
suffix.label: Each packet was numbered when it was sent by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received that packet.

suffix.name: Sent21.SendToLastRecvDelay
suffix.label: This histogram records the time duration between the client sending the request and the receiving of the last packet sent from the server, excluding the total pacing time requested by the client. Results are only shown if at least two packets are received.

suffix.name: Sent21.Success.RTT
suffix.label: The histogram shows the RTT for the

suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.
